<b>סברוה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The students, who were studying our משנה, assumed.</i> מאי מחיצה גודא—They assumed, what does מחיצה mean; a wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>There are two opinions in our גמרא, how to interpret the word מחיצה in our משנה, and subsequently whether היזק ראיה שמיה היזק or not. Each of these opinions is introduced with the term סברוה. The term 'סברוה' generally refers to an opinion which is originally introduced, only to be refuted later. We do not find however that either of these opinions is refuted. Why therefore does the גמרא introduce them with the term סברוה? Our תוספות will offer two interpretations.<br>-------------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates and responds to the following question:<br><b>אף על גב דלבסוף קאי –</b><br><b>Even though that</b> this assumption (that מחיצה refers to a wall) <b>remains at the conclusion</b> of the סוגיא. Those who maintained that גודא מחיצה, were not refuted, nevertheless –<br><b>קאמר סברוה לפי שזה הלשון אינו עיקר מחמת פירכא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש who emends the text to read 'פירכי', in the plural.</i> דלקמן –</b><br>The גמרא <b>refers</b> to their opinion as <b>‘they assumed’, since this opinion</b> (that מחיצה means גודא) <b>is not the main opinion, on account of the refutation(s)</b> mentioned <b>later</b> in the גמרא. Even though each refutation has been deflected and explained to satisfy this opinion that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק, however –<br><b>ודיחוי בעלמא הוא האי דמשני וכלשון שני הלכה וכן פוסק רבינו תם –</b><br><b>the answers given were merely deflections,</b> and not satisfying answers, <b>and the</b> final <b>ruling is like the second</b> opinion that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק, <b>and indeed the ר"ת rules that</b> היז"ר שמיה היזק. The גמרא therefore refers to this first לשון as סברוה to indicate that להלכה we do not follow their opinion, but rather the opinion that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק.<br>תוספות anticipates a follow-up question: The reason the גמרא uses the term 'סברוה' for the first לשון is because the הלכה does not follow that opinion. Why is it then that the גמרא uses the same term 'סברוה' to introduce the second לשון?<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See גמרא דף ג,א, ל"א וכו' סברוה וכו'.</i> That לשון is according to the הלכה!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ואגב דנקט בהאי לישנא סברוה נקט נמי בלישנא אחריתי –</b><br><b>And since he uses</b> the term 'סברוה'<b>, by this</b> (the first) <b>opinion</b> (to indicate that we do not follow this לשון), therefore <b>he uses it as well by the other</b> (second and valid) opinion.<br>תוספות offers another approach:<br><b>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק דבפרק קמא דנדרים (דף יא,א) איכא סברוה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there (י,ב) stated if one made a נדר and said [לא] לחולין שאוכל לך he is forbidden to eat by him. The גמרא states, סברוה that he meant to say לא לחולין להוי אלא קרבן, and this remains למסקנא. (See רב אשי on יא,ב)</i> –</b><br><b>And furthermore says the ר"י that in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>נדרים there is the expression 'סברוה' –<br>אף על גב דלבסוף קאי ומסיק הכי:</b><br><b>Even though that ultimately that</b> opinion <b>remained and was accepted as such.</b> Therefore here too in our גמרא, we may maintain that either or both of the 'סברוה' are valid opinions.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that according to the ר"י, the הלכה is not necessarily that היז"ר שמיה היזק.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא uses the term סברוה for the first לשון to indicate that we do not follow this opinion להלכה. The refutations to this opinion were not satisfactorily answered. However once we used the term 'סברוה' to introduce one opinion we used it as well to introduce the other opinion.<br>Another approach is that 'סברוה' can refer to an acceptable opinion that is not subsequently refuted or retracted.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. What are four ways that the term 'סברוה' may be used?<br>2. How can we interpret 'סברוה' to indicate that this opinion does not follow the הלכה, when the term 'סברוה' is used here in both opinions?
<b>כדתניא מחיצת הכרם שנפרצה—As we learnt in a ברייתא; the wall of a vineyard that was breached.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The word תנן (or דתנן) refers to a משנה. The word תניא (or דתניא) refers to a ברייתא.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">הנשיא יהודה רבי – הקדוש רבינו edited all the sayings of the תנאים that preceded him and incorporated those that he chose, in the משניות. The other teachings of the תנאים that were not incorporated in the משניות but remained outside the משניות are called ברייתות. The word ברייתא means ‘outside’. A משנה is generally considered to have a preferred status over a ברייתא.</i> When there is an anonymous דין in a משנה (without a specific תנא mentioned), we (generally) assign that opinion to רבי מאיר. This is known as סתם משנה ר"מ. However a סתם ברייתא is not necessarily ר"מ at all.<br>----------------------------<br><b>יש ספרים דגרסי דתנן ואומר רבינו תם שאינה משנה בשום מקום –</b><br><b>There are text that read 'דתנן',</b> <b>we learnt in a</b> משנה<b>,</b> instead of דתניא, we learnt in a ברייתא; <b>however the</b> ר"ת <b>says there no such</b> משנה <b>anywhere.</b> The correct reading is 'דתניא'.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>(ואם כן)<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Others emend this to read: 'ואם תאמר'.</i> היכי פשיט מינה בהגוזל קמא (בבא קמא דף ק,א ושם) דרבי מאיר דאין דינא דגרמי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">גרמי refers to a damage inflicted on someone indirectly. The alleged perpetrator did not physically cause the damage. The גמרא there seeks to prove that ר"מ maintains that in case of גרמי the perpetrator is liable.</i> –</b><br><b>Since</b> it is not a משנה <b>how</b> does the גמרא <b>in</b> פרק הגוזל קמא <b>conclude from this</b> ברייתא <b>that</b> <b>ר"מ executed the laws of גרמי.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there in ב"ק cites a case where an individual showed his friend a coin to ascertain if it is legal tender. Had he advised him incorrectly, thereby causing him a loss, it would be considered a case of גרמי. There is another type of indirect damage known as גרמא, where even ר"מ agrees that he is פטור. See תוספות דף כב,ב ד"ה זאת as to the difference between גרמי and גרמא.</i></b><br><b>ואם היתה משנה הוה אתי שפיר דסתם משנה רבי מאיר היא –</b><br><b>And if</b> this ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם <b>would</b> actually <b>have been a</b> משנה instead of a ברייתא <b>it would have been properly</b> understood how we can deduce from the law of מחיצת הכרם that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגמרי. The case of מחיצת הכרם falls in the category of גרמי.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The בעל הכרם did not physically or directly damage the בעל השדה, nevertheless the דין is that the בעל הכרם is חייב באחריותו.</i> We can therefore deduce from (the משנה of) מחיצת הכרם that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגמרי <b>since an anonymous</b> משנה <b>is attributed to ר"מ</b>.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Any משנה that is not stated in the name of a specific תנא, that משנה is attributed to be the opinion of ר"מ. There is no תנא whose name is mentioned in conjunction with the דין of מחיצת הכרם. Had it been a משנה, it would have been the opinion of ר"מ that he is חייב even though it is only גרמי. However since it is not a משנה, but rather a ברייתא, there is no rule that a סתם ברייתא is ר"מ. We cannot arbitrarily assign this ברייתא to ר"מ. How then does the גמרא infer from this ברייתא that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגמרי?!</i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו תם דמשמע ליה דאתיא כרבי מאיר מכח מתניתין דכלאים דמייתי התם<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there quoted this משנה (before quoting our ברייתא) in an attempt to prove that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגמרי. The גמרא refuted the proof, maintaining that it is not גרמי, since he physically spread the vines over his neighbor’s crops.</i> –</b><br><b>The ר"ת says that it is evident to</b> the גמרא<b></b> that this ברייתא is <b>in accordance with the view of ר"מ based on the משנה of</b> מסכת <b>כלאים, that</b> the גמרא <b>cited there</b> in ב"ק. The משנה states:<br><b>המסכך [את] גפנו על גבי תבואתו של חבירו [הרי זה] קידש וחייב באחריותו –</b><br><b>One who spreads out his grapevines over his neighbor’s</b> (growing) <b>grain; this act hallows</b> the grain (and the vines) to be prohibited from use<b>, and</b> the owner of the vines <b>is liable</b> for his neighbor’s loss. This concludes the quote from the משנה.<br><b>וההיא סתם משנה היא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">There is no תנא associated with the פסק of חייב באחריותו. This means that it is the opinion of ר"מ that the בעל הכרם is liable for the damage he caused by making the כלאים תבואה. There are other תנאים in that משנה who contend that the grain does not become כלאים, for one individual cannot effect a prohibition on something which does not belong to him [See ‘Thinking it over’]. כלאים become בהנאה אסור, according to these תנאים, only if the grapevines and the grain belong to the same person. ר"מ obviously disagrees. In our ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם, we are confronted with the same issue. The בעל הכרם and the בעל השדה are two individuals. According to the other תנאים it would not become כלאים. The ברייתא however disagrees and states 'קידש זה הרי'; that it becomes כלאים.</i> הילכך ההיא נמי דקתני קידש רבי מאיר היא –</b><br><b>And that</b> משנה in מסכת כלאים <b>is</b> indeed <b>a סתם משנה. Therefore this</b> ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם, <b>where it states</b> that the תבואה is קידש<b>,</b> it becomes כלאים, must follow the view <b>of ר"מ.</b> The גמרא rightfully proves from this ברייתא that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגרמי.<br>תוספות concludes:<br><b>ואין להאריך כאן יותר:</b><br><b>And there is no</b> need <b>to elaborate here anymore!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can prove from our סתם ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגמרי. There is a משנה סתם, i.e. ר"מ, which maintains that the בעל הכרם is חייב if he spread his vines over someone else’s grain. Our ברייתא maintains like the (ר"מ) סתם משנה that it does become כלאים. The case of the ברייתא is considered a  דינא דגמרי. We can therefore infer that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגרמי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the דין if someone pours milk into a friend’s meat stew?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות יבמות פג,ב ד"ה אין.</i>
<b>אומר לו גדור—He says to him; Fence it!</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם is discussing a case where a dividing wall between a vineyard and a grain field (that had different owners) was breached. There is then sufficient cause to be concerned about כלאים, since the vines and grain are immediately adjacent to each other. The ברייתא states that he tells him to repair the breach, and if he repaired it and it was breached again, he should tell him again. If he showed no interest in repairing, then he is liable for any damage that is caused if there is an actual איסור כלאים. It is not clear in the ברייתא, who is told to repair the fence. In addition it would seem that both the בעל הכרם and the בעל השדה should be jointly responsible to build the fence, since each one is contributing equally to the potential איסור כלאים. Why is only one party required to repair the fence? Indeed if someone is required to repair the fence why the need to tell him; especially twice?! תוספות will be discussing these issues.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is negating s'רש"י explanation that it is the בעל הכרם who is responsible to rebuild the wall on account of כלאים (since עבודת הכרם is ד' אמות it is as if the כרם extends an additional ד' אמות into the שדה הלבן and is causing the כלאים.)</i> לבעל הכרם והוא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דהוא.</i> המזיק –</b><br><b>The explanation</b> of the phrase ‘He says to him’; the word ‘him’ refers <b>to the owner of the vineyard for he is the aggressor.</b> It is the responsibility of the בעל הכרם to repair the breach in the dividing wall. The reason the בעל הכרם is required to repair the wall and not the בעל השדה, even though seemingly each one is causing the other’s field to be come כלאים, is –<br><b>דארבע אמות שאמרו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there (כו,א) states that one who plants trees on his own property must distance himself from his neighbor’s property four אמות from the property line. Perhaps that is why it is referred to as מחיצת הכרם; since it is the obligation of the בעל הכרם to erect this מחיצה.</i> להרחיק הוא בשביל עבודת הכרם</b><sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The term עבודת הכרם is to be understood to include any type of tree that requires cultivation of ד' אמות.</i> <b>כדאמרינן בפרק שני לקמן (דף כו,א) –</b><br><b>Because the four cubits which</b> the חכמים <b>said</b> that one is required to <b>distance himself</b> from the boundary of his neighbor’s property <b>that is on account of the work</b> required to cultivate the <b>vineyard</b>, <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>states later in the second פרק.</b><sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It was customary to plow underneath the trees for a distance of four אמות radius, from the trunk of the tree, to cultivate the soil underneath the tree. If one were to plant his tree adjacent to the property line, there is concern that he may bring his plow into his neighbor’s property, which he has no right to do. Planting a tree near the property line is considered an act of aggression. He is a מזיק. However if there is a dividing wall between the properties, he may plant trees right up to the wall. There is no concern that he may take his plow into the other property since there is the dividing wall. If however the wall is breached, the concern of עבודת הכרם returns. It is the obligation of the בעל העליו  to repair the wall; otherwise he is a מזיק, since his tree is within ד' אמות of his neighbor’s property, which is forbidden. In our ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם, the בעל הכרם planted his vines up to the property line since there was a dividing wall between him and the בעל השדה. Once the wall was breached, it became the duty of the בעל הכרם to repair the wall as just explained. Therefore as long as he does not repair the wall he is considered the מזיק and any resultant damage caused by his negligence to repair the wall is his responsibility. [The responsibility of the בעל הכרם extends even into an area for which originally he was not solely responsible. The בעל הכרם had to build the wall on account of עבודת הכרם not for כלאים. Nevertheless he is responsible not only to limit the damage caused by עבודת הכרם, but even for the damage caused by the ensuing איסור כלאים, since he is considered the מזיק. This liability for the איסור כלאים may be considered דינא דגרמי (as opposed to his responsibility to build the fence)].  The בעל הכרם, therefore, is also responsible for any damage of כלאים caused by his vines, since he is the מזיק.</i><b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואפילו רבי יוסי דקאמר לקמן (דף יח,ב כה,ב) על הניזק להרחיק את עצמו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">ר' יוסי is discussing the following case: The משנה states that one must distance a tree twenty five אמות from his neighbors pit; so that the roots of the tree do not eventually weaken the pit. If the tree was planted after the pit was dug, the owner of the pit has the right to chop down the tree (provided he pays for the tree).ר' יוסי  is of the opinion that even if the pit preceded the planting of the tree, he may not chop down the tree, for the owner of the tree has every right to plant a tree on his own property.ר' יוסי  maintains that if the victim does not want to suffer let him dig his pit where no one will be able to weaken it. It would seem that ר"י would not agree to the משנה which states that a tree must be distanced from the property line four אמות. According to ר"י one should be able to bring his tree to the property line, since he is currently not doing any damage. The two cases seem very similar.</i> –</b><br><b>And even according to ר' יוסי who later states it is incumbent on the injured party to distance himself.</b> תוספות maintains however that even if we agree that הניזק על להרחיק, nevertheless the ruling of the ברייתא (and the משנה of ד' אמות) is still valid. The reason is –<br><b>האמר רב אשי לקמן (דף כה,ב) מודי ר' יוסי בגירי דיליה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">One may not shoot arrows from his own רשות and damage objects in his neighbor’s רשות. ר' יוסי agrees that we do not say עצמו את להרחיק הניזק על in any case which is considered גירי דיליה. The case of the tree and the pit is not considered גירי דיליה. When the tree is being planted there is no damage to the pit. The damage will be later, and will happen by itself without any involvement of the בעל האילן.</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> רב אשי <b>said later</b> in the גמרא that <b>that</b> ר' יוסי <b>agrees</b> that if the damage is done <b>with his arrows</b>, then it is להרחיק המזיק על. In our case of עבודת הכרם, it is considered גירי דיליה. The בעל האילן will physically take the plow and bring it into his neighbor’s field. In this case it is considered גירי דיליה and ר' יוסי will agree that you must either distance yourself ד' אמות or build a dividing wall. When that wall is breached the בעל האילן reverts to being the מזיק, and is required to repair the wall.<br>תוספות addresses now the issue of the requirement that the בעל הכרם be told (twice!) to rebuild the wall.<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלהכי קתני אומר לו גדור ולא קתני חייב לגדור<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly it should have said he is obligated to build the fence. We rarely find this expression that the victim needs to remind the aggressor of his duties.</i> –</b><br><b>And the</b> ר"י <b>says that the</b> reason the ברייתא uses the expression 'גדור לו אומר' <b>– ‘he says to him rebuild the fence’, and</b> the ברייתא <b>does not say</b> that <b>‘he is obligated to repair the fence’.</b> תוספות will explain that here the ניזק is required to remind the מזיק –<br><b>לפי שצריך להתרות בו ואם לא התרו בו לגדור אינו חייב באחריותו<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem from תוספות that if he did not warn the בעל הכרם to repair the fence, it would still become כלאים; however the בעל הכרם would not be liable to pay for the damage. The reason he is not חייב is because the damage inflicted by the בעל הכרם is considered only גרמי (see previous תוספות), [since he is not causing the damage directly]. One is liable for the damages of גרמי (according to some opinions) only if it is done במזיד. Therefore he has to be told to rebuild, otherwise the בעל הכרם assumes that it is not his responsibility to rebuild. He is considered a בשוגג גרמי.</i> –</b><br><b>For here, it is required to warn</b> the מזיק <b>and if they did not warn him to repair the fence</b> the מזיק <b>is not liable for the damages</b> incurred on account of the איסור כלאים.<br><b>ולהכי נקט נמי תרי זימני נפרצה אומר לו גדור אף פעם שניה כשנפרצה צריך להתרותו –</b><br><b>And that is also</b> the reason <b>that he mentions two times; ‘if it was breached he says to him, ‘fence it’’!</b> The reason the ברייתא mentions it twice is because if he repaired it once, and it was breached a second time, then <b>even the second time that it was breached he is required to warn</b> the מזיק. The initial warning the first time, when he subsequently repaired it, is not sufficient –<br><b>שאינו סבור להיות חייב לגדור כל שעה –</b><br><b>For</b> the מזיק <b>does not deem it appropriate that he is required to repair it every time.</b> In order for him to be liable for איסור כלאים after he repaired it once and it broke, he must be warned a second time. Otherwise he is not liable.<br><b>ונפרצה פעם שלישית מספקא לרבינו יצחק אם צריך להתרותו כל שעה –</b><br><b>And if it was breached a third time;</b> after he was twice warned and rebuilt twice <b>the</b> ר"י <b>is doubtful, whether it is required to warn him every time;</b> otherwise there is no liability on the part of the בעל הכרם –<br><b>או שמא סגי בתרי זימני ואין צריך להתרות בו יותר –</b><br><b>Or perhaps twice is sufficient; and there is no requirement to warn him further.</b> He was warned already twice, He realizes that it is his continual obligation to have the wall repaired<br>תוספות offers a different explanation for the redundancy of גדור לו אומר נפרצה.<br><b>ורבינו תם מפרש דלהכי נקט תרי זימני לאשמועינן –</b><br><b>And the</b> ר"ת <b>explains – that the</b> reason <b>he mentions twice</b> the requirement to tell the בעל הכרם to repair the fence is <b>to teach us –<br>שאם יש תוספת מאתים בין מה שהוסיף בנפרצה ראשונה ובין מה שהוסיף בנפרצה שניה –</b><br><b>That if there was an additional</b> growth of a <b>two hundredth</b> amount <b>between what was added during the first breach and between what was added during the second breach.</b> During each breach individually it did not grow a sufficient amount to equal a two hundredth, but if the growth during both breaches were to be added together it would equal to a growth amount of a two hundredth (or more) –<br><b>דאין מצטרפין לאסור ומראשונה ראשונה בטלי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">After each repair, if during that breach it did not grow מאתיים, then that growth of כלאים becomes בטל, as if it never happened. By the next breach we start estimating anew how much it grew during the present breach. If at this new breach, less than מאתיים grew, it is again disregarded after the current repair. It is only בכלאים אסור if it grew מאתיים during the period of a single breach.</i> –</b><br><b>They cannot be combined to prohibit</b> the produce, <b>and from</b> after <b>the</b> repair of <b>first</b> breach the additional growth of <b>the first</b> breach <b>becomes nullified.<br>והארכתי בהגוזל קמא (בבא קמא דף ק,ב ושם) ובפרק במה אשה (שבת דף סה,א) :</b><br><b>And I</b> have dealt with this <b>at length in </b>פרק<b> הגוזל קמא</b> <b>and in פרק במה אשה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>In the case of מחיצת הכרם שנפרצה it is the obligation of the בעל הכרם to rebuild the wall. The בעל הכרם is considered the מזיק, since he is not permitted to plant within ד' אמות of the boundary line, unless there is a dividing wall.<br>ר' יוסי who normally maintains that עצמו את להרחיק הניזק על also agrees that the responsibility lies with the בעל הכרם, for since the concern is that the בעל הכרם will plow in his neighbors field to cultivate his כרם, that is considered גירי דיליה.<br>Nonetheless, unless the בעל הכרם is explicitly warned to rebuild the wall, he will not be חייב for the איסור כלאים, since he does not realize that it is his obligation. Indeed he must be warned even a second time (after the original breach had been repaired and was broken again). We cannot assume that the בעל הכרם realizes that it is his ongoing responsibility. Concerning whether he must be warned a third time תוספות is unsure, perhaps twice is sufficient to have the בעל הכרם realize his responsibility.<br>Another explanation why the ברייתא mentions the warning twice, to inform us that the rule of הוסיף מאתיים is כלאים, refers only to a הוספה of מאתיים during one breach period. We cannot combine the growths of two breach periods for the amount of הוסיף מאתיים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. The ברייתא of מחיצת הכרם can follow the view of ר' יוסי since it is considered גירי דיליה. We also derive from מחיצת הכרם that ר"מ is דאין דינא דגרמי.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See previous כדתניא ה"ד תוספות and also footnotes # 5 [in brackets] &amp; 9 in our תוספות</i> It seems contradictory that it should be both גירי דיליה and דינא דגמרי!<br>2. If we were to assume that one is required to warn the בעל הכרם on the third time also, what would be the דין concerning a fourth, fifth, etc. time?<br>3. How does the ר"ת derive from the ברייתא that we do not combine the הוספה of each נפרצה?<br>4. What would the ר"ת maintain is the דין when the בעל הכרם was warned only once, and it was נפרצה a second time; is the בעל הכרם חייב?

Daf 2b



Line 1

<b>נתיאש הימנה ולא גדרה—He abandoned it and did not rebuild it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא states that if the בעל הכרם abandons the rebuilding of the wall, then the produce acquires the status of כלאים and is אסור. In addition the בעל הכרם is liable for damages. It seems from the ברייתא that both the איסור כלאים and the liability of the בעל הכרם are dependent on the 'נתיאש הימנה'. Otherwise if he is still trying to rebuild the wall then it will not become כלאים, and obviously there is no liability. It is not clear why the איסור כלאים depends on the 'נתיאש'. Concerning the חיוב to pay, it is understood that as long as he is trying to repair the damage we cannot hold him responsible; he is doing all he can.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See previous אומר ה"ד תוספות, footnote # 9, that גרמי is only במזיד חייב.</i> However concerning the איסור כלאים, that should be independent of his 'נתיאש'. If it was הוסיף מאתיים it should become כלאים, regardless whether he was נתיאש or not. תוספות will clarify this issue.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>דוקא נתיאש אבל לא נתיאש ועוסק כל שעה לגדור אף על פי שהוסיף מאתים מותר –</b><br>It becomes כלאים only <b>specifically when he abandoned</b> all efforts to rebuild the wall <b>– however if he did not give up and he is continually occupied in rebuilding</b> the wall <b>even though that a two hundredth was added</b> to the growth of the produce in the duration, the produce <b>is permitted</b> to be eaten. There is no איסור כלאים even if הוסיף מאתיים –<br><b>כדתנן במסכת כלאים (פרק ה' משנה ו') הרואה ירק בכרם –</b><br><b>As we learnt in a משנה in מסכת כלאים one who sees a vegetable in a vineyard</b> which is considered כלאים if they are growing close together –<br><b>ואמר כשאגיע לשם אלקטנו הוסיף מאתים מותר –</b><br><b>And he said, ‘when I will arrive there, I will gather it’;<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This expression indicates that he is pursuing to rid his field from כלאים as soon as possible.</i></b> the דין is that even if <b>it grew an additional two hundredth,</b> by the time he arrived to harvest it, nevertheless <b>it is permitted.</b> There is no איסור כלאים. On the other hand, if he said instead –<br><b>לכשאחזור אלקטנו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This indicates that he is not in a special hurry to eradicate כלאים from his field.</i> הוסיף מאתים אסור –</b><br><b>When I shall return</b> (from whatever he intended to do then) <b>then I will gather it,</b> then the דין is if <b>it added a two hundredth</b> during this interlude, the produce <b>is prohibited.</b> It has the status of כלאים. This concludes the quote from the משנה in כלאים.<br><b>אלמא כשהוא מחזר אחר לקיטתו אפילו הוסיף מאתים מותר –</b><br><b>It is apparent that when he is pursuing to gather the vegetable</b> (as soon as possible) <b>even if מאתיים was added</b> during his pursuit of harvesting it, <b>it is</b> nevertheless <b>permitted.</b><br>The question is, what difference is there whether he is pursuing to rid his vineyard of כלאים or not. Seemingly it should depend only on whether it was הוסיף מאתיים or not. תוספות explains:<br><b>והטעם יש לפרש משום דכתיב (דברים כב<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק ט'.</i>) לא תזרע כרמך כלאים<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">There is an איסור כלאים even when one does not actually plant them together. If they happen to be growing together, even without any conscious effort to plant them, it is still prohibited to maintain כלאים. Nonetheless this prohibition against maintaining כלאים applies only when it is similar to planting.</i> דומיא דזריעה דניחא ליה:</b><br><b>The reason</b> for this דין <b>may be explained; for it is written</b> in the תורה <b>do not plant כלאים</b> (in) <b>your vineyard.</b> This teaches us that the איסור of כלאים needs to be <b>similar to planting.</b> This similarity consists <b>that just like by planting</b> it is obvious <b>that he is pleased</b> with his planting כלאים, for otherwise he would not plant the כלאים. Similarly, when כלאים is growing in one’s field, it becomes prohibited only when there is a certain satisfaction that it is growing.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore in the case in מס' כלאים, when he is pursuing to gather the vegetable as soon as possible, it does not become אסור. It is apparent that he is not satisfied with the כלאים growth. Therefore it is irrelevant how much it grew in the meantime, since he is not satisfied. However when he is not pursuing to gather the ירק immediately, but states rather that he will do it when he gets around to it, this demonstrates that there is a certain satisfaction with the כלאים growth (for otherwise he would uproot it as soon as possible), therefore if הוסיף מאתיים  it is כלאים. The same applies to the rebuilding of the wall. As long as he is involved in building the wall, he is demonstrating that he is not satisfied with the כלאים situation. It is only when he is מייאש from building the wall that it becomes אסור. He is demonstrating that he is not bothered (and in fact satisfied) by the כלאים growth</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The פסוק states לא תזרע כרמך כלאים. We derive from this that the איסור כלאים is only when one is pleased with the כלאים growth; as is the case when one plants כלאים. Where one demonstrates that he is not satisfied with the כלאים growth, it is not כלאים. This explains why as long as the בעל הכרם is involved in repairing the wall there is no איסור כלאים. Similarly when one is going directly to uproot כלאים, it does not become כלאים, regardless how much it grew in the duration.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly even if the בעל הכרם was נתיאש it should not become כלאים, since the בעל התבואה is not happy with the situation.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>
<b>וחייב באחריותו—And he is liable for its responsibility</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה in מסכת גיטין states:<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ב,נב דף.</i> If one is מטמא another’s טהרות (for instance תרומה) thus rendering it worthless (for it needs to be burnt), the rule is that if he did it בשוגג he is פטור, however במזיד he is חייב. This is different than regular damages, where one is liable whether it was בשוגג or במזיד. The גמרא there explains that legally (התורה מן) he is פטור in all cases since this is a היזק שאינו ניכר – an unrecognizable damage. There is no physical change to the טהרות. It does not appear to us as if the טהרות have been damaged. A היזק שאינו ניכר is not considered a היזק. If it was done במזיד, however, the חכמים punished the perpetrator in order to prevent people from wantonly damaging other people’s טהרות. Our case of כלאים seems to be a היזק שאינו ניכר. Why is he חייב?! תוספות will discuss this issue.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates the following difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דהיזק שאינו ניכר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The damage incurred to the grain is not apparent. The כלאים grain looks like regular grain. The damage to the grain is halachic damage; it is אסור בהנאה. This damage is not apparent. Why is the בעל הכרם liable for this damage?</i> לא שמיה היזק (גיטין נג,א) –</b><br><b>Even though that an unrecognizable damage is not considered a damage</b> –<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>נראה לרבינו יצחק דהאי חשיב היזק ניכר –</b><br><b>The</b> ר"י <b>is of the opinion that this</b> case of כלאים <b>is considered a recognizable damage –<br>שהרי ניכר הוא שהוא כלאים כשרואה הגפנים בשדה –</b><br><b>For it is obvious that it is</b> כלאים <b>when</b> one <b>sees the grapevines in the</b> grain <b>field.</b> It is known that grape vines and grain growing together are כלאים and אסור בהנאה. Therefore when one sees the כלאים he observes (in his mind’s eye) damaged and worthless produce. The damage is obvious and recognizable.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is seemingly introducing a new concept. היזק ניכר does not mean that there is an obvious physical damage present; that there has been physical destruction thereby limiting or eliminating its usefulness. It is sufficient if it is recognizable that the object suffered halachic damage. It is now unlawful to use this item in its customary manner. If it is obvious that legally it may not be used, that is considered a היזק ניכר.</i><br>תוספות anticipates a question:<br><b>ומטמא אף על פי שרואין השרץ<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A שרץ is a creeping, crawling type of animal. There are eight שרצים enumerated in the (ל-כט ,יא שמיני) תורה that are מטמא when dead. A dead שרץ is considered an הטומאה אב. It can be מטמא people as well as food.</i> על הטהרות –</b><br><b>And</b> concerning one <b>who defiles</b> the purified products (טהרות) of another, that is considered היזק שאינו ניכר in all instances <b>even when the</b> dead שרץ <b>is seen on the</b> טהרות<b>,</b> nevertheless it is considered a ניכר שאינו היזק. Seemingly there too it is obvious to all, that these טהרות are טמא since there is a שרץ on them. What is the difference between כלאים which is considered a היזק ניכר and מטמא which is considered a  ניכר שאינו היזק?<br>תוספות responds that by טהרות –<br><b>לא חשיב היזק ניכר דמי יודע אם הוכשרו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Foodstuffs cannot become טמא unless they came (willingly) in contact with water, before the טומאה touched them. This is derived from a (לד ,יא שמיני) פסוק which states יטמא מים עליו יבוא אשר 'וגו האוכל מכל; indicating that it can become טמא only after it came in contact with water. Seeing the שרץ on the טהרות is not evidence that the טהרות are טמא. It is possible that the טהרות never came in contact with water, and therefore are not מוכשר to be מקבל טומאה. That is why it is considered a ניכר שאינו היזק (even if it is טמא). See: ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –<br>It is not considered a</b>  היזק ניכר<b>,</b> even if one sees the שרץ on the טהרות. The reason is <b>for who knows whether</b> the טהרות <b>are fit</b> to become טמא. However by כלאים there are no such mitigating circumstances. In all cases it is כלאים. Therefore it is considered a  היזק ניכר.<br>תוספות anticipates an alternate solution to his question, and negates it:<br><b>אבל אין לומר דהכא נמי הוי היזק שאינו ניכר –</b><br><b>However one cannot say</b> the following to resolve the original question; why is he חייב? It is a היזק שאינו ניכר! Seemingly we may answer <b>that indeed</b> כלאים <b>is also a</b> היזק שאינו ניכר, and nevertheless he is חייב –<br><b>וקנסוהו כמו במטמא (שם) שלא יהא כל אחד הולך ומטמא טהרותיו של חבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">If the דין would be that היזק שאינו ניכר is always פטור, then there is the likelihood that if one were angered by his friend, he would avenge himself, by being מטמא his friend’s טהרות. He would be secure in the knowledge that he will not be liable for the damage since it is a היזק שאינו ניכר. This may cause rampant destruction. Therefore the חכמים instituted that even by a היזק שאינו ניכר such as מטמא, the perpetrator will be punished and required to make compensation for the damage he caused. We may think that the same holds true in our case of כלאים. That really it is a היזק שאינו ניכר, nevertheless the חכמים punished him for his negligence and require him to compensate for the damage. [The concern is that people may purposely inflict the damage of כלאים on others.]<br></i> –</b><br><b>Because</b> the חכמים <b>punished him, just</b> as the חכמים punished one <b>who is מטמא</b> the טהרות of another. The reason for the punishment of מטמא is <b>in order that no one should go and be מטמא</b> <b>his friend’s טהרות.</b><br>תוספות negates this option:<br><b>דהכא ליכא למיחש להכי שבעל הכרם נמי מפסיד –</b><br><b>For here</b> by מחיצת הכרם there <b>can be no such concern</b>, that he will willfully cause the other’s crop to become כלאים, <b>for the vineyard owner loses as well</b>. His vines are also כלאים and אסור בהנאה. We are not concerned that a person will be so spiteful to damage someone else, when he himself is being damaged through this action. Therefore in our case of כלאים the חכמים would not have punished the בעל הכרם, for there is no concern of widespread vandalism; as opposed to טומאה.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The point of a קנס is to prevent similar occurrences. If it is an isolated instance there is no need for קנס.</i> By טומאה the חכמים were concerned, for the perpetrator suffers no loss.<br>תוספות offers another reason why the solution of קנס is inappropriate:<br><b>ועוד אי קנס הוא במזיד דוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It will be necessary to distinguish between the falling of the wall, which was not במזיד, but rather באונס, as opposed to his negligence in rebuilding the wall which may be considered במזיד. However the מזיד of not rebuilding a wall would not seem sufficient to warrant a קנס, if דין פ"ע there is no חיוב.</i> היה לו להתחייב:</b><br><b>And furthermore if</b> the liability of the בעל הכרם <b>is a punishment</b> but it is not a real היזק <b>he should be liable only</b> if it <b>was premeditated.</b> A קנס is appropriate if the perpetrator acts in a premeditating and purposeful manner to harm the other. In our case of מחיצת הכרם, the איסור כלאים came accidentally; the wall fell in. The בעל הכרם did not want to make כלאים for the בעל השדה. There is no rationale to punish someone for an accident. For these two reasons we can therefore not accept this solution that it is a קנס. Rather the reason the בעל הכרם is חייב is because it is a  היזק ניכר.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>כלאים is a היזק ניכר since it is obvious that the produce in this field (a mixture of grapes and grain) is אסור בהנאה. However טהרותיו מטמא is considered a היזק שאינו ניכר since it is possible that the food was never מוכשר לקבל טומאה; the presence of the שרץ notwithstanding.<br>We cannot say that כלאים is a היזק שאינו ניכר and he is קנסא משום חייב because: a) There is no need for a קנס when the alleged perpetrator himself is being damaged as is the case by כלאים, and b) קנס is applicable only by מזיד; by מחיצת הכרם he was not a מזיד.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does תוספות distinguish between כלאים and מטמא, that by כלאים it is always obvious? It would seem that by כלאים it is also not obvious because could be it is not ליה ניחא?!<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5. See ('כ אות) בל"י, נח"מ, (ג"פ אות) סןכ"ד.</i><br>2. What would be the דין if someone plants wheat in a neighbor’s vineyard; is he חייב or not?

Line 3

<b>ואימא מאי מחיצה פלוגתא—And I can say, what </b>does <b>מחיצה</b> mean; <b>a division</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא originally interpreted מחיצה to mean a wall. After the גמרא showed that this is based on a ברייתא (and inferring from this translation that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק), the גמרא challenges this assumption and declares that מחיצה should mean a (property) division. There is seemingly no basis for this challenge; on the contrary the accepted translation of 'מחיצה' universally, is a wall. תוספות deals with this issue.<br>------------------------------<br><b>מפרש רבינו יצחק<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Why does the גמרא want to reinterpret the word מחיצה to mean a division, as opposed to the original interpretation that מחיצה is a dividing wall. The word מחיצה generally refers to a wall, not to a division.</i> משום דעל לשון גודא יש כמה קושיות כדפריך בסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא on this עמוד asks many questions on the opinion that ה"לש ר"ה from many משניות and a מימרא. תוספות has previously stated (סברוה ה"ד 'א עמוד), that the answers to these challenges are unconvincing.</i> –</b><br><b>The ר"י explains; because on the translation</b> that מחיצה refers to a <b>wall, there are many difficulties as the</b> גמרא <b>will shortly ask.</b> The גמרא asks many questions on the interpretation that מחיצה means a wall. This interpretation of גודא requires us to assume that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא immediately preceding this 'ואימא'.</i> The גמרא cites many sources which indicate that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק.<br><b>לפיכך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא presents its opposition to גודא מחיצה and offers the alternate that פלוגתא מחיצה immediately after the גמרא inferred that if גודא מחיצה then ה"לש ר"ה. This may indicate that the opposition was not to the translation itself, but rather what is inferred from the translation, namely that ה"לש ר"ה.<br></i> דוחק לפרש מחיצה פלוגתא אף על גב דבכל מקום הוי מחיצה גודא:</b><br><b>Therefore,</b> on account of these questions, the גמרא forces itself <b>to awkwardly interpret</b> the word <b>מחיצה</b> to mean <b>a division, even though that everywhere the</b> meaning of <b>'מחיצה'</b> <b>is a wall.</b> It is preferable to compromise the literal meaning, and conform to all the cited sources, than having a proper translation but (seemingly) contradicting all the cited sources.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא challenges the assumption that מחיצה means גודא. According to that assumption, we will maintain that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק. There are many sources which indicate that ה"ר שמיה היזק. Therefore it is preferable to interpret מחיצה to mean a division, thereby maintaining that; ה"ר שמיה היזק Even though this interpretation runs contrary to the usual interpretation of the word מחיצה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why can we not say that the reason the גמרא wants to say מחיצה פלוגתא is because if מחיצה גודא then it should have said 'בונין אותו' instead of 'בונין את הכותל', as the גמרא asks? Or is this also included in the 'כמה קושיות', that תוספות refers to?<br>2. What does this תוספות teach us as to the relative strengths of כלל versus פרט?
<b>וכיון<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It may prove helpful to first study the גמרא on א,ג from 'וכו אמרי אחרינא לישנא until after the parenthetic text that ends with (יחלוקו. See also מאי ה"ד א,ג תוספות.</i> דרצו בונין את הכותל בעל כרחו—And since they wanted, they build the wall against</b> either <b>one’s will</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא proposed an alternate reading of the משנה. The word מחיצה is translated as a division, and the thrust of the משנה is as follows; once the partners agreed to divide the חצר, each can enforce building a dividing wall. Generally when people own something in partnership either party can independently dissolve the partnership and divide it. Why would there be a need for an agreement to divide the חצר. In addition, what is the relevance of this agreement to divide, to the teaching of our משנה? The משנה is ultimately concerned about the wall, not about the division! תוספות will address these issues.<br>---------------------<br><b>לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">א,ג דף.</i> מוקי לה כשאין בה דין חלוקה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה states (א,יא דף) that one partner cannot coerce the other partner to divide their joint חצר, unless there is four אמות space for each partner after the division. [An object cannot be forcibly divided between שותפים, unless after the division each part retains its original status. A חצר less than ד' אמות, is not considered a viable (usable) חצר. A חצר of a total space less than אמות 'ח is a חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה, unless, of course, both partners agree to divide.] If there is less than that amount of space, then neither can coerce the other to divide. Our משנה is discussing such a חצר. Therefore it is required that they first both agree to divide the חצר – מחיצה לעשות שרצו השותפין, and (only) then, one can coerce the other to build a dividing wall jointly, since היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק.</i> –</b><br><b>Later</b> the גמרא <b>will interpret</b> our משנה, which requires that they both must first agree to divide, and only then can one coerce the other to build a wall jointly; that our משנה is discussing a חצר <b>where it is not legally</b> enforceable <b>to divide.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה לרבינו יצחק דאמאי נקט תנא דמתניתין באין בה דין חלוקה וקתני רצו –</b><br><b>And the</b> ר"י <b>is perplexed; why does the</b> תנא <b>of our</b> משנה <b>discuss</b> a case <b>where it is not legally</b> enforceable <b>to divide, and therefore the תנא must state 'רצו' –</b> they wanted to divide the חצר –<br><b>לא ליתני רצו ולאיירי בשיש בה דין חלוקה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">According to this לשון that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק, the תנא wants to teach us that either partner can coerce the other to jointly build a wall. The תנא should have just stated that one party can coerce the other to build a wall. Why the preamble that they wanted to divide a חצר שאין בה ד"ח? It seems totally unnecessary. All the משנה should say is  שחלקו בונין את הכותל וכו' השותפין or something similar. By a חצר שיש בה ד"ח either partner can coerce the other to both: a) divide the חצר, since it has a דין חלוקה, and in addition, to b) build a wall.</i> –</b><br><b>The</b> תנא <b>should not state</b> '<b>רצו</b>' at all in the משנה <b>and let</b> the תנא <b>discuss</b> a case <b>where there is a דין חלוקה!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ותירץ דקא משמע לן דסלקא דעתין בשאין בה דין חלוקה –</b><br><b>And the</b> ר"י <b>answered</b> that the תנא <b>comes to teach us</b> something concerning the דין of building a כותל by a חצר שאין בה ד"ח <b>for it may have entered our minds that by</b> a <b>חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה,</b> if one originally agreed to divide but now refuses to build a wall –<br><b>דמצי למימר כי איתרצאי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read אתרציתי.</i> לך לחלוק על מנת שלא לעשות גודא –</b><br><b>That he may say</b> that <b>when I agreed to you to divide</b> the חצר שאין בה ד"ח, it was <b>on the condition that</b> there be <b>no</b> obligation <b>to build a wall –<br>אבל על מנת לעשות גודא לא איתרצי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this (too) to read אתרציתי.</i> לך<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">If the משנה would have just told us the obligation to build a wall by a חצר שאין בה ד"ח, we may have mistakenly assumed that by a חצר שאין בה ד"ח, then either one can refuse to build a wall, by arguing that his initial agreement to divide was contingent that there would be no (additional expense, or loss of area by building a) wall. Our agreement to divide will be cancelled retroactively if you insist on building a wall. See: ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>But</b> that we should divide <b>on the condition to</b> ultimately <b>make a wall, I never agreed to you</b> to divide under such circumstances. The משנה teaches us however, that once both partners agree to divide (even a ח"ד בה שאין חצר) then either one can coerce the other to build a wall jointly.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The reason, according to the ש"רא, is because once we assume that ה"ר שמיה היזק, then it is assumed that if they agreed to divide, it is implicit in their agreement to build a wall to remove the היזק ראיה.</i><br><b>ויש ספרים דמקשין ומתרץ כן להדיא בשילהי שמעתין:<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is referring to the גמרא in parenthesis on א,ג דף.</i></b><br><b>And there are texts</b> of גמרות <b>that clearly ask and answer</b> this very same question <b>at the end of the discourse.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to the לשון that מחיצה means division then the משנה is discussing a חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה. That is why their consent for division is necessary. The novelty of this דין is that neither can claim that my agreement to divide was based on the assumption that there will be no wall.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How are we to understand the א"הו that one party can claim I never agreed to a wall:<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> Does it mean that therefore you have no claim against me and there will be no wall? Or does it mean that if you insist on the wall, the division is null and we go back to sharing the חצר together?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות כה.</i>

Line 4

<b>יתיב רב יוסף וקא מעיין בה—</b><b>רב יוסף was sitting and contemplating it </b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that איפרא הורמיז (the mother of שבור מלכא) sent a purse of דינרים to רב יוסף and instructed him to use it for a מצוה רבה (a great מצוה). רב יוסף was thinking what is a מצוה רבה and אביי told him that פדיון שבויים is a מצוה רבה. Our תוספות discusses the willingness of רב יוסף to do charity on behalf of a gentile, which seemingly is something that is frowned upon.<br>----------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר וכי לית ליה ביבש קצירה תשברנה וגומר (ישעיה כז<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק יא.</i>) כדאמרינן בפירקין (דף י,ב) –</b><br><b>And if you will say; and does not</b> רב יסף <b>agree</b> to the interpretation of the פסוק <b>ביבש קצירה תשברנה, etc. as</b> the גמרא <b>states</b> later<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there relates that (the same) איפרא הורמיז sent to רב אמי four hundred זוזים, but he did not accept them. She then sent it to רבא who did accept it. רב אמי took umbrage and said to רבא do you not follow the פסוק of ביבש קצירה תשברנה, meaning (see רש"י there ד"ה ביבש) that when the זכות of צדקה will wither away from the gentiles, then the gentiles will break.  By accepting from them money for צדקה we are giving them additional power. [The simple translation of the פסוק is; when its branch will wither, it will break.]  </i> <b>in this פרק.</b> How did רב יוסף consider using this money from a gentile for צדקה? <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דקבלה משום שלום מלכות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">איפרא הורמיז was the king’s mother; had she been slighted it would cause negative repercussions for the Jews.</i> כדעבד רבא לקמן (שם) –</b><br><b>And one can say; that he accepted</b> the money <b>in order to</b> keep the <b>peace</b> with the <b>government, as רבא did</b> (which is mentioned) <b>later<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 2. רבא accepted the money from איפרא הורמיז because of שלום מלכות.</i></b> in the גמרא –<br><b>וכי היכי דפלגינהו רבא לעניי עובדי כוכבים הכא נמי פדה בהו רב יוסף שבויי עובדי כוכבים –</b><br><b>And just as רבא distributed</b> the money received from איפרא הורמיז <b>to the gentile poor,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Giving the money to עניי עכו"ם is not considered a זכות for the giver (see ר' גרשום on יא,א ד"ה לעניי). See however בל"י who maintains that if giving לעניי עכו"ם is not considered צדקה at all then why is it necessary to state that רבא (and רב יוסף) accepted the money משום שלום מלכות. This would seemingly proof the צדקה לעניים is a מצוה however it is less of a מצוה than giving it to עניי ישראל therefore [combined with שלום מלכות] they were permitted to distribute it.</i> here too רב יוסף redeemed gentile captives with this</b> money.<br>תוספות offers an alternate approach:<br><b>ומיהו לא צריכי להכי אלא כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות הב"ח (and others) who amend the text to read הקונטרס דרב יוסף קבלה הכא משום; see רש"י יא,א ד"ה דלא סיימוה. </i> דרבא דקבלה משום שלום מלכות –</b><br><b>However it is not necessary to</b> come on to this explanation that רב יוסף used the money for שבויי עכו"ם, <b>but rather as רש"י explained that (רבא) [רב יוסף] accepted</b> the money from איפרא הורמיז <b>because of שלום מלכות –<br>וכיון שאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">This should (seemingly) be amended to read שאמרה.</i> לו ליתן למצוה רבה לא היה אפשר לחלקם לעניי עובדי כוכבים –</b><br><b>But since [s]he told</b> רב יוסף <b>to distribute it for a מצוה רבה it was not possible for him to divide it among עניי עכו"ם –<br>דאסור לגנוב דעת הבריות ואפילו דעתו של עובד כוכבים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there explains the ruling of the משנה why one may not send to an עכו"ם a ירך חתוכה with the גיד הנשה remaining inside, because the עכו"ם will presume that the ישראל took the trouble to remove the גיד (making it fit [even] for the ישראל) and then because of his friendship with the עכו"ם he gifts it to him, when in fact he did not remove the גיד. This is גניבת דעת of a נכרי which is also אסור. See ‘Thinking it over # 3.</i> (חולין צד,א) –</b><br><b>For it is forbidden to fool people and even</b> to mislead an <b>עכו"ם.</b> Therefore רב יוסף had no choice but to be פודה שבויי ישראל.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם, that it is not usual for ישראל to be פודה שבויי עכו"ם (as opposed to being מפרנס עני עכו"ם). See (however) ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><b>אבל מעות המתחלקים לעניים אין כאן גניבת דעת –</b><br><b>However monies</b> which are given to be <b>distributed to the poor</b> (as in the case of רב אמי ורבא later) <b>there is no גניבת דעת</b> if it is distributed to עניי עכו"ם (solely) –<br><b>דאינהו נמי ידע שישראל רגילין לפרנסם –</b><br><b>For the</b> gentiles <b>also know that the ישראל are accustomed to sustain</b> the עניי עכו"ם-<br><b>כדאמר בהנזקין (גיטין דף סא,א) מפרנסים עניי עכו"ם עם עניי ישראל מפני דרכי שלום –</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>הניזקין, we provide for the עניי עכו"ם together with עניי ישראל because of insuring the peace</b> (between the עכו"ם and ישראל).<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<b><br>והא דקבל מההוא טייעא דנדב שרגא לבי כנישתא בפרק קמא דערכין (דף ו,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל עד)-</b><br><b>And</b> that which we find <b>in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ערכין that they accepted</b> from an <b>Arab who donated candles for the synagogue –<br>אף על גב דהתם לא היה שלום מלכות<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The טייעא (presumably) had no connection to the government.</i> –</b><br><b>Even though</b> in <b>that</b> case <b>there was no</b> concern of <b>שלום מלכות,</b> so why did they accept it (there is the issue of ביבש קצירה תשברנה) –<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>התם טעמא משום דהוו כמו קרבן –</b><br><b>The reason</b> they accepted it <b>there because</b> that donation <b>was like a קרבן –<br>ואמרינן (נזיר סב,א) איש איש<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The פסוק in ויקרא (אמור) כב,יח states איש איש וגו' אשר יקריב קרבנו וגו'; the extra איש includes עכו"ם.</i> לרבות נכרים שנודרים נדרים ונדבות כישראל:<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות אשר"י אות לו that נדרים ונדבות are not לכפר (they are voluntarily) therefore they do not add זכותים, however צדקה is מכפר (see later י,ב where ר' יוחנן בן זכאי states כך צדקה מכפרת על אומות העולם), therefore one should refrain from having the עכו"ם give צדקה. Donating to a shul is like a קרבן but not like צדקה.</i></b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא states that the פסוק of <b>איש איש includes gentiles, that</b> they too <b>may offer pledges and gifts</b> for קרבנות <b>just like ישראל.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One may accept money from an עכו"ם to distribute for צדקה (to עכו"ם) if it is for שלום מלכות. One may even distribute it for ישראל if otherwise it would be גניבת דעת (as in the case of מצוה רבה). Donations to a ביכנ"ס may be accepted from עכו"ם because it is like bringing a קרבן, which עכו"ם may do.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According to the מסקנא of תוספות did רב יוסף redeem שבויי ישראל or שבויי עכו"ם?<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. Why did not רב יוסף redeem שבויי עכו"ם (if we he assume he was פודה שבויי ישראל)?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>3. רש"י stated that רב יוסף could not have redeemed שבויי עכו"ם because it would be גניבת דעת.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8</i> Seemingly, since איפרא הורמיז told רב יוסף to use the money for a מצוה רבה, if רב יוסף would have used it to be פודה שבויי עכו"ם (which is definitely not a מצוה רבה) it would be גניבה ממש, not merely גניבת דעת!<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות קעט.</i>

Line 5

<b>בונין את הכותל באמצע פשיטא—They build the wall in the middle; that is obvious!</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא concluded the discussion concerning the מ"ד that מחיצה means a wall (negating the possibility that it means ‘to divide’). The גמרא then cites the משנה which states בונין את הכותל באמצע and asks: פשיטא! It may seem that this is a general question on the משנה, regardless whether we maintain that מחיצה is either גודא or פלוגתא. This view may be bolstered by the following גמרא, which challenges היזק ראיה שמיה לאו והיזק?!<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The סברא that שמיה היזק לאו היזק ראיה is contingent on the opinion that גודא מחיצה.</i> The גמרא continues to cite no less than six sources (identified by a preceding סימן) that contradict this view. This would seem to indicate that the questions on the מ"ד who maintains היזק ראיה לאו שמיה היזק, begin only at this point, and not by the previous question of פשיטא; which is a general question according to either opinion. תוספות will negate this view.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7 to the ‘Summary’ for an explanation why the questions in the גמרא are divided into two parts.</i><br>-------------------------<br><b>למאן דאמר גודא פריך כמו כל הנך פירכי דלקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא will immediately pose six difficulties for the מ"ד that מחיצה means גודא.</i> –</b><br><b>This question is</b> (only) <b>on the one who maintains that</b> the word מחיצה in the משנה refers to <b>a wall,</b> <b>just like all these questions</b> mentioned <b>further</b> in our גמרא.<br>תוספות will first explain why this question is valid according to the מ"ד that מחיצה is גודא:<br><b>דכשהקנו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא later (א,ג) explains that when the משנה states 'שרצו' – they agreed (to build a wall), it does not mean merely a verbal agreement. It means that there was a valid contractual obligation to build the wall.</i> לעשות גודא כך הקנה זה כמו זה ופשיטא דבאמצע –</b><br><b>For when they contracted to build a wall,</b> it is obvious that <b>that this one contracted</b> to build the wall <b>just as the other</b> contracted to build a wall. <b>And it is obvious</b> that it must be built <b>in the middle</b>.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">They both took upon themselves a contractual obligation to build a wall jointly. It is obvious that the responsibility of building this wall lies on both of them equally; in regards to material as well as to space. Therefore the גמרא rightfully asks 'פשיטא'! See ‘Thinking it over’. </i><br>תוספות will now explain why there is no difficulty according to the מ"ד that מחיצה means to divide.<br><b>אבל למאן דאמר פלוגתא איצטריך למימר –</b><br><b>However according to the one that maintains</b> that מחיצה means <b>to divide</b>, <b>it is required</b> that the משנה <b>say</b> so explicitly. For had the משנה not stated that they build it in the middle –<br><b>סלקא דעתך אמינא דמשום היזק ראיה יש לו לסייע בבנין הכותל –</b><br><b>It would enter our minds to say,</b> granted <b>that on account of היזק ראיה,</b> the reluctant partner <b>is required to help in the building of the wall –<br>אבל אין לו לבנות בחלקו בשביל כך:<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The reluctant partner may claim that his loss of property (in a חלוקה דין בו שאין חצר), caused by the wall, is as damaging to him (if not more), as the resultant היזק ראיה he is causing his neighbor. The lack of mentioning בונין את הכותל באמצע, in the משנה may lead us to accept this argument.</i></b><br><b>However he is not required on account</b> of היזק ראיה <b>to build</b> the wall <b>in his portion</b> of the property. There was never a קנין between the two partners to build a wall (according to this מ"ד). We are obligating him to build a wall because he is (also) contributing to the היזק ראיה of his neighbor. We may argue (were it not for the משנה) that this obligation is limited to material but not space. The משנה therefore rightfully teaches us that היזק ראיה requires one to contribute space as well (even by a חלוקה דין בה שאין חצר).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The question פשיטא is only according to the מ"ד that מחיצה is גודא.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The reason that the גמרא breaks up the questions on this מ"ד into two sections; first the question of פשיטא and then the six following questions, may be as follows: The question of פשיטא deals specifically with the translation of מחיצה to mean גודא. This translation forces us to understand that they (contractually) agreed to build a wall. Thereby eliciting the question פשיטא! The following six questions, however deal specifically with the שמיה היזק לאו היזק ראיה component of this opinion. Therefore they are asked separately (with their own סימן designation).</i> According to this מ"ד both partners contractually obligated themselves to build the wall (otherwise there is no obligation to build anything); it is therefore obvious that both have to give the space equally. The דין of בונין את הכותל באמצע is seemingly superfluous. However, according to the מ"ד that מחיצה פלוגתא there was never an agreement to build a wall; rather the partners are coerced to build it on account of היזק ראיה. Had the משנה not specifically told us that it must be in the middle, we would have given credence to the argument that היזק ראיה can only obligate one to pay for the expenses, but not to give up property.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How does the גמרא answer the קשיא of 'פשיטא'!; <sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5</i> according to תוספות?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכת דוד אות צז.</i>

Line 7



Line 8

<b>תא שמע וכן בגינה—Come and hear; and similarly by a garden</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites from the משנה the case of 'וכן בגינה' to prove that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק, for the משנה says that by a גינה too, one must erect a מחיצה. However a closer reading of the משנה not only negates the proof, but may even prove the opposite. The משנה actually states וכן בגינה מקום שנהגו לגדור מחייבין אותו, indicating that the obligation to build a wall by a גינה is limited only to those places where the custom is to build dividing walls.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">At this point, תוספות will perhaps maintain that by a חצר as well, if it is a מקום שנהגו לגדור, one is obligated to build a wall even according to the מ"ד היזק ראיה לאו שמיה היזק. According to the מסקנא of תוספות, however, it is not necessary to make such an assumption.</i> This would indicate that where there is no prevailing custom, one is not required to build a wall. This would seem to indicate that היזק ראיה לאו שמיה היזק; the exact opposite of what we are trying to prove.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It is not a קשיא on the מ"ד that ש"ה ה"ר, for he can maintain that by a גינה the היזק ראיה is less than in a חצר;  therefore the obligation to build a wall in a גינה is only in a מקום שנהגו לגדור.</i> תוספות will answer this question.<br>------------------------<br><b>לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">א,ד דף.</i> מסקינן דהכי קאמר וכן בגינה סתם כמקום שנהגו לגדור דמי –</b><br><b>Later</b> the גמרא <b>concludes that this is what</b> the משנה intended <b>to say</b> when it wrote 'וכן בגינה מקום שנהגו לגדור מחייבין אותו'; namely ‘<b>and similarly, an unclassified garden;<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A place where there is (as yet) no prevailing custom whether to fence gardens or not.</i> is like a place where the custom is to fence it’.</b> The משנה states that a גינה סתם requires a wall just as a מקום שנהגו לגדור does. –<br><b>הלכך דייק שפיר דהיזק ראיה שמיה היזק:<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה cannot be discussing a case where they agreed to build a wall; in that case they would be obligated to build it even מקום שנהגו שלא לגדור. The משנה is therefore teaching us that סתם בגינה one is obligated to build a wall even if they did not initially agree to build a wall. This proves that שמיה היזק היזק ראיה. Otherwise; why should there be an obligation to build a wall in a גינה סתם, without a prior agreement?!</i></b><br><b>Therefore it is a proper inference,</b> from the statement וכן בגינה, <b>that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The proof from וכן בגינה that שמיה היזק היזק ראיה is based on the conclusion of the גמרא, that when the משנה states וכן בגינה it means that a גינה סתם requires a dividing wall just as it is required in a מקום שנהגו לגדור. The requirement for a wall by a גינה סתם can seemingly only be on account of היזק ראיה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is the word 'וכן בגינה' understood differently in the original interpretation of the משנה as opposed to the final interpretation as cited by תוספות?<br>2. What is the status of the חצר in our משנה; is it a מקום שנהגו לגדור, a מקום שנהגו שלא לגדור, or a חצר סתם? What would be the meaning of ''מקום שנהגו לבנות גויל וכו' mean?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

Line 9

<b>גינה שאני כדרבי אבא וכולי—A garden is different; like רבי אבא, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא teaches us that even if we maintain היזק ראיה לאו שמיה היזק, nevertheless under certain circumstances we are required to build a dividing wall. One such instance is the case of a גינה. The reason for building a wall in a גינה is to assure that we follow the injunction of ר' אבא, which prohibits a person from looking at his neighbor’s ripening crops.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The reason, according to רש"י is that he should not do damage to him through a רעה עין.</i> Seemingly this injunction applies to all crops, not only the crops of a גינה. In fact the injunction of ר' אבא specifically refers to a שדה and קמותיה which imply a wheat field that is usually found in a בקעה. Our משנה requires a wall by a גינה and not by a בקעה. Our תוספות will be discussing this question; why is the obligation to build a wall limited to a גינה and not to a בקעה?<br>-------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומהאי טעמא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A גינה requires a fence because one is forbidden to stand in a neighbor’s field while the produce is ripening.</i> יתחייב נמי לגדור בבקעה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Whether we maintain היזק ראיה לאו שמיה היזק, or it is assumed that in a בקעה there is no היזק ראיה, nevertheless there should be an obligation to erect a dividing wall in a בקעה, in order to comply with the ruling of ר' אבא; just as we are required to comply with this ruling by a גינה. Why is there a difference between a גינה and a בקעה? In both places produce is growing. Why by a גינה we need to comply with ר' אבא's ruling, but not by a בקעה?</i> –</b><br><b>And if you will say; from this very same reasoning, one should be required to fence</b> his adjoining property <b>in a בקעה.</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דשאני גינה שמגדלין בה ירק לאכילה וכל שעה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Vegetables cannot be stored for long periods of time, like grain. There needs to be a continual fresh supply of vegetables from the garden.</i> היא עומדת בקמותיה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The different types of vegetables ripen at different times of the year. At any season there is usually a vegetable growing and ripening. Therefore if there would be no wall there may be a continual transgression of ר' אבא's ruling.</i> –</b><br><b>And one may say; that</b> גינה <b>is different</b> from a בקעה, because in a גינה <b>vegetables are grown for eating</b> on a daily basis <b>and</b> a garden <b>is continually bearing ripening produce –<br>אבל בקעה אינה עומדת בקמותיה אלא חדש אחד בשנה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The grain that usually is planted in a בקעה is a once a year crop. Its ripening season is only one month</i> ולא מיחייב לגדור –</b><br><b>However, a</b> בקעה <b>does not have ripening produce only one month a year and</b> therefore <b>he is not obligated to fence it.</b> The damage that may be caused in that one month does not warrant the expense of a wall.<br><b>אבל אסור לעמוד בשעה שעומדת בקמותיה –</b><br><b>However, one is</b> indeed <b>prohibited from standing</b> and watching his neighbor’s field <b>while the crops are ripening.</b> The ruling of ר' אבא can be adhered to for such a limited time period. In the case of a גינה however, since there are crops on a continual basis, the injunction of ר' אבא will not be able to be followed unless there is a dividing wall.<br>תוספות has an additional question:<br><b>ואם תאמר ולמאן דאמר פלוגתא כיון דאשמועינן דאפילו בחצר שמיה היזק כל שכן בגינה –</b><br><b>And if you will say; according to the one who maintains</b> that מחיצה refers to <b>dividing</b> the חצר, for he maintains that שמיה היזק ראיה היזק <b>once</b> the משנה <b>taught us that even by a</b> חצר (where there does not exist the prohibition of ר' אבא for usually nothing grows in a חצר), היזק ראיה <b>is considered a</b> היזק, then <b>certainly by a גינה,</b> where the prohibition of ר' אבא applies; there is certainly a היזק if there is no wall –<br><b>ואמאי איצטריך תו למיתני וכן בגינה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Obviously a גינה requires a wall even without their consent. According to the מ"ד who maintains היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק it is understood why the משנה teaches us וכן' בגינה'. A wall is not required in a חצר (unless they both agree to it) since ה"ר לאו ש"ה. However in a גינה, a wall is required (even without their consent) on account of ר' אבא. That proves that the requirement of a wall by a גינה is greater than by a חצר. The מ"ד who maintains that a wall is required by a חצר even without their consent (for ה"ר שמיה היזק), will certainly require a dividing wall for a גינה. It need not be mentioned in the משנה!</i> –</b><br><b>So why is it necessary for the תנא of our משנה to teach us 'וכן בגינה'?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">According to the מ"ד ה"ר לאו שמיה היזק it is understood why the משנה teaches us both דינים. In the case of חצר the משנה teaches us that they are required to build a wall כמנהג המדינה, only if they originally agreed to build a מחיצה. The case of גינה teaches us that by a סתם גינה a wall is required even without an agreement. However, according to the מ"ד ה"ר שמיה היזק, both cases are teaching us the same דין. The case of גינה is superfluous, since we can know it with a כל שכן from the דין of חצר. See end of footnote # 9.</i></b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאיצטריך וכן בגינה למיתני משום גויל וגזית:</b><br><b>And one can say; that we need</b> to be taught the case of <b>'וכן בגינה'</b> <b>on account of גויל וגזית;</b> that he can be coerced to build the wall with גויל וגזית according to the מנהג המדינה. If the משנה would not have taught us 'וכן בגינה', we may have mistakenly assumed that any wall is sufficient, even if it is not כמנהג המדינה.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See the various commentaries who explain why we would have thought that by a גינה there is no requirement of גויל וגזית כמנהג המדינה. The following is merely a tentative suggestion. In a חצר the היזק ראיה is continuous and definitive. The use of the חצר is automatically diminished by the mere presence of a neighbor, whether he is looking at the חצר or not. It cannot be utilized to its fullest potential. Each neighbor therefore is considered an actual מזיק. For this type of מזיק the משנה requires him to build a solid wall כמנהג המדינה. In the case of a גינה, however, the neighbor is not necessarily a מזיק per se. It is only when and if he looks specifically at the crops, that he is מזיק him with a עין הרע. We have no proof that there is a מזיק here; only a concern that he may be מזיק him. We require him to build a wall to prevent a possible היזק. Therefore, as soon as he builds any type of wall, even not כמנהג המדינה there is no more היזק, since he cannot look at his neighbor’s crops. I may think that any wall is sufficient. The משנה therefore teaches us וכן בגינה that it must be כמנהג המדינה. ודו"ק וצע"ג. According to this suggestion it needs to be emphasized that the reason תוספות assumes כ"ש בגינה (in the question) is because we see that even the מ"ד of הרלש"ה agrees that a גינה requires a מחיצה; but not necessarily that a גינה inherently requires a מחיצה more than a וד"ל .חצר.  </i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A גינה requires a dividing wall (even if ה"ר לא ש"ה) because of the injunction of ר"א, since there is always produce growing in a גינה. However a בקעה does not require a wall since the crops are growing for only one month during the year. The person will be careful not to stare at his neighbor’s ripening crops. According to the מ"ד that ה"ר ש"ה the משנה teaches us the דין of 'וכן בגינה' to let us know that all the laws of גויל וגזית apply there as well.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is it possible to say that just as according to the מ"ד ה"ר לאו ש"ה nevertheless a גינה is different than חצר and requires a wall, similarly (but in a reverse manner) according to the מ"ד ה"ר ש"ה, a גינה is different than a חצר and does not require a wall (different than what תוספות assumes)? Explain.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות לב ד"ה ועיין.</i><br>2. Is there any connection between the first (קשיא and) תירוץ of תוספות and the second קשיא (and תירוץ)?

<b>נפל שאני—It collapsed; that is different</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא states that even according to the מאן דאמר that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק nevertheless if there originally was a dividing wall, which subsequently collapsed; both neighbors are obligated to rebuild the wall. תוספות will explain<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה נפל for a different explanation why נפל שאני.</i> why there is a difference whether originally there was a wall or not. Seemingly if ה"ר לאו ש"ה there never should be an obligation to build (or rebuild) a wall!<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות explains: The reason they are required to rebuild the wall is –<br><b>שהורגלו לעשות דבר הצנע בחצר ולא למדו ליזהר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The מ"ד ה"ר לא ש"ה agrees that ה"ר causes damage. However, he maintains that there is not sufficient damage (and he is not directly causing it) to obligate him to build a wall. The reluctant partner claims that the damaged party can use the חצר privately when the neighbor is not watching. In the case of נפל, however, that argument is undermined. The neighbor cannot now limit his use of the חצר to certain times, for he is already accustomed to use the חצר privately at all times (לא למדו ליזהר זמ"ז). [In addition] this past private usage while there was a wall, may give him a certain right (חזקה) that his חצר is dedicated to be used for private matters (שהורגלו לעשות דבר הצנע בחצר). It is necessary to rebuild the wall to reinstate and protect this right. See סוכ"ר ובל"י. </i> זה מזה:</b><br><b>for the</b> partners <b>became accustomed to do private things in the</b> חצר <b>and they have not adjusted to be wary of each other.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The היזק ראיה by a fallen wall is greater, since the neighbors are already accustomed to do much of their private work in the חצר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Explain why רש"י and תוספות reject each other’s interpretation of 'נפל שאני'.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br>2. What would be the נפק"מ לדינא between רש"י and תוספות?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות לה.</i>
