<b>ודקארי לה מאי קארי לה—And</b> the one <b>who cited this</b> משנה, <b>why did he cite it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא attempted to refute the מאן דאמר who maintains היזק היזק ראיה לא שמיה, from the משנה of כותל חצר שנפל, where we obligate them to build a wall. The גמרא negates this refutation by stating that all agree that if there was a wall previously, then they are obligated to rebuild it. This answer seems so obvious, that the גמרא challenged the original questioner. How did he think that he could refute the מ"ד of הרשל"ה from the משנה of נפל? Is he not aware that נפל שאני?! What was the question in the first place!? תוספות will, however, redefine the question of 'ודקארי לה מאי קארי לה'.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>כלומר<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">When the term 'כלומר' (or 'פירוש') is used, it usually signifies that the intended meaning is (slightly) different than what we may originally have assumed. Here too, תוספות is negating the explanation of the גמרא the way it was mentioned in the ‘Overview’ (which may be the way רש"י understood the question).</i> פשיטא דנפל שאני –</b><br>The גמרא <b>means to say</b> the following <b>it is obvious that if</b> the wall <b>collapsed it is different,</b> than if there never was a wall. All agree that if the existing wall collapsed he is required to rebuild it. Therefore not only can we not refute the opinion of the מ"ד who maintains that הרשל"ה, from this משנה of נפל –<br><b>ואדרבה היה לו להוכיח מדקתני ונפל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps the text should be amended to read שנפל.</i> מכלל דבעלמא לא שמיה היזק:</b><br><b>but on the contrary the</b> גמרא <b>should have proven</b> the exact opposite; that ה"ר לא ש"ה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See יוסף פורת (in the back of the גמרא) who explains that תוספות was not satisfied with the simple explanation (as mentioned in the ‘Overview’). If that were the question, then what is the s'גמרא answer סיפה איצטריכא ליה? How does that explain, why the question was asked; when the answer is so obvious? However, according to תוספות interpretation, that the question is that we can prove that הרשל"ה, then the s'גמרא answer is well understood. We cannot prove הרשל"ה from the fact that the משנה mentioned נפל. He mentioned נפל for the חידוש in the סיפא, that even if נפל he is not obligated to build more than ד' אמות.</i> For since the משנה teaches us the obligation to build a wall in a case where the wall collapsed, <b>it</b> can be <b>inferred that generally,</b> when there is no previously collapsed wall, but rather when we discuss a חצר that never had a wall, then the היזק ראיה in a חצר <b>is not considered damage;</b> and he is not obligated to build a wall.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The question לה קארי מאי לה ודקארי means that instead of attempting to prove from the משנה of 'הכותל נפל וכו, that ה"ר ש"ה, you should prove that ה"ר לא ש"ה since he is obligated only to rebuild a wall, not to build a new wall.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. What may be difficult with תוספות interpretation?<br>2. If the כותל חצר שנפל was in a חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה, can one coerce the other to keep the division and build a wall למ"ד הרש"ה? What bearing would the answer to this question have on תוספות פירוש?

<b>הזיקא דרבים שאני—Damage</b> caused <b>by many is different</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא attempted to prove that היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק, from the משנה of 'כופין אותו וכו. The גמרא rejected this proof, and stated that in the case of 'בית שער וכו everyone agrees that the היזק ראיה there is שמיה היזק, since it is a היזק ראיה of a רבים. תוספות will discuss why indeed is it a היזקא דברים.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates the following difficulty:<br><b>ואף על גב דלקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">דף ז,ב.</i> משמע דאיירי בחצר שאינה סמוכה לרשות הרבים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there mentions that רשב"ג maintains that the requirement to build a בית שער is limited only to a חצר הסמוכה לרה"ר. The רבנן disagree with רשב"ג and maintain that even a חצר שאינה סמוכה לרה"ר requires a בית שער.</i> –</b><br><b>And even though it seems from</b> the גמרא <b>later that this</b> particular משנה is <b>discussing a</b> חצר <b>which is not nearby to the</b> ה"ר<b>.</b> If the חצר is not סמוכה לרה"ר, why is there היזקא דברים.<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>מכל מקום איכא היזקא דרבים דזימנין דדחקי רבים ועיילי להתם כדאמרינן לקמן –</b><br><b>Nevertheless there is היזקא דברים</b> <b>for occasionally the multitude</b> of people <b>crowd</b> the רה"ר and it is uncomfortable to walk in the רה"ר <b>and they enter into the</b> area near the חצר <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>states later</b>; even though it is not the רה"ר, people walk there nevertheless. That is why even by a שאינה סמוכה לרה"ר חצר, there can be היזקא דברים because of 'זימניו דדחקי וכו.<br>תוספות anticipates the following question. This חצר is אינה סמוכה לרה"ר. רשב"ג maintains that it does not require a בית שער. We are not concerned about the public, since they are at a distance from the חצר. Why then does רשב"ג require the building of a door for the חצר? Seemingly there is no רבים on the outside to cause היזק ראיה.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> תוספות responds:<br><b>ורבן שמעון בן גמליאל אף על גב דלית ליה האי טעמא דזימנין דדחקי רבים –</b><br><b>And רשב"ג</b> <b>even though he does not agree with this reasoning that occasionally the multitudes crowd</b> the רה"ר and the people walk near the חצר. רשב"ג therefore maintains that a בית שער is not required for a חצר שאינה סמוכה לרה"ר.<br><b>מכל מקום מרחוק יכולין לראות לפנים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">We can imagine the three walls of a חצר shaped as a 'ח'. The bottom of the 'ח' opens to a 'מבוי', not directly to the רה"ר. The bottom of the 'ח' is closed with a door. The door however is being opened and closed by the בני החצר. To insure additional privacy a (half-circular) wall is built outside the door with an opening on its side (not directly in front of the door, but rather on the side of the semi-circle). For someone to see inside the חצר he would have to at least get close to the opening of the בית שער. A שומר הפתח (who sits in this בית שער) would be hired to discourage people from venturing close to this opening. If we are not concerned of זימנין דדחקי, and if the חצר is אינה סמוכה לרה"ר, then there is no need for a בית שער because no one is near the חצר. However that is true only if there is a door for the חצר. If there would be no door (and no בית שער) the opening to the חצר (the bottom of the 'ח') is fully exposed. The people in the distant רה"ר, would be constantly looking at the inside of the חצר. The door prevents that היזק ראיה.</i> –</b><br><b>Nevertheless,</b> even though people remain at a distance from the חצר <b>they can see, from afar, inside</b> the חצר and cause היזק ראיה.<br><b>ולכך לא פליג אלא אבית שער אבל בדלת מודה דכופין אותו לבנות:</b><br><b>And therefore</b> רשב"ג <b>does not argue</b> with the רבנן <b>except</b> for the case <b>of a בית שער,</b> <b>however concerning a door</b> for the חצר, even רשב"ג <b>admits</b> that the members of the חצר <b>can coerce</b> any <b>individual</b> of that חצר <b>to</b> participate <b>in building</b> the door.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A חצר שאינה סמוכה לרה"ר is still subject to הזיקא דרבים, since זמני דדחקי בה רבים. A door however, is required even if we are not concerned for זמני דדחקי בה רבים since the בני רה"ר can look into the חצר from afar, if there is no door.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we understand that תוספות question on רשב"ג (why does he require a דלת),<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> is not merely a question in order to understand the position of רשב"ג,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">If that were so, then תוספות would have asked the question later in that סוגיא.</i> but rather a way to prove that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י.</i>

<b>מאי לאו בכותל—Does that not mean with a wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא attempts to refute the מאן דאמר היזק ראיה לא שמיה היזק, based on the משנה of אין חלוקין. The גמרא assumes that the term חולקין indicates dividing by means of a wall. We infer from the משנה that if it is a חצר שיש בה דין חלוקה then the דין is חולקין. That proves that the initiator can compel his partner to build a wall – ה"ר ש"ה. תוספות will challenge this refutation. Even if we assume that חולקין means with a wall, it does not necessarily prove that ש"ה ה"ר.<br>----------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה ויהא בכותל דילמא הכי פירושו –</b><br><b>It is astounding!</b> Granted <b>that</b> they divide it <b>with a wall,</b> however that does not prove that שמיה היזק היזק ראיה, for <b>perhaps this is the interpretation</b> of this משנה<br><b>אין חולקין את החצר אפילו האחד רוצה לבנות את הכותל בתוך שלו –</b><br><b>A</b> חצר <b>cannot be divided</b> (if it is אין בו כדי חלוקה) <b>even if one</b> of the partners <b>wants to build the wall on his share</b> of the property; nevertheless he cannot coerce his partner to divide (since it is a חצר שאין בו דין חלוקה) –<br><b>עד שיהא בה ד' אמות לכל אחד –</b><br><b>Unless there will be four</b> אמות <b>for each</b> of the partners. This is what the משנה states, according to this interpretation. From this we will infer –<br><b>הא אם יש בה ד' אמות לכל אחד חולקין אם רצה לכנוס ולבנות בתוך שלו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The initiator can never coerce his partner to build a wall. The entire discussion was only concerning the division of the property, with the assumption that the wall will be built by the initiator only, and on his property.</i> –</b><br><b>However if there is four</b> אמות <b>for each of them,</b> then <b>they divide,</b> provided <b>if</b> the initiator <b>is willing to go into his own property and build</b> the wall there. Otherwise he cannot coerce his partner to divide with a wall (even if it is a חצר שיש בה דין חלוקה).<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דחולקין משמע באמצע<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The s'גמרא assumption is that חולקין means with a wall. תוספות is now telling us that חולקין implies that the division [with a wall] must be in the middle. The wall thus has to be in the middle. Each partner must contribute (at least his space) to the wall. Therefore we can conclude that שמיה היזק היזק ראיה.</i> –</b><br><b>And one can say; that</b> the word חולקין <b>to divide, implies</b> that the division is exactly <b>in the middle.</b><br>תוספות explains now why the word חולקין implies in the middle and not as תוספות proposed previously.<br><b>דאי אשמועינן כדפירישית הוה ליה למיתני אין עושין כותל בחצר עד שיהא כולי:<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">According to תוספות proposed explanation, this is the thrust of the משנה, whether a partner can coerce his neighbor to allow him to build a wall on his own. Why mention חולקין which implies an equal division?! That proves that the משנה is discussing an equal division of property with a joint wall built on both their properties.</i></b><br><b>For if</b> the משנה <b>is</b> coming <b>to teach us as I</b> previously <b>explained</b>; namely that we are discussing whether one of the partners has the right to erect a wall (on his property), then <b>the</b> משנה <b>should have stated, ‘A wall cannot be erected in a</b> חצר <b>unless there is etc.,</b> ד' אמות for each partner’.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>If it is assumed that חולקין means dividing a property by erecting a wall; then the משנה of 'אין חולקין וכו is teaching us that we divide a property שיש בה דין חלוקה by having each of the partners contribute (space) to the wall jointly. This proves that ה"ר ש"ה. Otherwise, if the משנה would only be discussing the right of the initiator to compel his partner to allow him to build a wall on his own property, then the משנה should have stated 'אין עושין כותל בחצר עד שיהא וכו but not אין חולקין וכו'.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to the אמינא הוה of תוספות, what would be the rules concerning dividing a חצר without a wall; both by a חצר שאין בו דין חלוקה and by a חצר שיש בה דין חלוקה?<br>Could we learn פשט in the משנה of אין חולקין the way תוספות originally proposed, regardless whether we maintain ה"ר ש"ה or not?<br><br>

<b>שאני התם דאמר ליה בעל החצר לבעל הגג כולי—It is different there; for the owner of the</b> חצר <b>says to the owner of the roof, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא attempted (seven times) and failed to prove that היזק ראיה שמיה היזק. If ה"ר לא ש"ה, there should be no requirement at all.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly we can refute תוספות proposed proof from the ברייתא. Perhaps the ברייתא is discussing a case where both partners contractually agreed in principle to build a joint wall. They did not however specify the details.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ and בל"י אות מ.</i>

<b>מאי קא משמע לן בשאין בה דין חלוקה—What is</b> the <b>משנה teaching us; when it cannot be divided legally</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited the לישנא אחרינא which maintains ה"ר ש"ה. Either partner can coerce the other to build a wall jointly. The reason the משנה says רצו which indicates it has to be done willingly; no coercion is permitted, is because the משנה is discussing a חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה. In such a חצר, no one can coerce the other to divide, unless they both agree. That is the meaning of שרצו השותפין; they agreed to divide the חצר שאין בד"ח. Once however they agreed to divide this חצר then either partner can coerce the other to jointly build a wall. The גמרא then questions this interpretation. The question reads (literally, somewhat) as follows: ‘what are you teaching us; that by a חצר שאין בה ד"ח they may willingly divide; we have already learnt this elsewhere’!<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The idea that שותפים may agree to divide a חצר שאין בד"ח, should be understood to mean, that once they contractually agree to divide, neither can retract his agreement.</i> A cursory reading of this question would indicate that the questioner assumed that our משנה is (only) teaching us the rules of dividing a חצר שאין בה ד"ח. Therefore he asks we already know these rules from elsewhere! תוספות will challenge this assumption, that all the משנה is teaching us are the rules of division. The משנה is teaching us (in addition) that הרש"ה! What therefore is the s'גמרא question מאי קמ"ל?!<br>----------------------<br>תוספות anticipates the following question:<br><b>אף על גב דקא משמע לן דשמיה היזק<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Why does the גמרא assume that the משנה is only teaching us that partners may divide a חצר שאין בד"ח; and therefore asks that this rule has already been taught elsewhere, where in fact the משנה is teaching us a new דין that הרש"ה. This דין was not taught in any other משנה.</i> –</b><br><b>Even though</b> the משנה <b>teaches us</b> that היזק ראיה <b>is considered damage.</b> How can the גמרא ask מאי קמ"ל when the משנה is teaching us הרש"ה!?<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>הכי פירושו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא knew that the משנה is not just teaching us the דין that by a חצר שאין בד"ח the partners may willingly divide. It is understood that the משנה is teaching us the דין of הרש"ה. Rather the s'גמרא question is as follows:</i> מאי קא משמע לן במאי דאיירי באין בה דין חלוקה –</b><br><b>This is the explanation</b> of the s'גמרא question. <b>What is</b> the משנה <b>teaching us</b> more <b>by discussing</b> a case of a חצר <b>which is</b> אין בד"ח<b>,</b> and telling us that in this situation הרש"ה –<br><b>לישמעינן בשיש בה דין חלוקה [אף על גב דלא רצו]<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The translation follows the text in the [brackets]; not in the (parenthesis).</i> (כשרצו) פלגי –</b><br><b>Let</b> the משנה <b>teach us</b> this same דין of הרש"ה in a חצר <b>that has</b> כדי חלוקה,<b><sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה should not have said שרצו indicating that willingness is required to divide the חצר, which limits the דין of the משנה to a חצר שאין בד"ח. This rule that a חצר שאין בה דין חלוקה may be divided willingly, we know from the משנה of 'וכו בזמן אימתי.</i></b> and the משנה teaches us that <b>even though</b> one of the partners <b>did not want</b> to divide, nevertheless <b>we divide</b> and force him to jointly build a common wall.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This may be a greater חידוש than by אין בד"ח. For by אבד"ח since he agreed to divide and we assume that הרש"ה, it would seem that he agreed even to build a wall. However, by יבד"ח where he never agreed to divide; the whole division is against his will, perhaps in such a case I may think that he is not obligated to build a wall.</i><br>תוספות explained that the question of מאי קמ"ל, is not merely that our משנה is superfluous since we know this דין from 'אימתי בזמן', but rather the question is why teach the דין of הרש"ה by אין בד"ח, instead of by יש בד"ח. When we see the s'גמרא answer to this question 'אי מהתם הו"א וכו, it seems however that the גמרא is responding only to the question that our משנה is superfluous, but not to the question that תוספות proposes, i.e. why teach הרש"ה by אבד"ח instead of יבד"ח. תוספות responds to this issue.<br><b>[ותירץ](תימה)<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The translation will be following the גירסא of the מהר"ם, namely ותירץ; not the printed גירסא in our תוספות (and גירסת מהרש"א) which reads 'ותימה'. See ‘Appendix’.</i> הא קא משמע לן דאפילו באין בה דין חלוקה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">By a חצר שיש בה בד"ח, the reluctant partner has no choice; he must divide since it is יש בד"ח and he must build a wall since הרש"ה.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>answered, this is what</b> the משנה <b>is teaching us</b>, by telling us the דין of הרש"ה by a חצר שאין בה בד"ח <b>that even</b> if the חצר is אבד"ח –<br><b>דאיכא למימר על מנת לעשות גודא לא איתרצאי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">By a חצר שאין בד"ח it is required that they both agree to divide.</i> כדפירש<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps this should be emended to read 'כדפירשתי' or 'כדפירש ר"י'.</i> לעיל:<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">דף ב,ב ד"ה וכיון עיי"ש.</i></b><br><b>Where it is possible</b> for the reluctant partner <b>to argue that I did not agree to divide if</b> it <b>results in</b> my obligation <b>to build a wall,<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">When the גמרא answers the question and states 'אי מהתם ה"א וכו' במסיפס בעלמא' it means as follows: If our משנה would state the דין of הרש"ה by a חצר שיש בד"ח, we may (mistakenly) think that even though we maintain הרש"ה, but by a חצר שאין בד"ח, we may falsely assume that the reluctant partner can say I agreed to divide this חצר with a מסיפס, but not with a כותל of גויל וגזית.</i> as was explained previously</b> in תוספות.We may have thought that the reluctant partner has a strong argument and is exempt from building the wall. Therefore our משנה teaches us that (even by 'רצו') by a חצר שאין בד"ח, once he agrees to divide the חצר, he is obligated to jointly build a wall.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Without תוספות we assume the following. The גמרא understands that the משנה by stating 'שרצו' is teaching us that by a חצר שאין בד"ח they may willingly divide. The גמרא asks that this דין was already taught elsewhere. The גמרא answers that from our משנה we know, that not only do they divide, but they must also build a כותל.<br>תוספות asks how can the גמרא assume that the משנה is only teaching us that they may divide a חצר שאין בד"ח, when it is obvious that the משנה is teaching us the דין of הרש"ה. Something the other משנה does not teach us.<br>תוספות explains that the גמרא originally knew that the משנה is teaching us הרש"ה. Nevertheless the question is why teach הרש"ה by a חצר שאין בד"ח as opposed to a חצר שיש בד"ח. The גמרא answers that even if we knew that הרש"ה by a חצר שיש בד"ח, we may still think that by a חצר שאין בד"ח one cannot coerce the reluctant partner to build a wall. The reluctant partner may argue that I only agreed to divide if I do not have to build a wall. Our משנה teaches us that this is not a valid argument and even by a חצר שאין בד"ח he is required to build a wall jointly.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to the מסקנא, is the משנה also teaching us the rule that by חצר שאין בד"ח, they may divide (and then not be permitted to retract)?<br>Appendix<br>The translation has followed the view of the מהר"ם who is 'גורס 'ותירץ; that תוספות is explaining the answer of the גמרא.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">There are difficulties with the s'מהר"ם view. Firstly is the change in the text from what actually appears in the תוספות. Secondly according to the מהר"ם the answer of the גמרא which states 'אי מהתם הו"א במסיפס בעלמא וכו is not the complete answer. The complete answer would require that which תוספות states: ע"מ לעשות גודא לא אתרצאי, which does not appear in the גמרא. A third difficulty is that in a previous (תוספות ב,ב ד"ה וכיון)  it seems that תוספות there asks and answers the same question and answer that our תוספות maintains is the s'גמרא question and answer here. תוספות there however, stated that according to some texts this question and answer that תוספות is proposing actually is found in the גמרא. It is assumed that תוספות is referring to the גמרא in parenthesis beginning with (''ל"א וכי רצו וכו'). However, according to the מהר"ם, our גמרא itself, before the parenthesis, is asking and answering the same question and answer of that תוספות. Why does תוספות say that (only) in some texts does this question and answer appear, when in fact it appears in all texts according to the מהר"ם. The following interpretation according to the גירסא of the מהרש"א (seemingly), removes all these difficulties.</i> Out text however reads (and the מהרש"א enforces it) 'ותימה'; that תוספות is challenging the s'גמרא question of מאי קמ"ל.<br>According to this גירסא the explanation of תוספות may be as follows.<br>תוספות explains the question of the גמרא: Why does the משנה teach us the rule of הרש"ה by a חצר שאין בד"ח, the משנה should have taught it to us by a חצר שיש בד"ח. In a חצר שיש בד"ח there is a greater חידוש;<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> that even though the reluctant partner did not even agree to divide (as opposed to a חצר שאין בד"ח), nevertheless, he can be coerced (not only to divide, but also) to jointly build a wall. The fact, that the משנה ignores this reasoning and teaches us this דין by a חצר שאין בד"ח indicates that the משנה wants to teach us [also] the laws of dividing a חצר שאין בד"ח; that once they agreed (contractually) to divide they cannot retract this agreement.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> The גמרא therefore asks, that the laws of agreeing to divide a חצר שאין בד"ח are already clearly stated; why repeat them. To which the גמרא answers, that it is true that the laws of division were already stated; however from that other משנה we may have thought that the rule that once they agreed to divide they cannot rescind, is only when they agree to a מסיפס. However if one partner insists on a כותל, then the other partner has the right to retract his agreement. The חצר would then revert to its original status of a חצר שאין בד"ח.<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא did not think, even in the הו"א, that he could retain the division and refuse to build a wall. According to the גמרא the assumption of the מקשן; namely that there is a greater חידוש to build a wall by a חצר שיש בד"ח, remains. Therefore if he would want to retain the חלוקה by a חצר שאין בד"ח he would have to build a wall, with a כ"ש from a חצר שיש בד"ח. The גמרא (in the הו"א) is discussing only the issue of 'רצו'; that it is possible to break the agreement by a חצר שאין בד"ח, if the partner insists on having a wall. Our משנה, when it states ''שרצו' is teaching us a דין in חלוקה, not (only) a דין in היזק ראיה.</i> Our משנה therefore teaches us that they cannot retract this agreement even if one partner insists on a כותל.<br>תוספות however, challenges the assumption of the גמרא. Why did the גמרא assume that out משנה wants to teach us the laws of division; when in reality our משנה wants to teach us the דין of הרש"ה? The reason the משנה teaches this to us by a חצר שאין בד"ח is because (contrary to the questioner’s assumption) the greater חידוש of הרש"ה is not by a חצר שיש בד"ח (as the מקשן assumed), but rather by a חצר שאין בד"ח. We may have thought that by a חצר שאין בד"ח the reluctant partner can argue I never agreed to divide with a wall. Therefore the חלוקה will remain without a wall; היזק ראיה cannot force one to build a wall by a חצר שאין בד"ח.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 16 above. This can perhaps explain the difference between תוספות asking 'ותימה' and the s'גמרא answer of 'אי מהתם וכו that they are not identical. The גמרא is discussing the ביטול חלוקה while תוספות is discussing היזק ראיה. וצ"ע ודו"ק.</i> That is why the משנה teaches us the דין of הרש"ה by a חצר שאין בד"ח, but not because the משנה wants to teach us any דין concerning dividing property. What therefore is the s'גמרא question!? תוספות does not offer an answer.

<b>כי רצו מאי הוי ניהדרו בהו—What of it, that they wanted; they can withdraw from</b> this<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asks specifically<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote"> תוספות is referencing the גמרא after the parenthesis, where the גמרא states אי 'בשאין בה דין חלוקה וכו. See (however) הגהות הב"ח (ד)</i> on the מ"ד מחיצה פלוגתא, why can we force them to divide and build a wall, based merely on their agreement to divide. What can stop either of the partners to rescind his previous commitment to divide? It is known that for any commitment to be binding there needs to be a קנין;<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The general term קנין usually refers to קנין חליפין (see רש"י here ד"ה קנין), where the granting party accepts a cloth (or something similar) [from the receiving party (or the witnesses)] and ‘in return’ commits himself to whatever he is granting.</i> an act that effectively binds the parties legally to whatever they are committing themselves to do. There is no mention of a קנין in our משנה. Our תוספות will discuss why is this question limited to the מ"ד פלוגתא, and not on the מ"ד גודא as well.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>למאן דאמר מחיצה גודא לא פריך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Why does the גמרא ask the question ''כי רצו וכו'' only on the מ"ד that מחיצה means a division and not on the מ"ד who maintains that מחיצה is גודא. Seemingly the same question applies to the מ"ד that מחיצה גודא. They agreed to build a wall; however what stops either of them from reneging on this agreement. There is no mention of a קנין. Why are they obligated to build a wall just because they merely agreed to build it?</i> דאיכא למימר דקנו ושיעבדו נכסיהן לבנין הכותל –</b><br>The גמרא <b>does not ask</b> this question (רצו וכו' כי) <b>on the one who interprets מחיצה</b> <b>to mean a wall for we can say that</b> the משנה is discussing a case where the partners <b>made a קנין (</b>a binding commitment to build the wall), <b>and they pledged their assets to the building of the wall.</b> The קנין was not merely that they are going to build a wall, but rather each partner made a קנין that he is committing and obligating his assets for the purpose of building this wall. The קנין creates a lien on his assets. This is a tangible קנין.<br><b>אלא למאן דאמר פלוגתא לא מהני קנין דקנין דברים בעלמא הוא –</b><br><b>However according to the מ"ד</b> that they are merely agreeing <b>to divide</b> the חצר, <b>a</b> קנין for obligating oneself to divide a חצר <b>is not a valid קנין,</b> <b>for it is merely a קנין</b> on <b>words.</b> They agree to divide and make a קנין to obligate them to their agreement. However the קנין is not transferring anything tangible to anyone. There are no assets that are being transferred. There is no lien being placed on any assets. They will both own the same percentage of the property after they divided, as they owned before they divided. A קנין is effective for assets and liens; it is not effective on personal promises, where no transfer of assets is taking place.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">When the גמרא asked 'כי רצו וכ, the גמרא knew that they made a קנין (otherwise, ask the question on the מ"ד מחיצה גודא as well); however the גמרא maintained that a קנין to divide is a קנין דברים. When ר"א אמר ר"י answered that שקנו מידם it was their intent to say that it was קנו ברוחות. However the מקשן did not understand it as such. The מקשן thought that it means merely a קנין to divide. He therefore persisted to ask that it is merely a קנין דברים. The תרצן explained that ר"י אמר א"ר meant a קנין ברוחות.</i><br><b>דלא מסיק אדעתיה שקנו ברוחות:</b><br><b>For the</b> גמרא <b>did not</b> originally <b>entertain the thought that they made a קנין</b> <b>concerning the location.</b> That type of a קנין is not a קנין דברים. Originally the entire property was owned jointly by both partners. They agreed to partition it (let us assume) in a north-south division. Each partner is transferring to the other all of his rights to the other half of the property which he is presently relinquishing. This is a קנין on something tangible; notably his rights in the other half of the property. However the מקשן did not think that the משנה is discussing this type of a קנין.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The reason the גמרא understood that if מחיצה גודא, the קנין was on נכסים שעבוד; however if מחיצה פלוגתא, the גמרא did not entertain the thought of קנין ברוחות, may be as follows: The term רצו should be taken in context for each case. In the case of גודא, the רצו was to build a wall. A willingness to build a wall indicates a commitment of money. Otherwise there is no willingness at all. This commitment cannot be effective without a קנין pledging his assets for the building of the wall. In the case of פלוגתא, the רצו is to divide. The commitment seems to be only in their willingness; there is no expenditure required. The קנין is in accordance with their willingness. Therefore the קנין is merely to divide. That is a קנין דברים. In addition just as by גודא, their commitment to build a wall is a general one, not specifying the type of wall; similarly one would assume that according to פלוגתא their agreement is general; not specifying the details of the division. A קנין on such an agreement is a קנין דברים.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to the מ"ד גודא, there was never a question that they could renege on their commitment, for it is assumed that they made a קנין and pledged their assets for the wall. However, according to the מ"ד פלוגתא, making a קנין for division is invalid since it is merely a קנין דברים. The מקשן did not entertain the possibility that they made a קנין ברוחות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the דין if the partners said while making the קנין that they are committing themselves to build a wall, but they did not pledge their assets; is that considered קנין דברים or not?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מז אות י"בל.</i>

Line 14

<b>קנין דברים בעלמא הוא—It is merely an acquisition of words</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוספות ד"ה כי.</i><br>The גמרא maintains that making a קנין to do something (in our case – to divide property), is not a valid קנין. Such a קנין is referred to as a קנין דברים. It does not obligate the parties to keep their agreement. A קנין is valid only where it entails a specific commitment of transferring or relinquishing assets (or rights).<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>בפרק השוכר את הפועלים (בבא מציעא דף צד,א) דתנן מתנה שומר חנם להיות כשואל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A שומר חנם is not obligated to pay for unforeseen accidents to the item he is watching. A שואל however is liable for any damage that occurs to the item he borrowed. Someone can deposit an item by a ש"ח, on the condition that the ש"ח agree to take the responsibilities of a שואל on this item.</i> –</b><br><b>In פרק השוכר את הפועלים (where) the משנה states, ‘an unpaid watchman can conditionally</b> obligate himself <b>to be like a borrower’.</b> The גמרא there asks; how can the mere verbal agreement of the ש"ח obligate him to pay as a שואל?<b></b> The<b></b> גמרא there answers that the משנה –<br><b>ומוקי לה בקנו מידו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A קנין חליפין is performed by exchanging a cloth from the hand of one to the hand of the other; therefore the expression קנו מידו.</i> –</b><br><b>is discussing</b> a situation <b>where they acquired it from his hand</b>; i.e. the ש"ח obligated himself through a קנין חליפין. Seemingly the ש"ח is making a קנין that he is to be considered a שואל. That however, is a קנין on mere words. Nothing tangible is seemingly being exchanged or granted. It should be considered a קנין דברים.<br>תוספות answers; the case of 'וכו ש"ח מתנה –<br><b>התם לאו קנין דברים הוא אלא קנין גמור הוא שמשעבד את עצמו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The קנין is not merely that he is a שואל; rather the קנין is that the ש"ח is obligating himself to pay for the deposited item should anything happen. That is a שעבוד of assets, not a קנין דברים.</i> שאם יאנס שישלם:</b><br><b>There it is not</b> considered <b>a קנין דברים; rather it is a valid קנין, for he pledges himself</b> <b>that if there will be an unforeseen accident, then he will pay.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A ש"ח is liable for אונסים like a שואל if he pledges, with a קנין, that he is responsible and will pay for any אונס.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>In תוספות question, would it seem that the קנין by the ש"ח is the same קנין דברים, as in the הו"א of our גמרא, or is it different (either better or worse)?<br>How did תוספות understand the term קנו מידו (in ב"מ) in the question, as opposed to how he understands it in the answer?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות מט.</i>
<b>רב אשי אמר כגון שהלך כולי רב אשי—said; for instance, one went, etc. </b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא is discussing the issue why the partners cannot renege on their agreement to divide the חצר. The גמרא answered that they made a קנין ברוחות, which binds them to their agreement. רב אשי offers an alternate explanation. They each actually made a קנין in their respective halves. It would seem more than obvious that once they were קונה their respective shares, they cannot renege. תוספות maintains that this answer is too obvious. It is stating that once they divided they cannot renege; but of course they cannot! תוספות resolves this issue.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו יצחק מה בא רב אשי להוסיף –</b><br><b>The</b> ר"י <b>is astounded!</b> <b>What is</b> רב אשי <b>coming to add</b> with his answer, that each of the partners made a חזקה in his respective share?!<br><b>וכי איצטריך לאשמועינן דחזקה מועלת כמו קנין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The term קנין is referring to (סודר) קנין חליפין.</i> –</b><br><b>Is it then necessary to inform us that a חזקה is as valid as a קנין?!</b> It is obvious that if each partner made a קנין חזקה in his part of the חצר, that they acquired it and they cannot go back on their agreement to divide.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דהא קא משמע לן דאף על גב דקאמר לקמן בחזקת הבתים (דף נג,א) –</b><br><b>The</b> ר"י <b>assumes that this is what</b> ר"א <b>is teaching us; that even though</b> the גמרא <b>says later in הבתים</b> <b>חזקת</b> פרק<b>,</b> if someone wants to acquire a field through קנין חזקה, then if the חזקה is being performed –<br><b>שלא בפניו צריך למימר לו לך חזק וקני –</b><br><b>not in the presence</b> of the previous owner, then <b>it is required</b> that the previous owner <b>say to him</b> before he makes the חזקה, <b>‘Go make a חזקה</b> <b>and acquire</b> the property for yourself’. Otherwise, if he did not tell him this, and he made the חזקה not in the presence of the previous owner, the חזקה is invalid. The field still belongs to the previous owner.<br>The question arises, what would be in our case of החצר חלוקת. Are they required to say to each other לך חזק וקני (or make the חזקה in the presence of each other), or not. תוספות continues:<br><b>הכא כיון שאמרו אתה תקח רוח צפונית ואני רוח דרומית –</b><br><b>Here</b> in the case of החצר חלוקת <b>since they said</b> to each other, <b>you take the northern</b> half <b>and I</b> will take <b>the southern</b> half –<br><b>והלך והחזיק לו כל אחד בשלו זה שלא בפני זה –</b><br><b>And they</b> subsequently <b>went and each made a חזקה</b> <b>in his</b> portion <b>not in the presence of the other</b>, nonetheless –<br><b>נעשה כמי שקנו מידם ברוחות אף על פי שלא אמרו זה לזה לך חזק וקני:</b><br><b>It becomes as if they made a קנין ברוחות,</b> in which case it is a valid קנין. Similarly here too it is a valid חזקה <b>even though they did not say to each other 'לך חזק וקני'.</b> The חזקה that each one made שלו בתוך is not the usual קנין חזקה. A usual קנין חזקה would not be valid since it took place שלא בפניו and neither said to the other לך חזק וקני. Rather the effect of the חזקה is in lieu of the קנו מידו. Just as by קנו מידו each partner is making a קנין whereby he is relinquishing his rights in the other half of the property and granting it to his partner; similarly in the case of והחזיק 'וכו שהלך, this החזיק is a קנין that each partner only claims this half for themselves. The partners are relinquishing their rights to the other half and granting it to their respective partners.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This type of קנין does not require saying לך חזק וקני. That requirement is limited to cases where there is a new owner, who previously did not have any interest at all in this property. We are not certain that the previous owner is willing to give up his ownership unless he states clearly, לך חזק וקני. In our case however, they are both partners; they each own (half of) the field. The קנין here is merely to effect their agreement of division. To accomplish this clarification as to their mutual relinquishing of interest in the property, לך חזק וקני is not required.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רב אשי is teaching us that the קנין to divide can be either by specifically making a קנין to that effect, קנו מידו ברוחות; or by each of the partners making a חזקה in his share after they verbally agreed to divide the property (north and south). In the latter case too, they cannot renege on their agreement even though it was done זה שלא בפני זה and neither said to the other לך חזק וקני.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Where is there a greater חידוש that they cannot renege on their agreement; in the case of קנו מידו ברוחות or in the case of 'הלך זה והחזיק וכו'?<br>2. What would be the דין in the case of רב אשי if there was only a general agreement to divide without specifying north and south, etc.; could they renege on this agreement after they each made a חזקה?<br>3. What is the purpose of the חזקה in the הו"א of תוספות as opposed to the מסקנא?

<b>ארבע אמות גובה אפותיא דה' קאי טפי לא קאי—</b>A wall <b>wide five</b> טפחים can <b>support a height of four אמות but not more</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא infers from our משנה that a stone wall of גזית four אמות high requires a width of ה' טפחים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">An אמה is usually considered approximately 18 inches; a טפח 3 inches.</i> in order to be structurally sound. In fact a width of ה' טפחים will only support a wall of ד' אמות; but not higher than ד' אמות. תוספות will argue that both our משנה and life experience contradict this assumption.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשיא לרבינו תם הא לבינין דגריעי קאי בשלשה טפחים –</b><br><b>The</b> ר"ת <b>has a difficulty</b> with this statement; <b>for bricks which are inferior</b> to גזית, and nevertheless <b>they stand on</b> a width of even <b>three</b> טפחים for a height of four אמות.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה clearly states that for לבינין a total of only ג' טפחים is required for a כותל ד' אמות.</i> Why therefore does the גמרא assume that גזית which is stronger<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">One would naturally assume that the stronger the building material the less width is required to attain the same height. In our משנה we see the opposite. לבינין which are inferior to גזית require a narrower width than גזית, which is a stronger material.</i> than לבינין require a full ה' טפחים width in order to be able to remain standing upright?<br>תוספות has an additional question:<br><b>ועוד הא קא חזינן דקאי בגזית טפי אפורתא –</b><br><b>And furthermore we do</b> actually <b>see that</b> even <b>a גזית</b> wall <b>can stand more</b> than ד' אמות high even <b>on a</b> width<b></b> that is <b>less</b> than five טפחים wide.<b></b> Why does the גמרא say that גזית requires ה' טפחים (and even then only for ד' אמות high).<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ותירץ דהכי קאמר טפי לא קאי כמשפט גזית –</b><br><b>And</b> the ר"ת <b>answered that this is what</b> the גמרא <b>is saying; more than</b> ד' אמות high <b>it will not</b> remain <b>standing</b> for a sufficient time <b>as is appropriate for גזית –<br>שרוצים בני אדם לבנותו שיעמוד ימים רבים כשבונים בגזית:</b><br><b>For people want to build</b> גזית, provided <b>that it should last for many years when they build with גזית.</b> It is true that גזית walls can be supported for more than ד' אמות high even on widths of less than ה' טפחים. However the longevity of these walls will be shortened. People building with expensive גזית material want their walls to last much longer. Therefore the increase in width is required to assure maximum longevity. לבינין walls that are not that expensive; a width of three טפחים is sufficient to assure the limited longevity, commensurate with its cost.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>To assure the maximum longevity for the expensive גזית wall a minimum of ה' טפחים width is required to attain a height of ד' אמות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the difference between the אמינא הוה and מסקנא of תוספות as to the reason for the various thicknesses of the walls?
<b>טרקסין—Dividing stone wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>תוספות will discuss the etymology of the word טרקסין.<br>----------------------<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דטרק הוי כמו טרוקי גלי ברכות (דף כח,א) וסין הוי סיני –</b><br><b>The</b> ר"ת <b>says that</b> '<b>טרק</b>' of טרקסין <b>is similar to</b> the word(s) <b>[גלי]</b> <b>טרוקי,</b> meaning <b>close [the doors]</b> that is mentioned in מסכת <b>ברכות</b> <b>.</b> <b>And</b> '<b>סין</b>' in the word טרקסין <b>refers to </b> הר <b>סיני–<br>כלומר שהיה מפסיק וסוגר את הלוחות שנתנו בסיני שהיו מונחות בארון –</b><br><b>This means to say</b> that the טרקסין was so named because <b>it separated and closed off the לוחות, which were given at </b>הר <b>סיני, <b>which were placed in the ארון –<br>שהיה בבית קדשי הקדשים –</b><br><b>which was in the קדשי הקדשים, the holy of holies.</b></b> The טרקסין wall separated the קדשי הקדשים, in which there were the לוחות שניתנו בסיני; from the rest of the בית המקדש.<br>תוספות offers another interpretation of the word טרקסין.<br><b>ויש מפרשים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י יומא נב,א ד"ה טרקסין which states; לשון פנים וחוץ הוא כך ראיתי בתלמוד ירושלמי וראיה לדבר חסידים הראשונים היו מכניסין פירותיהן דרך טרקסמון כדי לחייבם במעשר (ברכות דף לה,ב) למדנו שהטרק לשון כניסת פנים הוא: <br>See also רש"י גיטין פא,א ד"ה דרך טרקסמון where he writes:  דרך הכבושה מחוץ ליכנס לפנים ודומה לי שהוא לשון יוני כמו טרקסין (יומא דף נא).</i> טרקסין פנים וחוץ שאותה אמה היתה ספק אם מקודשת פנים או חוץ –</b><br><b>And others explain</b> that <b>טרקסין</b> means <b>inside and outside.</b> The reason this טרקסין wall was so called is because <b>for that</b> אמה which the טרקסין occupied, <b>there was a doubt if it was sanctified</b> like the <b>inner</b> part; the קדה"ק, <b>or</b> like the <b>outer</b> part; the היכל. תוספות bolsters this point –<br><b>ולכך היו שם שתי פרוכת כדאמרינן ביומא (דף נא,ב):</b><br><b>And therefore</b> in the second ביהמ"ק where there was no אמה טרקסין, <b>there was there</b> in the place of the אמה טרקסין <b>two curtains</b> [פרוכת] with an אמה of air space between them<b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The areas of the קודש and קדה"ק had to be distinctly separated.</i></b>, <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> מסכת <b>יומא.</b> One פרוכת for the outer (eastern) side of the טרקסין; in case the טרסקין itself was קדה"ק.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The outside curtain served then as a boundary for the קודש. The קדה"ק then began in the air space.</i> The other פרוכת was for the inner (western) side of the טרקסין, in case the טרקסין space was only קודש; not קדה"ק.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The inside curtain served then as a boundary for the קדה"ק. The קודש then began in the air space.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The dividing wall between the היכל and the קדה"ק was called טרקסין for the following reasons; a) the word טרקסין means closing off (the לוחות which were given at) סיני; or b) the word טרקסין means inside and outside, indicating that there was a doubt as to the precise sanctification of the טרקסין space itself, whether it was קודש or קדה"ק.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. What may be the advantages of each interpretation?<br>2. Was there a doubt in the times of the first ביהמ"ק as to the status of the אמה טרקסין?
<b>שאני התם דאיכא טפח יתירא—It is different there; for there is an additional טפח</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא inferred from our משנה that a wall requires a width of five טפחים to support a height of four אמות. However a width of six טפחים can support even a height of thirty אמות, as witnessed by the תוספות. אמה טרקלין suggests that there may a different explanation<b><sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות perhaps finds it difficult that the addition of only one more אמה width (a 20% increase), can support an additional twenty six אמות of height (a 650% increase)!</i></b> how a wall of thirty אמות high was supported by a width of (only) six טפחים.<br>---------------------------<br><b>הוה מצי לשנוי דאגב תקרה ומעזיבה קאי טפי כדאמרינן בסמוך:<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See 'עמוד ב. See 'תוס there, ד"ה אמר, which seems to contradict our תוספות.</i></b><br>The גמרא <b>could have answered</b> this apparent anomaly; <b>for on account of the</b> weight of the <b>ceiling and the plaster,</b> which rested and weighed down on the wall, therefore <b>it supports</b> much <b>more</b> than four אמות high for each five טפחים wide, <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>shortly states.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A wall can support a greater proportional height (than four אמות for each five טפחים width) provided it is not a free standing wall; but is braced by the weight of a roof/ceiling bearing down on it.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can a wall of five טפחים wide, with a תקרה ומעזיבה on it, support a height of thirty אמות?

<b>אמר אביי גמירי</b><b>— אביי said; there is a tradition </b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא is discussing the feasibility of building an אמה טרקסין in the בית שני, which was higher than thirty אמות. Originally it was suggested to build the wall up to thirty אמות (as it was in the בית ראשון), and for the rest of the height a curtain would be used. The גמרא said this is not feasible; an אמה width cannot support such a height. In the בית ראשון it was able to be thirty אמות high only because it was braced by the ceiling and plaster. To which the גמרא responded; let us make it whatever height an אמה width will support, and the rest will be made of curtains. אביי stated that there is a מסורה that the separation be made either completely with a wall (as it was in בית ראשון) or completely with a curtain (as it was in the משכן).<br>------------------------------<br><b>השתא לא צריך לשנויא קמא:<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This would seem to contradict the previous שאני ה"ד (א,ג) תוספות which stated that when there is additional support from the roof/ceiling then an אמה width can hold more than the height allowed for in our משנה (i.e. four אמות high for (every) five טפחים width). In fact it can hold up to thirty אמות high (with a width of one אמה). Now תוספות seems to be saying that this statement (concerning תקרה ומעזיבה) is irrelevant. See ל"מהרש here who questions תוספות assumption that the גמרא is retracting its original statement, since the גמרא did not say 'אלא'. This may indeed be the answer to our question. תוספות is not saying that the גמרא retracts the previous assumption of ''אגב תקרה וכו'; this assumption remains. תוספות is merely stating that this assumption is not necessary to answer the question why did they not build (at least) a partial wall in the בית שני., Once אביי stated that it is a tradition etc., the assumption of אגב תקרה is irrelevant to our discussion, but it remains valid. Therefore תוספות previously stated that the גמרא could have answered 'אגב תקרה וכו.</i></b><br><b>The first answer is not required anymore.</b> We need not say as we previously stated that a wall of thirty אמות high can be supported by a width of an אמה, only if in addition there is a bracing support from the weight of the roof/ceiling. That assumption is now irrelevant. In any case we could not build a partition consisting of both a wall and a curtain.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מסורה that אביי stated; either completely wall or completely curtain, is all that is necessary to explain why there was no wall/curtain combination in the בית שני<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>For what purpose is תוספות telling us that אגב תקרה ומעזיבה is now irrelevant?

<b>מכלל דאיכא זוטרתי—This implies that there are smaller</b> bricks<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא sought to resolve the query whether the three טפחים required for לבינים, included the plaster or not. A משנה in מסכת עירובין was cited, which stated that the width of the plank placed above the מבוי needs to be wide enough to support an אריח, which is half of a לבינה of three טפחים. This seems to prove that a לבינה itself without סיד is indeed three טפחים. The גמרא refuted this proof by maintaining that the לבינה mentioned in the משנה in עירובין may be a larger לבינה than the לבינה discussed in our משנה. The גמרא continued to bolster this assertion by referring to the text of the משנה wherein it said ‘a לבינה of three טפחים’. If all לבינים are three טפחים and no more, why does the משנה need to specify the size of the לבינה!? This is ample proof that the לבינה in מסכת עירובין is a larger לבינה; and there are smaller לבינים, which our משנה may be discussing. Thus the query remains. תוספות will challenge this assertion that since it mentions a size that proves that there are smaller ones.<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ודילמא מכלל דאיכא רברבתא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If this would be the inference, then the איבעיא would be resolved; for a לבינה is (at least) three טפחים. There are others that are even larger.</i> ומה דיקא הוא זה –</b><br><b>And if you will say; perhaps</b> from the s'משנה statement ‘a half brick of three טפחים’ <b>it can be inferred that there are</b> bricks <b>larger</b> than three טפחים; <b>what sort of deduction is this?!</b> How are we inferring from the statement ‘a half brick of three טפחים’, that there are bricks that are less than three טפחים?<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This assumption will prove, therefore that the query cannot be resolved.</i> Perhaps the inference is that there are also bricks more than three טפחים; and that is the reason why the משנה in עירובין specifies a לבינה of (only) three טפחים?<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If we follow this last assumption, the משנה in עירובין can (possibly) resolve the query.</i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ותירץ רבינו יצחק דאם אין פחות משלשה אבל גדולות יש –</b><br><b>And the</b> ר"י <b>answers; for if there are no</b> bricks <b>less than three</b> טפחים <b>however there are</b> bricks <b>larger</b> than three טפחים –<br><b>אם כן בכדי נקט חצי לבינה של ג' טפחים –</b><br><b>Then it is purposeless</b> for the משנה to <b>mention a half brick of three</b> טפחים –<br><b>דלא הוה צריך למתני אלא והאריח חצי לבינה ותו לא –</b><br><b>For the</b> משנה <b>should have only stated</b> that <b>‘and the אריח</b> <b>is a half brick’; and no more.</b> It should not have mentioned the size of a לבינה. If there are only לבינים larger than three טפחים and none smaller, then –<br><b>וממילא הייתי משער בקטנה הואיל ולא מפרש שיעורא:</b><br><b>I would have automatically measured</b> the size of the plank <b>with the smaller</b> לבינה; the one of three טפחים. I would not have thought of measuring with the larger לבינה (than three טפחים), <b>since</b> the משנה <b>did not specify the measurement.</b> If the requirement for a plank is the larger לבינה, the משנה should have been specific, to assure that we do it properly.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">One cannot argue that the משנה assumes that we will go לחומרא and use the larger size brick; for the requirement to place a plank on a מבוי is only a דרבנן. By a רבנן we generally are more lenient.</i> The fact that the משנה did state the size of a לבינה proves that there is indeed a smaller size לבינה, less than three טפחים. If the משנה would not have specified the size of the measuring לבינה, one would have assumed to use the smaller size. Therefore the משנה teaches us to use the larger לבינה (of three טפחים) for measurement and not the smaller לבינה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא inferred from the משנה in עירובין that there are also bricks smaller than three טפחים, from the fact that the משנה there specified the size of the brick as three טפחים. If there were no bricks less than three טפחים, and there were bricks larger than three טפחים, there would be no need for the משנה to specify the size of the bricks. It would be obvious that if the משנה does not specify the size, we use the smallest size, that of three טפחים. We may therefore infer that the משנה is teaching us that despite the fact that there are bricks less than three טפחים; nevertheless we are required to use a brick of three טפחים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. When תוספות asked that perhaps we can infer that there are larger bricks; was his intention that there are larger bricks only, or that we can infer that there are larger bricks as well as smaller bricks?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See (עד"ז) in בל"י אות נו.</i><br>2. What concept was introduced in תוספות answer, which resolved the question?

Line 9

 <b>הג"ה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly this תוספות was not part of the original תוספות but was included as an addendum from (presumably) other בעלי תוספות.</i> – A gloss</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב חסדא ruled that one may not dismantle a synagogue, before building a replacement synagogue. Two reasons were offered for this ruling. Either because (that for the duration) there will not be a place where to pray (לצלויי); or because they may be negligent in rebuilding the synagogue (פשיעותא).<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem from this תוספות (especially from the last answer) that we are not concerned that they will be lax and not rebuild the ביכנ"ס at all. Rather the concern is that for the duration that they are lax in rebuilding the ביכנ"ס, it would be considered negligence on their part.</i> The practical ramification of these reasons is if there is another place (or בית הכנסת)<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות seems to favor this גירסא.</i> where to pray. If the concern is לצלויי then it is permitted to dismantle the ביכנ"ס; if however the concern is פשיעותא, then even when there is a דוכתא לצלויי (or another ביכנ"ס) it is forbidden to dismantle the current ביכנ"ס. The גמרא then relates that זוטרא ומר מרימר would dismantle and rebuild the summer ביכנ"ס in the winter, and the winter ביכנ"ס in the summer. It is not clear whether we are discussing one ביכנ"ס which was dismantled and rebuilt twice a year; or we are discussing two separate בתי כנסיות, of which each one was dismantled and rebuilt. It is also not clear why they were permitted to do so. It would seemingly be in violation of the abovementioned ruling. תוספות will be discussing these issues.<br>---------------------------<br><b>בי קייטא ובי סיתווא הוי כמו איכא תיוהא ושרי –</b><br>Dismantling and rebuilding <b>a summer</b> synagogue in the winter,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The summer ביכנ"ס was dismantled at the end of the summer and rebuilt immediately in time for the winter.</i> and <b>a winter</b> synagogue in the summer, <b>is comparable to</b> a case where <b>there is a fissure</b> in the wall of the synagogue <b>and it is permitted</b> to dismantle (and rebuild) the synagogue in all these cases. When there is a fissure in the wall of the בית הכנסת which may cause it to collapse, it is certainly permissible to dismantle the ביכנ"ס and rebuild it (as the גמרא states shortly). Similarly during the winter season, the summer ביכנ"ס is considered faulty<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It is too cold there in the winter. Conversely, the winter ביכנ"ס, is too hot for the summer.</i> and may be dismantled and subsequently rebuilt as a winter ביכנ"ס; and vice versa with the winter ביכנ"ס during the summer. תוספות is now assuming that there was only one ביכנ"ס in this city. It was dismantled and rebuilt twice a year.<br>תוספות considers and discusses an alternate possibility:<br><b>ואם שתי בתי כנסיות היו בב' מקומות של קייטא ושל סיתווא –</b><br><b>And if</b> we were to assume that in the case of the גמרא, <b>there were two</b> בתי כנסיות <b>in two</b> separate <b>places</b> in the city, <b>a summer</b> ביכנ"ס <b>and a</b> separate <b>winter</b> ביכנ"ס; this would raise the question why where they permitted to dismantle the summer ביכנ"ס in the winter. We cannot consider the summer ביכנ"ס as if it is faulty in the winter; since there was a separate winter ביכנ"ס. What right did they have to dismantle the summer ביכנ"ס in the winter and vice versa?!<br>תוספות answers: We must say that the גמרא –<br><b>איירי כגון דחזו בה תיוהא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It would be difficult to say that they actually found a breach in the wall; for if that were the case, it would be permitted to dismantle the summer ביכנ"ס even in the summer. Therefore תוספות states 'כגון' something similar to a fault. In ordinary circumstances we would be reluctant to dismantle it; however since it was a summer ביכנ"ס in the winter, and was not being used, it was permissible to dismantle it (even according to the מ"ד פשיעותא) because it required repairs.</i> –</b><br><b>is discussing a situation similar to finding a breach</b> in the wall; therefore they were permitted to dismantle it.<br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>ועוד נראה כיון דיש שם בית הכנסת אחר אין לחוש אם לא יבנו זאת<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">This phrase seems to indicate, that we are not concerned even if it is never rebuilt.</i> –</b><br><b>And furthermore, it seems that since there is another</b> ביכנ"ס <b>there</b>, in that community (either the winter or summer ביכנ"ס) <b>there is no concern</b> even <b>if they do not rebuild this one</b> that they dismantled. The prohibition against dismantling a ביכנ"ס, is based on the concern that it will not be rebuilt (or that the people will not have a place to be מתפלל). In our situation however, these concerns are not valid. There is another ביכנ"ס where to be מתפלל.<br>תוספות challenges this previous answer:<br><b>והא דקאמר דאיכא דוכתא לצלויי<br>And that which</b> the גמרא <b>states</b> concerning the difference between the two opinions why a ביכנ"ס may not be dismantled; whether it is because there is concern that it will not be rebuilt (פשיעותא), or whether we are concerned that in the duration of dismantling and rebuilding there will be no place to be מתפלל; the difference between these two reasons is in a situation <b>where there is a place to be מתפלל.</b> In such a situation we would not be permitted to dismantle a ביכנ"ס (only) according to the opinion that we are concerned for פשיעותא. In any event we see that even if there is a לצלויי דכותא we are not permitted to dismantle a ביכנ"ס according to the מ"ד פשיעותא. How then were they permitted to dismantle the בי קייטא וכו'?<br>תוספות responds: That answer that the difference between the two opinions is in a case of איכא דוכתא לצלויי –<br><b>היינו שאין בית הכנסת<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This would indicate that this תוספות is not 'אחריתי כנישתא בי' גורס, but rather 'לצלויי דוכתא'.</i> –</b><br><b>That is</b> specifically where this לצלויי דוכתא <b>is not a ביכנ"ס.</b> In that situation we maintain that according to the מ"ד פשיעותא it is forbidden to dismantle the ביכנ"ס even though there is a לצלויי דוכתא. For since that לצלויי דוכתא is not designated as a ביכנ"ס it is merely a temporary meeting place, it does not fulfill the requirement that every community have a proper and permanent ביכנ"ס. In the case of 'וכו בי קייטא there are two כנסיות בתי. Therefore we may dismantle one of them (if necessary).<br>תוספות offers an additional explanation why they were permitted to dismantle the קייטא וכו' בי.<br><b>ועוד<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Even if we were to assume that (according to the מ"ד פשיעותא) one is not permitted to dismantle a ביכנ"ס even if there is another ביכנ"ס in the community (as our גירסא in the גמרא maintains), nevertheless this case is different.</i> מחמת קור וחום אין לחוש שמא יפשעו<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">When there are two ‘regular’ בתי כנסיות in a community, one is not permitted to dismantle one of them (according to the מ"ד פשיעותא) out of concern that the people will use the other ביכנ"ס. This may cause a laxity in the rebuilding of the dismantled ביכנ"ס. This is not acceptable. In our case however the circumstances will force the community to rebuild the 'וכו קייטא בי. See the following footnote.</i> –<br>And furthermore on account of the cold</b> in the winter (where they have only the summer ביכנ"ס) <b>and the heat</b> in the summer (where they have only the winter ביכנ"ס) <b>there is no concern that perhaps they will be negligent</b> and not rebuild the ביכנ"ס during the off season. The circumstances of the (extreme) heat and cold (in the inferior ביכנ"ס) will force the community to rebuild the needed ביכנ"ס in time for the new season.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation why there will be no negligence:<br><b>או בזמן גדול כל כך אין לחוש.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">In the event when there is another ביכנ"ס, we are concerned that they may be lax in rebuilding the ביכנ"ס. The original ביכנ"ס was used (throughout the year), and now it is being neglected. [There is only concern for laxity; not that they will never rebuild it (see Overview)]. This laxity is considered a פשיעותא. In our case however, even if they are lax in rebuilding the summer ביכנ"ס during the winter (they do not rebuild it immediately at the beginning of the winter), it is not considered a פשיעותא, because the summer ביכנ"ס is never used during the winter. It can be considered a פשיעותא, only if they do not rebuild it by the time summer arrives. תוספות maintains that either the necessity to rebuild the ביכנ"ס before the new season (on account of cold/heat) will force then to build it in the proper time; or there is so much time during the winter to rebuild the summer ביכנ"ס, that we are not concerned that they will be that negligent. (This explains the 'לשון 'או instead of 'ועוד').</i></b><br><b>Or</b> one can argue <b>that for such an extended period there is no concern</b> that it will not be rebuilt.<br><b>עד כאן הגה"ה:</b><br><b>The gloss is hereby concluded.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A community may dismantle a summer ביכנ"ס for a winter one (and vice versa). If there is both a summer and winter ביכנ"ס they may be dismantled out of season if there is a need for (minor) repairs. This is the first opinion of תוספות.<br>The other opinion(s) of תוספות is that they may be dismantled out of season regardless, whether it needs repair work or not. This case differs from the case of איכא דוכתא לצלויי where it is forbidden to dismantle a ביכנ"ס according to the מ"ד פשיעותא because there it is merely a דוכתא לצלויי, not a ביכנ"ס; however here there still remains a bona fide ביכנ"ס. Even if the מ"ד פשיעותא maintains that if there is another ביכנ"ס it is still prohibited to dismantle an existing ביכנ"ס, it is nevertheless permissible to dismantle the בי קייטא כו'. In the case of two בתי כנסיות, the people may become accustomed to using only one ביכנ"ס and be lax in rebuilding the other. By בי קייטא, however they will never be comfortable using the summer ביכנ"ס in the winter. Another reason is that the negligence of rebuilding the בי קייטא will never extend over the entire winter.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Do זוטרא ומר מרימר maintain the reason of צלויי, or פשיעותא?<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות נט.</i><br>2. At what point in the winter is it permitted to dismantle the summer ביכנ"ס?<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ (בד"ה או).</i>

Line 11

<b>אי הכי כי בנייה נמי—If</b> it is <b>so, if they built it, also</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא was discussing the ruling of רב חסדא that one may not dismantle a ביכנ"ס until a new ביכנ"ס is built. The גמרא asserted that even if all the building materials are prepared for the new ביכנ"ס, nevertheless we are still not permitted to dismantle the old ביכנ"ס. We are concerned that perhaps they will be confronted with a case of פדיון שבויים and will have to sell the materials to raise money for the ransom. The גמרא then asks if this is a valid concern then even if the new ביכנ"ס was built, it should still be prohibited to dismantle the old ביכנ"ס, for we may be required to sell the (new) ביכנ"ס for פדיון שבויים. תוספות is troubled by this question. It seems to indicate that we should never be permitted to dismantle a ביכנ"ס, out of concern that we may be required to sell the new one for פדיון שבויים. However there should be no such concern. We are not permitted to sell a ביכנ"ס for פדיון שבויים.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ע"פ נח"מ עיי"ש ועי' בבל"י.</i><br>--------------------<br><b>פירוש עד שיתפללו בה:</b><br><b>The meaning</b> that we should be concerned not to dismantle the old ביכנ"ס even if the new ביכנ"ס was built; that concern is limited <b>until they begin praying in</b> the new ביכנ"ס.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Only up to then is it permitted to sell the ביכנ"ס for פדיון שבויים. See previous footnote.</i> Once they started praying in the new ביכנ"ס however, there was not even a הוה אמינא, that we should not be permitted to dismantle the old ביכנ"ס.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא asked that even if the new ביכנ"ס was built, as long as they were not מתפלל there yet, it should be prohibited to dismantle to old ביכנ"ס.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why is there a difference whether they started to be מתפלל in the new ביכנ"ס or not?<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. How does the מסקנא of the גמרא differ from the הו"א concerning a built ביכנ"ס?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות סד.</i>

Line 12

<b>ועייליה לפורייה להתם—And he brought in his bed there</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב אשי wanted to be sure that there would be no laxity in the rebuilding of the ביכנ"ס, so he placed his bed and slept in the ביכנ"ס until the entire construction (including the setting of the drain pipes) was completed. תוספות will be discussing whether it is permissible to sleep in a ביכנ"ס.<br>--------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה והא אמרת<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספתא מגילה יא,ב. It does not mention however 'שינת ארעי'. See מנחת בכורים there.</i> בתי כנסיות אין ישנים בהם לא שינת קבע ולא שינת עראי –</b><br><b>And it is astounding! For you</b> know that it is <b>stated</b> concerning <b>synagogues</b>, that <b>we do not sleep in them neither a (fixed) [normal] sleep nor a temporary sleep</b> (a nap)<b>.</b> How was רב אשי permitted to sleep in this ביכנ"ס (that they were building)?<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See, ‘Thinking it over”.</i><br>תוספות offers a possible answer and rejects it:<br><b>ואין לתרץ משום דבבבל הוי ואמר רב אסי בפרק בתרא דמגילה (דף כח,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל בתי) –</b><br><b>And we cannot answer</b> that he was permitted to sleep in the ביכנ"ס, <b>since it was in בבל,</b> <b>and רב אסי said in the last פרק of </b>מסכת <b>מגילה</b><b> –<br>בתי כנסיות של בבל על תנאי הן עשויות –</b><br><b>The בתי כנסת of בבל are made with</b> certain <b>stipulations.</b> These stipulations allow the בתי כנסיות of בבל to be used for purposes other than a ביכנ"ס.<b><br>ופירש הקונטרס התם נפקא מינה לענין הא דקתני לעיל אין אוכלין בהן ואין שותים בהן –</b><br><b>And</b> רש"י <b>explained there</b> in מסכת מגילה that the fact the ביכנ"ס were made תנאי על <b>has a relevance concerning that which was previously taught</b> there in a ברייתא concerning a ביכנ"ס, namely that <b>one may neither eat nor drink in</b> a ביכנ"ס –<br><b>ואין נכנסין בהן בחמה מפני החמה ובגשמים מפני הגשמים ובשל בבל מותר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The בתי כנסיות in בבל were built with the provision that one may conduct himself there in a manner prohibited in other בתכנ"ס. It would seem from רש"י that in the בתכנ"ס of בבל one is permitted to sleep there as well, since it was built with the provision that people may sleep there. This would seemingly explain why רב אשי was permitted to place his bed in the ביכנ"ס.</i> –</b><br><b>And one may not enter into them in the summer time to</b> protect himself <b>from the heat;</b> nor may he enter a ביכנ"ס <b>in the rainy</b> season to shelter himself from <b>the rain; however in</b> the ביכנ"ס <b>of בבל he is permitted</b> to do the aforementioned acts.<br>תוספות rejects this explanation:<br><b>דהא קאמר התם בתר הכי רבינא ורב אדא הוו קיימי ושיילי שמעתא מרבא –</b><br><b>For</b> the גמרא in מגילה <b>subsequently relates that רבינא and רב אדא were standing and asking a הלכה question from רבא –<br>אתא זילחא דמטרא עלייהו ועיילי לבי כנישתא –</b><br><b>A downpour of rain fell upon them so they entered into the ביכנ"ס</b> to continue their discussion –<br><b>ולא משום מטרא אלא משום דשמעתא בעיא צילותא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">רבא would not be able to come to the right decision, since they are being distracted by the downpour.</i> –</b><br><b>However, they did not enter</b> the ביכנ"ס to protect themselves <b>from the rain rather they entered the ביכנ"ס because learning</b> תורה <b>requires a clear mind.</b> This concludes the story. תוספות continues –<br><b>והשתא והלא בית הכנסת של בבל היה והיו יכולין ליכנס בה מפני המטר<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The fact that the גמרא makes it clear that they did not enter the ביכנ"ס on account of the rain proves that even in בבל, one is not permitted to derive personal benefit from the ביכנ"ס. The question therefore remains; how was רב אשי permitted to sleep in the ביכנ"ס.</i> –</b><br><b>But now</b> let us see; <b>this was a ס"ביהכנ</b> <b>in בבל</b> and according to י"<b>רש they would be permitted to enter the</b> ביכנ"ס <b>on account of the rain</b>.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דלאו ממש לבית הכנסת עיילה לפוריה –</b><br><b>And one can say that he did not bring his bed into the ס"ביהכנ</b> <b>proper –<br>אלא בסמוך לבית הכנסת במקום שהאורחין רגילין לישן שם ולאכול –</b><br><b>But rather</b> in a room <b>adjacent to the ביכנ"ס,</b> <b>in the place where the guests customarily sleep and eat there.</b> תוספות will now show that it was customary to have a room adjacent to the ביכנ"ס for guests –<br><b>כדאמרינן בערבי פסחים (פסחים דף קא,א ושם דיבור המתחיל דאכלי) –</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>ערבי פסחים –<br>ושמואל<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">שמואל maintains that אין קידוש אלא במקום סעודה.</i> למה ליה לקדושי בבי כנישתא –</b><br><b>‘And</b> according <b>to</b> שמואל <b>why do they make</b> קידוש <b>in the ביכנ"ס?</b> The people go home to eat. There is no סעודה במקום קידוש. The גמרא answers קידוש is made in order that –<br><b>לאפוקי אורחים ידי חובתן דאכלו ושתו וגנו בבי כנישתא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">It seems obvious that these guests did these activities in the adjacent guest room provided for them, not in the ביכנ"ס proper. Similarly רב אשי placed his bed and slept in the adjoining room.</i> –<br>The guests fulfill their obligation</b> to make קידוש. Since there are guests <b>who eat, drink and sleep in the ביכנ"ס.’</b><br>תוספות deals now with the statement that בתי כנסיות שבבל על תנאי הם עשויין.<br><b>והא דאמר דעל תנאי הן עשויין מפרש רבינו יצחק –</b><br><b>And</b> concerning <b>that</b> which the גמרא states that the בתי כנסיות שבבל <b>were made על תנאי,</b> <b>the ר"י explains</b> that it does not mean that one can arbitrarily make a provision permitting usage of the ביכנ"ס for personal needs; but rather the תנאי was made –<br><b>לענין שאם יחרבו יעשו מהן מה שירצו לבד מקלות ראש<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there gives an example of קלות ראש to mean that it is forbidden to use the ביכנ"ס for חשבונות.</i> כדאמרינן התם:</b><br><b>concerning that if</b> the בתכנ"ס <b>became destroyed they can utilize</b> the destroyed ביכנ"ס <b>as they see fit,</b> <b>except</b> that they cannot utilize it <b>for light headed purposes as the גמרא states there in</b> מסכת מגילה.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is forbidden to do any secular activity in a ביכנ"ס even in בבל. The provisions that were made for the בכנ"ס of בבל was that one may make respectful use of them once they are destroyed, and no longer function as aביכנ"ס .רב אשי placed his bed and slept in a room adjoining the ביכנ"ס proper; not in the ביכנ"ס itself. [רש"י maintains, on account of the provisions – על תנאי הם עשוים, one may utilize an existing ביכנ"ס for personal needs.]<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>One would assume that the prohibition against sleeping, etc. in a ביכנ"ס is limited to a functioning ביכנ"ס. Here however רב אשי seemingly slept in a ביכנ"ס during construction<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> when it was not in use.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">This should be perhaps considered בחורבנן, where everything besides קלות ראש is permitted.</i> How can we justify תוספות question?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות סח.</i>
