Line 5



Line 6

<b>ואפילו מיתמי. ואף על גב דאמור רבנן הבא ליפרע כולי—And even from orphans. And even though the רבנן rule, one who comes to collect, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>There are two statements in the גמרא concerning whether or how a creditor may collect from יתומים; where the creditor has a שטר that their deceased father owed him money. One statement is cited here that הבא ליפרע מכנסי יתומים לא יפרע אלא בשבועה; that the מלוה may collect from יתומים only if he swears to substantiate his claim; that the father did not pay and the monies are still owed. This rule applies to יתומים גדולים (and also to יתומים קטנים where applicable).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This rule applies generally to anyone who collects בפניו שלא. The reason is to protect the יתומים or לקוחות, etc., since they are not familiar with the case, etc.</i> A second statement,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">ערכין כב,א. </i> in the name of רב אסי, is that לנכסי יתומין אא"כ רבית אוכלת בהם אין נזקקין; that we do not get involved to pay off the debts of יתומים (even with a שבועה), unless their assets are being consumed by the interest payments. This rule applies (only) to יתומים קטנים.<br>There is a dispute as to the reason for this second rule. רב פפא maintains that we cannot collect from יתומים קטנים, since the obligation of repaying a debt is (merely!!) a מצוה; therefore יתומים קטנים who are not obligated to perform מצות are exempt from paying the debt (as long as they are קטנים).<br>רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע maintains that the reason we cannot collect from יתומים קטנים is because there is a concern perhaps the father placed a bundle of valuables ('צררי') by the creditor before he died.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This concern of 'צררי' is rather far-fetched, and it is only applicable by קטנים who are totally defenseless; however by יתומים גדולים the מלוה may collect with a שבועה. See footnotes # 14 &amp; 15.</i><br>The גמרא states that there will be a practical difference between these two reasons in a case where the לוה admitted owing the money immediately before he died.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 28 for an additional נפק"מ.</i> According to ר"ה בדר"י, we will collect from the יתומים קטנים, since there is no concern of any payment. However according to רב פפא we cannot collect from the יתומים קטנים since they are לאו בני מיעבד מצוה. Our גמרא states that the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז is so strong than one may collect from יתומים without a שבועה if the father died תו"ז. The issue תוספות will be discussing is (according to ר"ה בדר"י) what is the ruling in a case of יתומים קטנים, where the לוה died תוך זמנו. Are יתומים קטנים also included in the ‘ואפילו מיתמי’ or not.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">If the גמרא would have cited the statement of רב אסי that אין נזקקין לנכסי יתומים (קטנים) וכו' (אע"ג דא"ר אסי),  it would be obvious that תו"ז you may collect. The גמרא however chose the (more ambiguous) statement of 'הבא ליפרע וכו. See later this תוספות by footnote # 21.</i> Do we say that the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז is equal to an admission from the לוה that he owes the money, and therefore we may collect even from יתומים קטנים (בלא שבועה), or we may not collect?<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>נראה דביתומים גדולים מיירי אבל בקטנים לא גבי אפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem from later in תוספות that he cannot collect even with a שבועה (see footnote # 16).</i> תוך זמנו –<br>It appears that we are discussing</b> (only) <b>mature orphans;</b> those that are over בר מצוה. It is only in that case that the מלוה can collect their father’s debt from the יתומים without a שבועה if it was תוך זמנו <b>– however</b> if the יתומים <b>are minors –</b> under בר מצוה – the creditor <b>will not be able to collect</b> his debt from the estate of the קטנים, which their father left them <b>even if it was within the time;</b> before the loan was due. Even if the father died before the due date of the loan, whereby we should assume that the loan was not paid, nevertheless the מלוה cannot collect the loan from the estate of the יתומים קטנים.<br>תוספות expounds on this statement that we cannot collect from יתומים קטנים even if the father died תוך זמנו:<br><b>לרב<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ולא מיבעיא לרב פפא.</i> פפא דמפרש טעמא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ערכין כב,א.</i> דאין נזקקין משום פריעת בעל חוב מצוה –</b><br><b>[And this is unquestionably</b> certain] <b>according to</b> <b>רב פפא who explains the reason</b> for the law which states <b>that we do not assign</b> the properties of יתומים קטנים (to pay off debts), unless their assets are being consumed by the accumulating interest on the loan.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">In this case it is for their benefit that the loan be paid, so that their assets should not be diminished because of the accumulating interest payments.</i> Otherwise we wait until the יתומים mature and become גדולים. The reason for this law according to רב פפא is <b>because it is a</b> מצוה <b>to pay the creditor;</b> that is the reason why a loan must be paid, however –<br><b>ויתמי לאו בני מיעבד מצוה נינהו –</b><br><b>And</b> since minor <b>orphans are not required to do</b> מצות<b>,</b> therefore there is no need to pay the loan, as long as they are minors. According to רב פפא, therefore, it is quite obvious that even though it is תוך זמנו, nevertheless we do not collect from the יתמי קטני, since they are לאו מיעבד מצוה בני.<br><b>ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read אלא אפילו.</i> לרב הונא בריה דרב יהושע דמפרש טעמא משום צררי –</b><br><b>However, even according to ר"ה בדר"י who</b> argues with רב פפא and<b></b> he <b>explains the reason</b> for the aforementioned דין of לנכסי יתומין (קטנים) אא"כ רבית אוכלת בהם אין נזקקין, is <b>because</b> we are concerned that perhaps the debtor handed the creditor <b>a bundle</b> containing valuables, as collateral for the debt. Therefore we cannot collect from the יתומים because perhaps the loan was already paid. It would seem that according to ר"ה בדר"י, if the father died תוך זמנו where there is no concern of צררי, since אין אדם פורע תוך זמנו, one should be able to collect from the יתומים קטנים (at least with a שבועה). Nonetheless, תוספות maintains that –<br><b>לא גבי מיתמי קטנים אפילו תוך זמנו דאין מקבלים עדים שלא בפני בעל דין –</b><br><b>He cannot collect from minor</b> יתומים even according to ר"ה בדר"י <b>even</b> if the father died תוך זמנו<b>,</b> so there is (seemingly) no concern for צררי, nevertheless the מלוה cannot collect <b>because</b> בי"ד <b>does not accept witnesses in the absence of the</b> opposing <b>litigant –<br>דקטנים חשוב שלא בפניו כדמוכח בריש פרק הגוזל בתרא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there relates the following: After s'רבי ירמיה father-in-law passed away, his (minor) son, the brother-in-law of ר' ירמיה would not allow ר' ירמיה entry to his deceased father’s house. ר' ירמיה argued to ר' אבין that he has witnesses that he, ר' ירמיה, made a חזקה in the house during his father-in-law’s lifetime (after it was sold or gifted to him). ר' אבין responded that we do not accept testimony שלא בפני בע"ד.</i> (בבא קמא דף קיב,א) –</b><br><b>For minors are considered as if they are not present, as is evident in the beginning of פרק הגוזל בתרא.</b> <sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The מלוה when he wishes to collect his debt from the יתומים must offer evidence that he is owed the money. This is usually in the form of a שטר with עדים. The בי"ד will not accept this evidence, for there is no לוה present to contest the evidence. The יתומים קטנים, even if they come to court, are not considered present. Therefore the מלוה cannot collect. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i><br>תוספות will discuss a new case:<br><b>ואפילו נתקבלה עדות בחיי האב<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">הגהות הב"ח inserts here the word נמי.</i> מצית למימר דחיישינן לצררי אפילו תוך הזמן בקטנים<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">קטנים are considered utterly defenseless, therefore בי"ד has to be concerned about them in a greater measure than is usually accorded to other litigants such as לקוחות and יתומים גדולים.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the aforementioned rule applies <b>even if the testimony was accepted during the father’s lifetime;</b> and בי"ד ascertained that the לוה owes the מלוה money. The father subsequently died, before the מלוה was able to collect the debt. One may have thought that according to ר"ה בדר"י the מלוה can collect from the estate. There is no problem of קבלת עדות שלא בפני בע"ד, since that was already done האב בחיי. There is seemingly also no concern of צררי, since it is תוך זמנו. Nevertheless, he cannot collect from the יתומים. The reason is, for <b>we can [still] say that by</b> קטנים <b>we are concerned for</b> צררי <b>even if it is תוך זמנו.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The fact that we are חושש for זמנו בתוך צררי is not in direct conflict with the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז. There is a difference between צררי and פרעון. By פרעון the לוה is paying off the loan and is giving up this payment money forever. The לוה will not part with his money before it is due. He needs the money. That is why he borrowed it in the first place. The idea of צררי, however, is that the לוה wants the מלוה to feel secure about his loan. He therefore places an object of value that he possesses, but may not need now, into the hands of the מלוה for security (hoping perhaps to even extend the due date). The לוה intends to retrieve the צררי when he ultimately pays up the loan. This type of ‘security’ is possible even תוך זמנו, since the לוה is not irrevocably giving up his rights to the צררי. </i></b><br>תוספות will prove his point that there can be a חשש צררי even תוך זמנו:<br><b>כדאשכחן גבי אלמנה בפרק השולח (גיטין דף לד,ב ושם) –</b><br><b>As we find</b> this same concern <b>by a widow in השולח פרק –<br>דתנן אין האלמנה נפרעת מנכסי יתומים אלא בשבועה –</b><br><b>For we learnt</b> there in <b>a משנה; ‘a widow cannot collect</b> her כתובה <b>from the assets of the orphans unless she swears’</b> that her former husband did not pay her any part of the כתובה during his lifetime –<br><b>וטעמא משום שמא התפיסה הבעל צררי אף על פי שהוא תוך הזמן<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">There seems to be some difficulties in the comparison of אלמנה to our case. Firstly by אלמנה we are חושש לצררי even by יתומים גדולים (as תוספות will soon point out). Secondly by אלמנה she is believed with a שבועה; as opposed to our case of יתומים קטנים, where the מלוה cannot collect even with a שבועה (see footnote # 6).</i> –</b><br><b>And the reason</b> why she cannot collect without a שבועה <b>because</b> we are concerned that <b>perhaps the husband placed צררי</b> in her possession; <b>even though</b> while the husband was alive <b>it was תוך זמנו.</b> The time of payment for a כתובה is after (a divorce or after) the husband’s death. The fact that the אלמנה must swear, proves that the חשש of צררי exists even if it is תוך זמנו. Therefore it is possible that by יתומים קטנים we are also concerned for צררי even תוך זמנו.<br>תוספות explains that the similarity to אלמנה is not a compelling proof:<br><b>ומיהו מאלמנה אין ראיה דהתם חיישינן לצררי אפילו בגדולים –</b><br><b>However there can be no</b> conclusive <b>proof</b> from the case of <b>אלמנה</b> that there is a חשש צררי even תוך זמנו by יתומים קטנים, <b>for there</b> by אלמנה <b>we are concerned for צררי</b> <b>even by adult</b> יתומים; she cannot collect from them without a שבועה. However by a מלוה ולוה if there are adult יתומים and it was תוך זמנו the מלוה can collect even without a שבועה, as we learnt in our גמרא. Therefore it is obvious that there is a difference between the כתובה of an אלמנה and a regular loan. The reason why by an אלמנה we are חושש for צררי even תוך זמנו and even by יתומים גדולים is –<br><b>משום דאית לה בתנאי בית דין –</b><br><b>Because she is owed</b> the כתובה <b>by a stipulation of בי"ד.</b> <sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The obligation of a כתובה is not merely self-imposed (like a loan); but rather it is incumbent on every husband to provide a כתובה for his wife. Therefore when there is such a  serious  obligation  on  the  husband,  we  suspect  that  out  of  concern  to  fulfill  this obligation, the husband presented her with צררי while he was still married to her, even though it is תוך זמנו. The husband may be concerned that his heirs will not fulfill this obligation. This in turn would reflect badly on him that he did not adhere to the תנאי בי"ד. However by a self-imposed obligation such as a loan, perhaps there is no חשש צררי if it is תוך זמנו.</i><b></b><br>תוספות goes on to prove that there is a difference, in regards to the concern of צררי, between a self-imposed obligation and a תנאי בי"ד.<br><b>כדאמרינן בהנושא (כתובות דף קב,ב ושם) דחיישינן טפי לצררי בבנותיו<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">After the father’s death, his daughters are fed and sustained from his estate. However they cannot collect from משועבדים נכסים for we are concerned perhaps they received צררי.</i> מבבת אשתו<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote"> If a husband stipulated that he will support his wife’s daughter (his stepdaughter) for a period of time, then if he died during this time, his stepdaughter can collect even from משועבדים נכסים; there is no concern of צררי.</i> –</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>הנושא that we are more concerned</b> that he deposited <b>צררי</b> concerning his obligation <b>for his daughters,</b> than we concerned for צררי concerning his obligation <b>for his wife’s daughter.</b> The reason we are more concerned בבנותיו is –<br><b>משום כיון דאיתנהו בתנאי בית דין אימור צררי אתפסינהו<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">It seems evident from the expression ראיה אין מאלמנה מיהו, that תוספות realized (originally) that there is no conclusive proof from אלמנה that we are concerned for צררי by יתומים קטנים תוך זמנו. It is therefore somewhat not clear what does תוספות initially intend to accomplish by citing the case of אלמנה. The explanation may be as follows. It seems that תוספות maintains ‘intuitively’ that we cannot collect from יתומים קטנים, even if it is תוך זמנו. These יתומים are utterly defenseless. It would be a travesty of justice if בי"ד would allow the מלוה to collect from these hapless individuals. On the other hand, however, a certain ‘mechanism’ is required to justify, why בי"ד has the right to restrain the מלוה from collecting from the יתומים קטנים, since it is תוך זמנו. This ‘mechanism’ is the concern of צררי. The question arises; where do we find the חשש of צררי if it is תוך זמנו. The answer is by אלמנה. From אלמנה we see that under certain circumstances there is a חשש צררי even תוך זמנו. By אלמנה the ‘trigger’ for the חשש of צררי is because it is a תנאי בי"ד. In our case the ‘trigger’ is the fact that we are dealing with יתומים קטנים. However there is no proof from אלמנה, that יתומים קטנים can trigger the חשש of צררי תוך זמנו, but at least there is a precedent that on occasion there is a חשש צררי even תוך זמנו.</i> –</b><br><b>Because since</b> his obligation to his daughters <b>is stipulated by בי"ד;</b> and it is not a self-imposed obligation as בת אשתו, therefore <b>I can say that</b> perhaps <b>he deposited צררי</b> by בנותיו in order to fulfill his תנאי בי"ד. However by בת אשתו we are not concerned that צררי אתפסינהו since it is a self-imposed obligation and not a תנאי בי"ד. We can derive from this גמרא that there is a greater concern for צררי when we are dealing with תנאי בי"ד. Similarly there is a greater concern of צררי by an אלמנה even though it is תוך זמנו since his obligation to her is a תנאי בי"ד. However by a regular הלואה perhaps we are not concerned for צררי if it is תוך זמנו, even by קטנים.<br>To summarize: According to רב פפא one cannot collect from יתומים קטנים even תוך זמנו because they are לאו בני מיעבד מצוה נינהו. According to ר"ה בדר"י if בי"ד did not accept the testimony of the מלוה while the father was alive, the מלוה cannot collect from יתומים קטנים, since אין מקבלין עדות שלא בפני בע"ד. The question is, according to ר"ה בדר"י can the מלוה collect from יתומים קטנים if the testimony was already accepted האב בחיי, Are we concerned for צררי or not. The fact that by אלמנה we are concerned for צררי even though it is תוך זמנו does not prove that the same applies by a הלואה. The case of אלמנה is different since he owes her the money בתנאי בי"ד as opposed to הלואה which is a self-imposed חיוב.<br>תוספות anticipates a possible proof from our גמרא that one cannot collect from יתומים קטנים תוך זמנו, and rejects it. The גמרא, when it wants to convey to us the strength of the חזקה that א"א פורע תו"ז, states that even though generally one cannot collect from (גדולים) יתומים נכסי only with a שבועה, nevertheless if it is תוך זמנו one may collect from (גדולים) יתומים even without a שבועה. The proposed proof is that if the דין would be that you may collect תוך זמנו even from יתומים קטנים, the גמרא should have cited a different rule. תוספות offers the proposed proof:<br><b>ואין להביא ראיה מדלא קאמר הכא –</b><br><b>And one cannot bring proof</b> that the מלוה cannot collect from יתומים קטנים תו"ז <b>from</b> the fact <b>that</b> the גמרא <b>did not state here</b> a different citation than which the גמרא actually states<b>.</b> The גמרא should have stated –<br><b>אף על גב דאמור רבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">This is the דין of ר' אסי in ערכין כב,א. The text actually reads יתומים and omits קטנים (See Overview). See footnote # 5. This citation would have clearly taught us that תוך זמנו one may collect from יתומים קטנים. However from the quote the גמרא cites הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים וכו', we cannot infer that one may collect even from יתומים קטנים בתוך זמנו, for (perhaps) the expression מנכסי יתומים here means (only) יתומים גדולים.</i> אין נזקקין לנכסי יתומים קטנים אלא אם כן רבית אוכלת בהן כולי –</b><br><b>Even though the</b> רבנן <b>said ‘we do not assign the assets of יתומים קטנים</b> for collection <b>unless the interest</b> due <b>is consuming those</b> assets, <b>etc.’</b> nevertheless if it is תוך זמנו the מלוה would collect even from קטנים יתומים<b>.</b> The fact that the גמרא chose this quote as opposed to 'וכו קטנים יתומים אין נזקקין לנכסי (seemingly) proves –<br><b>דלא מיירי בקטנים אלא דוקא בגדולים –</b><br><b>That we are not discussing קטנים</b> יתומים<b>,</b> that one may collect from them <b>but</b> rather we are discussing <b>specifically only</b> יתומים <b>גדולים.</b> If the דין would be that even by יתומים קטנים one may collect from them תוך זמנו the גמרא should have cited the other דין of אין נזקקין לנכסי יתומים קטנים וכו'. This concludes the proposed proof from our גמרא that we cannot collect from קטנים even if it is תוך זמנו.<br>תוספות rejects this proof. In reality according to י<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות has already established that according to רב פפא, who maintains the reason of יתמי לאו בני מצוה נינהו, one cannot collect from יתמי קטני in any event. The entire discussion is only according to ר"ה בדר"י.</i>ר"ה בדר"י one may collect from יתומים קטנים if it is תוך זמנו; the reason why the גמרא does not cite the other rule which would indicate that we may collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו is –<br><b>דשמא משום רב פפא נקט מילתיה בגדולים –</b><br><b>That perhaps on account of רב פפא</b> who definitely maintains that one cannot collect from יתמי קטני in any event, therefore <b>he chose a case of</b> יתומים <b>גדולים.</b> The בעל הגמרא did not want to get involved in this מחלוקת between רב פפא and ר"ה בדר"י whether one may collect from יתמי קטני. Therefore he chose to discuss only יתומים גדולים where all will agree that we may collect from them תוך זמנו. In truth however, perhaps according to ר"ה בדר"י one may collect from יתמי קטני תו"ז.<br>תוספות offers another rejection to the proposed proof:<br><b>אי נמי נקט ההוא דהבא ליפרע לאשמועינן דגבי אפילו בלא שבועה –</b><br><b>Or</b> we may <b>also</b> say the גמרא <b>cites this</b> quote <b>to teach us that</b> תוך זמנו, <b>one may collect</b> from יתומים <b>even without a שבועה.</b> It is possible<b></b> that you may collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו (according to ר"ה בדר"י) and the reason the גמרא did not cite the other quotation of אין נזקקים לנכסי 'כו יתומים קטנים is because there is a certain disadvantage in that quote versus the quote the גמרא actually uses; the quote of הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים לא יפרע אלא בשבועה.<b></b> <sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא cites a דין and teaches us that this דין does not apply תוך זמנו. We can infer the דין of תוך זמנו, by contrasting it with the original דין. If the original דין is that a שבועה is required from the יתומים, we can infer that תוך זמנו, no שבועה is required. If the original דין is that we cannot collect from יתומים קטנים at all, we can (only) infer that תו"ז we may collect from יתומים קטנים. However we will not be certain if it is with a שבועה or without a שבועה. The גמרא would rather teach us the דין that a שבועה is not required (which applies to all cases) rather than teaching us that we can collect from יתמי קטני (however [perhaps] with a שבועה).</i><br>תוספות offers an additional proof that we cannot collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו and rejects it:<br><b>ואין להביא ראיה משלהי דמכילתין (דף קעד,ב) –</b><br><b>And one cannot bring proof from the end of our מסכת</b> that we cannot collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו –<br><b>דקאמר מאי בינייהו דרב פפא ורב הונא בריה דרב יהושע –</b><br><b>Where</b> the גמרא <b>asks, ‘what is</b> the practical <b>difference between</b> the reasons <b>of רב פפא</b> <b>and</b> <b>ר"ה בדר"י’?</b> What ramifications are there להלכה? –<br><b>ולא קאמר איכא בינייהו כגון דמית לוה תוך הזמן דלרב הונא גבי –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>does not respond: there is a</b> practical difference between them <b>for instance where the לוה</b> <b>dies before the due date:</b> <b>according to ר"ה בדר"י</b> the מלוה <b>may collect</b> even from יתמי קטני since there is no חשש of צררי because the לוה died תוך זמנו. However according to רב פפא the מלוה cannot collect from the יתמי קטני since they are לאו בני מיעבד מצוה. The fact that the גמרא does not offer this difference is proof that this difference does not exist. Even according to ר"ה בדר"י one cannot collect from יתמי קטני because of צררי.<br>תוספות rejects this proof. In reality if one would maintain the reason of צררי, then the מלוה would be able to collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו, since we maintain חזקה א"א פורע תו"ז. However the גמרא cannot cite this case as a בינייהו מאי between רב פפא and ר"ה בדר"י<br><b>דהא רב הונא ורב פפא אמר בשמעתין דלית להו חזקה דריש לקיש –</b><br><b>For</b> concerning <b>ר"ה בדר"י</b> <b>and רב פפא,</b> our גמרא <b>states</b> (on this עמוד) <b>they do not agree with the חזקה of ר"ל</b> that א"א פורע תו"ז; but rather they maintain that אדם פורע תו"ז. Therefore it is understood that both ר"ה בדר"י and רב פפא agree that we cannot collect from (יתמי (קטני since there is a possibility that the לוה paid the loan תוך זמנו before he died. Our discussion was only according to us; we who maintain the opinion of ר"ל that א"א פורע תו"ז and assume the view of ר"ה בדר"י concerning צררי, what would be the הלכה for us.<br>תוספות offers an additional rejection of this latter proof. In reality according to the view of צררי the מלוה may collect from יתמי קטני תוך זמנו. However one cannot ask, why did not the גמרא mention this difference (between רב פפא and ר"ה בדר"י [as well]).<br><b>ועוד<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See “Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> דבכמה מקומות יכול למצוא איכא בינייהו טובא –</b><br><b>And furthermore</b> the lack of mentioning this additional בינייהו איכא is no proof that ר"ה בדר"י agrees with פ"ר in תו"ז <b>For in many instances</b> the גמרא <b>can find many practical differences</b> between the disputing opinions –<br><b>ואינו חושש לומר אלא דבר אחד<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">As in המניח.</i> או שנים<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">As in פשוט גט.</i> –<br>However</b> the גמרא <b>is not concerned</b> to mention all the differences; <b>rather</b> it suffices <b>to mention merely one or two</b> differences.<br><b>כדאמרינן בהמניח (בבא קמא דף לג,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל הקדישו) גבי פלוגתא דיושם השור –</b><br><b>As we<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly תוספות is referring to his remarks in the תוספות there הקדישו ה"ד.</i> say in</b> פרק <b>המניח concerning the argument</b> between רבי ישמעאל and רבי עקיבא <b>whether the</b> goring <b>ox is assessed</b> or confiscated. The גמרא there gives (only) one practical difference between these two opinions. תוספות there maintains that there are other practical differences between these two opinions, nevertheless the גמרא is satisfied with one. Similarly in this dispute the גמרא (in פרק גט פשוט) is satisfied by offering two differences<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">The other difference is in a case where the לוה was placed in חרם for not willing to pay the debt, and died while the חרם was still valid. See ‘Overview’ (footnote # 4) for the first נפק"מ.</i> between רב פפא and ר"ה בדר"י, even though there may be more, including that according to ר"ה בדר"י you may collect from יתמי קטני, but not according to רב פפא.<br>תוספות will now offer a (more acceptable) proof that even according to ר"ה בדר"י the מלוה cannot collect from יתמי קטניeven תוך זמנו .<br><b>מיהו יש להביא ראיה דאפילו רב הונא דמפרש טעמא משום צררי –</b><br><b>However we can bring a proof that even</b> according to <b>ר"ה</b> בדר"י <b>who explains</b> that <b>the reason</b> one may not collect from (קטנים) יתומים is <b>on account of צררי</b> –<br><b>לא גבי מיתומים קטנים אפילו תוך הזמן –</b><br><b>One may not collect from יתמי קטני even הזמן תוך.</b> תוספות continues with his proof –<br><b>דפריך עליה דרב אסי בפרק שום היתומים<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there (ב,כא) states that יום 'ל היתומים שום. That if there is a debt against the estate of the יתומים (from their father), בי"ד assesses the assets of the יתומים קטנים and announces for a period of thirty days, that these assets will be sold to satisfy the debt of the father. The גמרא asks who is the מלוה. If it is a gentile; he will not wait thirty days. If it is a ישראל, why should we assess the properties at all?! According to רב אסי we should wait till they grow older. We cannot say that there is interest due on this loan, for בי"ד will prohibit the מלוה from collecting the רבית.</i> (ערכין דף כב,א ושם) –</b><br><b>For</b> the גמרא <b>asks on the</b> statement <b>of אסי</b> <b>רב</b> <b>in היתומים שום</b> <b>פרק.</b> It is רב אסי who states that .(קטנים) אין נזקקין לנכסי יתומים  אא"כ רבית אוכלת בהם. The גמרא there asks that this statement seems to contradict the משנה there in ערכין –<br><b>ודחיק עלה לשנויי בבעל חוב שקיבל עליו לזו ולא לזו –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>forces itself to resolve</b> the contradiction, by answering that the משנה is discussing a gentile <b>מלוה</b> <b>that he accepted upon himself</b> to follow <b>this</b> assessment procedure of thirty days, <b>but he did not</b> accept upon himself to forgo the interest. Therefore since there is interest charged against the assets of the יתומים קטנים therefore בי"ד assigns their property for collection. This concludes the citation from the גמרא in ערכין. תוספות continues with his proof –<br><b>ולא משני הכא במאי עסקינן בשלא הגיע הזמן בחיי האב –</b><br><b>But</b> the גמרא <b>does not resolve</b> the contradiction, by saying that <b>here</b> in the משנה <b>we are discussing</b> a case <b>that the due date did not arrive during the lifetime of the father;</b> that is why we may collect from the יתומים. This explanation of the משנה according to רב אסי is much more reasonable than the explanation that the גמרא offers. Why indeed did the גמרא not offer this explanation?<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i> The answer is that the גמרא cannot offer this explanation for even if the father died before the due date, nevertheless a ישראל will not be able to collect from יתמי קטני even תוך זמנו.<br>תוספות anticipates a possible refutation of this proof and rejects it.<br><b>ואין לומר דההיא סוגיא סברה כטעמא דרב פפא –<br>And we cannot argue</b> the reason the גמרא did not offer this answer is <b>because that גמרא</b> (that gave this answer) <b>accepts the reasoning of רב פפא</b> who maintains that the reason one cannot collect from יתמי קטני is because they are לאו בני מיעבד מצוה. It makes no difference if it is תו"ז or not. However if we would maintain the opinion of ר"ה בדר"י then the מלוה would be able to collect מיתמי קטני תוך זמנו.<br>תוספות rejects this refutation. That סוגיא cannot be following the opinion of רב פפא –<br><b>דהא במסקנא משני כשחייב מודה והאי שינויא ליתא אליבא דטעמא דרב פפא –</b><br><b>For in the conclusion</b> of that סוגיא the גמרא <b>resolves</b> the contradiction that the משנה there is discussing a case <b>where the debtor</b> (לוה) <b>admitted</b> right before he died that he owes the money. In such a case we may collect from יתמי קטני. The fact that the גמרא gives this answer proves that the סוגיא there does not agree with the opinion of רב פפא, <b>for this answer,</b> that the לוה admitted that he owes the money, <b>is not</b> valid <b>according to the reasoning of רב פפא.<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">According to רב פפא even if the לוה admits that he owes the money we still cannot collect from יתמי קטני, because קטני לאו בני מיעבד מצוה נינהו. The fact that the גמרא gives the answer that מודה חייב proves that the סוגיא disagrees with רב פפא, and maintains the opinion of ר"ה בדר"י Nevertheless it would not give the answer of תוך זמנו. This proves that even if it is תוך זמנו the מלוה cannot collect מיתמי קטני. He can only collect if חייב מודה.</i></b><br>תוספות brought a proof from the הגמרא סוגית. Now תוספות will bring an additional proof from רב אסי himself that we cannot collect מיתמי קטני תוך זמנו.<br><b>וכן יש להוכיח מגופיה דמילתיה דרב אסי דקאמר אלא אם כן רבית אוכלת בהן –</b><br><b>And similarly we can prove</b> that we cannot collect תוך זמנו קטני מיתמי <b>from the words of רב אסי</b> <b>himself;</b> not only from the הגמרא סוגית (that it did not give the תירוץ of תוך זמנו); <b>for</b> רב אסי <b>stated that unless they are consumed by interest</b> one may not assign their properties. This limiting phrase אא"כ רבית אוכלת בהם indicates that only on account of רבית one may collect from יתמי קטני, but not under any other circumstances; even if it is תוך זמנו.<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">Even though מודה כשחייב he can collect; however that is so obvious that it does not contradict the phrase אא"כ, however collecting תוך זמנו is not so obvious and contradicts the 'אא"כ'. See ם"מהר.</i><br><b>ורבי יוחנן אינו מוסיף כי אם כתובת אשה משום מזוני –</b><br><b>and ר"י</b> <b>does not add</b> any other exception to the rule of רב אסי <b>except for a כתובה of a woman,</b> which may be collected from יתמי קטני; <b>for</b> if we do not pay off the כתובה immediately the widow will be <b>sustained and fed</b> at the expense of the יתומים.<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">Once the כתובה is paid off, the אלמנה does not receive מזוני from the estate of her husband.</i><br><b>משמע בעל חוב לא משתכח בשום ענין דנפרעין –</b><br><b>This indicates that by a מלוה we cannot find any case<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 32.</i> where he collects</b> from יתמי קטני even תוך זמנו.<br>תוספות anticipates the following objection. This may not be a conclusive proof. It is possible that רב אסי ור"י maintain that א"א פורע תו"ז, therefore קטנים יתומים מנכסי נפרעין אין even תו"ז. Our discussion however is according to those who maintain the חזקה of ר"ל that א"א פורע תו"ז.  <br>תוספות replies: <br><b>ומסתמא רב אסי ורבי יוחנן אית להו חזקה דריש לקיש דהכי הלכתא כדפסיק בשמעתין –</b><br><b>And it is assumable that רב אסי and ר"י</b> <b>maintain the חזקה</b> <b>of ר"ל</b> that א"א פורע תו"ז <b>for that is the הלכה</b> <b>as our</b> גמרא <b>concludes.</b> Therefore since we do not find explicitly that רב אסי ור"י argue with ר"ל it is assumed that they concur with him.<br>תוספות will offer additional proof that (רב אסי and) ר"י concur[s] with ר"ל.<br><b>ועוד אי לית להו חזקה דריש לקיש א"כ קיימא לן כריש לקיש בארבעה דברים –</b><br><b>And furthermore if</b> ר"י [and רב אסי] <b>do not maintain the</b> חזקה <b>of ר"ל;</b> there would then be a מחלוקת between ר"י ור"ל whether אדם פורע תוך זמנו. Our גמרא rules in favor of ר"ל. This will cause a difficulty <b>for then</b> it would come out that <b>we accept</b> the opinion of <b>ר"ל</b> against the opinion of ר"י <b>in four instances;</b> this dispute being the fourth.<br><b>ובריש החולץ (יבמות דף לו,א ושם) לא פסיק רבא כוותיה אלא בתלת –</b><br><b>And in the beginning of החולץ</b> פרק, <b>רבא</b> <b>did not rule according to</b> ר"ל against ר"י <b>only in three instances;</b> our case of תו"ז is not included in the three. If ר"י argues with ר"ל concerning תוך זמנו, and our גמרא rules in favor of ר"ל, then רבא should have mentioned a fourth case wherein we rule according to ר"ל against ר"י. The fact that רבא omits this case proves that ר"י does not argue with ר"ל concerning תו"ז.<br>תוספות anticipates a further difficulty with this proof. Perhaps ר"י does argue with ר"ל concerning תו"ז. However רבא does not mentioned this as a fourth case where the הלכה is like ר"ל and not like ר"י (even though our גמרא clearly maintains that the הלכה is like ר"ל). The reason is because רבא cannot say that the הלכה is like ר"ל by תו"ז; תוספות addresses this issue:<br><b>אף על גב דרבא ודאי פליג אריש לקיש בשמעתין –</b><br><b>Even though רבא</b> <b>certainly argues on ר"ל in our גמרא.</b> He definitely cannot maintain that the הלכה is like ר"ל and not like זמנו בתוך ר"י since he himself argues with ר"ל and maintains the view of ר"י. We therefore have no conclusive evidence that ר"י maintains א"א פורע תו"ז. Perhaps that is why he maintains that you may not collect from יתמי קטני. However what proof is there that if the הלכה is like ר"ל nevertheless one cannot collect from יתמי קטני?<br>תוספות responds that we cannot say that ר"ל ור"י argue over תו"ז for then the הלכה would be like ר"ל in four places not only the three that רבא mentions. Even though we understand why רבא does not mention this as a fourth instance –<br><b>מכל מקום גם לדידן מוכח<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not inform us how it is evident. See קכד אות בל"י.</i> דלא קיימא לן כריש לקיש אלא בתלת –</b><br><b>Nevertheless it is evident that even we</b> who follow the opinion of ר"ל concerning תו"ז; <b>that we do not follow</b> the opinion <b>of ר"ל</b> against ר"י <b>only in</b> the <b>three</b> cases (that רבא mentions), therefore it is obvious that ר"ל ור"י agree that א"א פורע תו"ז, and nevertheless ר"י ורב אסי agree that a מלוה can never collect יתמי קטני מנכסי even if it is תוך זמנו (unless רבית אוכלת בהם).<br>תוספות mentioned previously<sup class="footnote-marker">36</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 31.</i> that the סוגיא in ערכין wherein רב אסי ור"י made their statements, follows the view of צררי and not the view of רב פפא. Our תוספות anticipates a difficulty with this assumption:<br><b>ובפרק ד' וה' (בבא קמא דף לט,א ושם) דפריך לרבי יוחנן דאמר מעליית יתומים –</b><br><b>And in פרק ד' וה' where</b> the גמרא <b>challenges</b> the view <b>of</b> ר"י <b>who maintains</b> that if a מועד ox of the יתומים estate gored another ox we collect for the damages <b>from the assets of the יתומים.</b> The גמרא challenges this ruling for ר"י contradicts himself –<br><b>והאמר רבי יוחנן אין נזקקין לנכסי יתומים אלא לכתובת אשה –</b><br><b>For ר"י maintains we do not assign from the assets of the יתומים</b> for collection <b>only</b> for the purpose of giving <b>a woman her כתובה.</b> Why do we collect from the נכסי יתומים for the goring of their ox? This concludes the quote from the גמרא. תוספות proceeds to explain the difficulty with what was previously mentioned –<br><b>אף על גב דקיימא לן דטעמא הוי משום צררי והתם בשור שנגח לא שייך צררי –</b><br><b>Even though we established that the reason</b> we do not collect from יתומים is <b>because of צררי</b> and not because of נינהו מצוה מיעבד בני לאו יתמי; therefore the s'גמרא question is not understood, <b>for there,</b> by the case where <b>the ox</b> that belonged to their estate <b>gored,</b> and <b>ר"י</b> obligated them to pay from their estate, the concern of <b>צררי is not applicable</b>, for the liability was incurred after the father died. It would seem that if the only concern is <b>צררי</b> the <b>יתומים</b> should be liable. How can the <b>גמרא</b> compare the case of <b>שור שנגח</b> to the case of a loan that was made to the father?<br><b>תוספות</b> replies:<br><b>מכל מקום פריך שפיר דרבי יוחנן אית ליה אין נזקקין בכל ענין –</b><br><b>Nevertheless</b> even though the reason of צררי is not applicable by שנגח שור, <b>the</b> s'גמרא <b>question is proper for ר"י maintains</b> that we never <b>assess</b> the assets of יתומים <b>in any event –</b><br><b>אפילו במלוה הבא מחמת עצמו דלא שייך צררי –</b><br><b>even by a loan which was generated by</b> the יתום <b>himself;</b> the יתום borrowed the money <b>where</b> the concern <b>of</b> צררי <b>is not applicable;</b> nevertheless one cannot collect יתמי מנכסי, this is on account of –<br><b>מטעם דאין מקבלין עדות שלא בפני בעל דין:</b><br><b>The reason; for</b> בי"ד <b>does not accept testimony in the absence of the</b> opposing <b>litigant.</b> קטנים, as mentioned earlier in תוספות, are considered שלא בפני בע"ד.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות maintains that (according to רב פפא and) even according to ר"ה בדר"י one cannot collect from יתומים קטנים even if the לוה died תו"ז. The reason is because by יתומים קטנים we are concerned for צררי even תו"ז. We find a (similar) חשש of צררי תו"ז by an אלמנה.The proof that we do not collect מיתמי קטני תו"ז is: a) from the fact that the גמרא did not reconcile רב אסי and the משנה of שום היתומים, by saying that the משנה is discussing a case of תו"ז; and b) from the statements of רב אסי and ר"י which limit the collection from יתמי קטני to the instances of רבית אוכלת בהם and כתובת אשה exclusively; but no other – including תו"ז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. If יתמי קטני are included in the rule of 'אין מקבלין עדות שלא בפני בע"ד', why is it necessary for ר"ה בדר"י to offer the reason of צררי?<sup class="footnote-marker">37</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 12. See נח"מ בד"ה משום.</i><br>2. Why does תוספות find it necessary<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 24</i> to offer a second explanation as to why the גמרא did not say that the נפק"מ between פ"ר and ר"ה בדר"י is in a case of מית לוה בתוך הזמן?<br>3. What proof is there from the fact that the גמרא did not answer that the משנה is discussing a case where מית לוה קודם זמן; perhaps that גמרא holds that אדם פורע תו"ז?<sup class="footnote-marker">39</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 30. See מהרש"א.</i>
<b>אף על גב דאמור רבנן הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים כולי—Even though the רבנן said; ‘he who comes to collect from the assets of orphans, etc.’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our גמרא and others refer to a well-known ruling that הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים לא יפרע אלא בשבועה. Our תוספות is searching for the source of this ruling in a משנה.<br>--------------------------<br><b>ותניא נמי בפרק הכותב (כתובות דף פז,א ושם) –</b><br><b>And it is also stated in a ברייתא</b> <b>in פרק הכותב</b> <b>–</b><br><b>אבל מה אעשה שהרי אמרו חכמים הבא ליפרע כולי –</b><br><b>‘However what can I do, for the</b> חכמים <b>stated:</b> that <b>he who comes to collect, etc.</b> from יתומים must swear’. The fact that this ruling is quoted in a ברייתא preceded by the phrase שהרי אמרו חכמים –<br><b>משמע שהיא משנה בשום מקום<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">From the fact that our גמרא states אע"ג דאמור רבנן, there is no strong indication that it is a משנה, it could be a ruling of תנאים in a ברייתא or even of previous אמוראים However since this ruling is quoted in a ברייתא, as a known ruling, that would indicate that the original source is a משנה.</i> –</b><br><b>indicates that it is a</b> quote from a <b>משנה</b> <b>somewhere.</b> The ברייתא is quoting a known ruling. Such a universal ruling would be stated in a משנה.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה היכא אמרו חכמים דמאלמנה ליכא למילף דשאני אלמנה דאית לה בתנאי בית דין –</b><br><b>And</b> this <b>is puzzling;</b> for <b>where have the</b> חכמים <b>stated</b> this ruling in a משנה.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Our תוספות is aware that there is a משנה in (פז,א) כתובות which states that an אלמנה cannot collect from the יתומים אלא בשבועה, however we cannot use אלמנה as a source that by other obligations as well one must swear to collect from נכסי יתומים; as תוספות continues -</i> <b>For we cannot derive</b> this ruling of הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים לא יפרע אלא בשבועה, from the case <b>of אלמנה, for</b> אלמנה <b>is different</b> from other debts and obligations, <b>for</b> she is owed the כתובה <b>by</b> virtue <b>of a stipulation of בי"ד;</b> it is not a self-imposed obligation as other debts are.<br><b>וחיישינן לצררי טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוספות ד"ה ואפילו (footnote # 17) at length.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> therefore by אלמנה <b>we are more concerned about</b> the possibility <b>of צררי;</b> that the husband may have presented her (while he was alive) with a bundle of valuables to cover his כתובה obligation. Therefore she must swear. However by a regular loan since the מלוה is holding the שטר, there may be no need for a שבועה. Where then is the Mishnaic source for the ruling that 'הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים וכו?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק מדתנן בפרק הכותב (שם דף פד,א) גבי מי שמת והניח אשה ובעל חוב –</b><br><b>And the ר"י said that the source is from the משנה in פרק הכותב which states concerning one who died and left over</b> debts to his <b>wife</b> (כתובה) <b>and/or a creditor</b> to whom he owed a loan –<br><b>והיה לו מלוה ופקדון ביד אחרים כולי יתנו ליורשים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This opinion is stated there in the name of רבי עקיבא.</i> –</b><br><b>And he possessed either a loan or a deposit by others, etc.</b> He was a creditor as well; he was owed money. The question is how these owed assets should be distributed; should they be given to the wife for her כתובה or to the מלוה for his loan, etc. The משנה states that these owed assets <b>should be given to the heirs;</b> not to the אשה ובעל חוב. The reason is as the משנה there continues –<br><b>שכולם צריכים שבועה ואין היורשין צריכין שבועה –</b><br><b>For all</b> the creditors <b>require an oath</b> to collect from the assets of the deceased (which belong to the heirs), <b>however the heirs are not required to swear</b> in order to collect their inheritance. We see from that משנה that both the אלמנה and the (מלוה) בעל חוב cannot collect from the estate of the יורשים--יתומים unless they swear.<br>תוספות offers an additional source:<br><b>ועוד תנן בשבועות (דף מה,א) וכן היתומים מן היתומים<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there states that יתומים collect only with a שבועה. The גמרא clarifies that the משנה cannot mean that יתומים cannot collect from the לוה only with a שבועה, for if the מלוה can collect without a שבועה so should the יתומים be able to collect without a שבועה. Therefore the גמרא concludes that it means that יתומים cannot collect from the יתומים without a שבועה (see ‘Appendix’).</i> לא יפרעו אלא בשבועה וכולי –</b><br><b>And furthermore we learnt in a</b> משנה <b>in</b> מסכת <b>שבועות; and similarly orphans</b> of the creditor who wish to collect <b>from the orphans</b> of the debtor <b>they may not collect unless they swear, etc.;</b> Even though they have a שטר that the deceased debtor owed their deceased father money. What do the creditor’s orphans swear? The משנה continues –<br><b>שלא מצינו בין שטרותיו של אבא ששטר זה פרוע –</b><br><b>‘That we have not found among the documents of</b> our deceased <b>father that this note was paid’ –<br>אלמא גם האב היה נשבע שאינו פרוע –</b><br><b>We derive</b> from this <b>that the</b> (creditor) <b>father would also have to swear that</b> the note <b>was not paid up.</b> If the father would be able to collect from the יתומים of the לוה without a שבועה, why impose a שבועה on his children?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 5.</i> They should inherit his right of collection! The fact that they are required to swear proves that their father would not be able to collect without an oath; therefore we allow them to collect only if they swear.<br>תוספות concludes:<br><b>מכאן משמע שאם הוציא שטר חוב על חבירו ואמר ליה אישתבע לי דלא פרעתיך בגו זימניה –</b><br><b>it seems from this</b> גמרא <b>that if one presented a note against his friend;</b> stating that he owes him money <b>and</b> the לוה <b>said to</b> the מלוה <b>swear before me that I did not pay you before the due date,<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">If the לוה requests that the מלוה take an oath that he was not paid after the due date, then the מלוה must swear, even if he has a (מקוים) שטר. See שבועות מא,א.</i></b> the דין would be that the מלוה –<br><b>אין צריך לעשות שבועה:</b><br><b>is not required to take this oath.</b> If the דין would be that the לוה can force the מלוה to take this oath, then by יתומים the מלוה would also be required to take the oath even if the לוה died תוך זמנו and the יתומים are not requesting this oath. The דין is that בי"ד presents on behalf of the יתומים any claim that their father could have claimed. If the father can demand a שבועה תו"ז, then בי"ד would do the same for the יתומים. The fact, that the גמרא concludes that the מלוה does not swear for the יתומים תו"ז, proves that the father cannot demand such an oath either.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Appendix’.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ruling of 'הבא ליפרע מנכסי יתומים לא יפרע אלא בשבועה' can be derived either from the משנה in כתובות where it states that the בע"ח needs to swear, or from the משנה in שבועות where it states that the יתומים of the מלוה need to swear in order to collect from the יתומים of the לוה.<br>One cannot demand that the מלוה swear that שלא פרעתיך תו"ז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות maintains that we can derive that the לוה cannot make the מלוה swearשלא פרעתיך תו"ז, from the fact that the מלוה does not swear to the יתומים תו"ז. Seemingly there is a difference. By the יתומים there is only a טענת שמא, perhaps the loan was paid. Therefore the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז negates the שבועה. However by the לוה himself, since it is a טענת ברי perhaps he could require the מלוה to swear שלא פרעתיך תו"ז!<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See ראש סי' ט  עי' בבל"י ועוד.</i><br>Appendix<br>It is not clear what is the connection between the end of תוספות concerning a בתו"ז שבועה with the beginning of תוספות concerning the source from where we derive the rule that 'הבא ליפרע וכו.<br>Perhaps one can say (לחידודא עכ"פ) that תוספות anticipated and (partially) resolved the question addressed in ‘Thinking it over’. The second משנה that תוספות cited as a source for 'הבא ליפרע' is that היתומים מן היתומים לא יפרעו אלא בשבועה. The actual משנה states בשבועה אלא יפרעו לא היתומים; however the גמרא questions what it means. It cannot mean that the יתומים cannot collect from the לוה without a שבועה, for since the מלוה can collect without a שבועה, so too the יתומים should be able to collect without a שבועה. [Therefore it must mean that היתומים מן היתומים לא יפרעו אלא בשבועה.]<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> However one may challenge the assumption of the גמרא, that the משנה cannot be discussing a case of הלוה היתומים מן. Perhaps there is a difference between הלוה מן המלוה where no שבועה is required and הלוה מן היתומים where a שבועה is required. When the מלוה claims that the לוה owes money it is a טענת ברי, therefore no שבועה is required. However when the יתומים want to collect from the לוה, there is no טענת ברי; it is possible that the לוה repaid the loan unbeknown to the יתומים. Why therefore does the גמרא assume that since the מלוה does not require a שבועה, the same applies for the יתומים?!<br>From the fact that the גמרא does not make this difference, we see that גמרא maintains that the יתומים have the same טענת ברי as their father. The טענינן of בי"ד on behalf of the יתומים (that the loan is owed), has the same ודאות as the father’s claim. Therefore by the יתומים it is also considered a טענת ברי and no שבועה is required. The source of הבא ליפרע is based (according to this source) on the assumption that טענינן ליתומים is considered a טענת ברי.<br>Similarly in our case if the father would be able to demand a שבועה תו"ז, this טענה would automatically be transferred to the יתומים as a טענת ודאי. This would seemingly answer the question posed in ‘Thinking it over’.<br>However the question in ‘Thinking it over’ may still remain. We cannot compare the two cases. By הלוה מן (היתומים מן) היתומים the יתומים have a שטר that supports their claim, therefore that טענינן is considered a טענת ודאי. In our case however the יתומים have no support for the טענה of פרעתיך תו"ז; on the contrary the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז contradicts such a claim. Perhaps in such a case there is a difference between a טענת ברי and the טענינן of בי"ד which is not a טענת ברי.<br>ודו"ק 

Line 7

<b>מי אמרינן במקום חזקה מה לי לשקר או לא—Do we say in the face of a חזקה; ‘why would I lie’, or not.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא queries: in a case where there is a חזקה that contradicts a claim, and a מיגו that supports the claim, which is stronger; the מיגו that supports the claim or the חזקה that denies it. Specifically the case involves where the לוה claims פרעתיך תו"ז, however he could have claimed פרעתיך בזמני, is this מיגו strong enough to offset the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז. Our תוספות attempts to resolve this query, however these attempts (but one) are refuted.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה הרב יצחק בר מרדכי והא הך חזקה עדיפא משטר –</b><br><b>The ם"ריב presented a difficulty</b> with this query. <b>For this</b> חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז <b>is stronger than a note;</b> the חזקה enables the מלוה to collect better than a שטר can. תוספות explains how this is so –<br><b>דבשטר אינו גובה אלא בשבועה ובהך חזקה גובה בלא שבועה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that we may (even) be discussing a חזקה without a שטר; there are עדים that it is תו"ז of the loan. See תוס' ה,א ד"ה ובא.</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> if the מלוה possesses <b>a</b> שטר <b>he cannot collect</b> from the יתומים (or שלא בפניו) <b>unless</b> he takes <b>an oath</b> that the money is owed; however <b>with this חזקה</b> of א"א פורע תו"ז, the מלוה <b>collects</b> from the יתומים <b>without an oath;</b> if their father died תו"ז, as the גמרא previously stated –<br><b>ואם כן מאי קא מיבעיא ליה הא פשיטא דמיגו במקום עדים לא אמרינן –</b><br><b>And since this is so</b> (that this חזקה is stronger than a שטר), <b>what is his query</b> if a מיגו of מה לי לשקר is stronger than this חזקה? It certainly cannot be stronger than this חזקה. For <b>this is obvious that we do not say that a מיגו</b> can be believed <b>in the face of witnesses</b> who testify against the litigant who has the מיגו.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">If one of the litigants presents a claim for which he has a מיגו that supports it; however the other litigant presents witnesses that contradict his claim; he is certainly not believed; despite that he has a מיגו. עדים are the strongest validation and proof. The strength of a שטר is the עדים that sign on it. A שטר can therefore be considered as עדים. It follows therefore that if there is a מיגו against a שטר it will not be believed since it is a מיגו במקום עדים.</i> We have just surmised that שטר is weaker than the חזקה, for with the שטר he cannot collect מיתמי without a שבועה. Therefore if we cannot say a מיגו במקום שטר, then –<br><b>כל שכן במקום חזקה דעדיפא טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">It cannot be presumed at all that the ם"ריב maintained that חזקה is stronger than עדים! Therefore it is likely that the ם"ריב presumes that מיגו במקום שטר לא אמרינן, since עדים are backing the שטר. It follows then that if חזקה is stronger than שטר, we cannot say מיגו במקום חזקה.</i> –</b><br><b>certainly</b> we cannot believe a מגו <b>when it defies</b> this <b>חזקה</b> of א"א פורע תו"ז <b>which is more preferable</b> than the שטר, for it enables one to collect from יתומים without a שבועה.<br>To summarize: The חזקה is stronger than the שטר. The strength of the שטר is the עדים. We do not say מיגו במקום עדים (or במקום שטר); therefore we should certainly not say מיגו במקום חזקה which is stronger than the שטר. Why is the גמרא inquiring whether אמרינן מיגו במקום חזקה or not.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלא קשה כלל דודאי עדים עדיפי מחזקה –</b><br><b>And the ר"י</b> <b>says that</b> there <b>is no difficulty at all, for it is certain that עדים</b> <b>are preferable to חזקה</b> –<br><b>דאי אמרי שפרעו אפילו בתוך הזמן פטור –</b><br><b>for if</b> עדים <b>testify that</b> the לוה <b>paid</b> the מלוה <b>even within the</b> allotted <b>time;</b> before the due date, the לוה will be <b>exempt</b> from paying the loan, even though there is a חזקה that he did not pay, nevertheless the עדים that testify that he paid are stronger than the חזקה –<br><b>ואי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> אמרי אפילו אחר זמן ידענו שלא פרעו היה גובה מן היתומים בלא שבועה –</b><br><b>And if</b> the עדים <b>testify even after the time; we know that</b> the לוה <b>did not pay</b> the מלוה, the מלוה <b>would collect from the</b> יתומים <b>without a שבועה.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The assumption that חזקה is stronger than the עדים (of the שטר) is incorrect. עדים are stronger than חזקה. Whatever חזקה can accomplish (such as collecting from יתומים תו"ז without a שבועה), the עדים can accomplish more. They enable the מלוה to collect from the יתומים even לאחר זמנו without a שבועה. Whenever the חזקה and עדים conflict we follow the testimony of the עדים against the חזקה. When עדים testify that he paid תו"ז, the מלוה cannot collect (even from the לוה). Therefore from the fact that we do not say מיגו במקום עדים we cannot derive that we do not say מיגו במקום חזקה, for עדים are stronger than חזקה.</i></b><br>תוספות continues:<br><b>ומה שצריך שבועה ביש לו שטר זהו לפי שאינו מוכיח מתוך השטר אם פרע ואם לאו –</b><br><b>And</b> the reason why the מלוה <b>is required to swear</b> when he attempts to collect from the יתומים <b>when he has a שטר;<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly if when there is a חזקה he collects without a שבועה, so by a שטר which has the power of עדים he should certainly be able to collect without a שבועה (since תוספות concluded that עדים are stronger than חזקה). </i> that is because it is not</b> totally <b>evident from the</b> שטר <b>itself if</b> the לוה <b>paid or not.</b> The עדים on the שטר testify that there was a loan. They do not testify whether it was paid or not. Therefore there are no עדים that testify that this loan is still owed. That is why a שבועה is required. The fact that the מלוה is holding the שטר is not conclusive evidence that the לוה still owes the money –<br><b>דזימנין דזייר ליה אפשיטי דספרא כדאמרינן בפרק קמא דבבא מציעא (דף יז,א.) –</b><br><b>For occasionally the מלוה will retain</b> the שטר even if it was paid up<b>, on account of the coins that</b> are due <b>the scribe</b> for writing up the שטר <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>states in the first</b> פרק <b>of ב"מ.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">It is the responsibility of the לוה to pay for the scribe’s work. Occasionally the לוה is even lacking the few coins necessary to pay the סופר. The מלוה agrees to lay out these monies, but will not return the paid up שטר to the לוה, until the לוה repays the פשיטי דספרא. When the מלוה holds the שטר it is not comparable to עדים testifying that he owes money. There is always the concern that the loan was paid. Therefore he cannot collect from the יתומים without a שבועה. It is not a weakness in the דין of עדים; rather it is a weakness in the proof of holding the שטר. It is possible that we do say מיגו במקום שטר.</i></b><br>תוספות asks a different question:<b><br>אך קשה דמכל מקום תפשוט דלא אמרינן מיגו במקום חזקה מדרמי בר חמא –</b><br><b>However, there is a difficulty, that notwithstanding</b> what was previously said concerning עדים and a שטר the גמרא <b>should resolve</b> this query <b>that we do not believe a מיגו</b> <b>against a חזקה;</b> we can derive this <b>from רב"ח –<br>דאמר בפרק כל הנשבעין (שבועות דף מה,ב ושם) המפקיד אצל חבירו בשטר –<br>Who ruled in פרק כל הנשבעין, one who deposits</b> something <b>by his friend with a note</b> stating that he deposited a specific item; the דין is –<br><b>צריך להחזיר לו (בשטר)<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This is amended to read 'בעדים'.</i> –</b><br><b>The</b> נפקד <b>is required to return</b> the deposited item to its original owner <b>in the presence of witnesses.</b> If he has no witnesses that he returned the item; and the depositor shows the פקדון שטר, the recipient of the deposit –<br><b>ולא מהימן לומר החזרתי לך במיגו דאי בעי אמר דנאנסו –</b><br><b>is not believed to say I returned</b> the פקדון <b>to you,</b> even though he has a <b>מיגו that he could have claimed they were accidentally</b> lost or stolen, etc. Had he claimed נאנסו he would be פטור from paying, provided that he swears the שבועת השומרים. Nevertheless now that he claims החזרתי לך, he is not believed (even with a שבועה); rather he must pay for the פקדון.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See בשטר ה"ד ב,מה שבועות תוספות for different interpretations of s'רב"ח ruling. This תוספות seems to follow the view of the (לקמן עא,א ד"ה אמר רבא) רשב"ם. See 'נחלת משה וכו.</i> The reason the מיגו is not effective, is –<br><b>משום דמצי אמר ליה שטרך בידי מאי בעי –</b><br><b>Because</b> the depositor <b>can say to</b> the recipient; <b>what is your</b> שטר <b>doing in my hand;</b> if you had returned it to me I would have returned the שטר פקדון to you, so how come I still have the שטר. The fact that the שטר is in the possession of the בעל הפקדון proves that the שומר did not return the פקדון. This concludes the citation from the גמרא in שבועות. We see from that גמרא that a מיגו is not effective against the claim of שטרך בידי מאי בעי. This claim of שטרך בידי מאי בעי is conclusive evidence that the בעל השטר is owed (money). If the מיגו is not effective against the שטר –<br><b>וכל שכן דלא אמר מיגו במקום חזקה –</b><br><b>Then certainly a מיגו</b> <b>cannot be effective against the חזקה</b> of א"א פורע תו"ז –<br><b>דחזקה עדיפא דאין צריך שבועה וטעמא דשטרך בידי מאי בעי לא מהני לפוטרו משבועה –</b><br><b>For the חזקה</b> of א"א פורע תו"ז <b>is more effective</b> than a שטר; since with the חזקה, the מלוה <b>is not required to swear</b> to collect from the יתומים <b>however the claim of שטרך בידי מאי בעי is not sufficient to exempt</b> the מלוה <b>from a שבועה</b> if he wishes to collect from the יתומים. <sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">רמי בר חמא taught us that the טענה of בעי מאי בידי שטרך is stronger than a מיגו. The חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז is stronger than בעי מאי בידי שטרך as evidenced by the fact that חזקה exempts from a שבועה and the שטר does not. If there is no מיגו במקום שטר then there is certainly no מיגו במקום חזקה. What is the איבעיא of the גמרא (according to רב"ח)?! See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2. In the קשיא of the ם"ריב it was assumed that a שטר is equivalent to עדים. We know that the חזקה is stronger than a שטר alone, regarding the שבועה for יתומים. It is also known that מיגו במקום עדים לא אמרינן. If we equate שטר with עדים, and חזקה is stronger than שטר, therefore if אמרינן לא (שטר) מיגו במקום עדים then לא אמרינן מיגו במקום חזקה. This question was negated that a שטר is not עדים. However רב"ח says distinctly that מיגו במקום שטר לא אמרינן, then for sure מיגו במקום חזקה לא אמרינן, since חזקה is definitely stronger than שטר.</i><br>תוספות offers a possible response:<br><b>ושמא סוגיא דהכא לא סברה כרמי בר חמא –</b><br><b>And perhaps the</b> גמרא <b>here</b> that inquires whether אמרינן מיגו במקום חזקה or not, <b>does not agree with רב"ח;</b> it may maintain that a שטר מיגו במקום may be valid. If the שומר claims החזרתי במיגו דנאנסו he may be believed (with a שבועה). Therefore the גמרא inquires as to what the דין is by a מיגו במקום חזקה.<br>תוספות will offer other places where there is a discussion concerning מיגו במקום חזקה; however they are not relevant to our discussion here:<br><b>ולא דמי כלל לההוא דפרק<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This is amended to read דקדושין פרק האומר</i> האומר (דף סד,ב ושם) דאמר היכא דמוחזק לן דאית ליה אחים –</b><br><b>And</b> our גמרא <b>is not at all comparable to that</b> גמרא <b>in [</b>מסכת <b>קדושין] פרק האומר, where</b> the גמרא <b>states</b> that in a case <b>where it is known that</b> a married person <b>has brothers,</b> however we are unaware that he has children<b>;</b> which would require his wife to receive either יבום or חליצה upon his death –<br><b>ואמר יש לי בנים דנאמן במיגו דאי בעי פטר לה בגיטא –</b><br><b>And he claimed</b> before he died that <b>‘I have children’</b>. His wife will be פטור from יבום וחליצה if we accept his testimony. However this claim of exempting his wife from יבום goes contrary to the חזקה; until now it was presumed that he had brothers and was childless, which obligates her for יבום, nevertheless the דין is <b>that</b> the husband <b>is believed;</b> upon his death she is פטור מיבום וחליצה. The reason why he is believed against the חזקה that she requires יבום וחליצה is <b>for</b> he has a מיגו<b>, that he could have exempted her</b> from the יבום obligation <b>by</b> giving her <b>a גט.</b> That גמרא seems to maintain that a מיגו is effective against a חזקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">Up to this point she was בחזקת איסור יבמה לשוק. This חזקה contradicts his claim that he has children and therefore she should be החזקת היתר לשוק. We are forced to say that the מיגו במקום חזקה there is not at all similar to our מיגו במקום חזקה. The reason we must say that they are not comparable is because in our גמרא it is questionable whether we say מיגו במקום חזקה and in פרק האומר we believe him with a מיגו במקום חזקה.</i> However תוספות does not explain how the two cases are different.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">One explanation given is as follows: In פרק האומר the fact that he has brothers does not preclude his claim that he has sons, the two are not contradictory, and therefore the מיגו is effective. In our case the חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז   contradicts completely his claim of פרעתי תו"ז, therefore there is a possibility that such a מיגו is not effective (See ם"מהר).</i><br><b>וכן ההיא דהאשה שלום (יבמות דף קטו,א ושם) דבעי החזיקה היא מלחמה בעולם –</b><br><b>And similarly that</b> גמרא <b>in</b> פרק <b>האשה שלום where</b> the גמרא <b>queries</b>: <b>she established that there is a war</b> elsewhere <b>in the world;</b> and she claimed that her husband died there. Is she permitted to remarry or not.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The דין is that if a woman comes from overseas and claims that her husband died, she is permitted to remarry. If however there was a war there, she is not permitted to remarry even though she claims that her husband died. The reason she is not believed in the latter case is because we are concerned that in wartime since so many people died and she cannot find her husband she ‘assumes’ that he died without actually knowing for sure that he died.</i> The גמרא there explains the two sides of the query –<br><b>מי אמר מיגו דאי בעי אמרה שלום בעולם –</b><br><b>Do we say</b> that we should believe her that he died for she has a <b>מיגו, for if she wanted</b> to lie <b>she</b> could <b>have said there is peace in</b> that part of <b>the world</b> where my husband died. If she would have said that, since we are unaware of any war there, she would have been believed, therefore we should believe her now with this מיגו –<br><b>או דלמא כיון דהחזיקה היא ואמרה בדדמי לא אתי מה לי לשקר ומרע לחזקה –</b><br><b>Or perhaps</b> we do not believe her, for <b>once she established</b> that there is war where she claims her husband died and we know that in the time of war she says he died even if in reality <b>she only assumes</b> that he died, therefore <b>this</b> מיגו <b>cannot come</b> and be effective <b>and to weaken the חזקה</b> that in the time of war a woman’s claim is merely a בדדמי – an assumption not an actual testimony.<br><b>ומייתי התם מעין ההיא בעיא לא דמי כלל להך דהכא –</b><br><b>And the</b> גמרא <b>there discusses a similar query as ours;</b> this compels us to say that the query there <b>it is not at all comparable to this</b> query <b>here.</b> If they are similar why mention the query twice; in our גמרא and in יבמות. Again תוספות does not explain (here) why they are not similar.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות in (קט"ו,א ד"ה או) שלום האשה who explains that there the חזקה and the claim do not contradict each other. It is possible that there is a war (and even if she is claiming בדדמי) and yet the husband died. However, here the חזקה and the claim conflict with each other. Therefore no matter how we would resolve the איבעיא here, the איבעיא there in יבמות would remain. If we were to resolve here that מיגו במקום חזקה אמרינן, nevertheless in יבמות we still may not believe the woman since she may be saying a claim of בדדמי; not a טענת ברי as in תו"ז. If we were to resolve that מיגו במקום חזקה לא אמרינן, we still may believe the אשה that her husband died; since the fact that there is a war does not preclude his death.</i><br>תוספות has a different question:<br><b>ומיהו קשה מדתנן ביבמות בפרק בית שמאי (דף קיא,ב) –</b><br><b>However there is a difficulty from what we learnt in a משנה in</b> מסכת <b>יבמות in פרק ב"ש –<br>יבמה שאמרה תוך שלשים יום לא נבעלתי כופין אותו אחר שלשים מבקשים הימנו –</b><br><b>A sister-in-law, who</b> went through the יבום process and was subsequently divorced within thirty days, if she <b>claimed within</b> the first <b>thirty days</b> after the יבום; <b>there was no relationship with me,</b> the יבם did not perform ביאה with me during our marriage and therefore I still require חליצה, since I am still זקוקה ליבום,<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">A יבמה has an איסור to marry anyone but her brother’s –in-law, until she had ביאה or received חליצה from one of her יבמים. Marriage without ביאה is insufficient to remove this איסור.</i> so דין בית <b>forces</b> the יבם to give the יבמה חליצה. However if she complained to ד"בי, when she was divorced <b>after thirty days</b> have passed from the original יבום date, then בי"ד merely <b>requests from him</b> that he should give the חליצה ,יבמה; however בי"ד does not coerce him. This is the משנה.<br><b>ומפרש התם דעד שלשים יום מוקי איניש אנפשיה טפי לא מוקי –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>explains there;</b> why is there a difference whether the divorce took place within thirty days or after thirty days; <b>for up to thirty days</b> when a man is together with a woman <b>a person can control himself,</b> and withhold his temptation to have ביאה. However <b>more</b> than thirty days <b>he cannot control himself</b>, and by that time he will certainly have had ביאה with the יבמה.<br><b>ולכך לאחר שלשים יום אין כופין דלא מהימנא –</b><br><b>And therefore after thirty days</b> have passed since the יבום before she was divorced, and then she comes to complain <b>we do not coerce him</b> to give חליצה for it is assumed that he already had ביאה with his יבמה <b>for</b> the יבמה <b>is not believed.</b> It goes against the חזקה of טפי לא מוקי. A person cannot contain himself for more than thirty days. This ends the quote from the גמרא there.<br>תוספות concludes his question; the woman is not believed חזקה במקום:<br><b>אף על גב דאית לה מיגו דאי בעיא אמרה אינו יכול לבא עלי דנאמנת –</b><br><b>Even though she has a</b> מיגו <b>for if she wanted she</b> could have <b>said</b> <b>he is incapable of having</b> ביאה <b>with me;</b> he is physically dysfunctional. If she would have made such a claim then she would have been believed –<br><b>כדמוכח בסוף נדרים (דף צא,א) :</b><br><b>As it is evident in the end of</b> מסכת <b>נדרים</b> that a woman is believed to claim אינו יכול לבוא עלי.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The question is that there in יבמות there is a מיגו במקום חזקה; the חזקה is that a person will be בועל by thirty days which contradicts her claim of לא נבעלתי. On the other hand she should be believed that לא נבעלתי since she has a מיגו of אינו יכול לבוא עלי. The משנה there rules that she is not believed. That proves that במקום חזקה לא אמרינן מיגו. Why therefore is there an איבעיא in our גמרא if אמרינן מיגו במקום חזקה או לא?!</i> תוספות does not answer this question.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ בד"ה ומיהו. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The חזקה of א"א פורע תו"ז is stronger than שטר (because a שטר cannot prove conclusively that the loan was not paid); however it is not stronger than עדים. Our גמרא seemingly maintains that a מיגו may be valid against a שטר (in opposition to רב"ח) The איבעיא here is where the חזקה and טענה directly contradict each other; otherwise we may say מיגו במקום חזקה. By a יבמה we do not believe a מיגו against a חזקה, which seems to conflict with the query here.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות offers two proofs that עדים are stronger than חזקה. Why are both proofs required?<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i><br>2. How does תוספות compare the פקדון שטר of רב"ח to a שטר מלוה of our גמרא?<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> By a מלוה שטר a שבועה is required by יתומים since we are concerned that the מלוה retained the שטר because of the פשיטי דספרי (it is possible that a מיגו would be believed against a מלוה שטר); however by a שטר פקדון, the מפקיד pays for the שטר; there is no פשיטי דספרי, therefore the טענה of שטרך בידי מאי בעי is sufficiently strong to negate the מיגו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ בד"ה מדרמי.</i><br>3. If we were to assume in our גמרא that we do say מיגו במקום חזקה, would that necessarily mean that מיגו is stronger than חזקה? How can this possibly answer תוספות last question from יבמה?<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18.</i><br>4. Differentiate between the various חזקות and מגו that תוספות discusses.

<b>ואמר לו פרעתיך בזמני אמאי לא כולי—And he said to him; ‘I paid you on time’, why is he not</b> believed<b>, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא attempted to prove from our משנה that מיגו במקום חזקה לא אמרינן. For if he claimed פרעתי בזמני there is no reason why it is בחזקת שלא נתן. The משנה must be teaching us that if he claimed פרעתי תו"ז he is not believed even though he has a מיגו of פרעתיך בזמני, since it is a מיגו במקום חזקה.<br>The גמרא deflected this proof; the משנה is not discussing the issue of תו"ז at all. He is not believed on account of 'מי יימר וכו.<br>When refuting a resolution of an איבעיא it is preferable that the refutation maintain the exact opposite opinion<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our case: מיגו במקום חזקה אמרינן.</i> from that which we were trying to prove originally.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">In our case: מיגו במקום חזקה לא אמרינן. </i> Then there remain two equal and opposite positions; maintaining the original status quo of the איבעיא.<br>If however we merely deflect the proof, by maintaining that we can avoid the issue entirely,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In our case: saying 'מי יימר וכו'.</i> then there is no equal balance. There is the original proof which maintains one side of the issue; however there is no counterbalance. Indicating perhaps that the refutation is merely a deflection; but in essence we are biased towards the original proof since we cannot offer an interpretation that maintains the opposite view.<br>תוספות will contend that the גמרא could have refuted the proof by maintaining the opposite opinion; instead of the actual deflection which merely avoids the issue.<br>-----------------------<br>תוספות offers an alternate refutation of the proof:<br><b>הוה מצי לשנויי הא דקתני בחזקת שלא נתן –</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have answered that which the</b> משנה <b>states that it is presumed that he did not give</b> his share in the wall –<br><b>היינו בתוך זמנו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> או בזמנו ואמר פרעתיך בתוך הזמן דליכא מיגו כדפרישית לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' (ה,א) ד"ה ובא, בסופו.</i> –</b><br><b>That is</b> in a case where the claim and the response was made <b>within the time;</b> before the monies were due, <b>or</b> (even) that this exchange took place <b>on the date</b> it was due; in either of these two cases <b>if the</b> defendant <b>said I paid you before the</b> due <b>date</b> he is not believed<b>.</b> In both these cases it is understood why the defendant is not believed <b>for there is no מיגו</b> of פרעתיך בזמני<b>.</b> If the exchange too place before the due date, there is certainly no מיגו of פרעתיך בזמני, since it is before the due date. Even if the exchange took place on the due date there is still no מיגו of פרעתיך היום <b>as I previously explained;</b> a person does not have the חוצפה to lie and claim that I paid you today.<br><b>אבל לאחר זמנו הוי בחזקת שנתן דבמקום חזקה אמרינן מה לי לשקר<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We are now establishing that the משנה is discussing a case where the תביעה was זמנו תוך (or בזמנו). It is only then that he is not believed. We can therefore infer from this משנה that if the תביעה was זמנו לאחר he will always be believed even if he claims תו"ז פרעיך; for חזקה במקום מיגו אמרינן. See ‘Overview’. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –</b><br><b>However</b> if the claim was made <b>after the</b> due <b>date,</b> then <b>it would be presumed that he paid</b> for his share in the wall even if he claims פרעתיך תו"ז <b>for we do say ‘why would I lie’</b> even <b>in a place</b> where the claim contradicts a <b>חזקה</b> of א"א פורע תוך זמנו. We do say מיגו במקום חזקה.<br>תוספות maintains that the גמרא could have explained that the reason he is not believed is because there is no מיגו (since it took place 'וכו זמנו תוך), however if there would be a מיגו (if it were לאחר זמנו) he would be believed. Why indeed did the גמרא not give this answer? תוספות continues:<br><b>אך ניחא ליה לשנויי התם מימר אמר מי יימר דמחייבי לי רבנן דלא תיקשי נמי לאביי ולרבא:</b><br><b>However</b> the גמרא <b>prefers to answer</b> differently;<b></b> that <b>there</b> in our משנה the defendant <b>does surely say, ‘who says that the</b> רבנן <b>will hold me liable’.</b> The reason the גמרא prefers this answer<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Even though that according to this interpretation we cannot infer from the משנה that מיגו במקום חזקה אמרינן. Seemingly this is a weakness in the refutation of the original proof (see ‘Overview’).</i> as opposed to the answer תוספות proposed is <b>so that you should not</b> <b>also have a question on אביי ורבא;</b> who maintain that אדם פורע תוך זמנו. According to them seemingly the defendant should always be believed even if he claims that he paid זמנו תוך. If we were to give תוספות interpretation of the משנה, there would be a question on אביי ורבא, why is he not believed!<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא in fact asked this very same question on ה,ב.</i> Therefore the גמרא answered that the ruling of our משנה disregards the whole issue of פורע תו"ז. Rather, the reason it is בחזקת שלא נתן, for the defendant himself is not sure that he is liable. A person does not pay money, if he is not sure that he owes it.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא could have refuted this proof by maintaining that the משנה is discussing a case where the claim and response took place תו"ז However it would pose a difficulty for אביי ורבא who maintain אדם פורע תו"ז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the meaning that the claim was made תו"ז?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4. See מהר"ם.</i><br>Why does תוספות add 'אבל לאחר זמנו וכו'; how is this relevant?<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’, footnote # 6.</i>
