<b>והוא דקרו ליה בית כור—Provided that they call it בית כור<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A בית כור literally is the size of a field that a כור of grain can be planted there. A כור contains thirty סאה. A בית סאה is a plot of fifty by fifty אמות, for a total of twenty five hundred (2,500) square אמות. A בית כור is thirty times as large equaling seventy five thousand (75,000) square אמות. [It measures approximately a square 273.86 אמות on each side.] Despite this, it is obvious that any field can be given the name 'בית כור' regardless of its size.</i> </b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא teaches us that if a buyer offers to sell a בית כור to a seller, and instead gives him a smaller land that is called בית כור it is a valid sale, provided that people call this property בית כור. Our תוספות will be discussing a few issues; a) was the buyer aware that there is a field called בית כור; b) was the buyer aware of the size of the negotiated field; and finally c) how much did the buyer pay; for a complete בית כור or for less than a בית כור.<br>--------------------------<br>תוספות makes an additional proviso:<br><b>וכגון שהלוקח יודע שיש לו קרקע שקרוי בית כור<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It seems from תוספות that the sale is valid, even if the buyer is unaware that the field being negotiated for resale is called בית כור.</i> –</b><br><b>And for instance that the buyer is aware that</b> the seller <b>owns a</b> piece of <b>land which is</b> commonly <b>called</b> by everyone <b>בית כור.</b> It is only in this case, that the sale is valid. תוספות explains his point:<br><b>דאם לא כן הרי הטעהו    –</b><br><b>for if it were not so;</b> if the buyer is not aware that the seller owns a (small) field that is called בית כור, then even if the seller owns such a field, nevertheless it is not a valid sale. The reason the sale is not valid <b>for</b> the seller <b>misled him.</b> The seller offered to sell him a בית כור. The buyer was not aware that the seller owned a property that was commonly called בית כור. The buyer was under the assumption that he would receive a field that was the size of a בית כור. The owner dealt with him dishonestly, therefore the sale is void.<br>תוספות now discusses an additional issue: This ruling that the buyer must be aware that the seller owns a property called בית כור; otherwise the sale is void; this is true –<br><b>ואפילו אם רואה בשעת מכירה שאין שם בית כור –</b><br><b>(and) even if</b> the buyer <b>sees at the time of the sale,</b> that the proposed field for sale <b>does not contain a בית כור;</b> the buyer sees that the intended field is smaller than a בית כור; one might assume that since the buyer is aware of the size of the field and he agreed to buy it, it should be a valid sale regardless of its size. Nevertheless the sale will be void if the buyer is not aware that the owner possesses a field which is called בית כור. The reason the sale is void is because the buyer –<br><b>יכול לומר סבור הייתי שהיית משלים לי בית כור –</b><br><b>is empowered to claim, ‘I was under the impression</b> that even though the negotiated field did not have a בית כור, nevertheless since you told me you were selling me a בית כור, I was sure <b>that you were</b> planning <b>to augment me a</b> complete <b>בית כור;’</b> that in addition to this (small) field, you would give me additional fields, that together would total a בית כור. Therefore if the buyer was not aware that the seller had a field that was called בית כור, even if the negotiated field was less than a בית כור it is a voided sale. However if the buyer is aware that the seller owns a (small) property called בית כור, then the sale is valid even if the buyer did not see the negotiated field.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ונימא דדמים מודיעים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In the משנה later דף עז.ב there is a dispute between ר"י who maintains הדמים מודיעים and the חכמים who maintain אין הדמים ראיה. See, however בל"י אות קנט that the question is even according to the חכמים.</i> –</b><br><b>And if you will say; let the</b> amount of <b>money</b> being paid in this transaction <b>inform</b> us as to the intent of the buyer. If the price paid was for a field less than a בית כור, then the buyer cannot revoke the sale (even if he was not aware that the seller owns a small field called בית כור), for it is obvious that he would receive a small field; that is what he paid for<b><sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that if the price paid was for a field less than a בית כור, however the owner did not possess a field that is called בית כור, then the owner would be required to sell him a field the size of a בית כור, regardless of the price being paid. It is only when the owner possesses a field that is called בית כור that we maintain that it should be a valid sale even if the buyer is unaware that such a field exists; the buyer should have realized that something was amiss since he was being asked such a low price for a בית כור. See בל"י אות קס.</i></b> –<br><b>ואם נתן לו דמי בית כור אפילו קרו ליה בית כור ישלים לו בית כור שלם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This question may be based on the premise that תוספות set forth in the beginning; that if the buyer was misled, there is no sale. Therefore if the buyer paid for a בית כור that is what he should receive; otherwise he is being misled. If we would maintain, however initially, that it is not necessary for the buyer to be aware that the seller owns a property called בית כור, and nevertheless it is a valid sale, for we are not concerned that the seller is being misled; then there would seemingly be no question that the price paid should be our guide. The sale will be valid regardless of the payment as long as the seller possesses a field called בית כור.</i> –</b><br><b>And if</b> the buyer <b>gave</b> the seller <b>the money for a</b> complete <b>בית כור,</b> then <b>even if they call it בית כור</b> (and the buyer is aware that seller owns a field which is called בית כור), nevertheless the seller <b>should</b> be required <b>to supplement</b> his sale until he gives him <b>a complete בית כור</b>, since that is what the buyer paid for.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמיירי כגון דאוזיל גביה ואינו נותן לו אפילו דמי לתך –</b><br><b>And one can say; that we are discussing</b> a case where the seller <b>is lowering the price for this</b> buyer <b>and</b> the buyer is <b>not paying</b> the seller <b>even the price of a לתך</b> (which is half the size of a בית כור) –<br><b>ואי קרו ליה בית כור אפילו אין בו אלא לתך הגיעו –</b><br><b>So if they call</b> the negotiated field a <b>בית כור even if it does not contain but a לתך</b> (half a בית כור) <b>he attained</b> his goal; the sale is valid. The לוקח knew that the מוכר owned a לתך of land called בית כור and he agreed to buy it. In fact he paid less than the price of a לתך.<br><b>ואי לא קרו ליה בית כור חייב לתת לו בית כור שלם –</b><br><b>However if they do not call</b> this לתך field, <b>בית כור</b> (the buyer is not aware of any field being called בית כור), then <b>then</b> the seller <b>is obligated to give to</b> the buyer <b>a complete בית כור.</b> The amount paid is irrelevant. The seller sold the property for a price below market value. Nothing can be determined by looking at the price paid. The seller sold a בית כור; he is required to give the buyer a בית כור. If however the buyer paid market value then the price will determine the validity of the sale.<br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי דלא אוזיל גביה וכגון דנתן לו דמי לתך –</b><br><b>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say; <b>that he did not</b> sell it <b>cheaper</b> to this buyer, but charged him the regular price <b>and for instance that</b> the buyer <b>paid</b> the seller <b>the price of a לתך</b> which is the size of the field that is known as בית כור –<br><b>והשתא אי לא קרו ליה בית כור היה יכול לומר לוקח –</b><br><b>And therefore if they do not call it בית כור</b> the buyer would be able to claim –<br>אם תרצה לתת לי בית כור שלם ולעמוד במקחך עמוד ואם לאו תחזור לי מעותי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This answer rejects תוספות assumption that paying market value price should determine the validity of the sale. The buyer can force the מוכר to return the money and nullify the sale. He cannot however force the מוכר to sell him a בית כור for the price he paid (for a לתך). See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br><b>If you are willing to sell to me a complete בית כור, </b>for the price paid, as was stipulated that a בית כור is being sold, <b>and to stand by the transaction;</b> then <b>stand by it!</b> Give me a complete בית כור. <b>and if not;</b> you do not want to give me a full בית כור; but rather you want me to accept this smaller field which is called בית כור (of which I was never aware), then <b>return my money to me;</b> there is no sale at all!<br><b>אבל אי קרו ליה בית כור הגיעו אף על פי שאין בו אלא לתך:</b><br><b>However if they called</b> this field <b>בית כור</b> and the לוקח was aware of it, then the sale <b>is valid, even though</b> the field <b>is only the size of a לתך.</b> The לוקח knew that the owner owns a small field called בית כור. The לוקח realized that he is paying for the value of a לתך; he has no recourse but to accept this sale.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The case of the valid sale of a field the size of a לתך that is called בית כור is under the following circumstances:<br>The buyer is aware that the seller owns a field that is called בית כור and paid less than the price of a לתך\בית כור; otherwise even if the buyer was aware that the field in question was less than a בית כור the sale is void.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is the לוקח merely required to know that the מוכר owns a field which is called בית כור; or is he also required to know that the field which is called בית כור is actually smaller than a בית כור?<br>2. What is the ruling if the buyer paid the price of a לתך and he did not know that the seller owns property that is called בית כור?<br>3. What is the ruling if the buyer paid the price of a complete בית כור?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות ט בסופו.</i><br>4. Why is it that in his question תוספות only mentions the option if the field is called בית כור; however in both answers תוספות discusses both options whether the field is called בית כור or not?

Daf 7b



Line 1

<b>מר ינוקא—The young master</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא states that מר ינוקא and מר קשישא (the sons of רב חסדא) addressed רב אשי. The word ינוקא and קשישא mean young and old respectively. It seems odd that מר ינוקא (the younger) should be mentioned before מר קשישא (the older).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות הב"ח (א) in כתובות פט,ב.</i> תוספות addresses this issue.<br>--------------------------<br><b>הוא הגדול<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This explains why מר ינוקא is mentioned first (before מר קשישא). See ‘Overview’</i> ועל שם שנולד בינקותו של רב חסדא קרי ליה מר ינוקא –</b><br>מר ינוקא <b>is older</b> than מר קשישא, <b>but he was called מר ינוקא since he was born when רב חסדא was</b> (relatively) <b>young –<br>ומר קשישא הוא הצעיר ונולד בקשישותו של רב חסדא (ועיין רש"י כתובות פט,ב ד"ה מר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רש"י there states that מר ינוקא and מר קשישא actually had the same name; however the older was referred to as מר קשישא and the younger as מר ינוקא.</i>):</b><br><b>And מר קשישא is the younger</b> brother <b>and he was born when ר"ח was</b> (relatively) <b>older.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>מר ינוקא was older than מר קשישא and their names indicated the age of רב חסדא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why cannot we assume like רש"י that מר ינוקא was younger,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> and he was mentioned first, because he was the brighter of the two?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות יעב"ץ.</i>
<b>נהרדעי לטעמייהו—The</b> rabbis <b>of נהרדעא follow their logic</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>מר ינוקא ומר קשישא told רב אשי that the reason רב חמא ruled בדין קאמר ליה (regarding the case of the אספלידא ותרביצא) is because נהרדעי לטעמייהו (and they then cite a ruling by ר"נ אמר שמואל). Our תוספות clarifies who are the נהרדעי.<br>-------------------------<br><b>רב חמא נהרדעי הוא כדאמרינן בפרק קמא דסנהדרין (דף יז,ב) [אמוראי] דנהרדעי רב חמא –</b><br><b>ר"ח was from נהרדעא as</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of </b> מסכת<b> סנהדרין; ‘the אמוראים of נהרדעא is רב חמא –<br>ושמואל נמי נהרדעי הוא –</b><br><b>And שמואל also was</b> from <b>נהרדעא –<br>כדאמר שמואל (ברכות דף נח,ב) נהירין לי שבילי דרקיע<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">שמואל was able to calculate the movements of the heavenly bodies; i,e, the sun, the moon and the planets, etc. (except [as the גמרא states there] for כוכבא דשביט [probably a comet] which לא ידענו מאי ניהו.</i> כשבילי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">He was well acquainted with the שבילי דנהרדעי since he lived there.</i> דנהרדעי:</b><br><b>As שמואל stated the pathways of the heaven are</b> as <b>clear to me as the pathways of נהרדעא.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רב חמא who was a נהרדעי based his ruling, on a ruling of שמואל who was also a נהרדעי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What (if anything) is תוספות adding to פירוש רש"י?!
<b>אין להם דרך זה על זה—They have no</b> right of <b>way, one on another</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר"נ אמר שמואל ruled that after the brothers divided their father’s estate they have no easement rights on each other. If for instance one brother received a house and the other received a field,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Initially both brothers are equal owners of the בית וחצר. When they divide it is considered as if the בעל החצר is selling (and relinquishing) to the בעל הבית his rights in the בית, in lieu of the בעל הבית selling (and relinquishing) his rights in the חצר, to the בעל החצר.</i> the בעל הבית cannot walk through the field unless his brother (the בעל השדה) chooses to grant him this easement right (even though in the past they would walk through this field to enter the house). תוספות explains and clarifies this rule.<br>------------------------<br><b>טעמא משום דפסיק שמואל בפרק המוכר את הבית (לקמן דף סד,א.) כרבי עקיבא –</b><br><b>The reason</b> why אין להם דרך זע"ז is <b>because</b> (the same) <b>שמואל rules like ר"ע in פרק המוכר את הבית –<br>דאמר מוכר בעין יפה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The seller wishes to satisfy the buyer and gives him whatever is necessary [and more] so that the buyer is satisfied with his purchase.</i> מוכר –</b><br><b>Who</b> (ר"ע) <b>says that a seller sells with a ‘benevolent eye’ –<br>ולפיכך אין להם דרך זה על זה שלא שייר לעצמו כלום כל אחד חלק<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח omits this word חלק and it reads, כל אחד בחלק חברו.</i> בחלק חבירו –</b><br><b>And therefore</b> (since מוכר בעין יפה) <b>the</b> brothers <b>have no</b> claim of ‘right of <b>way’ against each other since each</b> brother <b>did not retain any</b> rights <b>in the portion which</b> he granted to <b>his friend</b> (brother) –<br><b>והוה לו כמוכר –</b><br><b>And</b> the division is considered as if each brother is <b>selling to</b> the other brothers all of his rights in the portions which are assigned to them.<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ואף על גב דאמרינן המוכר בית ושייר חצר מכר לו עם הדרך למאן דאמר מוכר בעין יפה מוכר<br>And even though we rule, according to the one who maintains מוכר בעין יפה מוכר, one who sells a house and retains the courtyard for himself, he sold him</b> the house <b>together with</b> right of <b>way</b> through the חצר<b></b> to enter the house; the buyer has the right of way to use the path in the חצר which belongs to the seller. Similarly here too, in this division, if one brother received a house and the other the courtyard, why do we not consider that the בעל החצר sold (his rights to) the בית and retained the חצר, in which case the בעל הבית should have an easement in the חצר. Why do we say that אין להם דרך זע"ז?!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>לא דמי דהכא כולם מוכרין וכל אחד מכר ולא שייר לעצמו כלום בחלק חבירו –</b><br>The cases are <b>not comparable, for here</b> by האחין שחלקו, <b>all</b> the brothers <b>are selling, and each one sold</b> his share <b>and did not retain in his brother’s share anything at all,</b> therefore the בעל הבית (who sold his interest of the חצר to the בעל החצר) has no easement rights in the חצר –<br><b>והוה ליה כמוכר חצר ושייר בית<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of מכר בית ושייר חצר there is only one seller; the (new) בעל החצר and he was מוכר to the (new) בעל הבית בעין יפה, thereby granting him an easement in the חצר. However here the בעל הבית and the בעל החצר (who were originally equal owners of the בית וחצר) are selling and relinquishing their rights in the חצר and בית (respectively), therefore the בעל הבית has no rights in the חצר (because even if we were to assume that the בעל החצר is giving him a דרך in the חצר, nevertheless the בעל הבית as a מוכר [to the בעל החצר] is relinquishing his rights to the חצר), and vice versa. See ’Thinking it over’.</i> דצריך ליקח לו דרך מבעל החצר:</b><br><b>And</b> the בעל הבית <b>is considered as if he sold the חצר and retained the בית,</b> in which case <b>he would be required to buy his easement from the בעל החצר</b> since כל המוכר בעין יפה מוכר.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ruling of אין להם דרך זע"ז is based on the ruling of כל המוכר בעין יפה מוכר. By האחין שחלקו all the brothers are considered sellers and relinquish any rights in the portions that now belong to their brothers.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does not the בעל הבית have a דרך in the חצר?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> Granted that when the בעל הבית sold his share of the חצר to the בעל החצר he relinquished all rights to the חצר, but when the בעל החצר sold his share in the בית to the בעל החצר he was מוכר בעין יפה and give him a דרך in the חצר (just as if the בעל החצר would have sold the בית to a stranger)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות כב ואילך.</i>

Line 2

<b>ולא סולמות זה על זה—And no</b> claim of <b>ladders one on the other</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר"נ אמר שמואל taught that brothers after dividing the estate have no easement claims on each other, nor do they have ‘rights of placing ladder’ claims on each other. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to the meaning of ולא סולמות זע"ז.<br>------------------------<br><b>פירש בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ולא סולמות.</i> אם נטל זה בית וחצר וזה נטל עלייה –</b><br><b>רש"י explained</b> the meaning of ולא סולמות זע"ז that <b>if one</b> brother <b>took the house and courtyard</b> for his share <b>and the other</b> brother <b>took the attic</b> for his share –<br><b>אין לקבוע סולם בחצירו של זה לעלות לעלייתו –</b><br>The בעל העלייה <b>cannot place a ladder in the חצר of the</b> בעל (הבית ו) החצר, in order <b>to go up to his עלייה.</b><br>תוספות asks on פירש"י:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו יצחק דהיינו ולא דרך זה על זה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Once the בעל העלייה relinquished his rights to the חצר he is not permitted to walk there and (certainly) not to place his ladder there.</i> –</b><br><b>And the ר"י has a difficulty</b> with פרש"י <b>for</b> ולא סולמות זע"ז <b>is</b> included in the ruling of <b>ולא דרך זע"ז,</b> nothing is being added by stating ולא סולמות זע"ז<b>.</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק כגון שלקח זה בית וזה עלייה וחצר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And it is the view of the ר"י</b> that ולא סולמות זע"ז is discussing a case where <b>for instance one</b> brother <b>took</b> the <b>house</b> for his share <b>and the other</b> brother took <b>the עלייה and the חצר,</b> and the rule is that the בעל העלייה (וחצר) –<br><b>אין לו לסמוך הסולם בכותל של זה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">One may have thought (based on ולא דרך זע"ז) that one is precluded from using the חצר as a passage; however just using the wall as a support for the ladder may be permitted, therefore ר"נ אמר שמואל added that this too is precluded.</i> ולעלות בעלייתו:</b><br><b>Cannot support the ladder on the wall of the</b> בעל הבית <b>in order to go up to his עלייה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ולא סולמות זע"ז means either (רש"י) that the בעל העלייה cannot place the foot of the ladder in the other’s חצר; or (תוס') that the בעל העלייה והחצר cannot support the ladder on the wall of the בעל הבית.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is it necessary to say, according to the פירוש ר"י,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> that the בעל העליה owns the חצר or will the ruling be the same if the בעל העליה and the בעל הבית share the ownership of the חצר?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i>

<b>ואי בעית אימא הא והא מבראי—And if you wish I can say; this and that are from the outside</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא reconciles the משנה which requires a בית שער for a חצר, with the episode which indicates that it is not desirable, in the following manner. 1. If the בית שער is inside the חצר it is undesirable; outside the חצר it is desirable. 2. Alternately even if it is outside the חצר, nevertheless if it has a door it is undesirable; no door - it is desirable. 3. And even with a door nevertheless without a lock (פותחת) – desirable; with a lock it is undesirable. 4. In addition even if it is [outside the חצר] with a door and a lock, but if it can be opened from the outside it is desirable, from the inside –undesirable. תוספות explains why other options are not offered.<br>-------------------------<br><b>ולא גרסינן הא והא מגוואי דמגוואי אין שייך לחלק בין אית ליה דלת ללית ליה –</b><br><b>And our text do not read, ‘[הא והא מגוואי] both cases</b> are where the בית שער <b>is inside</b> the חצר’ <b>for</b> if the בית שער <b>is inside</b> the חצר, <b>it is not possible to differentiate whether</b> the בית שער <b>has a door or</b> whether <b>it does not have</b> a door; in both cases it would not be desirable since the בית שער is in the חצר –<br><b>ובין אית ליה פותחת<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">פותחת is a lock.</i> ללית ליה –</b><br><b>And</b> if the בית שער is מגוואי we could also not differentiate <b>whether</b> the בית שער <b>has a פותחת or</b> whether it <b>does not have</b> a פותחת –<br><b>דבכל ענין הוא רע כיון שאין יכול לבא אלא עד פתח החצר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The פתח החצר has a door (as the משנה states כופין אותו לבנות וכו' ודלת לחצר [see later this תוספות]), thus preventing the עני from being heard in the חצר (see רש"י ד"ה מגוואי).</i> –</b><br><b>For in any event</b> (with or without a דלת or פותחת), having a בית שער מגוואי is <b>bad, since</b> the poor man <b>cannot come only up to the door of the חצר,</b> and the בית שער does not let his screams to be heard inside the חצר.<br>תוספות rejects an alternate explanation which would allow us to be גורס הא והא מגוואי:<br><b>ואין לפרש הא דאית ליה דלת כולי אחצר קאי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The בית שער is מגוואי, however if there is no דלת on the פתח חצר (not the בית שער) then there is no problem. For the עני can approach the בית שער directly. However when the חצר has a דלת then a בית שער מגוואי is undesirable.</i> –</b><br><b>And we cannot explain</b> that which the גמרא differentiates, <b>that this</b> case<b></b> where it is undesirable is in a situation <b>where it has a door, etc., it is referring</b> to the door <b>of the חצר</b> and not to the door of the בית שער; this would seemingly remove תוספות misgivings. However תוספות negates this interpretation –<br><b>דהא במתניתין בהדיא קתני כופין אותו לבנות דלת לחצר –</b><br><b>For the משנה states explicitly that we force</b> each member of the חצר <b>to build a door for the חצר,</b> therefore presumably every חצר has a דלת, so we cannot say that one case is where the חצר has no דלת. We must conclude that the differentiation of whether it has a דלת or not is referring to the בית שער and not to the חצר.<b></b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ולמאי דגרסינן מבראי קצת קשה דלא הוי כשאר שינויי דנקט צד דלא מעלי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’. In answers 3 and 4 we assume the undesirable status of the previous answer and nevertheless we can still reconcile the two cases. For instance in answer 2 (where the בית שער was outside the חצר), the undesirable case was where the בית שער had a door. In answer 3 we say that even if we assume the undesirable state of a door, nevertheless we can still reconcile by saying it is desirable if there is no lock. Similarly in answer 4 we state that even if there is a lock (the undesirable case of answer 3), nevertheless there is a desirable situation if the lock can be opened from the outside. In both answers (3&4) we assumed the undesirable cases of 2&3. However in answer 2 (הא והא מאבראי) we are assuming the desirable case of answer 1 (that it is מאבראי), but we do not assume the undesirable case of answer 1 (that it was מגוואי) as we do in answers 3&4.  </i> –</b><br><b>And according to our גירסא</b> of הא והא <b>מבראי there is a slight difficulty, for</b> this answer of הא והא מבראי is <b>not like the other answers where</b> the גמרא <b>mentions</b> (that both cases are discussing) <b>the negative side</b> and nevertheless it can be reconciled; for instance the גמרא states –<br><b>הא והא דאית ליה דלת והא והא דאית ליה פותחת –</b><br><b>Both cases are where there is a door</b> (which is a negative factor), or <b>both cases are where there is a פותחת</b> (which is also a negative factor) <b>–<br>והכא נקיט ההוא דמעלי:</b><br><b>However, here</b> the גמרא <b>mentions the positive</b> factor (that the בית שער is outside).<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not attempt to resolve this קצת קשה. See ‘Thinking it over’. [Perhaps תוספות is alluding that it would be better to interpret הא מגוואי והא מאבראי as the רשב"א does, where מגוואי is desirable and מאבראי is undesirable.]</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A בית שער מגוואי is never desirable. Every חצר has a דלת. The flow of the answers is not symmetrical (first assuming the desirable option and later the undesirable).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות is disturbed that the answer of הא והא מאבראי does not follow the syntax of the last two answers.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4&5.</i> However תוספות stated that it is impossible to state otherwise! Why therefore is it troublesome?!<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש.</i>

<b>לפי שבח ממון הן גובין—They collect according to the monetary value</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' יוחנן resolved the query of ר' אלעזר that for building the חומת העיר we collect from the inhabitants based proportionately on their wealth (the rich pay more than the poor), but we do not tax them all equally per capita (as one option of the query suggested). תוספות explains the reason for the ruling of ר' יוחנן.<br>-------------------------<br><b>כיון דאין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, דאין בה סכנת. </i> סכנת נפשות לא אזלינן אלא בתר ממון –</b><br><b>Since [here]</b> primarily <b>there is no danger to life</b> if there would be no חומה, therefore <b>we do not go according</b> to the people (that they should contribute per capita) <b>but rather</b> we go according <b>to the wealth</b> of the citizens. They each pay proportional to their assets (which may be stolen, if there is no חומה).<br>תוספות offers a corollary case:<br><b>והכי נמי אמר בהגוזל בתרא (בבא קמא דף קטז,ב) שיירא ההולכת במדבר ועמד עליה גייס –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>also states a similar</b> ruling <b>in</b> פרק <b>הגוזל בתרא; ‘a caravan that was traveling in the wilderness and marauders entrapped them.</b> The גייס and the שיירא agreed on the amount of money to be given to the גייס, so the שיירא will continue on its way –<br><b>מחשבין לפי ממון דליכא סכנת נפשות כיון דאין הגייס בא רק בשביל ממון –</b><br><b>We assess</b> the members of the שיירא <b>according to the money</b> they have with them, and they each give proportionally (this concludes the גמרא); תוספות continues the reason for this is <b>since there is no סכנת נפשת because the גייס only came for money,</b> but not to kill and maim.<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואף על גב דאמר בפרק בן סורר (סנהדרין דף עב,א) דהבא במחתרת נידון על שם סופו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The rule is that if a thief is burrowing his way into a house to steal and the בעל הבית apprehends him and kills the thief, the בעה"ב is not liable for his death, as explained shortly.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> (we rule in this case that מחשבין לפי ממון) <b>even though</b> the גמרא <b>states in פרק בן סורר that</b> a thief <b>who burrows through a tunnel is judged according to the consequence</b> of his actions –<br><b>ומפרש רבא טעמא בגמרא משום חזקה דאין אדם מעמיד עצמו על ממונו כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The owner will not stand idly by while the thief steals his money; he will put up a fight and the thief in return may kill the בעה"ב in order to steal the money, therefore the בעה"ב is initially exempt for killing the thief immediately, based on the axiom of הבא להרגך השכם להרגו. </i> –</b><br><b>And רבא explained the reason</b> there <b>in the גמרא, because there is a presumption that a person cannot hold himself back regarding his money, etc.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">We see from that גמרא that the בא במחתרת is considered that he is coming על עסקי נפשות (even though he initially only wants money), so seemingly by גייס it should also be considered עסקי נפשות and they should pay לפי נפשות.</i></b><br><b>ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read אפילו (not ואפילו); see מהר"ם.</i> הכי אין מחשבין אלא לפי ממון כיון דהגייס ברצונו אינו בא על הנפשות –</b><br><b>But nevertheless we only assess</b> the שיירא <b>according to the money</b> (and not according to נפשות even though it can come to נפשות as in the case of הבא במחתרת); <b>since the intent of the גייס is not come for נפשות</b> only for ממון. We know this is true –<br><b>דאם לא יעמדו נגדם לא יזיק לגופם הילכך לא חשיב סכנת נפשות<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not state clearly what is the difference between בא במחתרת where it is considered דיני נפשות and the owner has no liability for killing him, and the case of שיירא where it is not considered סכנת נפשות (even though seemingly the חזקה of אין אדם מעמיד עצמו על ממונו should apply here as well). One explanation may be that by מחתרת the owner of the house may assume that the thief realizes that the owner will put up a fight, so the thief is coming על עסקי נפשות and therefore he may be killed (as a רודף). However by שיירא or חומה the poor people can argue we are not interested in fighting for our money, and so from our perspective they are only coming על עסקי ממון and therefore גובין לפי ממון (see מהר"ם). Alternately, it depends what the issue is; by מחתרת we are discussing the right of the owner to defend his property, therefore the בא במחתרת is a רודף and may be killed; if however we are discussing how much to pay, then the גייס is only בא על עסקי ממון so we are גובה לפי ממון. See נח"מ, סוכ"ד and בל"י וכו', for various explanations to differentiate between the cases. </i> –</b><br><b>For if</b> the people of the שיירא <b>will not rise up against</b> the גייס, the גייס <b>will not cause them bodily harm, therefore</b> since the main intent of the גייס is ממון, <b>it is not considered סכנת נפשות</b> (even though it is possible that it may eventually turn out to be a סכנת נפשות [if the שיירא refuses to cooperate]).<br><b>לפיכך אם יעמדו עליהם לסטים ונתפשרו עמהם גובין לפי ממון –</b><br><b>Therefore if robbers apprehend the</b> שיירא <b>and they came to a</b> monetary <b>agreement with</b> the לסטים, <b>we collect according to the money</b> and not לפי נפשות –<br><b>אבל היכי דטעו<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, אבל היכא דתעו, etc. כיון דתעו. </i> במדבר אמר התם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק קטז,ב.</i> דמחשבינן אף לפי הנפשות<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">They pay the guide to lead them back to civilization both according to נפשות and ממון. [Presumably, half the fee is לפי נפשות (where all contribute equally) and half the fee is לפי ממון.]</i> –</b><br><b>However,</b> in a case where the שיירא <b>was lost in the מדבר,</b> the גמרא <b>rules there that we assess also according to נפשות –<br>משום כיון דטעו איכא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">In their current situation (since they are lost) there is a סכנת נפשות (they may perish in the מדבר) and lose their money.</i> סכנת נפשות:</b><br><b>Because, since they are lost</b> in the מדבר, <b>there is סכנת נפשות.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Where there is no immediate סכנת נפשות but only a monetary loss, we collect לפי ממון (even if it can deteriorate to a סכנת נפשות situation).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is the obligation to pay לפי ממון because of the (additional) money that the (richer) person is being protected from losing, or is it based on the cause of the problem, that the thieves come because of the (larger) amounts of money that is there (which belong the richer people)?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See ביאורים והערות (לרי"מ קנובלוביץ) אות קיד.</i> [In the case of שיירא would they pay according to how rich they are, or according to how much money they are traveling with?]<br>2. Is there more reason to say גובין לפי ממון by חומה over שיירא or vice versa?

Line 13

<b>לפי קירוב בתים הן גובין—They collect according to the closeness of the houses</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>In response to the query whether we are גובה לפי ממון or לפי נפשות, the ruling was לפי ממון, and in response to the query (according to the איכא דאמרי) whether we are גובה לפי קירוב בתים or לפי ממון, the response was לפי קירוב בתים. Our תוספות clarifies the resolution according to the איכא דאמרי.<br>--------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו תם ונותנין עניים קרובים יותר מרחוקים –</b><br><b>The ר"ת explained that</b> the resolution of לפי קירוב בתים הן גובין means <b>that the poor</b> who live <b>closer</b> to the חומה must <b>give more</b> than the עניים who live <b>further</b> from the חומה –<br><b>וכן עשירים קרובים יותר מעשירים רחוקים –</b><br><b>And similarly the rich</b> who live <b>closer</b> give <b>more that the rich</b> who live <b>further –<br>אבל עשירים רחוקים נותנין יותר מעניים קרובים דלפי שבח ממון נמי הן גובין:<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It seems that the primary evaluation is לפי ממון (for תוספות writes that the עשירים רחוקים pay more than the עניים קרובים [not even the same]). Let us assume a town of a hundred people where 20 percent of the population owns 50 percent of the money. These twenty people (as a group) will have to pay half the expenses. This half will be apportioned to these rich people depending ([perhaps] how rich they are and) how close or far they are from the חומה. The same will hold true for the remaining 80 poor people.</i></b><br><b>However</b> (even) <b>the rich</b> who live <b>further give more that the poor</b> who live <b>closer, because the collection is also based according to monetary value</b> of the citizens.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>לפי קירוב בתים הן גובין does not negate that we are also גובה לפי ממון.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is there a מחלוקת between the לישנא קמא and the איכא דאמרי (according to תוספות) since they both agree לפי ממון הן גובין?<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות קע.</i><br>2. What was the initial query if לפי ממון or לפי קירוב בתים (according to תוספות)?!

Line 14

<b>אילימא לצדיקים כולי—Can I say, for the righteous, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites the פסוק<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">תהלים קלט, יח.</i> of אספרם מחול ירבון; ‘can I count them, (when) they are more numerous than the sands’, and asks can this פסוק be referring to צדיקים (and rejects this notion). תוספות explains why the גמרא initially assumed that this פסוק is referring to the counting of צדיקים.<br>-----------------------<br><b>דבהכי מיירי קרא –</b><br>The גמרא assumes that אספרם מחול ירבון refers to צדיקים, <b>since this is what the פסוק is discussing –<br>דלעיל מיניה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק יז.</i> כתיב ולי מה יקרו רעיך אל מה עצמו ראשיהם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there who interprets מה עצמו ראשיהם as חשבון ספירתם. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>Because in the previous</b> פסוק <b>it is written, ‘and as for me how precious are your friends, oh Lord, how mighty are their leaders [numbers]’ –<br>וכתיב בתריה אספרם מחול ירבון:</b><br><b>And</b> in the <b>next</b> פסוק <b>it is written אספרם מחול ירבון,</b> obviously the אספרם is referring to the רעיך in the previous פסוק. The רעיך א-ל are the צדיקים.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It was assumed that אספרם refers to צדיקים from the continuity of the previous פסוק.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to the conclusion of the גמרא that the פסוק of אספרם does not refer to צדיקים, how do we explain the continuity of the פסוקים?

<b>לא שליט למרמא עליהם—There is no authority to levy</b> (it) <b>on them</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רנב"י told רנב"ח that by levying the כרגא tax on the רבנן you transgressed what is written in… כתובים that מנדה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">עזרא ז,כד, where דריוש commanded his governor in א"י not to tax all those that were involved in the service and building of the בית המקדש (השני).</i> בלו והלך לא שליט למרמא עליהם. Our תוספות explains the connection between the פסוק in עזרא which prohibited taxing the workers<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש on רש"י ד"ה מנדה.  </i> of the בית שני to the prohibition of taxing the רבנן.<br>---------------------------<br><b>לפי שהיו עסוקים במלאכת שמים בבנין בית המקדש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br>The reason those people were not taxed is <b>because they were involved in a heavenly service,</b> namely <b>the building of the בית המקדש –<br>הכא נמי אין להטיל מס על לומדי תורה:</b><br>Therefore <b>here too, tax should not be levied on those studying תורה,</b> because they are also עסוקים במלאכת שמים.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>People who are involved במלאכת שמים like לומדי תורה are not to be taxed.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes that the people who were tax exempt were involved in בנין בית המקדש.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> However the פסוק (seemingly) mentions the people who were serving in the ביהמ"ק (the כהניא ולויא זמריא תרעיא וגו'), and especially that this proclamation was given to עזרא who came to ירושלים after the ביהמ"ק was built!<br>2. How can we derive a הלכה that the רבנן should not be taxed from an act that a non-Jewish king (דריוש) did?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See חתם סופר.</i><br>3. Did דריוש tax the לומדי תורה?
<b>והלך זו ארנונא—And הלך refers to ארנונא</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explains the three different taxes of מנדה בלו והלך, which דריוש exempted the עוסקין במקדש to pay. רב יהודה said that הלך<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This (Aramaic word) is vowelized הה"א פתוחה והלמ"ד קמוצה.</i> is ארנונא. Our תוספות cites two interpretations of ארנונא.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירש בקונטרס עישור בהמות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps this means a tenth of the flock which is born that year.</i> ותבואה כולי –</b><br><b>רש"י explained</b> that ארנונא is the <b>tithe from cattle and produce,</b> which was to be given to the king.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation:<br><b>ורבינו חננאל פירש ארוחת דורון לשלטון העובר ממקום למקום –</b><br><b>And the ר"ח explained</b> that ארנונא means <b>an offer of food to the ruler</b> (and his entourage) <b>who is passing through from place to place –<br>שנותן לו כל עיר ועיר ארוחה –</b><br><b>Where each city,</b> in which the שלטון passes through, <b>offers him a meal –<br>ופירושו מלשון ויבא הלך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This (Hebrew word) is vowelized הה"א צרוייה והלמ"ד סגולה.</i> לאיש העשיר (שמואל ב יב<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק ד'. (The פסוק there continues that the עשיר made a meal for the הלך.) </i>):</b><br><b>And the interpretation of</b> the ר"ח of הלך <b>is based on the expression</b> in the פסוק <b>‘and a הלך [traveler] came to the rich man’.</b> We see that הלך refers to a traveler; therefore the gift that is given to the traveling שלטון is called הלך.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>הלך (or ארנוא) is either a tithe (פרש"י), or meals for the traveling officials (פר"ח).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. What are the relative advantages of פרש"י and פר"ח?<br>2. Which exemption would have been more beneficial for the Jews; that of רש"י (the tithe) or ר"ח (the meal)?

<b>כריא פתיא—</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא states that even the רבנן must participate (financially) in כריא פתיא, which רש"י interprets to mean digging water cisterns for the (community and) travelers. כריא means digging, and the cistern is referred to as פתיא since the drinking utensil (which was always in the cistern [to enable the travelers to drink]) is called a פתיא.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ברכות נ,א ד"ה פתיא which states  פתיא. כלי חרס כדאמר (ע"ז ד' לג:) הני פתיותא דבי מכסי</i> Our תוספות cites an alternate interpretation.<br>---------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו חננאל להסיר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כריא would mean (digging and) removing the גבשושית.</i> גבשושית מרחוב<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See יעב"ץ that the תרגום of אל תוך רחבה (דברים [ראה] יג,יז) is לגו פתיה; so פתיא here means the street (רחוב).</i> העיר:</b><br><b>The ר"ח interpreted</b> כריא פתיא to mean, <b>the removal an [obstructive] mound from the city street.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>כריא פתיא means either digging a cistern (רש"י) or street leveling (ר"ח).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Which כריא פתיא should be more required of the רבנן to participate in, that of רש"י or of the ר"ח?<br>2. How would the ר"ח explain כריא חדתא mentioned previously in the גמרא?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>3. What are the relative advantages of פרש"י ור"ח respectively?

<b>ככלב<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This תוספות should precede the previous תוס' ד"ה איפרא</i> וכעורב—Like a dog and like a raven</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר יונתן בן עמרם asked of רבינו הקדוש that רבי should sustain ר' יונתן as a dog and a raven are sustained. תוספות explains why he mentioned specifically these two animals in particular.<br>--------------------<br><b>כמו שפירש הקונטרס –</b><br>This is to be understood <b>as רש"י explained it.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ככלב וכעורב. These two animals (כלב and [בני] עורב) have special needs for food, and Hashem meets their needs, similarly ר' יונתן beseeched רבי that he should meet his needs.</i></b><br><b>והיינו דכתיב נותן לבהמה לחמה לבני עורב וגומר בהמה בגימטריא כלב:</b><br><b>And this is what is written;<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תהלים קמז, ט.</i></b> Hashem <b>gives to the בהמה its bread,</b> He (also) gives to the <b>raven’s children, etc.</b> The word <b>בהמה is</b> the <b>גמטריא of כלב.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">They both equal fifty-two.</i></b> We see in the same פסוק that Hashem sustains the כלב and the (בני) עורב.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The same פסוק states that Hashem sustains the כלב and the בני עורב.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Do רש"י and תוספות agree on the meaning of פרנסני ככלב וכעורב?<br>2. Why was it necessary for תוספות to show that כלב and בני עורב are both mentioned in the same פסוק?<br>3. Why is the sequence כלב and then עורב?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See חתם סופר on the גמרא.</i>

<b>איפרא הורמיז—</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates an incident with איפרא הורמיז, who was the mother of the Persian king, שבור. Our תוספות discusses the etymology of the name איפרא הורמיז.<br>--------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו חננאל דמשמעות הלשון חן מאת המקום –</b><br><b>The ר"ח explained that the indication of the language is</b> that איפרא הורמיז means <b>grace from the omnipotent</b> (Hashem). The ר"ח breaks up the two names; the name –<br><b>איפרא כמו אפריון נמטייה לרבי שמעון<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ש there offered a mediating opinion in a dispute. When שבור מלכא (the son of איפרא הורמיז) heard the view of ר"ש, he was impressed and said אפריון נמטייה לר"ש.</i> (בבא מציעא דף קיט,א) –</b><br><b>איפרא is like</b> the expression <b>אפריון נמטייה לר"ש, [we extend our grace to ר"ש] –</b><br>תוספות continues with the second name:<br><b>הורמיז שם שכינה כי ההיא דסוף פרק אחד דיני ממונות (סנהדרין דף לט,א ושם דיבור המתחיל דהורמיז)-</b><br><b>הורמיז is a name for the שכינה, like that</b> גמרא <b>in the end of פרק אחד דיני ממונות,</b> which states –<br><b>מפלגא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A sorcerer (there) said to אמימר your top half was created by השם; however your bottom half was created by a שד. It is evident from that גמרא that הורמיז refers to הקב"ה.</i> דידך ולעיל דהורמיז בזיי"ן מפלגא ולתחת דהורמין בנו"ן –</b><br><b>Your upper half</b> belongs <b>to הורמיז [</b>spelled] <b>with a זיי"ן; your bottom half</b> belongs <b>to הורמין</b> [spelled] <b>with a נו"ן;</b> the name הורמין –<br><b>כמו הורמין בר לילתא לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רבה describes there his encounter with the שד called הורמין בר לילתא. Perhaps the reason תוספות mentions הורמין בר לילתא, because there are גירסאות regarding הורמיז and הורמין, which are the exact opposite – that הורמין is השם and הורמיז is the שד, therefore תוספות proves this גירסא from הורמין בר לילתא who was definitely a שד.</i> (דף עג,א) :</b><br><b>Is like הורמין the son of לילתא</b> mentioned <b>later</b> in our מסכת.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The name איפרא הורמיז means grace from Hashem.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did תוספות (and the ר"ח) find it necessary to explain the name of איפרא הורמיז?
<b>יתיב רב יוסף וקא מעיין בה—רב יוסף was sitting and contemplating it </b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that איפרא הורמיז (the mother of שבור מלכא) sent a purse of דינרים to רב יוסף and instructed him to use it for a מצוה רבה (a great מצוה). רב יוסף was thinking what is a מצוה רבה and אביי told him that פדיון שבויים is a מצוה רבה. Our תוספות discusses the willingness of רב יוסף to do charity on behalf of a gentile, which seemingly is something that is frowned upon.<br>----------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר וכי לית ליה ביבש קצירה תשברנה וגומר (ישעיה כז<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק יא.</i>) כדאמרינן בפירקין (דף י,ב) –</b><br><b>And if you will say; and does not</b> רב יסף <b>agree</b> to the interpretation of the פסוק <b>ביבש קצירה תשברנה, etc. as</b> the גמרא <b>states</b> later<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there relates that (the same) איפרא הורמיז sent to רב אמי four hundred זוזים, but he did not accept them. She then sent it to רבא who did accept it. רב אמי took umbrage and said to רבא do you not follow the פסוק of ביבש קצירה תשברנה, meaning (see רש"י there ד"ה ביבש) that when the זכות of צדקה will wither away from the gentiles, then the gentiles will break.  By accepting from them money for צדקה we are giving them additional power. [The simple translation of the פסוק is; when its branch will wither, it will break.]  </i> <b>in this פרק.</b> How did רב יוסף consider using this money from a gentile for צדקה? <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דקבלה משום שלום מלכות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">איפרא הורמיז was the king’s mother; had she been slighted it would cause negative repercussions for the Jews.</i> כדעבד רבא לקמן (שם) –</b><br><b>And one can say; that he accepted</b> the money <b>in order to</b> keep the <b>peace</b> with the <b>government, as רבא did</b> (which is mentioned) <b>later<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 2. רבא accepted the money from איפרא הורמיז because of שלום מלכות.</i></b> in the גמרא –<br><b>וכי היכי דפלגינהו רבא לעניי עובדי כוכבים הכא נמי פדה בהו רב יוסף שבויי עובדי כוכבים –</b><br><b>And just as רבא distributed</b> the money received from איפרא הורמיז <b>to the gentile poor,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Giving the money to עניי עכו"ם is not considered a זכות for the giver (see ר' גרשום on יא,א ד"ה לעניי). See however בל"י who maintains that if giving לעניי עכו"ם is not considered צדקה at all then why is it necessary to state that רבא (and רב יוסף) accepted the money משום שלום מלכות. This would seemingly proof the צדקה לעניים is a מצוה however it is less of a מצוה than giving it to עניי ישראל therefore [combined with שלום מלכות] they were permitted to distribute it.</i> here too רב יוסף redeemed gentile captives with this</b> money.<br>תוספות offers an alternate approach:<br><b>ומיהו לא צריכי להכי אלא כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות הב"ח (and others) who amend the text to read הקונטרס דרב יוסף קבלה הכא משום; see רש"י יא,א ד"ה דלא סיימוה. </i> דרבא דקבלה משום שלום מלכות –</b><br><b>However it is not necessary to</b> come on to this explanation that רב יוסף used the money for שבויי עכו"ם, <b>but rather as רש"י explained that (רבא) [רב יוסף] accepted</b> the money from איפרא הורמיז <b>because of שלום מלכות –<br>וכיון שאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">This should (seemingly) be amended to read שאמרה.</i> לו ליתן למצוה רבה לא היה אפשר לחלקם לעניי עובדי כוכבים –</b><br><b>But since [s]he told</b> רב יוסף <b>to distribute it for a מצוה רבה it was not possible for him to divide it among עניי עכו"ם –<br>דאסור לגנוב דעת הבריות ואפילו דעתו של עובד כוכבים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there explains the ruling of the משנה why one may not send to an עכו"ם a ירך חתוכה with the גיד הנשה remaining inside, because the עכו"ם will presume that the ישראל took the trouble to remove the גיד (making it fit [even] for the ישראל) and then because of his friendship with the עכו"ם he gifts it to him, when in fact he did not remove the גיד. This is גניבת דעת of a נכרי which is also אסור. See ‘Thinking it over # 3.</i> (חולין צד,א) –</b><br><b>For it is forbidden to fool people and even</b> to mislead an <b>עכו"ם.</b> Therefore רב יוסף had no choice but to be פודה שבויי ישראל.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם, that it is not usual for ישראל to be פודה שבויי עכו"ם (as opposed to being מפרנס עני עכו"ם). See (however) ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><b>אבל מעות המתחלקים לעניים אין כאן גניבת דעת –</b><br><b>However monies</b> which are given to be <b>distributed to the poor</b> (as in the case of רב אמי ורבא later) <b>there is no גניבת דעת</b> if it is distributed to עניי עכו"ם (solely) –<br><b>דאינהו נמי ידע שישראל רגילין לפרנסם –</b><br><b>For the</b> gentiles <b>also know that the ישראל are accustomed to sustain</b> the עניי עכו"ם-<br><b>כדאמר בהנזקין (גיטין דף סא,א) מפרנסים עניי עכו"ם עם עניי ישראל מפני דרכי שלום –</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>הניזקין, we provide for the עניי עכו"ם together with עניי ישראל because of insuring the peace</b> (between the עכו"ם and ישראל).<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<b><br>והא דקבל מההוא טייעא דנדב שרגא לבי כנישתא בפרק קמא דערכין (דף ו,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל עד)-</b><br><b>And</b> that which we find <b>in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ערכין that they accepted</b> from an <b>Arab who donated candles for the synagogue –<br>אף על גב דהתם לא היה שלום מלכות<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The טייעא (presumably) had no connection to the government.</i> –</b><br><b>Even though</b> in <b>that</b> case <b>there was no</b> concern of <b>שלום מלכות,</b> so why did they accept it (there is the issue of ביבש קצירה תשברנה) –<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>התם טעמא משום דהוו כמו קרבן –</b><br><b>The reason</b> they accepted it <b>there because</b> that donation <b>was like a קרבן –<br>ואמרינן (נזיר סב,א) איש איש<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The פסוק in ויקרא (אמור) כב,יח states איש איש וגו' אשר יקריב קרבנו וגו'; the extra איש includes עכו"ם.</i> לרבות נכרים שנודרים נדרים ונדבות כישראל:<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות אשר"י אות לו that נדרים ונדבות are not לכפר (they are voluntarily) therefore they do not add זכותים, however צדקה is מכפר (see later י,ב where ר' יוחנן בן זכאי states כך צדקה מכפרת על אומות העולם), therefore one should refrain from having the עכו"ם give צדקה. Donating to a shul is like a קרבן but not like צדקה.</i></b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא states that the פסוק of <b>איש איש includes gentiles, that</b> they too <b>may offer pledges and gifts</b> for קרבנות <b>just like ישראל.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One may accept money from an עכו"ם to distribute for צדקה (to עכו"ם) if it is for שלום מלכות. One may even distribute it for ישראל if otherwise it would be גניבת דעת (as in the case of מצוה רבה). Donations to a ביכנ"ס may be accepted from עכו"ם because it is like bringing a קרבן, which עכו"ם may do.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According to the מסקנא of תוספות did רב יוסף redeem שבויי ישראל or שבויי עכו"ם?<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. Why did not רב יוסף redeem שבויי עכו"ם (if we he assume he was פודה שבויי ישראל)?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>3. רש"י stated that רב יוסף could not have redeemed שבויי עכו"ם because it would be גניבת דעת.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8</i> Seemingly, since איפרא הורמיז told רב יוסף to use the money for a מצוה רבה, if רב יוסף would have used it to be פודה שבויי עכו"ם (which is definitely not a מצוה רבה) it would be גניבה ממש, not merely גניבת דעת!<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות קעט.</i>

Daf 8b



Line 1

<b>פדיון שבוים מצוה רבה—Redeeming captives is a great מצוה</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>אביי derived from תני רב שמואל בר יהודה that פדיון שבויים is a מצוה רבה; seemingly indicating that it takes preference over all other מצות. Our תוספות will reconcile this with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>---------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמר בפרק בני העיר (מגילה דף כז,א) אין מוכרין ספר תורה אלא ללמוד תורה ולישא אשה –</b><br><b>And concerning that which</b> ר' יוחנן in the name of ר"מ <b>stated in פרק בני העיר, ‘one does not sell a ס"ת, unless</b> it is for the purpose of either <b>learning תורה or to marry a woman’</b> (this concludes the citation from פרק בני העיר); תוספות continues <b>–<br>ולא קתני פדיון שבוים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If פדיון שבוים is a מצוה רבה then why cannot we sell a ס"ת for פדיון שבוים; why is it less of a מצוה than ללמוד תורה or לישא אשה. It would seem from that גמרא that indeed פדיון שבוים is not such a מצוה רבה!</i> –</b><br><b>But it did not mention</b> that one is permitted to sell a ס"ת for <b>פדיון שבוים!</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>שמא מילתא דפשיטא היא ולא איצטריך למיתני:</b><br><b>Perhaps this is an obvious ruling, so it was not necessary</b> for ר"י אמר ר"מ <b>to teach it</b> that one may certainly sell a ס"ת for פדיון שבויים (since פדיון שבוים is a מצוה רבה).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is obvious that one may sell a ס"ת for פדיון שבוים (since it is a מצוה רבה).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It is apparent from the גמרא previously<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">ג,ב where it states דירתיה דאינשי לא מזבני. </i> that one may not sell a בית הכנסת for the sake of פדיון שבוים. It would follow that a ס"ת (which has a greater קדושה than a ביהכנ"ס), may certainly not be sold for פדיון שבוים. How can תוספות here rule that it is obvious that one may sell a ס"ת for פדיון שבוים?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

<b>ומתחלקת בג' מפני שהיא כדיני ממונות—And it is distributed by three because it is like monetary matters</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא states that when collecting for the קופה של צדקה (every week) there must be two collectors,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The reason is because אין עושין שררות על הצבור פחות משנים.</i> and when they distribute the money from this קופה it must be administered by three people. The reason three people are required is because it is a monetary decision (how much to give to each recipient<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה מפני.</i>), therefore like all monetary decisions it requires (a בי"ד of) three. תוספות explains the difference between collecting and distributing,<br>----------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מהאי טעמא נמי תהא נגבית בג'<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Just like by the distribution it is necessary to assess and evaluate the needs of the individual poor (and this is what makes it דיני ממונות), the same evaluation is necessary to assess the wealth of the rich; how much they should give, so three people should be required for this judgment.</i> –</b><br><b>And if you will say; for the very same reason</b> (that distributing is like דיני ממנות), <b>it should also be collected by three</b> (for collecting is also דיני ממונות) –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ופירש רבינו תם לפי שהיה ידוע סכום של כל אחד ואחד כמה יתן:<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The assessment of the donators was already made (by some governing body [and is not likely to change from week to week]). The job of the collectors was limited to collecting the money only. However the task of the distributors was to assess the needs of the poor and give them accordingly (and their situation tends to be more volatile). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i></b><br><b>And the ר"ת explained</b> that there was no need of assessment regarding the collection, <b>because it was already known the amount which each individual will donate.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The collectors only collected while the distributors assessed as well.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It would seem that if the needs of the עניים changed (from week to week), then the amount collected (from the עשירים) should also change from week to week. Why is assumed that the donation amount was fixed?

Line 7

<b>ולשנותה לכל מה שירצו—And to change it to whatever they desire</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא stated that the בני העיר can exchange the קופה and the תמחוי monies (with each other and also) to whatever the בני העיר choose.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">They need not use the קופה (or תמחוי) money exclusively for קופה (or תמחוי) purposes, but rather they can exchange קופה and תמחוי monies and furthermore they can use these monies for whatever they choose.</i> תוספות broadens the scope of לכל מה שירצו.<br>-----------------------<br><b>נראה לרבינו תם דיכולים לשנותו אף לדבר הרשות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The בני העיר can allocate the funds for non-צדקה or non-מצוה uses; to improve the city, for instance.</i> –</b><br><b>It is the view of the ר"ת that the</b> בני העיר <b>can change this</b> צדקה money <b>even for non-compulsory matters.</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דאמרינן בערכין בפרק קמא (דף ו,ב ושם) –</b><br><b>Even though</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ערכין –<br>האי מאן דנדב שרגא לבי כנשתא אסור לשנותה לדבר הרשות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The text of the גמרא there actually reads as follows: ת"ר ישראל שהתנדב מנורה או נר לבית הכנסת אסור לשנותה סבר רבי חייא בר אבא למימר לא שנא לדבר הרשות ולא שנא לדבר מצוה, אמר ליה רב אמי הכי אמר רבי יוחנן לא שנו אלא לדבר הרשות, אבל לדבר מצוה   <br>מותר לשנותה</i> –</b><br><b>This man who donated a candle for the synagogue; it is forbidden to change it</b> and use it for a <b>secular purpose.</b> It is evident from that גמרא that something which was dedicated for a דבר מצוה (a ביהכנ"ס) may not be used for a דבר הרשות –<br><b>ואמר נמי התם<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">ו,א (בסופו).</i> האומר פרוטה זו לצדקה –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>there also states, ‘one who says, ‘this פרוטה is for צדקה’ –<br>עד שלא באה ליד הגבאי מותר לשנותה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This (seemingly) means that instead of giving this specific פרוטה (פרוטה זו) for צדקה, he may spend this פרוטה for other purposes (even for a דבר הרשות); however he must keep his promise to give (another) פרוטה to צדקה.</i> –</b><br><b>Before</b> the פרוטה <b>came into the possession of the גבאי</b> צדקה <b>it is permitted to change</b> this פרוטה and use it for other purposes; however –<br><b>משבאה ליד הגבאי אסור לשנותה (לדבר הרשות<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח deletes the words לדבר הרשות.</i>) –<br>Once it came into the possession of the גבאי it is forbidden to change it</b> (for a דבר הרשות). How, therefore can (the גמרא here rule that we can be משנה the קופה ותמחוי [even after it came ליד הגבאי], and how can) the ר"ת rule that the monies of the קופה ותמחוי may be used even לדבר הרשות?!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>הכא שבני העיר משנים אותה שאני –</b><br><b>Here</b> (by the ruling of the ר"ת) <b>since the בני העיר are changing it</b> (not merely the גבאי צדקה or the donor) <b>it is different –<br>לפיכך מותר לשנותה אפילו לדבר הרשות<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i> ואפילו באה ליד הגבאי –</b><br><b>Therefore it is permitted to change it</b> (through the decision of the בני העיר), <b>even for a דבר הרשות and even if it came into the sגבאי' possession –<br>וכן היה רבינו תם נוהג לתת מעות הקופה לשומרי העיר<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –</b><br><b>And so indeed was the custom of the ר"ת to give the monies of the קופה</b> (which is designated for the poor), <b>to the guards of the city</b> (which is considered a דבר הרשות), the reason it is permitted –<br><b>לפי שעל דעת בני העיר נותנים אותם:</b><br><b>Because</b> the people <b>give</b> צדקה<b></b> to the קופה that it should be distributed <b>according to the will of the בני העיר</b> (alternately; <b>it was given</b> to the שומרי העיר <b>with the consent of the בני העיר).</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A גבאי (or the donor) cannot change the צדקה [to a דבר הרשות]; however the בני העיר can change צדקה monies to be used for צרכי ציבור even for a דבר הרשות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Can the גבאי change from one צדקה to another without consulting the בני העיר?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות יט.</i><br>2. תוספות ruled that to be משנה from צדקה to דברי הרשות requires the consent of בני העיר.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> How is it that the ר"ת distributed money from the קופה to the שומרי העיר without (seemingly) consulting the בני העיר?!<br>3. Seemingly when a person gives to the קופת צדקה he intends to fulfill his obligation to give צדקה;<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> how can the בני העיר decide to take away his מצות צדקה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See אילת השחר.</i>
