<b>לא יחפור—One should not dig</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה rules that one may not dig all kinds of pits and water canals or a launderer’s pond near his friends well. תוספות discusses the reason for this prohibition.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">From רש"י ד"ה אא"כ it seems that the reason is that digging adjacent to a well weakens the walls of the well.</i><br>---------------------------------<br><b>כל הני איירי דאית בהו מיא וטעמא משום מתונתא כדאמרינן בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">יט,א.</i> –<br>All these</b> prohibition <b>are in a case where there is water</b> in these excavations, <b>and the reason</b> it is prohibited <b>is because of the moisture, as the גמרא states –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה לרבינו יצחק והא אמרינן בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רבא on the עמוד ב' maintains that our משנה can even follow the view of ר' יוסי, who maintains that one may plant a tree near a well, even though eventually the roots of the tree may weaken the well. However in our משנה the damage is done directly by the digging (as opposed to the case of ר' יוסי where the planting does no damage to the בור at all; the damage comes much later when the roots extend into the בור).</i> כל מרא ומרא דקא מחית כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It seems from that גמרא (of כל מרא וכו') that the damage is caused by the digging process (see רש"י in footnote # 1), not as תוספות stated that the damage is caused by the moisture (like the גמרא of מתונתא).</i> –<br>And the ר"י is astounded, but the גמרא states, ‘every single strike of the shovel, etc.</b> weakens my earth –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלא קאמר אלא שמאותה שעה מתחיל ההיזק –<br>And the ר"י says</b> that רבא <b>only</b> meant <b>to say that the damage begins at that time</b> of the digging –<br><b>וכיון דבתחילת ההיזק הוו גירי דיליה מודה רבי יוסי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3. Later on כה,ב the גמרא cites the view of ר' יוסי that זה חופר בתוך שלו וזה נוטע בתוך שלו. However if he is causing damage directly (גירי דיליה – his arrows), even ר"י agrees that it is prohibited. When רבא stated כל מרא ומרא, he did not mean that the digging is the [ultimate] reason for distancing, rather it is to explain why even ר"י will agree that in this case he is obligated to distance himself since his actions now causes (some) weakening of the ground near the affected בור. However the actual requirement for distancing three טפחים (and סד בסיד) is because of מתונתא. </i> –<br>So since that at the onset of the damage</b> (when he starts digging) <b>it is ‘his arrows’</b> that are causing the damage, therefore <b>ר' יוסי would admit</b> that it is prohibited –<br><b>ומיהו אי לאו משום מיא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Placing the water there by itself, however, will not make it גירי דיליה, since it takes a while for the water to seep through and damage the בור. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> לא היה צריך הרחקה ג' טפחים:</b><br><b>However if not for the water it would not be necessary to distance three טפחים</b> from the בור.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The damage done by digging makes it גירי דיליה, the damage done by the water requires distancing three טפחים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות states that the damage caused by digging alone will not require distancing three טפחים;<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> why therefore would ר"י agree with our משנה which requires distancing three טפחים, since the requirement is based on מתונתא which is not גירי דיליה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i><br>2. If there would be no water (no מתונתא), will it still be necessary to distance somewhat from the בור because of the digging?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מראה עוזר (שם המחבר עוזר דרורי).</i>
<b>לא שיח ולא מערה—Not a ditch and not a cave</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה mentions various different excavations that are required to be distanced from a בור. Our תוספות discusses why some are mentioned while others are omitted.<br>------------------------------<br><b>והוא הדין חריצין ונעיצין והני נקט אגב בור דבכל מקום רגיל לשנות שיח ומערה בהדי בור –<br>And the same rule applies to חריצין ונעיצין,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ב"ק נ,ב ד"ה חריצין who writes; חריצין רחבין ומרובעין כמערה ואינן מקורין אלא כל פיו פתוח: נעיצין. קצרין מלמטה ורחבין מלמעלה. The חריצין are square uncovered ditches; נעיצין are ditches narrow on the bottom and wide on the top.</i> and</b> the משנה mentions (only) <b>these,</b> שיח ומערה (but not חריצין ונעיצין),<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We understand on our own that the same rules apply to חריצין ונעיצין as apply to בור שיח ומערה.</i> <b>on account of בור, for</b> the תנא <b>is accustomed everywhere to mention שיח ומערה together with בור –<br>ואמת המים ונברכת הכובסין דאין רגיל לשנותן גבי בור מפרש בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא on יט,א explains that if the משנה would have written only one of them (either נברכת הכובסין or אמת המים) we would not be able to derive the other from it. Each one has a חומרא, by אמת המים it is קביעה (permanent) and by נברכת הכובסין it קוו וקיימי (it is standing in its place) עיי"ש. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דצריכי תרוייהו –<br>And</b> regarding <b>אמת המים and נברכת הכובסין, which are not usually taught together with בור, the גמרא explains that it was necessary to write them both.</b><br>תוספות responds to the anticipated question:<br><b>ומיהו הא לא מפרש אמאי לא הוה שמעינן להו מבור<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה did not write חריצין ונעיצין because it is evident that they can be derived from בור, similarly we should be able to derive אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין also from בור, why mention it separately.</i> –<br>However</b> the גמרא <b>does not explain why we could not have derived</b> אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין <b>from בור;</b> the reason may be self-explanatory <b>–<br>דמצי למימר דבור ושיח דעמוקין טפי בעי הרחקת שלשה –<br>For</b> we <b>could have explained that בור ושיח, which are deeper,</b> (than אמת המים וכו') <b>requires a distancing of three</b> טפחים –<br><b>אבל הנך דלא עמיקי כולי האי הוה אמינא דלא בעי הרחקת שלשה –<br>However these</b> (אמת המים וכו') <b>which are not that deep, we may have thought that they do not require distancing three</b> טפחים –<br><b>ואי תנא הני הוה אמינא דבור ושיח דעמיקי טפי בעי הרחקה יותר מג'<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore it was necessary to teach בור (and שיח ומערה) as well as אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין.</i> –<br>And if the תנא</b> would teach that these אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין, require distancing ג' טפחים but not mention בור וכו', <b>we would have thought that בור ושיח which are deeper</b> than אמת המים וכו', <b>require distancing more than three</b> טפחים. The גמרא may have felt that this distinction is obvious.<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ובפרק הפרה (בבא קמא דף נ,ב) דתנן אחד החופר בור ושיח ומערות ומצריך להו לכולהו בגמרא –<br>And in פרק הפרה where</b> the משנה teaches that one is liable <b>whether he dug a בור, a שיח, or a מערה, and the גמרא there</b> explains why it was <b>necessary</b> for the משנה to teach <b>all</b> three cases; why was it necessary to explain it there but not here<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">In fact תוספות stated previously that there is no need to explain why he mentions all three because this is the norm to write all three of them together, so why does the גמרא in ב"ק find it necessary to make a צריכותא?!</i> –<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>התם ניחא דלא הוה ליה לתנא למינקטינהו אגב בור כיון דכתיב בור בקרא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">However here where the משנה is not referencing any פסוק, it is usual to mention שיח ומערה together with בור.</i> –<br>There it is understood, for the תנא should not have mentioned</b> שיח ומערה <b>on account of בור, since</b> only <b>בור is written in the פסוק –<br>אלא הוה ליה למיתני בור לחודיה:</b><br>The תנא <b>should have rather taught only בור,</b> therefore the גמרא found it necessary to make the צריכותא.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can derive חריצין ונעיצין from בור, but not אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין; it is usual to write שיח ומערה together with בור (even without a צריכותא); however when the פסוק writes בור exclusively, the משנה (when referencing this פסוק) needs a reason why to mention שיח ומערה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>When תוספות makes the צריכותא for אמת המים ונברכת הכובסין and בור he uses one סברא, the depth; and explains if it would say the shallower we would think the deeper needs more than three and if it would say the deeper we would think the shallower needs less than three,<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> However when the גמרא makes the צריכותא between אמת המים and נברכת הכובסין the גמרא uses two סברות (קביעי, וקוו וקיימי),<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> where seemingly it could have used one of them and make the צריכותא in the same manner of more than three or less than three. Why the difference?!<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם ומהרש"א.</i>

Line 9

<b>סלעים—Rocks</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה rules that one must distance סלעים from a neighbor’s wall three טפחים. Our תוספות clarifies what is the meaning of סלעים.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>אבנים שאש יוצא מהן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably flintstones. See רש"י ד"ה הסלעים who also interprets it in this manner. All the items in this category (including גפת, זבל, etc.), are all מוציא הבל they produce heat, which causes damage to the wall. </i> ולא סלעי נחושת<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">סלע may mean a rock or a coin. Copper (coins) also exudes heat; see later in this תוספות (footnote # 6). See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> דאין דרך להניחן אצל הכתלים –</b><br>סלעים means <b>stones from which fire is extracted, but not copper סלעים (coins) for it is not usual to place</b> coins <b>neat the walls –</b><br>תוספות comments on a related issue:<br><b>והא דאמר בירושלמי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">שבת פ"ד ה"א (in our text on דף כט,א).</i> אית תנא תני טומנין<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It is forbidden to wrap food and enclose it in something which is מוסיף הבל (adds heat). This איסור is called הטמנה (meaning ‘hiding’).</i> בסלעים ואית<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ואית תנא תני (instead of ואית תני).</i> תני דאין טומנין –<br>And this which is stated in</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי; ‘there is a תנא who teaches, one may be טומן in סלעים, and there is</b> another [<b>תנא] who teaches, it is forbidden to be טומן</b> in סלעים’. The ירושלמי reconciles these two rulings<br><b>כאן בסלעים של כסף כאן בסלעים של נחושת<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Silver coins do not emit heat, while copper coins do,</i> –<br>Here</b> where הטמנה is permitted, it is <b>silver coins,</b> and <b>here where it is prohibited it is by copper coins.</b> This concludes the citing of the ירושלמי there; תוספות continues –<br><b>הוה מצי לשנויי כאן בסלעים של אבנים כאן בשל כסף אלא ניחא ליה לשנויי כולהו במתכת:</b><br><b>The</b> ירושלמי <b>could have answered here it is by stone סלעים</b> (where it is אסור),<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">We see from our משנה that אבנים are מוסיף הבל (see footnote # 1.</i> and <b>here it is by silver סלעים</b> (where it is מותר); <b>however it was preferable to answer</b> the contradiction where <b>by all of them</b> we are discussing <b>metal</b> coins.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably the two תנאים were discussing similar cases (both coins; not one coins and one stones).</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>סלעים in the משנה refers to rocks, not copper coins since they are not found near walls. When differentiating between different rulings we prefer to make the difference as narrow as possible.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות (in the beginning) excludes copper coins (because they are not placed near a wall).<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> Why did not תוספות also exclude silver coins<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Generally a סלע is a silver coin (not copper) so if anything תוספות should have excluded silver coins. </i> as well (for the same reason)?<br>2. Is it permitted to place copper coins near a neighbor’s wall? Is it permitted to be מטמין in stones?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>וסד בסיד—And he plasters it with lime</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Regarding the first set of damagers in our משנה (בור וכו') the משנה writes 'וסד בסיד'.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא later on יט,א queries whether this means that we require two things, to distance three טפחים and סד בסיד, or only one is required; either distance three טפחים or סד בסיד. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> Regarding the second set of distancing (גפת וכו') it seems that it is not clear whether the גירסא is וסד בסיד or או סד בסיד. Our תוספות offers his opinion.<br>----------------------------<br><b>נראה לרבינו יצחק דבסיפא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The סיפא here refers to מרחיקין את הגפת וכו' שלשה טפחים וכו'.</i> נמי גרס וסד בסיד ולא גרס או –<br>It appears to the ר"י that in the סיפא, the משנה reads וסד בסיד and it does not read או</b> סד בסיד; תוספות proves this –<br><b>דאי גרסינן בסיפא או סד בסיד אם כן תפשוט<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> דברישא וסד בסיד תנן –<br>For if in the סיפא the גירסא is או סד בסיד, we can therefore resolve</b> the query <b>that in the רישא the ruling is וסד בסיד –<br>מדלא קתני או סד ברישא כמו בסיפא –<br>Since in the רישא it does not state או סד like it states in the סיפא</b>; rather it states וסד, so what is the query?!<br><b>אלא ודאי בסיפא נמי גרס וסד –<br>Rather in the סיפא we are also גורס, 'וסד'</b> (not או סד); therefore the גמרא queries whether it is וסד or או סד in the רישא –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דפשיטא ליה בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא when attempting to resolve the query whether the ruling in the רישא is וסד or או סד, stated that it must be וסד for if it is או סד, why divide the משנה into two categories (the רישא and the סיפא), since by both of them the rule is וסד, the משנה could have combined all the cases and conclude ג' טפחים או סד. It is apparent that the גמרא assumed that in the סיפא the ruling is או סד (despite that it is written וסד). This presents a difficulty according to the גירסת ר"י (see footnote # 5). </i> (לקמן דף יט,א) דבסיפא הוי או סד בסיד<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Since (according to the ר"י) the גירסא is וסד בסיד both in the רישא and the סיפא; why is it that regarding the רישא we are not certain whether וסד means וסד or או סד, but in the סיפא we are certain that וסד means או סד?!</i> –<br>And</b> the reason that <b>it is obvious to the גמרא that in the סיפא</b> the ruling <b>is או סד בסיד –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>היינו משום דאין ההיזק כל כך מרובה שלא יועיל לו סיד<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The היזק in the רישא is from מתונתא (moisture) and the היזק in the סיפא is from הבל (heat). </i> לחודיה:</b><br><b>This is because the damage in the סיפא is not the great, that סיד alone could not prevent it;</b> however the damage in the רישא is greater; therefore we are not certain whether in the רישא we require one or both of the remedies.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We are גורס וסד both in the רישא and סיפא. The damage in the רישא is greater than in the סיפא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According to the ר"י we are גורס both in the רישא and the סיפא, וסד בסיד. It turns out according to the query of the גמרא that it is possible that in the רישא the word וסד means ‘and’, and in the סיפא the word 'וסד' means ‘or’. It seems unusual that the same word in the same משנה means two different things!<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See תורת חיים (לקמן יט,א).</i><br>2. תוספות references the query later in the גמרא.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> The גמרא there<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">יט,א.</i> reads; איבעיא להו וסד בסיד תנן או דילמא או סד בסיד תנן. Is the גמרא asking what is the proper גירסא (in the רישא), or is the גמרא asking how do we understand the גירסא?

Line 10

<b>כליא—</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה states regarding the distancing of an oven from the wall that it is three טפחים from the כליא, which turns out to be four טפחים from the שפה. It is evident that the כליא protrudes out a טפח from the שפה. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to how to interpret כליא.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>פירש<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות cites the פר"ח as opposed to פרש"י ד"ה ואת who explains that כליא refers to the slanted base of the oven, which is wider on the bottom by a טפח compared to the top of the base. [Perhaps it is called כליא because the oven ends there.]</i> רבינו חננאל בטן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This protrusion is called a stomach for by (many) people the stomach usually protrudes.</i> דתנור צר מלמטה ובאמצעיתו מרחיב ובולט ויוצא כשיעור טפח –<br>The ר"ח explained</b> that כליא <b>means the ‘stomach’, for the oven is narrow at the bottom and in the middle</b> (of its height) <b>it widens and protrudes the size of a טפח –<br>ומאמצעיתו מיצר ועולה:</b><br><b>And from the middle it narrows as it rises</b> to the top (or rim) of the oven.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>כליא is the middle of the oven which protrudes a טפח (like a stomach).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there any advantage in the פר"ח over פרש"י, or vice versa?

Daf 17b



Line 1

<b>פתח בבור וסיים בכותל—He began with a pit an ended with a wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה states that one should not dig a pit near his friend’s <b>בור</b>, unless he distances his pit from his friends <b>wall</b> three טפחים. The גמרא asked why does he begin by mentioning בור and concluding by saying a wall. אביי answered that the משנה means from the wall of the בור. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to what the גמרא says next.<br>------------------------------<br><b>בקונטרס גרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה וליתני. The גמרא is asking (according to this גירסא), why does the משנה state 'מכותל' and we interpret it to mean מכותל בורו, when it can state explicitly 'מבורו'. </i> בתר דשני מכותל בורו שנינו וליתני אלא אם כן הרחיק מבורו –<br>After the גמרא answered, מכותל בורו שנינו, in פרש"י the text</b> of the גמרא continues and asks, <b>so let the משנה state ‘unless he distances from his בור’ –<br>ואינו נראה כמו שאפרש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בתוס' ד"ה מכותל.</i> –<br>And this does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>as I will explain –<br>ואי גרס לה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is saying if such a question (וליתני מכותל בורו) does appear in the גמרא, it should appear in the following manner.</i> הכי גרס לה פתח בבור וסיים בכותל וליתני אלא אם כן הרחיק מבורו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It should be one long question; first stating the problem (why פתח בבור וסיים בכותל) and then offering a suggestion what the משנה should have said. But not like פרש"י that after we asked פתח בבור וכו' and answered that מכותל בורו שנינו, we go and ask (again) וליתני אא"כ הרחיק מבורו.</i> –<br>And if there is such a גירסא, this is how it should be read; he begins with בור and ends with כותל, but her should have taught, ‘unless he distanced himself from his בור’ –<br>וכן משמע מתוך פירוש רבינו חננאל<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably תוס' means that the ר"ח agrees with the ואי גרס לה הכי גרס לה, that the question of וליתני מבורו is written in conjunction with the question of פתח בבור וכו', but not after the answer of מכותל בורו שנינו (as רש"י is גורס).</i> –<br>And so it seems from the פי' of the ר"ח –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty with his (and the sר"ח') proposed גירסא:<br><b>ואף על גב דבריש המניח<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there states; המניח את הכד ברה"ר ובא אחר ונתקל בה ושברה פטור ואם הוזק בה בעל החבית חייב.</i> (בבא קמא דף כז,א) כי פריך פתח בכד וסיים בחבית –<br>And even though that in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>המניח, when the</b> גמרא <b>asks</b> a similar question; ‘<b>he began with a jug and concluded with a barrel’;</b> the גמרא there <b>–<br>לא קא מסיים וליתני ואם הוזק בעל הכד כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">We see from there that the syntax of the גמרא is to merely pose the question and not offer the suggestion how it should be written (since that is obvious from the question), so why here does תוספות ‘condone’ (as well as the ר"ח) writing the suggestion after the question (since this suggestion is obvious)?! See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>Does not conclude, ‘but it should have taught ‘and if he was damaged the owner of the jug’, etc.</b> is liable’ –<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>אין לשון הגמרא שוה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore we cannot ask this type of question.</i> אלא פעמים מאריך ופעמים מקצר:</b><br><b>The language of the גמרא is not the same</b> everywhere, <b>but rather sometimes he elaborates, and sometimes he abbreviates.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The question of 'וליתני מבורו', according to רש"י is asked after the answer of 'מכותל בורו שנינו'; while according to תוספות, if anything, it is asked in conjunction and as an elaboration of the initial question פתח בבור וסיים בכותל (but not as an independent question after the answer of 'מכותל בור שנינו').<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks why here the גמרא adds the suggestion (of וליתני מבורו), while in המניח, the גמרא does not add וליתני וכו' בעל הכד חייב.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> Seemingly we can differentiate, that there the גמרא cannot say (with surety) וליתני בעל הכד, for perhaps the וליתני should be וליתני המניח את החבית (instead of המניח את הכד); however here the גמרא is sure that it should state מבורו (instead of מכותל חבירו). What is תוספות question?

Line 2

<b>מכותל בורו שנינו—We learned; from the wall of his pit</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה states that one should not dig a pit near his friend’s <b>בור</b>, unless he distances his pit from his friends <b>wall</b> three טפחים. The גמרא asked why does he begin by mentioning בור and concluding by saying a wall. אביי (or ר' יהודה) answered that the משנה means from the wall of the בור. Our תוספות explains the meaning of this answer.<br>-------------------------------------<br><b>כלומר לא מחלל בורו קאמר אלא מכותל שיש לבור שהראשון הניח כשחפר בורו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The second person obviously cannot dig on his neighbor’s property. We are saying that he cannot have the perimeter of his בור within three טפחים of his neighbor’s property. The space between the boundary line separating these two people and the outside perimeter of the first person’s בור, that space is called 'כותל בורו'. If the משנה would have said אא"כ הרחיק מבורו, we would assume that it means the cavity of בור # 1, so if the perimeter of בור # 1 is three טפחים from the boundary, the second person would be permitted to have the perimeter of בור #2 right by the border. Therefore the משנה states מכותל בורו that he must distance himself three טפחים from the border (regardless how far away בור # 1 is). כותל בורו is understood to mean the area between the perimeter of בור # 1 and the property line.</i> –<br>This</b> מכותל בורו <b>means</b> that the second person must distance himself <b>not from the cavity</b> (the interior) <b>of his</b> friend’s <b>בור, but rather from the wall which the בור has, which the first</b> person <b>allowed</b> space for <b>when he dug his בור –<br>ומהך מילתא דרב יהודה דייקא לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See later on this עמוד.</i> דאסור לסמוך מדהוזקק הראשון להניח כותל –<br>And from this statement of ר"י</b> (that מכותל בורו שנינו) the גמרא <b>later infers that it is forbidden to</b> dig a pit <b>adjacent</b> to the border, <b>since the first</b> one <b>was required to leave</b> space for <b>a wall –<br>ופריך מינה לאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">אביי maintains (shortly) that one may dig his בור as close as possible to his boundary line (סומך). The גמרא challenges אביי, since (אביי and)  ר' יהודה explain the משנה to mean מכותל בורו, indicating that (even) the first person was not סומך his בור to the border, but rather he had a כותל (a space between the outer perimeter of his בור and the border), this proves that even the first person who digs a pit, cannot be סומך, but rather must leave over some space for כותל בורו. </i> –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>challenges אביי</b> from this inference –<br><b>והשתא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">We are now saying according to תוספות that מבורו would mean from the cavity of the בור, and מכותל בורו means from the wall of the בור (the boundary, see footnote # 1).</i> לא אפשר למיגרס וליתני אלא אם כן הרחיק מבורו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This is how רש"י בד"ה וליתני is גורס. See previous תוספות ד"ה פתח (TIE footnote # 2). תוספות is saying that once we answered that מכותל בורו שנינו, we can no longer ask  וליתני וכו' מבורו, for that would be misleading, as תוספות goes on to explain.</i> דאם כן הוה משמע מחלל בורו –<br>So now</b> (after we answered מכותל בורו שנינו)<b></b> the text <b>cannot read 'וליתני אא"כ הרחיק מבורו', for then it would mean</b> that he has to distance himself <b>from the חלל בורו,</b> when in truth he needs to distance himself from כותל בורו –<b></b><br>תוספות addresses sרש"י' rejoinder to תוספות question:<br><b>ומה שפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה וליתני.</i> דאי הוה תני מבורו הוה ידעינא דמכותל בורו קאמר –<br>And this which רש"י explained that if the משנה would teach מבורו, ‘I would have known that it means מכותל בורו,</b> but not חלל בורו –<br><b>דאי מחלל בורו קאמר אין [זה] כונס לתוך שלו כלום<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">If בור # 1 was removed three טפחים from the border, בור # 2 can be at the border, so he is not כונס לתוך שלו. The expression אא"כ הרחיק indicates that בור # 2 cannot be on the property line.</i> כולי גרסת ספרו דחקתו<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">In sרש"י' text the question of וליתני was written after the answer מכותל בורו שנינו, therefore he needs to explain that even if the משנה would have said מבורו we would know that it means מכותל בורו.</i> –<br>For if</b> by מבורו the משנה <b>means חלל בורו,</b> it would turn out that <b>the second person need not recess into his</b> property <b>at all, etc.’; the reading of his text forced</b> רש"י<b></b> to say so –<br><b>אבל אין נראה דודאי אי תני מבורו הוה אמינא מחלל בורו קאמר ושרי לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3 that we derive from the משנה which states מכותל  בורו that even the first person must leave space (a כותל) between his בור and the property line. If it would not have stated מכותל בורו , but rather מבורו, we would assume that it means מחלל בורו, and we would not know that even the first person is אסור לסמוך.</i> –<br>However</b> sרש"י' explanation <b>does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for if</b> the משנה <b>would have taught מבורו, we would have assumed</b> that it <b>means</b> <b>מחלל בורו, and it is permitted to be סומך</b> to the border –<br><b>ואם הראשון הרחיק מאיליו מן המיצר ג' טפחים או יותר –<br>And</b> additionally <b>if the first</b> one <b>distanced</b> his בור, <b>on his own, three טפחים or more from the boundary –<br>הוה אמינא דהשני יכול לסמוך עד המיצר<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">He is still three טפחים distant from the חלל הבור.</i> –<br>We would have assumed that the second</b> one <b>can be סומך up to the border –<br>ואם כן צריך לשנות מכותלו לאשמועינן דאסור לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">This means that even the first person is אסור לסמוך (see footnote # 9) according to רבא (see shortly in our גמרא).</i> לרבא –<br>So therefore it is necessary</b> for the משנה <b>to teach 'מכותלו', according to רבא,</b> in order <b>to inform us that it is forbidden לסמוך –<br>ולאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">אביי maintains that it is מותר לסמוך (under certain conditions); why does it state מכותל בורו, why not מבורו.</i> צריך הרחקה בין שני הבורות ששה טפחים<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">Even if the first person was סומך (which is permitted according to אביי), the second person must distance the חלל בורו from the חלל בור # 1 a distance of six טפחים (so each בור has a כותל of three טפחים).</i> –<br>And according to אביי</b> it is necessary to state מכותל בורו to teach us <b>that a distance of six טפחים is required between the two בורות –</b><br>תוספות reconsiders (somewhat):<br><b>ומיהו יש ליישב הגירסא ופריך אליבא דאביי –<br>However we can justify the גירסא</b> of רש"י, <b>and</b> the גמרא <b>asks</b> 'וליתני וכו' מבורו', <b>according to אביי</b> (who maintains מותר לסמוך) –<br><b>דאליבא דידיה קיימא<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">אביי is the one who answered (according to one לשון) that מכותל בורו שנינו, and אביי maintains that מותר לסמוך, so we do not need the מכותל  בורו to teach us that אסור לסמוך (for according to אביי it is מותר לסמוך); the גמרא therefore rightfully asks let it state that he has to distance six טפחים מבורו..</i> דליתני אלא אם כן הרחיק מבורו<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">This means מחלל הבור.</i> ששה<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">This is not like גירסת רש"י in the משנה; of three טפחים. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> טפחים:</b><br><b>For we are discussing his</b> view, so therefore the גמרא can ask <b>דליתני אא"כ הרחיק six טפחים from his</b> friend’s <b>בור.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Once we interpret מכותל to mean מכותל בורו and it teaches us that אסור לסמוך, it is understood that the גמרא cannot ask וליתני מבורו, since we would not know that אסור לסמוך. However according to אביי it may be possible to ask וליתני וכו' (but six טפחים).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>When תוספות writes אא"כ הרחיק מבורו ששה טפחים, does he mean that the משנה should state ו' טפחים (in which case it is not at all like גירסת רש"י), or does תוספות mean something different?<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם ומהרש"א.</i>

Line 3

<b>למאי נפקא מינה למקח וממכר—How is this relevant; for buying and selling</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה, by stating מכותל is teaching us that a בור requires a wall of three טפחים, and this is relevant to מו"מ, that when one sells a בור and its wall, the wall must be at least three טפחים. Our תוספות points out that there is an additional relevance to this rule that כותל בור is three טפחים.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>הך נפקותא לא איצטריך<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">According to רבא there cannot be even a question למאי נפק"מ, since it teaches us that אסור לסמוך.</i> לרבא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא shortly (and the previous תוס' ד"ה מכותל [TIE footnote # 11]).</i> דהא קא משמע לן דאסור לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">One may not dig his pit immediately adjacent to the property line, even if the neighbor (on the other side) has no pit there. See TIE previous תוס' ד"ה מכותל footnote # 3.</i> –<br>According to רבא it is not necessary</b> to mention <b>this relevance</b> of מו"מ, <b>because</b> the <b>קמ"ל</b> of כותל בור שלשה teaches us <b>that it is forbidden לסמוך</b> (within three טפחים) –<br><b>אלא לאביי דקא סבר מותר לסמוך –<br>Rather</b> this question of למאי נפק"מ was <b>according to אביי who maintains that it is מותר לסמוך –<br>וקאמר למאי נפקא מינה –<br>So</b> on this<b></b> the גמרא <b>asks, what is the relevance</b> that a כותל בור is three טפחים (that the משנה chose to write מכותל) –<br><b>אי לאשמועינן דבעי הרחקה ו' טפחים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This is in a case where there is already a בור in one רשות, or if both sides want to dig a בור simultaneously.</i> ליתני אלא אם כן הרחיק מבורו ו' טפחים:</b><br><b>If it is to teach us that we require a distancing of six טפחים</b> between two בורות; the משנה <b>could have written,</b> he should not place his בור next to his friend’s בור, <b>unless he distanced</b> himself <b>from his</b> friend’s <b>בור six טפחים.</b> Why write מכותל?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה began with בור, so it should conclude with בור (not כותל).</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The question of למאי נפק"מ is only according to אביי, however according to רבא it teaches us that אסור לסמוך.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to תוס' that we are not גורס the question of 'וליתני וכו''; how do we understand the words הא קמ"ל, etc.?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

<b>אביי אמר סומך דהא אינה עשויה לבורות—<i>Abayay</i> said; he</b> may place it <b>near since it is not designated for pits</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>אביי maintains (in opposition to רבא) that one may dig his pit adjacent to his boundary line if the other field is not designated for digging pits. תוספות discusses this ruling.<br>--------------------------<br><b>והואיל וכן אינו מזיק לו אם הוא סומך –<br>And since this is so</b> (that the adjacent field is not עשויה לבורות), <b>he is not damaging his</b> neighbor, <b>if he is סומך</b>, since the neighbor will not be digging any pits in his domain <b>–</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דהא מפסיד הוא –<br>And the רשב"א has a difficulty; but his</b> neighbor <b>is losing,</b> by his placing his בור adjacent to the property line –<br><b>שאם יטע אילן יצטרך להרחיקו יותר מחמת שסומך זה עד המיצר –</b><br><b>For if his</b> neighbor <b>will</b> want <b>to plant a tree, he will need to distance it further</b> back on his property, <b>because of this one</b> who dug his pit <b>adjacent to the border –<br>דמרחיקין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This is the view of the ת"ק in the משנה on דף כה,ב.</i> האילן מן הבור חמש ועשרים אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The בעל האילן is losing this extra space, since he could have planted his tree closer to his boundary, if not for the בור. See מהרש"א that תוספות question seems to be that if the בעל הבור would be מרחיק three טפחים, the בעל האילן would only need to be מרחיק twenty five אמה, so his roots will not penetrate the כותל הבור. However now that the בעל הבור was סומך, he needs to move back an additional three טפחים (besides the כ"ה אמה) on his own property. We can no longer say that והואיל ואין מזיק לו, since he is מזיק him three טפחים (of his property). See סוכת דוד אות לח and ביאורים והערות (להרי"מ קנובלוביץ) אות ט. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>For</b> the rule is one must <b>distance,</b> when planting <b>a tree, twenty five אמות from an</b> existing <b>בור –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמכל מקום אינו עושה לו היזק –<br>And one can say; that nonetheless the</b> בעל הבור <b>is not damaging the</b> בעל האילן –<br><b>דהא דמרחיק יותר לא מפני שלא יזיקנו הבור אלא מפני שלא יזיק הוא לבור<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is distinguishing between one causing (direct) damage to his neighbor, where there is an obligation to distance oneself, and where one is causing that his neighbor needs to distance in order that the neighbor should not damage him (as in the case of the בור ואילן); in which case there is no need for the one who will be damaged to distance himself.</i> –<br>For</b> the reason the בעל האילן <b>distances himself more</b> (from the boundary) <b>is not in order so that the בור should not damage him, but rather because</b> the בעל האילן <b>should not damage the בור –<br>ולהכי אין לזה להניח מלסמוך בשביל כך דאם לא כן ירחיק<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote"> תוספות proves that in this case the בעל הבור is not required להרחיק (even though he inconveniences the בעל האילן), for if he were required להרחיק, he would need to be מרחיק כ"ה אמה, and we do not find such a requirement anywhere. </i> כל כ"ה אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה that תוספות means that the בעל הבור ובעל האילן would need to share equally that distance of כ"ה אמה; meaning that each one would need to distance himself twelve and a half אמות from the boundary.</i> את בורו:</b><br><b>So therefore</b> the בעל הבור <b>is not</b> required <b>to give up</b> his right <b>לסמוך on account of</b> the requirement for the בעל האילן to distance himself, <b>for if this is not so,</b> but the בעל הבור has distance himself on account of the אילן, <b>he should be</b> required <b>to distance his בור</b> from the boundary <b>the entire twenty-five אמות</b> (if it is a שדה העשויה לאילנות)!<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The חיוב of distancing is only if one is directly מזיק his neighbor, but if he is causing that the neighbor needs to take precautions not be מזיק him, there is no הרחקת נזיקין.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does not תוספות ask the same question on רבא (that you cannot be סומך); but nevertheless he is causing the בעל האילן to be מרחיק כ"ה אמה?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i><br>2. Why does not תוספות also ask the question on אביי ורבא according to the opinion that כ"ע בשדה שאינו עשויה לבורות סומך, and also on אביי if he maintains סומך even by a שדה העשויה לבורות?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See the ספרים in footnote # 2.</i>

<b>אביי אמר סומך—<i>Abayay</i> says, he can</b> dig <b>adjacent</b> to the border<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>אביי rules that if there is no other בור in the other רשות, he can dig a בור adjacent to the property line; according to one view (only) if the other field is אינה עשויה לבורות and according to the איכא דאמרי even if it is עשויה לבורות.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>אומר רבינו יצחק דלשתי הלשונות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’. Presumably תוספות is saying that even according to the א"ד that he may be סומך (according to אביי) even to a שדה העשויה לבורות, the same rule applies that the second party must distance himself six טפחים, and he cannot claim that his field is עשויה לבורות so therefore we should split the distance.</i> לאביי דאמר סומך –<br>The ר"י says that according to both versions of אביי, who maintains סומך –<br>אם בא אחד לחפור בור לאחר מכאן צריך הוא להרחיק כל ששה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> טפחים:</b><br><b>If the</b> neighbor <b>comes to dig a בור afterwards he is required to distance</b> his בור <b>the entire six טפחים</b> from the original בור.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The second party must distance himself the entire six טפחים (according to אביי).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does תוספות assume that the second party must distance himself six טפחים,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> perhaps he should only distance himself three טפחים to allow a כותל for the first בור, but no more?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See נתיבות המשפט סי' קנ"ה ס"ק יב and נחלת משה.</i>

<b>לאביי ניחא—According to <i>Abayay</i> it is understood</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא inferred from the משנה that if there is no בור in the adjacent field there is no need to distance his בור from the property line. This (seemingly) supports the view of אביי that even in a שדה העשויה לבורות, one may dig his בור at the boundary (as long as there is no other בור in the adjoining property). תוספות qualifies this proof.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>השתא סלקא דעתין דמכותל בורו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה stated אא"כ הרחיק מכותל חבירו, and we (אביי, ר' יהודה) interpreted it to mean מכותל בורו; that one does not merely distance from the cavity of the בור but rather from the כותל of the בור, which is three טפחים. See תוס' ד"ה מכותל [TIE footnote # 1 & 3] that we derive from מכותל בורו that even the first person must distance himself, so how can our משנה support the view of אביי.</i> היינו מחלל בורו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore we must say that at this point in the גמרא when it said הניחא לאביי it assumed that מכותל meant from the cavity of the בור and it assumed that the משנה was not precise when writing מכותל, for it did not mean actually מכותל but rather the cavity (which is adjacent to the inner part of the כותל).</i> ולא דקדק בלשון:</b><br><b>Now</b> (when we support אביי from the inference of the משנה) <b>we assume that</b> when the משנה stated that he needs to distance his בור <b>from כותל בורו, that means from the cavity of his בור, so he was not precise in his language.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא assumes now that מכותל בורו means מחלל בורו.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to this ס"ד, how much must the second person distance his בור from חלל בורו של חבירו?<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See חידושי הרשב"א (perhaps this is (also) included in the ולא דקדק בלשון which תוס' states).</i>

<b>הכי גרסינן בספרים ישנים סלע הבא בידים כולי וזה מרחיק ג' טפחים וסד בסיד—This is how it is written in older texts…</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites a ברייתא but does not specifically state which view is rejected by this ברייתא. There are also differing texts how the גמרא responded to this question and how it elaborated on this ברייתא. Our תוספות offers two גירסאות.<br>-------------------------<br><b>וקשה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read פירוש וקשה לאביי (instead of וקשה לאביי). תוספות learns that the question is on אביי.</i> לאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא clearly states that each one (even the first one) is required to distance himself three טפחים from the property line, while according to אביי the first one may dig adjacent to the property line without distancing.. The גמרא assumed that this law of distancing three טפחים is universally true whether it is בא בידים or not.</i> –<br>And</b> this ברייתא presents a <b>difficulty according to אביי –</b><br>תוספות continues with the גירסא of the sגמרא' answer according the ספרים ישנים:<br><b>הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is not like our גירסא in the גמרא and רש"י, where the answer is that בא בידים שאני, only then is a הרחקה required for the first person. See רש"י how he explains the question of ודקארי וכו' and בא בידים איצטריך.</i> נמי שבאו לחפור שניהם בבת אחת<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This answers the question on אביי, and there is no need to elaborate further (as far as the question on אביי is concerned). Nevertheless (as תוספות will point out shortly), the גמרא, since it cited this ברייתא, finds it necessary to explain it.</i> ובא בידים איצטריך ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly this rule that each one must distance three טפחים (if באו לחפור בב"א) is applicable in all situations, why does the ברייתא mention סלע הבא בידים?!</i> –</b><br>The גמרא answered; <b>here too</b> it is a case <b>where they both came to dig simultaneously.</b> The גמרא continues, <b>and it was necessary</b> to mention that it was earth which <b>crumbles</b> easily <b>in one’s hand.</b> תוספות continues with the גירסא of the ספרים ישנים <b>–<br>סלקא דעתך אמינא כיון דבא בידים ליבעי רווחא טפי קא משמע לן –</b><br>For <b>I may have thought</b> that <b>since it is בא בידים, it should required a greater spacing</b> (more than three טפחים), the ברייתא therefore <b>informs us</b> that three טפחים is sufficient. This concludes the גירסא of the ספרים ישנים –<br><b>והשתא לא היה צריך לאסוקי ובא בידים איצטריך ליה שהרי לא הקשה כלום מבא בידים<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See end of footnote # 2.</i> –<br>And now,</b> according to this גירסא, <b>it was not necessary to conclude</b> with the clarification <b>that 'בא בידים איצטריך ליה', for there was no question</b> on אביי, based on <b>בא בידים</b>, which the ברייתא stated –<br><b>אלא אגב דאייתי ברייתא מפרש לה –<br>Rather since</b> the גמרא <b>cited the ברייתא,</b> it chose <b>to explain it;</b> why mention בא בידים.<br>תוספות present an alternate גירסא:<br><b>ויש ספרים דגרסי טעמא דבא בידים הא לא בא בידים לא ופריך לרבא –<br>And there are some texts that read; the reason</b> we require distancing is since it is <b>בא בידים</b> (crumbling earth) <b>but if it would not be בא בידים</b> there is <b>no</b> need for distancing (for the first person); <b>and</b> the גמרא <b>is challenging רבא</b> according to this גירסא –<br><b>ומשני הוא הדין אפילו לא בא בידים ובא בידים איצטריך ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">According to this גירסא it was necessary for the גמרא to explain the בא בידים; otherwise there would be a question on רבא. </i> וכולי –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answers</b> on behalf of רבא, <b>‘the same rule</b> of distancing would apply <b>even if it was לא בא בידים, but it was necessary</b> for the ברייתא to teach <b>בא בידים, etc.’</b> that even by בא בידים three טפחים are sufficient.<br>תוספות offers conflicting views regarding differentiating between בא בידים and לא בא בידים:<br><b>ואין נראה לרבינו תם לחלק לענין היתר לסמוך בין בא בידים ובין לא בא בידים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The ר"ת is negating the previous גירסא which inferred that by לא בא בידים it is מותר לסמוך. According to the ר"ת if it is מותר לסמוך (like אביי) it is always מותך לסמוך (even if it is בא בידים) and if it is not מותר לסמוך it is never מותר לסמוך (even if it is לא בא בידים). Therefore since the ברייתא states מרחיק (by בא בידים), it inevitably means that it is always אסור לסמוך. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>And the ר"ת does not see any difference regarding permission to be סומך, whether it is בא בידים or whether it is not בא בידים –<br>ולרבינו יצחק נראה לחלק שפיר<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The ר"י (seemingly) supports the גירסא of the יש ספרים.</i> –<br>However the ר"י sees</b> sufficient reason <b>to properly distinguish</b> between the two:<b><br>דאף על גב דלא בא בידים שרי לסמוך בבא בידים אסור לסמוך –<br>That even though that by לא בא בידים it is permitted לסמוך,</b> nevertheless <b>by בא בידים it is אסור לסמוך –<br>לפי שהקרקע מתבקעת ונופלת קרקע של שדה חבירו:</b><br><b>Because</b> as soon as you start digging <b>the earth cracks and his friend’s land caves in.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to the ספרים ישנים the question is on אביי and the discussion why mention בא בידים is ancillary. According to the יש ספרים the question is on רבא and the discussion of בא בידים is central. The ר"ת ור"י dispute whether there is a difference regarding לסמוך between בא בידים and לא בא בידים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. The ר"ת writes that אין נראה לחלק וכו' בין בא בידים ובין לא בא בידים; however in the גמרא we see clearly that there is a סברא to differentiate between לא בא בידים, where three טפחים are sufficient, and בא בידים where I may have assumed that more than three טפחים are required. How can we reconcile the ר"ת with our גמרא.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br>2. Should we assume that the ר"ת agrees with the ספרים ישנים and the ר"י agrees with the יש ספרים?<br>3. The גמרא offers two reasons why רבא maintains אסור לסמוך, either because כי היכי דאת אימלכת וכו' אנא נמי וכו', or כל מרא וכו' מרפית לה לארעאי. Can we apply these two reasons respectively to the שיטות of the ר"ת and the ר"י?

Line 16

<b>מרחיקין את הגפת<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">גפת is the residue of pressed olives in the process of making olive oil. גפת and the other items associated with it exude heat (הבל) which damages the wall. See רש"י יז,א ד"ה גפת וד"ה הסלעים.</i> כולי טעמא דאיכא כותל כולי—One distances the <i>Gefes</i>, etc.; the reason is because there is a wall, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא derived from our משנה (which stated that we distance the גפת from the wall) that if there is no wall in the other domain one may place the גפת adjacent to the boundary, this seems to contradict רבא who maintains אסור לסמוך. Our תוספות clarifies this question on רבא.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות uses the word פירוש here to indicate that even though this is not understood so well, how this presents a difficulty for רבא (as תוספות will soon explain), nevertheless we must say that the question is on רבא!</i> וקשה לרבא –<br>The explanation</b> of this inference is that <b>there is a difficulty with רבא</b> who maintains אסור לסמוך (even if there is nothing being damaged on the other property) –<b></b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה מאי קושיא הכא ודאי מותר לסמוך בשאין כותל שאין מזיק כלום –<br>And it is astounding! what is the question?! Here</b> by גפת וכו' <b>it is certainly permitted to be סומך when there is no wall since he is not damaging anything –<br>וכשיחפוץ זה לעשות כותל יסיר את הגפת<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רבא ruled אסור לסמוך by a pit, for if he places his pit adjacent to the boundary, the other person will have to distance himself the full six טפחים in his רשות (instead of the ‘required’ three טפחים, since the ground will be wet from the water in the first בור). The problem is only when the other person wants to dig a pit and the first person will not want to stuff up and close his pit. However here (by גפת), initially there is certainly no problem (since there is no wall), and ultimately there will also be no problem, since he can (easily) remove the גפת.</i> –<br>And when this</b> other person <b>will want to make a wall he will remove the גפת –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהני נמי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The נמי may mean that not only do they damage the wall (if there is one), they also damage the ground (which will ultimately harm the wall). Alternately (preferably) it means that just like digging a בור and filling it with water makes the earth moist (thus damaging the other property), similarly here placing the גפת at the boundary ruins the ground. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> מקלקלין את הקרקע ויזיק לכותל לכשיבנה אפילו שוב יסיר –<br>And one can say that these items</b> (גפת וכו') <b>also ruin the ground and will</b> cause <b>damage to the wall when it will be built, even if he will remove them</b> before building the wall <b>–</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate answer:<br><b>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק דבכל אלו יש טורח בסילוקן –<br>And furthermore says the ר"י that by all these</b> items (גפת וכו') <b>there is a bother to remove them</b>; it is not that simple and easy –<br><b>ולכך מעתה יכול לעכב עליו כי יש לחוש שמא לא ימהר לסלקו כשירצה לעשות כותל –<br>So therefore</b> the neighbor <b>can prevent him as of now</b> from placing his גפת there, <b>since there is the concern that he will not remove it promptly when</b> the neighbor <b>wishes to build a wall –</b><br>תוספות has an additional question:<br><b>ואם תאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This question seems to be (only) according to the ועוד אומר ר"י.</i> אכתי מאי פריך לרבא –<br>And if you will say; but still what is the challenge to רבא –<br>הא מפרש טעמא לעיל משום דכל מרא ומרא דקא מחית מרפית לארעאי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">However here when he is placing the גפת on the border he is doing no damage at all (see footnote # 5).</i> –<br>Since he previously explained the reason</b> why one cannot be סומך a בור; <b>since every shovel full that you bang you loosen my earth –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דההוא טעמא לא קאמר אלא אליבא דרבי יוסי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">There is a dispute later in the משנה on כה,ב in a case where there is a בור in the neighbor’s property, the חכמים maintain that the other neighbor cannot plant a tree in his own property unless his distances the tree twenty-five אמות from the בור, while ר"י maintains there is no need to distance since he is planting the tree in his own property.</i> והכא לא פריך אלא אליבא דרבנן:</b><br><b>And one can say that this answer</b> (of כל מרא ומרא וכו') <b>was only said</b> to satisfy the view of רבא <b>even according to ר"י.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">רבא argues that even ר"י agrees with him, since the case of בור is worse than the case of the tree, for by the בור the neighbor can say כל מרא ומרא וכו'.</i> However here the challenge</b> to רבא was <b>only according to the רבנן.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">According to the רבנן (who prohibit planting a tree within twenty-five אמות of a בור) the reason why it is אסור to be סומך a בור to the border, because the neighbor can say, I also intend to dig a בור (and the water in your בור will prevent me from digging my בור). This reasoning applies to גפת as well.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One may not place גפת וכו' on the property line (according to רבא) either because it ruins the ground (for building a wall), or because he may not remove it promptly (ר"י). רבא does not necessarily employ the reasoning of כל מרא ומרא (according to the רבנן).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes in his first answer<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> that the גפת ruins the ground and ultimately the wall. Seemingly when one builds a wall, he first digs out a foundation, so seemingly any ground which was ruined will be excavated and removed, so why cannot he be סומך the גפת to the property line.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכת דוד אות מח.</i>

<b>דטירייא קשה לכותל—That vibrations are damaging for a wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that the reason one must distance a mill from the property line is because of the vibrations (טירייא) which damage the wall. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דלקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there cited a ברייתא which required distancing not only from a hand mill  (which vibrates and causes the earth to tremble) but also for a donkey driven mill (which is small and does not casue vibrations [see רש"י there ד"ה מאי]). Rather, says the גמרא, the reason is because both mills make noise (see רש"י there ד"ה משום).</i> (דף כ,ב) הדר ביה מטעמא דטירייא ומפרש אלא משום קלא –</b><br><b>Even though later</b> the גמרא <b>retracted from the reason of טירייא</b> (as the cause why we need to distance a mill three טפחים) <b>and</b> the גמרא there <b>explains, rather</b> the reason for distancing is <b>noise,</b> so why does the גמרא here state that the reason is טירייא?!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>מכל מקום נקט ליה הכא משום דמעיקרא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there first cited our משנה and explained that the reason is because of טירייא. Then the גמרא cited the ברייתא (see footnote # 1) where (seemingly) the reason of טירייא is inappropriate and concluded the reason is קלא. Nevertheless since the initial reason is טירייא and it is (seemingly) appropriate for a hand mill, therefore the גמרא here which is dealing only with a hand mill stated טירייא as the reason. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> הוה בעי לפרושי טעמא משום טירייא –<br>Nevertheless he mentions here</b> the reason of טירייא, <b>since initially</b> the גמרא there <b>wanted to explain the reason</b> for distancing <b>is because of טירייא –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate resolution:<br><b>ולספרים דלא גרסי אלא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In our text the גמרא asks (regarding the חמור); 'התם מאי טירייא איכא' and answers אלא משום קלא. However in other texts the word אלא is omitted. The answer then is that even by חמור there is טירייא, but it is caused (not by the shaking of the mill but rather) by the noise it makes which [also] causes vibrations. (See נחלת משה for a different interpretation).</i> אתי שפיר הכא דלההיא גירסא טירייא וקלא חד טעמא הוא:</b><br><b>And according to these text which do not read 'אלא', it works out well here. For according to that text טירייא and קלא are the same reason.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא mentions the reason of טירייא here (even though later the גמרא offers קלא as the reason) either because it was the initial reason, or because טירייא וקלא are the same reason.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why can’t we say that when the גמרא there stated 'אלא משום קלא' it meant that regarding the חמור mill it is משום קלא,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> but not regarding the regular mill?

Line 6

<b>לא יפתח אדם חנות של נחתומין—A person should not open up a bakery</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a משנה which states that one should not open up a bakery under a storehouse. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to the reason for this prohibition.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירוש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה חנות.</i> משום שהעשן קשה לאוצר –<br>רש"י explained because the smoke</b> from the bakery <b>ruins</b> whatever foodstuffs are in <b>the storehouse –</b><br>תוספות disagrees with פרש"י:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו תם דלקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כ,ב in the (first) משנה.</i> אמר ביין התירו שמשביחו –<br>And the ר"ת</b> has a <b>difficulty</b> with פרש"י <b>for later</b> the משנה <b>stated</b> if the אוצר contained only <b>wine, they permitted</b> to open a bakery underneath it, <b>since</b> the bakery <b>improves</b> the wine –<br><b>ועשן ודאי מזיק ליין דהא יין מעושן פסול לנסכים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה in מנחות פו,ב (see פרש"י there ד"ה מעושן). How can רש"י state that the reason why we cannot open a bakery is on account of the smoke; if that is the case why would we be permitted to open the bakery underneath the אוצר of wine, since the smoke will ruin the wine; not make it any better as the משנה states.</i> –<br>However smoke certainly ruins the wine, for smoked wine is unfit for נסכים</b> on the מזבח, since it is of an inferior quality –<br>תוספות offers his interpretation:<br><b>אלא נראה לרבינו תם דהיזק עשן ליכא כיון דאיכא שם תקרה ומעזיבה לא יכנס שם העשן –<br>Rather the view of the ר"ת is that there is no smoke damage since there is a ceiling and plastering</b> above the bakery, <b>the smoke will not enter</b> the storehouse above the bakery –<br><b>אלא טעמא שההבל מזיק את האוצר אבל את היין משביח –<br>However the reason</b> why not to open a bakery underneath a storehouse is because <b>the heat</b> of the baking <b>harms the אוצר, but</b> heat <b>improves the wine –</b><br>תוספות deals with an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>וגרסינן לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">כ,ב. In our text it reads אפילו קוטרא דשרגא (even the smoke of a candle).</i> אמר רב יוסף והאי דידן אפילו שרגא קשיא ליה כלומר הבלא דשרגא –<br>And the text there should read; ‘ר"י said but our</b> wine, <b>even a candle ruins it’; he meant the heat<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">ר"י was commenting that in the days bygone (in the time of the משנה, where it states משביחו) heat improved the wine, but nowadays even the heat of one candle spoils the wine. This is in accordance with תוספות explanation that we are dealing with heat, but not with smoke.</i> of the candle –<br>ולא גרסינן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4. Our גירסא there seems to support רש"י that the issue is smoke.</i> קוטרא דשרגא:</b><br><b>And the text does not read; ‘the smoke of a candle’;</b> for smoke always<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3. מעושן was פסול לנסכים even בזמן המשנה and before.</i> damaged wine.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The problem with a bakery under a storehouse is the smoke, according to רש"י; and the heat according to תוספות. Smoked wine is פסול לנסכים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we explain why רש"י (בד"ה חנות) mentions יין, since the next משנה states ביין התירו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש and סוכת דוד אות ג.</i>
<b>הא ליכא אוצר עביד—But if there is no storehouse he may make it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא inferred from the משנה that if there is no storehouse above, one may make a bakery, etc. (indicating that it is מותר לסמוך [not like רבא]). Our תוספות suggests an (alternate) answer.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>הוי מצי לשנויי הוא הדין כי ליכא לא סמיך והא קא משמע לן דהבלא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דהני קשה לאוצר (instead of דהבלא קשיא לאוצר).</i> קשיא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This is the same (type of) answer the גמרא gave on the previous (four) challenges to רבא.</i> לאוצר:</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have</b> also <b>answered; the same rule</b> will apply even <b>if there is no</b> storehouse above, and nevertheless one <b>cannot be סומך,</b> and the reason he mentions the אוצר <b>is to inform us that the heat</b> produced by <b>these</b> (the bakery, dye store, etc.) <b>damage the אוצר.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא could have answered (as it did previously); the משנה is merely teaching us that these items can damage the אוצר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that the גמרא could have answered that indeed even if there is no אוצר he is not permitted to be סומך, etc. How could the גמרא have said that, when in the ברייתא it clearly states 'אם היה רפת בקר קודמת לאוצר מותר', so it is obvious that if there is no אוצר one may be סומך (not like רבא)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם and פני שלמה. </i>

Line 7

<b>דיקא נמי דקתני אם היתה רפת בקר קודמת כולי—This can also be inferred;<br>for it was taught if the cattle stable preceded, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא stated that we can infer that דירה שאני (in a דירה, one may be סומך initially [even according to רבא], as opposed to other situations), since regarding a דירה, the ברייתא ruled that if the רפת בקר was there first, it is permitted. תוספות discusses and challenges this inference.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>ובכולהו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The words ובכולהו וכו' הכי are to be found in רש"י ד"ה דקתני.</i> הרחקות דמתניתין לא תני הכי והוה ליה לאשמועינן בשאר וכל שכן בדירה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The answer of the גמרא that דירה שאני assumes a priori that by a דירה there should be less restrictions on his use of the דירה than in other cases (see רש"י ד"ה דירה).. Therefore since the ברייתא makes the exception only by דירה, it is understood that in the other cases it is אסור לסמוך.</i> –<br>And</b> regarding <b>all</b> the required <b>distancing of our משנה, it was not taught</b> that if he came first he may be סומך, only here by דירה, so if the permission to be סומך applies to all the other cases (not like רבא), the ברייתא <b>should have informed us</b> that מותר לסמוך <b>by the other</b> cases (which are not a דירה), <b>and we would know that certainly by a דירה</b> one may be סומך –<br>תוספות challenges the דיקא נמי:<br><b>ותימה דלעולם בשאר הרחקות נמי מותר לסמוך והא דנקטיה הכא לאשמועינן רבותא –<br>And it is astounding! for really</b> we can maintain <b>that by the rest of the הרחקות</b> (even not by a דירה) <b>it is also permitted לסמוך, and the reason</b> the ברייתא <b>mentioned</b> this היתר <b>here</b> by חנות של נחתומין וכו', <b>is to inform us of a novelty –<br>דאף על גב דהוי גירי דיליה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">גירי דיליה means that he is causing the damage directly like one who shoots at someone with his arrows. The heat of the bakery directly damages the foodstuff in the אוצר. It seems from here that תוספות maintains that by the other הרחקות it is not considered גירי דיליה. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> אם היתה קודמת לאוצר מותר –<br>That even though it is ‘his arrows’,</b> nevertheless <b>if</b> the רפת בקר <b>preceded the אוצר it is permitted –<br>דהשתא הוי חידוש אפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In the משנה on כה,ב there is a dispute; the ת"ק maintains that one must distance his tree twenty five אמות from his neighbors בור. However ר"י maintains that there is no need to distance since זה חופר בתוך שלו וזה נוטע בתוך שלו. In this case it is not גירי דיליה, since the tree is not directly damaging the בור; the damage will only happen later. However, if it is a case of גירי דיליה even ר"י agrees that it is אסור. </i> לרבי יוסי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The bakery damages the אוצר directly; it is גירי דיליה so even ר"י agrees that if the אוצר was first, one cannot open a bakery underneath it. The חידוש is that even though it is גירי דיליה, but since there is no אוצר yet; one may open up a bakery, and keep it open, even if later the one above opens an אוצר.</i> –<br>For now it is a novelty even according to ר"י –<br>ואי אשמועינן בשאר לא הוי חידוש אלא לרבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The רבנן maintain that even when it is not גירי דיליה the מזיק must distance himself (see footnote # 4). However if there was no ניזק the מזיק can be סומך.</i> –<br>But if he would have let us know</b> this ruling that מותר לסמוך <b>by the other</b> cases (where it is not גירי דיליה), <b>it would have been a novelty only according to the רבנן –<br>אבל לרבי יוסי דקסבר על הניזק להרחיק לא הוי שום<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">In a case where it is not גירי דיליה even if there is a ניזק, the מזיק (according to ר יוסי) may do what he wants in his רשות (see footnote # 4), so what novelty is there that when the ניזק is not there, the מזיק can be סומך; it is obvious!</i> חידוש:</b><br><b>However according to ר"י, who maintains that the one who is being damaged needs to distance himself, there would be no novelty.</b> תוספות does not answer his question.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות asks that the reason he mentions the היתר לסמוך here, is because it is מותר even though it is גירי דיליה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It appears from תוספות that only this case of אוצר is considered גירי דיליה, but not the other cases in the previous משנה.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> However in the first תוספות in this פרק,<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">יז,א ד"ה לא. See also תוס' כב,ב ד"ה לימא.</i> תוספות writes that לא יחפור וכו' is considered גירי דיליה. How can we resolve this contradiction?!<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and נחלת משה.</i>
<b>דיקא נמי דקתני כולי—This can also be inferred, for it was taught, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא stated that we can infer that דירה שאני (in a דירה, one may be סומך initially [even according to רבא], as opposed to other situations), since regarding a דירה, the ברייתא ruled that if the רפת בקר was there first, it is permitted.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The answer of the גמרא that דירה שאני assumes a priori that by a דירה there should be less restrictions on his use of the דירה than in other cases (see רש"י ד"ה דירה).. Therefore since the ברייתא makes the exception only by דירה, it is understood that in the other cases it is אסור לסמוך. This seemingly presents a difficulty for אביי who maintains מותר לסמוך; why does the ברייתא state this rule only by a דירה if (according to אביי) it applies in all cases..</i><br>-----------------------------<br><b>ולאביי לא קשיא האי דיקא דלא משמע ליה שיהא חידוש בשאר טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">אביי disagrees with the a priori assumption (in footnote # 1) that there is more reason to allow לסמוך by דירה than in other cases; rather אביי maintains if you are permitted by דירה you are permitted just the same in other cases.</i> מבדירה:</b><br><b>And</b> this <b>inference</b> <b>does not present a difficulty for אביי, for to him it does not seems to be a greater novelty by the other</b> cases that it is מותר לסמוך <b>any more than by דירה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to אביי if one may be סומך by דירה, he may be סומך anywhere else.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why did not תוספות say that there is no difficulty for אביי, for he can maintain the reason the ברייתא spoke about אוצר is (not because דירה שאני, but rather) because there is a greater חידוש by אוצר, that even though it is גירי דיליה, it is still מותר לסמוך (as תוספות argued previously<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה דיקא (הא').</i>)?!<br>2. According to אביי that it is מותר לסמוך in all cases, why indeed did the ברייתא only mention אוצר?!<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>ואם היתה רפת בקר כולי—And if the cattle stable was, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא commented on the משנה of אוצר that if the רפת בקר was made before the אוצר, it is permitted to remain there. The משנה there mentioned other restriction under an אוצר including a bakery and dye store; what about them if they preceded the אוצר can they remain. תוספות deals with this issue.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>והוא הדין חנות של נחתומין ושל צבעין וחדא מינייהו נקט:</b><br><b>And the same ruling applies to a bakery and a dye shop,</b> and the ברייתא <b>mentioned one of them</b> (the רפת בקר), but it includes the others as well.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>All three prohibitions (including a bakery, a dye store and a רפת בקר) are lifted if they preceded the אוצר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can we find a חידוש that even by רפת בקר it is מותר if it came first, and certainly by חנות של נחתומין ושל צבעין, which would explain why the ברייתא mentions רפת בקר?<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכת דוד סוף אות י'.</i>

Line 8

<b>ותני עלה ד' אמות שאמרו כדי עבודת הכרם—And we learnt regarding this;<br>the four <i>Amos</i> which they said is in order to work the vineyard</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא first cited a משנה that one should not plant a tree near his neighbor’s field unless his distances it four אמות. The גמרא then cited a ברייתא explaining the משנה that the reason one needs to distance four אמות is in order to work the vineyard. תוספות explains why the ברייתא changes from a tree (in the משנה) to a vineyard (in the ברייתא).<br>------------------------------------<br>תוספות responds to the anticipated question:<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’.</i><br><b>הוה ליה למינקט כדי עבודת האילן –</b><br>The ברייתא <b>should have mentioned in order to work the tree</b> (not the vineyard), as it states in the משנה that מרחיקין את האילן –<br><b>אלא נקט עבודת הכרם לפי שנזכר לשון זה במסכת כלאים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">פ"ו מ"א and פ"ז מ"ג. The term 'עבודת הכרם' does not actually appear there (in our משניות).</i> גבי כרם שצריך הרחקה ד' אמות:</b><br><b>Rather</b> the reason he <b>mentions עבודת כרם is because this expression is mentioned in מסכת כלאים regarding a vineyard that it requires distancing of four אמות.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The term עבודת הכרם is used elsewhere therefor he uses it here (even) by אילן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly by כרם we are distancing ד' אמות to avoid the איסור of כלאים, so why mention it here where we are discussing (not כלאים, but) הרחקת נזיקין?

Line 9

<b>טעמא משום עבודת הכרם כולי—The reason is because of working the vineyard, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא challenged רבא (who maintains that it is אסור לסמוך [even if the היזק is not present now]) from a משנה later which states that one may not plant a tree within four אמות of his neighbor’s field, and the ברייתא explained the reason for distancing four אמות is because of עבודת הכרם. The גמרא infers from this that it is only because of עבודת הכרם that it is necessary to distance; otherwise it would not be necessary, which is in opposition to רבא who maintains אסור לסמוך. Our תוספות questions the need for this inference.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>בלאו האי דיוקא מצי למפרך בפשיטות דסגי בהרחקת ארבע אמות –<br>The</b> גמרא <b>could have asked simply, without this inference,</b> the משנה states <b>that distancing four אמות is sufficient –<br>ואי אסור לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">According to רבא one may not plant a tree in his property within twenty-five אמות of the property line, for perhaps his neighbor will decide to dig a בור there (and the roots of his tree will damage the בור).</i> היה צריך להרחיק כ"ה אמות –<br>But if,</b> as רבא rules that <b>it is forbidden לסמוך, he would need to distance</b> from his neighbor’s field <b>twenty-five אמות –<br>כדתנן לקמן (דף כה,ב) שמרחיקין את האילן מן הבור –<br>As the משנה taught later, that we distance the tree from the בור</b> twenty - five אמות; the reason the גמרא did not ask in this manner-<br><b>אלא ניחא ליה למידק דאפילו תוך ארבע אמות מותר לסמוך:</b><br><b>For he rather preferred to infer</b> from the ברייתא <b>that one may be סומך even within four אמות,</b> not only within twenty five אמות.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>From the משנה we can derive that one can be סומך a tree within twenty-five אמות; from the דיוק of the ברייתא we can infer that one may be סומך even within ד' אמות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If we were to prove from the משנה that it is מותר לסמוך within כ"ה אמות (as תוספות suggested) we would be faced with the question why do we need to be מרחיק even ד' אמות, therefore it was necessary to cite the ברייתא in order to explain why even though it is מותר לסמוך within כ"ה אמות, nevertheless it is אסור לסמוך within ד' אמות, because of עבודת הכרם.
<b>דמפסיק צונמא—That a rock separates</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explains the reason he does not need to distance (if not for עבודת הכרם) is because a rock separates the two fields therefore the roots of his tree will not penetrate into his neighbor’s field. תוספות explains why the need to distance (even) on account of עבודת הכרם.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">עבודת הכרם here means that he will plow the area of ד' אמות around the tree, therefore if he will plant the tree within ד' אמות, when he will be plowing around his tree, his plow will inevitable enter into his neighbor’s property. </i><br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אמאי צריך ד' אמות פשיטא שחוץ לצונמא לא יחרוש שלא יועיל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We only plow the soft earth around the tree, so it receives more nourishment, no one plows on a rock! The question is if it is מפסיק צונמא there is no need to distance the tree at all since he will not plow by the rock!</i> כלום לאילן –<br>And if you will say; why is it necessary</b> to distance the tree ד' אמות (even if we are concerned for עבודת הכרם); for <b>it is obvious that he will not plow past the rock</b> (which is on the border between the fields) <b>for that will not help the tree at all –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה אלא for an alternate answer (where he writes; וכן בשעת הבציר). See נחלת משה..</i> כשיחרוש עד הצונמא וירצה להפוך המחרישה לצד אחר –</b><br><b>And one can say that when he will plow up to the rock and will want to turn the plow around to the other side</b> (to plow there) –<br><b>המחרישה יכנס לשדה חבירו:</b><br><b>the plow will enter his neighbor’s field.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a need to distance ד' אמות even if מפסיק צונמא in order that he does not enter his neighbor’s property when he is turning the plow around.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to תוספות understanding that the ד' אמות is to prevent the turning around of the plow,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> why is this called עבודת הכרם (since there is no עבודת הכרם in these ד' אמות)?!
