Line 11

<b>היו שרשיו יוצאין כולי—Its roots extended, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asked how can we answer that we are discussing a case of מפסיק צונמא (there is a rock in between) for how does the משנה state that if its roots extend to the other property, he may chop them off; how can they extend since it is מפסיק צונמא. The גמרא answered that the משנה meant if there was no הפסק צונמא, and his roots extended into his neighbor’s field he may cut off the roots. Our תוספות is concerned how it came to be that he was so close that his roots extended into his neighbor’s field.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר היאך סמך אי שלא ברשות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If he planted the tree with his neighbor’s permission, obviously the neighbor cannot chop off the roots (see however נחלת משה).</i> אם כן יקוץ<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See the משנה later on כה,ב that if the tree was planted שלא ברשות, the neighbor may chop it down. Presumably תוספות means that he may chop it down, provided he pays the owner the value of the tree as the משנה states there קוצץ ונותן דמים. See later in this תוספות (footnote # 4).</i> –<br>And if you ill say; how</b> did he plant the tree so <b>close; if it was without permission</b> from the neighbor, <b>then</b> the neighbor should be permitted to <b>chop down</b> the entire tree (and not just to chop off the roots) –<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>וצריך לאוקמי בלוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A person owned a field and he planted a tree in the middle of the field, and then he sold half the field (which was adjacent to the tree [but not the part which had the tree]) to a buyer. The tree is now adjacent to his neighbor’s (the buyer’s) field. The buyer may chop of the roots, but may not chop down the tree (since it was planted ברשות). See the גמרא shortly that other cases were established in a case of a לוקח (see רש"י ד"ה הכא נמי).</i> –<br>And it will be necessary to establish</b> this משנה <b>by a buyer –</b><br>תוספות presents an alternate approach:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק בן אברהם אין נראה להעמיד בלוקח מדלא מסיק לה כדבסמוך –<br>However the ריצב"א does not agree that</b> this משנה is to be <b>established by a לוקח, since</b> the גמרא <b>did not conclude</b> here that we are discussing a לוקח, <b>as</b> the גמרא concluded <b>shortly</b> regarding another case; this proves that in this case we are not discussing a לוקח –<br><b>אלא נראה דמיירי בסמך שלא ברשות דאינו קוצץ האילן אלא בנתינת דמים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> –<br>Rather it is the view</b> of the ריצב"א <b>that we are discussing</b> a case <b>where he was סמך without permission</b> where the rule is <b>that he may not chop down the tree, unless he pays its value</b> to the owner –<br><b>ובזה לא רצה להאריך<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Instead the משנה stated the simpler rule that he may chop off the roots (without any payment).</i> ולהשמיענו:</b><br><b>And</b> regarding <b>this</b> rule (of קוצץ ונותן דמים) the משנה <b>did not wish to elaborate and inform us</b> of this rule (since it was taught already elsewhere).<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See משנה כה,ב. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>This משנה is either discussing a לוקח, or it was planted שלא ברשות, however the משנה did not wish to elaborate that he is קוצץ ונותן דמים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is it that the משנה taught the rule of קוצץ ונותן דמים by an אילן ובור, but not in the case of אילן ושדה?

<b>הכא נמי בלוקח—Here too; by a buyer</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that the משנה which stated ואם אילן קדם לא יקוץ is in a case of a buyer (לוקח); for otherwise how could he be סומך (to the בור). There is a three way dispute how to interpret 'בלוקח'.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה הכא who writes; אדם שנטע אילן בתוך שדהו ואח"כ מכר חצי שדהו לאיש אחר ובא הלוקח וחפר בור אין זה צריך לקוץ אילן שנטעו ברשותו. The tree is in the sellers field, where he had a right to plant it, so he need not chop it down when his neighbor (the buyer) digs a pit in his field. See ‘Thinking it over’. </i> שהאילן ביד מוכר –<br>רש"י explained that the tree</b> is now <b>in the possession of the seller –</b><br>תוספות disagrees:<br><b>ואין נראה לרבינו יצחק ברבי מרדכי דאם כן הוי ליה למימר במוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We are continually discussing the בעל האילן, so it should have said that the אילן is still by the מוכר </i> –<br>And the ריב"ם disagrees, for in that case</b> (that the tree is by the seller), the גמרא <b>should have answered</b> that the tree is <b>by the seller</b> (and not by the buyer) –<br><b>אלא נראה לו לפרש שהאילן ביד לוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The case is basically the same as according to פרש"י, except that he sold the field and the tree, so if the seller decides to dig a pit in his field, we cannot chop down the tree of the buyer since it was planted ברשוח..</i> –<br>Rather</b> the ריב"ם <b>prefers to explain that the tree is by the buyer –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ולשני הפירושים אלו אין להקשות מאי איריא שהאילן קדם אפילו קדם בור נמי –<br>And one cannot ask according to these two interpretations</b> (of רש"י and the ריב"ם), <b>why does</b> the משנה <b>teach us</b> the ruling of לא יקוץ in a case <b>where the tree preceded</b> the pit, the rule of לא יקוץ <b>should also apply even if the pit preceded</b> the tree; תוספות gives an example –<br><b>כגון שאדם אחד עשה הבור ואחר כך נטע האילן ומכר הבור לפירוש הקונטרס –<br>For instance where one person dug a pit</b> in his property <b>and afterwards planted a tree</b> in his property, <b>and</b> then he either <b>sold the pit according to פרש"י</b> that the אילן remains ברשות המוכר –<br><b>או אילן לפירוש רבינו יצחק ברבי מרדכי לא יקוץ שהרי בהיתר עשאן –<br>Or</b> he sold <b>the tree according to the פי' ריב"ם;</b> in either case there is <b>no</b> requirement <b>to chop down</b> the tree (even though it will damage the pit which was dug before the planting of the tree) <b>since it was done permissibly.</b> Why was it therefore necessary for the משנה to state that we do not chop off the tree if it was planted before the pit, it will not be chopped off even if it was planted after the בור as long as it was planted בהיתר <b>–</b><br>תוספות responds that in this example given, it is not considered בור קדם:<br><b>דבכהאי גוונא אילן קדם קרינא ביה שקדמה נטיעת האילן לערעור בעל הבור<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">בור קדם means that when he wants to plant the tree there is an ערעור from the בעל הבור (regardless whether he dug the pit it or not). However here since the owner is making both the בור and the אילן, there is no ערעור by the planting of the tree since it is the same owner. The ערעור takes place only after there are two owners, the בעל הבור and the בעל האילן but at that time the אילן was planted בהיתר; it was אילן קדם.</i> –<br>For in such a case we consider it</b> that <b>the tree preceded</b> the pit<b>,</b> <b>for the planting of the tree preceded the complaint of the בור owner –<br>דערעור אינו בא אלא על ידי מכירת בור או מכירת האילן –<br>Since the ערעור did not take place</b> previously (when it belonged to the same owner), <b>only later through the selling of pit</b> (לפירש"י) <b>or the selling of the tree</b> (לפי' ריב"ם) –<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>אבל לפירוש רבינו תם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read רבינו חננאל (instead of רבינו תם). See תוס' on the עמוד ב' ד"ה וסבר.</i> שפירש בלוקח שלקח מאדם אחד את אילן וטוענין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We say that perhaps the seller of the tree (to the current owner) came to an arrangement with the בעל הבור to allow him to plant (or keep) the tree there (or some other claim that allows him to plant and maintain the tree). The seller transfers this right to the buyer, therefore לא יקוץ.  </i> ללוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">There is a general rule that if a buyer (or an heir) gets into a dispute with a third party, בי"ד claims on behalf of the buyer (or heir) any claim which the seller (or the מוריש) could have claimed.</i> –<br>However according to the explanation of the ר"ת, who explain that 'בלוקח'</b> means <b>that</b> the בעל האילן <b>bought the tree from another person</b> and the reason why לא יקוץ <b>is because we</b> (the בי"ד) <b>argue on behalf of the לוקח –<br>קשה לרבינו יצחק מאי איריא אילן קדם אפילו קדם בור נמי –<br>The ר"י has a difficulty</b> with this פר"ת, for <b>why</b> does the משנה <b>teach</b> that if the <b>tree preceded</b> the בור, the rule is לא יקוץ, when according to the פר"ת <b>even if the בור preceded</b> the tree, the rule should <b>also</b> be לא יקוץ (since the seller had a right to maintain the tree and this right is transferred to the buyer)?!<br>תוספות has an additional difficulty on פר"ת:<br><b>ועוד כיון דהחזיק באילן ג' שנים איירי דבחזקת ג' שנים טוענין ללוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This rule that טוענין ללקוח (or ליורש) is only if the seller had a חזקת ג' שנים in the property (the tree), for then we assume that it is his property, therefore we transfer his rights to the buyer. however if the seller did not have חזקת ג' שנים, we are not certain that it even belonged to the seller and therefore we are not טוענין ללוקח.</i> –<br>And furthermore since we are discussing</b> a case <b>where</b> the seller <b>had a three year חזקה for this tree, for</b> it is only <b>by a חזקת ג' שנים that we argue on behalf of the buyer;</b> why is it necessary to establish the משנה by a לוקח –<br><b>לוקמה נמי בלא לוקח ובחזקה שיש עמה טענה:</b><br><b>Let us establish it even without a לוקח, but with a חזקה</b> of three years, where the בעל האילן <b>has a claim<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The claim of the בעל האילן is the same as in footnote # 6. He will claim that he bought this right from the בעל הבור, or something similar. It will be valid for him as it was valid in the case of a seller.</i></b> that he may keep his tree?!<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not answer. See פני שלמה (brought also in נחלת משה) who answers these two questions.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>בלוקח can mean either he sold the בור and retained the tree (רש"י), he sold the tree (ריב"ם), or he bought the tree from a third party (ר"ת; and טענינן ללוקח). The קדימה of the בור or אילן is determined by its status when there was an ערעור (complaint). According to the ר"ת it would seemingly make no difference what was קדים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to whom is there a greater חידוש (by a לוקח) that לא יקוץ; according to רש"י or the ריב"ם?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכת דוד אות כא (עד"ז).</i>

<b>לגלוגי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The marginal note indicates that this תוספות is referencing the גמרא on the עמוד א'. See however הגהות הב"ח at the end of תוד"ה ואי that this תוספות should follow and be after the three תוספות on this עמוד.</i> חרדל—Mustard plants<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות will cite various interpretation of the word 'לגלוגי'.</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a משנה which stated that one must distance his mustard plants (חרדל) from the beehive (דבורים).<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י on the עמוד א' ד"ה ואת החרדל that the bees eat the sharp mustard and it makes them consume their honey causing a loss to the beekeeper.</i> However ר' יוסי permits leaving the חרדל by the דבורים since the בעל החרדל can say to the בעל הדבורים; ‘instead of me distancing myself from the דבורים you should distance your דבורים from my חרדל, since they eat up לגלוגי חרדלאי’. There are differing opinions as to the meaning of לגלוגי.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">לקמן כה,ב בד"ה לגלוגי.</i> פרחים ובערוך פירש גרעין –<br>רש"י explained</b> that לגלוגי <b>are the flowers</b> of the mustard plant, <b>and in the ערוך he explained</b> that it refers to the mustard <b>seed –</b><br>תוספות disagrees:<br><b>ותרוייהו אין נראה לרבינו יצחק דהא קאמרי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Later on this עמוד.</i> רבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The רבנן maintain that the mustard must be distanced from the bees because they cause a loss to the beekeeper, but the bees cause no damage to the mustard (in opposition to the view of ר' יוסי) </i> דבורים לחרדל לא מזקי –<br>And the ר"י does not subscribe to both of these</b> interpretations, <b>since the רבנן reply</b> to ר' יוסי; ‘<b>the bees do not damage the mustard’,</b> and the רבנן continue to explain –<br><b>אי בבינתא כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The bees cannot find the seed because it is encased in its pod.</i> אי בטרפא כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It does not matter that the bees will eat the leaves  for it will grow back, so no damage is done.</i> משמע דלא פירש רבי יוסי בדבריו מה הן מזיקין –<br>‘If</b> you mean that the bees damage <b>the seed, etc.</b> it is not so, and <b>if</b> you mean <b>the leaves, etc.</b> it is not so’. <b>It is evident</b> from this equivocal response of the רבנן, <b>that ר"י was not explicit in his words</b> as to <b>what</b> exactly the bees <b>are damaging –<br>ולכך היו מסתפקין אי בבינתא כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">How then can רש"י and the ערוך be specific as to the meaning of לגלוגי (either seed or flower), when even the רבנן were not sure what ר"י meant with לגלוגי?!</i> –<br>So therefore</b> the רבנן <b>were in doubt whether</b> ר"י meant <b>the seed etc. –</b><br>תוספות offers his interpretation:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דלגלוגי הם ענפים והשתא לא פירש רבי יוסי מה הם מזיקות –<br>And it is the view of the ר"י that לגלוגי are the branches</b> of the mustard plant (on which there are both seeds and flowers); <b>so now ר"י was not specific what they are damaging</b> on the branches (whether it is the seed or the flowers) –<br><b>לכך אמרו ליה רבנן אי בבינתא כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See previously footnote # 7 and 8.</i> –<br>So therefore the רבנן said</b> to ר"י <b>if</b> you mean <b>the seed, etc.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מכל מקום הרי הן מזיקין לחרדל<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This question seems to be directed to the answer of the רבנן, but it does not seem connected to the previous discussion as to the meaning of לגלוגי. See (however) ‘Thinking it over’.</i> שיאכלו הפרחים<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The flowers are revealed (not like the seed) and do not grow back (not like the leaves). They are necessary for the growth of the plant.</i> –<br>And if you will say;</b> regardless<b></b> that there no damage regarding the seeds (because they can’t find them) and the leaves (because they grow back), <b>nevertheless</b> the bees <b>are damaging the mustard for they will eat the flowers –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר שהפרחים אינן כי אם מעט<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The חתם סופר amends this to read מעט זמן וביום (instead of מעט וביום).</i> וביום או יומים שיעמדו<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The function of the flowers is for a short time (a day or two); afterwards they fall off and are not necessary. In this short time the bees cannot consume enough of the flowers to cause any harm to the mustard plant. See סוכת דוד יט,א אות א'.</i> אין יכולין להזיק:</b><br><b>And one can say; that the flowers are only there for a short time, and in the day or two that</b> the flowers <b>stand,</b> the bees <b>cannot harm</b> them.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>לגלוגי can mean either flower (רש"י), seed (ערוך), or branches (ר"ת). Eating the (short term) flowers will not cause damage to the plant<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to רש"י that לגלוגי means flowers, why did the רבנן only discuss the seeds and the leaves, but not the flowers?!

Line 1

<b>ואי לא סמיך היכי משכחת לה—And if one cannot</b> come <b>close, how did it happen</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a משנה which stated that one must distance his mustard plants (חרדל) from the beehive (דבורים).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י on the עמוד א ד"ה ואת החרדל that the bees eat the sharp mustard and it makes them consume their honey causing a loss to the beekeeper.</i> However ר' יוסי permits leaving the חרדל in its place, since the בעל החרדל can say to the בעל הדבורים, ‘instead of me distancing myself from the דבורים, you should distance your דבורים from my חרדל, since they eat up לגלוגי חרדלאי’. The גמרא asked according to רבא that one is not permitted to be סומך (even if the item to be damaged is not there yet), how is it possible that the חרדל and דבורים were in close proximity, since it is אסור לסמוך?!<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly the ‘real’ question is that if it is אסור לסמוך then (even) if the בעל הדבורים was סומך first, but since it was באיסור, why are we obligating the בעל החרדל to do the complete distancing; the בעל הדבורים is also guilty.</i><br>----------------------------------<br><b>פירש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The need for this 'פירש' is that seemingly even according to אביי the מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן is not understood. For ממ"נ, if the בעל החרדל was סומך first בהיתר, why do the חכמים require the בעל החרדל to distance himself, and if the בעל הדבורים was סומך first בהיתר, why does ר"י maintain that the בעל החרדל does not need to be מרחיק; he was סומך באיסור! </i> רבינו יצחק בשלמא לאביי דאמר סמיך אתי שפיר דמיירי שסמך בעל דבורים תחילה –<br>The ר"י explained; granted, according to אביי, who maintains</b> that one may be <b>סומך,</b> the משנה <b>is properly understood, for we are discussing</b> a case <b>where the beekeeper was סמיך first</b> (his bees were near the property line where later his neighbor planted mustard) –<br><b>ואף על גב דהשתא קא סלקא דעתין דדבורים נמי מזקי לחרדל לכולי עלמא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It is only later in the גמרא that רבינא states that according to the רבנן the bees are not מזיק the חרדל. However now where the ברייתא states that the בעל החרדל complains to the בעל הדבורים that אכלי לגלוגי חרדלאי and the רבנן did not respond to that, it would seem that all agree that the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל. See footnote # 25.</i> –<br>So even though that now</b> (in this הו"א) <b>we assume that all agree that the bees also damage the חרדל,</b> so why can the beekeeper allow his bees to remain when the other is planting mustard<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably תוספות means they should both distance themselves equally, since they are both מזיקים. At this point (when saying this אע"ג), תוספות thinks that this case may not similar to the case of two בורות where the second מזיק is required to make the entire הרחקה, for we can argue (perhaps) that חרדל ודבורים is different from שני בורות (see shortly in this תוספות, that this indeed is the סברא of רב יוסי).</i> –<br><b>מכל מקום סברי רבנן דעל המזיק שני דהיינו בעל חרדל להרחיק את<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read את עצמו כל ההרחקות כמו (instead of את כל ההרחקה כמו).</i> כל ההרחקה –<br>Nevertheless the רבנן maintain that the second damager, meaning the בעל החרדל is required to distance himself the entire</b> amount <b>of distancing</b> that is required –<br><b>כמו גבי בור דאם סמך הראשון<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">According to אביי by a שדה שאינה עשויה לבורות, one may certainly be סומך, and according to one version he may be סומך (according to אביי) even by a שדה העשויה לבורות.</i> על המיצר השני מרחיק כל ששה טפחים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' יז,ב ד"ה אביי (הב'). We do not require the first one to fill up his בור and distance his (new) בור three טפחים from the boundary. Rather he remains in place and the second בור (which is also a מזיק [to the first בור]) must distance the entire six טפחים. The applies to the בעל הדבורים; since he was סומך בהיתר, the בעל החרדל must move the entire distance.</i> –<br>Just as by a pit that if one was סומך by the boundary, the second one</b> who wishes to dig a בור <b>is required to distance the entire six טפחים.</b> This explains how we can understand the רבנן according to אביי. Now תוספות will explain ר' יוסי according to אביי <b>–<br>ורבי יוסי סבר כיון דדבורים מזקי חרדל ועשה קצת שלא כהוגן –<br>And ר"י maintains that since the bees damage the mustard and he acted somewhat improperly –<br>שסמך על המיצר שזה עתיד לסוף לזרוע חרדל<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">We are somehow assuming that the בעל הדבורים was aware that his neighbor may be planning on planting חרדל.</i> –<br>For he was סומך at the boundary where his</b> neighbor <b>will eventually plant חרדל later,</b> so <b>–<br>אף על פי שבדין אינו יכול למונעו שלא יסמוך מכל מקום קצת שלא כהוגן עושה –<br>Even though legally</b> the future בעל החרדל <b>cannot prevent</b> the בעל הדבורים <b>from being סומך</b> (for we are now following the view of אביי)<b>, nevertheless</b> the בעל הדבורים <b>acted somewhat improperly,</b> therefore –<br><b>וגם<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read גם (instead of וגם).</i> בעל חרדל יכול לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">He can tell the בעל הדבורים; you can distance from me if you so choose, however I am not moving from here.</i> –<br>The בעל החרדל can also be סומך –<br>ולא דמי לבור דהתם משום דמרפי ליה לארעיה ומזיק השני בידים לכותל בורו של ראשון –<br>And</b> this case here <b>is not similar to a בור</b> (where the second מזיק [which here would be the בעל החרדל] needs to move the entire distance), <b>for there</b> the second בעל הבור <b>is loosening the ground</b> (by his digging) <b>so that the second</b> בעל הבור <b>is</b> directly <b>damaging with his hands the wall of the first בור –<br>לכך על השני להרחיק כל ההרחקה אבל הכא לא –<br>Therefore</b> (since there is direct damage from the שני) <b>the second</b> בעל הבור <b>is required to move the entire distance, but here</b> where the בעל החרדל is not damaging the bees directly,<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">He is merely causing him damage indirectly (גרמא), since the bees eat the mustard and consume the honey.</i> the בעל החרדל <b>is not</b> required to move. This is how we can understand the views of the רבנן ור"י according to אביי.<br>In summation; according to אביי the מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן is where the בעל הדברים was סומך first (and everyone agrees that the דבורים and the חרדל damage each other). The dispute hinges on whether this case is similar to two בורות where the second בור needs to make the entire הרחקה (the view of the רבנן) or that this is not similar to בור, where the second בור is מזיק בידים (therefore he makes the entire הרחקה) however here the בעל החרדל is not מזיק בידים [and the בעל הדבורים acted<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">If not for this סברא that the בעל הדבורים acted קצת שלא כהוגן (so even though it is still not similar to ב' בורות), nevertheless the חרדל would need to be מרחיק, since the בעל הדבורים acted בהיתר גמור, so why should he be מרחיק.</i> שלא כהוגן], therefore the בעל החרדל need not move any more than the בעל הדבורים (the view of ר' יוסי).<br>תוספות goes on to explain why according to רבא there is a difficulty:<br><b>אלא לרבא דאמר לא סמיך היכי משכחת לה דבעל החרדל ירחיק כל ההרחקה לרבנן –<br>However according to רבא, who maintains לא סמיך, how is it possible that according to the רבנן the בעל החרדל has to move the entire distance –<br>ולרבי יוסי לא ירחיק כלל –<br>And according to ר"י</b> the בעל החרדל <b>does not distance at all –<br>דכיון דתרוייהו מזקי אהדדי על כל אחד ואחד להרחיק חצי ההרחקה –<br>For since that both of them are damaging each other, each one should be required to move half the distance –<br>ואפילו סמך בעל דבורים תחלה יש לו לסלקם הואיל ושלא כדין סמכם –<br>And even if the בעל הדבורים was סומך first, he should remove his</b> bees <b>since he was סומך illegally</b> (according to רבא). This is the explanation of the sגמרא' question on רבא.<b></b><br>In summation; the question on רבא is that since we are assuming now that the דבורים and חרדל damage each other, and neither had permission to be סומך; the rule should be that both should be מרחיק (each one) a half, so why do the רבנן maintain that only the חרדל should be מרחיק, and ר"י maintains neither are required to be מרחיק?!<br>תוספות continues with the explanation of the answer of רב פפא:<br><b>אמר רב פפא בלוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ריב"ם in the תוס' יח,א ד"ה הכא it seemingly should have said במוכר. עיי"ש.</i> שזרע חרדל ומכר חצי שדהו והלוקח העמיד דבורים –<br>רב פפא answered</b> we are <b>discussing a buyer,</b> meaning <b>that</b> the owner of the field <b>planted mustard and</b> afterwards <b>he sold half his field</b> (which did not have any mustard plants) <b>and the buyer set up bees</b> in his part of the field –<br><b>וסברי רבנן כדמסיק<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 34.</i> דדבורים לא מזקי לחרדל ועל המזיק להרחיק את עצמו –<br>And the רבנן maintain</b> (now in this answer of ר"פ) <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>will conclude</b> (later according to רבינא) <b>that the bees do not damage the mustard, so</b> therefore <b>it is incumbent that the damager</b> (the בעל החרדל) <b>should distance himself</b> from the bees –<br><b>אף על פי שסמך בהיתר –<br>Even though he was permitted</b> initially <b>to be סומך (</b>since then it was all his field) –<b></b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דגבי אילן כשסמכו בהיתר אמרי דלא יקוץ –<br>Even though that by the tree</b> (and the בור) <b>when he was סומך</b> the tree <b>legally</b> (before there was a בור),<b></b> the משנה <b>states that it is not chopped off,</b> so why here is the בעל החרדל required to move his plants (he was סומך בהיתר)?!<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>הני מילי אילן שעשוי לעמוד שנים רבות ואיכא הפסד מרובה –<br>When were these words</b> said (that if it was בהיתר the rule is לא יקוץ) by <b>a tree, which is planted to remain for many years and there is a great loss</b> if we chop down the tree –<br><b>אבל משרה כרישין וחרדל לא –<br>However</b> regarding a <b>soaking pit, leeks or mustard,</b> this rule <b>does not</b> apply, since there is not that much difficulty in removing them and there is no great loss, therefore we say that since he is the (only) מזיק, the בעל החרדל is required to move –<br>תוספות proves that אילן is different from other cases:<br><b>דהכי נמי אמרינן<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">משנה כה,ב.</i> גבי אילן אם הבור קדם קוצץ ונותן דמים אף על גב דסמך אילנו באיסור –<br>For this is also what we say regarding a tree</b> that <b>‘if the בור preceded the tree</b> (and he planted the tree within twenty-five אמות of the בור) the rule is that the בעל הבור may <b>chop down the tree and pay</b> the tree owner <b>the value</b> of the tree, <b>even though</b> the בעל האילן <b>was סומך the tree illegally</b> (since there was a בור within twenty-five אמות of the tree) –<br><b>ובשאר דברים הנסמכים באיסור אינו נראה שיתנו דמים –<br>However by other cases</b> where he was <b>סומך illegally it does not seem</b> that the neighbor (the potential ניזק) is required <b>to pay money</b> for the removal of the מזיק. Why is there this difference –<br><b>אלא טעמא דלהפסד מרובה חששו<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore just as regarding the payment of money for the removal of a מזיק; it is only required by a tree but not for other מזיקים, the same applies for the requirement to remove the מזיק that we are lenient only by a tree, but not by other מזיקים (such as חרדל), and they need to be removed even though they were סומך בהיתר.</i> –<br>Rather the reason</b> for this distinction is <b>that</b> the רבנן <b>were concerned for a large loss</b> (by a tree), but not for a minor loss. This concludes the view of the רבנן (according to רב פפא) –<br><b>ורבי יוסי סבר דדבורים מזקי לחרדל וצריך בעל דבורים להרחיק כל ההרחקה –<br>However ר"י maintains that the bees harm the mustard</b> plant, <b>so the beekeeper must move away the entire distance –<br>כיון דבעל חרדל לא עשה כלל שלא כהוגן<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">When he planted the חרדל the entire field was his and he could plant wherever he pleases. This is a much greater היתר than according to אביי that one may be סומך to his neighbor’s field, for here the entire field is his; there is no issue of סמיכה at all. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –<br>Since the בעל החרדל did not do anything improper;</b> only the בעל הדבורים acted improperly by placing his bees near the חרדל where they would damage the חרדל –<br>In summation; the answer of ר"פ is that initially the whole field belonged to the בעל החרדל and then he sold part of his field (which did not have חרדל) to the person that later placed דבורים there. The רבנן maintain that since the דבורים do not damage the חרדל (so there is no need for him to distance himself), it is incumbent upon the בעל החרדל to distance (even though he planted בהיתר), since there is no great loss nor much bother to distance the חרדל. However ר"י maintains that the דבורים damage the חרדל (and the חרדל was planted בהיתר גמור), therefore the דבורים need to make the entire הרחקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The מחלוקת then is simply whether the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל or not, there seems to be no other issue here.</i><br>תוספות reacts to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">It is evident (from the sגמרא' question אי בלוקח מ"ט דרבנן) that the בעל החרדל owned the original field and he sold it to the (ultimate) בעל הדבורים, the question תוספות is anticipating is why did not the גמרא establish the case, where the בעל הדבורים was the original owner and sold part of the field to the (ultimate) בעל החרדל?</i><br><b>ומשום הכי<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to תוספות explanation (of ר"י) that the בעל החרדל is not required to distance himself, since לא עשה כלל שלא כהוגן; he did not act improperly at all (see footnote # 18).</i> נמי לא בעי לאוקמי כשסמך בעל דבורים תחלה ובלוקח –<br>And because of this</b> reason we can <b>also</b> understand why the גמרא <b>did not want to establish</b> the case of חרדל <b>where the beekeeper was סומך first and</b> another person <b>bought</b> part of his field and planted חרדל there –<br>תוספות first explains what advantage there would be in this case:<br><b>ולא היה צריך לדחוק ולומר דלרבנן על המזיק להרחיק אף על פי שעשה בהיתר<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">The way ר"פ is explaining it that the field belonged initially to the בעל החרדל, it is difficult to understand why the בעל החרדל (who planted the חרדל בהיתר) is required to distance himself from the דבורים which came later; why is this different from אילן ובור (see footnote # 23). </i> –<br>For it would not have necessary to cumbersomely explain that according to the רבנן, the מזיק is required to distance himself even if he did it permissibly –<br>מה שאינו גבי אילן ובור<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">By אילן ובור, if the אילן was first, he is not required to distance himself; why is it different by חרדל ודבורים. The answer which תוספות gave that by אילן ובור there is a הפסד מרובה is considered to be (somewhat of) a דוחק!</i> –<br>Which will be different from</b> the case <b>of a tree and a pit –</b><br>An additional advantage in establishing the בעל הדבורים as the initial owner:<br><b>וגם לא יצטרך לומר דלרבנן דבורים לא מזקי לחרדל ופליגי ארבי יוסי –<br>And it will also not be necessary to say that according to the רבנן the דבורים do not damage<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">If the דבורים (which came later) are מזיק the חרדל (which was planted ברשות), the רבנן would certainly agree with ר"י (see footnote # 19). Therefore the רבנן must maintain that the דבורים are not מזיק the חרדל. However if the דבורים would be the initial owner (and they were there ברשות) so even if the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל, it would be understood why the בעל החרדל has to distance (and not the בעל הדבורים), since the דבורים were there ברשות and the בעל החרדל (who is מזיק the דבורים) came later שלא ברשות.</i> the חרדל and argue with ר"י,</b> who maintains that they indeed damage the חרדל. <sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">It is generally accepted that we try to avoid a מחלוקת in a fact (whether the bees are or are not מזיק the חרדל); it is either one way or the other. If we would establish that the דבורים came first, this difficulty would be avoided.</i> The question is why indeed did we not establish that the דבורים came first?!<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>דאם כן כיון דבעל דבורים סמך בהיתר ולא עשה שלא כהוגן –<br>For if</b> that would <b>indeed</b> be the case that the בעל הדבורים was first, so <b>since the בעל הדבורים was סומך בהיתר and did nothing improper –<br>לא היה מתיר רבי יוסי לבעל חרדל לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore even though it would be advantageous, in order to better understand the view of the רבנן, if the case was that the בעל הדבורים was first, nevertheless since in that case the position of ר"י would be untenable, it was necessary to justify the view of ר"י (by saying the חרדל was first) even though there is some difficulty in understanding the view of the רבנן.</i> –<br>ר"י would not permit the בעל החרדל to be סומך,</b> since the בעל הדבורים acted properly and the בעל החרדל did not.<br>In summation; we cannot say that the case of לוקח is where the בעל הדבורים owned the field first and then sold it to the (eventual) בעל החרדל for (even though we would gain in our understanding of the רבנן)<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">We would not need to distinguish between אילן ובור and חרדל ודבורים and there would be no מחלוקת in מציאות.</i> the position of ר"י would be not acceptable.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר נוקי פלוגתייהו בלא לוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא makes no mention of a לוקח, so why complicate the case.</i> –<br>And if you will say, let us establish their argument without a buyer</b> and the בעל החרדל was סומך first (as in the case with a לוקח) –<br><b>דלרבנן דדבורים לא מזקי לחרדל צריך בעל חרדל להסיר ולהרחיק כל ההרחקה –<br>So according to the רבנן that the bees do not damage the mustard, the בעל החרדל is required to remove</b> the חרדל <b>and to distance</b> the חרדל <b>the entire distance,</b> so as not to damage the בעל הדבורים; he needs to do so<br><b>אף על פי שסמך תחלה<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">We are discussing this case according to the view of רבא that it is אסור לסמוך.</i> –<br>Even if he was סומך first,</b> since his סמיכה was not בהיתר <b>–<br>ולרבי יוסי כיון דתרוייהו מזקי אהדדי אין לבעל החרדל להרחיק כל ההרחקה אלא החצי<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">It will be basically the same מחלוקת as according to ר"פ, however by ר"פ (who establishes the מחלוקת by a לוקח), since the בעל החרדל was totally in his right, therefore ר"י maintains that only the בעל הדבורים (who is מזיק the חרדל) needs to distance, however here where there is no לוקח and the בעל החרדל had no right to be סומך (just like the בעל הדבורים), therefore they will both be מרחיק. According to the רבנן there will be no difference. </i> –<br>And according to ר"י, since both of them damage each other, the בעל החרדל is only required to distance himself, half the הרחקה, not the entire הרחקה.</b> The בעל הדבורים will distance himself the other half; why the need for a לוקח?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמתיר בחרדל משמע דמתיר לגמרי לסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">The (only) way to justify that is if the בעל החרדל was סומך ברשות and did nothing שלא כהוגן כלל (and that can be only by a לוקח).</i> –<br>And one can say</b> that the expression, ר' יוסי ‘<b>permits by חרדל’, indicates that</b> ר"י <b>completely permits</b> the בעל החרדל <b>to be סומך</b> without any הרחקה at all –<br>In summation; the reason we cannot say that the case is without a לוקח, and the חרדל was סומך first, therefore according to the רבנן that the דבורים are not מזיק the חרדל, the חרדל must be מרחיק and according to ר"י that the דבורים are also מזיק, they both need to be מרחיק, is because when the ברייתא states ר"י מתיר בחרדל, it means he does not distance himself at all.<br>תוספות explained the question of the גמרא and sר"פ' answer. תוספות explains now the continuation of the גמרא: The גמרא asks:<br><b>אי הכי מאי טעמא דרבנן כיון דבהיתר נסמכו –<br>‘If</b> indeed this is <b>so</b> (that we are discussing a לוקח, so the first one [the מזיק] was סומך בהיתר [since it was his field exclusively]), <b>what is the reasoning of the רבנן’, since they were נסמך בהיתר –<br>משרה<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">משרה is water in which flax is being soaked.</i> וכרישין למה צריך להרחיקן כשבאו ירק ובצלים<br>Why is it necessary to distance the משרה and the leeks when</b> the neighbor <b>brought</b> later <b>vegetables and onions</b> on his property –<br><b>וכל שכן חרדל למה ירחיקוהו כשבאו דבורים –<br>and</b> it is <b>certainly</b> not understood <b>why</b> it is necessary <b>to distance the mustard</b> (which was planted בהיתר) <b>when the bees came later.</b> The reason why the case of חרדל is more difficult to understand (according to the רבנן) than משרה וירק, is that –<br><b>כיון שגם הם מזקי<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of משרה וירק or כרישין ובצלים, since it is only the משרה וכרישים that damage but not the ירק ובצלים, it is somewhat tolerable to assume that the מזיק must distance himself even though he was סומך בהיתר. However by חרדל ודבורים where they are both מזיק each other and the חרדל was סומך בהיתר, it is totally astounding to say that (only) the בעל החרדל is required to distance himself.</i> דסלקא דעתין דדבורים נמי מזקי לחרדל לכולי עלמא –<br>Since</b> the bees <b>also damage</b> the mustard, <b>for</b> the one who asked this question <b>assumed<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות taught previously (see footnote # 15) that according to the answer of ר"פ the רבנן maintain that the bees do not damage the mustard (as רבינא concluded). However ר"פ did not say so explicitly. Therefore this מקשן assumed that the רבנן also agree with ר' יוסי that the bees do damage the mustard.</i> that all agree</b> (even the רבנן) <b>that the bees also damage the mustard –</b><br>תוספות continues to explain the sגמרא' next question:<br><b>ועוד מאי טעמא דרבי יוסי דלא פליג אלא בחרדל משום דדבורים נמי מזקי לחרדל –<br>‘And additionally, what is the reasoning of ר"י’ that he argues</b> with the רבנן (who maintain that the בעל החרדל needs to distance himself) <b>only by חרדל, since the bees damage the חרדל;</b> he should argue with the רבנן –<br><b>אפילו משרה וירק כיון שנעשה המשרה בהיתר לא יצטרך להרחיקה כמו גבי אילן ובור<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות here assumes that this מקשן rejects what תוספות previously said (see footnote # 17) that we can distinguish between אילן ובור (where there is a הפסד מרובה) and משרה וירק (where there is no הפסד and no great טרחה). See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>‘Even by משרה וירק’</b> (where only the משרה damages the ירק but not the other way), for <b>since the משרה was done בהיתר, it should not be necessary to distance it, just</b> as the ruling is <b>by a tree and a pit</b> (that if the tree was planted בהיתר all agree even the רבנן that it is not chopped down, so the same should apply to משרה וירק [especially according to ר"י]) –<br>תוספות continues with explaining the following answer of רבינא<br><b>ומשני רבינא לעולם בלוקח וקא סברי רבנן על המזיק להרחיק את עצמו –<br>And רבינא answered that we are really discussing a buyer, but the רבנן maintain that the מזיק must</b> always <b>distance himself –<br>אף על פי שעשה בהיתר ולהכי על בעל החרדל להרחיק שהוא הזיק –<br>Even though he did it בהיתר, so therefore the בעל החרדל must distance himself</b> (even though the he was סומך בהיתר), <b>since he is damaging</b> the דבורים, and the דבורים are not damaging the חרדל (as the גמרא will shortly state explicitly) –<br>תוספות continues with the explanation of the challenge to רבינא:<br><b>ופריך כיון דשמעינן ממילתא דרבינא שהדבורים אינם מזיקים לחרדל –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>asked, since we can infer from the answer of רבינא that the bees do not damage the mustard;</b> we can infer it –<br><b>דלכך<sup class="footnote-marker">36</sup><i class="footnote">If the דבורים are also מזיק the חרדל it would be untenable to require the בעל החרדל to distance since he was סומך בהיתר.</i> נתנו רבנן הרחקה על בעל החרדל –<br>For</b> that explains <b>why the רבנן required the בעל החרדל to distance himself –<br>מכלל דרבי יוסי סבר על הניזק להרחיק עצמו –<br>We can therefore infer that ר"י maintains that the ניזק must distance himself</b>; we infer this since ר"י <b>–<br>מדשרי סמיכת חרדל אף על פי שהוא מזיק ולא ניזק<sup class="footnote-marker">37</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is now assuming that this מקשן maintains that ר"י agrees to the רבנן that the דבורים do not damage the חרדל (see footnote # 25).</i> –<br>Permits the חרדל to remain even though he is the מזיק and not the ניזק –<br>אם כן אפילו משרה וירק נמי<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">According to this מקשן the case of חרדל ודבורים is the same a משרה וירק there is only one מזיק (the חרדל or the משרה), but not the דבורים, so the same rule that applies by חרדל ודבורים should apply by משרה וירק. Why does ר"י agree that by משרה וירק the בעל המשרה has to move?!</i> –<br>Therefore even by משרה וירק</b> the rule should <b>also</b> be that the ניזק (the בעל הירק) should distance himself, not the מזיק (the בעל המשרה), as it is by חרדל ודבורים –<br>תוספות comments:<br><b>והוא הדין דהוי מצי לאקשויי דברייתא<sup class="footnote-marker">39</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דבברייתא (instead of דברייתא).</i> בהדיא משמע שהדבורים מזקי נמי לחרדל –<br>And the truth is that</b> the גמרא <b>could have asked</b> (on רבינא), <b>that in the ברייתא it is explicitly implied that the bees damage the mustard –<br>דקתני ואוכלות לגלוגי<sup class="footnote-marker">40</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' ד"ה לגלוגי on this עמוד for various translations of לגלוגי.</i> חרדלי –<br>For it states, and they eat לגלוגי חרדלי,</b> so how can רבינא maintain that the דבורים do not damage the חרדל. The גמרא could have asked this –<br><b>אלא ניחא ליה למינקט קושיא דאפילו משרה וירק נמי משום דהתחיל כבר להקשותה<sup class="footnote-marker">41</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות הב"ח that after the תוס' ד"ה ואי it should be followed by תוס' ד"ה וסבר and then by תוד"ה מכלל and these three תוספות are really one תוספות and it should be followed by תוד"ה לגלוגי. </i>:</b><br><b>However</b> the גמרא <b>preferred to mention the challenge that even משרה וירק should also</b> not require הרחקה, <b>since</b> the גמרא <b>initially asked this</b> question on the answer of ר"פ.<br>In summation; רבינא answers that we discussing a לוקח and the bees do not damage the חרדל, and even though the בעל החרדל was סומך בהיתר he must distance himself, for the רבנן maintain that the מזיק must always distance himself. The גמרא asked that this implies that according to ר"י the ניזק must distance himself (by חרדל), so why by משרה וירק the בעל הירק (the ניזק) is not required to distance? תוספות will continue to explain the rest of the סוגיא in the following תוספות.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות explained why the question is not on<sup class="footnote-marker">42</sup><i class="footnote">Footnotes 3 -13.</i> אביי (only on רבא),<sup class="footnote-marker">43</sup><i class="footnote">Between footnotes 13-14.</i> the answer of ר"פ,<sup class="footnote-marker">44</sup><i class="footnote">Footnotes 14-31.</i> the questions on ר"פ,<sup class="footnote-marker">45</sup><i class="footnote">Footnotes 32-35.</i> the answer of רבינא and the question on רבינא.<sup class="footnote-marker">46</sup><i class="footnote">See footnotes 36-38.</i><br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes (in explaining ר"י according to ר"פ) that since the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל and the חרדל did nothing wrong therefore only the בעל הדבורים is required to distance.<sup class="footnote-marker">47</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18.</i> However by משרה וירק (even though the משרה was סומך בהיתר), only the בעל המשרה distances since the ירק is not מזיק the משרה. Seemingly if the בעל החרדל would not be סומך בהיתר, the rule would be that they both need to distance equally,<sup class="footnote-marker">48</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות (between footnote 13-14 who writes, דכיון דתרוייהו מזקי אהדדי על כל אחד ואחד להרחיק חצי ההרחקה. </i> but since he was סומך בהיתר he need not distance at all. Why therefore does the משרה make the entire הרחקה, since he was סומך בהיתר (so he and the ירק are equal), at most they should both make חצי הרחקה?!<br>2. תוספות writes<sup class="footnote-marker">49</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 35.</i> in explaining the question on רב פפא that ר' יוסי should argue even by משרה וירק since they were נסמך בהיתר, just as we say by אילן ובור. Seemingly by אילן ובור there is no יקוץ of the אילן according to ר' יוסי even if the בור was there first and the אילן was not נסמך בהיתר, so why does תוספות write, 'כיון שנעשה המשרה בהיתר וכו' כמו באילן ובור'?!

<b>מכלל<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See the הגהות הב"ח (ג) at the conclusion of the previous תוס' ד"ה ואי that this תוס' ד"ה מכלל should follow after the following תוס' ד"ה וסבר and that all three ד"ה ואי, וסבר, מכלל are one תוספות (followed by ד"ה לגלוגי).</i> דסבר רבי יוסי על הניזק להרחיק וכולי—It can be inferred that <i>Rabi<br>Yosee</i> maintains that the one damaged needs to distance, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ר"ת ור"ח explained that according to רבינא the only dispute between אביי ורבא is by a בור, but in all other cases they agree that the מזיק may be סומך if there is no ניזק. תוספות continues to explain the גמרא according to this interpretation.<br><b>צריכים לומר לפירוש זה דזה המקשה אינו אותו שהקשה בתחלה –<br>It is necessary to say according to this explanation</b> (of the ר"ת ור"ח) <b>that this</b> <b>questioner</b> (who is asking מכלל דר"י סבר וכו' אפי' משרה וירקא נמי) <b>is not the same questioner who asked initially –<br>ואי לא סמיך היכי משכחת לה –<br>‘And if</b> (according to רבא) one may <b>not be סומך, how can we have</b> such a case’ –<br><b>דהא לדידיה הוה ניחא ליה לאביי דאמר סמיך<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See the beginning of תוס' ד"ה ואי (TIE ‘In summation’ by footnote # 13) where he explains in detail the מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן regarding חרדל, according to אביי. In that explanation there was no question or inference that ר"י maintains על הניזק להרחיק. Now that we say that in all cases  (except for בור) רבא agrees with אביי that מותר לסמוך, so just as there is no difficulty according to אביי, there should be no difficulty according to רבא. See also תוס' ד"ה וסבר [TIE footnote # 13]. Why therefore is there now a question where there was not before. Therefore we must conclude that there are two מקשים. Evidently one knew something that the other did not, as תוס' continues to explain. </i> –<br>For according to that</b> original מקשן, the משנה of חרדל <b>was understood according to אביי –<br>ולא הוה קשה ליה מידי וסבר רבי יוסי על הניזק כולי –</b><br><b>And he had no difficulty at all</b> to ask, ‘<b>and does ר"י maintain על הניזק, etc.’ –</b><br>תוספות will now explain why the first מקשן had no issue, however the second מקשן had a question:<br><b>וצריך לומר שהמקשה הראשון הוה ידע שפיר המסקנא דדבורים לחרדל לא מזקי לרבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">[This is not as תוס' explained (according to רש"י) in the beginning of תוס' ד"ה ואי.] Therefore we can understand their מחלוקת that both agree על המזיק להרחיק, except that according to the רבנן, the bees are not מזיק therefore the חרדל must distance, however according to ר' יוסי that they are both מזיקים, so even though the דבורים were סומך בהיתר, but they did קצת שלא כהוגן and the חרדל is not damaging the bees directly, so they are both equal, and no one can demand that the other should make the entire הרחקה.</i> –<br>So it is necessary to say that the first מקשן</b> (who asked [on רבא], היכי משכחת לה, but had no difficulty with ר"י) <b>he properly knew the conclusion that according to the רבנן, the bees do not damage the mustard –<br>אבל המקשה הזה לא ידע להכי פריך מכלל דסבר רבי יוסי כולי –<br>However this מקשה</b> (who inferred that ר"י maintains על הניזק להרחיק) <b>he did not know this</b> (he assumed that the חרדל ודבורים damage each other), <b>therefore he asked, ‘we can infer that ר"י maintains, etc.</b> that על הניזק להרחיק. תוספות explains –<br><b>והקשה כיון דלרבנן חשיב בעל דבורים ניזק ולא מזיק שמצריכין לבעל חרדל להרחיק<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Obviously this shows that the בעל החרדל is the מזיק and the דבורים are the ניזק even though they too are מזיק the חרדל.</i> –<br>And he is asking, since according to the רבנן the beekeeper is considered a ניזק, but not a מזיק,</b> we know this <b>since we require the בעל החרדל to distance –<br>אף על גב שהם מזיקין לחרדל –<br>Even though that</b> the bees <b>are מזיק the חרדל –<br>מכל מקום כיון דסמך בהיתר לא חשיב מזיק ועל בעל חרדל להרחיק –<br>Nevertheless, since</b> the beekeeper <b>was סמך בהיתר he is not considered a מזיק, so the בעל החרדל is required to distance –<br>אם כן גם לרבי יוסי חשיב ניזק<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The מקשה did not see any reason why to differentiate regarding the status of the bees (whether they are a מזיק or a ניזק), between the רבנן ור"י. If the רבנן consider them a ניזק (which they obviously do) even though they are מזיק the חרדל, nevertheless since they were סומך בהיתר they are considered the ניזק, then presumably ר"י also considers them the ניזק.</i> ואפילו הכי מותר לסמוך לבעל החרדל –<br>Therefore</b> this מקשה assumes <b>that also according to ר"י</b> the bees <b>are considered the ניזק</b> (just as according to the רבנן), <b>and nevertheless the בעל החרדל</b> (who is the מזיק) <b>is permitted to be סומך</b> (to the bees who are the ניזק) –<br><b>אם כן סבר דעל הניזק להרחיק את עצמו אי הכי אפילו משרה וירק נמי כן –<br>So it turns out that the ניזק must distance himself, if that is so, even by משרה וירק it should also be so</b> that על הניזק להרחיק!<br>תוספות rejects am alternate explanation of the מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן:<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We can perhaps say that they argue whether the דבורים (who damage the חרדל) are considered a מזיק (ר"י), or not (the רבנן).</i><b><br>דאין סברא דלרבי יוסי חשיב בעל דבורים מזיק אף על פי שסמך בהיתר –<br>For it is not logical</b> to assume <b>that according to ר"י the בעל הדבורים is considered a מזיק, even though he was סומך בהיתר</b> (first), but nevertheless he is considered a מזיק –<br><b>משום שעשה קצת שלא כהוגן –</b><br><b>Because he acted somewhat improperly,</b><br><b>ולרבנן לית להו האי סברא –<br>And the רבנן do not agree to this concept;</b> we cannot assume this <b>–<br>דאין סברא כלל דלפלוגינהו בהכי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">According to the רבנן it would turn out that they consider the דבורים exclusively as a ניזק (since they require only the חרדל to distance), even though he עשה קצת שלא כהוגן; on the other hand ר"י considers the דבורים exclusively as a מזיק (since the חרדל is not required to distance at all), even though he was סומך בהיתר. These positions are too extreme from each other; it would be more palatable if one of them should consider the דבורים as a מזיק and a ניזק so they both should distance equally. Therefore it is difficult to accept that they are so far apart. </i> –<br>for it is not logical at all that this is their argument,</b> therefore we need to conclude that their argument is whether על המזיק להרחיק (the רבנן) or על הניזק להרחיק (ר"י), and if that is so, why does ר"י maintain that by משרה וירק על המזיק להרחיק?!<br>תוספות continues to explain the גמרא:<br><b>ומשני לעולם רבי יוסי על המזיק סבירא ליה וחשיב בעל דבורים מזיק –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answers that indeed ר"י maintains על המזיק</b> להרחיק, <b>but he considers the בעל הדבורים</b> also <b>as a מזיק –<br>אף על גב שסמך בהיתר כיון שעשה קצת שלא כהוגן בסמיכתו –<br>Even though he was סומך בהיתר</b> (for he was first), nevertheless the דבורים are a מזיק, <b>since he acted somewhat improperly by being סומך –<br>ורבנן נמי הוו מודו ליה בהך סברא אי הוו סברי דדבורים מזקי לחרדל –<br>And the רבנן would also have agreed to this logic</b> (to consider the דבורים a מזיק, because עשו קצת שלא כהוגן), <b>if they would presume that the דבורים damage the חרדל</b> (as ר"י assumes) –<br><b>אלא דסבירא להו דדבורים לא מזקי לחרדל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7. Previously when we assumed that both ר"י ורבנן agree that the דבורים damage the חרדל, it was not logical to say that they argue whether the בעל הדבורים who did something improper is considered a מזיק or not; they should seemingly agree one way or the other. However now we can say that by עשו שלא כהוגן, all will agree that it is considered a מזיק; however here according to the רבנן, the דבורים are not מזיק the חרדל at all.</i> ולכך מרחיק בעל החרדל –<br>However</b> since <b>they maintain that the דבורים are not מזיק the חרדל, therefore the בעל החרדל</b> (only) <b>has to distance –</b><br>תוספות goes back to explain the first מקשן (who asked ואי לא סמיך היכא משכחת לה):<br><b>וכמסקנא זו יש לפרש תחלת הסוגיא לדברי המקשה דפריך ואי לא סמיך היכי משכחת לה –<br>And we can explain the beginning of our סוגיא referring to the מקשה who asked, ‘and if you cannot be סומך, how can this be</b>; that the דבורים was סומך’; we can explain that question as we <b>concluded here,</b> meaning <b>–<br>דבשלמא אי סמיך<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, סמיך פליגי כדמסקינן (instead of סמיך כדמסקינן).</i> כדמסקינן השתא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">This means that the רבנן ור"י argue whether the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל (see [text by] footnote # 3), and the בעל הדבורים was סומך בהיתר (for we are following אביי), therefore according to the רבנן the בעל החרדל needs to distance since he is the only מזיק, and according to ר"י no one is מרחיק since the בעל הדבורים (even though he was סומך בהיתר, nevertheless) he was עושה קצת שלא כהוגן and now he is directly מזיק the חרדל (as opposed to the חרדל who is מזיק the דבורים indirectly). Therefore neither has to be מרחיק the entire distance. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>That it is understandable if</b> we rule like אביי that <b>סמיך,</b> so they argue <b>as we concluded here –<br>ולא כמו שפירשתי לפירוש הקונטרס שיחלקו<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שיחלקו בזה דלרבנן (instead of שיחלקו דלרבנן)..</i> דלרבנן הוו דבורים כמו ירק –<br>And not the way I</b> previously <b>explained<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See the beginning of תוס' ד"ה ואי. However now תוספות rejects this distinction; see footnote # 7.</i> according to פרש"י that they argue this</b> issue<b>; that according to the רבנן the דבורים are like ירק</b> (meaning they are not required to distance) –<br><b>כיון שנסמכו בהיתר אף על גב שגם הם מזיקין לחרדל כשיבא –<br>Since they were נסמך בהיתר</b> (first), <b>even though that they too are מזיק the חרדל when it will come</b> and be planted there –<br><b>ורבי יוסי מתיר לסמוך החרדל מפני שבעל הדבורים עשה קצת שלא כהוגן:</b><br><b>And ר"י permits the חרדל to be סומך since the בעל הדבורים acted somewhat improperly.</b> We do not need to learn this way; rather we can learn as תוספות just said previously.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מקשן who asked 'ואי לא סמיך היכי משכחת לה', was aware that the רבנן maintain that the דבורים לא מזקי לחרדל, while the מקשן who asked מכלל דסבר ר"י וכו' was not aware. Therefore in the בשלמא the argument between ר"י ורבנן was whether the דבורים are מזיק, but not as תוס' explained it according to רש"י that their argument is whether סמיכה בהיתר makes you a ניזק but not a מזיק.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות concludes that the מקשן ראשון who is asking היכי משכת לה according to רבא (and is satisfied according to אביי) understands that the רבנן ור"י argue whether the דבורים are מזיק the חרדל or not.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> If that is the case what is the question היכי משכחת לה, since the דבורים are not מזיק the חרדל, the בעל הדבורים has the right to by סומך?!<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<i><b>(לעיל)<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This indicates that this תוספות should precede תוס' ד"ה מכלל.</i></i> וסבר רבי יוסי על המזיק כולי—<i></i>And</b> does <i><b>Rabi Yosee </i>maintain that the damager is required, etc.<i></i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא came to a conclusion that ר"י (also) maintains על המזיק להרחיק את עצמו, but asked that we find elsewhere that he maintains על הניזק להרחיק את עצמו. Our תוספות initially discusses why the question is asked here. Subsequently תוספות will offer an entirely different explanation of our entire סוגיא.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות replies to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>לקמן על מקומה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה of משרה וירק is on כה,א. The משנה of אילן ובור is on כה,ב, The גמרא should have pointed out the contradiction between these two משניות in the גמרא there. Why mention it here?</i> הוה ליה לאקשויי –</b><br>The גמרא <b>should have asked this</b> question <b>later in its</b> proper <b>place –<br>אלא משום דאיצטריך ליה לפרש הכא דסבר רבי יוסי דעל המזיק להרחיק את עצמו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא just proved from משרה וירקא that (even) ר"י maintains that על המזיק להרחיק, therefore the גמרא felt it necessary to resolve the contradiction from אילן ובור where it is evident that ר"י maintains על הניזק להרחיק את עצמו.</i> –<br>However, since it was necessary</b> for the גמרא <b>to explain here that ר"י maintains that the מזיק must distance himself,</b> therefore <b>–<br>אסקוה לכולה מילתא הכא –</b><br>The גמרא <b>concluded the entire matter here –</b><br>תוספות addresses the meaning of 'לוקח':<br><b>ובלוקח דהכא אי אפשר לפרשו כפירוש רבינו חננאל<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' יח,א ד"ה הכא where תוספות brings down this view from the ר"ת (however see רש"ש there [and TIE there footnote # 5] that it should read ר' חננאל [not ר"ת]).</i> –<br>And regarding the 'לוקח' here, it is impossible to explain it according to the פר"ח</b> (in the case of אילן ובור) <b>–<br>דפירש באדם שלוקח משרה וטוענין ללוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">There is a general rule that if a buyer (or an heir) gets into a dispute with a third party, בי"ד claims on behalf of the buyer (or heir) any claim which the seller (or the מוריש) could have claimed. Therefore it is possible that the משרה can be סומך (even according to רבא), since we will claim on his behalf that this is the way it was when he bought it, and presumably the seller reached an agreement with the neighbor to be סומך the משרה.</i> –<br>Who explained</b> there (by משרה) that we are discussing <b>a person who bought a משרה</b> (which was near the boundary)<b>, and we argue ‘on behalf of a buyer’.</b> The reason this cannot be the meaning of 'לוקח' here <b>–<br>דאם כן למה ירחיק המשרה כשיבא שם ירק כיון שטוענין לו שהמוכר קנה סמיכה זו –<br>For if</b> indeed <b>it is so</b> (that he bought the משרה close to the boundary), <b>why should</b> he be required <b>to distance the משרה</b> when his neighbor <b>will plant there ירק,</b> for <b>‘we will argue on his behalf’ that the seller acquired this</b> right of <b>סמיכה</b> from the neighbor –<br><b>אלא צריך לפרש בלוקח כמו שפירש בקונטרס או כרבי יצחק ברבי מרדכי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See the תוס' on יח,א ד"ה הכא. That (regarding the אילן) it means (according to רש"י) that the initial owner still owns the אילן and the buyer made a בור, or (according to the ריב"ם) that the buyer has the אילן and the initial owner makes the בור. The same would be here wither the seller owns the משרה (according to רש"י), or the buyer  owns it (the ריב"ם). In either case it was made בהיתר.</i> –<br>Rather it is necessary to explain that 'לוקח' means either as רש"י explained it or the ריב"ם –<br>כך פירש רבינו יצחק כל הסוגיא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to the explanation given in the previous תוס' ד"ה ואי.</i> לפי שיטת רש"י –<br>This is how the ר"י explained the entire סוגיא according to sרש"י' approach –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשה לו מה הוצרך<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The חתם סופר amends this to read שהוצרך (instead of הוצרך).</i> לחלק בדוחק בין לוקח דאילן ללוקח דמשרה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות here is referencing this which תוספות stated in ד"ה ואי that the way ר"פ is explaining the case of חרדל that the field belonged initially to the בעל החרדל, it is difficult to understand why (according to the רבנן) the בעל החרדל (who planted the חרדל בהיתר) is required to distance himself from the דבורים which came later; why is this different from אילן ובור? By אילן ובור, if the אילן was first, he is not required to distance himself; why is it different by חרדל ודבורים? The answer which תוספות gave that by אילן ובור there is a הפסד מרובה is considered to be somewhat of a דוחק! See there TIE footnote # 22 & 23.</i> –<br>And</b> the ר"י <b>has a difficulty</b> with פרש"י; <b>why was it necessary to awkwardly differentiate between the buyer of a tree and the buyer of the משרה –</b><br>Another question on פרש"י:<br><b>ועוד דלמה המתין להביא משנה זו דמשרה וירק באחרונה המוקדמין במשנתנו<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא first cites the משנה of אילן ושדה (on כו,א), the משנה of אילן ובור (on כה,ב) and lastly the משנה of משרה וירק (on כה,א). Why is this משנה cited last at the very end of this סוגיא?!</i> –<br>And furthermore why did</b> the גמרא <b>wait till the end to cite this משנה of משרה וירק, which precedes</b> in the order of <b>our משניות</b> the משניות of אילן ושדה and אילן ובור –<br>A final question on פרש"י:<br><b>ועוד דקתני בתוספתא (פרק א' [ה"ז]) רבי יוסי מתיר בחרדל –<br>And additionally, the תוספתא states; ‘ר"י permits by חרדל</b> (that he does not distance) –<br><b>שאומר לו כדרך שעשית בתוך שלך כך אני עושה בתוך שלי –<br>For</b> the בעל החרדל <b>says to the</b> בעל הדבורים) <b>just as you do in your</b> property, <b>so I will do in my property’ –<br>משמע דבעל דבורים סמך תחלה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The בעל החרדל is saying to the בעל הדבורים, ‘I can do whatever you do’; indicating that the בעל הדבורים was סומך first.</i> –<br>Indicating that the בעל הדבורים was סומך first</b> not like פרש"י that the בעל החרדל was סומך first (בהיתר גמור)!<br>תוספות offers his interpretation of sרבינא' answer:<br><b>ומפרש רבינו תם ורבינו חננאל דהכי גרסינן –<br>And the ר"ת an the ר"ח explain that this is how the text reads –<br>אלא אמר רבינא קסברי רבנן על המזיק להרחיק את עצמו –<br>‘Rather רבינא said, the רבנן maintain the מזיק is required to distance himself’ –<br>והשתא הדר ביה מכל שינויי דלעיל –<br>So now</b> (by saying 'אלא'), the גמרא <b>retracts from all the previous answers</b> that were given on behalf of רבא –<br><b>דודאי בכולהו מודה רבא דכי ליכא כותל או ירק דסמיך –<br>For it is certain that in all</b> those cases, <b>רבא agrees that if there is no wall or vegetable that</b> one may be <b>סומך –<br>משום דקא סברי רבנן דדוקא על המזיק להרחיק את עצמו דהיינו כי איכא דבר הניזוק –<br>Since the רבנן maintain that it is specifically incumbent on the מזיק to distance himself; meaning when there is something that is being damaged;</b> only then can one be considered a מזיק –<br><b>אבל כי ליכא דבר הניזוק לא מקרי הסומך מזיק –<br>However when there is nothing being damaged, the סומך cannot be called a מזיק –<br>ולא אסר רבא לסמוך אפילו לרבנן אלא דוקא בור –<br>And רבא did not forbid to be סומך</b> anything, <b>even according to the רבנן, only a בור specifically</b> was prohibited –<br><b>משום טעמא דכל<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא on יז,ב and תוס' יז,א ד"ה לא יחפור. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> מרא ומרא דקא מחית מרפית לארעאי –<br>On account of the reason that with every</b> pounding <b>of your shovel you soften up my land –<br>ולהכי חשוב הסומך מזיק אפילו כי ליכא בור –<br>So therefore</b> in that case only, <b>the סומך is considered a מזיק even if there is no בור</b> in his neighbor’s רשות –<br><b>וכיון דלרבנן נמי סמיך אתי שפיר פלוגתייהו כדפרישית לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">בתוד"ה ואי in the very beginning. In summation; according to אביי the מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן is where the בעל הדברים was סומך first (and everyone agrees that the דבורים and the חרדל damage each other). The dispute hinges on whether this case is similar to two בורות where the second בור needs to make the entire הרחקה (the view of the רבנן) or that this is not similar to בור where the second בור is מזיק בידים (therefore he makes the entire הרחקה), however here the בעל החרדל is not מזיק בידים [and the בעל הדבורים acted קצת שלא כהוגן], therefore the בעל החרדל need not move any more than the בעל הדבורים (the view of ר' יוסי).</i> אליבא דאביי –<br>And since he can be סומך even according to the רבנן, the argument</b> between the רבנן and ר' יוסי <b>will be well understood as I explained previously according to אביי –<br>ולכך הדר ביה ולא מוקי בלוקח וכגון<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">This is not like ר"פ who established the מחלוקת by a לוקח where the בעל החרדל was סומך first. תוספות already explained (see footnote # 9) why it is difficult to learn that the חרדל was first, so now תוספות explains why we cannot say the מחלוקת is by a לוקח where the דבורים were first.</i> שסמך בעל דבורים תחלה –<br>And it is for this</b> following reason that רבינא <b>retracted</b> from the answer of רב פפא <b>and he did not establish</b> the מחלוקת between the רבנן ור"י <b>by a buyer, and in a case where the בעל הדבורים was סומך first –<br>משום דאם כן לא היה מתיר רבי יוסי לסמוך לבעל החרדל –<br>For if that</b> were the case <b>ר"י would not permit the בעל החרדל to be סומך –<br>כיון דבעל הדבורים לא עשה כלל שלא כהוגן –<br>Since the בעל הדבורים did not act improper at all</b> (it was completely בהיתר in a case of לוקח) –<br><b>ודוקא בדסמיך בלא לוקח שעשה קצת שלא כהוגן בעל הדבורים –<br>And it is only if</b> the בעל הדבורים <b>was סומך, not by a לוקח, where the בעל הדבורים acted somewhat improperly that –<br>מתיר רבי יוסי לבעל החרדל לסמוך כדפרישית לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> –<br>ר"י permits the בעל החרדל to be סומך as I explained previously –</b><br>תוספות will now show that all the difficulties mentioned before on פרש"י, will not apply to פי' ר"ת ור"ח:<br><b>ולפי זה אתי שפיר דלמסקנא זו לא נצטרך לחלק בין לוקח האילן ללוקח משרה<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9</i> –<br>And according to this it will all work out that in the conclusion we are not required to differentiate between a buyer of a tree</b> (where he can keep the tree) <b>to a buyer of a משרה</b> (where he is required to move it); in both cases he is not required to move it if he was a לוקח <b>–<br>ולהכי המתין נמי<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> כדי להביא מתניתין דמשרה משום דמינה צריך לחזור מכל שינויי דלעיל –<br>And therefore</b> we <b>also</b> understand why<b></b> the גמרא <b>waited to cite the משנה of משרה</b> (even though it was taught before some of the other משניות), <b>because on account of this משנה</b> it became <b>necessary to retract from all the previous answers –<br>ואתי נמי שפיר דמיירי שסמך נמי בעל דבורים תחלה<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> כמו שמוכח בתוספתא:</b><br><b>And it also works out well that we are discussing</b> a case <b>where the בעל הדבורים was סומך first as is evident in the תוספתא.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רבינא is retracting what was previously assumed, and concludes that according to רבא it is only by a בור that it is אסור לסמוך even if there is no other בור (because of כל מרא דמחית מרפית לארעי), but in all other cases since there is no ניזק, the סומך cannot be considered a מזיק. The מחלוקת between ר"י ורבנן is where the דבורים were סומך (and not by a לוקח).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that (even) according to רבא, it is only by בור that it is אסור לסמוך since כל מרא דקא מחית מרפית לארעי,<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 12.</i> however by the other 'מזיקים' there is no need for הרחקה, since he is not מזיק now. Previously<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">יז,ב ד"ה מרחיקין.</i> תוס' wrote (in the first answer) regarding גפת וכו' that 'הני נמי מקלקלין את הקרקע ויזיק לכותל לכשיבנה'. This seems to contradict our תוספות!<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i><br>[Additionally תוספות there writes (at the very end of תוספות) that the reason רבא gives of כל מרא וכו' is only אליבא דר"י but not אליבא דרבנן. However, from our תוספות it is evident that this reason applies even according to the רבנן?!]

<i>הכי גריס רבינו חננאל</i> <b>בא בידים אין לא בא בידים לא—</b><i>This is the text according to Rabeinu Chananel</i> If it <b>crumbles in one’s hand, yes; it does not crumble in one’s hand, no</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא queried what the משנה meant when it said that one must distance his pit from his friends pit three טפחים and סד בסיד; does the משנה require both; three טפחים and סד בסיד or either one is sufficient.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות יז,א ד"ה וסד that the גירסא in the משנה is certainly וסד. The query is does this וסד mean, ‘and סד’, or או סד.</i> The גמרא cited a ברייתא in which ר' יהודה ruled that by a סלע הבא בידים each one must separate three טפחים וסד בסיד. There are different גירסאות how there is any proof from this ברייתא.<br>---------------------------<br>תוספות states that according to the<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This is basically the גירסא in our גמרות.</i> גירסת ר"ח we understand the proof as follows:<br><b>אלמא או סד בסיד תנן דדוקא בא בידים בעי הרחקה וסיד<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">However if it is not בא בידים (but ‘regular’ land) only one is required, either הרחקה or סד בסיד.</i> –<br>It is evident</b> (from this ברייתא) that our משנה <b>is teaching 'או סד בסיד',</b> for we can infer that the ברייתא states <b>only by בא בידים do we require</b> both <b>distancing and סד בסיד –<br>ומשני הוא הדין לא בא ובא בידים איצטריך ליה כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">ר"י teaches us that even if it is בא בידים we do not require distancing more than three טפחים (just like לא בא בידים).</i> –<br>And the גמרא rejects</b> this proof, saying, not<b></b> necessarily so, for <b>the same ruling</b> (requiring both הרחקה and סד בסיד) applies even by <b>לא בא</b> בידים, however <b>it was necessary for</b> ר"י, etc.<br>תוספות mentions another גירסא:<br><b>ויש ספרים דלא גרסי האי דיוקא אלא משני בא בידים שאני<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">By בא בידים only do we require both, but not (necessarily) by לא בא בידים.</i> ודקארי לה מאי קארי כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ויש ספרים, the גמרא cites the ברייתא of ר"י as a proof that we require both (for we are [now] assuming that בא בידים and לא בא are the same [see footnote # 7]). The גמרא refuted this proof saying that they are not the same. The גמרא then asks how could we have even thought that there is any proof from this ברייתא of ר"י; is it not obvious that we cannot compare בא בידים to לא בא בידים. [The גמרא then answers that ר"י only meant to teach that בא בידים does not require more הרחקה than לא בא.]  </i> –<br>And there are other texts that do not mention this inference</b> (of טעמא דבא בידים, etc.), but assume that the proof is self-understood, <b>rather</b> according to this גירסא, the גמרא immediately rejects the proof by saying that <b>בא בידים is different,</b> and then the גמרא asks, <b>and the one that cited</b> this proof <b>why did he cite it, etc.</b> is it not obvious that it is a flawed proof since we cannot compare בא בידים to לא בא בידים –<br>תוספות is dissatisfied with this גירסא of the ויש ספרים:<br><b>ואין נראה דהיכי בעי למיפשט וסד בסיד תנן –</b><br><b>And</b> this גירסא <b>does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for how did</b> the גמרא <b>attempt to resolve that our משנה teaches וסד בסיד</b> (that we require both) –<br><b>הא איכא למיבעי ההיא דרבי יהודה גופיה אי תרוייהו בעי אי לאו –<br>For we can pose the same query on the very ברייתא of ר"י, whether we require both</b> (הרחקה וסד) <b>or not;</b> we can ask what does he mean when he says וסד; is it וסד or או סד <b>–<br>כיון דהשתא סבר דאין חילוק<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6 that according to the ויש ספרים we were able to resolve the query that we require both, since we assume that there is no difference between בא and לא בא. Therefore, תוספות asks, just like in our משנה where the גירסא is 'וסד' (see footnote # 1) and nevertheless we query does it mean וסד, or או סד, similarly in the ברייתא of ר"י (which is the same case as our משנה; this is the current assumption that there is no difference between בא and לא בא), we can pose the same query. However according to our גירסא where we assume that there is a difference between בא and לא בא (and therefore we resolve the query that in the משנה it is או סד), we can understand that even though in our משנה we can ask whether we require both or not, but when it is בא בידים which is a worse situation then obviously it requires both. See the end of תוס' יז,א ד"ה וסד. Alternately (and more simply) since we assume that לא בא is more lenient than בא, then even if there is a query by ר"י, nevertheless in either way we will resolve the query, we can always infer that by לא בא we do not require both. If by ר"י it is או סד then certainly in our משנה it is או סד and even if by ר"י it is וסד we can still infer that in our משנה where it is לא בא the rule is או סד.</i> בין בא בידים ללא בא:</b><br><b>Since now we are assuming that there is no difference between בא בידים and לא בא!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ר"ח infers that או סד, while the יש ספרים resolve that וסד. They argue whether (<i>a priori) </i>we can compare בא בידים to לא בא בידים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can we justify the גירסא of the ויש מפרשים by saying that they disagree with תוספות premise that the גירסא in the משנה is 'וסד' and the query is (merely) what does 'וסד' mean.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> However the ויש ספרים can maintain that the query is concerning the גירסא in our משנה; is it סד, or או סד. However in the ברייתא the גירסא certainly is וסד!<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
