<b>משום דמשתכי—Because they break<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This is according to פרש"י. תוספות will give us other interpretations.</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our משנה taught that one must distance סלעים (stones) from his neighbor’s wall, presumably because they emit heat. The גמרא asked why does the משנה in מסכת שבת, not include סלעים as one of the items in which one is not permitted to be טומן.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">הטמנה, טומן וכו' is the process of completely wrapping foods for שבת in some material so they retain their warmth. One is permitted to be מטמין in something which does not add heat (אינו מוסיף הבל) but not in something which is מוסיף הבל.</i> Initially רב יוסף answered because it is not usual to be מטמין in סלעים. However אביי asked that it is also unusual to be מטמין in גיזי צמר and nevertheless the משנה mentions them. רבא answered that it is not usual to be מטמין בסלעים because they are משתכי.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה הנך. The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read הקונטרס כאן דמשברין (instead of הקונטרס דמשברין). Presumably משברין here may (also) mean that they damage the pots (making dents and scratches, etc.).</i> דמשברין הקדירה אין דרך להטמין בהן –<br>רש"י [here] explained</b> that משתכי means <b>that</b> since the סלעים <b>break the pots it is not customary to be מטמין in them.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אכתי תיקשי וכי דרך להטמין בגיזי צמר כדפריך לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See “Overview’. Previously רב יוסף answered that it is not usual to be מטמין in סלעים, so אביי challenged and said, ‘but it is not the דרך to be מטמין in גיזי צמר and nevertheless it is mentioned’. רבא now answered that since סלעים are משתכי, they are not mentioned, presumably because it is not the דרך, but that answer was already refuted!</i> –<br>And if you will say, the question still</b> remains, ‘<b>and is it the custom to be מטמין in גיזי צמר’, as</b> the גמרא <b>asked previously?!</b><br>תוספות answers by differentiating between the two 'אין דרך להטמין':<br><b>ויש לומר דלעיל הוה בעי למימר דאין דרך להטמין בסלעים –<br>And one can say the previously</b> רב יוסף <b>wanted to say that אין דרך להטמין בסלעים –<br>לפי שההבל יוצא מבין הסלעים ואינו מתקיים ואף על פי כן לפעמים טומנין בהן –<br>Because the heat escapes from between the stones, so</b> the heat <b>does not last,</b> therefore it is אין דרך generally, <b>but nevertheless sometimes</b> people <b>are טומן in</b> סלעים –<br><b>להכי פריך שפיר מגיזי צמר דתני לה משום דלפעמים טומנין בהן<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">According to אביי the two, סלעים and גיזי צמר are similar in that generally we are not טומן בהם, but occasionally we are. Therefore there is a proper challenge why mention גיזי צמר but not סלעים.</i> –<br>Therefore</b> אביי <b>correctly challenged</b> this answer <b>from גיזי צמר which are taught, since occasionally we are טומן</b> in גיזי צמר, even though generally we are not טומן בהם –<br><b>אבל הכא קאמר דאין דרך להטמין כלל בהן לפי שמשברין הקדירה –<br>However here</b> רבא <b>is saying that it is not the custom at all to be מטמין with</b> סלעים <b>because they break the pots</b> (if you are מטמין with them) –<br><b>והואיל ומילתא דלא שכיח היא כלל לא חש למיתנייה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">According to this answer it is forbidden to be מטמין בסלעים; however the משנה did not teach it since it is לא שכיחי כלל.</i> –<br>So since it is something completely uncommon</b> the תנא <b>was not concerned to teach it –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate approach:<br><b>ועוד יש לפרש דכיון דלא שכיחא היא כלל שרי להטמין בהן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">According to this answer (as opposed to the previous answer) one is permitted to be מטמין בסלעים (see footnote # 6).</i> –<br>And additionally one can explain that since</b> הטמנה בסלעים <b>is totally uncommon, it is permitted to be מטמין in</b> סלעים –<br><b>דבמילתא דלא שכיחא לא גזרו בהו רבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The reason one may not be מטמין בדבר המוסיף הבל is on account of a גזירה that he may be מטמין ברמץ (in ashes which still may have some fire in them and he may rake the ashes to reignite the fire which is אסור מן התורה). However since it is unusual to be מטמין בסלעים (so even though it is מוסיף הבל) the גזירה does not apply to it.</i> –<br>For the רבנן did not make an injunction in something which is</b> totally <b>uncommon –<br>וכן מנהג שלנו שאנו נוהגין להטמין בסלעים שהאש יוצא מהן<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">We need to assume that at the time when they made the גזירה, their (clay) pots in those day were damaged or broken by the סלעים, so therefore the סלעים were not included in the גזירה (since it is לא שכיחי), so nowadays even though our (metal) pots can withstand the סלעים, the גזירה never applied to סלעים. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> שקורין קיילו"ש<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">These may be flint stones (or perhaps coal?). </i> –<br>And so too is our custom that we regularly are מטמין in</b> the type of <b>סלעים which emit fire which are called ‘Kayloosh’.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>אבל מכל מקום קשיא מה שהקשה בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה הנך.</i> דבכל מקום הוי שיתוך לשון חלודה –<br>However in any event there remains the difficulty which רש"י asked, that everywhere</b> else the word <b>שיתוך is an expression of rust</b> (not breaking) –<br><b>כמו באלו מציאות (בבא מציעא דף כו,א) דשתיך טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there is saying that since it is so rusty it cannot belong any more to the original owner.</i> –<br>Like in פרק אלו מציאות</b> where it states ‘<b>it is exceedingly rusty’ –<br>ובפרק הבונה (שבת דף קב,ב) דכיון דמשתכי לא עבדי הכי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot say that we find a בנין כל שהוא in the משכן, because in the משכן they would dig a small hole to hide their needles, because since they will rust (in the hole) they will not do it.</i> –<br>And in פרק הבונה</b> the גמרא states <b>since they will rust they do not do it –<br>ובפרק קמא דתענית (דף ח,א) אם ראית דור שהשמים משתכין עליו כנחושת –</b><br><b>And in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>תענית</b> it states, <b>if you see a generation that the heavens</b> appear <b>rusty as</b> the color of <b>copper.</b> In any event we see that שתיך means rust, why here is it used to mean breaking?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ומפרש רבינו תם בענין אחר דמשתכי דהבל שלהן מקלקל המאכל<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">Just as rust is the decomposition and spoilage of the metal, similarly here the סלעים spoil the food. When the גמרא states דמשתכי לה לקדרה it does not mean the pot per se, but rather the food inside the pot. See תוס' תענית ח,א ד"ה אם.</i> –<br>And the ר"ת explains משתכי in a different manner, that their heat</b> (of the סלעים) <b>spoils the food</b> (therefore they are not מטמין בסלעים) –<b></b><br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation of רבא:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק נראה כפירוש רבינו חננאל דמה שאמר להרחיקם<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">Until now we understood that רבא was explaining why we are not טומן בסלעים because דמשתכי; however the ר"ח learns that רבא is giving a different explanation of our משנה, why we must distance the סלעים from the כותל. According to the ר"ח the גירסא in our גמרא should read, סלעים היינו טעמא משום דמשתכי (not התם היינו טעמא משום דמשתכי לה לקדרה). רבא is discussing our משנה, not the case of הטמנה. See (however) later in this תוספות.</i> משום דמשתכי –<br>And the ר"י prefers the פי' ר"ח that</b> רבא was explaining, this which our משנה <b>states that we must distance</b> the סלעים from the כותל is <b>because דמשתכי;</b> meaning –<br><b>שמלקין את הארץ ומחלידים אותה ומעלין עפר תיחוח כדאמרינן לקמן גבי זרעים –<br>That</b> the סלעים <b>ruin the land and corrode it</b> (like rust corrodes) <b>and it causes to loosen the land as</b> the גמרא <b>states later regarding seeds –<br>ולא משום הבל דאין מוסיפין שום הבל וטומנין בהן –<br>But not because of any heat. For</b> סלעים <b>do not exude any heat, so</b> therefore one <b>may be טומן in</b> סלעים, therefore the משנה there (by הטמנה) does not mention סלעים –<br>תוספות reconciles the פר"ח even according to our גירסא:<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15.</i><br><b>ואפילו לפי הספרים דגרסי סלעים היינו טעמא דלא קתני להו התם<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">This גירסא seem to contradict the פר"ח who maintains that רבא is explaining why our משנה states that סלעים need to be distanced (because דמשתכי); however from this גירסא it seems clear that רבא is explaining why the other משנה (in שבת) does not mention סלעים.</i> –<br>And even according to the texts that read; ‘this is the reason why</b> the משנה <b>does not mention סלעים there’ –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>יש לפרש דהכי קאמר דלהכי לא קתני להו התם משום דטעמא דהכא –<br>It can be explained that this is what</b> רבא <b>is saying, that therefore</b> the משנה <b>there does not mention</b> סלעים <b>is because of the reason</b> given here, namely –<br><b>שצריך להרחיקם לא משום הבל אלא משום דמשתכי –<br>That it is necessary to distance</b> סלעים, <b>not because of הבל, but rather because דמשתכי</b> (it corrodes) therefore it is מותר to be מטמין in them –<br>תוספות offers support to the פר"ח:<br><b>והרב רבינו מרדכי הביא ראיה מירושלמי<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ב פ"ב ה"א.</i> דגרסינן התם<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם who reverses the גירסא; the first time it should state 'הכא', and the next time 'התם'.</i> איתמר<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read איתמר מפני שהסלעים (instead of איתמר שהסלעים)</i> שהסלעים מרתיחין –<br>And הרר"מ brought proof from the</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי</b> to the פר"ח, <b>for we read, ‘there it was stated</b> in one place <b>because the סלעים heat,</b> therefore it must be distanced from the כותל <b>–<br>והכא<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 19.</i> איתמר שאין הסלעים מרתיחין –<br>And here</b> concerning הטמנה <b>it was stated that the סלעים do nor heat up,</b> so it is מותר to be מטמין in סלעים. These two statements contradict each other –<br><b>אמר רבי יוסי כאן וכאן אין הסלעים מרתיחין –</b><br><b>ר"י answered</b> both <b>here</b> (in ב"ב) <b>and there</b> (by הטמנה) <b>the סלעים do not heat up</b> Therefore we understand why טומנין בהן, however why are we מרחיקין; it cannot be because of הבל –<br><b>אלא מפני שעושים עפר תיחוח ומלקין ארעית הכותל:</b><br><b>But rather it is because they loosen the earth and ruin the ground of the wall.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>People are never טומן בסלעים since they break (דמשתכי) the pots. Either it is אסור להטמין בסלעים, but the משנה does not mention it since it is לא שכיח, or since it is לא שכיח it is מותר להטמין בסלעים. Alternately (ר"ת) the סלעים ruin the food in the pots (like rust [דמשתכי] ruins the metal). Finally (ר"י ור"ח), רבא is explaining our משנה that סלעים must be distanced because they ruin the earth, but no heat (and מותר להטמין בסלעים).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How are we to understand that on one hand תוספות writes that it is אין דרך להטמין כלל בסלעים since they break the pots, and on the other hand nowadays we are טומן בסלעים; but how will the סלעים not break the pots?!<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9 and נחלת משה.</i>
<b>דמחממי חיים—Because it warms hot</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא explained; the reason our משנה does not include 'חול' in the items that need to be distanced because they emit heat, is that sand heats things that are already hot (therefore one cannot be טומן a hot pot in חול), however here where it is not near anything hot it does not emit heat. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמר בפרק כירה (שבת דף לח,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל ולא) ביצה –<br>And</b> regarding this <b>which</b> the משנה <b>states in פרק כירה</b> regarding a raw <b>egg –<br>אין טומנין אותה לא בחול<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This indicates that sand emits heat on its own even when it is wrapped around something cold. This would seemingly contradict our רבא, who states that sand only heats objects which are already warm.</i> ולא באבק דרכים –<br>One may not cover it up</b> (in order to cook it)<b>; neither with sand or the dust of the roads –</b><br>תוספות replies:<br><b>התם בחול שהוחם<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שהוחם מחום השמש (instead of שהוחם מחמת השמש). [It is not clear the need for this emendation; in מס' שבת the תוס' reads בחול שהוחם בחמה.] </i> מחמת השמש דומיא דאבק<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Regular אבק דרכים, obviously cannot cook an egg; rather it means אבק דרכים which was heated by the sun. The same applies to חול.</i> דרכים:</b><br><b>There</b> we are discussing <b>sand which was warmed from the heat of the sun, similar to the ‘dust of the roads’</b> which can cook the egg only if it was heated by the sun.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Only heated sand can cook an egg.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Where is there more reason to prohibit הטמנה in sand; is it if the דבר הנטמן is hot and the sand is cold, or is it if the דבר הנטמן is cold and the sand is hot?

Daf 19b



Line 1

<i> (שייך לע"ב)</i> <b>המבריך<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This תוספות references the גמרא on the עמוד ב'.  </i> את הגפן—One who bends a grapevine</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites a משנה that if one is מבריך a גפן in the ground,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The process of הברכה is that one takes one of the (attached) vines (from a grapevine) and buries part of it in the ground (enabling it to take root) and allows the other (unattached) end of the vine to remain above ground as a new grapevine. </i> one may not plant seeds directly on top of the buried vine unless it is buried three טפחים or more. The ברייתא states that one may plant seeds at the sides of the buried vine. תוספות clarifies and explains these rules.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See also רש"י ד"ה המבריך. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> גפן יחידי שהוא מושרש בארץ וכופף את הגפן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The branches (vines) of a grapevine are very pliable and can be bent without breaking them.</i> באמצעיתו –<br>The explanation</b> of המבריך את הגפן is that we are discussing <b>a single grapevine which is rooted in the ground, and he bends</b> one of the <b>vines in the middle –<br>ומכסהו בקרקע ונשרש שם –<br>And covers</b> this vine <b>with earth, and it takes root there –<br>וקאמר מותר לזרוע את הצדדין –<br>And</b> the ברייתא <b>rules that it is permitted to seed on the sides</b> of this covered vine –<br><b>דאף על גב שאינו רחוק שלשה טפחים ויונק עם הגפן מתחת הקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Plants can nourish from the same earth if they are within three טפחים of each other. This should seemingly be considered כלאים.</i> –<br>For even though that it is not distanced three טפחים</b> from the covered vine <b>and</b> so <b>it nourishes together with the vine underneath the ground</b>, nevertheless <b>–<br>כיון דמעל הקרקע ליכא עירבוביא שרי כדמוכח בעירובין (דף צג,א) ובמסכת כלאים (פרק ד') –<br>Since aboveground there is no mixing,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">He is not planting within three טפחים of the protruding vines aboveground. We do not see two different species growing next to each other.</i> it is permitted, as is evident</b> from the גמרות <b>in</b> מסכת <b>עירובין and מסכת כלאים,</b> where it states –<br><b>דזה סומך לגדר מכאן וזה מכאן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">They may plant right up to the fence, even though they are within three טפחים of each other and they will be יונק from the same קרקע underground, nevertheless it is permitted since the fence prevents ערבוביא.</i> –<br>This one</b> (בעל הגפן) may plant <b>close to the fence from this side, and the other one</b> (בעל הזרעים)<b></b> may plant close to the fence <b>from his</b> side<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והיכי דמי שזורע לצדדין –<br>And if you will say; but how is this</b> case <b>where he is seeding on the side –<br>אי כשהרחיק ג' טפחים מן הצדדין אפילו על גביו נמי ואי בלא הרחיק מן הצדדין נמי לא –<br>If he distanced himself three טפחים from the sides</b> of the protruding vine,<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that the vine is buried for a length of ten טפחים. The two protruding vines (the one end attached to the original vine and the other unattached vine) are ten טפחים distance from each other. He should then be permitted to seed on top of the middle four טפחים of the buried vine, since he is (at least) three טפחים distance from either protruding vine.</i> he should be permitted to seed <b>even on top of</b> the buried vine, <b>and if he did not distance</b> three טפחים from the protruding vine he should <b>not</b> be permitted to seed <b>even on the sides</b> of the buried vine<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">From what was said until now it is apparent that we are not concerned for יניקה underground, only for ערבוביא above ground. Therefore all that matters is that he distance himself three טפחים from the protruding vines and then he should be able to plant even on top of the buried vine, for there is no issue with יניקה.</i> –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דמיירי כשזורע הצדדין ברחוק ג' טפחים מגפן היוצא מן הקרקע מכל צד –<br>And the ר"י answered that this is a case where he planted on the sides</b> of the buried vine <b>at a distance of three טפחים on all sides<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">There is no seeding being done within a radius of three טפחים from the protruding vine on all sides. </i> from the vine which protrudes from the ground –<br>דליכא ערבוביא למעלה מן הקרקע –<br>So there is no mixture above ground –<br>ומכל מקום אסור לזרוע על גביו מפני שהשרשין נכנסין בתוך הגפן –<br>But nevertheless it is forbidden to plant</b> directly <b>on top of the</b> buried vine <b>because the roots</b> of the plant <b>will enter into the</b> buried <b>vine,</b> and even though it is not כלאים –<br><b>והוי כמרכיב זרעים באילן דאסור<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See קידושין לט,א where שמואל derives it from the פסוק (in ויקרא [קדושים] יט,יט) of את חקתי תשמרו שדך וגו'.</i> –</b><br><b>But it is like grafting plants into a tree which is forbidden.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומאי איריא דנקט גפן אפילו שאר אילן נמי אסור<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">כלאים is by a גפן, however the איסור הרכבה is by any tree.</i> –<br>And if you will say; so why does</b> the משנה <b>mention גפן</b> specifically, since the issue is הרכבה, so <b>even by other trees it is also אסור?!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דשאר אילנות שהן קשין מותר לזרוע על גביו כנגד השורש –<br>And the ר"י says that other trees which</b> their trunk and roots <b>are hard, it is permitted to plant on top of it</b> even <b>directly on the root –<br>דלא חיישינן שיכנס שורש הזרע בתוך האילן שהוא קשה –<br>For we are not concerned that the root of the plant will enter into the</b> root of <b>the tree</b> and be considered grafting (הרכבה)<b>, since it is hard</b> and it cannot penetrate –<br><b>אבל גפן שהוא רך חיישינן והאי (פירוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note indicates that other text read this 'פירכא' (not פירוקא).  See footnote # 14.</i>) מצא רבינו יצחק בירושלמי<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">פרק ז' ה"א.(right after the משנה). The ירושלמי there asks basically the same question as תוספות (that will explain the גירסא of פירכא [see footnote # 13]), and gives (somewhat) the same answer (although not that explicitly), עיי"ש.</i> בגמרא דהך משנה:</b><br><b>However by a גפן which is soft we are concerned</b> that the root of the seed will penetrate into the root of the גפן and it will be הרכבה. <b>And the ר"י found this answer in</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי on the גמרא of this משנה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>By a lone grapevine there is no concern of יניקה, only for ערבוביא. There is a concern for הרכבה from seeds by a גפן since its vines and roots are soft.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Do רש"י and תוספות agree here, or is there a מחלוקת here between רש"י and תוספות?<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See מראה עוזר.</i>

<b>התם בשופכין—There it is by pouring</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that when our משנה stated that we must distance מי רגלים from a wall, it was regarding pouring out a urinal full of urine near the wall; however an individual may urinate near the wall. תוספות explains the necessity of this ruling.<br>------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר בשלמא אי מיירי במשתין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Initially the גמרא assumed that (even) for urinating, one must distance himself from the wall.</i> אף על גב דתנא ליה אמת המים תנא ליה נמי האי –<br>And if you will say;</b> the משנה is <b>properly</b> understood <b>if we are discussing urinating,</b> for then <b>even though the משנה taught</b> that one must distance <b>an irrigation ditch,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We know therefore that water is damaging to the wall, so why mention urinating; it is the same thing?!</i></b> nevertheless the משנה <b>also teaches</b> מי רגלים –<br><b>דסלקא דעתין משום צניעותא לישתרי –<br>For we may have</b> mistakenly <b>assumed that on account of modesty it is permitted</b> to be urinate near the wall, where he is somewhat concealed, therefore the משנה teaches this novelty that notwithstanding the requirement of צניעות, it is still forbidden –<br><b>אבל אי מיירי בשופכין מאי קא משמע לן הא תנא ליה אמת המים –<br>However if</b> the משנה <b>is discussing pouring</b> out a full urinal, <b>what</b> is the משנה <b>teaching us</b> by including מי רגלים, the משנה already <b>taught us אמת המים</b> so that would seemingly include מי רגלים as well –<b></b><br>תוספות goes on to prove that the משנה does not repeat itself:<br><b>דמהאי טעמא אמר לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">On the preceding עמוד א'. The גמרא explained there that the משנה does not mention the distancing of moist sand (from a wall) since it already mentions אמת המים. The same should apply here; why mention שופכין של מי רגלים when we were already taught אמת המים.</i> דלא תני חול –<br>For</b> our משנה <b>did not teach חול for this very reason, as the</b> גמרא <b>previously stated –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>יש לומר דשאני חול שהוא כל שעה אצל הכותל<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore they are similar to אמת המים, which is also there all the time, so if אמת המים needs to be distanced, sand also needs to be distanced. Therefore the משנה had no reason to repeat itself by mentioning it</i> אבל הנך מי רגלים<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה needs to teach us that מי רגלים need to be distanced, for we would have thought that since the מי רגלים are absorbed into the ground immediately, they do not cause the same type of damage as אמת המים (and חול) and they do not require distancing, therefore the משנה teaches us that even שופכין של מי רגלים require distancing from the wall. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> כלים כרגע:</b><br><b>One can say; that sand is different</b> from מי רגלים, <b>for</b> the sand <b>is near the wall all the time, however these מי רגלים are gone in an instant!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The novelty of distancing שופכין של מי רגלים is that they are absorbed immediately.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that there is a greater novelty by מי רגלים over אמת המים (that they are absorbed immediately).<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> If that is the case why did not the משנה teach us distancing only by מי רגלים and we would know for sure that the same rule applies to אמת המים.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

<b>ותיובתא דרבה בר בר חנה—And it is a refutation of <i>Rabah Bar Bar Chono</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבה בר בר חנה ruled that one may urinate near his neighbor’s wall, and brought proof to this from a פסוק which states<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">מלכים א' כא,כא reads, וְהִכְרַתִּי לְאַחְאָב מַשְׁתִּין בְּקִיר וְעָצוּר וְעָזוּב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. </i> משתין בקיר (urinating by the wall). The גמרא refutes this from a ברייתא which states that one may not urinate next to a wall, except if the wall is built on a rock it is permitted. תוספות explains that we cannot reject this refutation of רבב"ח.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ולא מצי לשנויי דכי קאמר רבה בר בר חנה בצונמא –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>could not have answered</b> on behalf of רבב"ח, <b>that when did רבב"ח rule</b> that it is permitted, only by a <b>rock (צונמא);</b> where the ברייתא also permits it. The reason the גמרא did not offer this answer –<br><b>חדא דהוה ליה לפרושי בהדיא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">He should have said that one may be משתין if it is בצונמא as the ברייתא specified. An אמורא should be at least as specific as the ברייתא, if not more.</i> ועוד<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דדריש מקרא שמע<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">רבב"ח assumed that משתין בקיר refers to people; if the פסוק refers to a person as משתין בקיר it cannot be that the פסוק is referring only to those who were משתין בצונמא, the פסוק meant all the people (according to רבב"ח) including those that are משתין בקיר that is not צונמא.</i> מינה דלא מפליג:</b><br><b>Firstly,</b> רבב"ח <b>should have</b> <b>clarifed</b> himself <b>explicitly, and furthermore since he is expounding the פסוק, we can derive from this that he does not differentiate</b> between a צונמא and other types of walls.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רבב"ח permits משתין בקיר in all circumstances since he was not explicit otherwise, and the פסוק certainly does not distinguish.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות offers two reasons<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> why we cannot say that רבב"ח meant בצונמא. Which of those two reason is the relatively stronger one?
