<b>כיון דאיכא צער בעלי חיים כולי—Since there is suffering for an animal, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא taught that an אבר ובשר המדולדלין (a dangling limb or flesh) from an animal are ממעט בחלון. The גמרא asked but perhaps he will cut off this אבר המדולדל and throw it to the dogs (so it won’t remain in the חלון)? The גמרא answered that since this (cutting it off) will cause the animal pain we assume that he will not do it. Therefore he is מבטל this אבר to the חלון and it is ממעט. Our תוספות clarifies this reasoning.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר כולה בהמה שקיל ושדי לכלבים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא already established that we are discussing a non-kosher skinny animal that he has no other use for, so he will certainly kill it (no צער בע"ח there) and give it to the dogs. In any event he is not מבטל the אבר to the חלון.</i> –<br>And if you will say; he will take the entire animal and throw it do the dogs</b> (after he will kill it), so he is not מבטל the בהמה and the אבר to the חלון, so why is it ממעט?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמיירי בקוף וכל דדמי ליה דמנח התם לטיולי ביה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore he will certainly not kill it, and he will also not sever the אבר המדולדל because of צער בע"ח. Here לטיולי בה does not mean he will take if for a walk, but rather entertain himself there next to the אבר המדולדל.</i> –<br>And one can say we are discussing a monkey or something similar</b> to a monkey, <b>which he placed there</b> by the window <b>for his pleasure (</b>enjoyment) –<br><b>וניחא דנקט אבר ובשר ולא נקט בהמה גופה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">We established that the animal was tied (and cannot move) and that it was not fit to be eaten, so why discuss the אבר המדולדל, when we can discuss that he placed the animal in the window!</i> –<br>So</b> now <b>it is understood why</b> the ברייתא <b>mentioned a limb or flesh</b> (that is dangling)<b>, but did not mention an actual animal –<br>דאי חזיא לטיולי שקיל לה לטיולי בה ואי לא חזיא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore the ברייתא states that only the אבר המדולדל was actually in the window and the animal (monkey) was nearby, so he can still play with the animal (and will not throw it to the dogs), and will be מבטל the אבר to the חלון.</i> שדי לה לכלבים:</b><br><b>For if it is usable for his enjoyment, he will remove it</b> from the window <b>to entertain</b> himself <b>with</b> the animal, <b>and if it is useless for enjoyment he will throw it to the dogs</b> (since it has no other use).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One would not be מבטל an unfit to eat (non-kosher) animal to the חלון; he will either use it for amusement (if possible) or throw it to the dogs; however he will be מבטל the אבר המדולדל of this animal to the חלון if the animal can entertain him.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The notion, that this ברייתא is discussing a monkey that he wishes to play with, seems a little far-fetched and the ברייתא certainly does not state this (explicitly). How did תוספות derive this?

<b>אתיא אמיה ודריא ליה בשבת—The mother will come and take him away;</b> it was <b>on <i>Shabbos</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא included a בן שמונה as one of the items which are ממעט בחלון. The גמרא asked, how can it be ממעט, since the mother will remove the infant, The גמרא answered that it was on a שבת, where a בן שמונה is מוקצה so the mother will not move him. תוספות completes the sגמרא' answer.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The obvious question is that the mother will remove him after שבת, so it is not a קביעות, how can he be ממעט?!</i><br>-------------------------------<br><b>ואיירי בגוסס שימות קודם שיצא השבת<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> ואמר דשם תהא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש that תוס' maintains that a נפל does not require burial (in the ground).</i> קבורתו:</b><br><b>And we are discussing</b> an infant <b>who is a גוסס (about to die), who will die before שבת is out, and they intend that his burial should be there</b> in the חלון, therefore he will never be removed, that is why he can be ממעט בחלון.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The בן שמונה was a גוסס, who will die during שבת, and will be buried [left] there in the חלון, therefore he is ממעט.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If they intend to bury him there (permanently), why is it necessary to emphasize that he will die before שבת; what difference is there when he will die, since they intend to leave him there?!

<b>דלית בה שיעורא—For it does not have the</b> required <b>amount</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא included salt as one of the items which are ממעט בחלון. The גמרא asked, but salt is harmful to the wall (window sill) so he will remove it. The גמרא answered that the salt was resting on a potsherd. The גמרא asked, so the חספא can be חוצץ (without the salt). The גמרא answered that it did not have the proper שיעור. In our text the גמרא continues כדתנן חרס כדי ליתן בין פצים לחבירו.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">That משנה is discussing the שיעור required to be חייב for carrying out a חספא on שבת to (from) a רה"ר. In those days when they wanted to open a window in a wall, they made the window frame by placing vertically two parallel boards at a specific distance from each other and then fill the space between them (on top and on bottom) with a חספא. The size of this חספא is the minimum size required to be חייב for carrying a חספא on שבת. Anything smaller is insignificant for a חספא.  </i> Our תוספות offers an alternate גירסא.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">By saying 'פירוש' our תוספות is negating the explanation (of רש"י בד"ה דלית) that לית ביה שיעורא means that the חספא per se is too small and so cannot be considered a חציצה. This is not true, for the size of the דבר החוצץ is irrelevant; what is important is that it is large enough that when it is placed in the window, the part remaining open is less than a פותח טפח.</i> דאין שיעור לחספא למעט מפותח טפח –<br>The explanation of</b> דלית ביה שיעורא is <b>that there is not sufficient חספא to make</b> the opening less <b>than a square טפח –<br>ולא גרסינן כדתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If the explanation of דלית ביה שיעורא would be like the explanation תוספות rejected (in footnote # 2), then the גירסא of 'כדתנן' would be correct; we are saying that just like for שבת there is a שיעור לחיוב הוצאה, that same שיעור applies to חציצה בפני הטומאה. However תוספות rejected this פירוש, for there is no connection between שיעור להוצאה and the שיעור of חציצה, therefore the term כדתנן is inappropriate for it suggests that the two cases (שבת and חציצה) have the same שיעור (when in fact there is no real שיעור for the דבר החוצץ per se).</i> דמה ענין זה לשיעורי שבת אלא וכדתנן בוי"ו –<br>And</b> so therefore <b>the text does not read 'כדתנן', for what connection is there</b> between <b>the issue here</b> (regarding חציצה) <b>to the measurements for</b> חיובי <b>שבת, rather</b> the גירסא <b>is 'וכדתנן' with a 'וי"ו'</b> (before כדתנן) –<br><b>והכי פירושו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is explaining why we cite the משנה regarding a חספא on שבת, since it has no intrinsic connection to our case.</i> ואמאי מלח ממעט –<br>And this is the explanation</b> of (the flow in) the גמרא; <b>but why is salt ממעט –<br>הא כי שקיל חספא כשיצטרך לו יסיר גם המלח כדי שלא יזיק את הכותל<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This is an implicit question which we are to ask on our own. The 'וכדתנן' is answering this implicit question.</i> –<br>Since when he will need the חספא and remove it, he will also remove the salt so it should not harm the wall –<br>ואהא מייתי וכדתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The 'וכדתנן' does not explain the meaning of לית ביה שיעורא (which is as תוספות explained it), rather the גמרא cited the 'וכדתנן' to answer the implicit question that he will remove the חספא (and the מלח) so how can it be ממעט?!</i> כלומר דמיירי נמי דלית ביה כדי ליתן בין פצים לחבירו –<br>And</b> in order to answer this implicit question, the גמרא <b>cites</b> this משנה <b>saying 'וכדתנן', meaning, that our</b> case in the ברייתא is <b>also discussing</b> a case <b>where</b> the חספא is not large enough <b>to place between one post and the other –<br>דאין ראוי לכלום ולא שקיל ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">כדתנן means we are proving something, which makes sense according to the rejected פי' (in footnote # 2) that we are trying to prove the שיעור of a חספא. However 'וכדתנן' means that the fact in this case is similar to the facts in the other case, but we’re not trying to prove anything.</i> –<br>So</b> since this חספא <b>is not fit for anything, therefore he will not remove it –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate גירסא thereby justifying the גירסא of 'כדתנן':<br><b>ואית ספרים דלא גרסי חספא גופיה תיחוץ אלא גרסינן ותיפוק ליה משום חספא –<br>And there are some text, which do not read 'חספא גופיה תיחוץ', rather they read, 'ותיפוק ליה משום חספא' –<br>כלומר ותיפוק ליה שיסיר המלח כשיסיר חספא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">According to this גירסא the גמרא is explicitly asking the implicit question we mentioned before (in footnote # 5), however the גמרא never asked (according to this גירסא) that חספא גופיה תיחוץ.</i> –</b><br><b>This means that you can know that he will remove the salt when he removes the חספא,</b> so how can the salt be ממעט if eventually it will be removed when he needs the חספא –<br><b>ומשני דלית בה שיעורא כדתנן כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Anything smaller than בין פצים לפצים is never used, so he has no need for it. The משנה is a direct answer to a direct question; therefore it can state כדתנן (without a preceding וי"ו).</i> ולא שקיל ליה:</b><br><b>And</b> on this explicit question the גמרא <b>answered that it doesn’t have the</b> sufficient <b>size, as we learnt, etc.</b> and therefore <b>he will not remove it.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The חספא is not ממעט, since it is so small that (without the מלח) the opening will still be more than a פותח טפח.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is it more logical that the גמרא asks that the חספא should be חוצץ (as our גירסא has it), or that the גמרא asks, how can the מלח on the חספא be ממעט, since he will remove the חספא (the גירסא of the אית ספרים); which is the more obvious question?

<b>ושל חמור שלש מן האיצטרובלא—And by a donkey three from the base</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a ברייתא which teaches how much one must distance a mill של חמור from the neighbor’s wall. רש"י seems to interpret 'ושל חמור' literally that it is driven by a donkey. תוספות offers alternate explanations.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>פירוש רבינו חננאל דבשל חמור ליכא טיריא דאין חמור טוחן בה –<br>The ר"ח explained that by a</b> mill <b>of a חמור there are no vibrations, for there is no donkey which is</b> doing the <b>grinding in this</b> mill –<br><b>אלא חמור קורא לבנין העצים הנושאים את הריחים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The term חמור is used to indicate that just as a חמור carries a burden, this wooden structure also supports the burden of the mill; somewhat similar to our sawhorse.</i> –</b><br><b>Rather</b> the word <b>חמור is referring to the wooden structure which supports the mill;</b> תוספות offers some examples that חמור refers to a supporting structure –<br><b>כמו שמצינו דעצים הנושאים נקראים חמור כמו העץ שהמטה מוטלת עליו –<br>Just as we find that wood which supports are called חמור, for instance the wood upon which a bed is placed –<br>כדתנן (כלים פרק י"ח משנה ג') נקליטי המטה וחמור<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A board was place on the ground and the legs of the bed stand on this board. It is called חמור because it supports the bed.</i> טהורים –<br>As the משנה teaches, the headboards of a bed and the חמור (base of the bed) are טהורים –<br>וכן העץ הסובל שידה תיבה ומגדל נקרא חמור –<br>And similarly the wood which supports a chest or a box or a closet is</b> also <b>called חמור –<br>דתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read דתניא as it is a ברייתא in תוספתא דכלים [בבא מציעא] פ"ח ה"א.</i> חמור שתחת המלבן וספסלים שתחת הרגלים טהור –<br>As was taught, the חמור which is under the frame and the benches under the legs are טהור –<br>וכן עץ<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read, עץ שהמפוח של נפחים סומך (instead of עץ שהנפח סומך).</i> שהנפח סומך עליו נקרא חמור דתנן (שם פרק י"ד משנה ג') חמור של נפחים טמאים<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read טמא (instead of טמאים).</i> –<br>And similarly the wood upon which the [bellows of the] smith is supported, is called חמור, as the משנה teaches, the חמור of smiths are טמא –<br>וכן הריחים הבנין עשוי כמין כסא ועליה ריחים וזהו איצטרובל –<br>So similarly</b> regarding <b>the mill; the housing is made like a chair and on it is the mill</b> and the lower part of the mill which is on the chair is called <b>איצטרובל –<br>ואדם יושב כנגדן במקום גבוה ורגליו מרווחת<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read מתוחות (instead of מרווחת)</i> למטה ומסבב הגלגל ברגליו וטוחן –<br>And a person sits facing it on a high place and his legs are stretched out below him and he turns the wheel with his feet and</b> this is how it <b>grinds –<br>ולית ביה טיריא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The vibration may be muted and absorbed by the wooden structure underneath the mill.</i> אלא קול בעלמא –<br>And in</b> this mill <b>there are no vibrations, just merely some noise –<br>אבל בריחים שאדם טוחן בידיו או בגופו אית ביה נדנוד והיא טיריא –<br>However by a mill which a person grinds with his hand or body, there are vibrations and</b> these vibrations are called <b>טיריא –</b><br>תוספות presents a differing view:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק נראה דשל חמור נמי טוחן ביד אלא כשהוא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שהוא (instead of כשהו).</i> על גבי בנין –<br>And it appears to the ר"י that</b> in <b>a</b> mill <b>של חמור,</b> the person <b>also grinds with his hand</b> (not with his feet)<b>, but</b> the mill <b>is on a structure –<br>כדתנן במסכת זבים בפרק רביעי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">משנה ב'. The מהר"ם amends this to read ריחיים של יד (instead of ריחיים ושל יד).</i> חמור של ריחים ושל יד –<br>As the משנה taught in the fourth פרק of מסכת זבים, a חמור of a hand mill –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דתניא בתוספתא בפרק קמא דמכילתין<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">ה"ב.</i> מרחיקין הריחים של יד –<br>And this which we learnt in the תוספתא of the first פרק of our מסכת, ‘we distance a hand mill</b> from the neighbor’s wall –<br><b>שלשה מן השכב שהן ארבע מן הרכב ושל חמור שלשה מן האיצטרובל שהן ארבע מן הקלת –<br>Three</b> טפחים <b>from the lower stone which is four</b> טפחים <b>from the upper stone, and</b> we distance a mill of a <b>חמור three from the איצטרובל which is four from the קלח’;</b> this indicates that there are two types of ריחיים, one של יד and other של חמור, it seems that של חמור is not של יד, not as the ר"י suggested!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>לא משום דבשל חמור אין טוחנין ביד אלא סתם של יד אין בהן חמור אלא על גבי קרקע –<br>It does not</b> mean that in the ריחיים <b>של חמור we do not grind by hand, but rather a ‘regular’</b> ריחיים <b>של יד has no חמור</b> (no support structure), <b>but rather</b> it stands, directly <b>on the ground –<br>ולכך קתני בתר הכי ושל חמור אבל תרוייהו טוחנין ביד:</b><br><b>So therefore the ברייתא mentions afterwards a</b> ריחיים <b>של חמור</b> which is supported by the wooden structure, <b>however by both of them</b> (של יד ושל חמור) <b>the grinding is</b> done by <b>hand.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A חמור is a wooden structure which holds up the ריחיים. According to the ר"ח the grinding is done by foot, while according to the ר"ת it is done by hand.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why is it that the ר"ח and the ר"י do not explain של חמור to mean literally that a donkey drives the mill (as רש"י seems to explain)?<br>2. How are we to understand the מחלוקת between the ר"ח and the ר"י whether the grinding is done by foot or by hand?

Line 7

<b>שמע מינה כליא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See on יז,א that רש"י בד"ה ואת explains כליא to mean the base of the oven, while תוספות בד"ה כליא (and in TIE there) maintains that it is the protruding belly of the oven. </i> דתנור טפח—We know from this that the <i>Kalyoh </i>of an oven is a <i>Tefach</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>אביי stated that we can derive from our משנה that the protrusion of the כליא (to the rest of the oven) is a טפח and this is important regarding מקח וממכר. Our תוספות explains why this information was not discussed in a similar case previously.<br>--------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>הא דלא קאמר נמי לעיל שמע מינה שכב דריחים נמי טפח<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We know this since the משנה states שלש מן השכב שהן ד' מן הרכב. It is necessary to know this regarding מקח וממכר, just like by the oven, so why does not the גמרא mention this as well?!.</i> לפי שהיה פשוט להם איך היה:</b><br><b>The reason</b> the גמרא <b>previously did not state, ‘we can derive</b> from the משנה that the <b>שכב (base) of the mill also</b> extends <b>a טפח’</b> (just like it made this inference regarding an oven), this is because <b>it was obviously</b> known <b>to them how a mill was;</b> everyone knew that in the mills the שכב was a טפח wider than the rest of the mill.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is no need to belabor the obvious.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Can we somehow explain why is it that they knew the size of the mill, but not the size of the oven?<br>2. If everyone knows that the שכב extends a טפח from the רכב,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> why did the משנה have to add שהן ארבעה מן הרכב, it would be sufficient to state שלשה מן שכב and we would know that it is ארבעה מן הרכב?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>תנור<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A תנור (is larger and) has more heat than a כירה, therefore it requires more distancing.</i> דידן ככירה דנחתומין דמי –Our oven is like a baker’s stove</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our משנה required a three טפח floor (מעזיבה) under a תנור and a one טפח floor under a כירה. The ברייתא required a four טפח floor under a תנור and a three טפח floor under a כירה. אביי resolved the contradiction by saying the ברייתא is discussing a תנור וכירה of bakers (נחתומין), while our משנה is discussing a תנור וכיריים in a house. אביי concluded that our תנור is like a baker’s כירה so they both require a floor of three טפחים. Our תוספות explains why אביי stated that our תנור is like a baker’s כירה (seemingly saying that the standard is the baker’s כירה); he should have said that our תנור and the baker’s כירה are the same.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br>----------------------------------<br><b>כל אחד היה עושה תנור שלו כפי מה שהיה רוצה גדול או קטן –<br>Everyone would make their oven as they pleased; large or small</b> (there is no standard size for a family תנור) <b>–<br>אבל כירות של נחתומין היו כולן שוות והיו בקיאין בהן ונפקא מינה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">אביי is teaching us that we can derive from this משנה and ברייתא that if one agrees to sell a תנור (without specifications) it must be the same size as כירת הנחתומין. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> למקח וממכר:</b><br><b>However the bakers’ כירות were all the same and</b> the people <b>were well aware</b> of their size, <b>so</b> this comparison of our תנור to the baker’s כירה <b>is relevant regarding buying and selling.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A family תנור could be of any size, while the כירת הנחתומין was a set size and when one sells a תנור סתם it must be ככירת הנחתומין.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>On one hand תוספות states that there was no standard תנור size, and then תוספות concludes that by מו"מ one must give a תנור the size of כירת הנחתומין; why?! There is no standard תנור size!<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>מאי שנא רישא ומאי שנא סיפא—Why is it different in the <i>Raysho</i><br>and why is it different in the <i>Sayfoh</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The רישא of our משנה taught that one may prevent someone opening a store in the חצר, by claiming, ‘I cannot sleep because of the coming and goings in the store’. The סיפא of the משנה taught that one cannot protest and say. ‘I cannot sleep because of the noise of the hammer or mill or children’. The גמרא asked מאי שנא רישא (where he can protest) ומ"ש סיפא (where he cannot protest). It would seem that the contradiction to the רישא is from all three cases in the סיפא (the hammer, mill, and children). However the גמרא only resolves the contradiction regarding children (not from פטיש וריחיים). תוספות clarifies the sגמרא' question.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>השתא סלקא דעתין דתינוקות דסיפא היינו שבאין לקנות בחנות ומשום הכי פריך מאי שנא –<br>Now</b> (when the גמרא asks, מ"ש רישא ומ"ש סיפא) <b>we assumed that</b> the<b></b> issue of <b>the children – in the סיפא – is</b> because <b>they come to buy in the store</b> and make noise, <b>therefore</b> the גמרא <b>asks מ"ש</b> (that in the רישא noise is an issue and in the סיפא the noise of children is a non-issue) –<br><b>אבל מפטיש וריחים לא פריך דאין שם נכנסין ויוצאין –<br>However</b> regarding the noise <b>from a hammer or a mill there was no question, for there are no comings and goings –<br>דמי שיש לו חטין לטחון נותן לבעל הריחים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read הריחים וטוחן וכן (instead of הריחים וכן).</i> וכן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">There is not much foot traffic by the mill and the smith, as there is by the store.</i> פטיש:</b><br><b>For whoever has wheat to grind he gives it to the mill owner [and he grinds it] and similarly by the hammer</b> (you give the metal to the smith and he fashions it).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The contradiction was only from תינוקות for we assumed that the תינוקות would be continually going and coming to the store.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is he able to protest the coming and going in a store, and not able to protest the noise of a ריחים ופטיש.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רמב"ם הל שכנים פ"ו הי"ב ובמ"מ שם.</i>

<b>זכור אותו האיש לטוב ויהושע בן גמלא שמו—That man<br>should be remembered for good; and his name is יהושע בן גמלא</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא imparts a great importance to יהושע בן גמלא (for establishing teachers for every city where the children could learn תורה). Our תוספות elaborates regarding this יהושע בן גמלא.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>הוא אותו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח deletes the word האיש so it reads אותו דאמר.</i> האיש דאמר רב יוסף (ביבמות דף סא,א) תרקבא דדינרי עיילא ליה מרתא בת בייתוס –<br>This</b> יהושע בן גמלא <b>is the</b> same <b>one,</b> regarding whom <b>רב יוסף related</b> that <b>מרתא בת בייתוס gave for him three קבין of דינרים –<br>לינאי המלך<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">ינאי המלך was the Jewish king (and a descendant of הורדוס who was an עבד). He had a contentious relationship with the חכמים. See (however) תוס' יומא יח,א ד"ה עיילא.</i> עד דאוקים ליהושע בן גמלא בכהני רברבי וצדיק גמור היה כדאשכחן הכא –<br>To the king ינאי until he appointed יהושב בן גמלא as a כהן גדול, and</b> יב"ג <b>was a צדיק גמור as we find here</b> (that he is being praised effusively) –<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<b><br>והא דקאמר התם (שם) קטיר קא חזינא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">רב יוסף felt that יהושע בן גמלא received the כהונה גדולה only because מרתא בת בייתוס (who was his wife) paid off ינאי המלך. How can תוספות say that we are discussing the same person?</i> הכא לפי שהיו אחרים חשובים ממנו:</b><br><b>And this which</b> רב יוסף <b>said there, ‘I see here a cabal</b> of wicked people’; that is not to be understood the יב"ג was not fit to be כהן גדול, rather <b>it was because there were others who were more prominent than</b> יב"ג, but he was also fit to be כה"ג.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>יב"ג here is the same as יב"ג in מס' יבמות, and he was fit to be a כה"ג, although there were others who were more prominent than him.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is תוספות insisting that these two יהושע בן גמלא are the same person; perhaps there were two different people; or perhaps he changed for the better after he became a כה"ג?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ריטב"א here and תוספות ישנים in יבמות.</i>
<b>ולמדתם אותם ולמדתם אתם—And you will teach them; and you will teach</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that initially the people understood that it is incumbent on the fathers (only) to teach תורה to their children, for the פסוק states ולמדתם אותם את בניכם וגו'; however, the word אתם is written without a וי"ו, so it can be read a אתם (האלף פתוחה והתי"ו סגולה); meaning that אתם, you the father, should teach your children. תוספות offers an alternate גירסא and understanding of this דרשה.<br>------------------------------<br><b>יש ספרים דלא גרסי ולמדתם אתם ודריש מדכתיב ולמדתם משמע<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח inserts the word אתם so it reads משמע אתם בעצמכם. </i> מעצמכם:<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א who explains (according to the גירסא מעצמכם) that this גירסא is explaining מי שאין לו אב לא היה לומד to mean that no one taught him; he had to learn by himself מעצמכם.</i></b><br><b>There are text that are not גורס ולמדתם אתם,</b> rather they <b>expound</b> this דרשה as follows, <b>since it is written ולמדתם (and you shall teach); this indicates</b> that <b>you yourselves</b> the fathers of בניכם are required to teach your children.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can derive the דרשה that a father is obligated to teach his children, from the word 'ולמדתם' by itself (without the אותם אתם דרשה).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there any advantage in one גירסא over the other?

Line 3

<b>כי מציון תצא תורה—For the <i>Torah</i> will go forth from <i>Tzeeyon</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that there was a time when the children were taught תורה in ירושלים based on the פסוק of<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ישעיה ב,ג.</i> כי מציון תצא תורה [ודבר ה' מירושלים]. Our תוספות explains why indeed does the פסוק state that תורה comes forth from ציון וירושלים.<br>-------------------------------------<br><b>לפי שהיה רואה קדושה גדולה וכהנים עוסקים בעבודה –<br>For</b> when the child <b>would see the great holiness and the כהנים occupied in the service</b> of the בית המקדש –<br><b>היה מכוון לבו יותר ליראת שמים וללמוד תורה –<br>He would direct his heart to the fear of heaven and to study תורה –</b><br>תוספות supports his view:<br><b>כדדרשינן בספרי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">דברים (ראה) פיסקא קו.</i> למען<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">דברים (ראה) יד,כב-כג (regarding מעשר שני) reads, עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר אֵת כָּל תְּבוּאַת זַרְעֶךָ הַיֹּצֵא הַשָּׂדֶה שָׁנָה שָׁנָה. כג וְאָכַלְתָּ וגו' שָׁם מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ תִּירֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ וּבְכֹרֹת בְּקָרְךָ וְצֹאנֶךָ לְמַעַן תִּלְמַד לְיִרְאָה אֶת יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ וגו'. </i> תלמד ליראה וגומר גדול<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In our ספרי the לשון is מגיד שהמעשר מביא את האדם לידי תלמוד תורה.</i> מעשר שני שמביא לידי תלמוד –<br>As the ספרי expounds</b> the פסוק of, ‘<b>in order that you shall learn to fear, etc.’;</b> this teaches us that <b>מעשר</b> שני <b>is great, for it brings to studying</b> the תורה. This concludes the ספרי –<br>תוספות explains how does eating מע"ש in ירושלים bring to תלמוד:<br><b>לפי שהיה עומד בירושלים עד שיאכל מעשר שני שלו –<br>For</b> the person who brought his מע"ש to ירושלים, <b>would remain there until he</b> finished <b>eating all his מע"ש</b> (which may be eaten only in ירושלים) –<br><b>והיה רואה שכולם עוסקים במלאכת שמים ובעבודה –</b><br><b>And he would see that everyone is involved in the work of heaven and in the service</b> of the ביהמ"ק –<br><b>היה גם הוא מכוון ליראת שמים ועוסק בתורה:</b><br><b>So he too would direct</b> himself <b>to fear heaven and be occupied in תורה</b> study.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Being in a place where people are acting in a holy manner has that same effect on the visitor.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות assumes that being in the environment of ירושלים causes one to be מכוין to יראת שמים ולימוד התורה, and תוספות cites the ספרי as proof. However there is no more proof from the ספרי that the environment causes it,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The ספרי merely states that (eating the) מע"ש (in ירושלים) causes לימוד התורה, but not that it is on account of the environment. </i> than from our גמרא here. Why does תוספות cite the ספרי?<br>2. Why the different לשונות; regarding the child learning in ירושלים, תוספות writes, היה מכוון <b>לבו יותר</b> ליראת שמים <b>וללמוד</b> תורה, while regarding מע"ש, תוספות writes, היה <b>גם</b> הוא מכוון ליראת שמים <b>ועוסק</b> בתורה. [Similarly regarding their impression; by the child he writes, לפי שהיה רואה <b>קדושה גדולה וכהנים</b> עוסקים בעבודה, and regarding מע"ש he writes, והיה רואה <b>שכולם</b> עוסקים <b>במלאכת שמים</b> ובעבודה.]

Line 4

<b>כבן שש כבן שבע—At about the age of six, at about the age of seven</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>יהושע בן גמלא instituted that there be teachers for young children in every city, and the children would be brought to learn of the age of six or seven years old. Our תוספות explains whether it was six or seven.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>כבן שש בבריא כבן שבע בכחוש:</b><br><b>By a healthy child</b> he went to school when he was a<b>bout six</b> years old, and <b>a weak</b> child would go at <b>about seven</b> years <b>of age</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Stronger children would go to school earlier than the weaker ones.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why should we not say that the smarter children went at the age of six, and the others at the age of seven (regardless of their physical strength)?<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See יד רמ"ה אות נג.</i>

Line 5

<b>בבציר מבר שית לא תקבל—Do not accept less than the age of six</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב instructed רב שמואל בר שילת not to accept a student who is younger than six years of age. תוספות reconciles this with a seemingly contradictory משנה.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>והא דתנן במסכת אבות (פרק ה' משנה כ"א) בן חמש שנים למקרא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This seemingly contradicts our גמרא which requires the child be at least six years old (not five).</i> בבריא לגמרי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">In the previous תוס' ד"ה כבן we were told that a weak child begins learning at seven years old, and a healthy child (בריא) at six years old, however a בריא לגמרי can begin even at five years old.</i> –<br>And this which the משנה teaches in מסכת אבות, at five years old</b> a child should be taught <b>חומש,</b> that is only if he is <b>completely healthy –</b><br>תוספות offers support to his view:<br><b>כדאמר בכתובות (דף נ,א ושם) הלומד בנו פחות מבן שש רץ אחריו ואינו מגיעו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there that this means the father will attempt to revive him and make him healthy (רץ אחריו), but he will not be successful (ואינו מגיעו) for he is in danger of dying because of his excessive weakness.</i> –<br>As</b> רב קטינא <b>states in</b> מסכת <b>כתובות, ‘one who teaches his son</b> when he is <b>less than six</b> years old, <b>he may run after him, but he will not reach him.</b> The גמרא continues <b>–<br>ואיכא דאמרי חבריו רצין אחריו ואין מגיעין אותו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">He is too advanced so they cannot keep up with him.</i> ותרוייהו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This view reconciles that both the first לשון and the second are true by the same child, he is weak but smart.</i> איתנהו דחליש וגמיר –<br>And some say that his friends run after him, but they cannot reach him;</b> the גמרא concludes; <b>‘and both</b> these<b></b> statements <b>are true, he is weak</b> (like the first interpretation) <b>and he is learned’</b> (like the א"ד). The גמרא offers an alternate view –<br><b>ואיבעית אימא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The ואיבעית אימא maintains that the two previous statements are discussing two different types of children.</i> הא בכחוש והא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The 'ואיבעית אימא' in the גמרא there substantiates what תוספות says here that by a בריא [לגמרי], he can begin even younger than six years old.</i> בבריא:</b><br><b>And if you want I can say, this</b> (that he will be sick) is regarding <b>a weak</b> child, <b>and this</b> (the א"ד) is by a <b>healthy</b> child.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A child who is בריא לגמרי can begin learning at five years old.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Perhaps בן חמש in the משנה means when he completed his five years and is entering his sixth year and כבן שש here means when he is entering his sixth year, so there is no contradiction at all!<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See תורת חיים.</i>

Line 6

<b>אחד<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> מבני מבוי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A neighborhood was set up in the following manner; there was a small street or alleyway (מבוי) which opened (on one side [usually]) to the main street (the רה"ר). Let us picture this מבוי in the shape of the letter חי"ת, with the bottom opening into a רה"ר. Along the outside walls of this חי"ת (מבוי) were courtyards חצרים (which opened into the מבוי). Each חצר consisted of a few houses which opened into this חצר. The houses in one חצר shared a communal courtyard (חצר), the various חצרים around the outside walls of the מבוי shared the same מבוי. </i> כולי—One of the <i>Mohvooy</i> dwellers, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our גמרא cites a ברייתא, which states that if one of the בני מבוי decided to open a medical practice in the מבוי,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means that the practice will be in his house which is opened to a חצר which opens to this מבוי (not that the practice will take place in the מבוי).</i> or to become a אומן, גרדי or מלמד תינוקות, any other member of the מבוי can prevent him from doing so.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This would mean that any member of this מבוי, even if he lives in a different חצר of this מבוי, can prevent him.</i> תוספות rejects this גירסא.<br>------------------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו שמשון בן אברהם דלא גרס מבוי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרות the text reads חצר, however there was a גירסא of מבוי and the רשב"א rejects that גירסא.</i> אלא חצר<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This means that only a fellow member of the same חצר can prevent him, but not a member of a different חצר, even though they share the same מבוי.</i> –<br>The רשב"א explained that the גירסא is not מבוי, but rather חצר –<br>דאי גרס מבוי תיקשי לאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See previously on the bottom of כ,ב where אביי explains the סיפא of the משנה in a case of חצר אחרת; meaning that the people of another חצר in the same מבוי cannot prevent one from opening a business in another חצר. If the גירסא here would be בני מבוי, this would contradict the ruling of אביי. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דשרי בחצר אחרת –<br>For if the גירסא is מבוי, there will be a difficulty according to אביי who permits</b> opening a business <b>in another חצר –<br>וההיא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא on the עמוד ב'.</i> דעושה אדם חנות בצד חנות של חבירו שרי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שרי נמי לכל (instead of שרי לכל).</i> לכל הפחות בחצר אחר<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">That permission cannot mean that he can only open up in another מבוי, for that is obvious! It must mean (at least) that he can open another store in the same מבוי, but in a different חצר.</i> –<br>And</b> the גירסא of מבוי will also contradict <b>that</b> ברייתא, which states, ‘<b>a person may open a store next to his friend’s store’,</b> that permission <b>is [also] granted at least</b> to open a store <b>in an adjacent חצר</b> (in the same מבוי) –<br><b>ורבא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See on the end of the previous עמוד, where רבא disagrees with אביי and maintains that the משנה is not discussing חצר אחרת, so perhaps according to רבא even the members of a different חצר (in the same מבוי) can be מעכב.</i> נמי לא פליג עליה אלא<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">רבא argues that sאביי' answer of בחצר אחרת does not fit in the משנה, for the משנה does not state חצר אחרת.</i> דמוקי מתניתין דשריא אף באותה חצר –<br>And even רבא does not argue with אביי</b> (that members of another חצר cannot be מעכב), <b>rather he establishes the משנה that it is permitted</b> to establish a children’s school <b>even in the same חצר</b> and no one can protest –<br><b>והכא אסר אפילו בחצר אחרת<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">This is an even greater contradiction to רבא, who permits a school even באותה חצר and this ברייתא rules that even a חצר אחרת can protest!</i> אלא אחד מבני חצר גרס:</b><br><b>And here</b> (if the גירסא is מבוי) <b>it is forbidden even if</b> the people <b>of another חצר</b> protest; therefore we must <b>rather</b> conclude that the <b>גירסא is אחד מבני חצר,</b> only they can protest.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Only a dweller of the same חצר can prevent a fellow dweller from opening certain businesses in this חצר, but dwellers of other חצרים in this מבוי have no say.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Perhaps we can resolve the contradiction on אביי.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> In the case of אביי the noise of the תינוקות is their coming to the store<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' כ,ב ד"ה מאי.</i>, therefore the people of the מבוי cannot be מעכב for presumably they too use this store; however in the ברייתא of רופא וכו', this will attract people from other neighborhoods, therefore maybe even the בני מבוי can prevent him from increasing the foot traffic?<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>וגרדי—And a weaver</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא taught that if one member of the חצר wants to become a weaver (in the חצר), another member of this חצר can prevent him from doing so.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה מעכבין that they may prevent him since this business will increase the noise of the people coming and going.</i> תוספות reconciles this ברייתא with other seemingly contradictory rulings.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומאי שנא גרדי מבעל ריחים –<br>And if you will say; but why is a weaver different from a mill owner –<br>דתנן במתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כ,ב.</i> דאין יכול למחות בידו ולומר איני יכול לישן מקול הריחים ומקול הפטיש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Why can one protest the noise of the weaver, but not the noise of the mill owner?</i> –<br>For our משנה taught that ‘he cannot protest and say I cannot sleep because of the noise of the mill and the noise of the hammer’;</b> why is a גרדי different?!<b></b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמתניתין בעושה לעצמו והכא בגרדי העושה לאחרים דאיכא נכנסין ויוצאין –<br>And one can say that in the משנה</b> the case is that the mill owner <b>is working for himself</b> (so there is no traffic, only the noise of the mill), <b>however here</b> we are discussing a <b>גרדי who works for others</b> (he weaves cloth for the pubic) <b>so there are</b> people <b>coming and going,</b> and one can protest this type of disturbance –<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר הא אמרינן בסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See עמוד ב'.</i> האי בר מבואה דאוקי ריחייא כולי –<br>And if you will say; but</b> רב הונא <b>ruled shortly, this member of a מבוי who established a mill</b> in his מבוי, <b>etc.</b> and another מבוי member intended to place another mill in the same מבוי –<br><b>דינא הוא דמעכב עליה משום דאמר ליה קא פסקת לחיותי –<br>The rule is that</b> the first miller <b>can prevent him</b> from placing his mill in the same מבוי, <b>since he can tell him, ‘you are infringing on my livelihood’.</b> This concludes the ruling of ר"ה –<br><b>משמע דאי לאו משום דקא פסקת לחיותי היה יכול להעמיד שם הריחים –<br>It seems that if not for the</b> claim of <b>קא פסקת לחיותי,</b> the second one <b>would be permitted to place his mill there –<br>אף על גב דעושה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It is obvious that both mills are not private but for business purposes, for otherwise if they were intended only for private use, how can he claim קא פסקת לחיותי.</i> לאחרים<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The question is that תוספות previously stated that if the mill is used for business one can be מעכב, and from ר"ה it seems that the only reason he can be מעכב is because of competition, but otherwise one would be allowed to establish a mill for business and no one can be מעכב.</i> –<br>And even though his is working for others;</b> the mill is a business enterprise –<br>תוספות continues to ask:<br><b>ולקמן נמי תניא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">On the עמוד ב'. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> עושה אדם חנות בצד חנותו של חבירו כולי –<br>And later the ברייתא also teaches us that ‘one may make a store next to his friend’s store, etc.’;</b> this is true –<br><b>דאף על גב דאיכא נכנסין ויוצאין טובא –<br>Even though there are many people coming and going,</b> and here we say that if it is a business one can prevent it from opening –<br>תוספות rejects a possible solution:<br><b>ודוחק לחלק דהתם כבר יש יוצאין ונכנסין לריחים הראשון או לחנות הראשון<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The rejected proposed answer was that when there is no prior business and one wants to open a new business, the others may be מעבכ because of the traffic; however in those two cases where there already was a business and there was already traffic (so the people are used to it), perhaps an additional store will still be bearable. תוספות rejects this as a דוחק for obviously two stores means much more traffic than one store.</i> –<br>And it is difficult to differentiate that there</b> (in the cases of רחיים and חנות) <b>there is already</b> foot <b>traffic from the first mill or the first store,</b> therefore the additional foot traffic is somewhat bearable. תוספות rejects this answer as a דוחק.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהתם בחצר אחרת שרי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה אחד that a person from one חצר cannot be מעכב on a person from another חצר (even in the same מבוי). Therefore there is no question from ריחיים and חנות since the new business was in a different חצר.</i> –<br>And one can say that there it is permitted</b> because the other business is opening <b>in another חצר –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate answer to his first question:<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i><br><b>אי נמי מתניתין נמי בעושה לאחרים –<br>Or</b> you can <b>also</b> say <b>that our משנה,</b> which does not allow anyone to be מעכב on the mill and the banging of the hammer <b>is also</b> in a case <b>where he works for others –<br>ובריחים ובקול הפטיש אין נכנסין ויוצאין כל כך שנותנין לו פעם אחת וטוחן –<br>But</b> nonetheless <b>by a mill and hammer noise there is not so much foot traffic for they give him</b> the wheat <b>one time and he grinds it; <sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">According to this answer we can also explain why by ריחיים וחנות they cannot be מעכב (if not for the claim of קא פסקת) because in those cases there is little foot traffic.</i></b> the same is with the smith –<br><b>אבל בגרדי יש הרבה יוצאין ונכנסין שהרבה מביאין לו מטוה:</b><br><b>However by a weaver there is a lot of foot traffic for many</b> people <b>bring him yarn</b> to weave –<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה is when it is a private mill or smithy, the case of גרדי is a business, the case of ריחים וחנות is in two separate חצרים, or all cases are businesses, however there is more traffic by a weaver than by a mill or a smith.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות answers that the case of a חנות (בצד חנותו וכו') is when they are in two different חצרים. However when תוספות asked his question he assumed that they were in the same חצר;<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> why therefore did not תוספות ask how can we say that we cannot be מעכב the חנות, when in our משנה it clearly states חנות שבחצר יכול למחות?!<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and נחלת משה.</i>

Line 7



Line 8

<b>ולא לסופר ארמאי—And not to a gentile teacher</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא teaches us that one may not rent out his house in a חצר השותפין to a gentile teacher (because of the noise the students will make). תוספות reconciles this ברייתא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>משמע דאם לא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, לא היה סופר שרי (instead of לא סופר הוה שרי).</i> סופר הוה שרי להשכיר לארמאי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא only prohibits renting to a סופר ארמאי, but not to a ‘plain’ ארמאי.</i> –<br>It seems</b> from this ברייתא <b>that if</b> this gentile <b>was not a teacher, it would be permitted to rent out</b> one’s house <b>to a Gentile.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר דאמרינן בהגוזל בתרא (בבא קמא דף קיד,א) האי בר ישראל –<br>And if you will say, in</b> פרק <b>הגוזל בתרא where</b> רב אשי <b>stated, ‘this Jewish person –<br>דזבין ליה ארעא לעובד כוכבים אמיצרא דבר ישראל חבריה משמתינן ליה –<br>Who sold to a gentile land, which bordered</b> the property <b>of another Jew,</b> the rule is, the seller <b>is placed in חרם (excommunication) –<br>דאמר ליה אריא ארבעת אמיצראי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The gentile buyer will make all sorts of problems for the Jewish neighbor (like a lion, which causes problems).</i> –<br>For</b> the Jewish neighbor <b>says to</b> the seller <b>‘you placed a lion</b> (the נכרי) <b>at my border’;</b> we see that it is forbidden to sell land to any gentile (next to a ישראל), so why here do we only prevent a סופר ארמאי to rent, but not a regular ארמאי <b>–</b><br>תוספות rejects an anticipated solution:<br><b>ודוחק לחלק בין מכר לשכירות<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">One may choose to say that the prohibition is only to sell to a נכרי (who borders a ישראל), for then the damage is for an extensive time; however renting to a gentile is only temporary and may be permitted.  תוספות finds this distinction not to be adequate, for even a temporary damage is untenable.  </i> –<br>And it is difficult to differentiate between a sale and a rental –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דהתם כשישראל רצה לקנות אבל אם אין ישראל רוצה לקנות מותר:</b><br><b>And it is the view of the ר"י that there</b> in פרק הגוזל it is in a situation <b>where a Jew wanted to buy this property,</b> therefore the seller should not sell it to the נכרי, <b>however if no ישראל wants to buy, it is permitted</b> to sell<b></b> it to a נכרי, and similarly it is permitted to rent it to a נכרי (near another ישראל).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The prohibition of selling (or renting) to a gentile a property near another Jew, is only if there is another Jew who wants to buy (or rent) the property; otherwise it is permitted.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the ruling if there is another ישראל who is interested in buying, however the נכרי is offering a higher price; may the ישראל sell it to the נכרי?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>בסופר מתא—By a<i> Soifayr</i> of the city</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא answered that when the ברייתא stated that one may not rent out his house בחצר השותפין to a סופר, it meant a סופר מתא (not a ‘regular’ teacher of children). There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות how to explain ספר מתא.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>אין נראה לפרש כפירוש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה בסופר רש"י actually writes, מלמד תינוקות העיר ומושיב מלמדים תחתיו והוא מורה את כולם איך יעשו ויש שם קול גדול. It is not clear how תוספות understood this רש"י.</i> דסופר מתא היינו מלמד תינוקות של כל העיר –<br>It does not appear</b> to be correct <b>to explain</b> סופר מתא to mean <b>as רש"י explained it that a סופר מתא is the teacher of the small children of the entire city –<br>דאיכא קול גדול –<br>So there is much noise</b> (therefore it is prohibited to rent him a house in the חצר השותפין). The reason תוספות rejects פרש"י is –<br><b>דהא לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See כא,ב.</i> אמר רבא מקרי דרדקי וסופר מתא כמותרין ועומדין<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means that if they are negligent in performing their duties, they can be discharged without any additional warning. Their negligence causes irreparable damage.</i> –<br>For later רבא ruled that one who teaches small children</b> to read, <b>and a סופר מתא</b> are considered <b>as if they were duly forewarned,</b> תוספות asks according to פרש"י <b>–<br>כיון דאשמועינן דמקרי דרדקי הוי פסידא דלא הדר הוא הדין מלמד כל תינוקות העיר –<br>Since</b> רבא <b>informed us that a מקרי דרדקי</b> (who is negligent) <b>is considered a damage that cannot be repaired, the same should apply</b> to a סופר מתא who, according to רש"י <b>is the teacher of all the city’s little children –<br>ואמאי איצטריך תו למינקט סופר מתא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If a teacher of one class is considered forewarned because of the irreparable damage he can cause if he is negligent, how much more so this applies to the master teacher of the whole city! See however רש"י there ד"ה סופר מתא that it refers to a scribe (not a master teacher). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>So why was it necessary</b> for רבא <b>to also mention סופר מתא,</b> it is obvious!<br>תוספות rejects another פרש"י elsewhere:<br><b>ואין לפרש נמי כפירוש הקונטרס בהמקבל (בבא מציעא דף קט,ב)<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This is amended to read פרק השואל צז,א, The text there reads ספר מתא (without a וי"ו), not סופר מתא. Perhaps the text in תוספות here should be amended to read ספר (not סופר). A ספר (סמ"ך פתוחה, פ"א קמוצה) is indeed a barber.</i> סופר מתא מספר אנשי העיר –<br>And we also cannot explain it as רש"י explains it in</b> פרק <b>(המקבל) [השואל]</b> that <b>ספר מתא</b> means <b>the barber for the city people –<br>דהא קרי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read קרי ליה הכא (instead of קרי הכא).</i> הכא בברייתא סופר –<br>For in the ברייתא here he is called 'סופר'</b> (a teacher or scribe), not a ספר (barber) –<br>תוספות offers his interpretation of a סופר מתא:<br><b>אלא נראה כמו שפירש רבינו חננאל סופר מתא כותב שטרות העיר –<br>Rather</b> תוספות <b>prefers how the ר"ח explains it that סופר מתא</b> means <b>the</b> scribe <b>who writes the documents for</b> the people in the <b>city –</b><br><b>ולהכי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">We can understand if סופר מתא means a teacher why it is a פסידא דלא הדר (see תוס' כא,ב ד"ה ומקרי), however תוספות feels it necessary to explain why by a scribe it is a פסידא דלא הדר.</i> חשיב ליה לקמן פסידא דלא הדר אם נכתב השטר<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">If for instance if was a note of debt and the סופר entered the wrong amount, either the מלוה or the לוה will lose.</i> שלא כדין:</b><br><b>And therefore</b> the גמרא <b>considers</b> a mistake of the סופר מתא <b>as an irreparable damage, for if the document is written improperly</b> there is no recourse.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>סופר מתא can mean a master teacher, (a barber?), or the city scribe for documents.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does not תוספות cite פרש"י on the עמוד ב' that סופר מתא means a לבלר (a scribe)?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See (עד"ז) בנחלת משה.</i><br>2. According to the ר"ח that a סופר מתא writes the שטרות העיר, why indeed, can one prevent someone from renting him a house בחצר השותפין?

Line 9

<b>מתקנת יהושע בן גמלא ואילך לא ממטינן ינוקא ממתא למתא—From the enactment of יהושע בן גמלא and onwards we do not bring a child from city to city</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא taught that after the תקנה of יהושע בן גמלא that each city is required to provide teachers for the young children, we do not move the children from one city to another, but rather each city is obligated to provide a teacher for their city. [A teacher can teach from twenty five up to (but not including) forty students in a class. Once there are forty students (up to fifty) we need to hire an assistant. Fifty of more requires two teachers.] תוספות first qualifies and then explains this ruling.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>וכגון שיש כאן כ"ה ינוקי שראויין להשכיר להם מלמד<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Otherwise if there are no twenty-five students, the local children may be transported to another city and join the classes there. See the following תוספות ד"ה סך. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>And</b> this rule is valid provided <b>where for instance there are twenty-five children</b> in this city <b>that require that a teacher be hired</b> for them –<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר הא אי הוה ממטינן להו למתא אחריתי יצטרכו מלמד בפני עצמן –<br>And if you will say, but if</b> the rule would be not like רבא, and <b>we would</b> be permitted <b>to bring them</b> (these twenty-five students) <b>to another city, they would require a teacher for themselves –<br>כיון דאיכא כ"ה ינוקי ואם כן מאי נפקא מינה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות taught us that the ruling of רבא is only if there are twenty five students (see footnote # 1). Why do we need the ruling of רבא, what will be the purpose of moving twenty-five children from one city to another, they will still require a separate teacher for their class, so we can have them learn here, why take them elsewhere?! </i> –</b><br><b>Since they are twenty-five children, so therefore what difference does it make</b> whether we move them to another city, or not?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דנפקא מינה דאי הוו ב' מלמדי תינוקות באידך מתא –<br>And one can say; that there is a difference</b> in a case <b>if there are two teachers in the other city</b> (with a total of fifty students; twenty five in each class), if not for רבא –<br><b>היו יכולין להושיב חציים בפני זה וחציים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">One would have 37 student and the other 38; it is still less than 40. See ‘Overview’. They will save the wages of one teacher. Therefore רבא teaches that this is not permitted and they must hire a separate teacher for these 25 students locally.</i> בפני זה:</b><br><b>They could place half</b> the students (twelve) <b>before one</b> teacher <b>and</b> the other <b>half</b> (thirteen) <b>before the other teacher.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The rule of רבא is only if there are twenty five students. The rule is necessary in a case where in the other city there are fifty students and two teachers.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is it that if there are less than twenty-five students, they can be moved to another city (so the local city will not incur the expense of a teacher),<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> so even if there are twenty-five students why can’t they be moved as well, to limit the expense?!

Line 10

<b>סך מקרי דרדקי כ"ה ינוקי—The total for a teacher of beginners is twenty-five children</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא taught that the total amount of students for one teacher is twenty-five. תוספות explains how we are to understand this.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The expression סך מקרי וכו' would indicate perhaps that the total should not be more than twenty-five, or perhaps it means that we need a total of twenty-five to hire a teacher. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><br>------------------------------------<br><b>אבל פחות מכאן אין בני העיר יכולין לכוף זה את זה להשכיר להם מלמד:<br>However less than this</b> amount, if there are not twenty-five students in the city, <b>the people of the city cannot force each other to hire a teacher</b> for these children.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We require a minimum of twenty-five children to coerce all the people of the city to hire a teacher.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did תוספות not want to learn that twenty-five is the maximum amount<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> of children for one teacher?<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רמב"ן, רשב"א, etc.</i>

Daf 21b



Line 1

<b>פירש רבינו חננאל—<i>Rabeinu Chananel</i> explained</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that יואב killed only the males of אדום; when asked why, he replied that this is how was taught to read the פסוק as זכר (with two קמצי"ם) meaning males, when the teacher was asked, the teacher replied that he taught him זכר; however there are no vowels in the גמרא, so we are not certain what his רבי taught יואב. The גמרא concludes that יואב wanted to kill his רבי, saying that he was עושה מלאכת ה' רמיה.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This פסוק in ירמיה מח,י means that one who is slack and fraudulent in doing the work of ה' should be cursed. Teaching children how to read תורה is מלאכת ה'. Therefore יואב wanted to kill him since he was not taught the proper way how to read תמחה את זכר עמלק.</i> The ר"ח explains the גמרא as follows:<br>----------------------------------<br><b>דרביה אקרייה זכר כדין והיינו רמייה דלא אשגח למידע היכי הוה קרי תלמידיה וכן נראה –<br>That his רבי taught him זכר properly</b> (הזיי"ן צרויה והכ"ף סגולה), meaning the remembrance<b></b> (of עמלק), <b>and the רמייה</b> (the slackness of the רבי) <b>consisted that</b> the רבי <b>did not pay attention how his student was reading</b> it, <b>and</b> תוספות <b>agrees</b> with this explanation –<b></b><br>תוספות rejects an alternate explanation:<br><b>אבל אין נראה לפרש שגם רבו טעה ולימדו זכר דאם כן לאו רמייה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">רמייה indicates a lack of diligence in the teaching, but here the teacher was not slack, he merely was mistaken himself, that cannot be called רמייה. It is an honest mistake. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> הוא:</b><br><b>However,</b> תוספות <b>disagrees with an</b> alternate <b>explanation that also the רבי was mistaken and he</b> incorrectly <b>taught him זכר</b> (with two קצמי"ם; meaning males) <b>for if that</b> indeed was the case, <b>it cannot</b> be considered <b>רמייה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The רבי was slack since he did not follow up on how his student is reading, but not that the רבי made a mistake, for that is not considered רמייה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there any advantage in the second explanation (the אין נראה לפרש)?

Line 2



Line 3

<b>ומקרי דרדקי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The text in the גמרא reads ומקרי ינוקא (not ומקרי דרדקי). סופר מתא, which was the ד"ה of the previous תוספות is mentioned last in the גמרא (after מקרי ינוקא and שתלא).</i>—And a teacher of children</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא ruled that certain people are considered forewarned and can be fired if they made a mistake, without any (additional) warning, since their mistake is a mistake which cannot be rectified. Among these people is a מקרי דרדקי. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to why a מקרי דרדקי is considered a פסידא דלא הדר.<br>--------------------------<br><b>פירש בקונטרס בהמקבל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה מקרי (the last רש"י on the עמוד).</i> (בבא מציעא דף קט,א ושם) דהוי פסידא דלא הדרא –<br>רש"י explained in</b> פרק <b>המקבל that</b> if a מקרי דרדקי does not teach properly <b>it is</b> considered <b>an irretrievable loss –<br>משום דשבשתא כיון דעל על –<br>Because an error, once it enters</b> into the mind of the student, <b>it remains</b> there, and it cannot be unlearned (easily) –<br>תוספות disagrees with פרש"י:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו יצחק דהא רבא גופיה אית ליה לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See כא,א. How can we explain the ruling of רבא that a מקרי דרדקי is considered a פסידא דלא הדר because of שבשתא כיון דעל על (as רש"י would have it), since רבא himself disagrees with this concept and maintains the opposite that שבשתא ממילא נפקא?!</i> דשבשתא ממילא נפקא –<br>And the ר"י has a difficulty</b> with this explanation of רש"י, <b>for it is רבא himself who maintained previously, that an error will be corrected on its own;</b> the student will recognize the mistake sooner or later and correct himself –<br>תוספות offers his explanation:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דהוה פסידא דלא הדר –<br>And the ר"י says that it is an irretrievable loss –<br>דאותה שעה שמלמד להם טעות הם מתבטלים ואותה שעה אין יכולין להחזיר לעולם:</b><br><b>Since at the moment that he is teaching them incorrectly, they are wasting time</b> (and not learning תורה) <b>and that moment can never be retrieved!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A מקרי דרדקי is considered a פסידא דלא הדר since שבשתא כיון דעל על (רש"י), or the time wasted from learning תורה can never be retrieved.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to תוספות that a מלמד can be fired for making a mistake in teaching, because it causes ביטול תורה, are we allowed to give the children time off in middle of learning (recess, etc.); it is causing ביטול תורה?!
<b>שתלא—A tree planter</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא ruled that certain people are considered forewarned and can be fired if they made a mistake, without any (additional) warning, since their mistake is a mistake which cannot be rectified. Among these people is a שתלא, one who plants trees. תוספות explains why his mistake cannot be rectified.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי פסידא איכא אי יפסיד ישלם –<br>And if you will say; what</b> irretrievable <b>loss is there</b> by the שתלא; <b>if he</b> caused <b>damage</b> (by not planting [properly]) <b>let him pay,</b> so the employer will not sustain any loss?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאינו מפסיד אלא שפושע<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The שתלא was given saplings to plant. He planted them somewhat recklessly and the saplings did not mature properly, however they are now still worth more than the saplings, therefore he did not cause an actual loss to the owner, he merely deprived him from additional profit. One cannot claim damages from losing potential profit. Therefore this is considered a פסידא דלא הדרא and (even though we cannot hold him liable for the damages, nevertheless) he can be fired without warning.</i> שאין הנטיעות גדילות כמו שהיו ראויות ליגדל:</b><br><b>And one can say that</b> the שתלא <b>is not damaging</b> or destroying anything; <b>rather he is negligent</b> in his work <b>so that the saplings do not grow as they were supposed to grow</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The שתלא may not cause damage but he minimizes the profit (for which he is not liable), therefore he can be fired.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks about a שתלא; why did תוספות not ask about a טבח or a סופר מתא, why should they not pay if they damaged, just as he asks regarding a שתלא?!<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i>
<b>סופר מתא—The city scribe</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא ruled that certain people are considered forewarned and can be fired if they made a mistake, without any (additional) warning, since their mistake is a mistake which cannot be rectified. Among these people is a סופר מתא. There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות as to the identity of the סופר מתא.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>לא כמו שפירש בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה פסידא.</i> כותב ספר תורה בטעות דאין זה פסידא דלא הדר דיכולין להגיהו –</b><br>A סופר מתא <b>is not, as רש"י explained, one who wrote a ס"ת with mistakes, for that is not</b> considered <b>an irretrievable loss, for</b> the ס"ת <b>can be amended –<br>אלא כדפרישית לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כא,א תוס' ד"ה בסופר [TIE (there) footnote # 8]. A mistake in the amount due in a loan document is an irretrievable loss to either the lender or the borrower.</i> כותב שטרות:</b><br><b>Rather</b> a סופר מתא <b>is one who writes the documents, as I explained previously.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רש"י maintains that the סופר מתא is the scribe who writes the ס"ת, while תוספות maintains it is the scribe who writes the documents.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If the scribe wrote the incorrect amount in a loan document (for instance a sum less than the actual loan) and the לוה paid the smaller amount. Seemingly if witnesses testify to this mistake, cannot the מלוה collect his loss from the סופר (if the לוה is not here, etc.)? Why is it a פסידא דלא הדר?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See חי' הרשב"א.</i>

Line 5

<b>מרחיקין מצודת הדג כולי—We distance the fish nets, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites a ברייתא which states that one must distance his trap to catch fish from an existing trap, the distance that a fish can travel (which is a פרסה). This proves that one cannot encroach on his fellow’s livelihood. תוספות discusses this ruling.<br>---------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דרבינו תם מפרש דבדבר של הפקר אפילו רשע לא מיקרי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">There is a rule that by an עני המהפך בחררה (a poor person circling around a cookie) and someone took it away from him, that person is called a רשע (even though that legally he may keep the object). The ר"ת explains that this rule applies only if the עני wants to buy something and another buys it ahead of him; in that case he is called a רשע, since he could have bought the same item elsewhere. However if it is a מציאה (something which is הפקר) anyone can go ahead and be זוכה from הפקר even though another may be planning to acquire it, In this case we cannot say to him, ‘why are you taking this, go find another מציאה’, since מציאות are not [easily] found. Here too by the fish, the fish is הפקר, so why do we need to distance one’s net from another’s net, since by הפקר (according to the ר"ת) there is no rule of עני המהפך בחררה.</i> –<br>Even though that the ר"ת explained that by an item of הפקר, one is not even called a רשע</b> if he encroaches on his friend’s intent to acquire the הפקר item. The ר"ת proves this –<br><b>כדתנן (פאה פרק ד משנה ג) גבי פאה פירס טליתו עליה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">By merely spreading a טלית over the פאה he does not acquire it (there was no מעשה קנין); the question, however is why we remove him and let the others collect the פאה, this person (who spread his טלית) is seemingly an עני המהפך בחררה, so if others take it they should be considered a רשע. This proves (the ruling of the ר"ת) that by הפקר (like פאה, which is הפקר לעניים) the concept of עני המהפך בחררה does not apply.</i> מעבירין אותו ממנה –<br>As the משנה taught regarding פאה,</b> ‘<b>if</b> a poor person <b>spread out his טלית over</b> the פאה (with the intent of acquiring it for himself), the rule is <b>we remove him from</b> this פאה and we allow the other poor people (also) to collect the פאה –<br>Another proof to the view of the ר"ת:<br><b>וכן תנן בפרק קמא דבבא מציעא (דף י,א) ראה את המציאה ונפל עליה ובא אחר והחזיק בה –<br>And similarly the משנה taught in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ב"מ, ‘he saw a מציאה and fell on it</b> (but did not pick it up) <b>and another</b> person <b>came and took possession of it,</b> the rule is <b>–<br>זה שהחזיק בה זכה –<br>The one who took possession acquires it’,</b> and we do not consider him to be a רשע even though his friend wanted it and made his intention clear by falling on the מציאה –<br><b>ולא מיקרי רשע אלא בעני המהפך בחררה ובא אחר ונטלה –<br>And one is not called a רשע</b> in these cases of הפקר, <b>only by</b> a case of <b>עני המהפך בחררה and another came and took it</b> away from the עני, in that case he is called a רשע –<br><b>משום שאם לא ישתכר במקום זה ימצא להשתכר במקום אחר –<br>Because</b> we say to him <b>that if he will not profit in this place, he will find another place from where to profit –</b><br>תוספות now answers his initial question:<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i><br><b>והך דשמעתא לא קשיא דאף על גב דהוי דבר של הפקר –<br>And there is no difficulty from this ruling here, even though</b> the fish <b>is an item of הפקר,</b> and by הפקר there is no rule of עני המהפך בחררה, it is free for anyone –<br><b>מכל מקום בכמה מקומות ימצא שיוכל לפרוס מצודתו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This is not like regular הפקר (like מציאה) where we cannot say to him, ‘find your מציאה elsewhere’; however here by fishing there are many places where one can fish, so therefore if one is already fishing in this area, anyone else should find other fishing grounds, or be considered a רשע.</i> ועוד<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is differentiating (in this second answer) between the ruling of עני המהפך בחררה (which does not apply to הפקר), and the ruling of 'פסקת לחיותי', which can apply even to הפקר.</i> דהכא אומנותו בכך –<br>Nevertheless, he can find many other places where he can spread his net, and additionally that here this is his trade</b> and livelihood of the initial fisherman <b>–</b><br>תוספות continues with a question:<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See later by footnote # 11.</i><br><b>והא דאמרינן בפרק חזקת הבתים (לקמן דף נד,ב) נכסי כנענים הרי הן כמדבר –<br>And this which</b> רב יהודה אמר שמואל <b>states in פרק חזקת הבתים; ‘the properties of gentiles,</b> which are being sold to Jews, <b>are like a wilderness;</b> meaning they are הפקר, so that –<br><b>כל המחזיק בהן זכה בהן מאי טעמא –<br>Whoever takes possession of them acquires them’;</b> the גמרא explains, <b>that the reason is –<br>כנעני מכי מטא זוזי לידיה איסתלק ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The mode of acquisition and sale by a נכרי is through money (כסף), therefore as soon as the נכרי received the money for his field, he relinquishes his ownership of the field. However the ישראל who is purchasing the field from the נכרי, does not acquire the field until the נכרי writes him a שטר (a deed) granting him the field. In the interim (after the נכרי received the money and before the ישראל received the שטר) the field is ownerless; it no longer belongs to the נכרי since he forfeited his ownership of the field as soon as he was paid, while the ישראל does not assume ownership until he has his שטר, therefore the field is הפקר and כל המחזיק בו זכה בו.</i> וישראל לא קני עד דמטי שטרא לידיה –<br>As soon as the gentile receives the money in his hand, he is removed</b> from the property, <b>and the ישראל</b> who is purchasing the land <b>does not acquire it until he receives a deed in his hand –<br>ופירש רבינו שמואל בן מאיר התם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה הרי. The רשב"ם there maintains that the מחזיק is not even required to repay the original buyer for the loss of his money</i> דישראל המחזיק רשע מיהא מיקרי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The purchaser was an עני המהפך בחררה and this other ישראל snatched it away from him.</i> –<br>And the רשב"ם explained there that the</b> other <b>ישראל</b> (not the purchaser) <b>who takes possession</b> of the property, <b>is nevertheless called a רשע –<br>ולפירוש רבינו תם אפילו רשע לא הוי כיון שלא ימצא במקום אחר<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">This field is הפקר, and by הפקר the rule of עני המהפך בחררה does not apply (see footnote # 1).</i> –<br>However according to the פירוש ר"ת the</b> מחזיק <b>is not even considered a רשע, since he cannot find</b> a הפקר property <b>elsewhere –<br>וקשה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This is the conclusion of the question mentioned by footnote # 6.</i> לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם מהא דאמר באיזהו נשך (בבא מציעא דף עג,ב) –<br>So</b> based on the aforementioned, <b>the רשב"א has a difficulty</b> with the פר"ת <b>from this</b> which the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>איזהו נשך –<br>רב מרי בר רחל משכן ליה ההוא נכרי ביתא אזל רבא וזבניה –<br>A certain gentile</b> transferred <b>his house to רב מרי בר רחל as a security (משכון)</b> for a loan; <b>רבא went and bought this</b> house from the נכרי, while רמב"ר was still living in the house –<br><b>נטר תריסר ירחי שתא שקל אגר ביתא אמטייה לרבא<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The rent was for the following twelve months.</i> –</b><br>רמב"ר <b>waited twelve months</b> and then <b>took</b> with him <b>the rent for the house and bought it to רבא –<br>אמר ליה האי דלא מטאי לה למר אגר ביתא עד השתא דאמר מר סתם משכנתא שתא –</b><br>רמב"ר <b>said to</b> רבא, <b>‘the reason that I did not bring you rent until now</b> (for the past twelve months) <b>is because the master said that an unqualified משכון is for one year –<br>ולא מצי נכרי לסלוקי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">When the נכרי gave רמב"ר the house for a משכון it is presumed that רמב"ר (the מלוה) can live there for a year (סתם משכנתא שתא), and the מלוה deducts the amount of rent due from the loan. Therefore even though רבא bought the house from the נכרי (but after the loan and the giving of the משכון), nevertheless רמב"ר already acquired the right to live in the house for a year, and the purchase of רבא cannot deprive him of this right.</i> –<br>And the נכרי cannot remove me</b> for this whole year’. This concludes the גמרא.<br><b>והשתא כיון שקדמה חזקת רב מרי לחזקת רבא<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">When רבא bought the house, ר"מ was already living in the house; meaning that he made a חזקה in the house before רבא. At the moment when the house became הפקר (while רבא was purchasing it) ר"מ was מחזיק in it (by living there).</i> –<br>But now since the חזקה of ר"מ preceded the חזקה of רבא –<br>אם כן זכה בה רב מרי דנכסי הכנעני הרי הן כמדבר –<br>Therefore ר"מ acquired</b> the house, <b>since</b> we said<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> <b>that the properties of a נכרי</b> who is selling to a ישראל <b>are</b> הפקר <b>like a מדבר.</b> The question therefore is why did רמב"ר need to pay rent to רבא, since the house now belonged to רמב"ר.<b><br>ואי מקרי רשע<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8 & 9.</i> אתי שפיר דלא היה רוצה לזכות בה –<br>So if he is called a רשע</b> (as the רשב"ם stated), <b>it is understood</b> why ר"מ paid the rent, <b>since he did not want to acquire it</b> (for he did not want to be a רשע) –<br><b>אבל לפירוש רבינו תם דאפילו רשע לא מיקרי –<br>However according to the ר"ת</b> that<b></b> רמב"ר <b>would not even be called a רשע –<br>אמאי לא זכה בה רב מרי כיון דהיתר גמור הוא –<br>Why did not ר"מ acquire it, since it is perfectly permissible?!</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ושמא לפנים משורת הדין עבד –<br>And perhaps</b> רמב"ר <b>acted beyond the requirement of the law;</b> he did not want to cause a loss for רבא, even though legally it is permitted.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק בן אברהם נראה דחזקת רב מרי לא היתה אלא בתורת משכון<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably a חזקה must be with intent to own the property, however רמב"ר had no such intention.</i> –<br>And it appears to the ריב"א that ר"מ took possession only in regards to a משכון,</b> but he had no intention of making a חזקה for ownership –<br><b>ורבא קנה ממנו בשטר וזכה בה ואחר כך נתן מעות<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">In this scenario the house was never הפקר, since רבא acquired it first with a שטר before the נכרי removed himself from the house (which happened later when he received the money). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><br>And</b> (additionally/alternately) <b>רבא bought</b> the house from the נכרי <b>with a שטר and</b> thereby <b>acquired it</b> first <b>and</b> only <b>afterwards did he give the money</b> to the נכרי.<br><b>[ועיין עוד תוספות קדושין נט,א דיבור המתחיל עני המהפך וכולי ותוספות בבא מציעא עג,ב: סוף דיבור המתחיל נטר]:</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ruling of עני המהפך בחררה does not apply to הפקר, except for cases like fishing (where there are other places to fish) or where one is encroaching on someone’s livelihood. A חזקה for a משכון is not effective for an ownership חזקה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>From תוספות it seems that רבא acquired the house with the receiving of the שטר.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18.</i> However תוספות there in ב"ב (נד,ב ד"ה עובד) clearly states,שטר ודאי לא קנה בעובד כוכבים, so תוספות should have rather answered that רבא gave him the money at the same time that he received the שטר.<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See משפט שלום (למהרש"ם) סי' קצא בהגה"ה אות ג'.</i>
