<b>תנאי היא דתניא כולי—There are <i>Tahnoh’im</i>; as it was taught, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב הונא ruled that if one בן מבוי has a mill in the מבוי, he can prevent another בן מבוי from opening a competing mill (since קא פסקת ליה לחיותי). The גמרא challenged ר"ה from a ברייתא which stated that one may open up a competing business. The גמרא answered that this is really a dispute between תנאים and cites another ברייתא (of כופין בני מבואות), where רשב"ג agrees with ר"ה. Our תוספות discusses why the גמרא did not cite the משנה we already mentioned.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דאמאי לא מייתי (הברייתא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read המשנה (instead of הברייתא).</i>) דלעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to the previously cited מחלוקת between ר' יהודה ורבנן regarding יחלק חנוני קליות לתינוקות. In that משנה it is apparent that ר"י supports the view of ר"ה, and the גמרא concluded that even the רבנן may agree with ר"ה.</i> –<br>The רשב"א is astounded, why did</b> the גמרא <b>not cite the previous משנה –<br>דממה נפשך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means whether the חכמים (who argue with ר"י regarding חילוק קליות) agree with ר"ה (for they differentiate between חילוק קליות and the case of ר"ה), or whether the חכמים disagree with ר"ה (see footnote # 2), however ר"י certainly disagrees with the ברייתא of פותח אדם חנות וכו', and agrees with ר"ה so we can say that there is no question on ר"ה from the ברייתא, because ר"ה can argue that he follows the view of ר"י! See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> רבי יהודה דאמר לא יחלק חנוני קליות ואגוזים לתינוקות פליג אהך ברייתא –<br>For in any event, ר"י who maintains one may not distribute קליות ואגוזים to children,</b> certainly <b>argues on this ברייתא</b> of עושה אדם חנות בצד חנותו של חברו וכו', so why the need to cite a new ברייתא, when the previously cited משנה is sufficient –<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>ושמא ניחא לאתויי תנאי דפליגי בהדיא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">However, the משנה of ר"י with חילוק קליות, is not explicitly discussing whether one may open a competitive business near another business (which is what the ברייתא and ר"ה are discussing). .</i> בהכי:</b><br><b>But perhaps it is preferable</b> for the גמרא <b>to cite תנאים who argue explicitly in this</b> situation whether we allow competition or not.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is (sometimes) preferable to bring an explicit (weaker) proof than an implicit stronger proof.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the main advantage if we would cite the משנה of ר"י?
<b>כופין בני מבוי זה את זה כולי ולא מלמד תינוקות—The residents of a <i>Mohvuy</i><br>can force each other, etc. and not a teacher of small children</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא (of כופין) taught that a tradesman who is a resident of the מבוי and practices his trade in that מבוי can prevent any other of the מבוי residents from allowing a similar tradesman from another מבוי to move his trade into this מבוי. However if the other tradesman lives in this same מבוי, he cannot be prevented from practicing in this מבוי. One of the tradesmen enumerated is a מלמד תינוקות. Our תוספות discusses what type of מלמד תינוקות we are discussing.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>נראה לרבינו יצחק דבמלמד תינוקות נכרים איירי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The reason for this view of the ר"י is that if this ברייתא is discussing תינוקות ישראל, how can we prevent someone from coming and teaching them. רבא taught us that from the times of יהושע בן גמלא we need to establish מלמדי תינוקות everywhere. Therefore we must say that we are discussing תינוקות נכרים.</i> –<br>It is the view of the ר"י that we are discussing a teacher of small gentile children –<br>ולא יתכן אי גרס לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">On the עמוד א' the ברייתא beginning with אחד מבני וכו'. See there תוס' ד"ה אחד. The ברייתא there stated that neighbors can prevent each other from practicing their trade, including מלמד תינוקות. The גמרא concluded that this refers only to תינוקות עכו"ם. There is a dispute there if the text reads the neighbors of one חצר, or [even] the neighbors of one מבוי. </i> אחד מבני מבוי –<br>However this would not be correct if previously the גירסא would be, ‘one member of the מבוי</b> can prevent another from becoming a מלמד תינוקות’ –<br>תוספות explains the difficulty:<br><b>דהא מוקמינן ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, ליה לעיל בתינוקות (instead of ליה בתינוקות).</i> בתינוקות נכרים ומעכבין עליו בני מבוי –<br>For [previously]</b> (in the ברייתא of אחד) <b>we have established</b> that ברייתא <b>by gentile children, and</b> the ברייתא rules that <b>the בני מבוי can prevent</b> another בן מבוי from becoming a מלמד תינוקות נכרים –<br><b>והכא קאמר דלשכינו אינו כופהו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">There is a contradiction between the ברייתות if we are גורס in the previous ברייתא, אחד מבני מבוי. According to that ברייתא any member from a מבוי can prevent another member of this מבוי from becoming a מלמד תינקות נכרים; however from our current ברייתא (of כופין) one can only prevent a non-מבוי person from becoming a מלמד but not a fellow מבוי member. </i> –<br>However here</b> (in the ברייתא of כופין) <b>it states that he cannot prevent a neighbor</b> (a fellow בן מבוי) from being a מלמד תינוקת נכרים –<br><b>ואפילו רבן שמעון בן גמליאל לא פליג אלא משום דפסיק לחיותיה –<br>And even רשב"ג</b> (who maintains that he can prevent even שכנו) <b>he only argues because</b> the new מלמד <b>is disrupting his livelihood –<br>אבל משום קול תינוקות לא חייש<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In the previous ברייתא (אחד) however it seems that one can prevent his fellow בן מבוי from becoming a teacher because of the increased noise created by the (non-Jewish) school children.</i> –<br>But</b> רשב"ג <b>is not concerned on account of the children’s noise,</b> however in the previous ברייתא (of אחד) they can prevent each other from having a מלמד because of the noise made by the children –<br><b>ומיהו לפי מה שפירשתי [לעיל]<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> דגרסינן אחד מבני חצר אתי שפיר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The first ברייתא states that the people from a courtyard can prevent anyone in their courtyard from becoming a מלמד. However they cannot prevent someone in another courtyard (חצר) from becoming a מלמד even though it is in the same מבוי. This is what the second ברייתא states that no one in a מבוי can prevent another מבוי member from becoming a מלמד (if it is not in his חצר). </i> –<br>However according to what I explained previously that the גירסא</b> (in the ברייתא of אחד מבני וכו') <b>is אחד מבני חצר, it works out well –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation of the מלמד תינוקות in the ברייתא of כופין:<br><b>ולרבינו שמשון בן אברהם נראה דהכא בתינוקות ישראל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The רשב"א disagrees with the reasoning of the ר"ת; see footnote # 1. However, the רשב"א already taught us that the גירסא in the previous ברייתא is אחד מבני חצר (not מבוי), so there is no issue or contradiction between the ברייתות, rather the רשב"א (merely) disagrees with the ר"י how to interpret this ברייתא of כופין. In any event there would be no contradiction, since that ברייתא which prohibits is by נכרים, and this ברייתא which permits is by תינוקות ישראל.</i> –<br>However it appears to the רשב"א that here</b> we are discussing <b>Jewish children –<br>ואפילו אחר תקנת יהושע בן גמלא ושאני הכא דכבר יש שם מלמד תינוקות אחר<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Our ברייתא (of כופין) is discussing competition, not noise (like the ברייתא of אחד), therefore they can prevent competition from a בן מבוי אחר (but not from a fellow בן מבוי) </i> –<br>And even after the enactment of יהושע בן גמלא</b> (that מלמדי תינוקות are to be installed in every city, but nevertheless) <b>here it is different, for there is already another מלמד תינוקות</b> (like all the other cases in this ברייתא) –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ובסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Towards the very bottom of this עמוד.</i> דקאמר דמודה רב הונא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ה ruled previously (on this עמוד) that if one has a mill in a מבוי, he can prevent another fellow בן מבוי from opening another mill (for קא פסקת ליה לחיותי).</i> במקרי דרדקי דלא מצי מעכב<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ה however admits if there is a מלמד דרדקי (a teacher of small Jewish children) in a מבוי, he cannot prevent another מלמד דרדקי from teaching in this מבוי as well (for קנאת סופרים תרבה חכמה).</i> –<br>And when</b> רב יוסף <b>stated shortly that ר"ה admits that one cannot prevent a מלמד דרדקי,</b> from teaching in a מבוי which already has a מלמד דרדקי –<br><b>ואף על גב דאיהו<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ה maintains that no competition is allowed even among members of the same מבוי (see footnote # 11).. </i> סבר כרבן שמעון בן גמליאל<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The רשב"ג maintains that one can prevent competition even from a fellow בן מבוי just like ר"ה. Now according to the רשב"א the ברייתא in which רשב"ג prohibits competitions we are discussing מלמד תינקות ישראל, meaning that רשב"ג does not allow competition even by מלמד דרדקי; this conflicts with ר"ה who permits it, even though he generally agrees with רשב"ג. </i> –<br>And even though that</b> ר"ה <b>agrees with רשב"ג –</b><br>תוספות replies:<br><b>צריך לומר דרבן שמעון בן גמליאל לא פליג אמלמד תינוקות<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">He agrees that we cannot prevent competition by מלמד דרדקי (from the same בני מבוי).</i> אלא אשארא:</b><br><b>It will be necessary to say</b> (according to ר"ה) <b>that רשב"ג does not argue</b> with the ת"ק <b>regarding מלמד תינוקות, rather</b> he only argues regarding <b>the other</b> tradesmen.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ברייתא of כופין prohibits competition from people outside the מבוי including מלמד תינוקות. According to the ר"י this refers to תינוקות נכרים, while according to the רשב"א it refers even to תינוקות ישראל. However בני חצר can prevent a מלמד תינוקות even if there is no competition. According to the רשב"א, even רשב"ג agrees with the ת"ק that we cannot prevent a מלמד דרדקי from teaching (according to ר"ה).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that if we are גורס the word מבוי in the ברייתא of אחד מבני כו', there would be a contradiction regarding a מלמד דרדקי (according to the ר"י).<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> There are seemingly additional contradictions between the ברייתות; for in the ברייתא of אחד מבני it states that they can prevent a רופא, אומן, גרדי from opening shop; while in the ברייתא of כופין here it states that one cannot prevent another בן מבוי from being a חייט or a בורסקי. Why did not תוספות discuss this contradiction?!<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i>

Line 10

<b>פשיטא לי דבר מתא אבר מתא [אחריתי מצי] מעכב—It is obvious to me that<br>a city member can prevent a member of another city</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע ruled that a city dweller can prevent a dweller from another city from coming into his city and opening a competing business. ר"ה בדר"י queried whether the same ruling applies to two people who live in different מבואות (in the same city) from opening a competing business in the other’s מבוי.<br>------------------------------------<br><b>רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע כרבנן סבירא ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling of the רבנן certainly applies to two people of the same מבוי that neither can prevent the other from opening a competing business; this is certainly included in what the רבנן meant when they said 'ולשכנו אינו מעכב'.</i> –<br>ר"ה בדר"י agrees with the רבנן</b> who argue on רשב"ג and maintain that one cannot prevent a neighbor from opening a competing business –<br><b>ומיבעי ליה בר מבואה אבר מבואה דעלמא אי מצי מעכב אי הוי בכלל שכינו אי לאו –<br>However,</b> ר"ה בדר"י <b>queried in</b> a case of <b>one בן מבוי</b> against <b>another בן מבוי</b> (of the same city), <b>whether he can be מעכב</b> or not; the query is whether the other בן מבוי is <b>included in שכנו</b> (since they live in the same city) and he cannot be מעכב, <b>or</b> he is <b>not</b> considered שכנו since he lives in a different מבוי (albeit in the same city) –<br><b>כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ואי.</i> וכוותיה קיימא לן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A בן מבוי can certainly not prevent a fellow בן מבוי from opening a competing business.</i> לגבי רב הונא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ה ruled previously on this עמוד (like רשב"ג) that a miller can prevent his neighbor (in the same מבוי) from opening a competing mill.</i> דבתרא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The general rule is הלכה כבתראי we follow the later אמוראים. See תוס' קדושין מה,ב ד"ה הוה, who writes אבל מכאן ואילך (after the times of אביי ורבא) פסקינן כבתראי לפי שדקדקו יותר מן הראשונים להעמיד הלכה על בוריה. </i> הוא:</b><br><b>As רש"י explained</b> the query. תוספות concludes <b>we rule like</b> ר"ה בדר"י <b>against</b> the ruling of <b>רב הונא, since</b> ר"ה בדר"י <b>was a later</b> אמורא.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The query of ר"ה בדר"י is whether people in different מבואות are considered שכנו.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why was it necessary for תוספות to explain the query of ר"ה בדר"י; it seems clear enough (especially since רש"י explained it already)?!
<b>ואי שייך בכרגא דהכא לא מצי מעכב—But if he pays the local taxes, one cannot prevent him</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר"ה בדר"י ruled that any of the people from one city can prevent a person from another city from doing business in their city.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This means that any person in a city can prevent a stranger from doing business anywhere in the city, even if it is not his מבוי (since the stranger pays no taxes locally).</i> However if the outsider pays taxes in this city, he cannot be prevented. תוספות qualifies this ruling.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The word 'פירוש' generally denotes that the meaning is not what it seems to be at first glance, as we can see here.</i> בני העיר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If the stranger pays taxes, a local person cannot prevent him from opening business in any part of the city (meaning if he is opening his business not in the מבוי of the one who seeks to prevent him, he cannot prevent him).</i> אבל בני מבוי מצי מעכבי שלא יכנס<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">However, the dwellers of a מבוי can prevent a stranger (from a different city) from opening a business in their מבוי even though he is paying the local taxes. Paying local taxes allows him the right to open a business in the city at large, but not in a specific מבוי where he is not wanted.</i> במבואם:</b><br><b>The explanation</b> of this exception is regarding <b>the people of the city</b> in general; <b>however the dwellers of a מבוי can prevent</b> a person from another city <b>from entering in their מבוי</b> and doing business there even though he pays city taxes.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A stranger from a different city can be prevented from opening in a specific מבוי even if he pays taxes.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is תוספות ruling based on?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Can we derive anything from the query of ר"ה בדר"י?!</i>

Daf 22a



Line 1

<b>קנאת סופרים תרבה חכמה—The jealousy of teachers increases wisdom</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב יוסף said that even though רב הונא maintains that a miller in a מבוי can prevent another בן מבוי from opening a competing mill, nevertheless regarding teaching children, there is no right to prevent another teacher from teaching, because the jealousy among the teachers of each other will bring an increase of wisdom to the children. There is another גירסא which תוספות rejects.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>ולא גרסינן כמו שיש בספרים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This is the גירסא (in parenthesis) on the very bottom of the previous עמוד ב'.</i> –<br>And we are not גורס the way it is in other texts,</b> namely –<br><b>דאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">According to this (rejected) גירסא the reason for the ruling of ר"ה regarding מלמד דרדקי is based on this תקנת עזרא.</i> מר עזרא תיקן להם לישראל שיהו מושיבין סופר בצד סופר –<br>For the master said, ‘עזרא instituted for the Jewish people that they should place a teacher next to a teacher’</b>; תוספות explains why this גירסא is incorrect <b>–<br>דהא לא חשיב ליה במרובה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there enumerates ten תקנות which עזרא enacted, and this (שיהו מושיבין סופר בצד סופר) is not one of them.</i> (בבא קמא דף פב,א) גבי עשר תקנות שתיקן:</b><br><b>For</b> the גמרא <b>does not mention this</b> enactment of עזרא <b>among the ten enactments which</b> עזרא <b>instituted.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>עזרא did not enact that they should place one teacher next to another.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If we would assume that there was such a תקנת עזרא to place סופר בצד סופר, would that not contradict what we learnt previously that it was יהושע בן גמלא who instituted that there be מלמדי תנוקות, but according to this גירסא it had already begun by עזרא (who lived much before יהושע בן גמלא)?!

Line 3



Line 4

<b>מעלמא אתו ולעלמא ליזבנן—They came from elsewhere, let them sell to</b><br>those who come from <b>elsewhere</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבינא ruled that the merchants (דיקולאי) who came from outside the city, may sell their wares in the marketplace where there are buyers who also come from other cities. תוספות draws a halachic conclusion based on this גמרא.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>מכאן משמע דביומא דשוקא היה מותר להלוות לבני אדם הבאים ממקומות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to ממקומם (instead of ממקומות). The language seems somewhat stilted in any event.</i> שם לשוק –<br>From here it seems that on the market day it would be permitted for people, who come from elsewhere to the market here, to lend,</b> with interest –<br><b>נכרים דאתו מעלמא אבל לבני המקום לא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The lenders from elsewhere may lend (in the marketplace only) to other gentiles who are not local, but they may not lend to the local gentiles. That is reserved for the local lenders.</i> –</b><br>To the <b>gentiles who come from other</b> <b>places</b> to the market<b>; however not to the local</b> gentiles –<br><b>ודוקא בשוקא אבל לאהדורי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This seemingly means they cannot circulate in the city (outside the marketplace) to find non-local gentiles to lend. </i> לא:</b><br><b>And</b> they may lend <b>specifically only in the marketplace but not to circulate</b> in the city and find customers who wish to borrow.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Non local lenders may lend to non-local gentiles in the marketplace only.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. From תוספות it is clear that (even in the שוק) they may lend only to the נכרים that are non-local. Is the same true in the ruling of רבינא that the דקולאי were able to sell only to the non-locals, or even to the locals, and if yes why the difference?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See מאירי כא,א ד"ה כל and נחלת משה.</i><br>2. What is the novelty in תוספות ruling? Why would I think that lending is different from selling merchandise?

Line 6

<b>אמר ליה רבא לרב אדא בר אבא—<i>Rovo </i>said to <i>Rav Ado bar Abo</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that רבא said something to רב אדא בר אבא. There is another גירסא, however תוספות substantiates our גירסא.<br>----------------------------<br><b>כן גריס רבינו חננאל ולא גרסינן בר אהבה דאותו היה בימי רבי –<br>This is the גירסא of the ר"ח</b> (that it is בר אדא), <b>but the text does not read בר אהבה, for</b> רב אדא בר אהבה <b>lived in the time of רבי –<br>כדאמרינן בקדושין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there mentions many statements that רבי said on the day of his פטירה. One was concerning רב אדא בר אהבה that he is sitting בחיקו של א"א. According to the first פי' of רש"י, it means that he died that day (and was together with א"א in ג"ע). According to this פי' he could not have spoken to רבא who lived many generations after רבי.</i> (דף עב,ב ושם) היום ישב<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גירסא there in קידושין (in the גמרא, רש"י ותוספות) is יושב (not ישב).</i> רב אדא בר אהבה בחיקו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות there ד"ה היום who cites two explanations from רש"י, and one from the ר"י; quote - פירש בקונטרס יש אומרים מת וא"כ אין זה רב אדא בר אהבה שבגמרא ונראה לומר יושב בחיקו של אברהם שנכנס לברית מילה וזה רב אדא בר אהבה שהאריך ימים הרבה משמת רבי עד דורות אחרונים בימי רב נחמן בר יצחק כדאמרי' בב"ב (דף כב.א) אך ר"י פי' דשני רב אדא בר אהבה הוו.      . </i> של אברהם אבינו:</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> מסכת <b>קדושין</b> that רבי said, ‘<b>today רב אדא בר אהבה is sitting in the bosom of אברהם אבינו’.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רב אדא בר אהבה lived in the times of רבי, and רב אדא בר אבא lived in the times of רבא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does תוספות here prefer the first פרש"י (so the גירסא here cannot be בר אהבה), but in קידושין he cites the second פירש"י and the פר"י so that the גירסא here can be רב אדא בר אהבה?

Line 7

<b>פיל שבלע כפיפה מצרית—An elephant that swallowed a wicker basket</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>A query was posed regarding a wicker basket which an elephant swallowed and excreted it together with his waste. The question is whether the basket is now considered as כלי גללים (utensils made out of dung), which are not מקבל טומאה, or not (and they are מקבל טומאה).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See פרש"י ד"ה מהו who writes, מי חשוב כמעוכל והוה ליה ככלי גללים ואין מקבל טומאה עוד. It is not clear if רש"י (only) means that they will not be מקבל טומאה in the future, or he means that if they were טמא before, they are טהור now.</i> תוספות offers an alternate interpretation of this query.<br>------------------------------<br><b>בפרק רבי ישמעאל (מנחות דף סט,א ושם דיבור המתחיל פיל) איתא להך בעיא דהכא –<br>This query here is</b> (also) <b>cited in פרק ר' ישמעאל –<br>ומסיק התם למאי אי למבטל טומאתו תנינא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כלים פכ"ה מ"ט.</i> –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>there concludes, ‘regarding which</b> issue is this query, <b>if it is</b> regarding <b>nullifying its</b> present <b>טמאה;</b> this cannot be, for <b>we learnt</b> this in a משנה –<br><b>כל הכלים יורדין לידי טומאה במחשבה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A כלי cannot be מקבל טומאה unless it is a complete כלי. The decision whether the כלי is complete or not depends on the one making the כלי. If at any point he decides that it is a finished product and no additional work needs to be done, this מחשבה is sufficient for it to be considered a גמר כלי and it can be מקבל טומאה.</i> ואין עולין מטומאה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If a כלי became טמא (after the owner decided that it was completed), and now he decides that more work needs to be done. that is not sufficient to remove the טומאה. In order to remove the טומאה, the כלי must cease to exist as a proper כלי; it needs to be broken [for instance]).</i> אלא בשינוי מעשה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">However in this (proposed) query there was no שינוי מעשה for it was swallowed whole and excreted whole, therefore it cannot become טהור.</i> –<br>‘All utensils descend to become</b> <b>טמא, with thought</b> alone; <b>however they do not ascend from their טומאה</b> to become טהור, <b>unless there is a change of action’’ –<br>וקאמר לא צריכא דבלע הוצין ועבדינהו כפיפה אי הוי עיכול והוי ככלי גללים או לא –<br>So</b> the גמרא <b>concluded</b> that this query <b>was necessary only</b> in a case where it <b>swallowed palm fronds</b> and excreted them <b>and</b> the fronds were used <b>to make a basket;</b> the query is <b>whether</b> these הוצין <b>are considered digested</b> by the elephant <b>and</b> the basket should be considered <b>like dung vessels</b> (and are not מקבל טומאה), <b>or</b> they are <b>not</b> considered digested and the baskets made from them are מקבל טומאה. This concludes the citation from the גמרא in מנחות –<b><br>והכא בלע הוצין בעא מיניה דאי כפיפה שלימה אמאי לא הוה בידיה מתניתין היא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It is an assumption that the אמוראים were well versed in all the משניות. See ‘Thinking it over # 1.</i> –<br>So</b> therefore <b>here they asked</b> רב דימי מנהרדעא regarding a case where the elephant <b>swallowed הוצין</b> (as the גמרא concluded in מנחות), <b>for if</b> the query was regarding a <b>whole basket, why did</b> רב דימי <b>not know</b> the answer, since <b>it is an</b> explicit <b>משנה?!</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשיא לרבינו תם אם כן אמאי לא נקיטו ליה שוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">If a תלמיד חכם has wares to sell we announce that no one can sell this item until the ת"ח has sold out his wares. In our case why did they not prevent them from selling before רב דימי, since this question was not resolved; how can he have answered this query. If we were to learn that the query was regarding a complete כפיפה מצרית, we understand why לא נקיט ליה שוקא, since he should have known the ruling from the משנה, but in this case there is no ruling.</i> הא בעיא זו לא איפשיטא התם –<br>And the ר"ת has a difficulty</b> with this interpretation; <b>if indeed</b> it is so (that the query was regarding בלע הוצין), <b>why did they not hold up the market for him, since this query was not resolved there?!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמכל מקום הוה ליה לאיתויי הנך ראיות דמייתי התם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">רב דימי could have told them that we cannot resolve this query from this source or another source, the way the גמרא in מנחות attempted to resolve the query and he should have explained why it cannot be resolved from those sources. Instead רב דימי remained silent, which indicated to them that he was not that well versed in the issue, therefore לא נקטו ליה שוקא. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> ודחי להו:</b><br><b>And one can say that</b> (regardless<b></b> that there is no resolution), <b>nevertheless he should have cited those various proofs that were offered there</b> to resolve this query <b>and were rejected.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The query is not regarding swallowing a whole basket (for we know from a משנה that it will remain טמא), rather the query was where palm fronds were swallowed and a basket was made from them; is it considered כלי גללים or not. Even when one may not know the final answer, he should mention the various sources that may answer the question and why ultimately they don’t.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why cannot we resolve the story in this manner; רב דימי assumed that they were asking about הוצין (and therefore he did not answer), however in truth they were asking about a whole basket (and therefore לא נקיטו ליה שוקא)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See כוס הישועות.</i><br>2. It seems that רב דימי was wrong in that he did not discuss the issue.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> However from the גמרא later it seems that רב דימי was wronged, for he claimed אנא ענישתיה that רב אדא בר אבא died because he (seemingly) wronged רב דימי. So which way is it?!<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See תורת חיים.</i>

<b>אנא ענישתיה—I punished him</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that when רב אדא בר אבא passed on, each one of the various אמוראים stated that ראב"א died because, ‘I punished him’. תוספות has a novel view on this story.<br>---------------------------<br><b>כל אחד מהן היה מתאונן שעל ידו מת רב אדא –<br>Each one of them</b> (who stated 'אנא ענישתיה') <b>was bemoaning</b> that fact that <b>ר"א died because of him;</b> the reason they bemoaned it, is <b>–<br>משום דאמרינן בשבת בפרק שואל (דף קמט,ב) כל מי שחבירו נענש על ידו –<br>For</b> ר' יעקב <b>said in</b> מסכת <b>שבת in פרק שואל, ‘whoever</b> causes <b>that his friend is punished on his account –<br>אין מכניסין אותו במחיצתו של הקדוש ברוך הוא –<br>We do not let him enter into the partition</b> where <b>הקב"ה</b> is found’, and we derive it –<br><b>שנאמר (משלי יז<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק כו.</i>) גם ענוש לצדיק לא טוב אלא רע וכתיב (תהלים ה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק ה'.</i>) לא יגורך רע<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The צדיק who causes punishment did not do something good, but rather something evil, and evil cannot dwell with הקב"ה, so therefore all these אמוראים bemoaned the fact that they may have caused the death of ר"א.</i>. רבינו יצחק:</b><br><b>For it is written, ‘it is also not good for the righteous to punish’</b> meaning that it is <b>rather evil, and it is</b> also <b>written, ‘evil shall not dwell by You’.</b> This was said by the <b>ר"י.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>They were bemoaning [the possibility of] causing the death of ר"א, thereby denying themselves to be במחיצתו של הקב"ה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The simple reading of the text (for instance אנא ענישתיה דאפסיד גרוגרות דידי) indicates that they we not bemoaning, just stating that ה' took up their cause, and therefore ר"א was punished;<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">According to פי' הוס' they each should have said 'על ידי מת', why אנא ענישתיה!</i> why did תוספות find it necessary to interpret it as bemoaning?!

<b>וקמא היכי סמיך—And how was the first one close</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה stated, ‘if a man had his wall close to his friend’s wall, he should not place another wall near his friend’s wall unless he distanced himself four אמות from it’. The גמרא asked, ‘but how was the first wall close to his friend’s wall’. רב יהודה answered, this is what the משנה means, if one wishes to build a wall near his friend’s wall, he should distance himself four אמות. רבא asked, but the משנה stated, ‘he who has a wall next to his friend’s wall’. תוספות clarifies the discussion taking place in the גמרא.<br>----------------------------<br><b>סלקא דעתין דבנפל איירי שכן משמע הלשון דקתני מי שהיה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The words מי שהיה (in the past tense) indicate that in the past he had a wall סמוך לכותל חבירו (which collapsed) and now he wants to rebuild that collapsed wall; the משנה tells us that he cannot rebuild the wall in the same place as the first wall, but rather he must distance it ד' אמות from his friend’s wall. The question then is obvious; how come the first wall was within ד' אמות from כותל חבירו?!</i> כותלו סמוך לכותל חבירו –</b><br>The questioner who asked, <b>וקמא היכי סמיך, assumed that the case</b> in the משנה <b>is where</b> the first wall collapsed (and now he wants to build a second wall in place of the first one), <b>for the language of</b> the משנה <b>indicates so, for</b> the משנה <b>states, ‘one who had his wall near his friend’s wall’ –<br>ומשני רב יהודה הכי קאמר הבא לסמוך כולי –<br>And ר"י answered this is what</b> the משנה <b>meant; one who comes to be near</b> his neighbor’s wall, <b>etc.</b> he should not come closer than ד' אמות. תוספות clarifies –<br><b>ומתניתין הכי פירושה מי שהיה גבול כותלו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that 'גבול כותלו' here means that the boundary of his property, on which he could theoretically build a wall, was within ד' אמות of his neighbor’s wall (which may have been slightly distanced from the border). רב יהודה agrees that the word היה indicates (something in) the past, but it does not mean that there was a wall there in the past (as the מקשן assumed), but rather גבול כותלו (his border) was near his neighbor’s wall. We therefore tell him that even though your border is within ד' אמות of כותל חבירו, nevertheless the wall you wish to build must be distanced at least ד' אמת מכותל חבירו.</i> סמוך לכותל חבירו –<br>And this is the explanation of our משנה; when the boundary of someone’s wall was close to his neighbor’s wall,</b> he should distance his (proposed) wall ד' אמות.<br><b>ורבא פריך דכותל קתני ולא גבול<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">How can ר"י explain the משנה that there was no wall originally, when the משנה clearly states that there was a wall, therefore the question remains how was the first wall within ד' אמות from כותל חבירו.</i> –<br>And רבא challenged</b> ר"י, but the משנה <b>states כותל and not גבול</b> כותל.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר לרבא דאמר בריש פירקין דאסור לסמוך קמא היכי סמך –<br>And if you will say; according to רבא who said in the beginning<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">יז,ב. The גמרא there cites the view of רבא, that one may not dig a pit next to the property line, even if the neighbor did not dig a pit near the property line. עיי"ש.</i> of our פרק that it is forbidden to be close</b> to the boundary line; <b>how did the first</b> neighbor build his wall <b>close</b> to the boundary<b><sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The first assumption here is that when the משנה states that he must distance himself ד' אמות; this means that he must distance himself ד' אמות from the property line (regardless where the neighbor’s wall is). The second assumption here is that the first neighbor (who has his wall up) built it within two אמות of the boundary, for if he recessed his wall two (complete) אמות on his property (or more), why should the second neighbor, who wishes to build a new wall, be required to distance himself ד' אמות from the property line; he should only be required to distance himself no more than two אמות, for then there will already be a distance of ד' אמות between the old wall and the prospective new wall! The question is that according to רבא the first neighbor was not permitted to build his wall unless he recessed it, which cannot be, for if he already recessed it why is the second neighbor required to distance the full ד' אמות?! See מהר"ם ומהרש"א.</i></b> –<br>תוספות rejects a proposed answer:<br><b>ואפילו לפירוש רבינו תם<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See יח,ב תוס' ד"ה וסבר, where the ר"ת ור"ח maintain that according to the conclusion of the גמרא, even רבא admits that one can be סומך; the only exception (and argument with אביי) is concerning a בור. This would explain the משנה here. The first neighbor had the right to build his wall up to the property line (since there was no wall on the other field. The משנה rules that the second neighbor must distance the full ד' אמות from the first neighbor’s wall. This would (seemingly) answer תוספות question. </i> דלמסקנא שרי רבא לכולהו לסמוך לבד מבור –<br>And even according to the explanation of the ר"ת</b> who maintains <b>that according to the conclusion</b> of the גמרא, <b>even רבא permits to be סומך in all cases except for בור,</b> this would seemingly answer תוספות question –<br><b>מכל מקום אמאי לא פריך מהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא (when it originally assumed that רבא prohibits סמיכה in all cases [not only בור]), challenged the view of רבא from various משניות (in our פרק). The question is why did not the גמרא challenge רבא from our משנה which is the רישא (the first of a series of משניות), and instead challenged רבא from the סיפא (the later משניות)!</i> דהוי רישא אלא ממשרה וירק דהוי סיפא –<br>Nevertheless</b> there is still a difficulty, <b>why did not</b> the גמרא <b>challenge</b> רבא <b>from this משנה which is the first</b> משנה, <b>but rather</b> it chose to challenge רבא from the משנה regarding <b>soaking flax and vegetables which is the later</b> משנה –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דלא אסר רבא לסמוך אלא מילתא דמגופיה אתי היזק<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The item which you are being סומך will cause your neighbor some type of damage; for instance משרה where the moisture on your property can seep into the other property. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And one can say that רבא</b> (even in the הוה אמינא) <b>only forbade סמיכה by objects which the damage comes from them –<br>אבל הכא הכותל אינו מזיק כלום אלא שגורם למעט<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">When the first person built his wall on the property line there is no damage at all; however if the second person will want to build a wall he will need to recede ד' אמות so there will be traffic to solidify the walls. However even if there is no distancing of ד' אמות the first wall is not ruining the second wall (directly) it is only preventing us from having something which will strengthen the walls; that is not considered a damage even according to רבא (even in the הו"א).</i> הדוושא:</b><br><b>However here, the wall</b> which the first neighbor is building <b>does not damage</b> anything at all; <b>rather it only causes to reduce the traffic.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מקשן assumed there was a wall which collapsed (since it states מי שהיה כותלו), ר"י suggested that כותלו means גבול כותלו, which רבא rejected. רבא even in the הו"א, only prohibited placing items which may cause damage near the boundary, but not in a case where it merely prevents improving a situation.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the difference between our case of the wall, where תוספות claims that he is not causing damage,<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> to the case of the mustard and the bees,<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">דף יח,א (וב').</i> where the mustard does not damage the bees (it merely causes them to eat up their honey) and nevertheless we require a הרחקה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Daf 22b

Line 2

<b>אלא אמר רבא הכי קאמר מי שהיה כותלו כולי—Rather, said <i>Rovoh</i></b>; <b>this is what he said; he whose wall was, etc.</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to previous תוס' ד"ה וקמא</i><br>רבא explained that the משנה is teaching us that if a person had a wall which was distanced four אמות from his friend’s wall, and his wall collapsed, the new wall needs also to be distanced ד' אמות from his friend’s wall, תוספות questions the necessity of teaching this rule in this manner.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה רבינו יצחק בן מרדכי דלמה ליה למינקט בכי האי גוונא –<br>The ריב"ם asked; why did the</b> תנא of the משנה find it necessary <b>to mention this ruling, in such</b> an awkward <b>manner;</b> meaning <b>–<br>שהיה לו כותל ברחוק ארבע אמות ונפל –<br>That he</b> already <b>had a wall a distance of ד' אמות</b> from his neighbor’s wall, <b>and it collapsed,</b> so the new wall must also be distanced ד' אמות; why mention all this –<br><b>ליתני שלא יסמוך כותלו לכותל חבירו אלא אם כן הרחיק ארבע אמות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Why mention that there was a previous wall (distanced ד' אמות) which collapsed; what does that add?!</i> –<br>The משנה should have taught</b> instead, <b>that one should not put his wall near his friend’s wall unless he distanced</b> his wall <b>ד' אמות</b> from his friend’s wall?!<br>תוספות anticipates (and rejects) a possible answer:<br><b>וליכא למימר דדוקא בכי האי גוונא –</b><br><b>And we cannot say that it is only when it specifically</b> occurred <b>in this manner –<br>שהיה רחוק כבר ארבע אמות והרחיק הראשון קאמר דלא יסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why we should make this distinction is because if initially the first wall was distanced ד' אמות, one can argue that perhaps the neighbor paid him to distance himself ד' אמות or they came to a mutual agreement (with a קנין) to distance ד' אמות, therefore now this same agreement is binding, but if there was never a wall, one may argue that דוושא is not a sufficient reason to distance one wall from the other (see the end of the previous תוס' ד"ה וקמא that דוושא is less of a reason to distance than other הרחקות נזיקין).</i> –</b><br><b>Where it was already distanced ד' אמות, for he distanced the first wall,</b> it is only in this case that the משנה <b>rules that he cannot be סומך;</b> however if he never distanced himself, he need not distance himself now –<br>תוספות rejects this proposed answer:<br><b>אם כן מאי פריך בסמוך טעמא שלא יאפיל אי משום סולם אבל משום דוושא לא:</b><br>For <b>if</b> indeed this is <b>so why does</b> the גמרא <b>shortly challenge</b> this ruling by saying; ‘<b>the reason</b> he must distance<b></b> from a window is because <b>he should not darken it,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא later on this עמוד challenges רבא, who maintains that the reason for the הרחקה in our משנה is because of דוושא, from another משנה which states that when erecting a wall near the neighbors existing wall which has windows, one must distance the new wall from the windows ד' אמות in order not to darken the windows. The גמרא infers that the only reason for the הרחקה is שלא יאפיל, but otherwise there would be no need to be מרחיק on account of דוושא.</i> or</b> the reason he must distance is <b>because of the ladder,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא asked an additional question from the משנה which states that one must distance a wall from a rain gutter ד' אמות in order that there be room to place a ladder to clean out the gutter. The same question arises that the only reason we need to distance the wall is because of the ladder, but if not for that concern we would not need to distance for we are not concerned for דוושא.</i> but not on account of דוושא’,</b> when in those cases (one can say) he was never מרחיק previously so therefore there is no הרחקה for דוושא, since according to this proposed answer, הרחקה for דוושא is only required when he was already מרחיק previously. Therefore, according to the proposed answer, the questions on רבא are not understood. However, since the גמרא did ask these questions, this proves that the הרחקה of דוושא is even by the initial wall, so why did the משנה have to state its ruling in a case where the initial wall collapsed?!<b></b> תוספות does not answer his question.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The רשב"א and the רא"ש answer that there is a novelty that one must distance even if there was a prior wall which was distanced ד' אמות. We might have thought the since there already were two walls with a ד' אמות separation, so there was sufficient דוושא to strengthen the ground and the walls, therefore now when there is a new wall, there is no longer a need for דוושא, therefore the משנה teaches that even in this case there is still a need for דוושא (and הרחקה). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is not understood why the משנה had to give a case where there was an initial wall; the same rule applies even if this was the first wall.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we explain why תוספות did not accept the answer<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> of the רשב"א and רא"ש?

Line 6

<b>אבל משום דוושא לא—However, not because of the traffic</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא challenged the view of רבא who taught that the reason the walls need to be separated by ד' אמות is because we want that there should be traffic between the walls (דוושא) which will solidify the ground between the walls and prevent them from collapsing. The גמרא challenged רבא from the סיפא of our משנה which states that when erecting a wall near the neighbor’s existing wall which has windows, one must distance the new wall from the windows ד' אמות (and as the ברייתא explains) in order not to darken the windows. The גמרא infers that the only reason for the הרחקה is שלא יאפיל, but otherwise there would be no need to be מרחיק on account of דוושא. Prior to this question the גמרא surmised that in an old city, a wall of a חצר does not require דוושא,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The ground has already been hardened by the many years people have been walking there.</i> only the wall surrounding a גינה,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">People do not walk as much in a garden (because of the plants growing there) as they do in a חצר (which is made for general use).</i> however in a new city even the wall of a חצר requires דוושא.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See the פ' הרמב"ן that according to רב our משנה is by a עיר ישנה (therefore the distancing is only by כותל גינה) however according to ר' אושעיא the משנה is by עיר חדשה (therefore the distancing is [even] by כותל חצר). The question from חלונות (presumably) is (only) according to ר' אושעיא.</i> Based on these qualifiers, תוספות has a question.<br>---------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ולימא דאיירי בעיר ישנה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ (and footnote # 1).</i> –<br>And if you will say, but let</b> the גמרא <b>answer that</b> the משנה regarding the windows <b>is discussing an old city,</b> when there is no need for דוושא, therefore the only reason to distance ד' אמות from the windows is משום שלא יאפיל!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו תם דבית הוי כגינה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2. People make use of the space near the outside wall of the house, therefore people do not walk adjacent to that wall, so even in an עיר ישנה there is still a need for דוושא by a כותל בית..</i> לפי שנותנין מטה וכלים אצל הכותל –<br>And the ר"ת answers that</b> the wall of <b>a house is like</b> the wall of <b>a garden,</b> people do not walk immediately adjacent to the wall, <b>because they put a bed and utensils near the wall –</b><br>תוספות offers another distinction between חצר and בית:<br><b>ועוד יש לומר דבחצר איכא דוושא דרבים מה שאין כן בבית –<br>And furthermore, one can say that by a חצר</b> (which serves many houses) <b>there is much traffic, which is not the case by a house,</b> which only serves a single family. Therefore because of these two reasons, even if it were a עיר ישנה there would still be a need for דוושא and the sגמרא' question would remain.<br>תוספות offers an alternate approach:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק נראה דניחא ליה לשנויי בעיר חדשה דומיא דרישא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3. The entire question was only according to ר' אושעיא who maintains that the רישא (and the סיפא) is discussing an עיר חדשה. According to רב there never was a question from חלונות.</i> –<br>And it appears to the ר"י that</b> the גמרא <b>prefers to explain</b> the case of חלונות even <b>by a new city</b> (where דוושא is usually required) for the גמרא prefers that the סיפא of חלונות should be <b>similar to the רישא,</b> which is in a case of עיר חדשה –<br><b>וכן ההיא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא shortly asks an additional question on רבא (regarding the requirement for דוושא) from this משנה which states that one must distance a wall from a gutter ד' אמות in order to allow him place for a ladder to clean his gutter. The question is why mention the ladder; he needs to distance ד' אמות because of דוושא. Seemingly here too, the גמרא could have answered (as תוספות asked previously) that we are discussing an עיר ישנה where there is no need for דוושא.<br>According to the ר"י the answer is the same, for the גמרא prefers that this משנה as well should follow the pattern of our משנה, which (according to אושעיא) is in an עיר חדשה.  </i> דמרחיקין את הכותל מן המזחילה –<br>And similarly</b> regarding <b>that</b> משנה <b>which</b> requires <b>distancing the wall from the gutter,</b> the גמרא also prefers that it is in an עיר חדשה just like the previous משנה –<br><b>אף על גב דמפסקת בינתים ההיא דמרחיקין את הסולם מן השובך:</b><br><b>Even though that</b> the משנה of <b>מרחיקין את הסולם מן השובך interrupts between</b> our משנה and the משנה of מזחילה, nevertheless the גמרא still prefers that also the משנה of מזחילה is by an עיר חדשה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We cannot answer that the משנה of חלונות is by an עיר ישנה, for a כותל בית is more like a כותל גינה (than a כותל חצר) because there are items near the כותל which prevent דוושא, or there is not sufficient דוושא by a כותל בית (less people) as there is by a כותל חצר (more people). Alternately we prefer the סיפא (and the subsequent משנה) to be like the רישא by an עיר חדשה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did ר' אושעיא assume that the רישא is discussing an עיר חדשה?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 7

<b>וכמה אמר רב ייבא כולי—And how much; <i>Rav Yeyvoh</i> said, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא established the ברייתא, which required distancing a wall from (a wall with) windows, in a case where the wall was perpendicular to the window wall. The גמרא asked how far must the distance be, and רב ייבא answered, the width of the window. Shortly the גמרא asked again, how can we say that we need to distance the width of the window, but the משנה states that we need to distance ד' אמות from the window. תוספות assumed that these two questions (וכמה, and ד' אמות תנן) were asked by the same מקשן, which leads to תוספות question.<br>---------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה דהשתא בעי וכמה ובתר הכי פריך והתנן ארבע אמות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Since the מקשן knew that the distance is ד' אמות (as he asks later), why did he ask now וכמה?!</i> –<br>And it is astounding! For now the</b> מקשן <b>asks, and how much</b> must he distance the wall from the windows, <b>and later</b> the מקשן <b>asks, but we learnt</b> that he must distance <b>ד' אמות</b> (so how can ר' ייבא say כמלא רוחב החלון)?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דרב ייבא גופיה בעי וכמה ולא גמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">ר' ייבא asked 'וכמה', for he assumed that this ברייתא of כדי שלא יאפיל is independent of our משנה, so he did  not assume that the distance of the משנה applies to the ברייתא. The מקשן later, who asked והאנן תנן ד' אמות, was a new מקשן (not ר' ייבא) and he understood that the ברייתא is merely an elaboration of the משנה (not an independent ברייתא), therefore he asked on ר' ייבא. Therefore there is no question since there are two different מקשים. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And one can say that רב ייבא himself asked 'וכמה'</b> and answered, <b>but it was not the</b> מקשן of the <b>גמרא</b> who asked 'וכמה' –<br><b>וכענין זה יש באלו מציאות<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there asks on the משנה regarding פירות מפוזרות that one may keep, 'וכמה', and ר' יצחק answers קב בד' אמות. See the תוספות there that it is evident from the continuation of the גמרא that ר' יצחק was the one who asked 'וכמה' and he gave the answer, עיי"ש.</i> (בבא מציעא דף כא,א ושם דיבור המתחיל וכמה):</b><br><b>And something similar to this is found in</b> פרק <b>אלו מציאות.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Sometimes the one who answers is the one who asked.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why would ר' ייבא assume that the ברייתא is independent of the משנה?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> And is it?
<b>במדיר את כותלו—Where he slants his wall</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב זביד explained that there is no concern that the owner of the wall will stand on his wall and look into the windows (of the other person’s house), since he made the top of the wall on a slant, no one can stand there. תוספות clarifies why there is a concern in the first place.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ולא מצי לשנויי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא asked (on the answer of רב ייבא), ‘but he can still peer’ into the window; to which רב זביד answered במדיר. </i> במגביה כותלו ד' אמות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא clearly states that the new wall must be ד' אמות above the window, so how can the גמרא ask 'והלא מציץ'?!</i> –<br>But the</b> גמרא <b>could not have answered</b> that since we are discussing a case <b>where he raised his wall ד' אמות,</b> so seemingly how can he see inside the widow?!<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>דכיון דקאי מן הצד ואורך הכותל לרחבו של חלון יכול לעמוד בסוף הכותל ולשחות ולהציץ:</b><br><b>For since</b> the new wall <b>is standing perpendicular</b> to the window, meaning that <b>the length of the wall is</b> facing <b>the width of the window,</b> therefore <b>he is able to stand at the edge of the wall and bend down and peer</b> into the windows.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A height of ד' אמות cannot ensure that in a perpendicular wall, the owner will not be able to bend down and look inside, even if the wall is ד' אמות higher than the windows.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is there a difference, regarding the ability to bend down and peek into the window,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> whether the wall is parallel or perpendicular to the window?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>והא אנן תנן ארבע אמות—But we learnt four <i>Ahmois</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asked how can רב ייבא say that distance from the windows is the width of the window, when in our משנה it states that one must distance his wall from the windows ד' אמות. Our תוספות justifies and clarifies this question:<br>---------------------------------<br><b>דמתניתין איירי נמי מן הצד<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly what is the sגמרא' question. Perhaps our משנה is discussing parallel walls where ד' אמות is required for דוושא, and the ברייתא (which רב ייבא explains) is regarding perpendicular walls, where there is no דוושא and the only concern is שלא יאפיל, for which רוחב החלון is sufficient.</i> כיון דלא חייש לדוושא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The distancing in our משנה is not because of דוושא, for if it was for דוושא, why mention windows at all. Obviously there is no concern for דוושא (for they are not parallel), merely for שלא יאפיל (even when it is מן הצד) and nevertheless it requires distancing of ד' אמות which contradicts the view of רב ייבא.  See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> אלא משום חלונות:</b><br><b>For our משנה is also discussing</b> a case where the new wall <b>is perpendicular</b> to the wall with the windows. We know this to be so, <b>since</b> our משנה <b>is not concerned for דוושא,</b> it is <b>only</b> concerned <b>because of the windows,</b> and nevertheless it requires ד' אמות.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה mentions חלונות, indicating that the distancing is not for דוושא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות is apparently convinced that the reason of הרחקה in the משנה is not because of דוושא.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> Why then was it necessary for the גמרא to challenge רבא (who offered the reason of דוושא) from a ברייתא, when the גמרא could have asked from our משנה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">  See מהרש"א.</i>
