Line 10

<b>כדי שיהא זוקף את הסולם—So that he should raise up the ladder</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה teaches that if a person has a gutter running along the side of his roof, and his neighbor intends to build a wall parallel to the gutter, he is required to distance his wall ד' אמות from the gutter,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If the gutter is on the property line, he must pull back his wall ד"א from the property line. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> in order that the neighbor be able to place a ladder<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The gutter owner will place his ladder in the ד"א next to his neighbor’s wall on his neighbor’s property.</i> in these ד"א and lean it against his gutter to clean it out.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ and footnotes # 1 & 2. Why should the wall builder be obligated to give his neighbor space on his property to place a ladder</i><br><b>כשמכר ונתן לו זקיפת הסולם בחצירו איירי וקא משמע לן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly if they agreed that the gutter owner has rights in his neighbor’s property so obviously the wall builder has to distance himself; what is the משנה teaching us? תוספות addresses this issue.</i> דבעי ארבע<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">They agreed generally that gutter owner has the right to place his ladder in the wall builder’s property, but they did not agree as to how much space the ladder requires. The משנה teaches that if an unspecified agreement was reached the amount required (to distance the wall) is ד"א.</i> אמות:</b><br><b>The</b> משנה <b>is discussing</b> a case <b>where</b> the wall builder <b>sold or gifted</b> his neighbor the right <b>to set up a ladder in his courtyard, and</b> the משנה <b>is informing us that he is required</b> to give him <b>ד"א.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>If there was an unspecified agreement, the distancing required is ד' אמות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If they both agreed that he can place his ladder in his friend’s חצר (before anything was built on either side), however the מזחילה was distanced two אמות from the property line, is he required to distance the wall ד"א from the property line (because the agreement to place a ladder gives him ד"א בחצר חבירו), or just ד"א from the מזחילה?

Line 11

<b>לימא תנן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The text in our גמרות (and רש"י) reads לימא מתניתין דלא (not לימא תנן סתמא דלא). According to גירסת התוס', the גמרא is not merely asking a question (is this משנה in accordance with ר"י), but rather it is posing a challenge; how can it be that a סתם משנה (where the הלכה is usually like a סתם משנה) is not in agreement with ר"י (which indicates that the הלכה is not like ר"י), when later on כה,ב the גמרא cites רב יהודה אמר שמואל that הלכה כר"י!</i> סתמא דלא כרבי יוסי—Shall we say the <i>Mishnoh</i> taught anonymously not like <i>Rabi Yosee</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה stated that we must distance a ladder from a dovecote and a wall from a gutter ד' אמות. The גמרא assumed that this סתם משנה does not follow the view of ר' יוסי.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה later (כה,ב) cites a dispute between the חכמים and ר"י regarding a person who planted a tree (in his own property) which was within twenty-five אמות of his neighbor’s pit. The חכמים maintain that if the בור was there first, the tree needs to be chopped down. However, ר"י maintains that the tree can remain, for each person is doing whatever it is on their own property (עושה בתוך שלו). The גמרא there continues that even ר"י agrees by גירי דיליה (his own arrows), that it is necessary to refrain from causing any damage.</i> According to ר"י there is no reason why in the משנה, there is a need for distancing, since each one is עושה בתוך שלו. The גמרא answered that (even) in our משנה it can be considered גירי דיליה and therefore even ר"י would agree that distancing is required.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו חננאל מדקאמר הכא טפי לימא דלא כרבי יוסי ולא קאמר אמשניות דלעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This refers to the משניות on יז,א (regarding the הרחקות of בור, גפת, זרעים ריחיים וכו'), כ,ב (regarding תנור, חנות וכו'), כב,א (regarding כותל וכו').</i> –<br>The ר"ח explained since the</b> גמרא <b>preferred to ask here, ‘perhaps</b> this משנה <b>is not according to ר"י’ and</b> the גמרא <b>did not ask this</b> regarding <b>the previous משניות –<br>משמע דכולהו אתי כרבי יוסי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This is not like רש"י בד"ה לימא who writes, וטובא מילי איכא במתניתין דודאי לא כר"י. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> והוי כולהו גירי דיליה –<br>This indicates that all</b> those משניות <b>are according to</b> <b>ר"י and all of those</b> cases are considered <b>גירי דיליה (his arrows),</b> where even ר"י agrees that הרחקה is required, therefore the גמרא had no reason to ask there לימא דלא כר"י –<br>תוספות explains how all these cases are considered גירי דיליה:<br><b>דמההיא שעתא משתכחא היזיקא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"א, who cites in the name of the רי"ף, three criteria for גירי דיליה; 1. The damage begins immediately when placed, 2. The item itself damages, 3. The damage is initiated from the place it was put. In the case of הרחקת הבור, the damage to the neighbor’s property begins with the digging of the בור which loosens the neighbor’s ground. The same applies to the other הרחקות.</i> ולא פליג רבי יוסי אלא באילן<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">When the tree is planted within כ"ה אמה of the בור there is no damage at all to the בור; what damages the בור are the roots which grow later and they do not damage from the place of the tree but rather from the place of the roots. Therefore ר"י maintains that it is not גירי דיליה and זה חופר בתוך שלו וזה נוטע בתוך שלו.</i> –<br>For the damage is prevalent from that time</b> that he is סומך, <b>and ר"י argues</b> with the חכמים <b>only</b> regarding the <b>tree</b> and the pit.<b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>וצריך לומר לפירושו דמתניתין דלעיל הוי נמי גירי דיליה –<br>And it will be necessary to say according to the פירוש</b> ר"ח (who maintains that all the משניות are in agreement with ר"י) <b>that the previous משנה</b> (on כב,א) regarding distancing ד' אמות between two walls<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly in that case the damage is preventing דוושא, so how can that be considered גירי דיליה, for the damage caused by the lack of דוושא (which is merely preventive) does not seem to start immediately, only after a while.</i> <b>that it is also a case of גירי דיליה –<br>דמיד כשסומך הכותל מונע הדוושא:</b><br><b>for as soon as</b> the second neighbor <b>places his wall</b> within ד"א from the existing wall <b>he prevents דוושא,</b> so the damage begins immediately.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">We consider preventing דוושא as a היזק (on its own), not merely because later the walls may collapse, but the mere fact that the ground is not compacted, that itself is the היזק, and that begins immediately when he places his wall within ד"א from his neighbor’s wall.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>All the הרחקות in this פרק are (even) according to ר"י since they are all considered גירי דיליה (even the case of דוושא), the only exception is אילן ובור.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we explain the מחלוקת between<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> רש"י and the ר"ח (regarding גירי דיליה)?<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 12

<b>והא גרמא הוא—But it is</b> merely <b>causative</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained why we must distance a ladder from a dovecote, because it is possible that when one will place the ladder near the dovecote, a נמייה (mongoose/weasel?) may jump from the ladder onto the dovecote and kill the birds. The גמרא asked, but it is merely a גרמא (and גרמא is פטור בניזקין), why should he be prevented from placing his ladder there.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דלא פריך הכי לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">רבא explained on this עמוד the reason to distance one’s wall from a neighbor’s ד"א is in order there should be traffic that will tamp down the earth between the two walls. The question is that even if the walls are not distanced and there no דוושא, the one erecting the second wall is not causing any direct damage, he is a גרמא בניזקין; the same question (and answer) the גמרא mentions here should have been mentioned previously as well.</i> גבי דוושא:</b><br><b>It is astounding that</b> the גמרא <b>did not pose this same difficulty previously regarding דוושא (trampling traffic).</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The case of דוושא is also considered a גרמא and the גמרא there is not troubled by it!<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can we not distinguish between the case of נמייה (where it is more גרמא [less direct cause]) and דוושא (where it is less גרמא [more direct cause])?<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See TIE תוס' ד"ה לימא (on this עמוד) footnote # 8. </i>
<b>זאת אומרת גרמא בנזקין אסור—This tells us that it is forbidden to cause</b> indirect <b>damage</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא asked why should there be a prohibition of placing a ladder near a dovecote (because a נמייה may jump directly from the ladder to the dovecote), since it is merely a גרמא (and גרמא בנזקין is פטור). רב טובי בר מתנא replied, this ruling teaches us the even though גרמא בנזקין is פטור from paying damages, nevertheless one is forbidden from causing damage even through גרמא. Our תוספות discusses the difference between גרמא (which is פטור) and גרמי (for which one is חייב).<br>---------------------------<br><b>ומעיקרא סלקא דעתין כי היכי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read היכי דפטור הכי (instead of היכי דמעיקרא הכי). The מקשן assumed that since גרמא בנזקין פטור, this indicates that גרמא is not considered to be a מזיק; therefore he should be allowed to do it. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דמעיקרא פטור הכי נמי דמותר –<br>And initially</b> (when we asked why is it prohibited) <b>we assumed that just like one is (initially) פטור</b> for a damage done by גרמא, <b>similarly it should be permitted</b> to even do something which may cause a damage through גרמא.<br><b>הכא משמע<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא asked that he should be even permitted to place the ladder there since it is only גרמא, and the answer was that גרמא בנזקין is אסור, but the גמרא did not answer that there is a חיוב.</i> דגרמא בנזקין דפטור –<br>It seems</b> from the גמרא <b>here that</b> if one <b>caused damage indirectly (גרמא) he is exempt</b> from paying. תוספות cites some examples where we see that גרמא בנזקין פטור –<br><b>וכן בפרק כיצד הרגל (בבא קמא דף כו,ב) זרק כלי מראש הגג והיו תחתיו כרים וכסתות –<br>And similarly in פרק כיצד הרגל,</b> the גמרא states, <b>he threw</b> someone’s <b>vessel from the rooftop and underneath there were pillows and blankets</b> (which would prevent the כלי from shattering) –<br><b>וקדם וסילקן אפילו הוא פטור<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">He is not liable for throwing it off the roof, since they would have landed on the pillows and would not break; he is not liable for removing the pillows, since that is merely a גרמא (he did not break the כלי directly).</i> –<br>And even if the</b> thrower <b>went ahead and removed them</b> before the כלי landed,<b></b> so that the כלי broke; the thrower (who is the remover) <b>is פטור</b> from paying for the כלי –<br><b>ובפרק הפרה (שם דף מז,ב) הכניס פירות לחצר בעל הבית שלא ברשות כולי –<br>And in פרק הפרה,</b> it states <b>if one brought in produce into the owner’s courtyard without permission, etc. –<br>וקאמר בגמרא דאם אכלה והוזקה פטור<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The בעל הפירות did not encourage the בהמה to eat; the בהמה ate on its own, therefore the בעל הפירות is only a גרמא.</i> –<br>And the גמרא rules that if</b> the owner’s cow <b>ate</b> so much of these פירות <b>and was damaged</b> by the excess food<b>,</b> the בעל הפירות is <b>פטור –<br>ונתן סם המות לפני בהמת חבירו דפטור (שם) –<br>And</b> similarly the גמרא there rules that <b>one who placed poison before his friend’s animal</b> and the animal ate it and died, <b>that</b> the poisoner is <b>פטור –<br>ושולח בעירו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read הבערה (instead of בעירו).</i> ביד חרש שוטה וקטן (שם נט,ב) –<br>And one who sends fire in the hands of a חש"ו</b> and it damaged; the sender is פטור –<br><b>ופורץ גדר בפני בהמת חבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The animal then ran out and did damage, the breaker of the fence is פטור for the damage, since it is considered גרמא.</i> וכופף קמת חבירו בפני הדליקה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא there ב"ק נו,א that the fire reached the קמה through an unusually strong wind, therefore he is פטור.</i> –<br>And one who breaks a fence in front of his friend’s animal, and one who bends over his friend’s standing grain into the path of a fire –<br>ועושה מלאכה במי חטאת<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">מי חטאת is the water in which the אפר פרה אדומה was mixed into it. One may not use it for any work such as using it for a weight. If any work is done with it the מי חטאת is פסול.</i> (שם נה,ב נו,א.) וליבה וליבתו הרוח –<br>And one who did work with</b> his friend’s <b>מי חטאת, and</b> in a case where <b>he fanned</b> the flames <b>and the wind fanned</b> the flames (both together) –<br><b>דפטור בכל הנך כדאמר בפרק הכונס (שם דף נט,ב) –<br>That in these cases he is פטור as</b> the גמרא <b>rules in פרק הכונס –<br>ומבעית חבירו דהוי נמי גרמא –<br>And one who frightened his friend</b> and caused him damage <b>that is also</b> considered <b>גרמא</b> and he is פטור for any damages to his friend –<br><b>כדאמר בפרק קמא דקדושין (דף כד,ב) דאיהו הוא דאבעית אנפשיה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The one who was frightened contributed to his damage for he became frightened and that caused the damage. </i> –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>קדושין,</b> that he is פטור <b>since the</b> victim <b>frightened himself –<br>ובכיצד הרגל (בבא קמא דף כג,ב) שיסה בו כלב שיסה בו נחש פטור –<br>And in</b> פרק <b>כיצד הרגל</b> the ברייתא states, ‘<b>he incited a dog against him, or he incited a snake against him</b> and he was damaged by the dog or the snake, the inciter <b>is פטור’.</b> This concludes the many examples of גרמא בנזקין פטור.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ויש ליתן טעם מאי שנא כל הני מדינא דגרמי –<br>And it is</b> necessary <b>to give a reason, how are all these</b> cases of גרמא <b>different from the rule of גרמי –<br>כגון אחווי אחויי דהגוזל בתרא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">A person heard that the king wished to take possession of people’s property illegally, and he went and told them to take the property of a certain person, he is liable מדינא דגרמי, even though he did not actually take away his friend’s field.</i> (שם דף קטז,ב ושם) ומראה דינר לשולחני ונמצא רע –<br>For instance</b> the cases <b>where he pointed out</b> his neighbor’s field<b>,</b> in פרק הגוזל בתרא, <b>and where he showed a דינר to the moneychanger</b> who pronounced it good <b>and it turned out to be bad<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See ב"ק צט,ב. The שולחני did not actually damage him he only caused him to accept a counterfeit coin.</i> –<br>ונפרצה אומר לו גדור<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק ק,א. It is the responsibility of the בעל הכרם to repair the fence so as not to cause the wheat to become אסור on account of כלאים. The בעל הכרם is חייב for the loss of the wheat (due to the איסור כלאים) if he decides not to repair the fence, even though he did not actually damage the wheat directly.</i> ודן את הדין<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">שם. The דיין ruled incorrectly; causing a loss to one party. The rule, according to ר"מ, is that the דיין must pay for the loss, even if he did not make the loss directly. He did not take away the money from the respondent and give it to the claimant.</i> דחייב לרבי מאיר אפילו לא נשא ונתן בידו –<br>And</b> the case where if the wall between a vineyard and a wheat field <b>was breached, we tell</b> the vineyard owner, ‘<b>fence it’,</b> and if he did not, he is liable for the loss due to כלאים, <b>and where one passed judgment</b> incorrectly <b>where he is liable according to ר"מ, even if he did not take and give</b> the money <b>with his own hand –<br>והשורף שטרותיו של חבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק צח,א. The מלוה can no longer collect his debt for he does not have his שטר to prove that he is owed money. The burner is חייב to pay the מלוה the amount of the loan written in the שטר because of גרמי.</i> ומוכר שטר חוב לחבירו וחזר ומחלו<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See כתובות פו,א. The מלוה sold his שטר to a third person. The מלוה then went and forgave the לוה the debt. The לוה is not required to pay to the buyer of the שטר. However because of גרמי the מלוה must pay to the buyer the full face value of the שטר. </i> –<br>And one who burns his friend’s notes</b> of debt, <b>and one he sells his note of debt to his friend and forgave</b> the debtor; in all these case he is liable because of דינא דגרמי. It is necessary to establish criteria when is it considered גרמא (and he is פטור) and when is it considered גרמי (and he is חייב).<br>תוספות offers some solutions:<b><br>וחילק רבינו יצחק לשון אחד –</b><br><b>And the ר"י, in one version, differentiated</b> between גרמא and גרמי –<br><b>דדינא דגרמי חייב היינו שעושה הוא עצמו היזק לממון חבירו –<br>That the rule where גרמי is חייב is where he himself damaged another’s money –</b><br>In the case of סולם ושובך the damage is done by the נמייה not the person. In זרק כלי the damage is done by the ground. By הכניס פירות or סם המות the damage was done by the food or poison. By שלח הבערה ביד חש"ו the damage was done by the חש"ו. By פורץ גדר the damage was done by the בהמה. By כופף קמתו the damage was done by the fire. By מי חטאת it is a היזק שאינו ניכר therefore he is only a גרמא. By ליבה וליבתו הרוח the מזיק is the fire. By מבעית חבירו the מזיק is the נבעת. By שיסה בו כלב the מזיק is the dog/snake. In contrast the laws of גרמי are where the person does the damage. By אחווי as well as by the שולחני as well as by the דיין it is their words which cause the damage. By the כרם it is the reluctance of the בעל הכרם that makes it כלאים. The same is by השורף שטרותיו and המוכר שט"ח לחבירו that he was מזיק through burning or being מוחל.<br>תוספות offers another distinction between גרמא and גרמי:<br><b>ועוד חילק דדינא דגרמי דחייב היינו<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read היינו דבשעת מעשה בא ההיזק (instead of משעת מעשה שבא ההחיזק)</i> משעת מעשה שבא ההיזק –<br>And</b> the ר"י <b>additionally distinguished that the rule that גרמי is חייב is when the damage happened at that time,</b> not later as by גרמא –<br>By סולם ושובך the damage is not done when he places the ladder, rather after the נמייה jumps. By זרק כלי the damage came after he threw it or removed the pillows. By הכניס פירותיו and סם המות the damage happened after he placed it, when the בהמה ate it later. By שולח הבערה ביד חש"ו the damage happened after he gave it to them. By פורץ גדר the damage happened later. By כופף קמתו the damage happened later. [The case of עושה מלאכה במי חטאת needs some clarification.<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps since it is a היזק שאינו ניכר it is considered as if there is no damage now but it happens later (when he wants to use it, וצ"ע. </i>] By ליבה ולבתה הרוח the damage happened later when the fire came. By המבעית חברו the damage happened when the victim reacted. The same is by שיסה הכלב. In contrast by גרמי the damage happened immediately. By אחוויי אחוויי as soon as he showed it to the נכרים, the property was lost. By מראה דינר לשולחנו as soon as he validated the coin there was a loss. By the כלאים as soon as he gave up to repair the fence it becomes כלאים. The same is true by the דיין as soon as he ruled wrong the damage was done, The same applies to השורף שטרותיו and המוכר שט"ח לחברו ומחלו in all these cases the damage happens immediately. Therefore they are considered גרמי and he is חייב.<br>תוספות asks on both these two versions:<br><b>ועל הכל קשה טיהר את הטמא ובעל הבית עצמו עירבן עם פירותיו –</b><br><b>And there is a difficulty with all</b> (?) these <b>explanations;</b> the case where the דיין <b>was מטהר</b> food that was really <b>טמא and the owner mixed these</b> foods which the דיין was מטהר <b>with his</b> other <b>foods</b> which were טהור, thereby causing all his foods to become טמא, and the ruling is that the דיין is חייב on account of גרמי. The question is –<br><b>ואמאי חייב דהוא עצמו אינו עושה היזק בממון חבירו –<br>But why is</b> the דיין <b>חייב, for the</b> דיין <b>himself did not do damage to his friend’s money;</b> this presents a difficulty for the first version of the ר"י –<br><b>וגם באותה שעה שמטהר אינו בא ההיזק –<br>And also at the time he was</b> mistakenly <b>מטהר</b> the דברים טמאים, <b>the</b> <b>damage did not happen;</b> it only happened later when the owner mixed them with his פירות טהורים. This presents a difficulty to the second version of the ר"י.<br>תוספות offers an alternate distinction between גרמא and גרמי:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק בן אברהם דדינא דגרמי הוי מטעם קנס<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ריצב"א there is no intrinsic difference between the case of גרמא and גרמי, rather one is more frequent (גרמי) and the other is less common (גרמא). This may explain why טיהר את הטמא is חייב since it is frequent.</i> כדמוכח בירושלמי<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See שו"ת מהר"ם מרוטנבורג ח"ד סי' ת"ס who cites a ירושלמי in מס' שבועות פ"ו ה"ו, which states, דכל דיני דגרמי משום קנס.</i> –<br>And it appears to the ריצב"א that the ruling by גרמי</b> that it is חייב, <b>is because it is a punishment as is evident in</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי –<br>ולכך כל היזק המצוי ורגיל לבא קנסו חכמים –<br>So therefore any damage which is frequent and occurs usually, the חכמים fined</b> the perpetrator –<br><b>וטעם דקנסו שלא יהא כל אחד הולך ומזיק לחבירו בעין<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש who is troubled by this word 'בעין'. He suggested that it should be inserted in the next line which should read, והיינו כעין טעמא וכו'.</i> –<br>And the reason they fined him is in order to prevent everyone from going and (directly) damaging his friend –<br>והיינו טעמא דמאן דמחייב בהיזק שאינו ניכר<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See גיטין נג,א where there is a dispute whether היזק שאינו ניכר is considered a היזק and one is חייב or it is not considered a היזק and one is פטור. However even the מ"ד who maintains היזק שאינו ניכר is פטור, nevertheless he admits that if he did it מזיד he is חייב in order that שלא יהא כ"א הולך ומטמא טהרותיו של חבירו. See footnote # 24 & 25 for examples of היזק שאינו ניכר.</i> –<br>And this is</b> also <b>the reason of the one who holds one liable for an unnoticeable damage,</b> which was done במזיד <b>–<br>ואפשר דבשוגג נמי קניס<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">One is usually fined if he transgressed premeditatingly (במזיד), however if it was בשוגג there would seem no reason to fine him; it was accidental. Nevertheless by גרמי perhaps the חיוב is even for a שוגג, for we are גוזר שוגג אטו מזיד.</i> רבי מאיר<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">ר"מ is the תנא who is דאין דינא דגרמי.</i> כי היכי דקניס במטמא<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">מטמא is when one is מטמא the טהרות of his friend, thus rendering it worthless, since it needs to be burnt. This is considered a היזק שאינו ניכר, because superficially the טהרות look the same as they did before they became טמא.</i> ומדמע<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">מדמע is when one mixes תרומה into his friend’s חולין; causing the value of the חולין to become less. This too is a היזק שאינו ניכר. In both these cases ר"מ is מחייב even by שוגג because גזרו שוגג אטו מזיד.</i> אחד שוגג ואחד מזיד:</b><br><b>And it is possible<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות writes that it is possible that by גרמי we are also מחייב the שוגג, just like we are מחייב a שוגג by היזק שאינו ניכר. However, it is also possible that we cannot compare a היזק שאינו ניכר where the damage was done directly (it is merely אינו ניכר) and therefore we are stricter, however by גרמי where it was an indirect damage perhaps we are more lenient and are not גוזר שוגג אטו מזיד.</i> that ר"מ would fine</b> the גרמי <b>even if it was accidental, just like</b> ר"מ <b>fines by making טמא and mixing whether he is a שוגג or a מזיד.</b><br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that in the הו"א we assumed that just as he is פטור therefore we assume that it is מותר.<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> How is it possible to assume even in a הו"א that it is permitted to cause damage to another person; we are even obligated in השבת אבידה, so certainly it is forbidden to cause damage even indirectly?!<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>
<b>גרמא – פטור</b>	<b>טעמי הפטור והחיוב</b>	<b>גרמי – חייב</b>
סולם אצל שובך<br>זרק כלי מראש הגג<br>הכניס פירות<br>נתן סם המות<br>שלח בערה ביד חש"ו<br>פורץ גדר בעד בהמה<br>כופף קמת חברו בפני הדליקה<br>עושה מלאכה במי חטאת<br>לבה ולבתו הרוח<br>מבעית חברו<br>שיסה בו כלב נחש	א. בגרמא הוא לא עשה בעצמו מעשה ההיזק,<br>בגרמי הוא עושה בעצמו ההיזק<br>ב. בגרמא הנזק לא נעשה מיד,<br>בגרמי ההיזק בא בשעת מעשה<br>ג. גרמא אינו מצוי ורגיל תמיד – לא קנסו,<br>בגרמי מצוי ורגיל - קנסו 	אחווי אחויי<br>מראה דינר לשולחני<br>נפרצה אומר לו גדור<br>דן את הדין<br>שורף שטרותיו של חברו<br>מכר שט"ח ומחלו
<br><br>


Daf 23a



Line 1

<b>אתו אומני ויתבי תותייהו—The blood drawers came and sat underneath them</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that רב יוסף owned date palms and the אומנים (those who draw blood) would sit under these trees and do their work there. Ravens would come there, on account of the blood and the ravens would then settle on the trees and ruin the dates. רב יוסף wanted to chase the אומנים away, so אביי asked him, ‘the אומנים are merely a גרמא’,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">They are only an indirect cause of the damage which was done by the ravens not by the אומנים.</i> so why should they be required to leave. תוספות clarifies the situation<br>----------------------------<br><b>בקרקע שלהן היו יושבין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The trees were certainly on sרב יוסף' land. However immediately adjacent to the trees (perhaps even under the extended branches) the land belonged to the אומנים. Therefore רב יוסף could not send them away for they were not on his property. </i> ולא בקרקע של רב יוסף מדפריך בתר הכי והא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If however they were sitting on sרב יוסף' land, obviously he has the right to chase them away, therefore we must conclude that the אומנים were practicing their craft on their own land.</i> גרמא הוא:</b><br>These אומנים <b>were sitting on their own land, and not on sרב יוסף' land,</b> since אביי <b>subsequently challenged</b> רב יוסף saying, ‘<b>but it is</b> merely <b>a גרמא’</b> so how can you be justified in sending them away.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The אומנים did their work on their own land.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The גמרא later argues that the אומנים should have a right to continue there since, והא אחזיק להו'; meaning they have a חזקה. Why therefore is it necessary to say that it was their land, we can say it was sרב יוסף' land, and nevertheless he could not remove them since והא אחזיק להו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 2

<b>והא אחזיקו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרות the text reads אחזיק (not אחזיקו).</i> להו—But they established themselves</b> there<br>Overview<b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוספות ד"ה אתו.</i></b><br>The גמרא asked even if we maintain גרמא בנזקין אסור, nevertheless רב יוסף would have no right to evict the אומנים, since they already have a חזקה to ply their craft there. תוספות discusses the nature of this חזקה.<br>------------------------------<br><b>פירש רבי יצחק בן רבי מרדכי כיון שלא בא להחזיק בקרקע של חבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> ולומר שלו הוא –<br>The ר"י ב"ר מרדכי explained, since</b> the אומנים <b>did not come to take possession of someone else’s property and say that it belongs to him –<br>אלא לתשמיש בעלמא שנהנה ממנה מועלת חזקה שלא בטענה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In general if ראובן is the known owner of a property and שמעון made a חזקה in this property for three years and claims that ראובן sold it to him, the חזקה is effective and the property remains in the possession of שמעון. However if שמעון claims that he lived on this property for three years and no one protested, this is referred to as a חזקה שאין עמה טענה (there is no claim as to how שמעון owns this property) and this חזקה is not effective and the property reverts back to ראובן. The ר"י ב"ר מרדכי distinguishes between a חזקה which claims ownership (for which a טענה is required, as mentioned above), and a חזקה for usage rights (where no ownership is claimed), in which case no טענה is required. The mere fact that the owner did not protest (over a certain period of time) indicates that the owner conceded this usage to the user. </i> –<br>Rather</b> the חזקה <b>was merely for general usage that</b> the אומנים <b>are deriving benefit</b> from the land, in that case <b>a חזקה without a claim is effective –</b><br>The ר"י ב"ר מרדכי proves this distinction:<br><b>דמסתמא לא היו אומרים שמכר<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Firstly, there is no mention of such a claim. Additionally, if this was their claim (and presumably they were not lying), why would רב יוסף want to evict them, he would certainly have remembered that he sold them this right. Rather it makes more sense that nothing happened, but the אומנים inferred from the lack of protest that רב יוסף was מוחל, when in fact this מחילה is debatable as the גמרא continues to explain.</i> להם רב יוסף תשמיש זה –<br>For presumably the</b> אומנים <b>were not claiming that רב יוסף sold them the</b> rights to <b>this usage,</b> rather their claim seems to be that since he did not protest in the past, he implicitly conceded to them this right.<br>The ר"י ב"ר מרדכי supports his view:<br><b>והוו כי הנהו דלעיל (דף ו,א) דאחזוק להורדי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">הורדי are (small) beams. The case there is where שמעון built a wall between his property and sראובן' property. ראובן placed small beams on the wall and שמעון did not protest. The rule is that ראובן has the right to keep his beams on that wall.</i> דמועלת חזקה שלא בטענה –<br>And</b> the case here <b>is like the</b> cases <b>previously where one made a חזקה for הורדי,</b> that we assume <b>that the חזקה is effective without a claim,</b> for we assume <b>–<br>דמדלא מיחה ג' שנים מחל לו –<br>That since</b> the owner of the wall <b>did not protest for three years, he conceded to him</b> that right to place his beams on his wall. Similarly here, the fact the רב יוסף did not protest (for three years) indicates that he was מוחל the אומנים the right to practice there.<br>תוספות disagrees that חזקת תשמשין does not require a טענה:<br><b>ואין נראה דאם לא הקנה לו כי החזיק להורדי אמאי החזיק לכשורי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">רב יוסף there maintained (in opposition to רב נחמן) that if he made a חזקה for הורדי, that חזקה is effective even for כשורי. If we assume that ראובן claims that he bought the rights from שמעון to place (all types of) beams on his wall, it is understood that even though until now he placed only הורדי but since he claims that he bought the rights for all beams, the fact the שמעון did not protest the הורדי indicates that sראובן' claim is valid (see shortly in this תוספות that דאין אדם עושה קנין למחצה). However if the only reason why ראובן has a חזקה in the הורדי is because שמעון did not protest (but ראובן does not claim that he bought the rights from שמעון), how can רב יוסף say that a חזקה for הורדי is a חזקה for כשורי, perhaps שמעון did not mind small beams, but he certainly would mind large beams.</i> –<br>And</b> this <b>does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for if</b> (in the case of הורדי) <b>the</b> owner of the wall <b>did not transfer</b> the rights <b>to him, so if he established</b> the rights <b>for the small beams why did he establish</b> the rights <b>for large beams –<br>אלא על כרחך התם שטוען שהקנה לו ולהכי אחזיק לכשורי דאין<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן claims that שמעון gave him the right to place all types of beams [even heavy ones] on the wall. We know that he made a חזקה for the הורדי, which proves that שמעון certainly agreed to the הורדי, however since a person does not make a half-transaction, we can be sure that he purchased the rights to place all types of beams on sשמעון' wall.</i> אדם עושה קנין למחצה:<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח adds; והכא נמי מיירי שהיו טוענים שהקנה להם והוי חזקה שיש עמה טענה.</i></b><br><b>Rather perforce you must say</b> in that case <b>there</b> regarding the הורדי <b>that he claims that</b> the owner of the wall <b>was מקנה</b> to him the rights to place beams on the wall, <b>so therefore</b> even though he was only החזיק להורדי nevertheless he is also <b>אחזיק לכשורי, for a person does not make half-a-transaction [and</b> similarly <b>here too it is a case where</b> the אומנים <b>claim that he was מקנה to them</b> the rights to practice their trade there, <b>so it is a חזקה שיש עמה טענה].</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a dispute whether חזקת תשמישין requires a חזקה שיש עמה טענה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Does this תוספות agree with the previous תוספות that the אומנים were working on their own<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> property?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See TIE there ‘Thinking it over’. See אמתחת בנימין (לר' בנימין חשין).</i>
<b>אין חזקה לנזקין—There is no established presumption regarding damages</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous two תוס' ד"ה אתו וד"ה והא.</i><br>רב נחמן derived from the fact the רב יוסף wished to evict the אומנים, even though they had a חזקה to practice their craft there, that אין חזקה לנזקין. תוספות discusses what type of חזקה they had.<br>------------------------------<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דאפילו הקנה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read הקנה לו בעדים יכול (instead of הקנה יכול).</i> יכול לחזור בו דקנין בטעות הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means (according to the הגהות הב"ח) that not only if there were no witnesses to the קנין, there was only the חזקה (of three years) to bolster the claim of the מחזיק, that we say אין חזקה לנזקין (where the owner can perhaps claim, ‘I was never מקנה them this right, and I was not מוחה because I thought I could bear it’), but furthermore even if there are witnesses that the owner was מקנה to them this חזקה, nevertheless the קנין is void since it is a קנין בטעות. Alternately תוספות may mean that not only if the owner was merely מוחל by being quiet (for three years), can he retract, but even if he explicitly was מקנה to them this right, nevertheless he can retract because it is a קנין בטעות.</i> –<br>The ר"ת states that even</b> if the owner <b>transferred</b> the rights of the נזקין <b>[to him in</b> the presence <b>of witnesses]</b> nevertheless <b>the</b> owner <b>is able to retract</b> this קנין, <b>for it is a קנין</b> which was made <b>mistakenly –<br>דסבור היה שיכול לקבל ועכשיו אין יכול לקבל –<br>For</b> the owner <b>assumed that he is able to bear it, but now he is not able to bear it;</b> therefore, the קנין is void.<br>תוספות disagrees with the ר"ת:<br><b>ואין נראה דמדקאמר אין חזקה לנזקין<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A חזקה generally proves something; in our case that the owner was מקנה the right for this usage. For if he was not מקנה, why did he not protest. However, it is not a definite proof like if witnesses would testify that he was מקנה. If as the ר"ת maintains that even if there were witnesses to the קנין (as the הגהות הב"ח explains our תוס') he can still retract, רב נחמן should have said אין ראיה לנזקין that even if one brings definite proof such as עדים, nevertheless the owner can retract, so we will definitely know that a חזקה without עדים is certainly insufficient to have them retain this right. The fact that ר"נ merely stated אין חזקה לנזקין, indicates that a חזקה is insufficient, however if there are עדים then the קנין would be valid and they would retain the rights for this usage even though it is נזקין. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> איכא למידק הא ראיה יש –<br>And</b> this <b>does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for since</b> רב נחמן <b>stated there is no חזקה for נזקין; we can infer that</b> if <b>there is however proof</b> that would allow a חזקת נזקין <b>–</b><br>תוספות proves that we make such an inference of אין חזקה הא ראיה יש:<br><b>כדדייקינן בחזקת הבתים (לקמן דף מט,ב) גבי הא דתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">שם מב,א.</i> ולא (לאשה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal gloss amends this to read לאיש חזקה בנסי אשתו (instead of לאשה חזקה בנכסי בעלה).</i> חזקה בנכסי בעלה):</b><br><b>As</b> the גמרא <b>infers in</b> פרק <b>חזקת הבתים, regarding the משנה which taught, ‘</b>there <b>is no חזקה</b> (for a woman in her husband’s assets) <b>[for a man in his wife’s assets’].<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there infers that the משנה only means that if a man lived for three years in his wife’s property, it is not considered a חזקה and proof that he bought the house from her. However, we can infer that if he has a שטר or עדים that she sold him the property that is sufficient and it belongs to him (the גמרא there questions this ruling). In any event we see that when the term אין לו חזקה is used it only means that a חזקה is insufficient proof in these cases, but a valid proof such as עדים or שטר are effective. Therefore, here too if the אומנים would bring עדים that רב יוסף granted them this (damaging) usage, ר"י would not be able to recant even though it may be a קנין בטעות. </i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a dispute whether there is a ראיה בנזקין (the view of תוס') or not (ר"ת).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why indeed is it that regarding נזקין, we accept a ראיה but not a חזקה?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> Seemingly a חזקה supports the claim of the מוחזק that he granted them the right, otherwise why did he not protest the נזק?!<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See רא"ש and נחלת משה.</i>
<b>בקוטרא—By smoke</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous three תוס'.</i><br>The גמרא previously asked, how did רב יוסף expect to evict the אומנים, since they had a חזקה, to which the גמרא responded אין חזקה לנזקין. The גמרא then asked that this ruling of אין חזקה לנזקין is limited to the damages caused by smoke (קוטרא) or an outhouse (בית הכסא). Our תוספות qualifies these two נזקין of קוטרא ובית הכסא.<br>--------------------------------------<br><b>נראה לרבינו יצחק דדוקא בקוטרא דכבשן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This may be referring to a furnace in which metals are smelted or a kiln to make pottery where the heat is very high and there is excessive smoke.</i> שהוא גדול ומזיק ביותר אין חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">However regarding smoke from an oven or an open fire which is not that excessive, there is a חזקה.</i> –<br>It appears to the ר"י that</b> it is only <b>specifically the smoke of a furnace</b> that we say <b>there is no חזקה since</b> that smoke is <b>extensive and it damages excessively –<br>כדאמר במרובה (בבא קמא דף פב,ב) אין עושין כבשונות בירושלים מאי טעמא משום קוטרא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If all type of smoke cause damage, why prohibit only כבשונות בירושלים, we should prohibit all smoke. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>מרובה, ‘we do not allow furnaces in ירושלים’; what is the reason</b> for this prohibition; ‘<b>because of the smoke’ –<br>ודוקא נמי בית הכסא שלהן<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שלהן שהיו למעלה (instead of שלהן שהיה למעלה).</i> שהיה למעלה מן הקרקע והיה מסריח ביותר –<br>And also it is specifically</b> regarding <b>their outhouses</b> (that there is no חזקה), <b>since they were aboveground and it reeked excessively –<br>אבל בשלנו שהוא מכוסה יש חזקה:</b><br><b>However</b> regarding <b>our</b> outhouses <b>which are covered up, there is a חזקה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>קוטרא ובית הכסא (where there is no חזקה לנזקין) is only by furnaces and above ground uncovered outhouses, which cause excessive damage.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Was the ר"י more certain that only by עשן הכבשן there is no חזקה, or was he more certain that only ביהכ"ס שלהן there is no חזקה, or is there no difference.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i>
<b>לדידי דאנינא דעתאי—As for me that I am of a sensitive mindset</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוספות on this עמוד.</i><br>In response to the challenge that the rule of אין חזקה לנזקין applies only to קוטרא וביה"כ, but not to נזקין in general, רב יוסף stated that since he was from the אניני הדעת, therefore this נזק is considered for him as a קוטרא וביה"כ.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>פירוש שהיה איסטניס<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps תוספות means to say (with the term 'פירוש') that it was known that רב יוסף was an איסטניס. It was not that he merely said it now (for his personal benefit) when he was disturbed by the אומנים; rather it was a well-known fact. This is why תוספות cites the גמרא in ע"פ to prove that ר"י always maintained that he was an איסטניס. See footnote # 3.</i> כדאמרינן בערבי פסחים (פסחים דף קיג,ב ושם) –<br>The explanation</b> of אנינא דעתאי is <b>that he was delicate, as</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>ערבי פסחים –<br>שלשה חייהם אינן חיים הרחמנים והרתחנים ואניני הדעת אמר רב יוסף וכולהו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Additionally (see footnote # 2) he stated it even though it was not complimentary that one is a רתחן (angers quickly and heatedly), indicating that this was the truth.</i> איתנהו בי:</b><br><b>Three</b> types of people, <b>their lives are not lives; those who are merciful, irritable, and overly sensitive. רב יוסף commented, ‘and I have all these’</b> three traits.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רב יוסף was known to be an איסטניס (or אנין הדעת).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It would seem that תוספות is citing the גמרא in ע"פ to prove his פירוש that אנין הדעת means איסטניס (and not something else).<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See (however) footnote # 2 for a different approach to the proof from ע"פ.</i> However how does the גמרא in ע"פ prove this?! What else can אנין הדעת mean besides איסטניס that we require proof?
<b>כקוטרא ובית הכסא דמו—It is similar to smoke and an outhouse</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview to the previous תוס' on this עמוד.</i><br>In response to the challenge that the rule of אין חזקה לנזקין applies only to קוטרא וביה"כ, but not to נזקין in general, רב יוסף stated that since he was from the אניני הדעת, therefore this נזק is considered for him as a קוטרא וביה"כ.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דקאמר אפיקו קורקור מהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The understanding of the גמרא is that רב יוסף was concerned for the monetary loss which the ravens cost him on account that they destroyed his dates (by eating them). Therefore he said, ‘remove the ravens’. He, however, did not seem that concerned about the bloodletting from the אומנים, for then he would have said, remove the אומנים from here (because the blood disturbs me). The concern for the ravens eating the dates is a monetary one and has no connection to איסטניס (it is only the blood from the אומנים that makes it uncomfortable for an איסטניס). How did רב יוסף justify removing the ravens (which represents a monetary loss) to his status as an איסטניס. </i> משמע דמשום עורבים היה אומר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">He actually meant to remove the אומנים (for how else can they remove the ravens); nevertheless, since he stated אפיקו קורקור, this indicates that his main concern was the monetary loss.</i> –<br>And this which</b> רב יוסף <b>said, ‘remove the crowing</b> ravens <b>from here;</b> this <b>indicates that it was on account of the ravens that he said</b> to remove them, but not because of the blood of the אומנים –<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>ודאי אם לא היו עורבים היה סובל אף על גב דאנינא דעתיה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, he said אפיקו קורקור because they were the tipping point that made the bloodletting of the אומנים unbearable.</i> –</b><br>רב יוסף <b>would certainly be able to bear</b> the blood from the אומנים (alone), <b>if there were no עורבים, even though that</b> רב יוסף <b>was an איסטניס;</b> however the combination of the two (אומנים and עורבים) made it unbearable –<b></b><br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי העורבים היו אוכלים הדם ופורחים ומקנחים בפירות:</b><br><b>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say; <b>the עורבים would eat the blood</b> (from the bloodletting) <b>and would fly</b> on the date palms <b>and would wipe</b> their beaks <b>on the dates</b> and leave them covered with blood which was unbearable to רב יוסף who was an איסטניס.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רב יוסף, being an איסטניס could not bear the combination of bloodletting and the monetary loss of the dates, or he could not bear the dates being drenched in blood.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. It appears from תוספות (according to both answers) that רב יוסף was able to bear the sight of the bloodletting, but was not able to bear the bloodied dates. How can we explain that?<br>2. Why can’t we say that when רב יוסף said אפיקו קורקור he meant that since he was an איסטניס he could not bear the continued crowing of the ravens?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 3

<b>מרחיקין השובך מן העיר חמשים אמה—We distance the dovecote fifty cubits from the city</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה did not explain why we distance the שובך fifty אמות from the city. תוספות gives his reason<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה מרחיקין who writes שלא יפסדו זרעוני גינה. However, תוספות offers a different explanation.</i> and explains why it is not relevant in other cases.<br>---------------------------------------<br><b>מפני התבואה הנשטחת בגגות העיר כדי לייבש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We are concerned that the doves will reach the roofs and consume the grain.</i> –</b><br>We distance the שובך fifty אמות from the city, <b>on account of the grain which is spread out to dry on the roofs of the city –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly, if we will place the שובך outside the city (where the fields are), the birds will eat the grain in the fields (within fifty אמות of the שובך).</i><br><b>אבל לתבואה שבשדות ליכא למיחש בקרוב לעיר לפי שהשדות רחוקין מן העיר אלף אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If the שובך is placed fifty אמות from the city it will still be nine-hundred-fifty אמות away from the fields.</i> –<br>But there is no concern for the grain in the fields which are close to the city</b> (within חמישים אמה of the שובך), <b>since the fields are a thousand אמות away from the city –<br>כדתנן (ערכין דף לג,ה) אין עושין מגרש שדה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The תורה writes (במדבר [מסעי] לה,ד) regarding the ערי הלויים that a space of one thousand אמות around the city should be left vacant from plowing etc. This open space is intended to beautify the city. Presumably this applies to all cities.</i> ולא שדה מגרש:</b><br><b>As the משנה taught, ‘we do not make the open area (מגרש) into a field</b> (for growing crops) <b>and</b> we do not make <b>the field into a מגרש.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>If the שובך is placed fifty אמות from the city it will not eat the grain that is spread out to dry on the roofs, and not the grain in the fields which are a thousand אמות distance from the city.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did not תוספות accept פרש"י?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1. See נחלת משה. See following תוס' ד"ה ולא (TIE footnote # 3).</i>
<b>ולא יעשה שובך תוך שלו—And a person should not make a dovecote within his own</b> property<b></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה first taught us that one needs to distance a שובך fifty אמות from the city, and secondly that one should not make a שובך within his own property unless he distances it fifty אמות from all sides. תוספות clarifies the second ruling and explains why both rulings are necessary.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>ברחוק מן העיר<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In the city it is always prohibited from having a שובך (that is the first rule in the משנה).</i> בין השדות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה מרחיקין that the fields were (at least) one thousand אמות distance from the city. The שובך needs to be distanced fifty אמות on all sides from his neighbors’ properties. A fifty אמה radius from the שובך cannot include his neighbors’ properties.</i> –</b><br>This ruling not to make a dovecote בתוך שלו unless there are fifty אמות clearances in all direction is referring to a שובך <b>which is far from the city among the fields.</b><br><b>ואצטריך למיתני תרוייהו –<br>And it is necessary to teach both</b> rulings (near the city and out in the fields) –<br><b>דאי תנא רישא להרחיק מן העיר התם דוקא מרחיק –<br>For if</b> the משנה would only <b>teach the first</b> ruling, which is the requirement <b>to distance</b> the שובך <b>from the city,</b> we might assume that it is <b>only</b> necessary <b>to distance</b> from the city –<br><b>מפני שתבואות העיר מגולות הן בחצר הן בגג<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This צריכותא is valid according to תוספות who explains the reason for distancing the שובך from the city is on account of the תבואה which is spread out on the roofs (see previous תוס' ד"ה מרחיקין [TIE footnote # 1]). However according to פרש"י (see there TIE footnote # 1) that the reason is that they should not eat the זרעוני גנות (which are also covered) so why the need for the סיפא.</i> –<br>Since the produce</b> which is found in <b>the city is open</b> and revealed, <b>whether</b> it is found <b>in the courtyard or on the roof,</b> therefore the birds will find them easily –<br><b>אבל תבואה הנזרעת בשדה ומכוסה אין צריך להרחיק –<br>However</b> regarding <b>the grain</b> <b>which is planted in the field and is covered up, it is not necessary to distance</b> the שובך; since the grain is not that accessible, presumably the birds will not eat them, therefore it was necessary to teach the סיפא, that distancing is necessary even in the field –<br><b>ואי תנא סיפא משום דבשדות שכיחא תבואה אבל בעיר דלא שכיח כולי האי אימא לא:</b><br><b>And if</b> the משנה <b>would</b> just <b>teach the סיפא</b> (regarding a שובך in the field) we would think the reason a שובך is prohibited in the field <b>is because grain is common in the field</b> (therefore the birds will surely find (some of) the grain, <b>however in the city where</b> תבואה <b>is not that common, I would say</b> that <b>no</b> distancing is required, therefore the משנה taught us both cases.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a need to teach us distancing both from the city (where תבואה is not common) and in the field (where it is covered).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why was it necessary for תוספות to explain that בתוך שלו refers to a שובך in the fields outside the city; why could not תוספות say that if a person wants to make a שובך on his property within the city he may do so provided the שובך is distanced fifty אמות from his neighbors?
<b>בית ארבעת כורין כמלא שגר היונה—An area of four <i>Koor</i>, as is the full flight of a dove</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The רבנן maintain that one may make a dovecote in his property if there is a radius of (at least) fifty אמות in all directions that are still within his property. However, רבי יהודה disagrees and requires that there be four בית כור of his property<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A בית כור means the area in which a כור of grain can be planted. A בית סאה is an area in which a סאה of grain can be planted and it is fifty אמות by fifty אמות square or an area of 2,500 square אמות. A כור is thirty סאה, which means that the area of a בית כור is (2500x30 or) 75,000 square אמות. The width or length of a 75000 square אמות area is slightly less than 274 אמות. Meaning that according to ר"י the שובך must be surrounded by 274 אמות of his property. We assume that four בית כור means a בית כור on each of the four sides of the שובך.</i> surrounding the שובך. Our תוספות explains the dispute.<br>------------------------------<br><b>ורבי יהודה ורבנן לא פליגי בשגר היונה כמה הוי –<br>And ר"י and the רבנן do not argue how much the flight of a dove is –<br>דמודו רבנן דבית ארבעה כורין הוי שגר היונה –<br>For</b> even <b>the רבנן agree that the שגר היונה is the area of four כורין</b> (on all sides) –<br><b>אלא רבנן סברי כיון דבחמשים אמה מליא כריסייהו כדאמרינן בגמרא תו לא מזקי טפי –<br>Rather the רבנן maintains that since</b> the doves <b>fill up their stomachs</b> with food <b>within fifty אמות as the גמרא states, therefore they will not damage anymore</b> outside the fifty אמות, even though they do fly further than fifty אמות –<br><b>ורבי יהודה סבר דכמלא שגר מזקי:</b><br><b>However, ר"י maintains that they damage as far as they fly,</b> for they eat even beyond the fifty אמות.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>All agree that the doves fly more than fifty אמות, however ר"י ורבנן argue whether they eat their fill within fifty אמות (the רבנן), or not (ר"י).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly the reason תוספות assumes that there is no dispute regarding מלא שגר היונה, is because this is an observable fact, so it is not probable that they argue over a fact. However, if this is the reason, so similarly whether the birds eat their fill within fifty אמות (or not) is also a fact, so what have we gained, by exchanging one argument of fact for another?!<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 4

<b>אלא אם כן הרחיק שלשים ריס—Unless he distanced</b> himself <b>thirty <i>Ris</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a משנה which states<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק עט,ב.</i> that one may not set out traps for doves unless he distanced them thirty ריס from a settled area. תוספות discusses the various measurements used for distance.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>היינו ד' מיל דהמיל ז' ריס ומחצה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A מיל is two thousand אמות. A ריס would be 266 (and 2/3) אמות. [See תוס' ב"מ לג,א ד"ה וזהו. (According to the גירסא of רוס it is בגימטריא 266! If we use the number 266 2/3 the גימטריא in תוספות there is (almost) exact) This number is also quite close the שגר היונה (of 274); see previous תוס' ד"ה בית TIE Footnote # 1 ]</i> –</b><br>Thirty<b></b> ריס <b>is</b> the equivalent of <b>four מיל,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Four מיל is a פרסה or 8,000 אמות (266.6…7 x 30 = 8,000).</i> for a מיל is seven and a half ריס –<br>ופעמים שהגמרא נותן שיעור בריסין ופעמים במילין ופעמים בפרסה:</b><br><b>And sometimes the גמרא expresses the distance in ריסין</b> (30 in our case), <b>and sometimes in מילין</b> (four) <b>and sometimes in a פרסה</b> (1).<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Thirty ריס is four מיל (or one פרסה). The גמרא uses various modes of measuring distances.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there any reason why the משנה there chose to measure it in ריסין instead of in מילין or a פרסה?

Line 5

<b>והתניא ביישוב אפילו מאה מיל<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read מיל לא יפרוס.</i>—But the <i>Braysoh</i></b> <b>taught that in a settled<br>place [he should not spread out</b> the nets] <b>even for a hundred <i>Mil</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a משנה that one may not set up traps for doves within thirty ריס of the ישוב.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">אביי explained that this משנה does not contradict our משנה which requires distancing only fifty אמות; because even though doves can fly שלשים ריס they eat their fill within fifty אמות.</i> The גמרא asked that we learnt in a ברייתא that in a ישוב one should not set up traps for doves even for one hundred מיל. This (seemingly) contradicts the cited משנה which places a limit of (only) thirty ריס, not מאה מיל. Our תוספות discusses this question, considering that this ברייתא may be internally inconsistent.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות will ask that either the ברייתא is not self-consistent (so instead of asking from the ברייתא on the משנה, the גמרא should first clarify the contradiction in the ברייתא), or if we can justify the ברייתא, there will automatically not be any contradiction from the ברייתא to the משנה. Why ask a contradiction from the ברייתא on the משנה?!</i> דמאי סלקא דעתין דהוי פירוש וביישוב –<br>It is astounding! For what did we assume</b> (in this question) <b>is the meaning of</b> the word <b>'וביישוב'</b> in the ברייתא –<br><b>אי קרי העיר יישוב אם כן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read כן אם אפילו (instead of כן אפילו).</i> אפילו מאה מיל לאו דוקא כמו שמשמע<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The simple reading of the ברייתא when it states אפילו מאה מיל לא יפרוס means to tell us an exaggerated amount, but it is not limited to hundred, rather any distance is prohibited. </i> –<br>If the city is called a יישוב</b> (and we are not permitted to put up traps אפילו מאה מיל from a city), <b>so then if</b> we assume that when the ברייתא stated <b>אפילו מאה מיל, it was not definitive, for it seems</b> that the number, ‘a hundred מיל’, is לאו דוקא –<br><b>אלא אפילו אלף מיל או יותר –<br>But rather</b> the ברייתא when it said not to make traps within מאה מיל, it meant <b>even a thousand מיל or more</b> is also prohibited. If we make these assumptions –<br><b>אם כן בשום מקום לא יפרוס אפילו במדבר ורחוק לאין סוף מן העיר<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This would then mean that one can never place traps to capture birds. This cannot be what the ברייתא means!</i> –<br>So therefore, one cannot spread out</b> traps <b>even in the desert and extremely far from the city;</b> this seems incomprehensible <b>–</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate reading of the ברייתא that is more comprehensible:<br><b>ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות writes 'ואפילו', since the simple reading of the ברייתא is that any distance is prohibited; even more than מאה מיל.</i> אם נאמר דמאה מיל דוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This means that more than מאה מיל one may place the traps, which is much more reasonable.</i> מכל מקום היאך יפרש את הברייתא –<br>And even if we say that מאה מיל is exact, nevertheless how can we explain the ברייתא –<br>דהכי תניא בתוספתא דמרובה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק פ"ח ה"ד.</i> אין פורסין נשבין ליונים –<br>For this is what the ברייתא, in the תוספתא of</b> פרק <b>מרובה, states; ‘we do not set out traps for doves –<br>אלא אם כן הרחיק מן היישוב שלשים ריס<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">This רישא of the ברייתא is exactly the same ruling as the משנה in ב"ק עט,ב, cited in our גמרא</i> –<br>Unless he distanced them thirty ריס from the יישוב’.</b> The ברייתא continues <b>–<br>במה דברים אמורים במדבר אבל ביישוב אפילו מאה מיל לא יפרוס כיון דעיר קרי יישוב<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The רישא requires distancing of only thirty ריס from the יישוב (which means the city) and the סיפא requires distancing a hundred מיל from the יישוב (the city). This is self-contradictory. Instead of asking from the סיפא of the ברייתא on the משנה, the גמרא should have asked from the סיפא of the ברייתא on the רישא (which states the exact same ruling as the משנה)!!</i> –<br>‘When were these words said, in the desert, but in the יישוב one should not spread out</b> his traps <b>even</b> for a distance <b>of מאה מיל’,</b> how can we reconcile the סיפא with the רישא <b>if עיר is referred to as יישוב?!</b><br>תוספות offers a third approach which would remove the contradiction in the ברייתא:<br><b>ואי סלקא דעתין דהכי פירושו במה דברים אמורים במדבר פירוש שאין זרעים<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, no birds will fly more than thirty ריס without food in between.</i> –<br>And if we assumed that this is the explanation</b> of the סיפא; ‘<b>when are these words said (</b>that thirty ריס is a sufficient distance from the city) if those thirty ריס which separated the traps from the city <b>were in a desert’, meaning that there were no seeds</b> to be found between the city and the traps –<br><b>אבל ביישוב פירוש ביישוב זרעים אפילו מאה מיל לא יפרוס אם כן מאי קשיא ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The same answer we used to reconcile the רישא with the סיפא of the ברייתא, applies to the משנה and ברייתא as well. The משנה (which limits it to thirty ריס, is discussing a מדבר (without זרעים) and the סיפא of the ברייתא is where it is a יישוב זרעים. Either the ברייתא is self-contradictory; and if it is not, then there is no question from the ברייתא to the משנה. Why is the גמרא concerned about the contradiction the ברייתא and the משנה, and not the contradiction in the ברייתא itself?!</i> –<br>‘However, ביישוב’, meaning that</b> if the space in between the שובך and the city <b>is ‘settled’ with seeds,</b> then the ברייתא maintains <b>that even if it is a hundred מיל</b> (from the city) <b>לא יפרוס;</b> since the birds have food along the way, there is no limit how far they can travel. We have now properly explained the ברייתא. However, if this is what the ברייתא means, <b>so what therefore is the difficulty</b> between the משנה and the ברייתא?!<br>תוספות answers:<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The thrust of the sריצב"א' answer is that the גמרא is not (necessarily) posing a contradiction from the ברייתא to the משנה, but rather the גמרא is challenging the answer of אביי, who stated that birds can fly even thirty ריס, but they eat only in the first fifty אמות.</i><br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק בן אברהם דודאי סלקא דעתין דאיירי ביישוב זרעים<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This means that there are זרעים between the שובך and the city, so the birds have sufficient food to travel long distances.</i> –<br>And the ריצב"א says that we certainly assumed that</b> (in the [סיפא of the] ברייתא) <b>we are discussing a יישוב זרעים –<br>ולהכי פריך ומישט שייטי שלשים ריס ותו לא אפילו ביישוב זרעים<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">אביי answered that they are filled after fifty אמות, but they will fly thirty ריס without eating any more. This indicates that even if there is food (יישוב זרעים) they will only eat by the first fifty אמות and fly thirty ריס and no more. But the ברייתא stated that they fly מאה מיל. If not for אביי we could interpret the ברייתא that without food they fly thirty ריס, but with food they fly מאה אמה. The reason for this difference must be that when there is food (יישוב זרעים) they continue to eat even past the first fifty אמות. This disproves אביי who maintains they do not eat past the first fifty אמות.</i> –<br>So therefore</b> the גמרא asks (on אביי); ‘<b>and indeed do they fly only thirty ריס and no more’, even by a יישוב זרעים –<br>והא מוכח דביישוב זרעים שייטי טובא ואין זה אלא משום אכילה –<br>But it is evident</b> from the (סיפא of the) ברייתא <b>that by יישוב זרעים they fly</b> much <b>more</b> than thirty ריס, since the ברייתא prohibits up to a hundred מיל, <b>and the only</b> reason for this extension <b>is because of the food –<br>אלמא דלא מליא כריסייהו בחמשים אמה –<br>It is</b> therefore <b>evident that they do not fill up their stomachs in fifty אמה,</b> like אביי maintained but rather they keep on eating as they continue to fly!<br>תוספות cites the sגמרא' answer:<br><b>ומשני דלא איירי ביישוב זרעים אלא ביישוב שובכין ויישוב כרמים<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">They are able to rest in the שובכין וכרמים and be renewed for continued flight.</i> –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answers that</b> the ברייתא <b>is not discussing יישוב זרעים</b> (for even with the זרעים they can travel at most thirty ריס), <b>rather</b> the ברייתא is discussing <b>יישוב שובכין (dovecotes) or יישוב כרמים (vineyards) –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">We are now saying that by יישוב זרעים they can only fly thirty ריס; why does the ברייתא call a יישוב זרעים, a מדבר?!</i><br><b>וקרי מדבר היכא דליכא שובכים<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">From the perspective of birds, an area which does not have שובכים וכרמים (to enable them to continue flying) is called a מדבר (even though it has a יישוב זרעים).</i> וכרמים:</b><br><b>And</b> the ברייתא <b>calls מדבר</b> (where the limit is thirty ריס) a place <b>where there is no שובכים וכרמים</b> (even though there is זרעים, since the birds eat their fill in the first fifty אמות, and there is no שובכים וכרמים they cannot fly further).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The גמרא is asking on אביי that since we see that birds can fly even a hundred מיל even though elsewhere it states they can fly only thirty ריס, this seemingly indicates that the reason for this difference is that when there is food on the way (יישוב זרעים) they continue to eat (beyond חמישים אמה) and to fly (beyond שלשים ריס).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to the מסקנא of the גמרא is the term 'מאה מיל' in the ברייתא precise, or is it לאו דוקא and it is אסור even more than מאה מיל by יישוב כרמים ושובכים?<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>יורש תנינא—We</b> already <b>learnt</b> regarding <b>an heir</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב פפא (or רב זביד) inferred from our משנה, which stated that if one bought a dovecote he may keep it there, that we (the בית דין) claim on behalf of a buyer or an heir. The גמרא asked, we already learnt this rule regarding a יורש in a משנה (so what is ר"פ (or ר"ז) teaching us?<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא answered that ר"ז wanted (mainly) to teach us regarding a לוקח (which is what our משנה is discussing).</i> תוספות clarifies the sגמרא' question.<br>----------------------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">What is the גמרא asking, יורש תנינא; however ר"ז is teaching us that we argue for a לוקח also, not only for a יורש?! In fact, this is what the גמרא answers (see footnote # 1); but why is there even a question?!</i><br><b>וסלקא דעתיה המקשה דמתניתין אשמעינן ביורש והוא הדין בלוקח<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The מקשן assumed that the same logic that tells us טענינן ליורש, that same logic applies to a לוקח as well, so what is ר"ז teaching us regarding a לוקח, since we have a משנה that טענינן ליורש, the same applies to a לוקח.</i> –<br>And the questioner assumed that</b> even though <b>that the</b> cited <b>משנה is discussing a יורש,</b> but presumably <b>the same ruling</b> applies <b>to a לוקח</b> (that he does not require a claim) –<br><b>ומיהו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The answer of the תרצן (see footnote # 1) must be that לוקח and יורש are two separate issues; the fact that טוענין ליורש, does not necessarily indicate that טוענין ללוקח, therefore ר"ז wanted to infer that we are טוענין ללוקח as well. The question is that now that we are saying that יורש ולוקח are different and cannot be derived from each other, why did ר"ז infer from our משנה that טוענין ללוקח וטוענין ליורש, since our משנה is only discussing a לוקח and not a יורש.</i> רב זביד דנקט נמי יורש אמתניתין דלקמן סמיך –<br>However, ר"ז who also mentioned יורש</b> (which does not appear in our משנה), <b>he was depending on the משנה later,</b> which the מקשן cited –<br><b>אבל מתניתין דהכא לא שמעינן מינה יורש<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות may be rejecting the notion that perhaps ר"ז maintains (not like the מקשן [see footnote # 3]) that we cannot derive טוענין ללוקח from the fact that טוענין ליורש, but the reverse is true that once we know טוענין ללוקח, we certainly know that טוענין ליורש (see ‘Thinking it over’), and not like תוס' stated that ר"ז knows טוענין ליורש from the other משנה.  </i> מדאיצטריך מתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">If (as we wanted to maintain in footnote # 5) that we can derive טוענין ליורש from טוענין ללוקח, why was there a need to write the משנה later that טוענין ליורש. This proves the neither can be derived from the other (see ‘Thinking it over’).</i> דלקמן:</b><br><b>However, from our משנה here we would not know</b> that טוענין ל<b>יורש, since there is a necessity for the later משנה</b> (regarding a יורש).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מקשן assumed that יורש ולוקח are similar however the תרצן (ור"ז) disagree.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why indeed cannot we derive יורש from לוקח and vice versa?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

<b>וצריכי—And they are</b> (both) <b>needed</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that it was necessary for the משניות to teach us the rule of טוענין (ליורש וללוקח) both here in our משנה (regarding הלוקח שובך from an individual) and also in the other משנה (by לקח חצר regarding a רבים), because we could not derive one from the other. Our תוספות explains why there were not two משניות regarding טוענין ליורש, just as there are two משניות regarding טוענין ללוקח<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ביורש נמי ליתני תרתי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It was necessary for the משניות to teach us two types of טוענין ללוקח, one regarding a יחיד and the other regarding a רבים (see ‘Overview’), the same should be regarding טוענין ליורש that the משנה should teach us this rule specifically regarding a יחיד and a רבים, since we cannot derive one from the other. [See previous תוס' ד"ה יורש (TIE footnote # 6) that we cannot derive יורש and לוקח from each other. Therefore it is seemingly not sufficient that the ruling was taught by לוקח; it should be taught by יורש as well.]</i> –<br>And if you will say; let there also be two משניות regarding an heir?</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאשמעינן בלוקח והוא הדין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Granted that we could not derive יורש from לוקח (see footnote # 1); however that is if the rule of טוענין would be taught only by לוקח and not by יורש. However once טוענין is taught both by יורש and לוקח (indicating that the same rule applies by both of them), so once we know that by לוקח there is no difference between יחיד ורבים, the same will apply by יורש as well. [We cannot derive the rule one from the other, but once we know the rule we can derive the details one from the other.]</i> ביורש:</b><br><b>And one can say; that we were</b> already <b>informed regarding a לוקח</b> that there is no difference between a יחיד and a רבים, <b>so</b> it is self-understood <b>that the same ruling applies to a יורש</b> that there is no difference between a יחיד and a רבים.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We cannot derive the rules (of יורש ולוקח) one from the other, but once we know the rule exists by both, we can derive the details one from the other.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we understand the difference between the question in תוספות (that יורש should require two teachings [and we cannot derive it from לוקח]), and the answer of תוספות that we can derive it from לוקח so there is no need for two teachings by יורש also?
<b>אחולי אחילו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא in our texts reads אחולי אחול בני רשות הרבים גביה (instead of אחולי אחילו גביה).</i> גביה—They surely relinquished</b> their claim <b>against him</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explains that if the rule of טוענין ללוקח was taught only regarding the case of זיזין which extend into the רה"ר, I would say that only in that case do we say טוענין ללוקח for we assume that the בני רה"ר forgave him this trespass and allowed him to extend his זיזין into the רה"ר,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Otherwise, if they were not מוחל, how was he able to extend them into the רה"ר? The people (who are many) would certainly not allow him to keep it there. This proves that they came to a certain arrangement. This explanation is according to פרש"י (see ד"ה אימא). However see later in this תוספות that according to תוספות there is a different reason to differentiate. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> however by a שובך which belonged to an individual perhaps we are not טוענין ללוקח. Our תוספות explains what is meant that the בני רה"ר are מוחל; who are these בני רה"ר that have the right to be מוחל?<br>---------------------------------------<br><b>פירוש ז' טובי העיר במעמד אנשי העיר שהרשות בידם כדאמר פרק בתרא דמגילה (דף כו,א) –<br>The explanation</b> that the בני רה"ר were מוחל is that we are referring to <b>the ז' טובי העיר,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The ז' טובי העיר are the appointed representatives of the people of the city, to deal with all the needs of the city (like the city councilmen today). They are permitted, on their own, to do a limited number of dealings on behalf of the city; however, their power is greatly extended if they make their decision במעמד אנשי העיר.</i> in the presence of</b> all <b>the people of the city,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This presumably means that (a majority of) the people agree to take this action. We will assume that תוספות maintains that the זט"ה alone cannot be מוחל this person to extend his זיזים לרה"ר; however, במעמד אנשי העיר they can be מוחל (since all/most of the city agrees).</i></b> who were מוחל this person to extend his זיזים, <b>for they have permission to do so, as</b> the גמרא <b>states in the last פרק of</b> מסכת <b>מגילה –</b><br>תוספות explains why we assume מחילה here more than by שובך:<br><b>וכיון דליכא לכל חד בדרך אלא פורתא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Since we are discussing במעמד אנשי העיר, so each one has a very small interest in the street (it is a shared ‘ownership’ with all the other people), therefore we can assume that they are willing to forgo this small interest which they have in the street. However, by a שובך where the neighbor may bear the entire loss from these birds, we cannot assume that he was מוחל. [This all is in the הו"א, according to the מסקנא we say טוענין and he retains the right to the שובך.]</i> מחלי טפי מיחיד:</b><br><b>And since each individual only owns a minute portion of the road, they are quicker to be מוחל</b> their small share <b>than one individual</b> who is prone to a greater damage.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מחילה is done by all the people who, since they each have a minimal share, are willing to be מוחל, easier than one individual who carries the entire loss.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does תוספות not accept פרש"י as to the reason<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> why by a רבים there is more reason to assume that they were מוחל?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Daf 23b



Line 1

<b>חוץ לחמשים אמה הרי הוא של מוצאו—Beyond fifty cubits, it belongs to its finder</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה taught that if a chick was found within fifty אמות of the שובך, it belongs to the owner of the שובך, however if it is found beyond the fifty אמות it belongs to the finder. תוספות discusses this ruling.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>דאזלינן בתר רובא דעלמא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">When the ניפול is found within fifty אמות from a שובך we assume that it came from this שובך (it hopped this short distance). However, if it was found beyond fifty אמות from any שובך, [obviously someone brought it here, and we do not know who, therefore] there is no reason to return it to the בעל השובך, since the majority of chicks are from the entire world and not from this שובך, therefore we follow the majority and assume that it does not belong to this שובך.</i> –</b><br>The reason it belongs to the finder, <b>for we assume</b> that this chick <b>came from the majority</b> of chicks <b>in the world,</b> but not necessarily from a neighboring שובך –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ואפילו למאן דאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This refers to שמואל.
