<b>עני והעשיר הוה—He was poor and became rich</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that פאפי יונאה was a poor man who became rich, and was building a mansion on his property. There were sesame seed pressers in his neighborhood, and when they would press the seeds, his building would shake. רב אשי ruled that this is a case of גירי דיליה, where (even) ר' יוסי agrees that it must discontinue. תוספות discuses why it was necessary to mention that פאפי יונאה was poor and became rich.<br>---------------------------<br><b>רבותא נקט שהיה עני ולא איבעי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, איבעי להו לאסוקי (instead of איבעי לאסוקי).</i> לאסוקי אדעתייהו שיבנה האפדנא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, when they began their pressing operation they were סומך בהיתר, since their pressing could cause no harm to this poor person.</i> –</b><br>The גמרא, by <b>mentioning that he was poor</b> (and later because rich), is teaching us <b>a novelty,</b> that even though <b>these</b> pressers <b>had no reason to entertain that</b> פאפי יונאה <b>would build this mansion,</b> since he was poor <b>–<br>אפילו הכי הוזקקו להרחיק משום דהוו גירי דידהו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא here, תוס' יז,א ד"ה לא (TIE there footnote # 5), and elsewhere. גירי דידהו means that the damage is coming directly from the one causing the damage, as in our case, where as they were pressing, the house was shaking. </i> –<br>Nevertheless, they were required to distance themselves, because it was גירי דידהו (their arrows) –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דסמך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, דבסמך (instead of דסמך).</i> בהיתר אין צריך להרחיק אפילו בגירי דיליה –<br>Even though that</b> in a case where <b>he had the right to come close, it is not necessary to distance, even in</b> a case of <b>גירי דיליה –<br>כדתניא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there stated that one should not open up a חנות של נחתומים ושל צבעין under his friend’s warehouse, and the same applies to a רפת בקר. The גמרא cited a ברייתא that if the רפת בקר preceded the אוצר he may leave it there.</i> (לעיל דף כ,ב) אם היה רפת בקר קודמת לאוצר מותר –<br>As the ברייתא taught, ‘if the stable for the oxen preceded the storehouse, it is permitted’</b> to remain –<br><b>והוא הדין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5. The ruling of the ברייתא regarding רפת בקר applies to a חנות של נחתומים ושל צבעין as well; that if they were there before the אוצר, they can remain, even though this is considered </i> חנות של נחתומים וצבעין<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, ושל צבעין (instead of וצבעין).</i> ואין חילוק בין דירה לשאר<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Initially on דף יח,א the גמרא explained (according to רבא) that the reason they can remain is because the רפת בקר and חנות של נחתומין ושל צבעין are considered his dwelling place, therefore we are more lenient, as opposed to a גירי דיליה in a field. However (according to תוספות) this distinction is discarded in the מסקנא (see footnote # 9).</i> לפי המסקנא –<br>And the same rule applies to a bakery or a store of dyeing; and according to the conclusion<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See יח,ב תוס' ד"ה וסבר בפי' ר"ח ור"ח (TIE pg. 3), that according to the מסקנא one may be סומך except for בור.</i></b> in the גמרא <b>there is no difference between a dwelling to other</b> situations, so why were the pressers required to distance themselves since they were סומך בהיתר?!<b></b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דהכא היינו טעמא משום דלא קביעא תשמישייהו כל כך<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, even though we do not distinguish between דירה לשאר (as תוספות said), nevertheless we differentiate between קביעא תשמישייהו (where it is permitted if סמך בהיתר) and לא קביעא תשמישייהו where even if it was סמך בהיתר one must distance if it is גירי דיליה, since it is not that much of a bother to move the sesame press. Alternately, since it is not קביעא תשמישייהו, so every time they begin anew, it is as if they are starting now, so it is considered סומך באיסור.</i> כי הנך דלעיל –<br>Says the ר"ת that here the reason</b> they must distance even though they were סומך בהיתר is <b>because their usage</b> of pressing sesame seeds <b>was not that permanent like the other</b> cases mentioned <b>previously,</b> namely רפת בקר וחנות של נחתומים ושל צבעין –<br>An additional solution is offered:<br><b>(הג"ה. ועוד דהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, דהכא שאני משום (instead of דהכא משום).</i> משום דבאיסור סמך<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">These עצורי had no right to press the seeds (so close to the boundary) even before פאפי יונאה began building his mansion, since their banging caused the ground of פאפי to loosen and become soft, therefore it is considered סומך באיסור. See sרבא' statement previously on יז,ב.</i> דכל מרא<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, מרא ומרא דמחי (instead of מרא דמחי). See רש"ש who is גורס 'מחא' (bang).</i> דמחי מרפי לארעא<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, לארעא והוה דומיא דבור. ע"כ (instead of לארעא. ע"כ)</i>. עד כאן הג"ה):</b><br><b>(An annotation. And furthermore, for here [it is different] since he was סומך illegally, for with every shovel [and shovel]</b> that he bangs <b>he loosens the ground [so it is similar to</b> the case of a <b>pit]. This concludes the annotation.)</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>גירי דיליה requires one to distance even if initially there was no concern (like here where פאפי was poor); provided that it is not קביעא תשמישייהו, however if it is קביעא תשמישייהו, if he was סמך בהיתר he may remain even if it is גירי דיליה. (Alternately here they were סומך באיסור, since כל מרא מרפי לארעא.)<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did the ר"ת not accept the answer of the הג"ה (that they were סומך באיסור)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Daf 26a



Line 1

<b>אפומא דחצבא—On the mouth of a jug</b> <br><br>Overview<br>The גמרא asked, how much must the אפדנא of פאפי shake in order to have the seed pressers distance themselves. The גמרא answers that if it shakes the lid on the top of a jug. רש"י explains this to mean that if one places the jug on top of the wall (of the אפדנא), the lid of the jug will shake because of the vibrations from the pressers. <br>----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>על פירוש הקונטרס קשיא לרבינו יצחק דאיך יהא האפדנא נייד כולי האי -<br>The ר"י has a difficulty with פרש"י for how can the אפדנא shake so much -<br>עד שתתנדנד הנכתמא דאם כן הבית קרוב ליפול -<br>To the extent that the lid</b> (of the jug) <b>will shake, for if indeed this is so, the house is about to collapse,</b> meaning that it is not well constructed <b>-<br>ולפי הענין משמע שהיה בנין חזק שהרי מתוך העושר בנאה -<br>However according to the context</b> of the story, <b>it seems that it was a strong building, for he built it on account of his richness,</b> he would not have scrimped on the quality of the construction –<br><br>תוספות provides additional proof that אפדנא is a well-constructed edifice:<br><b>ובמסכת שבת (דף עז,ב) נמי אמר<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרות it merely states אפדנא אפיתחא דין (without the מאי). The גמרא there explains why things are named the way they are.</i> מאי אפנדא אפיתחא דין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The word אפדנא is comprised of two parts; the אפ refers to פתח and the דנא refers to דין.</i> שמאספין שם לדין -<br>And in מסכת שבת</b> the גמרא <b>also states, ‘what is אפדנא</b>; there <b>is judgment at its opening’,</b> meaning <b>that they gather there for judgment</b> (a court or בית דין) <b>-<br>משמע דבירה גדולה היא –<br>Indicating that it is a large building,</b> so how can the walls move so much that the lid of a jug will shake?!<br><br>תוספות offers his interpretation:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דכד ניידא נכתמא כשאדם אוחז הכד בידו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ר"י it will take very strong vibrations to make the lid shake if it is on top of the wall, however even a minor vibration will make the lid shake when it is held in a person’s hand.</i> שזהו דבר מועט הרבה -<br>And it appears to the ר"י</b> that when the גמרא states, ‘<b>as the lid shakes’,</b> it means that it shakes <b>when the person is holding the jug in his hand, for this is a very minor</b> vibration, so -<br><b>אם כך מתנדנד האפדנא חייב להרחיק -<br>So if the אפדנא shakes that much</b> (to casue the lid to shake in one’s hand)<b>, he is obligated to distance himself.<br><br></b>תוספות offers a validation of פרש"י:<br><b>ולרבינו יצחק בן אברהם נראה שאין פירוש הקונטרס דחוק –<br>And the ריצב"א maintains that פרש"י is not</b> at all <b>difficult -<br>דבדבר מועט מתנדנד הנכתמא שהוא דבר קל אף על פי שהאפדנא אינו מתנדנד<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">When the vibration reach the אפדנא wall, it will not cause it to shake (since it is a strong building), however once these vibration reach the lid (which is very light) it will shake considerably. [Place two coins next to each other touching and pin one coin down with your finger, strike the pinned down coin with a third coin; the pinned down coin will remain stationary while the coin next to it will be pushed away, from the vibration (try it, you’ll like it)] </i> כל כך:<br>For with a very minor</b> vibration <b>the lid</b> on top of the אפדנא wall <b>will shake, since</b> the lid <b>is very light, even though the אפדנא will not shake so much.<br></b><br>Summary<br>רש"י (and the ריצב"א) explain that the lid will shake when it is on top of the אפדנא wall; while the ר"ת maintains that it will shake while holding it in your hand<br><br>Thinking it over<br>When will it be more likely that the lid will shake from the banging of the pressers, if the jug is on the wall or if the jug is in his hand? 

Line 2

<b>זיקא הוא דקא ממטי לה—It is the wind that brings it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that when the family of בר מריון בריה דרבין would beat the flax, the chaff (of the flax) would fly away and damage people.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The chaff per se cannot damage anyone, except when it hits someone with the force of the wind behind it.</i> רבינא ruled that ר' יוסי held one is liable for damage that is casue by גירי דיליה, only if it is from his force, however here the wind is carrying it,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">גירי דיליה is only if it is like his arrows who fly by the force of the archer, however here he is merely separating the chaff, it is traveling elsewhere only because of the wind; it cannot be considered גירי דיליה.</i> so they are not liable, and may continue to beat the flax. תוספות reconciles this ruling of רבינא with other seemingly contradictory rulings.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>קשיא לרבינו יצחק דליחייב משום אש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">אש (fire) is one of the four major categories of damagers (אבות נזיקין). Any damage which is inflicted in a manner similar to אש is חייב as a תולדה (a derivative) of אש, and one is liable for any damage it caused.</i> –<br>The ר"י has a difficulty</b> with the ruling of רבינא, <b>for he should be liable on account of ‘fire’,</b> for this case of chaff –<br><b>מידי דהוה אאבנו וסכינו ומשאו שהניחן בראש גגו –<br>Is similar</b> to the case where a one <b>placed his stone, his knife, or his load on top of his roof –<br>ונפלו ברוח מצויה והזיקו דחייב משום אש<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Here too he should (not only be prevented from continuing to do this, but he should also) be liable for the damages, for it is similar to the case of אבנו וסכינו וכו'. The wind is carrying his chaff and damaging others.</i> כדאמר בפרק קמא דבבא קמא (דף ו,א) –<br>And they fell down on account of a common wind, and they damaged</b> something while falling<b>,</b> the rule is <b>that he is liable, because</b> this is considered <b>אש, as</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ב"ק –</b><br>תוספות rejects a possible solution:<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps in the case of the chaff here, it was blown by a רוח שאינו מצויה (an uncommonly strong wind).</i><br><b>והכא דאמטי ליה ברוח מצויה איירי –<br>Abd here we are discussing</b> a case <b>where</b> the chaff <b>was carried along by a רוח מצויה</b>; we know that we are discussing a רוח מצויה <b>–<br>מדפריך עלה מזורה ורוח<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא asked on רבינא why is this case different from the case of winnowing on שבת, where the winnowing (separating the grain from the chaff) is accomplished only through the wind, and nevertheless he is חייב, the same should be here that he should be liable even though the wind is assisting in causing the damage.</i> מסייעו<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amens this to read מסייעתו (instead of מסייעו).</i> דאיירי ברוח מצויה –<br>Since</b> the גמרא <b>challenges the</b> ruling of רבינא <b>from</b> the case of one <b>who is winnowing and the wind helps him</b> winnow, <b>which</b> that case is <b>by a רוח מצויה;</b> we know that the case of זורה is where it was a רוח מצויה <b>–<br>כדמשמע בהכונס (שם דף ס,א. ושם) גבי<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא there stated regarding the case of ליבה ולבתה הרוח that if his own fanning the flame is sufficient to cause the damage, he is liable, however if his fanning is insufficient and it caused damage only because of the wind, he is פטור. The גמרא there asked why is this different from זורע ורוח מסייעתו, where he is חייב (for מלאכת שבת), even though the winnowing is accomplished only through the wind. From this question it is apparent that זורה is only חייב by a רוח מצויה, for if one would by חייב by זורה even with a רוח שאינה מצויה, how can the גמרא compare and ask from זורה on ליבה, since by זורה the תורה is so strict that he is חייב even by a רוח שא"מ, however by ליבה (אש), one is never חייב for a רוח שא"מ. This proves that זורה is only by a רוח מצויה. Now since the גמרא ask from זורה on the flax, that means that the case of the flax is also by a רוח מצויה.</i> ליבה וליבתו הרוח –<br>As it seems in</b> פרק <b>הכונס regarding</b> the case where <b>he fanned</b> the flames <b>and the wind</b> assisted him in <b>fanning</b> the flame –<br>An additional proof that the chaff case is by a רוח מצויה:<br><b>ומדפריך מגץ היוצא מתחת הפטיש דהיינו ברוח מצויה דחייב משום אש<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The חיוב of אש is only by a רו"מ.</i> –<br>And</b> also, <b>since</b> the גמרא asks on רבינא, why is his case different <b>from</b> the case of a <b>spark that flies from a hammer,</b> for which he is liable for damages. And that case <b>is by a רו"מ, since he liable on account of אש<br>דגבי אש קתני לה בהכונס<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See the משנה there סב,ב where it states, גץ שיצא מתחת הפטיש והזיק חייב, גמל שהיה טעון פשתן ועבר ברשות הרבים ונכנס פשתנו לתוך החנות ודלקו בנרו של חנוני והדליק את הבירה בעל גמל חייב, הניח חנוני נרו מבחוץ החנוני חייב. All the cases are about אש.</i> –</b><br><b>For the משנה in</b> פרק <b>הכונס teaches</b> the rule of גץ <b>by the</b> cases of <b>אש !</b> The question remains (since this is a case of רו"מ), why (in the case of רבינא) is he not חייב on account of אש?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלא דמי לאש דאין חייב משום אש אלא כשעשה האדם את האש לבדו –<br>And the ר"י answers that</b> this case of the chaff <b>is not similar to אש, for one is not חייב for אש, unless the person makes the fire by himself –<br>כדכתיב<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">שמות (משפטים) כב,ה reads, כִּי תֵצֵא אֵשׁ וּמָצְאָה קֹצִים וְנֶאֱכַל גָּדִישׁ אוֹ הַקָּמָה אוֹ הַשָּׂדֶה שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם הַמַּבְעִר אֶת הַבְּעֵרָה .</i> המבעיר את הבערה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The fire (which he made) is what damages, the wind merely moves the fire to a certain destination.</i> בלא סיוע הרוח ואחר כך הולכת על ידי רוח מצויה –<br>As it is written, ‘the one who ignites the blaze’;</b> meaning that he initially ignited the fire <b>without the assistance of the wind, and afterwards the fire travels through a commonplace wind –<br>אבל הכא אין עושה לבדו כל עיקר אלא על ידי הרוח<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות distinguishes between damage caused by fire and the damage caused by the chaff. Fire itself can damage; the wind merely extends the area when the fire can damage. This person made a fire, which is a דבר המזיק and it spread ברו"מ therefore he is חייב. However, the chaff is not a דבר המזיק; it can do no harm on its own (see footnote # 1). Without the wind there is no damage, therefore he is פטור, for he did not make a דבר המזיק (like אש) and need not distance either.</i> –<br>However here he is doing nothing by himself, only through the wind –<br>דאי לאו רוח לא הוה רקתא אזלא כל עיקר ודמי לליבה<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8. By ליבה וליבתו הרוח if his fanning the coals is insufficient to start a fire without the wind, he is פטור since he did not create a מזיק by himself, only together with the wind. The same applies here by the chaff that he did not create a מזיק; it became a מזיק only because of the wind.</i> וליבתו הרוח דפטור –<br>For if not for the wind, the chaff would not go anywhere at all, so it is similar to</b> the case of <b>ליבה וליבתה הרוח where he is פטור –<br>והיינו<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות may be explaining how come the גמרא later askes מ"ש מגץ, but it does not ask מ"ש מאש. The answer is that the גמרא understood that chaff is different from אש, as תוס' just explained. The question is מ"ש מגץ.</i> דמשני כי פריך בסמוך מאי שנא מגץ<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See (text by) footnote # 9.</i> דהוה סלקא דעתך דדמי ממש לגץ<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות perhaps means to say that just as chaff is not a מזיק (see footnote # 1 & 13), similarly the גץ (itself) is also not a דבר המזיק. Therefore, the גמרא asks why is he חייב by גץ, and פטור by the chaff.</i> –<br>And this is</b> also <b>what</b> the גמרא answers <b>when</b> the גמרא <b>asks shortly, ‘why is</b> the case of the chaff <b>different from</b> the case of <b>a spark’;</b> the גמרא asked this because <b>it assumed that</b> the case of chaff <b>is exactly similar to</b> the case of <b>the spark –<br>ומשני התם ניחא ליה דליזל<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">This may mean that he wants the spark to leave his smithy.</i> ומתכוין להכות בכח עד שיצא הגץ ומתרחק<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amens this to read ויתרחק (instead of ומתרחק). This may also mean that for his work as a smith he needs to bang hard so that sparks will fly So he intends to make sparks.</i> בלא שום זיקא-<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answered, ‘there</b> by the גץ <b>he is pleased that</b> the spark <b>should go forth’ and</b> so <b>he bangs strongly so that the גץ should leave and distance itself,</b> all this is accomplished <b>without a wind</b><br><b>וחייב משום אש על מה שגומר והולך על ידי רוח מצויה –<br>So</b> therefore, <b>he is liable because of אש, for</b> the damage <b>which is completed and travels through a רו"מ –<br>אבל הכא לא ניחא ליה דתיזל כלומר ואינו מכה בכח ואי לאו רוח<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amens this to read הרוח (instead of רוח).</i> אין הרקתא הולכת כלל<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות distinguishes between גץ and chaff; by גץ he is hitting it hard for he wants it to go away (or he needs to hit it hard), so that his intent is that the גץ should fly away; that is creating a דבר המזיק and the wind merely extends its distance; however by chaff he has no  intent that it should go away, he does not mind if it remained here, therefore he is not creating a דבר מזיק.</i> –<br>However here</b> by the chaff, <b>he is not interested at all that</b> the chaff <b>should travel, meaning that he is not banging it hard</b> so it should go away, <b>and if not for the רו"מ the chaff will not travel at all.<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות, however did not offer a distinction between chaff (where he is פטור) and אבנו סכינו ומשאו which damaged ברו"מ (where he is חייב). See מהרש"א who writes, דלא דמי לאבנו סכינו וכו' כיון דבכוונה נטלן ממקום אחר והניחן בראש הגג ה"ל נעשה האש ע"י האדם לבדו ואח"כ הולכת ע"י רו"מ, אבל הכא אין כוונתו על הרקתא להניחו שם דכל דעתו אינו אלא לנפץ הכתנא ממנו ואין עושה לבדו כל עיקר רק ע"י הרוח ודו"ק. The מהרש"א seems to be saying that by אסו"מ he is placing something with intent where it can damage. However, by chaff he is merely preparing the flax; he has no intent at all regarding the chaff.  Alternately, אסו"מ damage on account of their weight or sharpness, however chaff can only damage because of the wind. See נחלת משה.</i></b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מכל מקום יהא חייב להרחיק מידי דהוה אגורן דמתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה on כד,ב requires distancing a threshing floor (גורן) fifty אמות (in order not to damage his neighbors).</i> דחייב להרחיק –<br>And if you will say; nonetheless</b> (even if he is not liable for the damages), <b>he should be required to distance himself, for it is similar to the גורן in our משנה where he is obligated to distance</b> himself –<br><b>אף על גב דזיקא ממטי ליה –<br>Even though that</b> in our משנה also it is <b>the wind which carries</b> the chaff?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דמתניתין כרבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See the משנה and the גמרא on כה,ב. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> והכא איירי אליבא דרבי יוסי דלא מחייב אלא בגירי דיליה –<br>And one can say that our משנה</b> of גורן is <b>according to the רבנן and here</b> (by the chaff) <b>we are discussing</b> the ruling <b>according to ר"י, who only holds one liable by גירי דיליה,</b> and here it is not גירי דיליה (since he made no מזיק) –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<b><br>והא דפריך מגץ ולא מצי לאוקמי ההיא דגץ כרבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">The same answer which תוספות gave to reconcile the משנה of אילן with the ruling of רבינא (by chaff), the גמרא could have given concerning the difficulty from the משנה of גץ.</i> –<br>And this which</b> the גמרא <b>challenged</b> רבינא <b>from גץ</b> היוצא וכו', <b>so</b> why <b>did not</b> the גמרא <b>establish that</b> משנה of גץ <b>according to the רבנן</b> who argue with ר' יוסי –<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>משום דלא פליגי רבי יוסי ורבנן לענין חיוב תשלומין אלא לענין הרחקה<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">The answer that the משנה of גץ is according to the חכמים is not satisfactory, for the argument between ר"י ורבנן is only regarding הרחקה, but even the רבנן agree with ר"י that there is no חיוב תשלומין; so why is he חייב by גץ and פטור by the chaff. Therefore, we must give the sגמרא' answer.</i> –<br>Because ר"י and the רבנן do not argue regarding the obligation to pay, rather</b> the argue <b>only regarding distancing.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי שנא מנמייה<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה on כב,ב states, we must distance the ladder from the dovecote four אמות in order that the נמייה should not jump (from the ladder to the dovecote). נמייה is a weasel type animal (mongoose?). </i> דאפילו לר' יוסי מרחיקין –<br>And if you will say; why</b> is the case of the chaff <b>different from a נמייה, where even according to ר"י</b> we require <b>distancing –<br>אף על גב דהיא גופה ממטיא נפשה כמר<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח deletes the words כמר בר רב אשי (and it reads נפשה ומיהו).</i> בר רב אשי –<br>Even though that it is the נמייה who brings herself</b> to the dovecote <b>(like מר בר רב אשי</b> who ruled in opposition to רבינא) <b>–</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ומיהו התם משום דזימנין דבהדי דנח<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amens this to read דמנח (instead of דנח).</i> כולי כדקאמר לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">כב,ב. See the שטה מקובצת that this means that when he is placing the ladder the נמייה is already on the ladder, therefore it is as if he is bringing the נמייה closer to the שובך.</i> –<br>However there</b> he must distance, for it is considered גירי דיליה <b>because occasionally as he puts down</b> the ladder, etc. the נמייה will jump from the ladder to the שובך. <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>explained previously,</b> however here it is not גירי דיליה as רבינא stated.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>אבל קשה מעורבין לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">See there (also) תוד"ה אתו TIE footnote # 1.</i> (דף כג,א) דאמר רב יוסף אפיקו לי קורקור מהכא –<br>However, there is a difficulty from the previous</b> case of <b>ravens, where ר"י demanded remove the crowing</b> ravens <b>from here –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דגמרא לא סבר לה כרבינא דרבינו תם פוסק כמר בר רב אשי וכאמימר<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">According to this answer of תוספות (that we do not rule like רבינא), we do not need the explanations differentiating between the case of רבינא (flax) and the other cases (of אש, אבנו סכינו, גץ), except according to רבינא. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>And one can say that the גמרא does not agree with רבינא, for the ר"ת ruled like מר בר רב אשי and אמימר,</b> who maintain that the case of the flax is similar to (either) זורה ורוח מסייעתו (or to גץ היוצא) that in the case of the flax he has to distance himself (and he may be liable).<br>תוספות offers an alternate answer (that we can agree with רבינא):<br><b>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק דבעלי חיים שאני דחמירי טפי מרוח –<br>And additionally says the ר"י</b> that we can reconcile the view of רבינא (who is more lenient by the flax) with the cases of נמייה and עורבין (where we are stricter), <b>for animals are different, since we are stricter</b> regarding animals (who assist in causing damage) <b>more than</b> regarding a <b>wind</b> (which assists in causing damage) –<br><b>דכח אחר מעורב בהן<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">The אדם המזיק did not make the wind come; it is a כח אחר, however by the נמייה and the עורבין the אדם המזיק allowed the נמייה to come on his ladder and the עורבין came because of the bloodletting, therefore it is גירי דיליה.</i> כדאמרינן<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states that if the תורה would not have written the חיוב for אש המזיק, we could not derive it from the חיוב of בור המזיק, for by בור there is no כח אחר מעורב בו, therefore one is חייב, however by אש, since there is a כח אחר מעורב בו, we would assume that he is פטור. We see from there that כח אחר מעורב בו is a reason to be lenient.</i> בבבא קמא (דף ו,א) :</b><br><b>Since</b> regarding damage caused by wind (like the flax, winnowing and גץ) <b>there is another force mixed in with them, as</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> מסכת <b>ב"ק.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות distinguishes between the case of רבינא and the cases of אש and גץ. We either do not rule like רבינא or we can differentiate between wind and animals.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes that the משנה regarding גורן follows the view of the רבנן, but not that of ר' יוסי.<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 24.</i> Previously however תוספות stated<sup class="footnote-marker">36</sup><i class="footnote">כב,ב ד"ה לימא.(TIE [by] footnote # 4).</i> that all the משניות (except for אילן) are according to ר"י (for they are גירי דיליה). How can we reconcile these two תוספות?<sup class="footnote-marker">37</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br>2. תוספות answers that there is no question from עורבין since the ר"ת rules like מר בר רב אשי and מרימר.<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 32.</i> How does that resolve the issue, can we compare the case of עורבין to the case of זורה or גץ?<sup class="footnote-marker">39</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 3

<b>מאי שנא מזורה ורוח מסייעתו—Why is this different from winnowing and the wind assists him</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>מר בר רב אשי asked why is the case of רבינא (regarding the flax) different from winnowing, where we say that he is חייב on שבת, even though the winnowing is accomplished (only) with the assistance of the wind. תוספות explains the differing views of רבינא and מר בר ר"א regarding this comparison.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>ורבינא לא חשיב לה פירכא דסבר כי היכי דלא גמרינן משבת לענין תשלומין –<br>רבינא, however, does not consider this a challenge, for he maintains that just as we do not derive</b> damages <b>from שבת regarding payment –<br>כדמפרש רב אשי בהכונס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states that in a case of ליבה וליבתה הרוח (and the fire caused damage), if his fanning is not sufficient to set the blaze without the assistance of the wind he is פטור from paying. The גמרא asked why is this different from זורה ורוח מסייעתו where he is חייב? רב אשי responded that by שבת as long as his intent was fulfilled (he wanted to start a fire); it is considered מלאכת מחשבת (even though he may only be considered a גרמא) and therefore he is חייב.</i> (בבא קמא דף ס,א ושם) דגבי שבת מלאכת מחשבת אסרה תורה –<br>As רב אשי explained in</b> פרק <b>הכונס that regarding שבת the תורה prohibited a ‘thoughtful act’ –<br>אבל הכא גרמא הוא וגרמא בנזקין פטור –<br>However here</b> by damages <b>it is</b> merely <b>a cause, and causing a damage is exempt</b> from payment. Therefore, רבינא maintains, just as we cannot derive payment from the laws of שבת <b>–<br>הכי נמי לא גמרינן מהתם שיהא חייב להרחיק –</b><br>Similarly, <b>here too</b> regarding the flax, <b>we cannot derive from</b> שבת <b>that he should be obligated to distance –<br>ומר בר רב אשי סבר נהי דחיוב תשלומין לא גמרינן –<br>And מר בר ר"א maintains that granted we cannot derive the obligation of payment</b> from שבת (since גרמא בנזקין is פטור), however –<br><b>לענין הרחקה דליחשב גירי דיליה גמרינן שפיר כיון דגרמא בנזקין אסור:</b><br><b>Regarding distancing that it should be considered גירי דיליה, we can properly derive</b> that from שבת <b>since גרמא בנזקין</b> (while it is פטור, nevertheless it) <b>is אסור.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רבינא maintains that just like we cannot derive a חיוב from שבת, we cannot derive הרחקה, while מר בר ר"א maintains that while גרמא is indeed פטור but it is אסור.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can we understand that something may be considered גירי דיליה and he is obligated להרחיק, but nevertheless he is פטור for the damage he caused, even though it is גירי דיליה? Alternately how can something be merely a גרמא and nevertheless it is גירי דיליה?!

Line 4

<b>ורבינא מאי שנא מגץ—And</b> according to <i><b>Ravinoh</i> why is it different from a spark</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבינא ruled that the chaff from the flax which was carried by a wind to the neighbor’s property is not considered גירי דיליה. The גמרא asked why (according to רבינא) is this case different from a גץ היוצא מתחת הפטיש and it damaged, where he is liable, even though the damage was caused only with the aid of the wind. תוספות discusses why this question is on רבינא more than on אמימר.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our texts it is מרימר (not אמימר). Perhaps they are the same person?</i><br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ואמאי קאמר ורבינא לאמימר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> נמי תיקשי לענין חיוב תשלומין<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה מ"ש where תוספות cites רב אשי who maintains that regarding the case גרמא (like the case here by flax) that there is no תשלומין since גרמא בנזקין is פטור but there is a חיוב הרחקה since גרמא is אסור. In this question תוס' assumes that אמימר follows this view of רב אשי when he said, היינו זורה ורוח מסייעתו', meaning that there is a חיוב הרחקה, but no חיוב תשלומין; the same question can be asked on אמימר, why is this different מגץ?! </i> מאי שנא מגץ –<br>And if you will say; but why does</b> the גמרא <b>ask</b> only <b>according to רבינא, the question should also</b> be posed <b>to אמימר regarding the obligation to pay; why is</b> the case of the flax (where he is only required to distance but not to pay) <b>different from גץ</b> (where he is required to pay)?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר משום הכי נקט רבינא דאמימר הוי מצי לדחויי –<br>And one can say; that it is for this</b> reason that the גמרא <b>mentions</b> only <b>רבינא, since אמימר could have deflected</b> the question by saying –<br><b>דהכי נמי חייב<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דחייב (instead of חייב).</i> לדידיה בתשלומין דלגמרי מדמה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In this answer תוספות maintains that it is not necessary to assume that אמימר agrees with רב אשי (see footnote # 3), rather אמימר maintains that we derive from שבת that (regarding wind assisted damage) not only is he liable to distance, but he must also pay for the damage. [Regarding the question in פרק הכונס (from ליבה וליבתה הרוח), אמימר can use one of the other answers there (not like רב אשי). עיי"ש בהכונס.] See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2. </i> לה לזורה ורוח מסייעתו:</b><br><b>That indeed he is liable for payment according to</b> אמימר, <b>for he compares completely</b> the case of the flax <b>to</b> the case of ‘<b>winnowing and the wind assists him’.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>אמימר can maintain that in a case of רוח מסייעתו he is even liable for damages.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why did not תוספות ask that the question on רבינא should apply to מר בר רב אשי as well (as to אמימר)?<br>2. Is it necessary to assume that אמימר maintains that he is liable for payment?

Line 5

<b>אחד גפנים ואחד כל אילן—Whether grapevines or whether any tree</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה states that one must distance his tree four אמות from his friend’s field, whether it is a grapevine or any other tree. The issue at hand is that since the משנה states 'ואחד כל אילן', why mention גפנים at all?<br>---------------------------<br><b>מתוך פירוש הקונטרס לעיל (דף יח,א)<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See there רש"י ד"ה גדר, where he writes (regarding if there is a wall in between).שאין מזיקו עוד לעבודת הכרם זה סומך אילנות לגדר מכאן וזה סומך אילנות לגדר מכאן ואי נמי אחד מהן שדה לבן אין כאן כלאים כדאמר בעירובין (דף יא.) אם גפנים מכאן מותר לזרוע כאן.</i> משמע דנקט אחד גפנים משום דשייך בהו כלאים –<br>From the content of פרש"י previously, it seems</b> that according to רש"י, the משנה <b>mentions 'אחד גפנים', because</b> the rules of <b>כלאים apply to the</b> גפנים. We can infer<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">רש"י does not state clearly that the reason for mentioning גפנים is on account of כלאים; however from his words (ואי נמי אחד מהן שדה לבן אין כאן כלאים וכו'), we can infer that רש"י meant to say that the case of היה גדר בינתיים explains why he mentions גפנים since the גדר prevents the איסור כלאים (as well; not only the issue of הרחקת נזקין).</i> this from פרש"י –<br><b>דהביא ראיה מכאן דכשיש גדר ליכא איסור כלאים וזה סומך לגדר מכאן וזה מכאן –<br>Since</b> רש"י there <b>brought proof from this (our)</b> משנה, which states <b>that when there is a wall</b> separating between the vineyard and a grain field, <b>there is no prohibition of כלאים, and this one may come up close to the wall on this</b> side, <b>and the other one</b> can come up close to the wall <b>from the other side.</b><br>תוספות disagrees:<br><b>ואין נראה דשדה חבירו דקתני הכא על כרחך לאו בשל זרעים איירי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The prohibition of כלאים with גפנים is (only) with grain, but not with other trees.</i> –<br>However, it does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for</b> when the משנה <b>here taught, ‘his friend’s field’, perforce it was not discussing a seeded</b> field (which grows grain, etc.) –<br><b>דהא מוקמינן בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Later on this עמוד.</i> דמתניתין אילנות לאילנות וגפנים לגפנים –<br>For</b> רב יוסף <b>established in the גמרא that our משנה,</b> which requires distancing<b></b> four אמות from the neighbor’s field, is (only) discussing distancing <b>trees from trees and grapevines from grapevines –<br>אבל אילנות לגפנים בעי טפי משום ציפרי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The birds sat on the trees and descended on the vineyard and damaged it.</i> ומהאי טעמא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This is תוספות conclusion (not in the גמרא), that the birds will settle on the גפנים and damage the זרעים. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> גפנים לזרעים בעי טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">It is evident according to תוספות that שדה חבירו cannot be discussing a שדה זרעים, since that requires distancing more than ד' אמות. Since the משנה is not discussing שדה של זרעים there is no כלאים.</i> –<br>However, trees from גפנים require greater distancing</b> than ד' אמות <b>because of the birds, and for the same reason גפנים from זרעים</b> also <b>require greater</b> distancing –<br>תוספות offers his explanation why the משנה mentions גפנים וכל אילן:<br><b>אלא דנראה דנקט אחד גפנים ואחד כל אילן –<br>Rather it appears</b> to תוספות <b>that</b> the reason the משנה <b>mentions אחד גפנים ואחד כל אילן</b> (and not merely כל אילן alone), is in order<br><b>דלא תיסוק אדעתין למימר דשיעור ד' אמות דמתניתין דוקא בגפנים –<br>That we should not</b> mistakenly <b>assume</b> (if the משנה would only state אילן) <b>that the amount of ד"א</b> distancing <b>in our משנה is only</b> regarding <b>גפנים</b> (but not other trees); the reason we might mistakenly assume this is <b>–<br>שמצינו בהם שיעור זה במקום אחר<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' יח,א ד"ה ותני (TIE footnote # 2). We might therefore assume that since the משנה here mentions ד"א, so even though it states אילן, we still might have thought that it means only גפנים. Therefore, the משנה was explicit.</i> לענין כלאים:</b><br><b>Since we find this amount</b> (of ד"א) by גפנים <b>elsewhere regarding כלאים.</b> Therefore, the משנה needed to say אחד גפנים ואחד כל אילן that this שיעור applies to all trees.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה mentions גפנים, according to רש"י, to teach us that if there is a גדר there is no איסור כלאים. According to תוספות it needed to mention גפנים and אילן, so we should not mistakenly assume that distancing ד"א applies only to גפן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות compares אילן לגפנים to אילן לזרעים.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> However, אילן are large trees so it is understood that the birds nestle there and go below to damage the vineyard. However, גפנים are low trees, and birds normally do not nestle there,<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">If the birds nestle on the גפנים, why the need for greater distancing from אילנות לגפנים, since the birds nestle on the גפנים without the אילנות?!</i> why do we require greater distancing.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 7

<b>אבל בבבל ב' אמות—However in <i>Bohvel</i>,</b> it is <b>two cubits</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>שמואל ruled that the requirement to distance a tree four אמות from שדה חבירו is only in ארץ ישראל (where the plow needed ד"א), however in בבל where the plow is smaller, distancing two אמות is sufficient. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>--------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דבפרק המוכר את הספינה (לקמן דף פב,ב ושם דף פג,א) גבי קנה ג' קנה קרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The rule is if someone buys one or two trees, he only owns the tree but not the land. However if one buys three trees he owns the land between the trees. The issue is how close (or far) do the trees need to be from each other in order to receive ownership of the land as well. One opinion is that it must be between eight and sixteen אמות.</i> –<br>It is astounding! for in פרק המוכר את הספינה, regarding</b> the ruling that if <b>he bought three</b> trees <b>he acquires the land</b> between the trees –<br><b>דאמר רב יוסף עובדא הוה בדורא דרעותא כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The case there was that the trees were closer than eight אמות between them (see footnote # 1), and nevertheless ר' יהודה ruled that they receive the land as long as the distance between them is כמלא בקר וכליו (the amount of space for an ox and its utensils [plow, etc.]). רב יוסף, who heard this ruling from ר"י was unsure of the size of כמלא בקר וכליו. However, when he learnt our משנה (which requires ד"א) and the ברייתא (which stated that the ד"א is כדי עבודת הכרם), he deduced that מלא בקר וכליו is ד"א.</i> –<br>Where רב יוסף said there was a story in a ‘city of shepherds’, etc. –<br>משמע מהתם דבבבל נמי בעינן ד' אמות דבבבל הוה מעשה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">According to שמואל the size of כמלא בקר וכליו in בבל is only two אמות. How did רב יוסף understand it to be ד"א. Granted that in א"י it is ד"א, but not in בבל</i> –<br>It seems from</b> the גמרא <b>there that in בבל we also require distancing ד"א, for that story</b> in דורא דרעותא <b>took place in בבל?!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>וצריך לומר דבההיא דורא דרעותא היה להם מחרישה גדולה כמו בארץ ישראל:</b><br><b>And it will be necessary to say that in that דורא דרעותא they had a large plow like in א"י;</b> however elsewhere in בבל the מחרישה was smaller.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There was sometimes a מחרישה of ד"א even in בבל.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How much must one distance his tree in דורא דרעותא?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"א.</i>

Line 9

<b>אבל בגפנים בעי טפי—However, by grapevines, more is required</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב יוסף qualified the ruling of the משנה, which requires a distancing of four אמות, that it is only between trees and trees or גפנים and גפנים, however trees from גפנים require a greater amount of distancing, on account of the birds which settle on the trees and damage the גפנים. Our תוספות qualifies this rule of רב יוסף.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>והוא כשנטע דקלים כשהם גבוהים<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">He replanted trees that were already grown. In this case as soon as he plants the trees the birds come immediately and settle on the branches and continue straight on to damage the adjacent vineyard. It seems that according to תוספות this is considered גירי דיליה (see נחלת משה). See the גמרא previously on כב,ב regarding the נמייה.</i> –</b><br>The rule of רב יוסף is valid, <b>provided that when he planted the palm trees,</b> the trees were already <b>tall –<br>אבל אם נטע גרעין לא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דממילא קא גדל ולא גירי דיליה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">We follow ר' יוסי that if it is not גירי דיליה, we do not require distancing. In this case it is not גירי דיליה since all he did was place a kernel in the ground. That certainly did not casue any damage to the גפנים. The damage that happens later is certainly not considered ‘his arrows’ – גירי דיליה.</i> הוא:</b><br><b>However, if he planted a kernel, it does not require</b> greater distancing (more than ד"א), <b>since</b> the tree <b>grows automatically and it is not</b> considered <b>‘his arrows’.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The greater distancing is only if he planted large palms, but not if he planted a seed.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>When תוספות writes אבל אם נטע גרעין לא,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> does תוספות mean that by a גרעין we do not require distancing more than ד"א, or does תוספות mean that he does not require any distancing at all, since it is only a גרעין (and it’s not גירי דיליה)?

<b>אנא לא קייצנא דאמר רב כולי—I will not chop it down, for <i>Rav</i></b><i> </i><b>stated, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא בר רב חנן refused to chop down his palm trees (even) after רב יוסף told him that he is legally required to do so. He said (quoting רב) that it is forbidden to cut down a fruit bearing tree. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with seemingly contradictory גמרות.<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והתנן במתניתא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">כה,ב. The משנה there states that if the pit came before the tree (and the tree can damage the pit), the rule is that the tree is cut down but the owner is paid. In any event we are permitted to cut down the tree (if it is a מזיק), so here too, why did he refuse to cut down the tree since he was מזיק the גפנים.</i> דקוצץ ונותן דמים –<br>And if you will say; but we learnt in our משנה that he cuts down</b> the tree <b>and pays its value</b> to the tree owner –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאיכא לאוקמי באילן סרק<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See רמב"ם הל' מלכים פ"ו ה"ט that an אילן סרק may be cut down for no reason at all.</i> –<br>And one can say; that we can establish the משנה by a barren tree</b> which bears no fruit, therefore it is permitted to cut it down, however here it was a fruit bearing tree and the injunction of רב applies.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>אבל קשה דאמרינן בהחובל (בבא קמא דף צב,א) גבי הנהו דיקלי דמכחשי בגופני הוו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The story there was that sשמואל' sharecropper brought him some dates, when שמואל ate them, they had a taste of wine, so he asked his אריס why is this, and the אריס told him that these date palms were planted among the grapevines. שמואל was upset that the date palms are weakening his wine, so he told the אריס to destroy the palms. [If the dates had a taste of wine that means that the flavor of wine was entering into the dates instead of the grapes.]</i> –<br>However, there is a difficulty, for the</b> גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>החובל regarding these date palms, which were weakening the grapevines –<br>דקאמר למחר אייתי לי מקורייהו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there ד"ה מקורייהו.</i> אלמא משום היזק גפנים מותר לקוץ דקלים –</b><br><b>Where</b> שמואל <b>said</b> to the אריס<b>, ‘tomorrow bring me from their roots</b> (i.e., uproot the trees)’; <b>it is evident that it is permitted to cut down the date palms because they damage the grapevines.</b> This seems to contradict the ruling of רב here.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לפרש דשאני התם שיותר מדאי היו מכחישים בגפנים עד דהוה טעים בהו טעמא דחמרא:</b><br><b>And one can explain that it is different there</b> by the case of שמואל <b>for the</b> date palms <b>were weakening the grapevines to such a great extent that he was able to taste</b> in the dates <b>the flavor of wine;</b> for such excessive damage it is permitted to cut down even a fruit tree.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One may destroy barren trees (the previous משנה). One may destroy fruit trees if they are causing excessive damage.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is more precious; date palms or grapevines?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות there (ב"ק צב,א) ד"ה למחר.</i>

Line 1

<b>עד דאמרי ליה הא דאמר רב יהודה מיצר שהחזיקו כולי—Until I said to him this<br>which <i>Rav Yehudoh</i> said, ‘a border<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Alternately; a strip of land or a pathway.</i> which was possessed, etc.’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא related that רב פפא had date palms on the border that he shared with רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע. ר"פ noticed that ר"ה was digging (in his own property) and cutting off the roots of the trees. ר"פ asked him why he is cutting of the roots, etc. so ר"ה answered him that he is digging a pit, and the משנה rules that he may chop down the roots and keep them. ר"פ recounted that he tried to bring all types of proofs against ר"ה to no avail until he told him the ruling of רב יהודה that a מיצר which the public took possession of, it is forbidden to ruin it. תוספות discusses the issues in this controversy.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה מאי מייתי מרב יהודה דרבים שאני –<br>It is astounding! what</b> proof does רב פפא <b>bring from</b> the ruling of <b>ר"י,</b> that a מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים אסור לקלקלו; since it is understood <b>that by a רבים (the public) it is different</b>; we cannot derive a יחיד (the case of ר"פ) from a רבים (the ruling of ר"י). We are more concerned for the needs of a רבים than of a יחיד<br>תוספות proves this point that a יחיד ורבים are different <b>–<br>דאי לאו הכי קשיא מתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">כב,ב. How can the well digger chop of the roots of the tree since the tree owner was החזיק (since we are now assuming that the ruling of ר"י applies to the situation with roots). The obvious answer is that this rule of ר"י regarding החזיק is only if it was a רבים, but not if it was a יחיד. The question remains how did ר"פ bring proof from the ruling of ר"י?!</i> דקתני קוצץ ויורד –<br>For</b> if it is <b>not so</b> (but rather a יחיד ורבים are the same), <b>there will be a difficulty from our משנה which states, he may chop off</b> the roots as he digs <b>down –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ופירש רבינו חננאל ורבינו יצחק בן מאיר דרבים החזיקו במצריה דרב הונא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The border (on the side) of ר"ה was used as a pathway for the public. Underneath this pathway were the roots of sר"פ' trees. ר"פ challenged ר"ה that he cannot dig there since it is a מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים.</i> וברשותו –<br>And the ר"ח and the ריב"ם explained</b> that here too it was <b>many</b> people <b>who were מחזיק on the border of ר"ה, and</b> they were מחזיק <b>with his consent.</b> We must assume that it was with the consent of ר"ה <b>–<br>דאי לאו הכי אין חזקתו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amend this to חזקתן (instead of חזקתו).</i> מועלת כדמשמע בהמניח (בבא קמא דף כח,א ושם) –<br>For otherwise</b> (if the חזקה was made without his consent) <b>their חזקה would not be effective, as it seems<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there cites this ruling of ר"י that a מצר וכו' אסור לקלקלו, regarding a case where there was a right of way in someone’s field, עיי"ש. It appears that this rule applies only if the right of way was provided with the consent of the owner, otherwise he can chase them away.</i></b> from the גמרא <b>in</b> פרק <b>המניח –</b><br>תוספות continues with his explanation:<br><b>ואתא רב הונא וקא חפר ברשות הרבים<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> וקצץ שרשים דרב פפא –<br>And ר"ה came and was digging in this public domain</b> (the pathway which he allowed for the public), <b>and was cutting the roots of sר"פ'</b> trees which extended into sר"ה' property underneath this public pathway –<br><b>ומשום הכי פריך מדרב יהודה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably when the גמרא stated initially that ר"פ אמירי ליה כולהו ולא יכילי ליה, he was trying to convince ר"ה that he has no right to cut his roots; however, since לא יכילי ליה, so he took another tact based on the fact that it was a מיצר שהחזיקו בו רבים.</i> דכיון שהחזיקו בו רבים אינו רשאי לחפור<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ה was not permitted to dig (not because he was cutting the roots of ר"פ, but rather) because it was a public road.</i> –<br>So therefore</b> ר"פ <b>challenged</b> ר"ה <b>from</b> the ruling of <b>ר"י, that since the public took possession</b> of this pathway, ר"ה <b>is not permitted to dig</b> there –<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דקאמר אמאי לא אמרי ליה כאן בתוך שש עשרה אמה וכולי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See פרש"י ד"ה בתוך that ר"ה could have claimed that your חזקה on the tree (and its roots) extends only sixteen אמות and I am digging past the sixteen אמות. This גמרא is understood if we assume that the claim of ר"פ was based on his חזקה of the tree (not like פר"ח וריב"ם).</i> –<br>And</b> regarding <b>this which</b> ר"ה <b>stated, ‘why did I not say to</b> ר"פ, <b>here it is within sixteen אמה, etc.’</b> How are we to understand this according<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">What connection is there between the rule of sixteen אמות for the nourishment of the tree, since the basis of sר"פ' claim was that it was a מיצר שהחזיקו בו רבים?!</i> to the פר"ח וריב"ם?!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>הכי פירושו כלומר כי קאמר רב יהודה מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים אסור לקלקלו –<br>This is its explanation;</b> ר"ה <b>meant to say, when did ר"י rule</b> that a <b>מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים אסור לקלקלו –<br>הני מילי תוך ט"ז אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">A מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים requires a pathway that is sixteen אמות wide. ר"ה dug outside those sixteen אמות (which may have also been used as a pathway, but he was not obligated to give them such a wide pathway; only up to sixteen אמות).</i> אבל חוץ לט"ז אמה מותר לקלקלו –<br>That is only within sixteen אמות, however outside the sixteen אמות he is permitted to ruin it –<br>כיון שמניח ט"ז אמה כדין רשות הרבים<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">A רה"ר is considered a valid רה"ר (regarding הוצאה בשבת) if it is sixteen אמות wide.</i> –<br>Since he leaves</b> a pathway <b>of sixteen אמות as is required for a רה"ר.</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty on פר"ח וריב"ם that one may be מקלקל a מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים as long as there remains ט"ז אמה:<br><b>ובסוף חזקת הבתים<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where a person (who had the right to build up to the property line with the רה"ר) decided to build his wall not on the property line (which he had the right to), but he recessed the wall and built it on his property some distance away from the רה"ר. Now he wishes to return this wall and rebuild it on the property line with the רה"ר. According to ר"י it is forbidden (since the empty space became a מיצר שהחזיקו בו רבים; people used the space on his property between the wall and the רה"ר), while ר"ל maintains it is permitted since there is רווחא (enough space).</i> (לקמן דף ס,ב) דאסר רבי יוחנן לאדם שכנס תוך שלו להחזיר כתלים במקומן –<br>And in the end of</b> פרק <b>חזקת הבתים where ר"י prohibited a person, who receded into his own</b> property and built a wall there, <b>to return the walls to their place</b> at the border of his property –<br><b>אף על גב דאיכא רווחא כדמשמע<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to כדמשני התם (instead of כדמשמע התם).</i> התם אליבא דריש לקיש<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there explained that ר"ל is not concerned for the ruling of ר"י (see footnote # 13), since ר' יהודה is discussing about destroying the pathway which is prohibited, however here even if he puts back the walls there is still the entire רה"ר (of sixteen אמות), which the people can use. It is apparent from the גמרא that ר' יוחנן prohibits returning the walls even though there is רווחא. The question why is this different from our גמרא where ר"ה claimed that he can dig and ruin the pathway as long as they have ט"ז אמה remaining. </i> הכא איכא רווחא –<br>Even though there is space as (it appears) [the</b> גמרא <b>answers] there according to ר"ל; ‘here there is space’ –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>רווחא דקאמר התם<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read התם היינו שאינו (instead of התם שאינו).</i> שאינו סותם כל רשות הרבים אבל ליכא רווחא ט"ז אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The רה"ר there was not wide ט"ז אמה (for whatever reason).</i> –<br>The רווחא, which</b> ר"ל <b>stated there, means that</b> by returning the wall <b>he will not close up the entire רה"ר,</b> there will still be place to walk, <b>however there is no space of ט"ז אמה –<br>אבל אי איכא רווחא ט"ז אמה –<br>However if there is a width of sixteen אמה</b> in the רה"ר –<br><b>מודה רבי יוחנן דמותר לקלקלו ומחזיר כתלים למקומן כדאמר הכא –<br>ר"י would admit that we can ruin</b> the excess of ט"ז אמה <b>and he can return the walls to their place</b> on the border of the רה"ר <b>as</b> ר"ה <b>stated here.</b><br>In summation; according to the ר"ח וריב"ם, the claim ר"פ had against ר"ה was not based on his rights of his tree, but rather the place where ר"ה was digging was used by the public as a pathway, and so he had no right to ruin their pathway. ר"ה could have responded that even after his digging there still remained a pathway of sixteen אמות, which is sufficient for a public pathway.<br>תוספות asks (a general question, not related the פר"ח וריב"ם).<br><b>ומיהו קשה מאי קאמר רב פפא אמרי ליה מכולהי מאי כולהי –<br>However there is a difficulty; what did ר"פ mean when he said, I asked him from ‘all of these’; what are ‘all of these’?</b> What proof did ר"פ bring against ר"ה?<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ומפרש הרב רבינו מנחם דמכולהי היינו מכל הני דתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">כה,ב.</i> אם האילן קדם לא יקוץ<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> ספק כולי –<br>And ה"ר מנחם explained that 'מכולהי' means from all these which the משנה taught;</b> i.e., ‘<b>if the tree was first, he should not chop it down, and if it is in doubt, etc.</b> he should not chop it down –<br><b>ולא יכלי ליה שהיה דוחה אותו דמיירי באילן עצמו אבל השרשים יקוץ –<br>However, I could not overcome him, for</b> ר"ה <b>deflected</b> those proofs saying that the משנה<b></b> which prevents the chopping <b>is discussing the actual tree, however one may chop off the roots.</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation for the entire סוגיא:<b><br>ורבינו תם מפרש דרב הונא היה קוצץ ולוקח השרשים לעצמו –<br>And the ר"ת explains that ר"ה was cutting the roots and taking</b> them <b>for himself –<br>ואמר ליה רב פפא מאי האי כלומר למה אתה לוקח השרשים לעצמך –<br>So ר"פ said to</b> ר"ה, ‘<b>what is this’; meaning, why are you taking the roots for yourself?</b><br><b>אמר ליה דתנן<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">כו,א.</i> קוצץ ויורד וכיון שבדין אני קוצץ כמו כן יהו העצים שלי –</b><br>ר"ה <b>replied to</b> ר"פ, <b>the משנה taught, ‘he may cut and</b> dig <b>downwards’, so since I may legally cut</b> the roots, <b>similarly the wood</b> of the roots <b>should be mine –<br>ואמרי ליה מכולהי היינו הנהו דמייתי הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"ש who asks, what are these הנהו דמייתי הכא?</i> –<br>So I</b> (ר"פ) <b>said to</b> ר"ה <b>all of these, meaning these that he mentions here –<br>וההיא דמייתי לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">On this עמוד.</i> שרשי אילן הדיוט הבאים כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">The rule is that מדרבנן one may not derive benefit from them, however there is no חיוב מעילה מה"ת if one benefited from them; indicating that the שרשים are not הקדש since they belong to the בעל האילן.</i> –<br>And those</b> proofs, <b>which</b> the גמרא <b>cites later,</b> from a משנה<b></b> i.e. <b>the roots of commoner’s tree which entered, etc.</b> into הקדש property <b>–<br>דמינה מוכח לקמן דהעצים שלו דקתני במתניתין היינו של בעל האילן<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 23.</i> –</b><br><b>Which</b> from that משנה <b>we prove later that when our משנה stated, ‘and the wood</b> of the roots <b>belong to him’,</b> the משנה <b>meant it belongs to the tree owner –<br>ולא יכלי ליה שדחה לו כדדחי ליה לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא later rejected the original proof (in footnote # 23) from the סיפא of that משנה.</i> עד דאמרי ליה מרב יהודה כולי –<br>But</b> nevertheless, <b>I could not convince him, for he deflected</b> this proof <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>deflects it later, until I told him of</b> the ruling <b>of ר"י, etc. –</b><br>תוספות explains what proof is there from the ruling of ר"י:<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ר"ת the argument between ר"פ ור"ה was regarding the ownership of the roots; how is the ruling of ר"י concerning a מיצר שהחזיקו בו רבים relevant to their argument?</i><br><b>דנהי שלא תועיל חזקתי כחזקת רבים לענין שלא תהא רשאי לקוצצו –<br>For granted that the חזקה of</b> ר"פ <b>is not effective as the חזקה of the many, regarding that</b> ר"ה <b>should not be permitted to chop off</b> the roots –<br><b>לענין זה מיהא תועיל שיהו העצים שלי –<br>Nevertheless, regarding</b> the ownership of the roots, the חזקה of ר"פ <b>should be effective that the wood</b> of the roots <b>should belong to</b> ר"פ –<br><b>ומסיק אמאי לא אמרי ליה חוץ לשש עשרה יש להיות העצים שלי –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>concluded</b> that ר"ה said, <b>why did I not tell him</b> (ר"פ) <b>that past sixteen</b> אמות <b>the wood should belong to me –<br>כדאמר רבינא לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">רבינא reconciled that the רישא of that משנה in מעילה (where it seems that the roots belong to the בעל האילן) is when the roots were within sixteen אמות, and the סיפא (where the roots belong to the בעל הקרקע) is where the roots are חוץ לט"ז אמה.</i> כאן תוך שש עשרה כולי:</b><br><b>As רבינא differentiated later, ‘here it is within sixteen</b> אמה, <b>etc.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The claim of ר"פ was based on the fact that it was a מצר שהחזיקו בו רבים (the view of ר"ח וריב"ם) and the sixteen אמות refers to the width of a רה"ר, or (according to the ר"ת) the dispute was regarding the ownership of the roots.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>ה"ר מנחם explained that 'דמכולהו' refers to the משנה on כה,ב regarding אם האילן קדם לא יקוץ.<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 19.</i> However this is seemingly no proof, for perforce we must say that לא יקוץ refers to the tree but not to the roots (as ר"ה actually responded according to ה"ר מנחם), for regarding the roots our משנה (on כו,א) states clearly קוצץ ויורד!<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and נחלת משה .</i>
