<b>אלא הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרות (and רש"י) the גירסא is מידי אריא בגידולין (instead of אלא הכא בגידולין). See in this תוספות.</i> בגידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן—Rather here it is by growths that came afterwards</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a query from ר' יעקב regarding the roots that may be cut down; do they belong to the tree owner or to the land owner. The גמרא cites a משנה which ruled regarding roots that came from a commoner’s field into a הקדש field or roots from a הקדש field to a הדיוט field that in both cases the rule is לא נהנין (מדרבנן) ולא מועלין (מה"ת).<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">From the first case (הדיוט לשל הקדש) we can (seemingly) infer that the שרשים belong to the בעל האילן (therefore לא מועלין), and from the second case (הקדש לשל הדיוט) we can infer that it belongs to the בעל הקרקע. There is a difficulty in resolving the conflicting inferences. The גמרא resolves this conflict by stating אלא הכא וכו' that since it is גידולין there can never be מעילה (but we cannot resolve whether it belongs to the בעל האילן or the בעל הקרקע).</i> The גמרא stated that we cannot resolve our query from this משנה, since the משנה is discussing growth which the tree grew after it became הקדש and this תנא maintains that there is no מעילה by גידולין.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>ויש ספרים דגרסי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is the גירסא in our גמרא and in פרש"י. According to this גירסא after the גמרא refuted the proof of רב חסדא (from the רישא that it belongs to the בעל האילן), by citing the סיפא (which indicates that it belongs to the בעל הקרקע), the same refuter continues to reconcile the רישא and the סיפא of the משנה by stating that we are discussing גידולים. According to both גירסאות there is no proof from the משנה; the difference is only whether there are three statements (רב חסדא, the refuter, and the reconciler), if we גורס אלא, or there are two statements (רב חסדא and the refuter who is also the reconciler), if we are גורס מידי אריא. </i> מידי איריא הא בגידולין וכל זה מדברי המקשה –<br>And there are texts which read, ‘מידי איריא (can anything be derived), here</b> we are discussing <b>growths’, and this is all from the words of the מקשה [the</b> one who <b>refuted]</b> the proof of רב חסדא (by citing the סיפא) –<br><b>כלומר על כרחך לא תוכל לפשוט מכאן דבגידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן איירי –<br>Meaning to say, perforce you cannot resolve</b> the query of ר' יעקב <b>from here, since</b> the משנה <b>is discussing growths that came afterwards.</b><br>תוספות now explains the reconciliation of the רישא with the סיפא:<br><b>ואי בתר אילן אזלינן רישא אשמועינן דאין נהנין<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">There is no חידוש in the רישא that אין מועלין, since we now assume בתר אילן אזלינן and the אילן was של הדיוט.</i> וסיפא אשמועינן דאין מועלין<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">There is not such a חידוש in the סיפא that אין נהנין, since we now assume בתר אילן and the אילן is של הקדש.</i> –<br>For if we assume that we follow the tree</b> (meaning that the roots belong to the בעל האילן); <b>the רישא</b> (where it was an אילן של הדיוט לשל הקדש) <b>informs us</b> that even though the שרשים are חולין (for בתר אילן אזלינן), nevertheless <b>we are not permitted to derive benefit</b> (מדרבנן), <b>and the סיפא</b> (where it was של הקדש לשל הדיוט) <b>informs us</b> that even though בתר אילן אזלינן (which is הקדש), nevertheless <b>there is no מעילה</b> (מה"ת), since אין מעילה בגידולין –<br><b>ואי בתר קרקע אזלינן רישא אשמועינן דאין מועלין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">There is no חידוש in the רישא that אין נהנין since בתר קרקע אזלינן and the קרקע is הקדש.</i> וסיפא דאין נהנין בגידולין<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">There is no חידוש in the סיפא that אין מועלין, since בתר קרקע אזלינן and the and the קרקע is הדיוט.</i> –<br>And if we follow the ground, the רישא</b> (של הדיוט) <b>informs us that</b> even though it is in a הקדש field, nevertheless <b>אין מועלין,</b> since אין מעילה בגידולין, <b>and the סיפא</b> (של הקדש) <b>teaches us</b> that even though it is בשל הדיוט, nevertheless <b>אין נהנין בגידולין</b> (מדרבנן).<br>תוספות asks:<b><br>ואם תאמר ההיא בבא דאשמועינן דאין מעילה בגידולין<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This can be either the סיפא (of של הקדש לתוך של הדיוט) if we assume בתר אילן אזלינן, or the רישא (of של הדיוט לתוך של הקדש) if we assume בתר קרקע אזלינן. Either of these two clauses teach us respectively that אין מעילה בגידולין.</i> –<br>And if you will say; that clause which informs us that אין מעילה בגידולין;</b> why does the משנה teach it to us in a case of הדיוט לתוך הקדש or הקדש לתוך הדיוט <b>–<br>לשמעינן של הקדש הבאין בשל הקדש דהוי רבותא טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Either in the רישא or the סיפא (depending on whether we maintain בתר אילן or בתר קרקע) where the חידוש was אין מועלין, the משנה should have substituted that clause (הדיוט לתוך הקדש or הקדש לתוך הדיוט) with the clause of הקדש לתוך הקדש (לא נהנין) ולא מועלין. It is obviously a greater חידוש that even הקדש לתוך הקדש (where there is no הדיוט at all, and nevertheless) the rule is אין מועלין.</i> –</b><br>The משנה <b>should teach it to us</b> in a case of <b>של הקדש הבאין בשל הקדש, which will be a greater novelty,</b> that even in this case, there is no מעילה <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דנקט הכי משום אידך בבא דאשמועינן דאין נהנין –<br>And one can say that he presents it in this</b> manner (הדיוט לתוך הקדש or הקדש לתוך הדיוט) <b>for the other clause which teaches us that אין נהנין –<br>דהוי רבותא טפי שאין הכל של הקדש<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">To clarify; let us assume that בתר אילן אזלינן, therefore the חידוש of אין מועלין is in the סיפא (where it is הקדש לתוך הדיוט). תוספות question was that instead of saying הקדש לתוך הדיוט there is no מעילה, say rather that even הקדש לתוך הקדש there is no מעילה. The answer is that even though it would be a greater חידוש regarding אין מועלין, however it would be a lesser חידוש regarding אין נהנין as opposed to הקדש לתוך הדיוט. Therefore, the משנה chose the case of הקדש לתוך הדיוט לא נהנין ולא מועלין to emphasize the חידוש of אין נהנין (even though it minimizes the חידוש of אין מועלין). Alternately, since in the רישא it needed to state הדיוט לתוך הקדש to teach the חידוש of אין נהנין, therefore in the סיפא he also teaches הקדש and הדיוט. [However, this same answer is given later by the שיטת הר"ח and there (see footnote # 15) תוספות expresses it clearly that he wants to write the סיפא דומיא דרישא; וצ"ע.]</i> –<br>Which is a greater novelty when not everything is הקדש,</b> but rather one is הקדש and the other is הדיוט.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation of the גמרא:<br><b>ורבינו חננאל לא גריס אלא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The word 'אלא' indicates that we are completely rejecting the initial proof of רב חסדא that בתר אילן אזלינן.</i> והמתרץ<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The מתרץ is the one who is reinstituting the resolution of רב חסדא from the רישא that בתר אילן אזלינן, and the מתרץ is answering the question posed by the מקשן who asked from the סיפא where it appears that בתר קרקע אזלינן.</i> הוא דקאמר הכי דמוקי סיפא דאין מעילה בגידולין –<br>And the ר"ח is not גורס</b> the word '<b>אלא', rather</b> it is the <b>מתרץ who is saying this, for he is establishing the סיפא</b> which states <b>that there is no מעילה,</b> so the תרצן explains that the סיפא (only<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">In the רישא where it was של הדיוט the concept of גידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן doesn’t apply that easily (except perhaps by the שרשים [see later footnote # 16]) since it is an אילן של הדיוט; however, in the סיפא where it is של הקדש, it is fitting to establish it by גידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן (after the tree was הקדש, the שרשים extended to the הדיוט field) and therefore אין מועלין. See ‘Thinking it over’</i>) is <b>in</b> a case of <b>גידולין,</b> which grew after he was מקדיש the tree <b>–</b><br>תוספות an¬ticipates a difficulty according to the פר"ח:<br><b>והא דלא נקט דשל הקדש בשל הקדש<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות cannot offer the same answer which he said previously (see footnote # 10), since according to the ר"ח we maintain that בתר אילן אזלינן, so therefore the חידוש of אין נהנין is practically the same whether הקדש לתוך הדיוט or הקדש לתוך הקדש, the real חידוש of the סיפא is that אין מועלין and that would seemingly be greater by הקדש לתוך הקדש. ועצ"ע.</i> –<br>And</b> the reason the משנה <b>did not present</b> the סיפא in a case of <b>הקדש בשל הקדש,</b> instead of הקדש לתוך הדיוט –<b></b><br>תוספות replies that the משנה would rather teach הקדש לתוך הדיוט:<br><b>משום דבעי למינקט דומיא דרישא<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">In the רישא it was necessary to teach הדיוט לתוך הקדש, since the משנה intends to teach us that בתר אילן אזלינן, and we would not know that if it would have stated הקדש לתוך הקדש. Once the רישא was ‘split’ to הקדש והדיוט, the משנה decided for the sake of symmetry that in the סיפא it should also be one of הקדש and one of הדיוט, even though the חידוש is less. </i> דאין הכל דהקדש אלא חד דהקדש וחד דהדיוט –<br>Since</b> the משנה <b>wishes to present</b> the סיפא in a case which is <b>similar to the רישא, where not everything is הקדש, but rather one is הקדש and one is הדיוט –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The ר"ח assumes that the רישא is teaching us that בתר אילן אזלינן and the סיפא (only) is in a case of גידולין (this means that he was first מקדיש the tree and later the שרשים entered a שדה הדיוט). Perhaps we should learn the משנה in the opposite manner. The סיפא is teaching us that בתר קרקע אזלינן (which means that when he was מקדיש the tree the roots were already in the שדה הדיוט) and nevertheless אין מועלין, since בתר קרקע אזלינן (and it is קרקע של הדיוט), and the רישא is discussing a case of גידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן (it is a case where the roots entered the שדה הקדש after the field was הוקדש), so even though בתר קרקע אזלינן (and the roots are now in קרקע הקדש, nevertheless אין מועלין since אין מעילה בגידולין. Our תוספות explains why we cannot learn this way.</i><br><b>אבל אי בתר קרקע אזלינן ורישא אשמועינן דאין מעילה בגידולין<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 16.</i> –<br>However, if</b> we would derive from the סיפא that <b>בתר קרקע אזלינן and the רישא teaches us that אין מעילה בגידולין,</b> in that case the difficulty will be –<br><b>ליתני רישא של הקדש בשל הקדש –<br>Let the רישא state של הקדש בשל הקדש,</b> for this is the greater חידוש, for even though בתר קרקע אזלינן and the initial tree as well as the roots are all בשל הקדש, nevertheless there is no מעילה since אין מעילה בגידולין, why does the משנה give a case of הדיוט לשל הקדש, where the חידוש is minimal?<br>תוספות explains that on this question we cannot give the same answer as previously:<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15.</i><br><b>דאין מיושב כל כך לומר תנא רישא אגב סיפא כמו<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">It is more reasonable to say that we adjust the סיפא to fit with the רישא, than it is to say that we adjust the רישא to fit with the סיפא. Therefore, the ר"ח is correct in saying that the רישא teaches us בתר אילן אזלינן and the סיפא teaches us that אין מעילה בגידולין, and the reason the סיפא does not state הקדש לתוך הקדש (which is a greater חידוש) is because תנא סיפא אגב רישא.</i> תנא סיפא אגב רישא:</b><br><b>For it is not that satisfactory to say that</b> the משנה <b>taught in the רישא</b> הדיוט לתוך) הקדש) <b>on account of the סיפא</b> (where it states הקדש לתוך הדיוט), <b>as it</b> (more proper to say) <b>that he taught in the סיפא</b> (הקדש לתוך הדיוט) <b>on account of the רישא</b> (הדיוט לתוך הקדש).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We do not resolve the query; however, we do resolve the apparent contradiction between the רישא and the סיפא according to both sides of the query; if בתר אילן אזלינן the רישא teaches אין נהנין and the סיפא teaches אין מעילה בגידולין and the opposite applies if we maintain בתר קרקע אזלינן. The ר"ח maintains that the query is resolved and the סיפא only, is discussing גידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we explain according to the ר"ח that only the סיפא is in a case of גידולין הבאין לאחר מכאן, but not the רישא;<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> how is it that the cases in the משנה are not addressing the same situation?!

Line 7

<b>רבינא אמר לא קשיא כאן תוך ט"ז כולי—<i>Rahveenoh</i> said, there is no difficulty; here it is within sixteen, etc.</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה אלא.</i><br>רבינא reconciles the רישא (which indicates thar we follow the tree) and the סיפא (which indicates that we follow the ground), that one is where the roots are within sixteen אמות from the tree and the other is where the roots are beyond sixteen אמות from the tree. תוספות explains and discusses this answer<br>---------------------------------<br><b>רישא בתוך ט"ז אמה דבתר אילן אזלינן<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, the rule is אין מועלין since the tree is של הדיוט, but nevertheless מדרבנן the rule is לא נהנין since the roots entered לתוך הקדש.</i> וסיפא חוץ לט"ז אמה דבתר קרקע אזלינן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The roots are בשל הדיוט and since they are more than sixteen אמות from the tree we are אזלינן בתר קרקע and there is no מעילה, however מדרבנן since the tree is של הקדש, therefore אין נהנין.</i> –<br>The רישא (</b>which is discussing של הדיוט בתוך של הקדש) is in a case where the roots <b>are within sixteen אמות</b> of the tree, <b>so</b> in that case we <b>follow the tree, and the סיפא</b> (which is discussing של הקדש לתוך של הדיוט) is where the roots are <b>outside the sixteen אמות</b> of the tree, <b>so</b> therefore <b>we follow the land –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר וליתני אידי ואידי תוך ט"ז<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In this case we say בתר אילן אזלינן, therefore the ruling of the רישא (which is הדיוט לתוך הקדש) remains as is that לא נהנין ולא מועלין (see footnote # 2).</i> וליתני סיפא מועלין<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The roots are within sixteen אמות where בתר אילן אזלינן, therefore there is מעילה even though the roots are בשל הדיוט.</i> –<br>And if you will say, but let the משנה teach both cases</b> (הדיוט לתוך הקדש and הקדש לתוך הדיוט) where the roots are <b>within sixteen אמות of the tree, and in the סיפא</b> the rule will be that <b>מועלין –<br>אי נמי אידי ואידי אחר ט"ז וליתני ברישא מועלין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage in either of these two scenarios is that both the רישא and the סיפא are discussing the same case (either תוך ט"ז אמה or חוץ לט"ז אמה). However according to the way רבינא explained it, there is the difficulty that the רישא and the סיפא are discussing two different cases, which is highly unusual.</i> –<br>Or</b> the משנה could <b>also</b> choose the other option that both cases are <b>outside the sixteen אמות</b> (where בתר קרקע אזלינן) <b>and the ruling in the רישא</b> (of הדיוט לתוך הקדש) will be <b>מועלין</b> since the roots entered לתוך הקדש <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דתנא הכי לאשמועינן דבתרוייהו בין בתוך ט"ז אמה בין חוץ לט"ז אמה –<br>And one can say, that the משנה taught it in this</b> manner <b>to inform us that by both of them</b> (whether הדיוט לתוך הקדש or הקדש לתוך הדיוט), <b>whether it is within the sixteen אמות or outside the sixteen אמות</b> the rule always is –<br><b>לא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות obviously does not mean that in all cases (whether הדיוט לתוך הקדש or whether הקדש לתוך הדיוט) whether it is תוך ט"ז or חוץ לט"ז there is לא נהנין ולא מועלין, for that is obviously not true; rather תוספות means that there are certain cases both by הדיוט לתוך הקדש and הקדש לתוך הדיוט (depending on whether it is תוך ט"ז or חוץ לט"ז) that the rule is לא נהנין ואין מועלין, as explained in the beginning of this תוספות (see footnote # 2 & 3).</i> נהנין ולא מועלין:<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Had the משנה just stated the case of אידי ואידי בתוך ט"ז אמה, we would not know that חוץ לט"ז אמה by הקדש לתוך הדיוט the rule is לא נהנין ולא מועלין (we may have thought that נהנין). Similarly, if the משנה stated the case of חוץ לט"ז אמה, we would not know that בתוך ט"ז אמה the rule is אין נהנין ולא מועלין by הדיוט לתוך תקדש (we may have though that נהנין).</i></b><br><b>You may not derive benefit, however there is no</b> חיוב <b>מעילה.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Within ט"ז אמה we go בתר אילן (and nevertheless by הדיוט לתוך הקדש לא נהנין) and לא מועלין, and חוץ לט"ז we go בתר קרקע (and nevertheless by הקדש לתוך הדיוט לא נהנין), which we would not have known if both cases were either תוך ט"ז or חוץ לט"ז.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות explained that if both cases would be either תוך ט"ז or חוץ לט"ז we would not know what the rule would be in the other cases (חוץ לט"ז or תוך ט"ז respectively); we might think that נהנין.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> However how is it better now that the רישא and סיפא are discussing תוך ט"ז and חוץ לט"ז respectively, there is still the problem that we do not know what the rules would be in the other cases (where הדיוט לתוך הקדש is חוץ לט"ז, and הקדש לתוך הדיוט is תוך ט"ז) where the rule should be מועלין; how do we know that?! Why is one choice better than the other?!

Line 8

<b>גזלן הוא ואין מביאין ממנו בכורים—He is a robber and we do not bring<i> Beekurim </i>from it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>עולא stated that whoever owns a tree which is growing within sixteen אמות of a neighbors field, is considered a robber,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה גזלן that the owner is considered a גזלן because his tree is receiving nourishment from his neighbor’s field.</i> and we do not bring ביכורים from that tree. תוספות offers two interpretations for this ruling.<br>----------------------------<br><b>פירוש רבינו חננאל משום דאין מביאין גזל<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The fruits of this tree are considered גזל because they grew and were nourished by his neighbor’s property without his consent.</i> על גבי המזבח –<br>The ר"ח explained</b> the reason we do not bring ביכורים from this tree is <b>because we do not offer</b> anything which is <b>stolen,</b> to be brought <b>on top of the מזבח –<br>שנאמר אני ה' שונא גזל בעולה (ישעיה סא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק ח'.</i>) וכתיב והבאתם גזול וגומר (מלאכי א<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק יג. The פסוק concludes, הַאֶרְצֶה אוֹתָהּ מִיֶּדְכֶם אָמַר ה'.</i>) –<br>As it says; ‘I, ה', hate a</b> קרבן <b>עולה</b> which is <b>stolen’, and it is written, ‘and you bring</b> that which is <b>stolen’, etc. –<br>ולית לן דעולא דהא בהדיא פסקינן כרבי יוסי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">כה,ב. The גמרא there states אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל הלכה כר' יוסי. A person may plant his tree on his property wherever he chooses, even if it is close to his neighbor’s field; therefore, he is not considered a גזלן, and may bring ביכורים.</i> דאמר זה נוטע בתוך שלו כולי –<br>However, we do not accept</b> this ruling <b>of</b> <b>עולא, for we explicitly rule like ר"י, who maintains, ‘this one plants within his</b> property’, <b>etc.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר לפירושו עולא כמאן סבר –<br>And if you will say; according to the explanation of the</b> ר"ח<b>, whose</b> ruling does <b>עלא follow;</b> he cannot follow ר"י as we just explained –<br><b>דכרבנן נמי לא הוי דרבנן לא בעו הרחקה אלא ד' אמות<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See our משנה on כו,א.</i> ולעולא שש עשרה אמה –<br>For he is also not in accord with the רבנן, since the רבנן require a distancing of only four אמות and עולא</b> requires <b>sixteen אמות!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דעולא הוי מוקי מתניתין בצונמא –<br>And one can say that עולא will establish our משנה</b> (which requires only four אמות distancing) <b>by a rock</b> (between the properties) –<br><b>כדמוקי לה בריש פירקין<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">יח,א.</i> ולהכי לא בעי אלא ד' אמות –<br>Just as we established</b> this משנה by a צונמא <b>in the beginning of our פרק, so therefore only four אמות are required,</b> since there is no nourishment from the neighbor’s field (the rock prevents it), however by regular fields one would be required (according to עולא) to distance his trees sixteen אמות from his neighbor’s field.<br>תוספות asks on the פר"ח:<br><b>ומיהו קשיא לרבי יצחק דפריך לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">כז,א.</i> לעולא מהקונה אילן וקרקעו מביא וקורא –<br>However, the ר"י has a difficulty</b> with the פר"ח, <b>for later the</b> גמרא <b>challenges עולא from</b> a משנה which states, <b>one who buys a tree with its land, he brings</b> ביכורים <b>and reads</b> the פרשה of ביכורים, the גמרא continues –<br><b>מאי לאו כל שהוא –</b><br><b>Is it not so</b> that this rule of מביא וקורא applies even if he bought <b>a miniscule</b> amount of land; this would contradict the ruling of עולא that a tree requires sixteen אמות of land. This concludes the citation from the גמרא. תוספות continues with his question on the פר"ח,<br><b>ומאי קושיא שאני התם שקנאו ולא הוה גזלן<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">It is obvious that when he bought the tree it was understood that he has the rights of his tree being nourished by the surrounding land (even though he does not own it), so there is no issue of גזילה therefore he is מביא וקורא. What is the question on עולא according to the פר"ח?!</i> –<br>but what is</b> the sגמרא' question on עולא, <b>there it is different for he bought the tree so he is not a גזלן –</b><br>תוספות prefers רש"י interpretation:<br><b>ונראה כפירוש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ואין.</i> דאף על גב דמותר לסמוך אין מביאין ממנו בכורים –<br>And it would appear like sרש"י' interpretation, that even though it is permitted</b> to plant a tree <b>close</b> to the neighbor’s boundary, nevertheless one <b>cannot bring ביכורים from</b> such a tree (even though he is not a גזלן) –<br><b>דבעינן אשר תביא מארצך<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The פסוק in דברים (תבוא) כו,ב regarding הבאת ביכורים reads אשר תביא מארצך meaning that the fruit must grow and be nourished from your land; however in this case it is growing from the nourishment it received from the neighbor’s land. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>Since we require,</b> regarding מצות ביכורים, that it be, as the פסוק states <b>אשר תביא מארצך (which you will bring from your land)<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">According to פרש"י the sגמרא' question (see footnote # 9) on עולא is understood, for even though he bought the tree and it is understood that his tree may receive nourishment from his neighbor, nevertheless it is not his land!</i> –</b><br>תוספות clarifies a possible misunderstanding:<br><b>ולקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">כז,ב.</i> דאמר אילן הסמוך מביא וקורא<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא disagrees with the ruling of עולא and maintains that one brings ביכורים וקורא even from a tree which is סמוך למיצר.</i> שעל מנת כן הנחיל יהושע את הארץ –<br>And later where</b> the גמרא <b>states, ‘a tree which is close</b> to the boundary, <b>one may bring</b> ביכורים <b>and read</b> the פרשת ביכורים, <b>for it was with this stipulation that יהושע granted the land’</b> of א"י to the בנ"י –<br><b>לא קאמר שעל מנת כן הנחיל שיהא מותר לסמוך דבלאו הכי שרי –<br>It does not mean that he granted</b> the land <b>with this stipulation that it is permitted</b> to plant <b>close</b> to the border, <b>for</b> even <b>without this</b> stipulation of יהושע <b>it is permitted</b> לסמוך (since the הלכה is like ר' יוסי) –<br><b>אלא על מנת כן הנחיל שיהא חשוב כמו מארצך ויכול לומר<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends tis to read לומר מן האדמה אשר (instead of לומר אשר).</i> אשר נתת לי:</b><br><b>Rather</b> the גמרא meant to say that <b>it is with this stipulation that</b> יהושע <b>granted</b> the בנ"י the land <b>that</b> when a tree is planted near the border, the fruit growing on these trees <b>should be considered just like</b> they grew <b>from your land, so he will be able to proclaim ‘[from the land] which You</b> (ה') <b>gave me’.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>עולא maintains (according to פר"ח) that one is not permitted to be סומך within sixteen אמות therefore if was סומך he is a גזלן and cannot bring ביכורים. While רש"י explains that even though it is מותר לסמוך, nevertheless he cannot bring ביכורים (according to עולא), since it is not מארצך.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to פרש"י that one is מותר לסמוך and the issue here is 'מארצך';<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> why did עולא say, 'גזלן הוא';<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> why is he a גזלן if it is מותר לסמוך?!<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

Line 9

<b>עשר נטיעות המפוזרות כולי—Ten saplings which are spread out, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites a משנה that if there are ten saplings planted in a בית סאה (equidistant from each other),<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A בית סאה is a square which is fifty אמות by fifty אמות (or any area of 2500 square אמות). This means that each sapling has an area of 250 square אמות around it.</i> one may plow it on the year before שמיטה right up to before ר"ה of שמיטה.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Normally one must refrain from plowing the tree a month before ר"ה, however by saplings it is permitted.</i> Our תוספות clarifies some of the rulings regarding עשר נטיעות.<br>----------------------------<br><b>בסוכה (דף לד,א) אמר עשר נטיעות וערבה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In the ביהמ"ק they would bring one ערבה besides the ערבות that are together with the לולב.</i> וניסוך המים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This refers to the pouring of water on the מזבח during סוכות in addition to the usual pouring of the wine by the קרבן תמיד.</i> הלכה למשה מסיני –<br>In</b> מסכת <b>סוכה,</b> the גמרא <b>states that the rules of עשר נטיעות, ערבה and the pouring of the water, are</b> derived from a <b>הלכה למשה מסיני –<br>ודוקא עשר לתוך בית סאה אבל פחות אין צריכין חרישה כל כך<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Since they have more space to nourish from, they do not require that much plowing, so we do not plow the entire בית סאה, only how much the saplings need (which is underneath the tree and around the tree כמלא אורה וסלו).</i> –<br>And it is specifically ten</b> נטיעות <b>in a בית סאה</b> where one may plow up to ר"ה, <b>however if it is less</b> than ten, <b>the</b> saplings <b>do not require that much plowing –<br>וכן נמי אם היו בבית סאה יותר מעשר נטיעות אין חורשין לפי שעומדין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">There is not sufficient land to support more than ten נטיעות, therefore some of the plantings will need to be uprooted (and we are not sure which ones, therefore we cannot plow this (entire) בית סאה).  </i> ליעקר:</b><br><b>And the same is also</b> true <b>if there were more than ten saplings</b> <b>in a בית סאה, we do not plow them</b> up to ר"ה, <b>since</b> some of them <b>are destined to be uprooted.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The rule of עשר נטיעות (as well as ערבה וניסוך המים) is a הלל"מ. It is applicable only if there are exactly ten saplings for a בית סאה, no more and no less.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the ruling if there are five saplings in half a בית סאה, are we permitted to plow the entire half בית סאה?

<b>כמה מרובע יתר על העיגול רביע—How much is a square larger than a circle; a fourth</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>If a circle is inscribed within a square, the area of the square will be a fourth larger than the area of the circle.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This would mean if the area of a square (4x4) is sixteen, the area of a circle (with a diameter of 4) will be twelve; a fourth less than the square. This holds true if we assume (as the גמרא does) the value for pi to be 3.  [𝐴=𝜋<br>𝑟<br>2<br>] Pi is the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter. According to pi = 3 if the diameter of a circle is one, the circumference is three.</i><br>--------------------------------<br><b>הכי איתא בברייתא דמסכת מדות וכן בעירובין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">יד,ב וש"נ. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i>:</b><br><b>This</b> ratio <b>is cited in a ברייתא in מסכת מדות and so too in</b> מסכת <b>עירובין.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>This ratio is cited elsewhere in the גמרא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>There is a משנה in מס' אהלות פי"ב מ"ו which states that שהמרובע יותר על העגול רביע. Why did not תוספות cite this משנה, rather than citing a ברייתא and a גמרא?!
<b>הכי גרס רבינו תם פש להו תרי תילתא אמתא—This is how <i>Rabainu Tahm</i><br>reads</b> the text; <b>‘there still remains two-thirds of an <i>Ahmoh</i>’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>עולא maintains that a tree is יונק from an circular area with a radius of 16 אמות around the tree. This is an area of 768 square אמות.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא reaches this conclusion by first squaring the area (which is 32 x 32 אמות [twice the radius of 16[) which is 1024 square אמות. We then reduce the area of a circle from the area of a square by ¼ (which is 256); subtract that from 1024 it equals 768. Using the equation of 𝐴=𝜋<br>𝑟<br>2<br> (where 𝜋=3 as the גמרא assumes), we achieve the same result; 3 x 16 x 16 = 768. [A is the area of the circle; 𝜋 is the symbol for pi which is the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter. This is not an exact number; the גמרא assumes it to be 3, and r refers to the radius of the circle.]</i> From the משנה on כו,ב regarding three trees in a בית סאה (which is 2500 square אמות) it turns out that each tree is יונק an area of 833 and 1/3 square אמות. We have here a discrepancy of 65 and 1/3 square אמות, which עולא is less than the משנה. In order to make the measurement of עולא (nearly) equal to the משנה, we will need to increase the radius to somewhat more than 16. The גירסא in our גמרא is that we are missing one-half אמה (meaning that the radius should be 16.5 אמות), while according to the ר"ת it should be increased 2/3 of an אמה to 16 and 2/3).<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Using the same formula as in footnote # 1 if r = 16.5 (as in our גירסא) the area will be 816.75 (still a difference of 16.58 sq. אמות approximately, from the משנה); if, however, r = 16.66... (as the ר"ת would have it) the area would be 833.33; virtually the same as the משנה. This is why the ר"ת prefers his גירסא. However, it seems that they did not use this formula (in footnote # 1) in those days, therefore it was necessary for תוספות to use other methods to achieve his goal of finding the right amount that the radius needs to be increased, in order to match עולא with the משנה.</i><br>-------------------------------------<br><b>פירוש כשתקיף אילן דעולא רצועה רחבה שני שלישי אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means literally that if you will add a strip of land 2/3 of an אמה outside the circumference of the circle which has a radius of sixteen אמות from the tree (making the new radius 16 2/3 אמות).</i> –<br>The explanation of</b> פש להו תרי תילתא אמתא (we are missing 2/3 of an אמה) is that <b>when you will surround the tree of עולא</b> (which has a radius of 16 אמה) <b>with a strip</b> of land which is <b>2/3 of an אמה wide,</b> meaning that the radius will now be 16 and 2/3 אמה, this new area of יניקה –<br><b>יהא גדול כאילן המשנה שהיה יותר ס"ה אמות ושליש ברוחב אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ and in the גמרא.</i> –<br>Will be as large as the tree of the משנה whose</b> area <b>was larger by 65 and 1/3 אמה</b><br><b>with a width of an אמה</b> (meaning 65 and 1/3 sq. אמות) –<b></b><br>תוספות will now show how adding the additional 2/3 אמות, will make sעולא' tree יונק from the same area as the משנה tree:<br><b>שהרי אם תקיף ל"ב על ל"ב מרובעים<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">We begin by assuming that the sixteen אמה radius (which is 32 אמה diameter) is a square of 32 אמות (on each side) instead of a circle with a 32 אמה diameter. The way the גמרא calculates the area of a circle is by first assuming a square with the same size as the diameter of the circle, then after calculating the area of the square, they would reduce it by ¼ and that would give the area of a circle, so that a circle inscribed in a square 2x2 which has an area of 4 (2x2 =4), the circle (which has a radius of 1), will have an area of 3, a fourth less than the square.  </i> יצטרך קכ"ח<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The perimeter of a 32x32 square is 128 (32x4=128). However, we need to add the strip to each of the four corners; each corner will require a strip of 2/3x2/3 אמה to complete adding 2/3 of an אמה to the entire square.</i> ולד' קרנות ח' שלישים<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">8/3 = 2 and 2/3.  </i> –<br>For if you will</b> surround a <b>square of 32 by 32</b> with a strip of 2/3 אמה width, <b>it will require</b> a strip of 128 אמה long and <b>for the four corners</b> an additional <b>8/3</b> אמה –<br><b>הרי ק"ל ושני שלישים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">128 + 8/3 or 128 + 2 and 2/3 = 130 and 2/3.</i> אורך על שני שלישים רוחב –<br>So</b> now we have a strip of <b>130 and 2/3</b> אמות <b>long by 2/3</b> אמה <b>wide</b>; this is the extra area added on by adding 2/3 אמה around the entire square. However, this is by a square, but we are dealing with a circle, therefore –<br><b>תחסר הרביע<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">130.66.. x .75 = 97.99995 or actually 98. We are using only whole numbers. Alternately 130.66/4= 32.665; 130.66-32.665=98.</i> שהעיגול פחות ישאר צ"ח –<br>Diminish</b> this amount <b>by a fourth, which is</b> the amount the area of a <b>circle is less</b> than a square (who share the same diameter) <b>there will remain</b> a strip of <b>98</b> by 2/3 אמה; we now have the area we have added to עולא, by adding the strip of 2/3 אמה, namely 98 x2/3 אמה. This will equal the 65 1/3 אמה which the משנה was greater than עולא, as תוספות will now show –<br><b>וכן ס"ה אמה ושליש תחתוך לג' חלקים לאורך תהיה רצועה אחת של קצ"ו<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">65 1/3 x 3 = 196 [65x3=195, and 1/3x 3=1; in total 196].</i> ברוחב שליש –<br>And similarly, the 65 and 1/3 אמה</b> (which is the amount the area of the משנה was greater than the original area of עולא), take this strip <b>and cut it in the length into three</b> equal parts and put them next to each other in length, <b>you will have one strip of 196 אמה</b> long <b>by 1/3</b> אמה wide –<br><b>תחתוך לשנים ותשים זה בצד זה תהיה רצועה ארכה צ"ח על רוחב שני שלישי<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The long strip was 1/3 אמה wide when they are joined in the width it is 2/3 אמה wide.</i> אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">This area 98x2/3 is exactly the same as the area of עולא if we add a strip of 2/3 אמה.</i> –<br>Cut</b> this long strip of 196 אמה <b>into two</b> equal parts (each one 98 אמה) <b>there will be a strip of 98 אמה long by a width of 2/3 אמה.</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate method to reconcile the אילן דעולא with the אילן דמשנה:<br><b>עוד מצא רבינו יצחק בספר<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read בספר אחד מפורש בגליון הספר (instead of בספר אחר מפורש בגמרת הספר).</i> אחר מפורש בגמרת הספר להקיף בחוטים<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage of this explanation over the previous one is that practically one cannot take a strip which is a rectangle 2/3 אמה wide and place it around a circle since the circle is round and a strip is straight; however, with thin threads one can imagine circling the circle with the threads.</i> אילן דעולא –<br>Additionally, the ר"י found in another ספר, expressed in the margin of the ספר, to surround, with threads, the</b> outside circumference of the <b>עולא tree –<br>שהוא ל"ב על ל"ב עד שיהא<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שיהא רוחב החוט(ין) שני (instead of שיהא שני).</i> שני שלישי אמה סביב<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The עולא tree has a diameter of 32 אמה. Mark off the circumference of this diameter, and start encircling this circumference (beginning immediately next to the edge of the circumference) with many threads next to each other, until the width from the most outside thread to the edge of the circumference is 2/3 אמה.</i> –<br>Which has a diameter of 32 by 32,</b> there should be sufficient threads <b>until the [width of</b> these <b>threads] will be 2/3 of an אמה</b> wide <b>around</b> the entire circumference –<br><b>תחתוך החוטין ותפשטם יהיה העליון ארכו ק' שהוא מקיף ל"ג ושליש<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The outer thread was 2/3 אמה beyond the circumference (see footnote # 16), this addition is on both (all) sides of the circle; the new diameter (the diameter of this thread is) is an additional (2 x 2/3 or) 1 and 1/3 אמה, making the total diameter 33 and 1/3. [32 + 1 and 1/3 = 33 1/3].  </i> –<br>Cut the threads and stretch them out</b> in a straight line, the <b>upper</b> (outside) thread <b>will be 100</b> אמה <b>long since it encircles a</b> diameter of <b>33 and 1/3 –<br>וכל שיש ברחבו טפח יש בהיקפו ג'<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">This is the number used for pi in the גמרא in the formula C = pi x diameter. Therefore since the diameter is 33 and 1/3, so 3 x 33 and 1/3 = 100. [the current number for pi is 3.1415…]</i> –<br>And</b> the rule is <b>that if the diameter is a טפח, the circumference is three</b> טפחים –<br><b>והתחתון צ"ו שהוא מקיף ל"ב<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">32 x 3 = 96.</i> הרי<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read הרי אורך התחתון (instead of הרי התחתון). </i> התחתון פחות מן העליון מכל צד ב' אמות<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">It is 4 אמות less (100-96=4). If we line up the threads by their center, we can view the closest (shortest) thread as 2 אמות less on each side than the outside (longest) thread. </i> –<br>And the lower (inner)</b> thread is <b>96</b> אמות long, <b>since it surrounds</b> the actual diameter of <b>32, so the [length] of the inner</b> thread is <b>less than the outer</b> thread <b>2 אמות on each side –<br>ותחתוך העודף מצד אחד ותמלא צד אחד<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ש amends this to read אחר (instead of אחד).</i> האורך לצד הקצר<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that there are five threads ranging in length (from the inside out) at 96,97,98,99,100. When they are lying straight the 100 thread is two אמות longer on each end than the 96 thread and one אמה longer than the 98 thread, (1/2 from the 99 thread and 1½ from the 97 thread). When we cut the five threads at one end, there are two אמות from the 100 thread and 1 אמה from the 98 thread (1/2 and 1 ½ from the 97 and 99 threads respectively). We then take these threads flip them and place them on the other side The longer cut piece to the shorter thread, so that the 2 אמות from the 100 thread goes on the 96 thread making it 98 and the one אמה from the 98 thread (which now became a 97 thread) goes on the original 98 thread and it remains 98, etc.; in short all 5 threads become 98 אמה threads.</i> תהיה רצועה צ"ח<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">98 by 2/3 = 65 1/3 x 1 אמה. [ 98x2=196; 196/3 = 65 and 1/3] <br></i> –<br>And cut off the extra</b> threads that protrude from <b>one side</b> of the outer threads, <b>and fill in the other side, the long next to the short so you will have a strip of 98 אמה</b> by 2/3 אמה<br><b>וכן הוא ס"ה ושליש –</b><br><b>Which is the same as 65 and 1/3</b> by one אמה –<br>Another way of equalizing אילן דעולא with the אילן דמשנה:<br><b>דרך אחרת ל"ג ושליש על ל"ג ושליש<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">We are aiding 2/3 אמה to the length and width of the original 32x32. This comes to 33 1/3. </i> מרובעים עולה –<br>Another way; 33 and 1/3 by 33 and 1/3 squared, equals –<br>אלף ומאה וי"א אמות ושליש של שליש שהיא תשיעית אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">33 1/3 x 33 1/3 = 100/3 x 100/3 = 10,000/3 = 1111 1/9.</i> –<br>Eleven hundred eleven</b> sq. <b>אמות plus a third of a third which is a ninth of an אמה –<br>תחסר הרביעית ישאר תתל"ג ושליש<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">1111.11x.75=833.33.</i> הרי אילן המשנה ל"ג ושליש על ל"ג ושליש –<br>Subtract a fourth</b> (since we are discussing a circle) <b>the remainder is 833 and 1/3</b> אמה<b>, which is the</b> equivalent of the <b>משנה tree, which is 33 and 1/3 by 33 and 1/3.</b><br>Another calculation:<br><b>(הג"ה. או כעין זה שליש סאה<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">In the משנה there are three trees in a בית סאה, which is 50x50 אמה.</i> הוי י"ו וב' שלישים על חמשים<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">50/3= 16 2/3.</i> –<br>)A gloss: Or something like this, a third of a</b> בית <b>סאה is 16 and 2/3 by 50 –<br>חתוך באמצע ושים זה על זה יהיה עשרים וחמש על שלשים ושלש ושליש<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">25x33.333=833.325.</i>) –<br>Cut</b> the fifty אמה length <b>in the middle and place one next to the other you will have 25 by 33 and 1/3(.</b><br>Another calculation:<br><b>דרך אחרת בית סאה היא מאה על כ"ה<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">A בית סאה is 2500 sq. אמה which is 50 by 50, or 100 by 25.</i> תקח השליש לאילן אחד יהיה ל"ג ושליש על כ"ה –<br>Another way; a בית סאה is 100 by 25, take one third for one tree,</b> his area <b>will be 33 and 1/3 by 25</b> in a rectangle –<br><b>והם ל"ג ושליש על ל"ג ושליש עגולים –<br>Which is the equivalent of a circle</b> with a diameter of <b>33 and 1/3;</b> תוספות shows how <b>–<br>שהרי מוסיף הרביע מלבר שהיא שליש מלגיו<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">A circle inscribed in a square that has an area of four, will have an area of three. The area of the square is ‘one’ more than the circle. This ‘one’ can be considered a third of the area of the circle (מלגיו), or it can be considered a fourth of the entire area of the square (מלבר). We reduce the area of a square by a fourth to get the area of a inscribed circle and we increase the area of the inscribed circle by one third to get the area of the square</i> –<br>Since we add</b> to the area of a circle a <b>fourth from the outside which is a third from the inside –<br>דהיינו ח' אמה ושליש<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">A third מלגיו of 25 is 8 1/3.</i> באורך ל"ג ושליש יהיו ל"ג ושליש על ל"ג ושליש מרובעים –<br>Which is 8 and 1/3, to a length of 33 and 1/3, there will then be 33 and 1/3 squared –<br>(ולספרים דגרסינן פש להו פלגא דאמתא<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">The רש"ל deletes the entire parenthesis. </i>) –</b><br><b>ועשה אותו עגול שיחסר הרביע שהוספת<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">We made it into a square (of 33 and1/3 by adding a fourth מלבר, we will turn it back into a circle by reducing it a fourth, so the area of a circle with a diameter of 33 1/3 is the same that of a square which is 33 1/3 by 25, which is 833 1/3. </i> ויהיה עגול ל"ג ושליש על ל"ג ושליש-–</b><br><b>And make this round, meaning subtract the fourth which we added, so it will be a circle of 33 and 1/3 by 33 and 1/3.</b><br>תוספות concluded explaining the גמרא according to his גירסא of תרי תלתא אמתא, now תוספות will explain the גמרא according to the גירסא of פלגא דאמתא:<br><b>ולספרים דגרסי פש ליה פלגא דאמתא יש לפרש דחשיב עולא י"ו לכל צד לבד מקום האילן –<br>And according to the text which are גורס, ‘there is missing half an אמה’, we can explain that</b> when <b>עולא counts</b> the <b>sixteen</b> אמות <b>in all directions,</b> that is <b>excluding the place the tree</b> occupies –<br><b>ומקום אילן שליש על שליש נמצא אילן דעולא ל"ב ושליש על ל"ב ושליש<sup
