is 833 and 1/3, and אילן דעולא (with the extra חצי אמה) is 33 1/3 in diameter whose area is also 833 1/3 (33.3333x33.3333=1111.10889 x.75=833.33).</i> –<br>So when you will add the extra half אמה</b> (פלגא דאמתא) <b>around the entire circumference you will have a diameter of 33 and 1/3;</b> which is the same as the אילן דמשנה.<br>Another explanation and גירסא in our גמרא:<br><b>ורבינו משולם מפרש דעולא לא חשיב מקום האילן<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">As in the ספרים דגרסי פלגא אמתא.</i> ומקום האילן הוי אמה על אמה –<br>And רבינו משולם explains that עולא does not count the place of the tree, however the tree occupies an אמה in diameter</b> (not a third of an אמה as in the previous explanation) –<br><b>נמצא דהוי אילן דעולא ל"ג על ל"ג ואם היו מרובעים היה עולה אלף ופ"ט –<br>It turns out that אילן דעולא has a diameter of 33, and if it were squared it would add up to 1089</b> sq. אמות –<br><b>תחסר הרביע ישאר תתי"ו ושלשה רבעי אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">39</sup><i class="footnote">1089 x .75 = 816.75.</i> –<br>Subtract a quarter</b> for the area of a circle with a diameter of 33, <b>there will remain</b> an area of <b>816 ¾ אמה.</b><br><b>ולא גרסינן (והוו) [פשו] להו ז' מאה ושתין ותמניא –<br>And we are not גורס, ‘there remains 768’</b> sq. אמות, rather there remains 816 ¾ אמות –<br><b>נמצא דאילן המשנה יתר על של עולא י"ו אמה ושליש ורביע<sup class="footnote-marker">40</sup><i class="footnote">833 1/3 – 816 ¾ = 16 7/12. [1/3 = 4/12 + ¼ = 3/12 = 7/12.]  </i> –<br>It turns out that the אילן המשנה is larger than</b> אילן <b>דעולא by 16 7/12 אמה –<br>ופלגא דאמתא קאי אבית סאה שהיא חמשים על חמשים –<br>And</b> when the גמרא states פש ליה <b>פלגא דאמתא, it is referring to the בית סאה which is 50 x 50 –<br>כשתסיר פלגא דאמתא לאורך וכן לרוחב יעלה החסרון חמשים אמה חסר רביע<sup class="footnote-marker">41</sup><i class="footnote">Let as assume that we first remove a strip half an אמה in the length, so we have a strip of 50 x ½. Then we remove a strip in the width. However since we already removed ½ אמה, the strip of the width now is only 49 ½ x ½ . we will add ¼ אמה to the 49 ½ from the 50 so we have two 49.75 strips each ½ אמה wide. Meaning we have a strip 49.75 x 1 אמה.   </i> –<br>That when you will remove half an אמה in the length and similarly</b> half an אמה <b>in the width, the part subtracted will be 49 ¾ אמה –<br>דהיינו לג' אילנות ולאילן אחד יעלה י"ו אמה ושליש ורביע<sup class="footnote-marker">42</sup><i class="footnote">49.75/3= 16 7/12. This is the amount that אילן דמשנה was greater than אילן דעולא (see [text by] footnote # 38). </i> וישאר<sup class="footnote-marker">43</sup><i class="footnote">After subtracting 49.75 from a בית סאה (2500 square אמות) we have left 2450.25. That is the space required for 3 trees. Divide that by 3 (2450.25/3) = 816.75. The same amount a אילן דעולא. See footnote # 39. </i> כאילן דעולא:</b><br><b>This amount</b> of 49 ¾ <b>is for three trees but for one tree</b> f<b>or one tree it will equal 16 7/12, so the remainder will be the same as אילן דעולא.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There are various ways of reconciling the אילן דעולא with אילן דמשנה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why was it necessary for תוספות to cite more than one example how to reconcile אילן דעולא with אילן דמשנה?
<b>לחומרא לא דק—He was not particular in being stringent</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>We can infer from the ruling of עולא that if a tree is sixteen אמות away from the border he can bring ביכורים (but not less than sixteen אמות for then his tree nourishes from his neighbor’s field). The גמרא asked that based on the משנה a tree nourishes from more than a sixteen אמה radius,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה הכי whether it is 16 2/3 or 16 ½. </i> so how can עלא obligate one to bring ביכורים from just a sixteen אמה radius. The גמרא explained that since עולא is being strict, he is obligating one to being ביכורים even from a sixteen אמה radius, he was not that exact.<br>תוספות discusses this answer<br>---------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא נמי קולא הוא הא דמייתי ביכורים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">According to עולא he will bring ביכורים if his tree is sixteen אמות away from his neighbor’s property, even though that he is really פטור from bringing ביכורים at that distance. However, he will not separate תרומות ומעשרות from the fruit that he is bringing as ביכורים, when in reality (since he is not חייב in ביכורים) he is obligated to separate תרו"מ from those 'ביכורים'. It turns out that by obligating him to bring ביכורים from a radius of sixteen, עולא is being lenient for he is exempting him from separating תרו"מ from those fruits.</i> דמפקע להו מתרומה ומעשר –<br>And if you will say; but this</b> ruling of עולא <b>that he brings ביכורים</b> if it is more than sixteen אמות, <b>is also a leniency, for he exempts</b> these ביכורים <b>from תרומה and מעשר –<br>כדאמרינן בהמוכר את הספינה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ביכורים are not obligated in הפרשת תרו"מ since ביכורים itself is considered תרומה.</i> (לקמן דף פא,ב ושם) –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>המוכר את הספינה –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דעולא לא איירי אלא במאי דאינו מביא בתוך י"ו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">עולא merely stated that if the tree is within sixteen אמות he does not need to bring ביכורים. We are inferring that more than sixteen he is obligated; however, that inference may be mistaken. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>And one can say that עולא is only discussing the issue that one does not bring</b> ביכורים if the tree is <b>within sixteen</b> אמות –<br><b>אבל חוץ לי"ו פעמים מביא ופעמים אינו מביא:</b><br><b>However outside sixteen</b> אמות, <b>sometimes he brings</b> ביכורים if it is<b></b> as far as the proper שיעור mentioned in the משנה <b>and sometimes he does not bring</b> ביכורים, if it is more than sixteen but less than the שיעור of the משנה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>עולא never said that one brings ביכורים if it is (slightly more than) sixteen אמות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to תוספות that עולא never said to bring ביכורים if it is sixteen אמות or more,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> what does the גמרא mean by saying ולחומרא לא דק, since עולא did not rule at all לחומרא, he merely ruled that less than sixteen one does not bring ביכורים?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

Line 5

<b>אילן וקרקעו כולי—A tree and its land, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא challenges עולא (who maintains that one must have a radius of sixteen אמה around his tree on his property to bring ביכורים), from a משנה which states that if one bought a tree and its land he is obligated to bring ביכורים. The מקשן assumed that he needs to bring ביכורים even if it was a minuscule amount of land (less than sixteen אמות), which would contradict the ruling of עולא. The גמרא responded that the משנה (when it stated וקרקעו) means that he bought land in a sixteen אמה radius around the tree. תוספות discusses the need for such a ruling.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>למאי דמוקי לה בי"ו אמה צריך לפרש מאי אתא לאשמועינן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It is obvious if he owns the tree and the land around it to nourish the tree, he certainly is required to bring ביכורים!</i> –<br>According to how the</b> גמרא <b>establishes this</b> משנה that he bought sixteen אמות of land, <b>it is necessary to explain what is this</b> משנה <b>coming to teach us?!</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דאתא לאשמועינן ולמידק –<br>And it appears to the רשב"א that</b> the משנה <b>is coming to inform us that we should infer</b> from this ruling <b>–<br>הא קנה אילן סתם אינו מביא וקורא –<br>That if he simply bought one tree</b> (without mentioning the land), <b>he does not bring</b> ביכורים <b>and does not read</b> the פרשה of ביכורים –<br><b>ואם קנה ב' אפילו סתם מביא וקורא דקנה קרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה when it states הקונה אילן וקרקעו מביא וקורא is not that much interested in this law (if we establish it where he bought sixteen אמות), but rather for the two inferences from the law, one that by one tree he brings ביכורים only if he explicitly bought the land around it, otherwise if nothing specific was mentioned regarding the land, we assume that he does not own the land and therefore אינו מביא, and two that it is only by one tree where he brings ביכורים only if he specifically negotiated to buy the land, however if he bought two trees, even if there was no discussion about the surrounding land, nevertheless he brings ביכורים, since this משנה agrees with ר"מ that when one buys two trees, he is קונה the קרקע (not like the חכמים who argue and maintain that only if he buys three trees is he קונה the קרקע).</i> –<br>But if he bought two trees, even</b> without mentioning the land around them, <b>he brings</b> ביכורים <b>and reads</b> פרשת ביכורים <b>since he acquired the land –<br>וכרבי מאיר דאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See the משנה in ביכורים פ"א מי"א which states, הקונה שלשה אילנות בתוך של חברו, מביא וקורא, רבי מאיר אומר אפילו שניים, קנה אילן וקרקעו, מביא וקורא. See ‘Thinking it over’</i> (לקמן פא,א) הקונה ב' אילנות קנה קרקע:</b><br><b>For</b> this follows the ruling of <b>ר"מ who maintains</b> that <b>one who buys two trees, he acquires the land</b> around them.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The משנה may teach an obvious law in order that we should infer other laws from it.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Does the משנה in ביכורים,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> support or contradict תוספות answer?

Line 6

<b>הא שלשה מביא וקורא—However, three, he can bring and proclaim</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה אילן.</i><br>The גמרא cites a משנה which states<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">מס' ביכורים פ"א משנה ו states; הקונה שני אילנות בתוך של חברו, מביא ואינו קורא. In משנה יא it states; הקונה שלשה אילנות בתוך של חברו, מביא וקורא.</i> that if one bought two trees in his friend’s property, he may bring ביכורים, but does not read פרשת ביכורים. The implication is that if he bought three trees, he would be מביא וקורא, even if he owns a miniscule amount of land. This would contradict the ruling of עולא. Our תוספות examines the need for this inference.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>הוה מצי למיפרך מסיפא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">סיפא here means משנה יא a few משניות after משנה ו' (which was cited here). See footnote # 2.</i> דקתני בהדיא במסכת ביכורים בסיפא דהך דמייתי הכא –</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have challenged</b> עולא <b>from the סיפא for it was taught explicitly in מסכת ביכורים in the סיפא of this</b> משנה, <b>which was cited here,</b> that<br><b>הקונה ג' אילנות תוך של חבירו מביא וקורא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Why does the גמרא infer from the רישא when it states explicitly in the סיפא?!</i> –<br>One who buys three trees within his friend’s</b> property <b>he is מביא וקורא –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>אלא דאורחא דגמרא בכמה מקומות שמדקדק מרישא מה שיכול –<br>Rather</b> we need to say <b>that it is the manner of the גמרא in many places to infer from the רישא as much as possible</b> (even though it is explicit later in the סיפא)<b>.</b><br><b>[ועיין תוספות שבת לט,ב דיבור המתחיל אלא פניו] :</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Oftentimes the גמרא prefers to infer from the רישא what is explicit in the סיפא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did not תוספות ask that the גמרא could have challenged עולא from the רישא directly without any implication, since the רישא states that הקונה ב' אילנות מביא ואינו קורא, and we are assuming now that he only has קרקע כל שהוא, so why is he מביא according to עולא?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and נחלת משה.</i>
<b>לא שש עשרה אמה—No; sixteen cubits</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא concludes that there is no contradiction to עולא, for the משניות, which teach that he brings ביכורים, are all in cases where he owns sixteen אמות radius of land around the trees. תוספות clarifies this answer.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא אמרינן בהמוכר את הספינה (לקמן דף פב,א ושם) גבי שלשה קנה קרקע –<br>And if you will say; but</b> ר' יוחנן <b>states in</b> פרק <b>המוכר את הספינה regarding</b> the משנה there<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">פא,א.</i> which rules that if <b>he bought three</b> trees <b>he acquires the land</b> around the trees –<br><b>וכמה תחתיהן וביניהן וחוצה להן כמלא אורה וסלו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">From the sגמרא' answer here it appears that when one buys three trees he acquires sixteen אמות radius around the tree; however from the גמרא there it appears that he receives (only) כמלא אורה וסלו, which is less than sixteen אמות.</i> –<br>And how much</b> land is he קונה around the trees; he is קונה the land <b>underneath</b> the trees and the land <b>between</b> the three trees <b>and outside</b> the trees the amount of <b>space</b> necessary <b>for the harvester and his basket –</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהתם כשענפי האילן גדולים הרבה ויוצאין חוץ לשש עשרה אמה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In a ‘regular’ tree (where the branches extend less than sixteen אמה), the buyer receives just sixteen אמות. However, if the branches extend beyond sixteen אמות, he receives the entire area under the tree (which is more than sixteen אמה), plus כמלא אורה וסלו outside the tree to enable the harvester to pick the fruit. This is (only) according to עולא.</i> –<br>And one can say; that</b> the גמרא <b>there</b> is in a case <b>where the tree branches are very long and they extend beyond the sixteen אמה</b> radius.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר קונה אילן אחד אמאי אינו מביא וקורא למאן דאמר קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">There is a dispute in the גמרא when one buys the rights to the fruits of a field (or the rent of a real estate property); meaning that all the fruits that grow belong to the buyer (but not to the owner of the field); does that make this buyer as if he is the owner of the field – קנין פירות כקנין הגף דמי, or not – קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי. In our case this will make a difference whether הקונה אילן אחד is מביא וקורא or not. The owner of this tree has a קנין פירות in the field around the tree (even if he did not buy anything there, for it is self-understood when he bought this tree that it will be יונק from the surrounding area). Therefore, if we maintain קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי, the owner of the tree ‘owns’ the nourishing area, so it is מארצך and מן האדמה שנתת לי, etc. He. therefore, should be obligated to bring ביכורים.</i> –<br>And if you will say;</b> one <b>who buys one tree, why is he not מביא וקורא according to the one who maintains that ‘an acquisition for the fruits is just as an acquisition for the principal’ –<br>ומאי שנא ממוכר שדהו לפירות –<br>And why</b> is this case of קונה אילן אחד <b>different from one who sells his field for פירות –<br>דמביא וקורא לדידיה כדאמרינן בפרק השולח (גיטין דף מז,ב ושם) –</b><br>Where the rule is <b>that</b> the buyer is <b>מביא וקורא as</b> ר' יוחנן <b>states in פרק השולח –</b><br>תוספות anticipates and rejects a possible answer to his question:<br><b>וליכא למימר דהאי תנא סבר דקנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי –<br>And we cannot say that this תנא</b> (who rules that הקונה אילן אחד is not מביא וקורא), <b>maintains קנין פירות לאו כקנין הגוף דמי</b> and therefore he is אינו מביא וקורא; this is not so –<br><b>דהא רבי מאיר אית ליה דכקנין הגוף דמי בהשולח (שם דף מח,א) ובהחובל (בבא קמא דף צ,א ושם) –<br>Since ר"מ maintains in</b> פרק <b>השולח</b> and in פרק <b>החובל that</b> קנין פירות <b>כקנין הגוף דמי –<br>ואית ליה לקמן (דף פא,א) דקונה אילן אחד (אינו מביא וקורא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read מביא ואינו קורא (instead of אינו מביא וקורא).</i>)<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The question then is on ר"מ, since he maintains קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי why is he אינו קורא?!</i> –<br>And</b> nevertheless, <b>he maintains later that one who buys one tree is מביא ואינו קורא –</b><br>תוספות answers and distinguishes between קנין פירות elsewhere and here:<br><b>ויש לומר דשאני התם שהקרקע קנוי לו עד זמן קבוע –<br>And one can say that there</b> (by a ‘regular’ קנין פירות) <b>it is different</b> than here, <b>for there the land is acquired to him for a specific time,</b> and during that agreed upon time the owner (seller) cannot renege –<br><b>אבל הכא אם יתייבש מיד האילן אין לו בקרקע כלום –<br>However here</b> by the tree, <b>if the tree would dry out immediately, he does not own anything in the land,</b> he cannot even plant another tree there, therefore he is אינו קורא –<br><b>אי נמי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> התם קרקע קנויה לו לכל דבר למשטח בה פירי ולמיזרע בה סילקא וירקא –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> offer another difference; <b>there the land is his</b> (the buyer’s) <b>to do anything with it, to spread out fruit on the land</b> (to dry) <b>or to plant there beets and vegetables –<br>אבל גבי אילן אין לו אלא יניקה לבדה:</b><br><b>However, regarding the tree, he only has the nourishment</b> from the land, but he cannot use it for any other of his purposes.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to עולא, regular trees receive sixteen אמות; trees with branches that exceed 16 אמה receive an additional כמלא אורה וסלו. Even if we maintain קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי, nevertheless one who is קונה אילן אחד is not מביא וקורא, either because his קנין פירות could end immediately, or his rights are very limited.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there a difference להלכה between the two answers<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> תוספות gives regarding קנין פירות כקנין הגוף דמי?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 7

<b>ובוידוי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">וידוי here refers to the proclamation one makes concerning his distribution of מעשרות. This is found in דברים (תבא) כו,יג-טו. It is known as וידוי מעשרות. </i>—And with confession</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבי עקיבא stated that even a minuscule amount of land obligates a person with certain responsibilities (including פאה and ביכורים, etc.). תוספות cites רש"י that we are not גורס the word 'ובוידוי' and discusses it.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>פירוש בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ובוידוי. In our רש"י it states דאין וידוי אלא במעשר והוא אינו תלוי בקרקע. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דלא גרסינן ובוידוי דלא כתיב במעשר שני (שיש) שום וידוי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות פורת יוסף amends this to read דלא כתיב בוידוי מעשר שני לא (instead of דלא כתיב במעשר שני (שיש) שום וידוי).</i> –<br>רש"י explained that the text does not read 'ובוידוי', for by the וידוי of מעשר שני it is not written –<br>לא מארצך ולא מאדמה אשר נתת לי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If it would say (by וידוי מעשר) the word מארצך, or האדמה אשר נתת לי (as it says by ביכורים), it would have the same ruling as ביכורים that it must be from your land, and according to עולא it would require the sixteen אמות in order not to be יונק משדה חבירו, however since these words do not appear by וידוי מעשרות, there is no such requirement (to have any land at all).</i> –<br>Neither מארצך (from your land) nor מאדמה אשר נתת לי (from the land which you gave me) –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דכתיב ביה וברך את עמך את ישראל ואת האדמה אשר נתתה לנו (דברים כו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">פסוק טו.</i>) –<br>Even though it says by</b> וידוי מעשר, ‘<b>and bless your nation ישראל and the land which you gave us’,</b> which may seemingly indicate that one must own the land –<br><b>לא שיהא לו לחלק אלא לכל ישראל –<br>It does not</b> mean <b>that he</b> (the individual) <b>should have a portion</b> (ownership) in the land, <b>rather</b> the land which ה' gave us, which belongs <b>to all of ישראל</b> (but not that it belongs to this particular person)<b>.</b><br>According to רש"י (as תוספות explains it) there is no need to own קרקע in order to proclaim וידוי מעשר. However תוספות cites a dissenting view:<br><b>ומיהו על כרחך אין וידוי בלא קרקע דתני עלה בירושלמי<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">פאה פ"ג ה"ו. In our ירושלמי it is on יז,ב.</i> אף בוידוי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות disagrees with רש"י (based on the ירושלמי) and maintains that וידוי מעשר requires קרקע.</i> –<br>Nevertheless, perforce you must say that there can be no וידוי</b> מעשר <b>without</b> owning <b>land, for it was taught in</b> the תלמוד <b>ירושלמי, on this</b> משנה of ר"ע, <b>that also by וידוי</b> we require קרקע כל שהוא.<br><b>ומכל מקום לא גרסינן ליה מדתני עלה בירושלמי מכלל דבמשנה ליתיה :</b><br><b>But nevertheless</b> (even though וידוי requires קרקע) <b>we are not גורס</b> וידוי <b>in the משנה</b> (of ר"ע), <b>for since it was taught in</b> the גמרא <b>of the ירושלמי, it is evident that in the משנה there is no</b> mention of וידוי (otherwise why does the גמרא there need to mention it).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Both רש"י and תוספות agree that we are not גורס the word וידוי in the משנה; however according to רש"י it does not require קרקע, while according to תוספות (based on the ירושלמי) it does require קרקע כ"ש.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is the reason תוספות offers why וידוי does not require קרקע the same reason which רש"י gives,<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote 2.</i> or is it different?
<b>ולכתוב עליה פרוזבול—And to write a <i>Prusbul</i> on it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר"ע ruled that in order to write a פרוזבול,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה פרוזבול, that this is a תקנה of הלל that the lender assigns his debts to בי"ד so that the מלוה should be able to collect them even after שמיטה. </i> the לוה must have some קרקע, even a miniscule amount is sufficient. תוספות discuses this ruling<br>--------------------------------<br><b>אבל אמטלטלין אין כותבין פרוזבול מפני שיכול לכלותן והיא הלואה דלא שכיחא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A מלוה is usually only willing to lend when the לוה owns קרקע, for then his loan is secured by the land, however if the לוה has only מטלטלין (but no land), the loan is not secured, for the מטלטלין can be lost or stolen or sold, etc. Therefore, since this is an uncommon case, the חכמים did not institute their תקנות by a מילתא דלא שכיחא. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>However,</b> if the borrower owns only movable items, <b>we do not write a פרוזבול, since</b> the לוה <b>can rid himself from them, so it is an uncommon</b> type <b>of loan –<br>ועציץ נקוב<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Plants that grow in an עציץ נקוב are considered (מחובר ל)קרקע regarding many laws, since they nourish from the ground through the hole(s) in the עציץ (נקוב).</i> אף על פי שיכול לכלותו כותבין עליו פרוזבול דלא פלוג רבנן במקרקעי –<br>And regarding a perforated flowerpot, one may write a פרוזבול</b> if the לוה owns one. <b>Even though it can be destroyed,</b> nevertheless <b>the רבנן did not distinguish</b> between different types of <b>קרקע –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דכותבין אפילו על קרקע כל שהוא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A קרקע כ"ש will (seemingly) not be sufficient to secure the loan; why is it different from מטלטלין?!</i> –<br>And</b> the reason <b>we write</b> a פרוזבול <b>even on a miniscule amount of land –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>פירש רבינו שמואל בן מאיר בהשולח (גיטין דף לז,א דיבור המתחיל אלא) משום דאין אונאה לקרקעות –<br>The רשב"ם explained in</b> פרק <b>השולח, since there is no ‘cheating’<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The rule of אונאה is that if an item was overcharged (or undercharged) by a sixth or more, there is recourse; the sale is nullified if the difference was more than a sixth, or if it was exactly a sixth, the amount overpaid (or underpaid) must be returned to the buyer (or seller). However, by קרקע even if one was overcharged by more than a sixth, the sale is valid as is. This means that a piece of קרקע which has a certain market value, can be considered to be worth much more, since if you sell at a much higher price, the sale will be valid.</i> by קרקעות –<br>והוי כאילו יש לו משכון בכל<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The small piece of land, which the לוה has, can be considered to be worth much more (the entire amount of the loan), since the מלוה can collect it and sell it for a much higher price; therefore his loan is secured.</i> –<br>So therefore, it is</b> considered <b>as if he has collateral for the entire</b> loan –<br>תוספות disagrees:<br><b>ואין נראה דנהי דאין להן אונאה ביטול מקח ביתר מפלגא יש להן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See כתובת צט,ב ואילך. This means that if land which was worth one hundred was sold for (more than) two hundred, the sale is void. Therefore, if the loan is much more than the value of this קרקע כ"ש how can it be considered as collateral, and so the פרוזבול should not be effective.</i> –<br>And</b> this answer <b>does not appear</b> to be correct, <b>for granted that</b> קרקע <b>is not subject</b> to the regular rules of <b>אונאה, nevertheless the sale can be annulled</b> if it is sold <b>for more than half</b> its market value –<br>תוספות offers his interpretation:<br><b>אלא היינו טעמא משום דגבי והדר גבי כמעשה דקטינא דאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The story there is that a לוה owed two hundred זוז, and he passed on and left over a small plot of land worth fifty זוז. The מלוה took that field as partial payment for his loan. The heirs of the לוה came and gave him fifty זוז and reclaimed the field. The מלוה went back and took the field again since his loan was not paid up and this land is משועבד for the loan. אביי ruled there that the מלוה has the right to do so, עיי"ש. Here too the מלוה can collect this small parcel for partial payment and then when the לוה will redeem his field (by paying the מלוה its value), the מלוה can go back and take the field again and again until his loan is fully paid.  </i> (כתובות דף צא,ב) –<br>Rather this is the reason</b> that we write a פרוזבול on קרקע כ"ש, <b>because he can collect and collect again, like the story of אביי with a small</b> plot of land –<br><b>דעל ידי כך ראוי לגבות כל חובו וכענין זה איכא סוף פרק כל הגט (גיטין דף ל,ב) –<br>That through this</b> process <b>it is possible to collect the entire debt. And there is something similar to this in the end of פרק כל הגט –<br>גבי המלוה מעות את הכהן כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The משנה there (on ל,א) teaches that one may lend money to a כהן, etc. and receive payment by keeping the תרומה, which he is normally required to give to a כהן, and deduct it from the money owed to him by the כהן. The גמרא there states that if the כהן died and left over land (which is משעובד for his loan), he may (according to ר' יוחנן) continue to collect his full debt (by keeping the תרומה) even if the land was very small (כמלא מחט), since whenever the יורשים choose to redeem the field, he can again claim the field which is משועבד to him (so potentially he has a שעבוד for his entire loan).</i> הניח מלא מחט גובה מלא קורדום:<br>Regarding one who lends money to a כהן, etc.</b> that if <b>he left over land</b> even the <b>size of a needle, he can collect the size of an axe</b><br><b>[ועיין תוס' גיטין לז,א דיבור המתחיל אלא ותוספות קדושין כו,ב דיבור המתחיל ולכתוב] :</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We cannot write a פרוזבול for מטלטלין; however, we write for קרקע כ"ש either because אין אונאה לקרקעות, or because we can collect it repeatedly.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that we do not write a פרוזבול on מטלטלין because it is a מילתא דלא שכיחא.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> If that is the case, why can we write a פרוזבול on a קרקע כ"ש; seemingly there too it is a מילתא דלא שכיחא to lend money to someone who virtually has no קרקע?!<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Daf 27b



Line 1

<b>בחטה—By wheat</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא resolved the contradiction on עולא (who maintains that we do not bring בכורים unless the tree has sixteen אמות radius in his own property) from the משנה (which states קרקע כ"ש is חייב in ביכורים), by establishing the משנה that he is bringing ביכורים from wheat (which does not require sixteen אמות) since it is יונק only from its immediate place. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא חטה יניקתה ג' טפחים –<br>And if you will say; but wheat nourishes</b> in a radius <b>of three טפחים;</b> so how can a קרקע כ"ש be מחויב in ביכורים even by wheat –<br><b>כדמוכח בשבת פרק אמר רבי עקיבא בשמעתין דערוגה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">We derive it there from the משנה on פד,ב that in an ערוגה (row/square) which is an אמה by an אמה (six טפחים on each side), we may plant there five different types of seeds and it is not כלאים. In any event, the זרעים there are not within three טפחים of each other, therefore there is no יניקה. </i> (דף פה,א) –<br>As is evident in</b> מסכת <b>שבת</b> in <b>פרק אמר ר"ע in the סוגיא of ערוגה –</b><br>תוספות anticipates (and rejects) a possible answer to his question:<br><b>ואין לומר דכל שהוא דהכא לאו דוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>And one cannot say that</b> when the משנה <b>here</b> states <b>כ"ש, it is not precise;</b> it means ג' טפחים<b>;</b> this would seemingly answer the question.<br>תוספות rejects this approach:<br><b>דהא בפרק קמא דקדושין (דף כו,א) קא מייתי לה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Specifically, the rule that we can acquire מטלטלין with this קרקע כ"ש through קנין אגב. </i> בשמעתא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This is concerning קנין אגב where one who wishes to buy מטלטלין and קרקע from the seller, he needs only to make a קנין in the קרקע, and he automatically is קונה the מטלטלין via (אגב) the קרקע (see רש"י here ד"ה ונקנין).  The גמרא there posed a query whether it is necessary for the מטלטלין to be on the field in order to acquire the מטלטלין with קנין אגב, or it is not necessary; the מטלטלין can be anywhere and nevertheless he is קונה the מטלטלין as well.</i> דאי בעי צבורין בה או לאו –<br>For in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>קדושין,</b> the גמרא <b>cites this</b> משנה, <b>in the discussion whether we require</b> they be <b>piled up in it, or not –<br>וקאמר כל שהוא למאי חזי ומשני כגון שנעץ בה מחט וקאמר איכפל תנא לאשמועינן מחט<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">If the only application of קנין אגב by a קרקע כ"ש is by a needle (if we require צבורין), it is unlikely that the תנא would go to the trouble to teach us such a case, since a needle is so insignificant.</i> –<br>And</b> the גמרא there <b>said</b>, (if צבורין is required) a land which is <b>כל שהוא for what is it fit</b> (how can you put the מטלטלין on the land, there is no space since it is a כ"ש), <b>and</b> the גמרא <b>answered, ‘for instance he stuck a needle in</b> the ground’ (to acquire it בקנין אגב), <b>so</b> the גמרא <b>asked, ‘did the תנא trouble himself to inform us</b> about a <b>needle’ –<br>מי לא עסקינן דתלי ביה מרגניתא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">There is much reason to discuss this case since it is a valuable item and we need to know if he acquires it or not.</i> משמע דכל שהוא דוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">For if it means three טפחים what is the discussion; on an area with a radius of three טפחים, many objects can be placed there. </i> –</b><br>And the גמרא there answered; it is not just a needle; <b>cannot we be discussing where he hung a pearl on</b> the needle. In any event <b>it seems</b> from that גמרא <b>that</b> the term <b>כ"ש is precise (</b>and not three טפחים). The question remains why is a קרקע כ"ש sufficient for ביכורים (even) by a חטה, since it requires three טפחים for יניקה?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דנהי דיניקתה ג' מכל מקום עיקר יניקתה אינו אלא כנגדה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore, since the עיקר יניקה is כנגדה, therefore (even though it receives additional יניקה up to three טפחים), it is considered מארצך וכו'.</i> –<br>And one can say; that even though it nourishes from three טפחים, nevertheless its main nourishment is only directly underneath it –</b><br>תוספות supports his contention that we are concerned only for עיקר יניקה:<br><b>ואילן נמי יניקתו כ"ה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא later on this עמוד, regarding מרחיקין את האילן מן הבור כ"ה אמה.</i> אפילו הכי עיקר יניקתו<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">That is how עולא can reconcile why he requires only a sixteen אמה radius.</i> י"ו :</b><br><b>And by a tree as well,</b> (even though) <b>it nourishes</b> up to <b>twenty-five</b> אמה, <b>nevertheless the main יניקה is sixteen</b> אמה –<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The main nourishment of the wheat is from the ground directly underneath it, even though it receives additional nourishment up to three טפחים distance.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does not תוספות prove that כל שהוא here mean precisely a כ"ש,<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> from our גמרא, which states, 'דיקא נמי דקתני כ"ש'; why does תוספות need to prove it from קדושין?!<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם and נחלת משה.</i>

<b>ואחד אילן הנוטה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This (seemingly) means that the roots are all in the property of the tree owner, it is only the branches that extend into the neighbor’s property. The first case of אילן הסמוך למיצר is where (all?) the roots extend to the other property. </i> מביא וקורא—Or whether it is a leaning tree, he brings and proclaims</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' יוחנן ruled that a tree which is leaning over a neighbor’s property, one is required to bring ביכורים from it. Our תוספות compares this ruling and a similar one<br>-------------------------------------<br><b>בפרק המקבל (בבא מציעא דף קז,א ושם) פליגי רב ושמואל באילן הנוטה על המיצר –<br>In פרק המקבל there is a dispute between רב and שמואל regarding a tree which leans over the boundary,</b> to whom do the fruits belong –<br><b>רב אמר הנוטה לכאן לכאן והנוטה לכאן לכאן ושמואל אמר חולקין –<br>רב rules that those who lean to</b> one side belong <b>to</b> that owner <b>and</b> those <b>that lean</b> <b>to</b> the other side belong <b>to</b> the other owner, <b>and שמואל rules that they divide</b> all the fruits –<br><b>ופירש בקונטרס התם דבנטיית שרשים איירי ולפיכך שמעתין דהכא כרב<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">According to שמואל who rules חולקין, he would not be able to be מביא וקורא, since the fruits are not all his.</i> דאזיל בתר שרשין –<br>And רש"י explained there<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ונהגו. It seems from פרש"י there that if all the roots of sראובן' tree were in sשמעון' property, and vice versa, the rule (according to רב) will be that sראובן' fruits belong to שמעון, and sשמעון' fruits belong to ראובן. However, שמואל maintains יחלוקו, since the tree is in one רשות and the roots in another. </i> that we are discussing the leaning of the roots, so therefore</b> the ruling of ר' יוחנן <b>here is according to רב who follows the roots<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1 that the case of אילן הנוטה is where the roots were all in the field of the בעל האילן so even though the branches are in his neighbor’s property we follow the roots according to sרב' view. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>ורבינו שמשון בן אברהם פירש שם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See there תוס' ד"ה אילן that אילן העומד על המיצר means that the tree straddles the property line; it has nothing to do with the roots.</i> בענין אחר:</b><br><b>However, the רשב"א there explained it in a different manner.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Our גמרא follows the ruling of רב, according to פרש"י in ב"מ.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How will we reconcile the case of<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> אילן הסמוך למיצר according to רב, since the roots extend to the neighbor’s property?! Why is he מביא וקורא since the fruits are not his?!<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>שעל מנת כן הנחיל יהושע וכולי—For it was on this condition that <i>Yehoshuah </i>apportioned, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא stated that when יהושע divided ארץ ישראל to all the שבטים he stipulated that they should not mind if someone’s tree is nourishing from their land, etc.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>במרובה (בבא קמא דף פב,א) פריך אמאי לא חשיב לה בהדי עשרה תנאין של יהושע <sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there on (the very bottom of) פ,ב states ת"ר עשרה תנאין התנה יהושע, and it does not mention this תנאי.</i>ומשני<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there answers that this statement of עשרה תנאין וכו' is not a ברייתא, rather it is a מימרא from ר' יהושע בן לוי who was an אמורא, so ר' יוחנן (who includes this תנאי) can disagree with him and maintains that this too was one of the תנאים of יהושע.</i> לה:</b><br><b>In</b> פרק <b>מרובה the</b> גמרא <b>asks why do we not count</b> this stipulation <b>among the ten stipulations of יהושע, and</b> the גמרא there <b>answers this</b> question.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>This תנאי is not included in the ten תנאים mentioned in מרובה, as there is a disagreement as to which תנאים were actually made by יהושע.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does תוספות mention this question, especially since he does not give us the answer?!<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps this מחלוקת can help us understand the two opposing views attributed to ר' יוחנן</i>

<b>בדחלולי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our גמרות the text reads, וסגיא בדחלולי [or according to the הגהות הב"ח, it reads ובדחלולי בעלמא סגיא].</i> סגי—It is sufficient to make it sparse<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This seems to be פרש"י בד"ה ושדי.</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר' שמעון ruled in our משנה that if the branches of a (privately owned) tree hang over the רה"ר, the owner is required to chop off all the overhanging branches along the plumb line, out of concern for טומאה. The גמרא cites a ברייתא that ר"ש meant that we are concerned for אוהל הטומאה.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י ד"ה מפני that we are concerned that perhaps there is a מת under the tree and whoever passes under the tree will become טמא, since the tree is מאהיל on the מת and on the passerby. </i> The גמרא explains that without this ברייתא we may have assumed that ר"ש was concerned thar perhaps ravens will come and throw the טומאה on the tree;<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See the פי' רבינו גרשום who writes, that sometimes the עורב will throw the מת on the tree and it will not fall down on the ground, so therefore it is necessary to chop down the tree that the עורב should not place it there. And רש"י similarly states the same. Seemingly this means that the person who will walk under the branch where the מת is lying will become טמא (either because the branch does not have a פותח טפח, or the מת extends beyond the branch, וצ"ע.</i> however, if that would be the concern it would be sufficient בדחלולי, and we would not require him to chop down all the branches.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י and פי' ר"ג that the tree should trimmed to such an extent that if the עורב will throw the מת on the tree the branches will be so sparse that it will fall to the ground and there will hardly be any branches left to become an אוהל over the מת and the passerby.</i> There is a dispute between רש"י and the ר"ח as to the meaning of 'בדחלולי'.<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו חננאל דחלולי לשון יראה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We are perhaps familiar with the term דחילו ורחימו which in לשון קודש is יראה ואהבה. According to the ר"ח the 'ד' of בדחלילו is part of the root of the word (as opposed to the 'ב'). However according to פרש"י the root seems to be חלולי (hollow or sparse). See רשב"א.</i> –<br>The ר"ח explains</b> that <b>דחלולי means fear</b> in Aramaic, meaning –<br><b>שעושים צורה של עץ ונראין כבני אדם ואין העוף רשאי לישאר שם<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">By placing a scarecrow by the tree there is no longer a concern that an עורב will place (see רש"ש) a מת on the tree, since the עורב is afraid to approach the tree. Therefore, this should seemingly be sufficient If we would only have the משנה).</i> –<br>That they make a form out of wood, which looks like a person</b> (a scarecrow), <b>so a bird is not permitted</b> (frightened) <b>to remain there,</b> therefore <b>–<br>קא משמע לן דאף על פי שברח העוף –</b><br>The ברייתא <b>informs us that even though the bird flees</b> on account of the scarecrow, nevertheless that is insufficient, for –<br><b>פעמים שמשאיר שם בשר המת שמביא בפיו ונשאר שם בענף –<br>Occasionally it leaves over there the flesh of the corpse which</b> the bird <b>brings with its beak and it remains there on the branch<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably תוספות means that after a while this בשר המת will fall to the ground and the tree will be מאהיל on the מת and the passerby, causing him to become טמא.    </i> –<br>הלכך אין לו תקנה אלא בקציצת ענפים כולם:<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read כולם כנגד המשקולת: (instead of [just] כולם:).</i></b><br><b>Therefore, there is no solution unless all the branches [along the plumb line] are chopped off.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Based on our משנה one would think that by merely placing a scarecrow would prevent the טומאה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can the גמרא say that without the ברייתא, we could have thought that the concern is for עורבים, and בדחלולי would be sufficient, when the משנה clearly states כל האילן כנגד המשקולת?!<br><br><b>הדרן עלך לא יחפור</b><br><b>We shall return to you</b><br>פרק<br><b>לא יחפור</b>

<b>חזקת הבתים ובית הבדים—The possession of houses and olive presses<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A הבד בית, olive press, is generally owned by an individual who presses olives, for a fee, for various olive growers and/or olive (and) oil merchants. See ‘Thinking it over’ and מ"נח.</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our משנה states that there are two types of חזקה. For those items that are constantly in use (i.e. a house) the חזקה is three complete years. However those items which are not constantly in use, their חזקה do not require שנים מיום ליום שלש, but rather three seasons. Our משנה mentions הבדים בית as one of the items that require a ליום מיום שנים חזקה שלש, indicating that it is active throughout the year. תוספות challenges this assumption.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>פירש רבינו יצחק בר מרדכי דהא דתנן בפרק חומר בקדש (חגיגה כד,ב) –</b><br><b>The ם"ריב</b> <b>explained</b> that <b>this which we learnt in a משנה</b> <b>in בקודש פרק חומר,</b> namely<br><b>עברו הגיתות והבדים דמשמע שיש להן זמן קבוע –</b><br><b>‘</b>When the season of <b>wine pressing and olive pressing passes’</b>, etc. This concludes the quote from the משנה; <b>indicating that</b> olive (and wine) pressing <b>have a set time</b> during the year, when these activities take place. If this is true why does a חזקה of הבדים בית require three full years? The requirement of a ליום מיום שנים שלש חזקת is limited to such things that are continually active throughout the year; not to an activity which is done sporadically as a הבדים בית seems to be.<br>תוספות answers that when the משנה states that the season passed, the reason we say the season passed is not because there is no pressing after this season but rather –<br><b>היינו שרוב העולם דורכים אז בזמן לקיטה –</b><br><b>It means that <i>most </i>people do their pressing then, at harvest time;</b> therefore it is called the season of pressing –<br><b>אבל יש בני אדם שמצניעין כל השנה ודורכין במעט מעט:</b><br><b>However, there are people that store (</b>their olives [and grapes]) for <b>the whole year;</b> they do not press them at the harvest time, but rather <b>they press</b> their olives (and grapes) <b>little by little;</b> so they indeed use the presses for the entire year. That is why it requires a ליום מיום שנים שלש חזקת, since it is active the entire year.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>An olive press is in use continuously; however most of the pressing is done during the harvest season.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What possible difficulty may footnote # 1 resolve?

<b>שלשה חדשים בראשונה—Three months in the first</b> year<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה states that a הבעל בית שדה, which does not produce crops continuously, does not require a full three year חזקה. Rather it may be accomplished (according to ר"י) by two, three month, cycles (one month cycles ע"לר) and one twelve month cycle in between; for a total of eighteen (fourteen) months. It is not clear what the מחזיק is required to do in the field during these three months to accomplish a valid חזקה. It is also not clear how it is possible to have three harvests in a הבעל בית, in less than three years, since a הבעל בית produces one only crop a year. תוספות will address these issues.<br>-------------------------<br><b>מתוך פירוש הקונטרס משמע דבעי רבי ישמעאל –</b><br><b>From s'י"רש</b> <b>explanation it seems that ישמעאל 'ר</b> <b>requires –</b><br><b>שהוא יזרע ויקצור<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In our (שדה ה"ד) רש"י it states that he planted during the three months; it does not specifically state that he also harvested during these three months. במפרשים 'ועי.</i> באותן שלשה חדשים ראשונים וכן באחרונים –</b><br><b>That</b> the מחזיק <b>should sow and harvest</b> the field <b>in these first three months</b> (of the first year) <b>and similarly in the last</b> three months (of the third year).<br>תוספות anticipates a question:<br><b>ואין תימה שתהא תבואה הנזרעת אחר ניסן גדילה בג' חדשים ואין זמנה עד ניסן הבא –</b><br><b>And it is not surprising that grain which was sown after</b> the month of ניסן <b>would ripen in three months,</b> even though <b>its</b> usual <b>time</b> for ripening <b>is not until the following ניסן.</b> תוספות is assuming (and it seems also that רש"י agrees<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See שדה ה"ד רש"י where he writes, (seemingly) concerning the first three months, that יש ממהרין לזרוע לפני ר"ה.</i>) that when the משנה states 'באמצע חדש עשר ושנים', we are referring to a regular year from השנה ראש to ה"ר. Therefore the first three months (the first year) are אב, תמוז and אלול. The last three months (the third year) are כסלו, חשון, תשרי. A הבעל בית שדה generally yields one crop a year.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See שדה ה"ד רש"י where he states: בשנה אחת פעם אלא פירות עושה אינה, and at the end of the same רש"י, he states: שזורע את שדהו לאכול פרי העשוי לשנה.</i> Grain (in those areas around ובבל י"א) ripens around ניסן time.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The עומר of barley was harvested on the second day of פסח. The חדשה מנחה of wheat was brought on שבועות, etc. See ולב לא ט, בא 'פ where the תורה relates the effect that ברד מכת [which (seemingly) took place a short while before יציאת מצרים], had on the wheat and barley.</i> It would seem unusual that grain can be planted and harvested (so quickly) during אלול – תמוז, then planted and harvested again in ניסן<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not ask how is it possible to plant a (second) crop in אלול-תמוז, if a crop was already harvested in the previous ניסן. The reason may be that (according to רש"י) in our case no one planted the field previously during this year. The מחזיק entered a barren field in תמוז and planted it then. See however later in this תוספות (footnote # 9), where it is apparent that (according to תוספות) two crops can be harvested within a year.</i> (and planted and harvested again during כסלו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It may be that תוספות is not (that) concerned about harvesting and planting during כסלו-תשרי for then it is the rainy season, however אלול-תמוז is the driest season, how can grain be planted and harvested then? See however footnote # 5; If it is planted and harvested during כסלו-תשרי, it will not be planted again for ניסן.</i> – תשרי).<br>תוספות maintains that this is not such a difficulty –<br><b>דמצינן כעין זה דאמרינן בראש השנה (יג,א) כל תבואה הנקצרת בחג –</b><br><b>For we find</b> something <b>similar to this, for</b> the גמרא <b>states in ה"ר</b> מסכת <b>any grain which is harvested on the holiday</b> of סוכות –<br><b>בידוע שהביאה שליש לפני ראש השנה –</b><br><b>It is known that it grew a third</b> of its entire growth <b>before</b> ה"ר<b>.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">That grain would be therefore considered to ‘belong’ to the year, previous to the סוכות in which it was harvested. This is relevant to the laws of מעשר and שביעית. It is also relevant to us; since it grew a third before ה"ר, it will be considered a proper harvest (even) before ה"ר in regard to the חזקה.</i></b><br><b>אלמא גדלה פעמים באותו זמן –</b><br><b>It is evident that sometimes it does grow in that season;</b> around ה"ר time. Therefore it is possible that grain can be planted and harvested immediately before (or after) ה"ר.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br>תוספות asks another question:<br><b>אבל קשיא לרבינו יצחק דאם כן אמאי צריך י"ח חדשים בט"ו חדשים סגי –</b><br><b>however the</b> ר"י <b>has a</b> different <b>difficulty</b> with s'י"רש interpretation <b>for if this is so;</b> that it is possible to plant and harvest grain before ה"ר, without negatively affecting the upcoming ניסן crop, then <b>why are eighteen months needed</b> in order to effect a three season חזקה, it should be sufficient to accomplish the חזקה in fifteen months. תוספות goes on to explain:<br><b>שיזרע ג' חדשים לפני ניסן ויקצור בניסן ושניה בסוף הקיץ<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">It seems, that תוספות maintains that a field can yield two crops in the same year. See footnote # 5.</i> ושלישית בניסן הבא –</b><br><b>He should plant</b> the grain <b>three months</b> before <b>ניסן and harvest</b> the first crop <b>in ניסן,</b> as is usual <b>and the second</b> crop will be planted and harvested <b>at the end of the summer</b>; in אלול-תמוז as stated previously according to <sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">According to רש"י a span of six months from harvest to harvest is sufficient. The first harvest occurs before ה"ר and the second before פסח. תוספות question is that this (first) cycle can start with a ניסן harvest, instead of a ה"ר harvest.</i>י"רש <b>and the third</b> crop will be harvested <b>in the following ניסן.</b> There will be three crops harvested within fifteen months; beginning with שבט and ending the following ניסן a year and three months later.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This difficulty is (only) according to s'י"רש opinion that it is possible to plant and harvest within a three month cycle. See later in תוספות for a differing opinion.</i><br>תוספות offers an answer:<br><b>ויש לומר דצריך אכילה חשובה של י"ב באמצע –</b><br><b>And one can say</b> that fifteen months is not sufficient, because <b>we require a substantive consumption</b> <b>of twelve months in between</b> the two minor usages of three months apiece.<b></b> A שדה בית הבעל generally yields one crop a year. A חזקה requires (planting and) harvesting three crops. Therefore we require that at least one of the חזקה crops, namely the middle one, be a substantive normative חזקה of one full year. For the other two חזקות we are lenient, allowing two, three month חזקה cycles, for a total of eighteen months.<br>תוספות anticipates the following question:<br><b>אף על גב דאמרינן בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">ב,כח דף.</i> אכל תלת פירי לתלתא ירחי –</b><br><b>Even though the</b> גמרא <b>states,</b> that if <b>one consumes three produce</b> harvests <b>in three months –</b><br><b>כגון אספסתא לרבי ישמעאל הויא חזקה –</b><br><b>For instance</b> in the case of <b>אספסתא</b> which can be harvested once a month, that <b>according to ישמעאל 'ר</b> <b>it will be a</b> valid <b>חזקה.</b> We can derive from that גמרא that according to ר"י a חזקה can be accomplished in three months and there is no requirement of an אכילה חשובה of twelve months (besides the other two חזקה periods). Why therefore here in the case of a שדה הבעל is there a requirement of an אכילה חשובה of one year.<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>שאני התם לפי שהוא זמן שלה –</b><br><b>For it is different there</b> in the case of אספסתא <b>for that is its time.</b> אספסתא can grow in a month, be harvested then grow again in another month, be harvested etc. Therefore it is logical that no twelve month חשובה אכילה period is required, since a month is its proper time to grow and be harvested. However by a הבעל בית שדה, its growing season is one year from harvest to harvest. Therefore even though it is technically possible to induce it to produce three harvests in a shorter period than the normal three years, nevertheless one of these consumption periods must be the normal full year cycle.<br>תוספות questions s'י"רש interpretation:<br><b>אבל קשה לרבינו יצחק דאמרינן בגמרא (לקמן דף לו,ב) –</b><br><b>However the ר"י has a difficulty; for the גמרא states –</b><br><b>פירא רבה ופירא זוטא איכא בינייהו דרבי ישמעאל ורבי עקיבא –</b><br><b>That the difference</b> of opinion <b>between ר"י</b> (who requires eighteen months) <b>and ר"ע</b> (who requires fourteen months)<b></b> is based on whether <b>‘large produce’ or ‘small produce’</b> are required for a חזקה.<br><b>ופירש הקונטרס דרבי ישמעאל סבר פירא רבה –</b><br><b>And</b> רש"י <b>explains</b> that גמרא to mean <b>that</b> ר"י <b>maintains that</b> consuming a <b>פירא</b> <b>רבה</b> is required in order to effect a חזקה –<br><b>כגון שעורים ושבולת שועל שגדלים בג' חדשים –<br>For instance barley and oats that grows in three months.</b> Therefore, eighteen months are required; twelve months in the middle; and the two cycles of three months, to plant and harvest the רבה פירא. Harvesting זוטא פירא is not sufficient to establish a חזקה. However –<br><b>ורבי עקיבא סבר פירא זוטא כגון ירק הגדל בחדש אחד –</b><br><b>ע"ר</b> <b>maintains that</b> even <b>זוטא פירא</b> <b>such as vegetables that grow in one month</b> are also sufficient to constitute a חזקה. Therefore fourteen months are sufficient. This concludes the citing of the גמרא and י"פירש. תוספות now concludes his question. How can רש"י state that ר"י requires רבה פירי of three months for a חזקה –<br><b>והא אמרינן בגמרא (לקמן עמוד ב') דאספסתא בחדש אחד הויא חזקה לרבי ישמעאל –</b><br><b>For the גמרא states that</b> harvesting <b>אספסתא</b> <b>once a month</b> three times <b>is</b> considered <b>a חזקה according to ר"י!</b> The אספסתא would be considered a פירי זוטא according to רש"י. How can we reconcile these two issues; that ר"י requires פירי רבה and nevertheless by אספסתא there is a חזקה in (three) one month cycles?!<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 3.</i><br>On account of this last question (and the previous difficulties) תוספות disagrees with רש"י who says that for each of the two minor חזקה cycles both זריעה and קצירה are required.<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דלא בעי רבי ישמעאל שיזרע התבואה ויקצור –</b><br><b>And the ר"י</b> <b>maintains that ישמעאל 'ר</b> <b>does not require that the grain be</b> both <b>planted and harvested –<br>אלא אפילו זרעה הראשון או הוא יזרענה בשלשה חדשים אחרונים אף על פי שלא קצרה –</b><br><b>But rather even if</b> the <b>first (previous) owner</b> <b>planted</b> the field and the present מחזיק harvested it during the (last) three months of the first year, it would be considered a proper אכילה for the first year cycle of the חזקה, <b>similarly if</b> the מחזיק only <b>plants</b> this field <b>in the last three months</b> of the חזקה (i.e. the first three months of the third year) <b>even though</b> the מחזיק <b>did not harvest</b> the grain that he planted, nevertheless the planting of the last three months is also considered a valid אכילה for the third year of the חזקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage of this interpretation is that we may now maintain that only one crop a year can be harvested from a בעל שדה, and nevertheless three אכילות can be accomplished in eighteen months. The original owner planted his field in the first year and the מחזיק harvested it in the last three months of the first year. The next year was a regular year of planting and harvesting by the מחזיק. In the first three months of the third year the מחזיק planted the field, and he now has a חזקה even before the harvest of the third crop, which will take place later in the year. It also explains why the חזקה cannot be accomplished in fifteen months (תוספות second question) for that would require more than one crop a year. There will also be no question from אספסתא (see א"מהרש) [where no twelve month middle cycle is required, and a one month  cycle is sufficient], for there he is both planting and harvesting; however here he is either planting or harvesting, therefore we require a three month cycle and a twelve month חשובה אכילה in between.</i><br>תוספות will now explain the מחלוקת between י"ור ע"ר concerning זוטא ופירי רבה פירי and it will not conflict with the case of אספסתא, according to this interpretation.<br><b>ובהא פליגי דרבי ישמעאל סבר בעינן שיהא גדל הפרי ברשותו הרבה כגון ג' חדשים –</b><br><b>And this is what</b> ע"ור ר"י are <b>arguing</b> about<b>: for ר"י</b> <b>maintains that it is necessary that the produce should grow in his possession an extended</b> amount of time <b>for instance three months –<br>והיינו פירא רבה –</b><br><b>And this is</b> what <b>רבה</b> <b>פירא</b> <b>means;</b> that it is growing for an extended time of three months. Otherwise it cannot be counted for a yearly חזקה cycle.<br><b>ורבי עקיבא סבר דאין צריך שיגדל ברשותו אלא חדש אחד והיינו פירא זוטא –</b><br><b>However ע"ר</b> <b>maintains that it is not necessary that it grow in his possession</b> three months but rather <b>only one month</b> is sufficient <b>and that</b> is the meaning of <b>זוטא פירא.</b> However neither ר"י nor ע"ר require that it must be planted and harvested in that time (i.e. one or three months); either זריעה or קצירה is sufficient.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">י"רש who maintains that each yearly חזקה cycle must consist of both וקצירה זריעה, cannot interpret ופירא רבה פירא זוטא, the way תוספות explains it. There can be no חזקה by produce that requires more than a month from the זריעה until קצירה, even according to ע"ר since there was no וקצירה זריעה. Therefore רש"י must interpret that ר"י and ע"ר are arguing whether a זוטא פירי, a produce that requires no more than a month from זריעה to קצירה, is eligible to be considered a חזקה, or that only a רבה פירא which requires three months is eligible for a חזקה. Therefore תוספות has the סתירה (according to רש"י) between ר"י of the משנה, where three months are required and ר"י of אספסתא where one month is sufficient for a חזקה.</i><br>According to תוספות the חזקה in each three month cycles (one month for ר"ע) is accomplished either by זריעה or קצירה but not (necessarily) both. תוספות questions this.<br><b>ואם תאמר היאך יהא ניכר שיחזיק בה כל ג' חדשים ראשונים או אחרונים –</b><br><b>And if you will say; How will it be apparent that he was in possession</b> of the field <b>all of the first three months or of the last</b> three months –<br><b>כי ביום אחד או בב' יוכל לקצור או לזרוע –</b><br><b>Since, in one or two days he is able to harvest</b> (concerning the first three months) <b>or to plant</b> (concerning the last three months).<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 4.</i> What does it mean that he made a חזקה for three months? What did he actually do during the entire three month period?<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">According to רש"י it is understood. He planted in the beginning of the three months and harvested at the end of the three months, therefore it is considered as if he was מחזיק all three months, for this is the normal manner in which a person tends to his field.</i><br>תוספות anticipates a possible answer:<br><b>וכי תימא שמנכש את השדה ומתקנו –</b><br><b>And if you will say that he will weed the field and improve it</b> by removing any defects; that is the way he will be מחזיק for the three month cycles. תוספות rejects this answer –<br><b>הא לא הויא חזקה מידי דהוה אניר דאמר לקמן (דף לו,ב) דלא הויא חזקה –</b><br><b>For</b> מנכש or מתקן <b>is not a חזקה</b> <b>for it is similar to plowing</b>, concerning which the גמרא <b>later says that</b> plowing <b>is not a חזקה</b> <b>–</b><br><b>משום דמימר אמר כל שיבא דכרבא ניעול בה<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The מסורת הש"ס amends this to read לעייל ביה.</i> –</b><br><b>Because</b> the original owner <b>certainly says, ‘let every chip of the plow go into</b> the soil’. The original owner is saying let the מחזיק plow so much until his whole plow will be consumed chip by chip from the wear and tear of plowing.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See ם"רשב there כל ה"ד.</i> The owner is happy that a stranger is plowing his field. After the מחזיק is finished plowing the owner will be able to plant the field and avoid all the difficult work of plowing. Therefore just as plowing is no חזקה similarly weeding and repairing is no חזקה for the same reason. The owner is happy that someone else is doing his work.<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 5.</i> A חזקה is only when the מחזיק is infringing on the rights of the owner in some way; when he harvests the crops, etc. The question remains; how does he perform a חזקה for three months.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר כגון שאוכלה שחת –</b><br><b>And one can say; that he consumes it for fodder, for instance.</b> He harvests the growing stalks [of grain] before they mature and uses them as animal fodder. That will be considered as a חזקה for the three months (in addition to the planting [or regular harvesting] of grain).<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן (שם [לו,] א) אכלה שחת לא הויא חזקה –</b><br><b>And</b> concerning <b>that</b> which the גמרא <b>states: If he consumed שחת</b> <b>it is not a חזקה.</b> This seemingly contradicts what תוספות just said that his חזקה is accomplished by אוכלה שחת.<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 6.</i><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>הני מילי כשאוכל בענין זה שאין התבואה חוזרת לבא –</b><br><b>These words</b> (that חזקה הויא לא שחת אכלה) were said <b>when he consumed it in such a manner that the grain will not come back;</b> he cut the stalks in such a manner that they will never recover and grow back to produce grain. In that case חזקה הויא לא שחת אכלה –<br><b>דשייך לומר לאו אחזקת כדמחזקי אינשי לפיכך לא חש למחות –</b><br><b>For</b> then it is <b>applicable that the</b> original owner says, ‘<b>you did not take possession</b> of this field <b>in the</b> manner <b>which people</b> usually <b>take possession.’</b> A person who is in possession of a field does not willfully destroy his crops of grain and instead feed the stalks to animals. Therefore since the מחזיק did not make a regular חזקה <b>therefore</b> the original owner <b>was not concerned to protest</b> this unusual occupation of his field. This explains the גמרא of הויא חזקה לא שחת אכלה.<br><b>אבל אם אכלה שחת בענין שאין התבואה מתקלקלת –</b><br><b>However if he was שחת אכלה in a manner that the grain does not spoil;</b> there will be a crop of grain even after שחת אכלה –<br><b>כדרך שבני אדם עושים בעוד שהוא ירק ולא בא עדיין גבעול שלה הויא חזקה –</b><br><b>As is the custom of</b> some <b>people, who perform the</b> אכילת שחת <b>while</b> the plant <b>is still green and it did not reach the stalk stage;</b> then even if you cut it, it will regenerate and produce grain, in that case <b>it will be a חזקה.</b> This is the type of שחת אכלה that תוספות mentioned which is eligible for the three month חזקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 7.</i><br>תוספות concluded that there can be a continuous חזקה in a שדה through שחת אכלה. However, תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ובשדה אילן דבעו רבנן דפליגי ארבי ישמעאל בגמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">לקמן לו,ב.</i> מיום ליום ג' שנים –</b><br><b>And</b> concerning <b>an orchard,</b> in which <b>the רבנן, who argue with ר"י</b> as mentioned <b>in the גמרא, require</b> that the חזקה be <b>three</b> full <b>years ‘from day to day’ –</b><br><b>אף על גב דלא שייך התם אכלה שחת –</b><br><b>Even though that שחת אכלה</b> is <b>not possible there,</b> by an orchard; there are no stalks to be harvested. How can there be a חזקה for three full years? What is he doing during all this time to show that he is מחזיק? Seemingly he only harvests the fruit, which requires a relatively short time.<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over # 8.</i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>מכל מקום איכא למימר כגון שזומר ומעכב העצים לעצמו –</b><br><b>Nevertheless</b> even though there is no שחת אכלה, <b>we can say</b> that he makes a חזקה continually <b>that he prunes</b> the trees <b>for instance and he retains the</b> pruned <b>wood for his usage</b>; for firewood, building, etc.<br>תוספות anticipates a question:<br><b>ואף על גב דמתקן בכך והוי כמו ניר –</b><br><b>And even though that</b> by <b>pruning</b>, <b>he is merely</b> <b>improving</b> the orchard for the owner <b>and it is similar to plowing;</b> which the גמרא says is not a חזקה, as mentioned previously. How can pruning be a חזקה?<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>כיון (שמתקן<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See מסורת הש"ס that others substitute שמעכב for שמתקן.</i>) העצים לעצמו לא שייך למימר כל שיבא דכרבא ניעול בה –</b><br><b>Since, however, he is retaining the wood for himself, it is not appropriate</b> for the original owner <b>to say let every chip of the plow go into</b> the soil. The owner is not happy that he is taking the wood for himself and away from the owner. We cannot compare plowing to pruning. By plowing the owner is only gaining, however by pruning even if the owner is gaining somewhat, but he is losing his wood. Therefore זומר ומעכב לעצמו is considered a חזקה.<br>תוספות will offer another way how the חזקה is accomplished in the three month cycle.<br><b>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק דאחזיק בה בכהאי גוונא –</b><br><b>And furthermore, says the ר"י that he made a חזקה</b> in the field <b>in this manner –<br>שנעל<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' לקמן נב,ב ד"ה נעל ודו"ק.</i> וגדר את השדה ונועל במפתח ואין מניח אדם ליכנס –</b><br><b>That he made a lock and fenced in the field and he</b> continually <b>locks it with a key</b>, when he leaves the field <b>and he permits no person to enter.</b> This is considered a חזקה for it shows (exclusive) ownership.<br>תוספות anticipates a question on this explanation:<br><b>והא דאמר בגמרא (דף כט,ב) צונמא במאי קני לה ולא קאמר כגון שנעלה וגדרה –</b><br><b>And</b> concerning <b>that which the</b> גמרא <b>says how can one acquire</b> possession <b>of a rocky area</b> (with חזקת ג"ש)<b>;</b> since there can be no planting there? This concludes the quote from the גמרא.<b></b> The גמרא <b>does not say</b> that a צונמא may be acquired, if <b>for instance he locked it and fenced it.</b> The fact that the גמרא did not give this answer would seemingly indicate that וגדר נעל is not a valid חזקה, contrary to what תוספות said.<br>תוספות replies:<br><b>איכא למימר דאין נעילה מועלת אלא אם כן איכא אכילה בהדה או זריעה –</b><br><b>It is possible to answer that locking</b> alone <b>is insufficient</b> to be a חזקה <b>unless there is a harvest</b> together <b>with</b> the locking, <b>or planting</b> together<b></b> with the locking –<br><b>אבל נעילה גרידא לא מהני מידי<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">It could be he is merely a watchman, or he wants to protect his neighbor’s property. However when he harvests [or plants], the locking indicates that he is protecting his produce.</i> –</b><br><b>However, locking alone</b> without זריעה or קצירה <b>is not sufficient at all,</b> there is no חזקה. Therefore by צונמא where there can be no וקצירה זריעה, the גמרא could not have said that the חזקה was made by נעל וגדר. However by a הבעל שדה where there is זריעה or קצירה, then וגדר נעל can complete the three month חזקה cycle.<br>תוספות concludes:<br><b>והשתא אתי שפיר נמי לרבנן דרבי ישמעאל:</b><br><b>And now</b> that we are stating that וגדר נעל can accompany וקצירה זריעה to complete a חזקה, then <b>it will also be understood according to the</b> רבנן who argue <b>with ר"י</b> concerning a האילן שדה. They maintain that a full three year חזקה is necessary. That חזקה can be accomplished if in addition to harvesting the fruit he will fence and lock the orchard.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a dispute between רש"י and תוספות whether during the two, three (one) month, cycles the מחזיק is required to both plant and harvest the crops (רש"י); or whether it is sufficient that he either harvest or plant the crops (תוספות).<br>A similar dispute is whether פירי רבה ופירי זוטא is referring to the growing cycle of the crop (רש"י); or whether it merely refers to the time the מחזיק is working with it. According to רש"י planting and harvesting (is all that) is required for the חזקה. According to תוספות, in addition to the harvesting or planting, he is also required to be אכלה שחת in a manner that the crop is not destroyed. Alternatively he may fence and lock up the field that he is harvesting or planting for a valid חזקה.<br>Plowing, weeding, pruning (unless he retains the wood), repairing, locking etc. are not acts of חזקה (for חזקת ג' שנים as opposed to חזקת קנין).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Does the חזקה of eighteen (fourteen) months need to begin only at a specific date (תמוז, for instance), or from any time that the מחזיק begins the חזקה, it will conclude eighteen months later (רש"י, תוספות)?<br>2. What proof does תוספות bring from the גמרא in ר"ה that כל תבואה וכו' בחזקת וכו' לפני ר"ה; perhaps that is concerning a בית השלחין?<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i><br>3. Can we answer תוספות final question on רש"י in the following manner; <sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13. See א"רשב.</i> similar to תוספות answer on the previous question of אספסתא. In the case of אספסתא since its cycle is one month, therefore three one month cycles are sufficient. However concerning a בית הבעל where its intrinsic cycle is one year, the חכמים were willing to lessen the two minor cycles but only if there would be an אכילה חשובה of פירי רבה – three months.<br>4. According to תוספות, when is he required to plant/harvest in the three month cycle; in the beginning, at the end, or there is no difference?<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 16.</i><br>5. תוספות cites that plowing is not a חזקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 20</i> Why is זריעה a חזקה?<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">. See יא אות י"בל.</i><br>6. תוספות asks, that the גמרא states אכלה שחת לא הוי חזקה; this conflicts with תוספות suggestion that he be אכלה שחת.<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 21.</i> Why does not תוספות answer that the גמרא is discussing a case where it is only אכלה שחת; he never harvests the crop; here, however, he is harvesting the crop?<br>7. If it was אכלה שחת in the manner כדרך שבנ"א עושים is that a חזקה?<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 22.</i> Why?<br>8. תוספות asks how one makes a חזקה in a שדה אילן.<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 24.</i> Is this question applicable according to רש"י?
<b>שהן י"ח חדש—Which are eighteen months</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>After the משנה teaches us how a חזקה is made in a הבעל בית, the משנה concludes ‘חודש שהן י"ח’. תוספות will discuss what is this phrase ‘חודש י"ח שהן’, teaching us.<br>------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה וכי מניינא אתא לאשמועינן וכהאי גוונא פריך בכמה דוכתי –</b><br><b>It is astounding! Does</b> the תנא of the משנה <b>come to teach us how to count?!</b> It is obvious that twelve months and twice three months are eighteen months. Why does the משנה conclude that ‘it adds up to eighteen months’? <b>And in many places the גמרא asks in this manner</b>; we do not need to be taught how to calculate.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This may be a support to the original question; or perhaps it is an additional question. Why indeed did the גמרא not ask here, וכי מנינא אתא לאשמועינן?</i><br>תוספות anticipates a possible answer:<br><b>וליכא למימר דרצופין אתי לאשמועינן –</b><br><b>And we cannot answer that</b> the תנא of the משנה <b>is teaching us that</b> these eighteen months <b>must be consecutive.</b> If the תנא would have merely stated ‘three months, etc. and three months, etc. and twelve months in between, without adding 'שהן י"ח חודש', I may mistakenly assume that the three months and the twelve months etc. do not have to be consecutive. It may be possible to make a חזקה for three months, then wait awhile and then continue to make the חזקה for the twelve months, etc. The משנה, by stating חודש ח"י שהן, makes it clear that the total amount of time is eighteen months, meaning there can be no interruption in between. This will seemingly answer תוספות question.<br>תוספות rejects this answer:<br><b>דאם כן מאי קא משמע לן רב הונא –</b><br><b>For if it is indeed so;</b> that by stating חודש ח"י שהן, the משנה is teaching us the requirement of רצופין, then <b>what does הונא רב</b> <b>teach us.</b> הונא רב states in the גמרא,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">א,כט דף.</i> that the שנים 'ג חזקת must be רצופין. However, now that we are proposing that the phrase חודש ח"י שהן, teaches already the rule of רצופין, why did הונא רב have to repeat it. We already know it from the משנה!<br>תוספות anticipates a possible answer to this last question and rejects it. Seemingly it is possible that we know the rule of רצופין from the משנה. However הונא רב is merely restating that we can derive it from the משנה; he is not necessarily teaching us something new. This would seem to resolve all difficulties. תוספות however rejects this approach:<br><b>ובגמרא משמע דממתניתין לא הוה שמעינן דבעינן רצופים –</b><br><b>However</b> from <b>the גמרא</b> <b>it seems that from our משנה</b> (alone) we <b>would not be aware that</b> רצופין <b>is required<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">After the גמרא cites the rule of רב הונא, it asks immediately מאי קמ"ל תנינא חזקתן שלש שנים וכו'. Now if we were to assume that שהן י"ח חודש teaches us that רצופין are required, the גמרא should have asked מאי קמ"ל תנינא שהן י"ח חודש. This proves that the גמרא assumes that שהן י"ח חודש cannot teach us the rule of רצופין. Also from the answer of the גמרא it is indicated that this rule is a חידוש of רב הונא. See: ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>אי לא דאשמועינן רב הונא [עי' תוי"ט שתמה על זה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The ט"יו 'תוס claims, even if חודש ח"י שהן teaches us רצופין, however it may be that רצופין is required only by a בית הבעל (where חודש ח"י is stated), since it is not a complete three years. הונא רב is teaching us that even when three full years are required for a חזקה, nevertheless רצופין are still required. See א"רעק and others who discuss this point.<br></i>]:</b><br><b>Were it not</b> for the fact <b>that</b> הונא רב <b>taught it to us.</b> Therefore the question remains why is it necessary for the משנה to state 'חודש ח"י שהן'? It cannot be to teach us רצופין, for רב הונא exclusively is teaching that to us.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות questions the need for the משנה to state חודש ח"י שהן. It cannot come to teach us רצופין, for that is taught exclusively by הונא רב.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why indeed cannot we infer from חודש ח"י שהן that רצופין are required?
