<b>וזו באה בפני עצמה ומעידה—And this</b> one <b>comes by itself and testifies</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>When two group of עדים contradict each other we believe neither group. רב הונא and רב חסדא (merely) argue what is the future status of these two groups. תוספות will argue that the latter group should be believed over the former group; since the בתראי had other options to discredit the קמאי.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה בין לרב הונא בין לרב חסדא נהמנינהו לבתראי –</b><br><b>And it is astounding!</b> For <b>either according to ה"ר</b> <b>or according to ח"ר we should believe the latter</b> group of עדים who contradicted the former group. The דין should be that the former group of עדים becomes פסול ודאי and the latter group of עדים should be כשר ודאי. The reason we should believe the בתראי over the קמאי, is that the בתראי have<br><b>במיגו דאי בעי פסלינהו לקמאי בגזלנותא –</b><br><b>a מיגו, they could have disqualified the קמאי</b> by testifying that the קמאי <b>are robbers.</b> If the בתראי, who wish to discredit the testimony of the קמאי, would claim that they know that the קמאי committed robbery, the ruling would be that the קמאי become עדים פסולים and their testimony is automatically discredited. Therefore, on account of this מיגו, the בתראי should be believed when they dispute the testimony of the קמאי.<br>תוספות anticipates a tangential question. There is seemingly another מיגו that can be employed in order to believe the בתראי. The בתראי could have refuted (been מזים) the קמאי by saying that at the same time that they testified that this occurrence took place in טבריה, they were actually with us in צפורי. If the בתראי would have been מזים the קמאי, the בתראי would be believed and the קמאי would become פסולים עדים. Why is תוספות choosing the מיגו of גזלנותא as opposed to the מיגו of הזמה? תוספות explains:<br><b>ומיהו במיגו דאי בעי הוי מזמי להו ליכא להמנינהו –</b><br><b>However, with the מיגו</b> <b>that</b> the בתראי <b>could have been מזים</b> the קמאי; with that מיגו <b>we cannot believe</b> the בתראי. The מיגו of הזמה is not a valid מיגו. תסופות explains why הזמה is not a valid מיגו –<br><b>דיראים להזימן פן יוזמו גם הם –</b><br><b>for</b> the בתראי <b>are reluctant to be מזים</b> the קמאי <b>lest they</b> themselves (the בתראי) <b>will also become מוזם</b> through another group of עדים. In order for the מיגו of הזמה to function, the בתראי would be required to say that at the time that the קמאי are testifying that the incident (in טבריה) took place, they were actually with us at a different place (צפורי). However it is possible that the בתראי were actually in the same place (טבריה) where the קמאי were, at the same time. If they would falsely claim that they (and the קמאי) were at another place (צפורי) at that time, there is the concern that another group of עדים would be מזים the בתראי (by saying we saw you then in טבריה).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In the מיגו of בגזלנותא פסלי, however there is no such concern that the בתראי will be מוזם. The בתראי could testify that the קמאי committed robbery at a time and place that they know for sure that they (the בתראי) were actually there (without – of course – observing any crime at all).</i><br>תוספות will answer the original question: the בתראי should be believed, since they have a מיגו. They could have disqualified the קמאי by claiming that they are גזלנים.<br><b>ונראה לי דמיגו במקום עדים לא אמרינן –</b><br><b>And it seems to me</b> that <b>we do not</b> believe <b>a מיגו</b> <b>where it contradicts עדים.</b> The question was that the מיגו that the בתראי have should completely nullify the testimony of the קמאי. A מיגו does not have the ‘strength’ to nullify עדים.<br><b>(ועוד<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The א"מהרש deletes the 'ועוד', indicating that this is a continuation of the first answer. Others however, disagree, and maintain that it is a different answer (see following footnote #3).</i>) דמיגו לא יוכל לסייעם יותר משני עדים –</b><br><b>(And furthermore) [for<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A מיגו במקום עדים usually refers to a situation where one of the litigants has a מיגו to support his claim, while the other litigant has עדים to support his claim. In such a situation it is clear that מיגו במקום עדים לא אמרינן.  In our case however there are two contradictory groups of עדים. The purpose of the מיגו is merely to verify which of these two groups should be believed as עדים. Seemingly here the rule of עדים במקום מיגו should not apply. It is this issue that תוספות is now clarifying.</i>] a</b> מיגו <b>cannot assist them</b> (the בתראי) any <b>more than two</b> (additional) <b>witnesses</b> who will agree to what the בתראי say. A מיגו is certainly no more powerful than two witnesses. If two more עדים will come and testify that the בתראי are saying the truth; that will not change anything. It will still be considered an מוכחשת עדות –<br><b>ואפילו היו עמהן ק' עדים אין נאמנין דתרי כמאה –</b><br><b>And even if a hundred עדים</b> <b>would be with</b> the בתראי, <b>they will not be believed</b> any more than the קמאי, who consist of two עדים, <b>for two</b> עדים <b>are like a hundred</b> עדים<b>.</b> Therefore, since even if there were additional עדים supporting the בתראי, they still would not be believed any more than the קמאי, then certainly a מיגו which is not as strong as two עדים, cannot substantiate their testimony.<br>תוספות offers an additional answer:<br><b>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק דלא שייך מיגו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read מיגו אלא באדם אחד אבל בשנים אין שייך מיגו דאין.</i> –<br>And furthermore, says the ר"י a מיגו</b> <b>is (not) applicable [only by one person, however by two</b> people, <b>a</b> מיגו is <b>not applicable] –</b><br><b>דאין דעת שניהם שוה ומה שירצה זה לטעון לא יטעון זה:</b><br><b>for the minds of both</b> עדים <b>are not the same and that which this</b> witness may <b>want to claim the other</b> witness may <b>not claim it.</b> A מיגו is not applicable by עדים. Perhaps the בתראי are indeed liars; and are coming to בי"ד to falsely contradict the עדות of the קמאי by saying that their testimony is not true.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">We are not (necessarily) suspecting any group of (serious) collusion. Rather each עד may come alone (due, perhaps, to the insistence of the litigant), to discredit the other group of עדים. The initial reaction to discredit the קמאי is by denying and contradicting their testimony (and not by claiming that they are גזלנים). ב"צ ועדיין.</i> The reason they are not saying the ‘better lie’ of גזלנותא is because each one of them is concerned that perhaps his partner will not think of saying the lie of גזלנותא<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We do not believe the בתראי with a מיגו that they could פסל the קמאי with a claim of גזלנותא because; a) אמרינן לא עדים במקום מיגו (f)or כמאה תרי; or b) a מיגו cannot function with two people.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות question is on רב חסדא as well. תוספות previously cited<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">דף לא,א ד"ה אמר רבה.</i> that רב חסדא maintains אמרינן עדים במקום לשקר לי מה. How can we explain תוספות answer here, that אמרינן לא עדים במקום מיגו?<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See (קלו אות) ד"סוכ.</i><br>2. Why is the ר"י not satisfied with תוספות previous answer(s)?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות קלז.</i><br>3. In a case of ותרי תרי, if we were to follow the חזקה, would that contradict תוספות assertion that כמאה תרי?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See  footnote # 8</i><br>4. תוספות states that אמרינן לא תרי בי מיגו. How can we reconcile this with a previous תוספות,<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">דף כט,א ד"ה הני</i> which claims that the עדים have a מיגו concerning payment of rent?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י there אות סה.</i><br>5. Why is תוספות asking his question of מיגו here by the מחלוקת between ר"ה ור"ח? This is a general question concerning every ותרי תרי.
<b>ורב נחמן כרב הונא—And ר"נ is according to ר"ה</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our גמרא (initially) attempts to explain the opinion of רב נחמן who maintains that the עדות אבהתא is accepted, even though these עדים were contradicted concerning the עדות אכילה. The reason is because רב נחמן agrees with רב הונא that in a case of תרי ותרי, even though both groups of עדים are ספק פסול, nevertheless we disregard this ספק פסול and maintain the original חזקת כשרות of both groups of עדים. They are believed in any other testimony (besides the contradictory testimony, where we cannot believe either of them). According to רב נחמן this applies even to a (different) testimony (עדות אבהתא) in the very same case where they were contradicted (עדות אכילה) and considered a ספק פסול.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The א"מהרש explains that the ruling of נ"ור ה"ר does not apply in a case where עדים are directly disqualifying other עדים by claiming that they are גזלנים. In this case all will agree that (we do not say it is ותרי תרי, but rather that) the accused group is פסול for all עדות. The עדים that are being disqualified cannot be considered as תרי, for now they are the דבר בעלי, and not עדים. However in the case of ה"ור נ"ר the עדים are contradicting each other concerning something else. Neither group can be considered as דבר בעלי, but rather as עדים. It is only in these cases, where the פסלות is merely implied, that we consider it ותרי תרי. (See footnotes # 3, 12-15.)</i><br>-----------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דבפרק ב' דכתובות (דף יט,ב) תניא שנים שהיו חתומין על השטר ומתו –</b><br><b>And it is astounding! For we have learnt in a ברייתא in the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>כתובות; Two</b> witnesses <b>that were signatories on a document, and they died</b> subsequently before the document was authenticated –<br><b>ובאו שנים ואמרו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ואמרו ידענו שכת"י הוא זה אבל קטנים היו או פסולי עדות היו או.</i> שכתב ידם הוא אבל קטנים או פסולי עדות או אנוסים היו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הפוסלים עדים are claiming that the החתומין עדים were פסול at the time of the השטר חתימת, but not that they are לעדות פסול now (See footnote # 1).</i> –</b><br><b>And two</b> other people <b>came and stated [we know] that this is the handwriting</b> of the deceased witnesses; they are authenticating the signatures <b>– however they were minors</b> when they signed this שטר <b>or</b> they claimed that the deceased <b>were disqualified witnesses or they were coerced</b> to sign this document.<b></b> On one hand the second group authenticated the <b>חתימות</b>; however they maintain that the document is invalid for the reasons given. The ruling is as follows:<br><b>אם כתב ידם יוצא ממקום אחר אין נאמנין –</b><br><b>if the signatures</b> of the deceased <b>can be authenticated from another source</b>; there are certified copies of their signatures available which compare favorably with the signatures on this document, then the second group of עדים <b>are not believed</b> to disqualify the שטר.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If, however אין כת"י יוצא ממק"א, and the only authentication is from these עדים who claim קטנים היו וכו', the שטר is invalid. These latter עדים are believed for it is considered הפה שאסר הוא הפה שהתיר. We can only validate the שטר on account of their testimony, but they simultaneously claim that the עדים were פסול. It seems that even though מיגו בי תרי לא אמרינן (see previous תוספות ד"ה וזו), nevertheless הפה שאסר וכו' בי תרי we do say.</i> This concludes the quote from the ברייתא.<br>תוספות continues:<br><b>ופריך ומגבינן ביה בשטרא תרי ותרי נינהו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It is considered ותרי תרי even though no one is actually disputing the witnesses who claim 'וכו היו קטנים. The reason is, because once we authenticate their חתימות it is presumed that they were כשרים עדים. This presumption is considered as if the החתומין עדים are testifying that they were כשרים עדים and what they signed is true. This is implicit in the very essence of a שטר.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא there <b>challenges</b> this ברייתא, which states that the second group is not believed, which implies <b>that we collect with this</b> contested <b>שטר!</b> How can this be?! It is <b>two against two!</b> The two latter עדים are disqualifying the two עדים on the שטר. Therefore even if we authenticate their signatures from elsewhere, nevertheless the two latter עדים are claiming that it is an invalid שטר. It is ותרי תרי! After some discussion in the גמרא –<br><b>ומסיק התם (כרב)<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See the marginal note that the גירסא is רב נחמן.</i> נחמן דלא מגבינן בשטרא –</b><br><b>And נחמן רב concludes there that we cannot collect with</b> this <b>שטר –</b><br><b>ואוקי תרי להדי תרי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 5.</i> ואוקי ממונא בחזקת מריה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">If it would be a case where אחר ממקום יוצא ידם כתב אין, then בי"ד would tear up the שטר. In this case בי"ד does not tear up the שטר; nor does it validate the שטר.</i> –</b><br><b>For we place two</b> עדים who disqualify the שטר <b>against the two</b> עדים who validate the שטר <b>and we place the money in the possession of its owner.</b> Whoever has the money gets to keep it, regardless of what it says in the שטר. This concludes the citing of the גמרא in כתובות.<br>תוספות now presents the difficulty:<br><b>ואמאי לא מגבינן ביה והא סבירא ליה הכא כרב הונא דכשרים הם לעדות אחרת –</b><br><b>And why do we not collect with this</b> שטר?! <b>For</b> the same נ"ר <b>maintains here as ה"ר</b> does <b>that</b> the המוכחשים עדים <b>are כשרים</b> עדים <b>for</b> any <b>other testimony</b> where they are not being contradicted. The reason for this is –<br><b>דמוקמינן להו אחזקת כשרות<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of our גמרא, the עדים are contradicting each other concerning אכילה; each group implying that the other is testifying falsely, thus פסול for any other עדות. Nevertheless since it is only a פסול ספק (for there is contradictory testimony) we maintain (according to נחמן רב) the original כשרות חזקת of each group allowing them to testify (even in the very same case) if they are not contradicted in this testimony.</i> –</b><br><b>For we place</b> each group of these המוכחשים עדים <b>on their</b> original <b>presumption of כשרות.</b><br><b>והתם<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read והתם נמי כעדות.</i> כעדות אחרת דמי –</b><br><b>And there [also]</b> the testimony concerning the loan <b>is similar to another testimony</b> from the testimony concerning their qualification as עדים <b>–<br>דהא אין מכחישים אלו את החתומים בזאת המלוה שהיו אומרים אין חייב לו כלום –</b><br><b>For these</b> עדים who claim קטנים היו וכו' <b>are not discrediting those</b> עדים <b>that signed on this loan that</b> the הפוסלים עדים <b>should be saying that the</b> לוה <b>owes nothing to</b> the מלוה. The הפוסלים עדים are not saying this –<br><b>אלא שאמרו אינכם נאמנים בדבר זה דפסולים הייתם –</b><br><b>But rather</b> the הפוסלים עדים <b>claimed</b> that <b>you are not to be believed concerning this</b> matter <b>for you were disqualified;</b> either by being קטנים or 'וכו אנוסים. Therefore –<br><b>והוה לן למימר דנאמנים–</b><br><b>We should have maintained that</b> the השטר עדי <b>be believed</b> concerning the loan –<br>The השטר עדי since they were authenticated are (presumed to be) testifying that they were עדים כשרים.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See previous footnote # 5.</i> In addition, they testify to the veracity of the loan. The הפוסלים עדים are only testifying concerning the כשרות of the השטר עדי. They are not testifying whether the loan is true or not. These two groups of עדים are זה את זה מכחישים concerning one thing only; whether or not the עדים were כשר when they signed the שטר. We cannot come to any conclusion since it is ותרי תרי. However concerning the loan there is no contention. The השטר עדי testify that there was a loan and no one is contradicting them. Therefore according to נחמן רב (and רב הונא) the עדות on the loan should be considered an אחרת עדות than 'וכו היו קטנים, and the השטר עדי should be believed concerning the loan.<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">This question is valid only because the הפוסלים עדים are not claiming that they are פסול now, but rather they were פסול at the time of the השטר חתימת. They were קטנים then, etc. The השטר עדי would not be considered ד"בע, since we are discussing a past testimony; not their current status. If however the עדים הפוסלים would claim that the השטר עדי are פסולים עדים now [as well], then it would not even be ותרי תרי since the עדי השטר would be ד"בע, and not עדים. The השטר עדי would be disqualified and the שטר would be discarded. See footnote # 1. </i><br><b>כמו הכא דכשרים –</b><br><b>just like here</b> in the מחלוקת between נ"ר and רבא, where נ"ר maintains that the אבהתא עדי <b>are</b> כשר –<br><b>אף על גב דאלו מכחישים אותם ופוסלים וחושבין אותן כשאר פסולים לכל דבר עדות –</b><br><b>even though that these</b> other חזקה עדי <b>are contradicting them</b> concerning the חזקה, and by this contradictory testimony <b>they disqualify</b> the (וחזקה) אבהתא עדי <b>and</b> the חזקה עדי <b>consider the</b> (וחזקה) אבהתא עדי <b>like</b> all <b>other disqualified</b> עדים <b>for any matter of testifying.</b> In the eyes of the חזקה עדי the עדי אבהתא (וחזקה) are liars and should be disqualified from ever testifying again. Nevertheless, we do not accept their implication; for the עדי אבהתא (וחזקה) have a חזקת כשרות, and are believed in all other testimony, even concerning אבהתא which is affecting<b></b> the same case in which they were contradicted. The same should be true in the case of קטנים היו וכו' that the עדי השטר should be believed concerning the loan.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דכי אמרו קטנים היו ליכא לאוקמינהו אחזקייהו –</b><br><b>And the ר"י</b> <b>says when</b> the disqualifying עדים <b>said</b> that the signatories <b>were minors</b> when they signed the שטר; so even though it may be considered ותרי תרי, nevertheless <b>we cannot establish them on their presumption</b> of כשרות. The question here is whether or not these עדים were קטנים when they signed this שטר. There is no חזקה that they we not קטנים; on the contrary every person was previously a קטן! If there is a question if they are liars or not (as in our גמרא), then they have a חזקת כשרות, but not concerning if they were קטנים or גדולים. Therefore the ספק remains.<br>תוספות continues to explain the next case<br><b>וכן אנוסים נמי לא מפקי להו מחזקת כשרות דאמרינן אנוסים היו מחמת נפשות –</b><br><b>And similarly</b> when the עדים claim that the חתומין were <b>אנוסים</b> they also <b>did not exclude the</b> החתומין<b></b> עדים <b>from</b> their <b>כשרות חזקת for we assume</b> that they meant that the עדים החתומין <b>were coerced</b> to sign <b>under the threat of death</b>. One is not permitted to sign falsely if threatened by monetary loss. If he does he becomes לעדות פסול. However if one is threatened with his life, he is permitted to sign falsely, and certainly does not become פסול לעדות. The עדים are claiming that the החתומין עדים were נפשות מחמת אנוסים; the השטר עדי (presumptuously) claim that they were not אנוסים. It is ותרי תרי. However there is no חזקה that can tell us that they were not נפשות מחמת אנוסים.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">If the הפוסלים עדים would claim that the החתומין עדות were ממון מחמת אנוסים, which is forbidden, then it would be similar as if they were פוסל them by גזלנותא. The השטר עדי become ד"בע and they and the שטר would be פסול. If, however, the הפוסלים עדים testify that the השטר עדי subsequently did תשובה, they are not ד"בע any more, but considered עדים. Therefore, on account of the ותרי תרי, we would utilize the כשרות חזקת to absolve them from this accusation and be מכשיר them (for other עדות) as well as the שטר.</i><br>תוספות now explains the last case: When the הפוסלים עדים stated that the החתומין עדים –<br><b>ופסולי עדות היו איכא למימר כגון שפוסלים אותן משנולדו –</b><br><b>were disqualified עדים</b> which could seemingly mean that they are רשעים; in that case there would be a כשרות חזקת, that they are not רשעים. Nevertheless there is no difficulty <b>for we can say</b> that פסולים means <b>for instance that they disqualify</b> the עדים החתומין <b>from when they were born;</b> meaning –<br><b>שאומרים קרובים היו ועכשיו נתרחקו :<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote"> For instance if a(n older) sister of an עד married the מלוה before the עד was born. That is a פסול קורבה משנולד. The עד cannot testify for his sister’s husband. Once they are no longer married the עד may testify on behalf of the מלוה.</i></b><br><b>that</b> the הפוסלים עדים <b>say</b> that the החתומין עדים <b>were relatives</b> (either to each other or to the מלוה or לוה) from birth <b>and now they became distanced;</b> the relationship no longer exists.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">It is required that the הפוסלים עדים agree that now the השטר עדי are not relatives. If they claim that they are relatives (even) now, then the השטר עדי become ד"בע, and there is no ותרי תרי (see footnotes # 1, 3, 12 & 14).</i> It was a relationship due to a marriage for instance and the marriage dissolved and they are no longer relatives. In this case also since the עדים claim that they were relatives from birth, there is no כשרות חזקת that tells us they were never relatives. Therefore even though it is ותרי תרי, it remains a ספק. That is why נחמן רב there concludes that מריה בחזק ממונא אוקי for there is no כשרות חזקת that can resolve the ותרי תרי.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The דין (of נ"ור ה"ר) that ז"זא המכחישים עדים are permitted to testify for other עדויות, is limited to situations where a כשרות חזקת can resolve the פסול ספק created by the ותרי תרי. If however there is no חזקה that can resolve the תרי ותרי, the ספק remains (and the עדים certainly cannot testify in the same case even for a different עדות).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is תוספות asking that the עדים should be believed concerning the loan, or that the שטר should be כשר? (What is the difference between these two options?)<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See מס' כתובות (פ"ב) אות שצו-ז on משכנות הרועים. </i><br>2. It would seem that if they claim אנוסים היו, they are also implying that there was no loan. Why does תוספות include this in his question and answer?<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות פה (בד"ה והנה).</i><br>3. In the case of קטנים היו why do we not say there is a חזקה that אין העדים חותמין על השטר אא"כ נעשה בגדול?<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות קמא.</i><br>4. What changed in תוספות understanding, from the קשיא to the תירוץ?
<b>ורבא כרב חסדא—And רבא is according to ר"ח</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to ליה אמר ה"ד א,לא תוספות.</i><br>The גמרא explained that the reason רבא maintains that we cannot accept theעדי אבהתא since these עדים were already contradicted concerning אכילה, is because רבא agrees with רב חסדא that המוכחשים עדים are פסול for all testimony. תוספות finds this assumption to be in contradiction with another ruling of רבא.<br>---------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אם כן אמאי חשיב רבא במרובה (בבא קמא דף עב,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל אין) –</b><br><b>And if you will say; if this is true;</b> that רבא agrees with ח"ר that עדים who contradict each other are פסול for all עדויות, then <b>why does</b> רבא <b>consider in</b>פרק <b>מרובה –<br>ובפרק זה בורר (סנהדרין דף כז,א ושם דיבור המתחיל אין) עד זומם חידוש הוא –</b><br><b>And in פרק זה בורר</b> that <b>an</b> זומם עד <b>is a novelty.</b> The novelty of זומם עד is that you believe the עדים who are being מזים over the עדים who are being מוזם. <b>–<br>ואין לך בו אלא משעת חידושו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Logically the זומם עד should become פסול from the time of the original testimony. For it is at that time that he lied. We are not aware of it till the actual הזמה, but the פסול is on account of his lying. רבא agrees to this logic. However the fact that הוא חידוש זומם עד precludes us from acting on the logic. Rather we maintain חידושו אלא בו אין לך. </i> –</b><br><b>And</b> therefore, since it is a חידוש, <b>you cannot retain in</b> this חידוש of believing the מזימין and discrediting the מוזמים <b>only from the time of its חידוש.</b> The זוממים עדים become discredited from the time of the testimony of the מזימים and onwards. However any testimony they gave prior to becoming זוממין עדים, even if it was given after the testimony for which they ultimately became עדים זוממים, that testimony is valid. This is the basis for s'רבא ruling (according to one opinion) that עד זומם מכאן ולהבא הוא נפסל.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See previous ליה אמר ה"ד א,לא תוספות.</i> The question is; if רבא agrees with רב חסדא, what is the חידוש of זוממים עדים –<br><b>והלא מה שהוא נפסל אינו חידוש –</b><br><b>For is it not</b> so, the fact <b>that</b> the זומם עד <b>becomes</b> פסול <b>is not a חידוש –<br>דהא מן הדין היה להיות לשניהן פסולים כמו בשני כתי עדים המכחישות זו את זו –</b><br><b>For rightfully</b> the ruling <b>should be that they should both be</b> פסול<b>;</b> the עדים המזימים and the זוממים עדים for they are contradicting each other. Therefore they are just <b>like two groups of</b> עדים <b>who contradict each other.</b> In that case both groups are פסול; this is the ruling of רב חסדא, to which רבא agrees. The same should apply to the זוממים עדים and the המזימים עדים.<br><b>אם כן לא הוי חידוש אלא מה שהמזימין כשרים –</b><br><b>Therefore there is no</b> חידוש in the פסול of the זוממין עדים. It is to be expected; for every הזמה is also implicitly a הכחשה<b></b> but rather the <b>only</b> חידוש is <b>that the מזימים are כשרים</b>; even though the עדים זוממין contradict the מזימין, nevertheless the מזימין are believed and are עדים כשרים. This should not affect the פסול of the עדים זוממין. Since there is no חידוש in their פסול they should be פסול למפרע, from the time they gave the testimony which leads to their הזמה. Why therefore does רבא maintain that עד זומם מכאן ולהבא הוא נפסל since it is a חידוש, when in reality it is not a חידוש.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דרבא דאמר חידוש הוא לא הוי אלא לפי המסקנא דאתי שפיר כרב הונא:</b><br><b>And the ר"י</b> <b>says that when</b> the גמרא maintains that רבא <b>said that</b> עד זומם <b>is a חידוש, this applies only according to the conclusion</b> of our<b></b> גמרא <b>that</b> רבא <b>can rightfully agree with</b> הונא רב, who maintains that the המכחישים עדים כתי שני remain עדים כשרים (except for עדות באותה, where they are פסול). If רבא agrees with הונא רב, then the fact that the זוממין עדים are פסול for all עדות, that is a חידוש, therefore חידושו משעת אלא בו לך אין, and that is why נפסל ולהבא הוא עד זומם מכאן.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The idea that הוא חידוש זומם עד follows the ruling of הונא רב that by ותרי תרי the עדים remain כשרים עדים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>From תוספות answer it seems that when the גמרא assumed that חסדא כרב רבא, then רבא could not maintain הוא חידוש זומם עד. However in a previous תוספות,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">דף לא,א ד"ה אמר ליה</i> it is clearly stated (according to one answer) that our entire סוגיא (including that חסדא כרב רבא) must follow the view of הוא חידוש זומם עד?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See א"מהרש.</i>
