Line 3

<b>סהדותא בעינן—We require testimony</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>One interpretation of the מחלוקת whether מחאה בפני ב' or בפני ג' is dependent if we require witnesses to ascertain that he made a מחאה then two are sufficient, however if we require publicity then three are required.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This follows the פי' הרשב"ם.</i> תוספות clarifies this מחלוקת.<br>----------------------------<br><b>ואי לאו משום סהדותא הוה סגי בחד דחברך חברא אית ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is seemingly disagreeing with the רשב"ם (ד"ה והכא), and maintains that even בפני א' it will certainly reach the מחזיק. </i> –</b><br><b>And if not for</b> the requirement <b>of עדות,</b> a מחאה in the presence <b>of one would have been sufficient since חברך חברא אית ליה,</b> however we cannot verify that a מחאה was made unless witnesses attest to it.<b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואף על פי שלשון הרע אין נשמע היינו לפי שמעלימין אותו מבני אדם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If he says the לה"ר in the presence of only two people, they assume that he does not want it publicized (since his statement can be interpreted in a negative fashion; see previous תוס' ד"ה לית (הב')). However here where he is making a מחאה there is no reason they should not publicize it.</i> –</b><br><b>And even though that לה"ר is not publicized</b> unless it is said in the presence of three, <b>that is because</b> by לה"ר the listeners have a tendency <b>to hide</b> the לה"ר <b>from</b> other <b>people,</b> therefore unless it is said בפני ג' there is no קול (and it is considered לה"ר), but by מחאה it is publicized because that is the purpose of a מחאה; they know he wants it publicized.<br>תוספות explains the view of the מ"ד בפני ג':<br><b>ומאן דאמר בפני ג' בעי גלויי מילתא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות may either mean that if it is בפני ב' they will not be מפרסם it, since they think it may be ל"ב; or in order that the מחזיק take the מחאה seriously, it is not sufficient that he (merely) hears about it (in a surreptitious manner), but rather it should be well publicized that everyone knows about it (see חי' הרשב"א הוצאת מוסד הרב קוק # 12, 14).</i> כמו בלשון הרע:</b><br><b>And the one who maintains בפני ג'</b> (even though it can be heard even בפני א'), <b>he requires that it should be well publicized just as by לה"ר,</b> that by three it is not לה"ר<b>.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מ"ד of מחאה בפני ב' maintains that it will reach the מחזיק even if he tells one person; the מ"ד בפני ג' maintains that it will not be publicized unless it is בפני ג'.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What are the relative advantages of פי' הרשב"ם and פי' התוס'?

Line 4

<b>כיון שמיחה שנה ראשונה שוב אין צריך למחות—Since he was מוחה the first year he is not required to be מוחה again</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>It was stated in the name of רב (or חייא בר רב) that once the מערער made a מחאה, he is not required to be מוחה again. A cursory reading may indicate that he never has to make another מחאה (even after three years elapsed since his initial מחאה). תוספות rejects this view and explains the פי' הרשב"ם.<br>----------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה לא.</i> עד סוף<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, סוף כל ג' וג' שנים.</i> ג' שנים –</b><br><b>The</b> רשב"ם <b>explained</b> that א"צ למחות means that a מחאה is not required <b>until the end of [each] three year</b> cycle; there should not be (more than) three years between מחאות.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מתניתין היא דקתני עד כדי שיחזיק שנה ויודיעוהו שנה ויבא לשנה אחרת וימחה –</b><br><b>And if you will say;</b> what is the חידוש of this ruling; this was already stated <b>in our משנה where it says,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">לח,א, this is in regards if the מערער lived (in אספמיא) a year away from the מחזיק.</i> ‘so that he will make a חזקה for a year and they will inform him</b> for <b>a year</b> <b>and</b> the מערער <b>will come the next</b> (third) <b>year and protest’ –<br>אלמא דאין צריך למחות רק פעם אחת תוך ג' שנים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over # 1.</i> –</b><br><b>It is evident</b> from the משנה <b>that he is only required to be מוחה once during the three years;</b> so what is the חידוש that כיון שמיחה שנה ראשונה שוב אין צריך למחות?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאי ממתניתין הוה אמינא דאין צריך כי אם מחאה אחת בסוף ג' –</b><br><b>And one can say; that if</b> we would only learn <b>from our משנה, I would have thought that only one מחאה is required at the end of three years</b> (as the case is regarding אסמפיא in our משנה, that he made a מחאה at the end of the third year)<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The מערער is ‘excused’ for not making the מחאה earlier, since it took that much time for the חזקה to reach him and for him to respond. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><b>אבל אם מיחה בתחלת ג' ושוב לא מיחה בכל אותן ג' סלקא דעתין דמודה שהיא שלו –</b><br><b>However</b> in a case <b>where</b> the מערער <b>was מוחה in the beginning of</b> the <b>three</b> years (i.e. in the [beginning of the] first year of the חזקה) <b>and he was not מוחה again for the entire</b> following <b>three years, we may have thought</b> that by not being continually מוחה, the מערער <b>is admitting that it</b> belongs to the מחזיק; for otherwise why is he not continually being מוחה, therefore the חידוש is that even if he made a מחאה in the beginning, that מחאה is valid for a period of three years.<br>תוספות rejects an alternate explanation of שוב א"צ למחות:<br><b>ואין לפרש דאין צריך למחות עד עולם<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage of this פירוש is that it would remove תוספות question that this חידוש was already stated in the משנה. According to this interpretation it was certainly not mentioned in the משנה. Nonetheless תוספות dismisses this interpretation.</i> –</b><br><b>And we cannot explain that אין צריך למחות</b> means that he is not required to be מוחה <b>forever,</b> after he made one מחאה –<br><b>דאם כן פליגי אדריש לקיש והוה ליה למימר ריש לקיש אמר:</b><br><b>For if indeed</b> this is sרב' intention that there need be no more מחאות, then רב <b>argues with ר"ל</b> (who maintains וצריך למחות בסוף כל ג' וג'), <b>so</b> the גמרא <b>should have stated ר"ל אמר</b> (which indicates a disagreement with the previous opinion [namely רב]), <b>and not אמר ר"ל</b> (which indicates a new statement but no argument).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>שוב א"צ למחות means that he need not be מוחה until three years have passed.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות asks that we already know the דין of שוב א"צ למחות from our משנה.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4</i> However, in our משנה he could not be מוחה more often, but in a case where he could be מוחה more often perhaps he is required to be מוחה (בכל שנה)?<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שמה.</i><br>2. תוספות states in his answer<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> that in the הו"א we would have thought that if he was מוחה in the beginning and then not מוחה till the end of the three years that it should be a חזקה, since it appears that the מערער is מודה that it belongs to the מחזיק. Would we also have assumed then that if he was not מערער until (before) the end of three years (when he was close enough to be מוחה earlier) that by not being מוחה he is also מודה that it belongs to the מערער? What is the difference between the two cases?<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

Line 5

<b>'וצריך למחות בסוף כל ג—And it is necessary to protest at the end of each three</b> years<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>ר"ל ruled (in the name of בר קפרא) that there must be a מחאה within each three year cycle. A מחאה cannot be effective for more than three years. תוספות discusses the reasons for this ruling, and the validity of this ruling.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>אין לפרש דטעמא שלא יאמר לקחתי אחר המחאה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If the מערער made a מחאה and four years later he comes again, the מחזיק can claim that he bought the field sometime after the מחאה and was החזיק for three years and lost the שטר. The מערער would then (seemingly) lose the field; therefore it is incumbent on the מערער to be מערער within three years of his last מחאה, so that the מחזיק should never have a חזקה. This ruling would then be more like an עצה טובה to the מערער.</i> –</b><br><b>It cannot be explained that the reason</b> why צריך למחות בסוף כל ג' is <b>in order that</b> the מחזיק <b>should not claim, ‘I bought it</b> from you <b>after the מחאה’;</b> this cannot be the reason –<br><b>כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה אמר ר"ל (בסופו).</i> כיון דעל כרחו מודה דמעיקרא קודם מחאה לא בתורת מכירה נחת בהם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">We are concerned that if the מערער was not מוחה for three years after his first מחאה, the מחזיק may claim that I bought it after the (first) מחאה and made a חזקה for three years after the (first) מחאה. This should be of no concern. We know that the מחזיק was in the field the first year, for the מערער made a מחאה based on the sמחזיק' occupation of his field in the presence of עדים. If the מחזיק will subsequently claim that he bought it in year two (for instance), it will be understood that in year one he was in the field illegally. Once it is established that he was there illegally, a חזקה will not be sufficient to establish the field in his possession. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>As</b> the רשב"ם <b>negated</b> this explanation, for <b>since perforce</b> the מחזיק <b>admits that initially before</b> the first <b>מחאה he entered the field without buying it –<br>אין נאמן לומר אחרי כן קניתי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Once someone is established as a גזלן in a field he cannot rely on a חזקה, but must have a שטר. See לקמן מז,א.</i> –</b><br><b>He is not believed to claim I bought it afterwards.</b><br>תוספות offers another reason to negate this interpretation:<br><b>ועוד דאם כן שפיר קרי ליה גזלן<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ל ruled that the מחאה must be made within three years, for otherwise (according to this explanation) the מחזיק will be זוכה by claiming, ‘I bought it from you after the מחאה’. The גמרא cites that ר' יוחנן disagreed with this ruling (that the מחזיק will have a חזקה if there is no מחאה within three years) and said, ‘but can a גזלן have a חזקה’. Seemingly ר"י was referring to this מחזיק as a גזלן. The גמרא asked why does ר"י refer to this מחזיק as a גזלן just because there was an ערער; nothing was proven yet. However according to this explanation that the מחזיק admits that he was in the field illegally the first year (he bought the field after the מחאה), then ר"י is right by calling the מחזיק a גזלן. What was the sגמרא' question! </i> –</b><br><b>And in addition if indeed</b> this is the concern, <b>so it is proper for him to be called a גזלן!</b><br>תוספות continues to give the correct interpretation:<br><b>אלא טעמא כדפירש הקונטרס משום דתלת שנין מזדהר איניש בשטריה אחר המחאה ותו לא –</b><br><b>But rather the reason</b> why a מחאה is required every three years is <b>as</b> the רשב"ם <b>explained it, <sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> because a person is careful</b> to watch <b>his שטר for three years after the מחאה, but no longer</b> than three years. Therefore if the מערער will wait longer than three years between מחאות, the מחזיק will claim that (he bought the field initially before the first מחאה, but) since three years passed without a מחאה (he assumed it to be frivolous) and he lost the שטר.<b></b><br>תוספות notes a contradiction from another ruling:<br><b>ולהאי טעמא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> הא דאמר לעיל (דף לא,א) אבל אכלה שית שנין אין לך מחאה גדולה מזו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The (details of the) case there (which are relevant to us) is that the מערער brought a שטר that he bought this field four years ago from the same מוכר from which the מחזיק (who has no שטר) claims he bought the field. The ruling is that if the מחזיק can bring עדים that he made a חזקה beginning three years prior to the שטר of the מערער, which is seven years prior to the current date (so that by the time the מערער allegedly bought the field the מחזיק already had his חזקה ג' שנים and need not keep his שטר), the field remains by the מחזיק. However if the מחזיק can only bring proof that he was מחזיק for two years prior to the alleged sale to the מערער (six years before the current date), the field is given to the מערער. We consider this שטר which is dated four years ago (at which point the מחזיק was there for only two years and did not have a חזקה and presumably still had his שטר) as a proper מחאה (on part of the מוכר), which should have caused the מחזיק to keep his שטר, until now. Even though the מחזיק made an additional חזקה for four years after the alleged sale to the מערער, nevertheless (it seems from that גמרא) that once the מחאה was made (with this שטר from four years ago) the מחזיק must keep his שטר (indefinitely or until he settles with the מערער). This contradicts our גמרא which requires the מערער to make a מחאה every three years, and in that case since four years passed since the מחאה (with his שטר מכירה) the field should have remained by the מחזיק. </i> –</b><br><b>And according to this reason</b> (that a מחאה must be made every three years for otherwise the מחזיק does not keep his שטר), <b>that which</b> the גמרא <b>stated previously, ‘but if he consumed</b> the פירות <b>for</b> (only) <b>six years, there is no מחאה greater than this’,</b> that גמרא –<br><b>פליגא<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See הגהות הב"ח (ח) who cites the רא"ש that there is no contradiction between these two גמרות. See רשב"ם ל,ב ד"ה וה"מ who offers another explanation why there is no contradiction (see נח"מ).</i> אהך דהכא דקאמר דצריך למחות כל ג'<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א that according to the אין לפרש there will be no difficulty, because since in the case of אכלה שית the מחזיק never claimed לקחתי אחר המחאה, therefore he loses the field, however generally we are concerned that he may claim לקחתי אחר המחאה, therefore he should be מוחה every three years.</i> –</b><br><b>Argues with that which</b> is <b>stated here,</b> namely <b>that he is required to be מוחה every three years.</b><br>תוספות concludes:<br><b>ונראה דכההיא הלכתא דסתמא דגמרא קאמר לה –</b><br><b>And it is the view</b> of תוספות <b>that the הלכה is like that</b> previous גמרא, <b>for the גמרא</b> there <b>stated it anonymously –<br>ולא כמו שפסק רבינו חננאל דהלכה כבר קפרא:</b><br><b>And not like the ר"ח who ruled that the הלכה is like בר קפרא</b> that a מחאה must be every three years, but rather one מחאה is sufficient.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A מחאה must be made every three years for otherwise that מחזיק will not keep the שטר. The הלכה however (according to תוספות) is that it is not necessary.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות explained that we are not concerned that the מחזיק will claim that I bought it from you after the מחאה, because then he will have entered the field initially illegally and he cannot have a חזקה (because he is a גזלן) and the field will revert to the מערער. Seemingly the מחזיק can reply that in truth I bought it before the מחאה, but after you made the מחאה I decided to buy it from you again so there will be no complaints. We find<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See ל,ב where רבא states, עביד איניש דזבין דיניה.</i> this to be a valid argument previously!<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

Line 6



Line 7

<b>מחאה בפני שנים ואין צריך לומר כתובו—A מחאה is in the presence of two and it is not necessary to say, ‘write it’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא taught in the name of רב נחמן that a מחאה can be made in the presence of (only) two witnesses, and these witnesses may (formally) write down their testimony (that a מחאה was made),<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה מחאה that the עדים will present this document to the מערער as a proof that he made a proper מחאה.</i> even though the מערער did not order them to write it down. תוספות discusses what is the purpose and effectiveness of this document that the עדים write and attest to.<br>----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומה מועיל הכתיבה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות question is on מודעה and קיום שטרות as well, as is evident in תוספות answer (see footnote # 10).</i> –</b><br><b>And if you will say, but what will this writing help (</b>the מערער) –<br><b>והא לא חשיב שטר אם לא נעשה מדעת מי שהוא חובתו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">One explanation why a שטר must be written מדעת המתחייב to be considered a valid שטר is (see נח"מ) because seemingly every שטר should be פסול because of מפיהם ולא מפי כתבם (see footnote # 5 & 7). However if it is written מדעת המתחייב it is not considered מפי כתבם (of the עדים) but rather מפי כתבו (of the מתחייב). See סוכ"ד (דף מ,א) אות ג' for an alternate explanation.</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> a written document <b>is not considered a</b> valid <b>שטר unless it is written with the consent of the one</b> for whom the שטר is <b>to his detriment –<br>כגון שטר מכר מדעת מוכר ושטר מתנה מדעת נותן ושטר מלוה מדעת לוה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In these three cases of a sale, a gift, and a loan the ones that stand to lose if the שטר is effective are the seller, the grantor, and the borrower respectively (the seller and grantor are transferring away their assets and the borrower becomes liable for the loan), therefore their respective consent is required to make those שטרות valid.</i> –</b><br><b>For instance a bill of sale</b> must be written <b>with the consent of the seller and a note of a gift</b> must be written <b>with the consent of the giver, and a note of a loan</b> must be written <b>with the consent of the borrower;</b> however here the מחזיק (who stands to lose from this note) never consented that it be written. Therefore it is not considered a שטר.<br>תוספות rejects another purported purpose of this note<br><b>ועדות נמי לא חשיב דמפיהם ולא מפי כתבם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The תורה writes (דברים [שופטים] יט,טו) that על פי שנים עדים וגו' יקום דבר. The גמרא in יבמות לא,ב interprets the word 'פי' to teach us that we require that the testimony of witnesses come from their mouth, but not from their writing.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> this note <b>can also not be considered as testimony, because of ‘from their mouths but not from their writing’ –<br>ופירש רש"י בפירוש החומש<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">שם בד"ה על.</i> שלא יכתבו עדותן באיגרת וישלחו לבית דין –</b><br><b>And רש"י explained</b> this <b>in his commentary on the חומש</b> that ולא מפי כתבם means <b>that the</b> עדים <b>should not write their testimony in a letter and send it to בי"ד.</b> Therefore here too, the note with the signatures of the עדים cannot be used in בי"ד as a proof that a מחאה was made. <sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">From תוספות elsewhere (see כתובות כ,א ד"ה ור"י) it is apparent that by a regular valid שטר we do not void it because of מפיהם ולא מפי כתבם since עדים החתומים על השטר נעשה כמי שנחקרה עדותן בבי"ד [or because it is written מדעת המתחייב (see footnote # 3)]. However since in our case here it is not a valid שטר since it was not written מדעת המתחייב, therefore it cannot be considered (even) as הגדת עדות, because of the פסול of מפיהם ולא מפי כתבם.</i> The question remains what is the purpose of the עדים writing that the מערער was מוחה when (seemingly) it is ineffective?!<b></b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דתקנת חכמים היא שיהא חשוב עדות כדי לבטל החזקה בעדות כל דהו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">This testimony is flawed מן התורה since it is in violation of ולא מפי כתבם, nevertheless the חכמים gave it minimal power to be מבטל a חזקה. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1. We know that we can be מבטל a חזקה even with minimal support, as תוספות points out.   </i> –</b><br><b>And one can say that this is an enactment of the חכמים that it should be considered</b> a proper <b>testimony in order to nullify the חזקה</b> (even) <b>with minimal testimony,</b> for the ruling is –<br><b>שבדבר מועט מבטלים החזקה –</b><br><b>That</b> even <b>with minimal evidence we nullify the חזקה –</b><br>תוספות proves that a חזקה can be nullified even with a minimal cause:<br><b>דהא אפילו יתברר לנו שלא שמע המחזיק מחאה מהני לבטל החזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly if the מחזיק did not hear the מחאה we cannot fault him for not keeping the שטר past the third year. Nevertheless since the מערער did what is necessary, the property reverts back to him, for the מחאה alone nullifies the חזקה, even without the ריעותא that the מחזיק should have kept his שטר.</i> –</b><br><b>For even if we will determine that the מחזיק did not hear the מחאה,</b> nevertheless if we can verify that a מחאה was made that <b>is sufficient to nullify the חזקה.</b><br>תוספות explains the efficacy of writing a מודעה:<br><b>וגם במודעא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2. A מודעא is when the seller of a property gives notice beforehand that he is being forced to sell unwillingly and he declares the sale null and void (see רשב"ם ד"ה וכן on מ,א). The same question applies there, what is the purpose of writing it since it is not a שטר (for it is not written מדעת המתחייב [the buyer]) and it is מפי כתבם.</i> תקנת חכמים היא להציל הנאנס –</b><br><b>And similarly by מודעא it is a תקנת חכמים</b> that it should be a valid testimony <b>to protect the oppressed –<br>וקיום שטרות נמי משום דמעשה בית דין הוא וכל מעשה בית דין נכתב שלא מרצון החייב<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">מעשה בי"ד may not have a דין of a שטר (since it is written שלא מדעת המתחייב; the לוה has no say in the process of קיום), nevertheless what they write in the מעשה בי"ד (like קיום שטרות) is valid because the limitation of מפיהם ולא מפי כתבים applies to עדים but not to בי"ד.</i> –</b><br><b>And also</b> regarding <b>קיום שטרות</b> it is a valid testimony <b>because it is an enactment of בי"ד and every מעשה בי"ד is written without the consent of the liable</b> party.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation of מפיהם ולא מפי כתבם:<b><br>ועוד אומר רבינו יצחק ששמע מן רבינו תם שנוהגים לשלח העדים עדותם באיגרת לבית דין –</b><br><b>And in addition, the ר"י stated that he heard from ר"ת that the custom is for עדים to send their testimony to בי"ד in a letter –<br>וחשיב עדות<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">It is apparent from that which תוספות shortly asks (see footnote # 15) and answers that according to the ר"ת when the עדים sent their עדות in an אגרת to בי"ד it has the strength of a שטר (and not merely the strength of הגדת עדות). This means that just as a שטר is valid even if the עדי השטר died (or do not remember the testimony) nevertheless the שטר is still valid. Similarly if the עדים sent their עדות to בי"ד in an אגרת. However if it is considered (merely) הגדת עדות, it will be valid only if the עדים (are alive and) remember the הגדת עדות as תוספות will mention shortly. It would also seem that according to the ר"ת there is no need that it be written מדעת המתחייב in order to be considered a שטר (see footnote # 3) since according to the ר"ת the פסול of ולא מפי כתבם comes only to exclude an אלם but not עדות בכתב [see בל"י אות שנג ד"ה ומכל זה]).</i> –</b><br><b>And it is considered a</b> valid <b>testimony –</b><br>תוספות responds to the obvious question:<br><b>והא דדרשינן בספרי מפיהם ולא מפי כתבם –</b><br><b>And that which the ספרי infers</b> that it must be only <b>מפיהם but not מפי כתבם</b>, so how can the עדים send in written testimony to בי"ד?! תוספות responds –<br><b>לא אתא אלא למעוטי דוקא אלם שאינו בר הגדה אבל ראוי להגדה אין הגדה מעכבת בו<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">According to this view (that an עד may send his testimony to בי"ד in writing) it is understood that the writing of the מחאה (or מודעה) is a valid testimony [as a שטר] and not (merely) a תקנת חכמים as תוספות previously answered.</i> –</b><br><b>That is coming only to specifically exclude a mute who is one who cannot testify orally, however one who can speak, it is not necessary for him to speak,</b> but he can even send his testimony to בי"ד in writing.<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן בפרק ב' דכתובות (דף כ,א) כותב אדם עדותו על השטר –</b><br><b>And that which</b> the ברייתא <b>states in the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>כתובות, ‘a person may write his testimony on a note –<br>ומעיד עליה אחר כמה שנים והוא שזוכר מעצמו<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there ד"ה שזוכרה מעצמו who explains בלא ראיית השטר נזכר קצת מעדותו מאליו. Even ר' יוחנן who argues with ר"ה and maintains that it is a valid עדות even if it is אין זוכרה מעצמו, nevertheless he too maintains that it is עדות כשרה if after he sees the notes he reminds himself (partially) of the testimony. However if he does not remember even after consulting his notes, it is not a valid testimony. See (רש"י and) תוס' there ד"ה ור"י.</i> אבל אין זוכר מעצמו לא –</b><br><b>And testify</b> from <b>this</b> note even <b>after many years’</b> have passed from the time of the incident. רב הונא qualified that this rule is valid ‘<b>providing that he remembers on his own, however if he does not remember on his own</b> he may <b>not</b> testify from this note’. This concludes the citation from כתובות. Seemingly this contradicts what תוספות just ruled that a note is admissible testimony!<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">It is apparent from this question that when the ר"ת stated that עדים may send in their written testimony to בי"ד, he meant that it would be considered as a שטר and therefore valid even if the עדים do not remember the testimony. Therefore we have the contradiction from כתובות where the גמרא requires that he remember the testimony. However if the ר"ת would have meant that written testimony is valid (merely) as הגדת עדות but not as a שטר, then there is no contradiction from כתובות since the ר"ת also meant that the written testimony is valid (like all הגדת עדות) only if זוכרה מעצמו (see footnote # 12).</i><br>תוספות responds that the ruling there –<br><b>היינו כשאינו מוציא כתב ידו בבית דין<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The עד there does not remember the testimony (מעצמו); he reads over his note and then testifies personally in בי"ד without presenting the note. This is similar to עד מפי עד (which is פסול), since he is testifying on something which he does not recall on his own (see נח"מ).</i> –</b><br><b>Is in a case where he does not present his hand written</b> note <b>in בי"ד.</b> However if he would present his note to בי"ד in would be a valid עדות (even if אינו זוכרה מעצמו).<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">If he sends his written עדות to בי"ד however, it has the validity of a שטר (see footnote # 12).</i><br>תוספות offers an alternate distinction:<br><b>ועוד שמא עד אחד בכתב אין חשוב עדות שאין שטר אלא בב' –</b><br><b>And in addition, perhaps the writing of one עד is not considered a testimony for there can be no שטר unless two</b> people sign it –<br><b>להכי לא מהני בההיא דכתובות אפילו יוצא<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read יוציא (instead of יוצא).</i> כתב ידו אלא אם כן זוכר בראיית עדות<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">If however one does remember the testimony on his own he is permitted to present this testimony in writing to בי"ד without him being present, as תוספות ruled previously. </i> –</b><br><b>Therefore in that case in</b> מסכת <b>כתובות</b> the note <b>is not</b> an <b>effective</b> testimony <b>even if he would present his hand written note, unless he recalls seeing</b> the event <b>as a witness.</b><br>תוספות comments:<br><b>וצריך עיון בההיא דעד אחד בכתב בגט פשוט<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there cites a מחלוקת between אביי and אמימר in a case of ע"א בשטר וע"א בעל פה; meaning there was a שטר (מלוה) where only one עד signed, and another עד testified orally that there was a loan. אביי maintains that it is invalid, while אמימר maintains that it is a valid שטר and can collect from נכסים משועבדים. It appears (see the תוספות there) that if it would be a case where the two עדים would sign on two separate documents even אביי would agree that it is a valid שטר. This contradicts that which תוספות just ruled that an ע"א בשטר is not a valid שטר. [An ע"א בכתב is a valid עדות (so the מלוה would collect from נכסים בני חורין), but since it is not a שטר, the מלוה cannot collect from נכסים משועבדין (according to שיטת תוס') which seems to be contradicted from the גמרא there, which maintains that it is a valid שטר.]  </i> (לקמן דף קסה,א ושם דיבור המתחיל אמר) –</b><br><b>And</b> some <b>contemplation is necessary regarding the case of ‘one עד in a note’,</b> which is discussed <b>in</b> פרק <b>גט פשוט,</b> to reconcile it with that which תוספות stated here.<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות כא for a possible explanation.</i><b></b><br>In summation: according to the first explanation (of the ר"ת), an עד can send in his written testimony and it is valid even though he may not remember his testimony. The עד may use his notes as an aid if he remembers (somewhat). According to the second explanation even if he presents his note in בי"ד it is not considered a שטר, but merely עדות and is valid only if he remembers.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי קא משמע לן דאין צריך לומר כתובו פשיטא כיון דזכותו הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –</b><br><b>And if you will say; what is</b> רבא אמר ר"נ <b>teaching us that it is not necessary</b> (for the מערער) <b>to say</b> to the עדים<b>, ‘write’; it is obvious</b> that they can record what he told them <b>since it is for his benefit –</b><br>תוספות offers a partial answer:<br><b>ובמחאה איכא למימר דנקיט ביה ואין צריך לומר כתובו אגב אחריני –</b><br><b>And regarding מחאה it is possible to answer that he mentions ואצ"ל כתובו, because of the other cases</b> where it was necessary to mention ואצ"ל כתובו like by קנין<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Regarding קנין it is a חוב for the מוכר and nevertheless the ruling is that אצ"ל כתובו.</i> –<br><b>ולא אתא לאשמועינן במחאה אלא שהיא בפני ב' –</b><br><b>And by מחאה all</b> that רבא אמר ר"נ <b>wanted to teach us is that it requires the presence of</b> only <b>two</b> and not three as ר' אבהו אמר ר"י ruled –<br><b>אבל במודעא קשה למאי איצטריך –</b><br><b>However by מודעא it is difficult why is it necessary to</b> mention<b></b> it at all. It obviously needs only two<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">Their role is merely to be עדים that he was מוסר מודעה; there is no reason we should require more than two.</i> (and not three) and certainly אצ"ל כתובו since it is לזכותו.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאתא לאשמועינן דאף על פי שלא צוה להם לכתוב והם כתבו שצוה כשרה –</b><br><b>And one can say that</b> רבא אמר ר"נ <b>comes to teach us that even though that he did not tell them to write, but they wrote that he commanded</b> them to write, nevertheless <b>it is כשר –<br>ולא מיחזי כשקרא דמסתמא לפיכך מחה או מסר מודעא בפניהם כדי שיכתבו</b><sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See thinking it over # 3.</i><b>:</b><br><b>And it does not appear like a false statement, for presumably the reason he was מוחה or gave over the מודעה in their presence was in order that they should write</b> it.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The written מחאה is effective either because it is a תק"ח or because עדים may submit their testimony בכתב. The חידוש of אצ"ל כתובו is that it is not מיחזי כשקרא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes in his initial answer that writing a מחאה is effective (even though it is not considered a שטר or הגדת עדות), because it is a תק"ח to be מבטל the חזקה even with a דבר מועט.<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> Does the תק"ח make this written מחאה into a valid שטר, or does it (merely) accept their writing as הגדת עדות?<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שנב (what the difference would be if it is a שטר or הגדת עדות).</i><br>2. תוספות asks what is the חידוש that א"צ לומר כתובו.<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 22.</i> Is this a general question or only a question on פי' ר"ת?<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות כב.</i><br>3. תוספות explains that the חידוש of אצ"ל כתובו is that it is not מחזי כשקרא.<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 25.</i> Why however was it necessary to repeat it by מודעה once it was already stated by מחאה?<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

<b>קנין<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A קנין (which usually refers to קנין סודר) is an act which finalizes an agreement between two parties; for instance the transfer of assets. The קונה (or the עדים that act on his behalf) give a כלי to the מקנה, and by the מקנה accepting the כלי, the transaction is complete and final and neither can retract.</i> בפני ב' ואין צריך כולי—A קנין is</b> done <b>in the presence of two and does not require, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא אמר ר"נ stated that קנין is performed in the presence of two; (seemingly) indicating, that if there are not two עדים present to observe the קנין it is not effective. תוספות disabuses us of this notion.<br>---------------------------<br><b>אומר רבינו תם דלא אתא למעוטי שלא יהא חשוב קנין כשנעשה שלא בפני שנים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The reason ר"נ says קנין בפני ב' is only to teach us that even if it was done בפני ב' (and not בפני ג'), nevertheless אצ"ל כתובו (see תוס' סנהדרין ו,א ד"ה צריכא on the top of the עמוד ב').</i> –</b><br><b>The ר"ת says that</b> the statement קנין בפני ב' <b>does not come to exclude that it will not be considered a קנין if it is not performed in the presence of two</b> עדים –<br><b>דהא אמרינן בקדושין (דף סה,ב) דלא איברו סהדי אלא לשקרי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there relates that מר זוטרא and רב אדא סבא (the sons of רב מרי בר איסר) divided the estate of their father (without witnesses). They asked רב אשי whether the division is valid since they were no עדים to effectuate the division. רב אשי responded that witnesses are made for the sole purpose that no one should deny that a transaction was made. However the transaction (in this case the division) is effective even without witnesses. Similarly here the קנין is valid regardless if there are witnesses or not. [One of the exceptions to this rule is by גיטין וקדושין that if there were no witnesses that the גט or קידושין were given, it will not be considered גיטין וקדושין, even if both parties agreed that the גיטין וקדושין took place. The reason is because by the act of גיטין וקדושין we are חב לאחריני (others cannot marry these people). Therefore the עדי גיטין וקדושין are sometimes referred to as עדי קיום as opposed to other עדים who are (merely) עדי בירור.]</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> רב אשי <b>stated in</b> מסכת <b>קדושין, ‘that witnesses were created only for liars’ –</b><br>תוספות offers an additional proof the קנין is valid without עדים.<br><b>ואמרינן בפרק הזהב (בבא מציעא דף מו,א) גבי היה עומד בגורן כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there (on מה,ב) cites a ברייתא, ‘a man (who wanted to exempt himself from paying the חומש when redeeming his מעשר שני) who had no money with him says to his friend, ‘these פירות of מע"ש are given to you as a present’ and then he says to him, ‘those פירות מע"ש that you now own, I am redeeming them with the monies which I have in my house’. The advantage for him is that since he was not פודה his מע"ש but his friend’s he is not required to add the חומש. The גמרא inferred that if he would have money it would be better to transfer the money to his friend (than the מע"ש) and have his friend redeem the מע"ש. In this way it would be less of a הערמה (for we all know that he is not [really] granting the מע"ש to his friend). The גמרא then asked why should he transfer the פירות to his friend and then he should redeem the מע"ש of his friend, when it would be more appropriate that he transfer the money (which he has in his house) to his friend through קנין חליפין and his friend will redeem his מע"ש (also without paying the חומש).</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>states in פרק הזהב, regarding</b> the case where <b>he was standing on the threshing</b> floor, etc. –<br><b>ואי אמרינן מטבע נקנה בחליפין ניקנינהו ניהליה אגב סודר –</b><br><b>‘And if we maintain that coins can be acquired through</b> קנין <b>חליפין, let</b> the owner of the מע"ש <b>transfer to his</b> friend the money in his house <b>through</b> קנין <b>סודר,</b> and his friend will redeem the מע"ש (without paying the חומש) –<br><b>ומפרק דלית ליה סודר<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This means he had no article (or כלי) with which to perform קנין חליפין. However he was able to transfer the פירות, which were there in the גורן, through קנין משיכה. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>replies that he has no kerchief;</b> the גמרא asks <b>–<br>ולקנינהו אגב קרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The owner of the פירות מע"ש should grant his friend a small piece of the גורן through קנין חזקה and be מקנה to him the money in his house through קנין אגב (by which one acquires the מטלטלין אגב קרקע). </i> דלית ליה –</b><br><b>And let him transfer</b> the money to his friend through קנין <b>אגב קרקע,</b> and the גמרא responds <b>he has no</b> קרקע. The גמרא asks how can you say he has no קרקע –<br><b>והא עומד בגורן קתני כשאינו שלו –</b><br><b>But the ברייתא states he was standing on the threshing floor,</b> the גמרא responds the גורן <b>did not belong to him;</b> the גמרא finally asks –<br><b>איכפל תנא לאשמועינן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The תנא stated the case that he transfers the פירות instead of the מעות (which would be more appropriate) because we are discussing a case of a גברא ערטילאי דלית ליה כלום! The תנא should teach us by a regular case where he has a סודר or קרקע etc.</i> בגברא ערטילאי דלית ליה כלום –</b><br><b>Did the תנא trouble</b> himself <b>to let us know</b> this rule in the most unusual case <b>of a naked man who owns nothing –<br>אלא שמע מינה דאין מטבע נקנה בחליפין<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore his only option is to be מקנה him the פירות מע"ש, since the monies (which are not here) cannot be transferred through חליפין.</i> –</b><br><b>But rather we can derive from this ברייתא that coins cannot be acquired through</b> קנין <b>חליפין.</b> This concludes the citation from the גמרא in ב"מ. Now תוספות concludes with his proof that no עדים are required for חליפין –<br><b>ואי לא חשיב קנין בלא עדים לישנינן דליכא עדים<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא should have responded that perhaps מטבע נקנית בחליפין, however here there were no עדים to validate the קנין.</i> –</b><br><b>And if</b> by קנין סודר <b>it is not considered a קנין without עדים</b> the גמרא <b>should have answered that there was no עדים.</b> This proves that קנין סודר is effective even without עדים.<br>תוספות offers one final proof:<br><b>ועוד דבפרק קמא דסנהדרין (דף ו,א.) אמרו רבנן פשרה<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">A פשרה is where the two litigants agree to compromise as the דיין will see fit (even if it is not in complete accordance with the strict interpretation of the law).</i> ביחיד –</b><br><b>And furthermore the רבנן maintain in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>סנהדרין that a compromise</b> can be done <b>with</b> only <b>one</b> דיין, we do not require a בי"ד of three –<br><b>אף על גב דפשרה בעיא קנין<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The litigants must make a קנין סודר in which they commit their assets to pay the other litigant whatever the result of the compromise demands.</i> כדמסיק התם:<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות in סנהדרין ד"ה צריכה rejects this proof, writing: ואין ראיה מכאן כלל דיכול להקנות בפני שנים לקיים הפשרה שעשה ביחיד.</i></b><br><b>Even though that a פשרה requires a קנין as</b> the גמרא <b>concludes there.</b> If קנין requires two עדים, how can only one person rule on the פשרה? This proves (again) that קנין does not require עדים.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>A קנין סודר is valid without anyone being present to witness it.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>If we were to maintain that קנין (סודר) requires two (not like the ר"ת), what would be the ruling regarding other קנינים, such as משיכה, חזקה, etc.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> would they also require שנים?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>
<b>ואין צריך לומר כתובו—And it is not necessary to say, ‘write it’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא אמר ר"נ taught that if a קנין is made in the presence of two עדים, those עדים may write up a שטר stating that this קנין took place and give it to the beneficiary even though the מקנה (seller, benefactor) did not tell them to write it up as a שטר. Our תוספות clarifies the details of this ruling.<br>---------------------------<br><b>וכותבין בלא רשותו כל זמן שלא חזר בו –</b><br><b>And</b> the עדים <b>may write</b> this שטר <b>without his</b> explicit <b>permission as long as he did not retract</b> (and tell the עדים specifically that he does not want this קנין to be written up in a שטר) –<br><b>ומיהו יכול לחזור בו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The מקנה may have his reason why he does not want this transaction to be documented (he does not want it publicized, etc. [see תוספות לקמן עז,א ד"ה חוזר]).</i> כדאמרינן לקמן בפרק המוכר את הספינה (דף עז,א) –</b><br><b>However he can retract</b> (and prevent the עדים from writing the שטר) <b>as</b> רב <b>states later in פרק המוכר את הספינה;</b> if someone says to עדים –<br><b>זכו בשדה זו לפלוני<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The עדים give the מקנה a סודר (on behalf of the recipient) and when the מקנה accepts the סודר the ownership of the field is transferred from the מקנה to the קונה through קנין חליפין. The recipient need not even be aware of this transactions, since it is for his benefit and זכין לאדם שלא בפניו,</i> וכתבו לו את השטר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The שטר (in this instance), which will be given to the קונה, will serve (merely) as proof that the קונה owns this field from this date onwards. The acquisition of the field was already accomplished through the קנין חליפין.</i> חוזר בשטר ואינו חוזר בשדה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It is evident from this גמרא that even when the קנין חליפין is effective (אינו חוזר בשדה), nevertheless the מקנה can prevent the עדים from writing a שטר should he so desire (חוזר בשטר).</i> –</b><br><b>‘Acquire this field on behalf of that person and write a שטר for him</b> that he owns the field’; the grantor <b>may retract regarding the שטר</b> <b>(</b>that the עדים who were זוכה the field on behalf of the recipient cannot write a שטר מתנה that the grantor gave this field to the recipient) <b>however</b> the grantor <b>cannot retract</b> the giving of <b>the field</b> (the field will belong to the קונה albeit without a שטר to prove that it is his).<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן בריש אף על פי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states: אמר לעדים כתבו וחתמו והבו ליה קנו מיניה לא צריך אימלוכי ביה לא קנו מיני (פומבדיתא אמרי לא צריך אימלוכי ביה) בני מתא מחסיא אמרי צריך אימלוכי ביה והלכתא צריך אימלוכי ביה:</i> (כתובות דף נה,א ושם דיבור המתחיל כתובו) –</b><br><b>And</b> <b>regarding that which</b> <b>the גמרא</b> <b>states in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>אע"פ</b>, if someone said to עדים –<br><b>כתובו וחתומו והבו ליה קנו מיניה לא צריך לאימלוכי ביה –</b><br><b>‘Write</b> <b>a</b> שטר מתנה <b>and sign it and give it to the</b> <b>recipient’, if</b> the עדים <b>preformed a קנין</b> חליפין<b></b> to acquire the property on behalf of the recipient, <b>it is not necessary for the</b> עדים <b>to consult with the</b> grantor.<b></b> It would superficially seem from that גמרא that the reason the עדים need not consult with the grantor regarding writing the שטר is (only) because he told them 'כתובו', otherwise (it seems) the עדים would need to consult with the grantor, not as it seems from our גמרא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over # 1’</i> –<br>תוספות responds; the reason they do not need to consult with the grantor –<br><b>לאו דוקא משום דאמר להו כתובו דאפילו לא אמר להו נמי כדאמרינן הכא –</b><br><b>Is not specifically because he told the</b> עדים, <b>‘write it’, for even if he did not tell the</b> עדים ‘write it’, the rule would <b>also</b> be that they do not need to consult him, <b>as</b> <b>the גמרא states here –<br>אלא משום דבעי למימר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> לא קנו מיניה צריך לאימלוכי ביה אף על גב דאמר להו כתובו:</b><br><b>But rather</b> the reason the גמרא mentions 'כתובו' <b>is because</b> the גמרא <b>wanted to teach</b> us (the concluding rule) <b>that if the</b> עדים <b>did not make a קנין</b> with the grantor, <b>they do need to consult with him</b> again immediately prior to writing the שטר <b>even though he</b> already <b>told them 'כתובו'!</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מקנה may change his mind and prevent the עדים from writing the שטר before it was written.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i><br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Is תוספות question from פרק אע"פ<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> connected to what תוספות stated initially that he may retract as long as the שטר was not written, or is it merely a contradiction between the two גמרות?<br>2. Can the מקנה prevent the delivery of the שטר to the קונה after it was written,<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> but before it was delivered?<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם לקמן עז,א ד"ה חוזר.</i>
<b>קיום שטרות בשלשה—Ratification of notes is with three</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא אמר רב נחמן teaches that three people are required to authenticate the signatures of witnesses on a שטר, but two are not sufficient (as opposed to מחאה, מודעה, הודאה, קנין, where two are sufficient). תוספות discusses this ruling.<br>----------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>אף על גב דרב נחמן גופיה סבירא ליה בסנהדרין (דף ה,ב) ב' שדנו דיניהם דין –</b><br><b>Even though ר"נ himself maintains in</b> מסכת <b>סנהדרין</b> that if <b>two people</b> passed <b>judgment, their ruling is valid,</b> so why do we say here that three are required for קיום שטרות and two will not be acceptable even בדיעבד?!<b></b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>קיום שטרות שאני כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה קיום.</i> –</b><br><b>קיום שטרות is different as</b> the רשב"ם <b>explained</b> why two are unacceptable even בדיעבד –<br><b>דאי ליכא אלא ב' מה יש בין קיום שטר לשטר שלמעלה הימנו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The קיום השטר is (generally) written on the bottom under the witnesses’ signatures.</i> –</b><br><b>For if there are only two</b> who are מקיים the שטר, <b>what</b> difference <b>is there between the קיום השטר</b> (where only two authenticate it) <b>to the</b> actual <b>שטר which is above</b> the קיום which also has two people signed on it, for –<br><b>הכא תרי חתימי והכא תרי חתימי –</b><br><b>For here</b> (by the קיום) <b>two sign and here</b> (by the שטר) also <b>two sign –<br>ודומה לב' עדים ששמעו מפי עדים שלמעלה שהשטר כשר ועד מפי עד פסול –</b><br><b>So</b> the קיום appears <b>similar to two witnesses who heard from</b> the two <b>witnesses</b> signed <b>above that the שטר is כשר, but</b> the ruling is <b>that one עד</b> who testifies what he heard from <b>another עד,</b> that testimony <b>is invalid.</b> That is the problem with קיום of two –<br><b>אבל כשהם ג' ניכר שהם בית דין שהעידו עדים לפניהם על כתב ידם והכשירו השטר –</b><br><b>However when the</b> מקיימי השטר <b>are three, it is apparent that they are a בי"ד, in front of whom עדים testified regarding their handwriting, and</b> the three <b>approved the שטר</b><br><b>ודומה לפסק דין –<br>So then it is similar to a פס"ד</b> and not merely to an עדות.<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן בפרק ב' דכתובות (דף כב,א ושם דיבור המתחיל ודלמא) –</b><br><b>And that which</b> רב זירא said in the name of ר' אבא <b>in the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>כתובות –<br>ג' שישבו לקיים את השטר ומת אחד מהן צריכי למיכתב במותב תלתא הוינא וחד ליתוהי –</b><br><b>Three</b> דיינים <b>who sat down to be מקיים a שטר and one</b> of them <b>died b</b>efore he had the chance to sign (so that only the signatures of two דיינים appear on the קיום), <b>it is necessary for them to write, ‘we three were sitting and one</b> (of the three) <b>is no</b> longer <b>here’<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This will assure everyone that initially there was a בי"ד of three who were מקיים the שטר, however one of them died before he was able to sign it.</i> –<br>ואמר רב נחמן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In our texts in כתובות it reads ר"נ בר יצחק.</i> ואי כתב ביה בי דינא תו לא צריך –</b><br><b>And ר"נ commented, ‘and if</b> the words '<b>בי דינא</b>' <b>is written</b> in the קיום <b>it is not necessary anymore</b> to write that initially there were three דיינים, since the term 'בי דינא' indicates that there were three דיינים. The גמרא there asks –<br><b>ודלמא בית דין חצוף הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> דאמר שמואל ב' שדנו דיניהן דין –</b><br><b>But perhaps it was an ‘audacious’ בי"ד, for שמואל maintains that two</b> דיינים <b>who ruled</b> on a case <b>their ruling stands,</b> however they are considered a בי"ד חצוף. So here too even though the קיום stated בי דינא, it is still possible that it was a בי"ד חצוף of two,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">That בי"ד חצוף assumed that קיום שטרות can also be done בשנים; however ‘we’ require three דיינים.</i> how can we be certain that there were three דיינים initially to be מקיים the שטר. The גמרא answers –<br><b>דכתב ביה בי דינא דרבנן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">In our texts there the גירסא is ב"ד דרבנא אשי (not רבנן דבי ר"א).</i> דבי רב אשי –</b><br><b>That it was written</b> in the קיום that it was performed <b>in the בי"ד of the students in the academy of רב אשי</b> where presumably it was not a בי"ד חצוף. The גמרא continues to ask –<br><b>ודלמא רבנן דבי רב אשי כשמואל סבירא להו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It seems from this question that the גמרא understands that ‘we’ maintain קיום שטרות requires three. However even if the קיום states that it was performed in the בי"ד דרבנא אשי, nevertheless since it is possible that those רבנן agree with שמואל (that ב' שדנו דיניהם דין) so therefore they are being מקיים with only two דיינים. The implication of this question is that (the רבנן דבי ר"א and) שמואל maintain that קיום is valid (בדיעבד at least) with only two דיינים. This contradicts what תוספות said previously that even if we maintain ב' שדנו דיניהם דין nevertheless by קיום there must be ג' (even בדיעבד).</i> –</b><br><b>But perhaps the רבנן of דבי רב אשי agree with שמואל (</b>presumably) that ב' שדנו דיניהם דין (even regarding קיום שטרות)? So how can we be sure that there were three דיינים initially at the קיום process before the signing?! This concludes the citation from the גמרא in כתובות.<br>תוספות responds: The גמרא there –<br><b>לא ששמואל סובר דקיום שטרות בשנים –</b><br><b>Did not</b> mean <b>that שמואל maintains that קיום שטרות</b> can be accomplished <b>with</b> only <b>two דיינים</b> (for presumably שמואל rules like the הלכה which תוספות stated earlier that קיום שטרות requires three דיינים) –<br><b>אלא הכי פירושא ודלמא רבנן דבי רב אשי סבירא להו בקיום שטרות כדשמואל בעלמא<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is willing to accept that (perhaps) the רבנן דבי רב אשי (who were [merely] students in the academy of ר"א) would maintain קיום שטרות בב'. However תוספות reasons that שמואל will certainly agree with the הלכה that קיום שטרות בג' (even though he maintains [as does ר"נ] that ב' שדנו דיניהם דין).</i> –</b><br><b>But rather this is the explanation</b> of that question mentioned previously, ‘<b>but perhaps the רבנן דבי רב אשי maintain by קיום שטרות that it is</b> the same ruling as <b>שמואל</b> rules <b>elsewhere’;</b> namely that just as שמואל rules elsewhere (but not by קיום שטרות) that ב' שדנו דיניהם דין, similarly the רבנן דבי ר"א maintain that even by קיום שטרות two are sufficient –<br><b>אבל שמואל מצי סבר שפיר דקיום שטרות בג' –</b><br><b>However שמאול may properly maintain the קיום שטרות</b> must be <b>with three –<br>אף על גב דבעלמא ב' שדנו דיניהן דין כמו רב נחמן –</b><br><b>Even though that generally</b> (by other cases; not קיום שטרות) the rule is that <b>ב' שדנו דיניהם דין, just like ר"נ</b> who maintains elsewhere ב' שדנו דיניהם דין, but requires three by קיום שטרות.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר דרב נחמן<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See מסורת הש"ס that in our גמרות in ב"מ the text reads רבה בר רב הונא, and not ר"נ. [See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.]</i> גופיה קאמר בבבא מציעא (דף לא,ב) –</b><br><b>And if you will say; but ר"נ himself states in</b> מסכת <b>ב"מ –<br>גבי עובדא דאיסור גיורא ורב ספרא עבוד עסקא וכולי<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The case there was that איסור and ר"ס entered into a business partnership. At a certain point איסור divided half the merchandise (under the auspices of two people who assessed its value) and took half for himself (as a partner).</i> –</b><br><b>Regarding the episode where איסור גיורא and רב ספרא entered into a business contract, etc.;</b> from sר"נ' statements there –<br><b>משמע התם דתרי לאו בית דין<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">It is an accepted ruling that the division of assets between partners must be assessed by a בי"ד.</i> –</b><br><b>It seems that two is not considered a בי"ד</b> and their ruling is invalid –<br><b>מדקאמר ליה זיל אייתי לי תלתא דפלגת קמייהו אי נמי תרי מגו תלתא<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">This contradicts what תוספות stated at the very beginning that ר"נ maintains ב' שדנו דיניהם דין. Here ר"נ required three even בדיעבד. </i> –</b><br><b>Since</b> ר"נ <b>told</b> איסור, ‘<b>bring to me the three people in whose presence you divided</b> the assets, <b>or at least two of these three people,</b> so that the two can testify that it was divided under the auspices of a בי"ד of three.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דהתם מיירי דלא עשאן בית דין בפירוש אלא פלג קמייהו בסתם –</b><br><b>And one can say; that there it is a case where</b> איסור <b>did not explicitly appoint the</b> two people <b>as a בי"ד, but rather he simply made the division in their presence,</b> without telling them what their designation is –<br><b>הלכך אי קמי תרי פלג נראה דלעשותן עדים נתכוין –<br>Therefore if he divided</b> the merchandise <b>in the presence of two, it appears that his intention was that they</b> (merely) <b>become witness</b> to this division –<br><b>ואי קמי תלת פלג נראה דלעשותן בית דין נתכוין<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore ר"נ insisted that he bring the (two out of the) three to testify since they were not designated.</i> –</b><br><b>However if he divided in the presence of three, it is apparent that his intention was to make them into a בי"ד;</b> this distinction (between two and three) applies where he was not specific –<br><b>אבל במקום שעשאן בית דין בפירוש בשנים סגי [ועיין עוד תוספות גיטין לב,ב דיבור המתחיל ורב נחמן]:</b><br><b>However, where he specifically designated them as a בי"ד,</b> (even) <b>two are sufficient,</b> since ר"נ maintains ב' שדנו דיניהם דין.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Even those who maintain ב' שדנו דיניהם דין, nevertheless all agree that קיום שטרות requires three.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות found it necessary to explain that when the גמרא stated ודלמא רבנן דבי רב אשי כשמואל סבירא להו, it did not mean that שמואל maintains קיום שטרות בב'. Why did not תוספות clarify in the same manner that which the גמרא said previously<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> ודלמא בית דין חצוף הוא דאמר שמואל ב' שדנו דיניהן דין; that it does not mean that שמואל maintains קיום שטרות בב'?!<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i><br>2. The last question<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> of תוספות seems to be a contradiction between ר"נ in ב"מ and ר"נ in סנהדרין; why is תוספות asking this question here?!

<b>אמאן דלא ציית דינא כולי—For one who does not comply with a ruling, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבה and רב יוסף both ruled that the עדים do not write a מודעא unless the person (who is allegedly accused of forcing the transaction) is one who does not adhere to the ruling of a בי"ד; however if he does adhere to the ruling of בי"ד then the person who is being forced can go directly to בי"ד and tell them what is happening (that he is being coerced) and there is no need for the עדים to write a מודעא.<br>------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה מודעא דמאי –</b><br><b>It is astounding! What</b> type of <b>מודעא</b> are we discussing –<br><b>אי דגיטין ודמתנה גלוי מילתא הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">On the עמוד ב' the נהרדעי state that a שטר מודעא must state that the undersigned עדים know the nature of the coercion. The גמרא asks that this cannot be applicable by an אונס regarding גיטין ומתנה, for there it is merely a גילוי מילתא that he was an אונס. Regarding a sale where the seller receives money it is necessary to be aware of the אונס, for generally sellers are coerced to sell because they need the money (however this is not considered a proper אונס), therefore the עדים have to verify beforehand that indeed there was a valid coercion which voids the sale. However by גיטין ומתנה (where he receives nothing in return) why is there a need for the עדים to know the coercion; if he was not coerced why is he making a מודעא and why is he granting the גט ומתנה, therefore when he makes the מודעא it means that he is certainly being coerced (and we will all become aware of it) and (similarly here in our discussion) for some reason he cannot go to בי"ד at this point. There is no reason not to write the מודעא even אמאן דציית לדינא.</i> דודאי הוא אנוס בשום ענין שאין יכול לבא לבית דין –</b><br><b>If it is a</b> מודעא <b>regarding</b> granting <b>a גט or a gift</b> (which the person is being coerced to grant), there is no reason why we should not write a מודעה since this מודעא is merely <b>revealing something</b> which will become evident, <b>for he is certainly coerced in some fashion which prevents him from coming to בי"ד –<br>ואי דזביני והא אמר רבא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See עמוד ב'. (See רשב"ם there ד"ה לא for a detailed explanation.)</i> לא כתבינן מודעא אזביני –</b><br><b>And if</b> the מודעא is regarding <b>a sale,</b> this cannot be, <b>for רבא ruled that we do not write a מודעא for sales –</b><br>תוספות anticipates and reject a possible explanation:<br><b>וכי תימא רבה ורב יוסף לית להו דרבא –</b><br><b>And if you will say that רבה ורב יוסף disagree with רבא</b> and maintain that we do write מודעא אזביני –<br><b>מכל מקום הוה ליה למיפרך ולשנויי כדפריך בסמוך אנהרדעי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1. The גמרא asked what type of מודעא are the נהרדעי discussing; if it is regarding גיטין ומתנה it is merely a גילוי מילתא, and it cannot be regarding זביני, since רבא ruled that לא כתבינן מודעא אזביני. The same questions should be posed (and answered) regarding the ruling of רבה ור"י that לא כתבינן מודעא אלא אמאן דלא ציית דינא.</i> –</b><br><b>Nevertheless</b> the גמרא <b>should have asked and answered</b> (regarding what type of מודעא we are discussing<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא could have answered that רבה ור"י are discussing a מודעא אזביני and they disagree with רבא and maintain כתבינן מודעא אזביני (see מהרש"א).</i>) <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>shortly asks on</b> the ruling of <b>נהרדעי!</b><br>תוספות has an additional difficulty<b></b> (with the proposed resolution of the 'וכי תימא')<b>:</b><br><b>ועוד והא אביי ורבא גופייהו דאמרי תרוייהו אפילו עלי ועליך<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">אביי ורבא responded to רבה ור"י (disagreeing with them) that a מודעא can be written even on us. This disagreement cannot be regarding גיטין ומתנה for then everyone agrees that we write a מודעא (even אמאן דציית לדינא) since it is merely a גילוי מילתא בעלמא. It cannot be in regards to זביני for then how can (אביי and) רבא say we can write it even on us, when רבא maintains אין כותבין מודעא אזביני! </i> –</b><br><b>And</b> there is an <b>additional</b> difficulty <b>for אביי ורבא themselves both maintain that</b> a מודעא can be written <b>even on me and you</b> (who are ציית לדינא) –<br><b>אם כן לא איירי במודעא דזביני –</b><br><b>Therefore</b> since it is (אביי and) רבא who is responding, it is understood that <b>we are not discussing a מודעא דזביני.</b> The question remains to which מודעא were רבה ור"י referring to.<br>תוספות rejects a possible explanation:<br><b>וכי ההוא מעשה דפרדיסא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See עמוד ב' (and footnote # 1). The גמרא there explained that the ruling of נהרדעי is pertaining to a case similar to מעשה דפרדיסא. The story there is where one mortgaged his פרדס (orchard) for a loan for a period of three years (during which time the lender can eat the fruits for full payment for the loan). After the three years passed the lender told the owner, ‘if you sell me this פרדס, fine and if not I will hide the mortgage note and claim that I bought it from you three years ago and since I have שני חזקה I will keep the field for free’. In such a case the owner had no choice but to sell the field for otherwise he would lose it entirely; in such a case we write a מודעא אזביני even according to רבא. </i> לא שייך הכא דאפילו ציית דינא פשיטא דכתבינן:<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Even if the lender (see footnote # 5) is a ציית לדינא, nevertheless what will it help if the owner goes to בי"ד; the מלוה will claim I bought it and have שני חזקה. In such a case we will write a מודעא even אמאן דציית לדינא.</i></b><br><b>And it is not feasible</b> to assume that <b>here</b> we are discussing an incident <b>similar to the story of the orchard, for</b> in such a case <b>it is obvious that even if</b> (the coercer) is ציית דינא, <b>we will write</b> a מודעא. <b>תוספות</b> does not answer his question.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שס for possible solutions.</i><br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the ruling if there was a מסירת מודעה by גט ומתנה and then it became apparent that there was no אונס; is it a valid גט ומתנה?<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שס בד"ה והנה הא.</i>

<b>איכא דאמרי אמר רב יוסף דלא אמר להו תיתבו כולי—There are others who</b><br><b>say that רב יוסף said, ‘that he did not tell them, ‘sit, etc.’’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב יהודה ruled that we do not enforce a hidden gift (מתנתא טמירתא). There are two versions (in the name of רב יוסף) what is a מתנתא טמירתא. The first version is that the grantor told the עדים, ‘go and hide and write him a שטר מתנה’. The second version (according to our גירסא) is that he did not tell the עדים, ‘sit in the marketplace and in the street (where everyone can see) and write it’. The גמרא explained that the difference between these two opinions is where he merely told them to write it (and did not say hide, etc. but he also did not say sit in the שוק, etc.)<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">According to the first opinion that a מתנה טמירה is where he told them to hide, it will be כשר by סתם; according to the איכא דאמרי that for a מתנה to be valid he needs to tell the עדים sit in the שוק, it will be considered a מתנה טמירה by סתם.</i><br>------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>אהך גירסא קשה לרבינו יצחק מאי קבעי מאי בינייהו הא בהדיא חולקין בסתמא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות argues that the difference between the two לשונות is so obvious that we cannot understand the question.</i> –</b><br><b>The ר"י has a difficulty with this גירסא; why does</b> the גמרא <b>ask, ‘what is the difference between</b> the two interpretations of ר"י’; <b>it is explicitly</b> clear <b>that they argue in</b> a case of סתמא where he told the עדים (nothing) just to write the גט –<br>תוספות asks an additional question:<br><b>ועוד דפסקינן לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">מא,א.</i> הלכתא דחיישינן בסתמא –</b><br><b>And furthermore</b> the גמרא <b>rules later that we are concerned</b> for a מתנה טמירה <b>in</b> a case of <b>סתמא</b> (which we understand to mean that he only told them to write), that by סתם it is not a valid מתנה –<br><b>ואם כן היכי מגבינן כולהו מתנתא כיון דאינו אומר לסהדי כתבו בשוקי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read בשוקי וברייתא.</i> ברייתא –</b><br><b>So if indeed</b> this is <b>so</b> that בסתמא it is not a valid מתנה, <b>how do we enforce all מתנות</b> (nowadays) <b>since</b> the custom nowadays is <b>that he does not tell the עדים write it בשוקי וברייתא,</b> but rather only סתמא, so it should not be a valid מתנה.<br>תוספות answers the latter difficulty:<br><b>ומיהו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ומיהו יש לומר לפי.</i> לפי שנוהגים עתה לכתוב בשטרי מתנה –</b><br><b>However, one can say; according to the custom nowadays to write in the</b> text of <b>שטרי מתנה –<br>ואמר לנו מתנה זו כתבוה בשוקא וחתמוה בברא –</b><br><b>‘And</b> the grantor <b>told us</b> (the witnesses), “<b>write this</b> שטר <b>מתנה in the שוק and sign it in the streets”’,<br>הלכך כי אמר להו נמי סתמא דעתו לומר כמו שכותבים בשטרות –</b><br><b>Therefore</b> even <b>if the grantor</b> actually <b>told the עדים</b> to write it <b>סתמא, his intention was to tell</b> them that they should write in <b>in the manner it is written in the שטרי</b> מתנה, namely בשוקי ובברייתא; this is nowadays –<br><b>ובימי האמוראים לא היו נוהגים לכתוב כך –</b><br><b>However in the days of the אמוראים it was not customary to write in the notes</b> 'כתבוה בשוקא וחתמוה בברא' –<br><b>לכך היה צריך לומר להם בפירוש כתבו בשוקא כולי –</b><br><b>Therefore it was necessary</b> (then) <b>to tell the</b> עדים <b>explicitly, ‘כתבו בשוקא’, etc.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות (answered the second question regarding the הלכה, however he) did not answer the first question how come the גמרא asks מאי בינייהו, when it is obvious that they argue by סתמא.</i></b><br>תוספות offers an alternate גירסא:<br><b>ורבינו חננאל גריס דאמר להו לא תיתבו בשוקא ברא –</b><br><b>And the גירסא of the ר"ח is</b> that the איכא דאמרי maintain that a מתנה טמירה is <b>where he told</b> the עדים <b>do not sit in an outside market</b> when you write the שטר מתנה (but he did not tell them to hide) –<br><b>וקרי ליה סתמא שאינו אומר להם להטמין עצמו ואומר שלא לפרסם –</b><br><b>And</b> when the גמרא says (איכא בינייהו) סתמא <b>it is referring</b> to this case <b>where he does not tell them to hide but he tells them not to publicize it –<br>והיינו סתמא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read סתמא דלא פירש לא פרסום ולא הטמנה אבל.</i> כלומר לא פרסם ולא הטמינם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">According to the first לשון (that if he tells them to hide it is a מתנה טמירה) in this case it is כשר (since he did not tell them to hide) according to the א"ד (that if he tells them לא תיתבו בשוקא ברא it is פסול) in this case it is (also) פסול since he told them שלא לפרסם. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And סתמא means [that he did not specify], neither that they should publicize it</b> (which would be valid according to everyone)<b>, nor that they should hide</b> (which would void the שטר מתנה according to everyone)<b>,</b> rather he told them not to publicize it –<br><b>אבל כתובו לא חשיב סתמא וכשר<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">According to the פי' ר"ח that which the א"ד stated that if he tells the עדים do not write it בשוקא  וכו', it is פסול, does not mean that he is required to tell them כתובו בשוקא; rather even if he told them כתובו alone it is כשר, however if he told them not to be מפרסם then it will be פסול according to the א"ד.</i> לפירוש רבינו חננאל –</b><br><b>However if he told the</b> עדים only <b>כתובו</b> (and did not add בשוקא) that <b>is not considered סתמא and it is כשר according to פירוש ר"ח.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ר"ח there is a חידוש in the answer of the גמרא that the difference is by סתמא, since סתמא means not to publicize and not to hide, however כתובו סתם is כשר לכו"ע.</i></b><br><b>ולפיכך<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ולפי זה מה (instead of ולפיכך מה).</i> מה שנהגו לכתוב בשטרות מתנה זו כתבוה בשוקא וחתמוה בברא –</b><br><b>And according to this</b> פירוש that plain כתובו is כשר (even without בשוקא), <b>that which was instituted to write in שטרות that this מתנה, you should write it בשוקא and sign it בברא,</b> is not really necessary, for it is כשר in all instances as long as he did not tell them not to be מפרסם; the reason it is written in the שטר מתנה –<br><b>אינו אלא לשופרא דשטרא –</b><br><b>Is only for the ‘beauty’ of the שטר;</b> (it is merely an elegant expression showing that he is gladly and openly granting this gift).<br>תוספות is reluctant to accept the פי' ר"ח:<br><b>ומיהו לישנא דסתמא לא משמע הכי:</b><br><b>However the expression of סתמא does not indicate this</b> which the ר"ח claims, namely, that he told them not to be מפרסם but he did not tell them to hide; rather סתמא means he only told them to write and nothing else.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to our גירסא the term סתמא refers to where he merely told the witnesses כתובו. However according to פי' ר"ח it means when he told them not to be מפרסם (but not to hide), however כתובו סתם is כשר לכו"ע.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Seemingly according to the ר"ח there still remains תוספות original question, why does the גמרא ask מאי בינייהו when it is evident that they argue in a case where (he did not tell them to hide, but rather) he told them not to publicize it?<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8 and סוכ"ד אות סד ונח"מ.</i>

<b>שלא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם—No one ever said anything to me</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה teaches that a חזקה שאין עמה טענה (which is not considered a חזקה) is where the מוחזק claims his rights to the property by the virtue that no one (during these three years) ever complained to me that I am on their property. תוספות mentions another case of חזקה שאין עמה טענה and explains why the משנה chose this specific case.<br>---------------------------<br><b>והוא הדין דאפילו אם אמר זבינתיה מפלוני דזבנה מינך דלא הויא חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">It is not a חזקה, since the מחזיק does not claim that he knows that the seller bought it from the מערער (or that the seller was דר בו חד יומא). See previously ל,א ושם בתוד"ה לאו.</i> –</b><br><b>And the law would also be the same even if</b> the מחזיק <b>claimed, ‘I bought it from him, who bought it from you’; that this is not</b> considered to be a <b>חזקה –<br>עד שיאמר אתה מכרת לי כדקתני סיפא –</b><br><b>Unless</b> the מחזיק <b>claims, ‘you sold it to me’, as the משנה states in the סיפא.</b><br>תוספות explains why the משנה chose the case of לא אמר לי אדם instead of מפלניא זבינתיה דזבנה מינך:<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly there is a greater חידוש in מפלניא זבינתיה where he at least makes some claim of purchase (albeit an unacceptable claim), as opposed to לא אמר לי וכו' where he has no claim at all.</i><br><b>אלא הא עדיפא ליה למינקט שלא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם –</b><br>The משנה <b>rather preferred to mention</b> the case of <b>שלא אמר לי דבר מעולם –<br>לאשמועינן דלא הוי פתח פיך לאלם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">פתח פיך לאלם (משלי לא,ח) (in limited circumstances) allows בי"ד, in a case where one of the litigants is confused or unsure and cannot make a proper claim, to speak on his behalf or encourage him that perhaps he meant something else. In the case of לא אמר לי אדם, we are concerned that perhaps the מחזיק did buy it, however since he lost his שטר, he assumes that if he will say אתה מכרת לי and he cannot provide a שטר, we will assume him to be a גזלן; however if he claims לא אמר לי אדם, we may accept his claim (see the גמרא and תוס' ד"ה אמרי). However when he claims מפלניא זבינתיה וכו', there can be no acceptable reason why he is claiming מפלניא זבינתיה instead of מינך זבינתיה (or קמי דידי זבינא), for in all situations he has no שטר (from the מ"ק) and will be considered (in his mind) a גזלן. [Alternately, we may say פתח פיך לאלם where indeed he is an אלם as in the case of לא אמר לי אדם which is no claim at all (and he is afraid to claim אתה מכרת לי), however in the case of מפלניא זבינתיה, he is not an אלם; he is making (what he thinks) is a valid claim. בי"ד will not encourage someone to change his claim (and say מינך זבינתיה). See ‘Thinking it over’.]</i> כדאמר בגמרא:</b><br><b>To inform us that</b> (even) <b>in</b> this case the concept of ‘<b>open your mouth on behalf of the mute’, does not</b> apply, <b>as stated in the גמרא.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The advantage of stating לא אמר לי אדם is not a חזקה, instead of מפלניא זבינתיה, is because there is the חידוש that we do not say פתח פיך לאלם.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is there no חידוש by מפלניא זבינתיה that בי"ד does not say (פתח פיך and) that perhaps it was קמי דידי (or דר ביה חד יומא),<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3. In that case בי"ד is merely reminding him that he may have forgotten a detail, but are not changing his claim.</i> and you forgot to mention it?
