<b>שלא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This תוספות should (seemingly) precede the תוס' ד"ה אמרי.</i> אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם פשיטא—For nobody ever told me anything; it is obvious!</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites the משנה that if the מחזיק claims the land is his because no one ever complained, it is not a חזקה, and asks but this is obvious that it is not a חזקה, why is it necessary for the משנה to teach this ruling. תוספות discusses this question and explains what פשיטא is referring to.<br>---------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>קשה למורנו הרב משה(?) דמאי פריך פשיטא –</b><br><b>The מהר"ם has a difficulty; why does the</b> גמרא <b>ask, פשיטא</b> that this is obvious –<br><b>הא לעיל (דף כח,ב) פריך גמרא אלא מעתה חזקה שאין עמה טענה כולי –</b><br><b>But previously the גמרא asked, ‘but now</b> that we derive חזקה from שור מועד, the law should be that <b>a חזקה שאין עמה טענה, etc.</b> should be a valid חזקה’. This concludes the citation of the relevant גמרא –<br><b>ופירש שם בתוספות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה אלא מעתה חזקה.</i> פירוש א'<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read פירוש ראשון.</i> דאפילו אמר [שלא אמר] לי אדם דבר מעולם פריך –</b><br><b>And תוספות there in the [first] explanation states</b> that the meaning of חזקה שאין עמה טענה there, is <b>even</b> if the מחזיק <b>said, ‘שלא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם’,</b> even in such a case the גמרא <b>asked</b> that it should be a חזקה. It is evident that the גמרא entertained this thought that there is a possibility that שלא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם should be a valid חזקה, why therefore does the גמרא assume here that it is פשיטא that it is not a חזקה?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה לומר<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read לי (instead of לומר); referring seemingly to the מהר"ם.</i> דמכח סיפא –</b><br><b>And it seems to</b> [the מהר"ם] <b>that it is from the</b> inference <b>of the סיפא –<br>דמשמע דאפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דאפילו אם אמר מפלוני.</i> מפלוני דזבנה מינך זבינתה לא הויא חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The סיפא states that a valid חזקה is (only) when the מחזיק claims אתה מכרת לי, indicating that מפלוני דזבנה מינך זבינתה is not a valid חזקה. </i> פריך פשיטא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Once we can infer from the סיפא that [even] מפלוני דזבנה מינך זבינתה is not a חזקה (see previous footnote # 6), then it is פשיטא that לא אמר לי אדם וכו' (which is a lesser claim) is definitely not a חזקה, so why mention this in the משנה.</i> –</b><br><b>Which implies that even if [he claimed], ‘I bought it from him who brought it from you’, it is not a חזקה;</b> it is on account of this implication that the גמרא <b>asks, פשיטא!</b><br>תוספות is not satisfied with this interpretation of פשיטא:<br><b>ונראה כי זה דוחק<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ונראה דזה דוחק</i> דמנא ליה למיפרך ארישא טפי מאסיפא –</b><br><b>And it appears</b> to תוספות <b>that</b> this explanation <b>is awkward, for from where does</b> the גמרא <b>derive to ask on the רישא more than on the סיפא –<br>דהא מרישא איכא למידק איפכא<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The רישא teaches that the ineffective חזקה שאין עמה טענה is when he claims לא אמר לי אדם וכו'; indicating if he would offer the better claim of מפלוני דזבן מינך וכו', then it would be a valid חזקה.</i> וליפרוך טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The question should be since the implication of the רישא is that the claim if מפלוני דזבן מינך וכו' is a valid חזקה (see footnote # 9), why does the סיפא state that a valid חזקה is (only) if he claims אתה מכרת לי, when in fact it is a valid claim even if he states מפלוני דזבן מינך וכו'. The advantage of this question is that we first infer from the רישא (which we study first) and then ask why the סיפא does not coincide with the רישא, but we do not first infer from the סיפא (which is studied last) to ask on the רישא. [Alternately the גמרא should have asked that here is a contradiction between the דיוקא דרישא (that מפלניא דזבין is a valid חזקה) and דיוקא דסיפא (that it is not).] </i> מסיפא לרישא<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read מרישא לסיפא (instead of מסיפא לרישא).</i> –</b><br><b>For from the רישא we can infer the opposite, so</b> the גמרא <b>should</b> rather <b>ask from the [רישא on the סיפא]?!</b><br>תוספות offers his explanation:<br><b>ונראה לי דמקשה לא מסיק<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read אסיק (instead of מסיק).</i> אדעתיה דנטעון ליה אנן<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא shortly answers that we may have thought that it is a case of פתח פיך לאלם and we would claim on his behalf; however the מקשה did not entertain such an idea that בי"ד would claim on his behalf.</i> –</b><br><b>And it seems to</b> תוספות <b>that the one who asked</b> פשיטא, <b>it never entered his mind that we would claim on his behalf</b> that the מערער either sold of forfeited the field to him –<br><b>ולהכי פריך פשיטא<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read פשיטא דחזקה גרידא אינה מועלת בלא טענה.</i> דטענה גרידא אינה מועלת דאינה טענה –</b><br><b>So therefore</b> the מקשה <b>asked פשיטא</b> that it is not a חזקה<b>, since a חזקה alone cannot be effective without a claim –<br>ומשני דסלקא דעתין דנטעון ליה אנן<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read אנן ולעיל פריך חזקה שאין עמה טענה תהוי חזקה היינו דנטעון ליה אנן דכיון שלא מיחה.</i> דכיון דלא מיחה שלש שנים ודאי מכר לו או מחל<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>answered that we may have thought</b> (if not for the משנה) <b>that we</b> (the בי"ד) <b>should argue on his behalf [and</b> similarly <b>previously</b> (on כח,ב) when the גמרא <b>asked</b> that <b>a חזקה שאין עמה טענה should be a</b> valid <b>חזקה,</b> the גמרא meant <b>that</b> בי"ד <b>should claim on his behalf<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">If he claims שלא אמר לי דבר מעולם (so even though we cannot say שמא מכר לו, nevertheless) בי"ד should claim on his behalf perhaps מחל לו which is in accordance with his claim of שלא אמר לי דבר מעולם. See סוכ"ד אות י.</i>] that since he did not protest for three years he certainly sold</b> it <b>to him or forfeited</b> the property to the מחזיק.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation:<br><b>ועוד יש לומר דלרבנן דרבי ישמעאל דלא ילפי משור<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read משור המועד פריך.</i> פריך פשיטא<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">According to ר"י who derives חזקת ג' שנים from שור המועד there is room to consider that even a חזקה שאין עמה טענה should be a חזקה similar to שור המועד (see תוספות ד"ה אלא מעתה חזקה on כח,ב); however according to the חכמים who maintain the reason of חזקת ג' שנים is because no one holds a שטר for more than three years and the חזקה is in place of the שטר, so obviously he must claim אתה מכרת and I lost the שטר so therefore it is פשיטא that a חזקה שאין עמה טענה is no חזקה.</i> –</b><br><b>And in addition one can say; that the question פשיטא is according to the רבנן who</b> argue with <b>ר"י and do not derive</b> חזקה <b>from שור [המועד].</b><br>תוספות has a difficulty with this explanation:<br><b>אבל קשה דבמתניתין לא הוזכרו רבנן ומתניתין כרבי ישמעאל<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore we cannot say that the question on the משנה is (only) according to the רבנן דר"י, for our משנה may be according to ר"י, according to whom there is reason to assume that חזקה שאין עמה טענה הויא חזקה! </i> –</b><br><b>However there is a difficulty for the רבנן are not mentioned in our משנה, and our משנה is</b> (perhaps) <b>according to ר"י –</b><br>תוספות gives a final answer:<br><b>ונראה דפריך אחזקה דיום אחד<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא ו,א and תוס' ו,ב ד"ה ואי that there are certain חזקות (like חזקת תשמישין) that can be accomplished in one day if the owner was not מערער. Regarding these חזקות it is פשיטא that without a טענה there can be no חזקה as opposed to a חזקת ג' שנים where one may think that since the מ"ק was not מוחה for so long (three years) he was surely מוחל; this does not apply by חזקת יום אחד. The גמרא answered that because of פתח פיך לאלם we may argue that (even though there is no מחילה, but) perhaps he sold him the חזקת תשמישין. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2. [Alternately, the גמרא answers that even though it is פשיטא by חזקת תשמישין but it is not פשיטא regarding חזקת ג"ש.]</i> דמתניתין נמי איירי בה מדקתני כל חזקה כדפירש הקונטרס:</b><br><b>And it seems</b> to תוספות <b>that the</b> גמרא <b>asks</b> פשיטא, <b>regarding a חזקה of</b> (only) <b>one day, which our משנה is also discussing as the</b> רשב"ם <b>explained,<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">במתני' ד"ה כל.</i> since the משנה states כל חזקה</b> (indicating that we also discussing a חזקה דיום אחד).<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The question פשיטא can be referencing the דיוקא דסיפא; or the מקשה never assumed that אנן נטעון ליה; alternately it may be only according to the רבנן דר"י or it is referring to a חזקה דחד יומא.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות here writes that we may have thought that we would claim on behalf of the מחזיק that the מערער was מכר לו או מחל.<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 16.</i> Previously (on כח,ב) תוספות writes only שמחל לו; why did not תוספות write there as well שמכר לו או מחל לו?<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and נח"מ.</i><br>2. According to תוספות final answer that we are discussing a חזקה דחד יומא;<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 21.</i> what is the meaning of אחוי שטרך, since by חזקת תשמישין we do not write a שטר for otherwise there would be a requirement of חזקת ג"ש since there is the ריעותא of אחוי שטרך?!<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>

<b>אמרי לי אחוי (לי) שטרך—They will say to me, ‘show your שטר’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explains that we may have thought that in the case of לא אמר לי אדם, we would perhaps say פתח פיך לאלם, since he is afraid to claim אתה מכרת לי for then he will be not be able to present the שטר. Our תוספות explains why that concern is not there (in his mind) when he claims לא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">If he is concerned that he will be not believed when he claims אתה מכרת לי, why would he be granted the field if he claims לא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם, which seemingly gives him no rights at all in this field! </i><br>-----------------------------------<br><b>וכשלא אוכל להראות שטרי שהפסדתיו יאמרו שגזלתיה</b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוספות ד"ה שלא (TIE footnote # 3).</i> <b>–</b><br>The מחזיק thinks if I will claim (as the truth [supposedly] is) that אתה מכרת לי, <b>so then when I will not be able to present the שטר, which I lost, the</b> בי"ד <b>will assume that I stole<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i></b> the field –<br><b>אבל כשאומר לא אמר לי אדם [דבר] מעולם לא יאמרו שגזלתיה –</b><br><b>However when I claim, ‘no one ever said anything to me’,</b> בי"ד <b>will not assume that I stole</b> the field –<br><b>אלא ראיתי שלא מיחו בידי והחזקתי בה ונמצא שמחל לי:</b><br><b>But rather</b> they will assume that <b>I saw that no one is protesting</b> against <b>me, so I made a חזקה in</b> the field, <b>and it turns out</b> (in the sמחזיק' mind) <b>that the</b> original owner <b>forfeited</b> the field <b>to</b> <b>me</b> and it legally belongs to me.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מחזיק (mistakenly) assumes that לא אמר לי אדם דבר מעולם is considered a מחילה and allows him to own the land.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Does תוספות add anything to our understanding of his reluctance to claim אתה מכרת לי,<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If תוספות is not adding anything in our understanding, why is it necessary for תוספות to explain why he does not want to claim אתה מכרת לי because יאמרו שגזלתיה! The תוספות could have begun with the words אבל כשאומר וכו'.</i> more than is indicated in the גמרא?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See סוכ"ד אות ח בד"ה ועיין תוס' (in regards to # 2 as well).</i><br>2. Why when he claims אתה מכרת לי can he also not argue that (in addition to buying, which he cannot prove, nevertheless) שמחל לי?!

<b>והא אחזקי לי—But I made a חזקה for myself</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The case at hand: רב ענן replaced the dividing fence on his neighbor’s property (thus extending his own property). ר"נ ordered him to return it where it was originally. ר"ע initially claimed והא אחזיקי לי, to which ר"נ responded it is not a חזקה. ר"ע then claimed that the neighbor was מוחל since he assisted me in putting up the fence; ר"נ responded that it is a מחילה בטעות. The רשב"ם and תוספות differ in their explanation of this episode.<br>------------------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה והא.</i> בניתי כותל על פיו והוא סייע לי –</b><br><b>The רשב"ם explained</b> the claim of ר"ע was, <b>‘I built the wall with his consent and he</b> (even) <b>helped me to erect it –<br>וכיון שבמצותו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שבמצותו עשיתי הוי.</i> עשה הוי חזקה שיש עמה טענה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">According to (תוספות understanding of) the רשב"ם, the claim made by ר"ע was that his neighbor gifted him this land. [We will need to say that the expression והא אחיל does not mean he forfeited, for (generally) there is no such קנין as מחילה (regarding transferring of assets), but rather he gifted it to me, by telling me where to place the fence.] The רשב"ם understands that the neighbor indeed told ר"ע where to place the fence, since later ר"ע stated that he helped me put up the fence. However ר"ע had no proof that the neighbor told him where to place the fence, so he argued that his חזקה in the presence of the neighbor for a few days (without a מחאה) is sufficient to support his claim that the neighbor gifted him the area. [ר"ע was קונה the קרקע through קנין חזקה by building the fence.] ר"נ responded that a few days is no חזקה, so there is no proof that he gifted the area to you. ר"ע argued that since he helped me build the fence (for which there were witnesses) that act is an act of gifting me the area, and it should me mine. ר"נ responded that it was a mistaken מחילה (gift); the neighbor never realized you were on his property. </i> –</b><br><b>And since [I] did it at his insistence, it is a חזקה with a valid claim.</b><br>תוספות disagrees with פי' הרשב"ם:<br><b>וקשה דמדקאמר בתר הכי והא אחיל משמע דעד השתא לא הוה מחזיק בה מטעם מחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> this explanation is <b>difficult; for since</b> ר"ע <b>stated later, ‘but he was אחיל’, this indicates that up to that point</b> (where ר"ע claimed והא אחיל), ר"ע <b>was not claiming the field because of מחילה,</b> but rather he had a different claim on the field –<br>תוספות has another difficulty with פי' הרשב"ם:<br><b>ועוד דלאלתר הוה ליה לרב נחמן למימר מחילה בטעות הואי –</b><br><b>And in addition,</b> if the basis of sר"ע' claim was מחילה, then <b>ר"נ should have told him immediately</b> (when ר"ע said 'והא אחזיקי לי') <b>that it was a mistaken מחילה</b> (and not wait until ר"ע claimed והא אחיל) –<b></b><br>תוספות offers his interpretation of the גמרא:<br><b>ונראה לפרש דרב ענן הוה טעין שלקח ממנו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">ר"ע claimed that he actually bought the additional property from his neighbor, and not (merely) that his neighbor gifted him the property, by telling him where to erect the wall (as the רשב"ם maintains).</i> ולא היה לו עדים שלקחה –</b><br><b>And it is the view</b> of תוספות <b>to explain</b> the גמרא as follows, <b>that ר"ע was claiming that he bought this area from his</b> neighbor<b>, but</b> ר"ע <b>did not have עדים that he bought it</b> from his neighbor –<br><b>והיה רוצה להיות נאמן מתורת חזקה –</b><br><b>And</b> ר"ע <b>wanted</b> that he should <b>be believed by the rules of חזקה</b> (since the person saw me build a wall in his presence and he did not protest that proves that he sold me this land) –<br><b>וכי אמר ליה רב נחמן דלאו חזקה היא השיב לו רב ענן והא אחיל –</b><br><b>And when ר"נ told</b> ר"ע that<b></b> such a short period of time <b>is not a חזקה,</b> so <b>ר"ע responded 'והא אחיל';</b> meaning –<br><b>דאף על פי שאינו נאמן לומר לקחתיה –</b><br><b>That even though that</b> ר"ע <b>is not believed</b> on the basis of this short חזקה <b>to claim, ‘I bought it’,</b> nevertheless –<br><b>תהא שלי מטעם מחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over # 2.</i> דסייע בגודא בהדאי והיה לו עדים או היה מודה בסיועו –</b><br><b>It should be mine because of מחילה, for he helped to</b> build the <b>wall together with me,</b> and ר"ע <b>had witnesses or</b> the neighbor <b>admitted that he was helping.</b><br>תוספות concludes, however:<b><br>ואין הסוגיא מוכחת כן:</b><br><b>But the flow of the גמרא does not indicate so</b> that he claimed initially that he bought it. There is no mention at all that ר"ע claimed he bought the land.<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">In addition the expression הדר גודא בארעיה does not indicate that he bought it. Also ר"נ answered him that you also did not know, but according to this פי' he knew that he was on his neighbor’s land, but he claims he bought it. See נח"מ for a possible solution to some of these difficulties. </i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The רשב"ם maintains that both claims of ר"ע were based on מחילה (that the neighbor gifted him the field), while תוספות maintains that the first claim of ר"ע was that he purchased it, and only the second claim was on account of מחילה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות asks on פי' הרשב"ם, how can he say that initially when he claimed והא אחזיקי לי, he meant on account of מחילה, when the claim of מחילה was later when he said 'והא אחיל'.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> However according to the רשב"ם<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i>, even though both claims were on account of מחילה, however the first claim was that we should believe him that there was מחילה because of the חזקה, however the second claim was we know that there was מחילה since he assisted me. They are two different claims! <sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שפ.</i><br>2. תוספות explains that sר"ע' second claim (of והא אחיל) was that even if you do not believe me that I bought it, but it should me mine because of מחילה.<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> Why did ר"ע have to change his claim from buying to מחילה, when he could have maintained his claim of buying and proven it<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See previously לה,ב that ואי דלי לי צנא דפירי לאלתר הוי חזקה.</i> by the fact that the neighbor helped him erect the wall?!<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שפא.</i>
<b>כמאן כרבי יהודה—Like whom; like ר"י</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates that רב נחמן replied to רב ענן that if you intend to acquire the annexed property with an immediate חזקה according to the view of ר"י, etc., you should be aware that the הלכה is not like them. This seemingly indicates that ר"ע supposedly follows the view of ר"י, however תוספות points out that this seemingly contradicts another statement made by ר"ע.<br>---------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>קשה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דהאמר רב ענן לעיל (דף לח,ב) –</b><br><b>The רשב"א has a difficulty, from ר"ע stated previously –<br>לדידי מפרשא לי מיניה דמר שמואל מחאה בפני עדים שאין יכולין לומר לו כולי –</b><br><b>‘I heard explicitly from the master שמואל that a protest made in the presence of witnesses that cannot convey</b> the מחאה <b>to</b> the מחזיק, <b>etc.</b> is not a valid מחאה’ –<br><b>משמע דלא בעי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read בעי מחאה בפניו והיינו.</i> בפניו מחאה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">שמואל there distinguishes between making the מחאה בפני עדים who can tell the מחזיק and עדים who cannot tell the מחזיק; in any event it is apparent that the מערער need not make the מחאה בפני המחזיק.</i> והיינו דלא כרבי יהודה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ר"י maintains that a מחאה must be made בפני המחזיק; see תוס' לח,ב ד"ה אין. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>indicating that</b> ר"ע maintains <b>that there is no requirement for a מחאה בפניו, which is not like</b> the view <b>of ר"י.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The difficulty is that on one hand ר"ע maintains that מחאה שלא בפניו הויא מחאה and argues with ר"י; however in our גמרא it seems that ר"ע wanted to make a חזקה based on the ruling of ר"י that בפניו לאלתר הוי חזקה. [The רשב"א is of the opinion that these two laws of מחאה שלא בפניו and חזקה בפניו are intertwined; if one maintains בפניו לאלתר הוי חזקה, he will also maintain מחאה שלא בפניו לא הוי מחאה. (This is because both laws of ר"י are derived from the same ruling in our משנה where ר"י states לא אמרו ג' שנים אלא וכו' באספמיא (which means that if he is closer the חזקה can even be immediately) ויבא לשנה אחרת (from which we derive that a מחאה must be בפניו).] </i></b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ושמא סבר כוותיה בחדא ופליג עליה בחדא:</b><br><b>And perhaps</b> ר"ע <b>agrees with</b> ר"י <b>in one ruling</b> that בפניו לאלתר הוי חזקה, <b>but he argues with him in the other</b> הלכה and maintains מחאה שלא בפניו הוי מחאה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ר"ע agrees with ר"י that החזיק בפניו לאלתר הוי חזקה, but disagrees with him and maintains that מחאה שלא בפניו הוי מחאה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that ר"י maintains מחאה שלא בפניו לא הוי מחאה.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> However previously (on לט,א) the same ר"נ (who said to ר"ע that כמאן כר"י) maintains that ר"י is also of the opinion that מחאה שלא בפניו הויא מחאה and it is merely עצה טובה קמ"ל!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהודרא בתרא (למהרש"א).</i>

Line 9

<b>אמר ליה מחילה בטעות הואי—He said to him, it was a mistaken forfeiture</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב נחמן told רב ענן that he cannot keep the added property which the other party forfeited to him (by assisting him in making the wall [on his property]), since it is a mistaken מחילה (the neighbor did not realize that the fence was being erected on his property). תוספות reconciles our גמרא (in which ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה) with another גמרא which seems to imply otherwise.<br>---------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשה דבפרק איזהו נשך (בבא מציעא דף סו,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל התם) אמר רב נחמן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where a מלוה and לוה agreed that if the loan will not be paid up by three years, a particular field (of the לוה) will belong to the מלוה. This type of agreement (if this, then that) is called an אסמכתא. See footnote # 2.</i> –</b><br><b>And there is a difficulty; for ר"נ states in פרק איזהו נשך –<br>השתא דאמור רבנן אסמכתא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">אסמכתא means support or dependence. The לוה (in this case), when he agreed to transfer his field to the מלוה if he does not pay the loan after three years, did not really think it would happen, for he was certain that he will surely pay the loan and was depending on this payment that this transfer would never come to pass. He merely said it to assuage the concern of the מלוה, letting him know that his loan is secure. Therefore since there was no serious intent (on part of the לוה) to make this transfer, therefore this transfer (or קנין) is not effective.</i> לא קני הדרא ארעא והדרי פירי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Even if the מלוה entered the field after three years (and the loan was not paid) and consumed the פירות, the מלוה must return the land and the פירות that he consumed to the לוה, for since אסמכתא לא קני it was never the sמלוה' field.</i> –</b><br><b>Now that the רבנן ruled that an אסמכתא is not</b> legally <b>binding,</b> therefore <b>the land and the fruits revert back</b> to the לוה. The גמרא there continues –<br><b>למימרא דסבר רב נחמן מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא considers this case of אסמכתא as a מחילה בטעות. The לוה allowed the מלוה into his field as payment for the debt and agreed that he can keep the field and eat the פירות, for he mistakenly thought that it belongs to the מלוה. ר"נ ruled however that since this is a mistake, the transfer is invalid, indicating that a מחילה בטעות is not a מחילה.</i> –</b><br><b>Does</b> this mean <b>to say that ר"נ maintains a mistaken forfeiture is not a מחילה?!</b><br><b>והא איתמר המוכר פירות דקל לחבירו כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where he is selling the dates that will grow (in the future) on this דקל. The view of רב הונא is that once the dates are grown no one can rescind, however ר"נ maintains that the sale can be rescinded even after the dates grew, since at the time of the deal the dates did not exist and the rule is אין אדם מקנה דבר שלא בא לעולם.  </i> –</b><br><b>But it was taught, one who sell the fruits of a date palm to his friend, etc. –<br>ואמר רב נחמן ומודינא דאי שמיט ואכיל לא מפקינן מיניה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The reason is because at that point in time (when the seller did not yet realize that he can invalidate the sale) the seller is (mistakenly) forfeiting his rights to these פירות, because he mistakenly assumes that they belong to the buyer. This proves that מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה.</i> –</b><br><b>And ר"נ said, ‘and I admit</b> to ר"ה <b>that if</b> the buyer <b>pulled down</b> the dates <b>and ate them, we do not extract from him</b> the price of the dates, which the buyer consumed’. This indicates that ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה, which contradict the previous statement of ר"נ that הדרא ארעא והדרא פירי.<br><b>ומשני התם זביני והכא הלואה –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>answers; there</b> (by the fruit) <b>it is a sale, but here</b> (by the אסמכתא) <b>it is a loan.</b> We cannot compare the two cases.<br><b>ופירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">רש"י there ד"ה הכא.</i> הכא הלואה ומיחזי כרבית שמתחלה בהלואה באו לידו וכרבית קצוצה דמו –</b><br><b>And רש"י explained; here</b> (in the case of הדרא ארעא והדרא פירי) <b>it is a loan<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read הלואה שמתחלה (deleting the words ומיחזי כרבית). [However in our רש"י texts in ב"מ the words ומיחזי כרבית do appear.]</i> (and it appears like interest), <sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The מלוה ate the פירות of the mortgaged property (after the three years); if he will not be required to return the value of the פירות which he consumed (together with the land), those פירות will be interest payments on his loan. The מלוה will eventually receive his loan back in addition to the פירות which he consumed. Therefore even though מחילה בטעות may be a מחילה, but we cannot allow the מלוה to keep the פירות since he would be transgressing the איסור of רבית. It is however, merely מחזי כרבית for it is considered as if the לוה sold him the field (to become effective after three years, if he does not repay him until then). This is not רבית. However since the sale is not valid for it is an אסמכתא, therefore if the מלוה would not return the פירות it would be מחזי כרבית.</i>for initially he received this</b> money <b>as a loan and it is similar to fixed רבית;<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The reason רש"י states וכרבית קצוצה דמו is because the rule is that only רבית קצוצה has to be returned to the לוה (since רבית קצוצה is אסור מן התורה), however any other type of רבית (like אבק רבית) even though it is prohibited, nevertheless once it is taken, there is no obligation to return it (since it is only an איסור דרבנן). In our case the מלוה already took the רבית; he ate the פירות, therefore the reason he must return it is because כרבית קצוצה דמו; people will mistakenly assume that רבית קצוצה need not be returned.</i></b> רש"י continues <b>–<br>ואין אבק רבית<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">Literally אבק רבית means the ‘dust’ of רבית. Actual רבית or רבית קצוצה (which is אסור מדאורייתא) is when at the time of the loan the interest payments were set. However when it was not initially set up that there be interest payments (as in a purchase; see footnote # 12) it is called אבק רבית and is אסור only מדרבנן.</i> אלא במכר כגון לקח ממנו פירות דריש מתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">ב"מ ס,ב. The case there is where someone pays twenty-five דינרים for a כור of wheat (which was the market price) but did not take delivery. Later when the price of wheat rose to thirty דינרים for a כור, the buyer asked for his wheat and the seller said he has no wheat in stock, but will sell him a barrel of wine (which he also did not have in stock) for the credit of thirty דינרים. The buyer has gained five דינרים (or perhaps more) in this transaction. This is considered אבק רבית and is אסור מדרבנן. </i> –</b><br><b>And אבק רבית is only by a sale</b> where <b>for instance he bought fruit from him</b> as mentioned <b>in the beginning of our משנה.<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Even though there was no רבית קצוצה by הדרא ארעא והדרא פרי, nevertheless since it was a loan and not a sale therefore it is כרבית קצוצה דמי and must be returned. </i></b> This concludes the citation of the גמרא ופרש"י in ב"מ. תוספות continues with his question<b></b> on פירש"י –<br><b>דהתם משמע דבכל מקום לרב נחמן מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9.</i> –</b><br><b>So from the</b> גמרא in ב"מ <b>it seems that according to ר"נ in all instances מחילה בטעות is a מחילה</b> (according to פירש"י) –<br><b>בר מהתם בהלואה דמיחזי כרבית –</b><br><b>Except for that case of הלואה where it appears</b> to be <b>like רבית,</b> therefore only there is מחילה בטעות not a מחילה –<br><b>והכא סבר רב נחמן דלא הויא מחילה<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">There was no loan here and nevertheless ר"נ told ר"ע that it is a מחילה בטעות and not an effective מחילה. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>However here ר"נ maintains that</b> מחילה בטעות <b>is not a מחילה.</b><br>תוספות mentions an additional difficulty with that פירש"י:<br><b>ומיהו בלאו הכי קשה על פירושו דהא אמר רבינא התם בריש פירקא (דף סב,א) –</b><br><b>However, without</b> the aforementioned difficulty with פרש"י, <b>there is</b> another <b>difficulty with his interpretation, for רבינא stated there in the beginning of the פרק –<br>דמשכנתא בלא נכייתא<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">משכנתא בלא נכייתא literally means collateral without reduction. The לוה puts up his field as collateral for the מלוה; that until the loan is paid, the field is under the control of the מלוה and the מלוה can reap the harvest without reducing the amount of the loan. The לוה will have to repay the full amount of the loan regardless of how much פירות the מלוה consumes. Those פירות are actually רבית, nevertheless רבינא maintains that we do not return that (רבית) money from the מלוה to the לוה.</i> בדינינו אין מחזירין ממלוה ללוה דלא חשיב רבית קצוצה<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">The חכמים will make the מלוה return to the לוה any fixed רבית which the מלוה collected. However here there is no fixed רבית (since it is possible that nothing will grow on the fields). אבק רבית is not יוצא בדיינים. The same should apply to the אסמכתא field that it is also not רבית קצוצה for the same reason.</i> –</b><br><b>That our courts do not return a משכתנא בלא נכייתא from the מלוה to the לוה for it is not considered רבית קצוצה –<br>ומסתמא דלא פליג עליה רב נחמן<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">רש"י explained that really מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה the only reason why the פירות must be returned is because it is like רבית קצוצה. However this type of רבית is not יוצא בדיינים as רבינא ruled (for it is not רבית קצוצה); it remains by the מלוה, so why does ר"נ rule that הדרא ארעא והדרא פירי?!</i> –</b><br><b>And presumably ר"נ will not argue with</b> רבינא and will agree that he does not return the פירות; so why does he maintain that הדרא ארעא והדרא פירי since it is not רבית קצוצה.<br>In summation: It appears from רש"י that ר"נ generally maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה except in the case of the loan where (even though there is a מחילה [בטעות], nevertheless) the מלוה cannot retain the פירות since it is <i>similar</i> to רבית קצוצה.<br>תוספות asks, firstly our גמרא (which is not discussing a loan) states that ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה, and secondly in this type of רבית (eating the fruits of collateralized property), the ruling is that it remains by the מלוה since it is not רבית קצוצה.<br>תוספות offers his explanation of the גמרא in ב"מ:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו תם דהכי פירושו דבכל מקום סבר רב נחמן דלא הויא מחילה כדאמר הכא –</b><br><b>And it is the view of the ר"ת that this is the explanation; that ר"נ always maintains that</b> מחילה בטעות <b>is not a מחילה, as</b> ר"נ <b>stated here –<br>ובריש המפקיד (בבא מציעא דף לה,א) קאמר נמי רב נחמן התם שומא בטעות הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where a watchman lost the nose rings (כיפי) which were deposited by him. The watchman did not have with what to pay so they assessed and took away his house for the כיפי. Eventually the כיפי were found (in his possession; he misplaced them) and ר"נ ruled that house be returned, for the שומא was done mistakenly since the watchman was always in the possession of the כיפי.</i> –</b><br><b>And ר"נ also stated in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>המפקיד that there it was an erroneous assessment</b> and therefore it is voided –<br><b>ובסוף פרק קמא דגיטין (דף יד,א) נמי אמר דקנין בטעות חוזר<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where gardeners thought that one of them received extra money, so they told him to return it to the owner and he made a קנין with the owner that he will return it; later they realized that there was a mistake in the accounting and no money was owed; ר"נ ruled that it was a קנין בטעות and he is not obligated to pay.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> ר"נ <b>also stated at the end of the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>גיטין that a mistaken קנין can be retracted;</b> all of the above prove that a mistaken transaction is null. תוספות addresses now the גמרא in ב"מ, in which ר"נ differentiates between the פירות דקל which he may keep<b></b> and the פירות האסמכתא which must be returned –<br><b>אלא היינו טעמא דרב נחמן דהתם זביני ולא הויא מחילה בטעות –</b><br><b>Rather this is the reasoning of ר"נ that there</b> (by the פירות דקל) <b>it was a sale, and not a מחילה בטעות</b> (and therefore if שמיט ואכיל the buyer does not need to return the פירות); it is not a מחילה בטעות –<br><b>שאפילו היה המוכר יודע שיוכל לחזור לא היה חוזר –</b><br><b>For even had the seller known that he can retract</b> the sale of the פירות, we may assume that <b>he would not have retracted –<br>דניחא ליה דליקו בהימנותיה וגמר ומקני<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">The מוכר sold the פירות דקל to the לוקח; however it is legally non-binding so the מוכר could nullify the sale. However the מוכר feels that he will gain more by agreeing to the sale so his credibility remains intact, than voiding the sale and losing his credibility. In actuality the מוכר did not realize, at the time the לוקח was harvesting the פירות that the sale was not binding. This happened later, and at that time the מוכר indeed wanted to nullify the sale. However since at the time the buyer harvested the פירות, the מוכר did not object, we assume (that at least at that moment) he would not have objected even had he known that he could object. </i> –</b><br><b>For it is beneficial for him to retain his trustworthiness and he decides to transfer</b> the פירות to the buyer in any event –<br><b>אבל הכא הויא הלואה והלוה אינו מקני ליה אלא בתורת מכר –</b><br><b>However here</b> by the אסמכתא <b>it was a loan, and the לוה does not transfer</b> the rights to the land voluntarily, <b>only by the rules a sale</b> (in lieu of the money he received from the מלוה [as a loan]) <b>–<br>והמכר אינו כלום דאסמכתא היא ולא גמר ומקני<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">We do not say דליקו בהימנותא regarding the לוה since he never had any intention of granting the field to the מלוה as payment for the loan; however the מוכר פירות דקל had every intention of selling the פירות דקל.</i> וכיון דהדרא ארעא הדרי נמי פירי –</b><br><b>However the sale is meaningless for it is an אסמכתא and</b> the לוה <b>never</b> <b>decided to transfer</b> the land, <sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">To review; ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה; however by פירות דקל there was no מחילה בטעות for the seller wants to keep his good name and even though he may be legally entitled to retrieve the פירות, we assume that at the time the buyer gathered the פירות, the seller did not mind (even though he may have known that legally there was no sale). It is therefore considered a bona fide מחילה. By the case of the loan (where the לוה committed his field to the מלוה if he does not pay), the only right the מלוה has to this field, is because it is considered like a sale (the field in exchange for the money he lent the לוה). However it is an invalid sale for the לוה never intended to give up his field since he was certain that he would have paid up the loan in time. Once the sale is invalidated the פירות which the מלוה ate must also revert back to the לוה since it grew on the sלוה' field. This has no connection to רבית.</i> <b>so since the land returns</b> to the לוה because the sale is invalid (since it is an אסמכתא) <b>the פירות also return</b> to the <b>לוה</b> (since the field never belonged to the <b>מלוה</b>) <sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">There is a basic difference between the אסמכתא case of ר"נ (where הדרא פירי) and the משכנתא בלא נכייתא of רבינא (where אינו יוצא בדיינים). By משכנתא בל"נ the לוה willingly gave his field to the מלוה to eat the פירות as (אבק) רבית. It may not be permitted, but once paid it is not יוצא בדיינים. In the case of אסמכתא, the לוה did not give anything [willingly] since he assumed the field would never go to the מלוה, it was a sale based on an אסמכתא which is invalid. Therefore הדרא פירי; not because of רבית, but rather because there never was a sale.</i> –<br><b>אבל אם היה נותן בתורת רבית<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps תוספות means to say as follows. The לוה transfers the field to the מלוה (since he did not pay the loan). However, the לוה still retains the right to redeem the field from the מלוה should he have the funds to pay off the loan. The לוה assures the מלוה that even if he will eventually redeem the field he grants the מלוה all the פירות the מלוה will consume in the interim as a רבית payment for the loan. This רבית need not be returned, since it is אבק רבית.</i> היה קונה דאבק רבית אין יוצא בדיינים –</b><br><b>However if he would give</b> the fruits <b>as רבית</b> (as in the case of משכנתא בלא נכייתא)<b></b> the מלוה <b>would acquire</b> the fruits <b>since אבק רבית is not יוצא בדיינים.</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ורבא<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See there ב"מ סו,ב, that רבא (assuming that ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה [as רש"י explained the גמרא]) wanted to ask ר"נ how can one maintain מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה (and therefore he may keep the פירות דקל) when the rule by אונאה is (see footnote # 27) that one must return the אונאה (to the buyer) even though (the buyer) gave the extra money willingly and was מוחל בטעות. </i> דהוה בעי לאותובי אונאה<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">One rule regarding אונאה (swindling) is that if the price paid was one sixth more (or less) than the true value then (even though the sale is valid) the extra money must be returned.</i> לא היה יודע זה הפירוש –</b><br><b>And רבא who wanted to refute</b> ר"נ from the laws of <b>אונאה did not know this interpretation</b> (of sר"נ' answer, which תוספות gave) –<br><b>שאם היה יודע לא היה מקשה כלום מאונאה –</b><br><b>For if</b> רבא <b>would have known</b> תוספות interpretation, <b>he could not have asked anything from אונאה;</b> he could not have asked why by אונאה he gets back his money but by פירות דקל he does not get back the פירות –<br><b>דהכא לא הויא מחילה בטעות כדפרישית<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read, כדפירישית [משום] דגמר ומקני</i> גמר ומקני –</b><br><b>For here</b> by פירות דקל <b>it is not a מחילה בטעות</b> (as by אונאה) <b>as I explained</b> that the reason he does not return the פירות דקל is [<b>because]</b> the owner convincingly <b>decides to transfer</b> the פירות to the buyer to protect his good name.<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">Rather רבא thought the explanation of sר"נ' distinction between פירות דקל and אסמכתא is as רש"י explained it, whereupon ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה, and the question from אונאה is a valid question.</i><br>תוספות clarifies one more difficulty from the גמרא there:<br><b>ורב נחמן היה משיב<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly since רבא did not understand what ר"נ answered, ר"נ should have merely told him that he was mistaken in the understanding of his answer. תוספות explains why ר"נ responded to רבא as if it were a valid question.</i> מאיילונית<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">The rule regarding an איילונית (a woman who cannot bear children) is that if at the time of marriage we did not realize that she was an איילונית, when he divorces her (upon realizing that she is an איילונית) she does not receive a כתובה since the marriage was a מקח טעות. The obligation of a regular כתובה includes that the husband must give her back (if he divorces her) all the assets she brought into the marriage for which he accepted responsibility. By an איילונית however she does not even receive these assets either, since she has no rights of a כתובה. When the איילונית bought her assets into the marriage and gave them in the custody of her husband she did not know that she was an איילונית (for presumably had she known that she would lose these assets she would never agree to give them to her husband), and nevertheless her מחילה בטעות (mistakenly giving over her assets to her husband) is a מחילה; proving that מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה. This is what ר"נ answered רבא. However תוספות maintains that ר"נ is of the opinion that מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה, how can he argue that איילונית supports his view?!</i> לפי סברת רבא –</b><br><b>And ר"נ</b> who <b>was answering from</b> the case of <b>איילונית</b> (that the case of איילונית supports ר"נ)<b>,</b> it was only <b>according to the logic of רבא –<br>כלומר אדמותבת לי מאונאה תסייען מאיילונית –</b><br><b>Meaning</b> according to your (sרבא') mistaken view that I (ר"נ) maintain מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה; so <b>instead of challenging me from אונאה</b> (which seems to prove that לא הויא מחילה) <b>support my view from איילונית</b> (which proves that הויא מחילה); what ר"נ meant to tell רבא is that –<br><b>אלא על כרחך<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">[ר"נ concluded there that there is no proof from אונאה since דלא ידע דאיתיה אונאה דמחיל גביה and there is no proof from איילונית since דניחא לה דתיפוק עלה שמא דאישות. If we assume the way תוספות explains the difference between the אסמכתא and פירות דקל (but generally מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה) then this answer of ר"נ is understood; we cannot compare פירות דקל to אונאה, since by אונאה the one who was cheated never realized that he was cheated (דלא ידע דאיתיה אונאה דמחיל גביה) it is a מחילה בטעות, however by פירות דקל he wanted to sell the פירות and did not mind the buyer keeping them since דליקו בהימנותיה. Similarly there is no question from איילונית (where מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה), since there she is willing to do anything to be considered married, including giving up her assets. However according to פרש"י that ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה, while we can understand why איילונית is no proof that מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה (since she wants to be considered married), it is difficult to understand why by אונאה it is not a מחילה (since he is not aware) and generally מחילה בטעות is a מחילה (for in all cases of מחילה בטעות seemingly the person does not know of his טעות, just like by אונאה). The question applies to פירות דקל as well (for רש"י does not mention anything regarding דליקו בהימנותא, only that it is מחילה בטעות) how is that different from אונאה? This is perhaps what תוספות means with the אלא ע"כ צריך אתה לחלק כדפי'. וצע"ג.(Alternately the אלא ע"כ is referring to the two questions תוספות had on פירש"י and therefore ע"כ צריך אתה לחלק כדפרישית)]</i> צריך אתה לחלק כדפרישית:</b><br><b>You</b> (רבא) <b>perforce must rather differentiate</b> (between פירות דקל and משכנתא) <b>the way</b> תוספות <b>explained</b> ר"נ, but not the way רבא understood ר"נ.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>רש"י maintains that according to ר"נ we rule מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה (except by a מלוה where it is מיחזי כרבית). תוספות maintains that according to ר"נ any מחילה בטעות לא הויא מחילה except where there is the סברא of דליקו בהימנותיה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות question is how come by פירות דקל we find that ר"נ maintains מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה and here by ר"ע, it is not a מחילה.<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15.</i> Seemingly there are two differences between the cases. Firstly מחילה בטעות הויא מחילה means that if someone forgives a debt under mistaken assumption it is a valid מחילה since he is not taking anything away from anyone; he is allowing the money to remain where it is (as in the case of פירות דקל); however in the case of ר"ע he is being מוציא קרקע from the רשות of his neighbor in such a case perhaps the מחילה בטעות is not effective.<br>Secondly, in the case of פירות דקל the owner sees the buyer harvesting the fruits of his tree (which were sold to the buyer by the seller) and he is acquiescent. That is a מחילה albeit בטעות. However here the neighbor was not being מוחל anything to ר"ע, he assumed the wall was being built on the original boundary line; how was he מוחל anything?!<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">See בל"י אות שפו.</i>

Daf 41b



Line 1

<b>אתא לקמיה דרב יהודה כולי—He came before רב יהודה, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The case here is that the witnesses, who testified that רב כהנא moved the fence into his neighbor’s property, were contradictory; one עד said he moved it over two rows while the other said three rows. ר"י ruled (based on the ruling of רשב"א) that רב כהנא must return two rows of land to his neighbor (since both witnesses agree that he took away (at least) two rows. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradicting גמרא.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>ומסיק דרב יהודה כרבי שמעון בן אלעזר<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">רשב"א interprets a מחלוקת of ב"ש וב"ה in the following manner. In a case where one witness testifies that the לוה owes the מלוה one מנה and the other עד testifies that he owes מאתיים, the ב"ש maintain that נחלקה עדותן and there is no testimony, while ב"ה (whom we follow) maintains that יש בכלל מאתיים מנה and the לוה owes the מלוה a מנה. Similarly here; two אוצייתא is בכלל three אוצייתא, so he must return two אוצייתא.</i> סבירא ליה –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>concludes that ר"י agrees with רשב"א.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ותימה דבפרק זה בורר (סנהדרין דף ל,א ושם לא,א דיבור המתחיל הוא) אמר רב יהודה –</b><br><b>And it is astounding! For ר"י states in פרק זה בורר –<br>עדות המכחשת זה את זה בבדיקות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">When בי"ד interrogates the witnesses they ask them two types of questions, called חקירות ובדיקות. The חקירות are the names of the parties, the time and place the incident occurred. Any contradiction in חקירות nullifies their testimony. בדיקות refers to (other) details, as will be explained in תוספות.</i> כשרה בדיני ממונות –</b><br><B>A</b> pair of <b>witnesses regarding monetary issues, who contradict each other in בדיקות, their</b> testimony <b>is accepted –<br>ומוקי לה באחד אומר ארנקי לבנה ואחד אומר ארנקי שחורה –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>established this</b> ruling (of עדות המכחשת זא"ז בבדיקות כשרה בדיני ממונות) in a case <b>where one</b> עד <b>said</b> he lent him the money from a <b>white wallet and one</b> עד <b>says</b> it was a <b>black wallet,</b> then עדותן כשרה –<br><b>אבל אחד אומר מנה שחור ואחד אומר מנה לבן אין מצטרפין –</b><br><b>However if one</b> עד <b>said</b> it was a <b>black מנה</b> which he lent the לוה <b>and the other</b> עד <b>said it was a white מנה, they do not combine</b> to be an עדות כשרה since they contradict each other; this is the view of רב יהודה, however –<br><b>נהרדעי אמרי אפילו אחד אומר מנה לבן ואחד אומר מנה שחור –</b><br><b>The נהרדעי maintain that even if one says מנה לבן and one says מנה שחור</b> it is a valid עדות –<br><b>ומסיק דאינהו דאמור כרבי שמעון בן אלעזר דהכא –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>concludes that the</b> נהרדעי <b>follow the ruling of רשב"א here</b> (that if one says מנה and the other מאתיים it is a valid עדות) –<br><b>משמע דרב יהודה דפליג אנהרדעי פליג<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, פליג נמי אר"ש.</i> ארבי שמעון בן אלעזר דהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Our גמרא maintains that ר"י (of two or three rows) agrees with the ruling of רשב"א (regarding מנה מאתיים). The גמרא there (seemingly) maintains that מנה לבן וכו' is similar to the case of מנה מאתיים and נהרדעי follow רשב"א and (seemingly) ר"י does not. This is an inherent contradiction!</i> –</b><br><b>It seems that ר"י who argues with the נהרדעי</b> (regarding מנה לבן) <b>[also] argues with רשב"א</b> mentioned <b>here;</b> however here the גמרא states that ר"י agrees with רשב"א.<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דרב יהודה נמי כרבי שמעון בן אלעזר ובהא פליגי –</b><br><b>And one can say; that ר"י also agrees with רשב"א</b> (regarding מנה מאתיים)<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The case of מנה מאתיים literally parallels our case here of תרי ותלת אוצייתא.</i><b>, and the argument</b> between ר"י ונהרדעי (regarding מנה לבן) is <b>as follows –<br>דנהרדעי סברי דאחד אומר מנה שחור ואחד אומר מנה לבן –</b><br><b>For the נהרדעי maintain that</b> the case of <b>אחד אומר מנה שחור ואחד אומר מנה לבן –<br>דמי למילתיה דרבי שמעון בן אלעזר דלא דייקי ביה סהדי ודמי לארנקי –</b><br><b>Is similar to the case of רשב"א</b> (of מנה מאתיים) <b>for the witnesses are not</b> that <b>particular and</b> (the case of מנה לבן) <b>is similar to</b> the case of a black <b>wallet</b> (where all agree that it is a proper עדות, since the עדים do not pay attention to these details) –<br><b>ורב יהודה סבר דלא דמי כלל לארנקי דהתם<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, דהתם כיון דאין.</i> דאין זה גוף המעשה לא היה להן לבדוק –</b><br><b>However, ר"י maintains that</b> the case of מנה לבן <b>is not similar at all to</b> the case of <b>ארנקי</b> (where all agree it is a valid עדות) <b>for</b> by ארנקי <b>[since]</b> the testimony <b>is not</b> regarding <b>the actual occurrence</b> (the issue is the amount of money not the wallet), therefore <b>it was not incumbent upon the</b> עדים <b>to verify</b> what was the color of the wallet, so their contradiction is meaningless –<br><b>אבל מנה דגוף הדבר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read, הדבר שמעידין עליו הוא דייקי.</i> הוא שמעידין עליו דייקי –</b><br><b>However regarding</b> the color of the <b>מנה</b> (whether it was white or black) <b>since this is the actual issue for which they are testifying</b> (they claim that the מלוה gave money to the לוה), <b>the</b> witnesses <b>are precise</b> and make sure that they have all the details correct. When we see a discrepancy we void their testimony –<br><b>וקסבר דמודה רבי שמעון בן אלעזר במנה שחור דבטלה עדותן אפילו לבית הלל –</b><br><b>And</b> ר"י <b>maintains that רשב"א will agree</b> that <b>regarding</b> the case of <b>מנה שחור even ב"ה</b> agree <b>that their testimony is voided.</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות just explained that a discrepancy between מנה לבן and מנה שחור (even if the amount owed is the same) invalidates the עדות (according to ר"י). Seemingly then a discrepancy between מנה and מאתיים (which makes a difference in the amount owed) should surely disqualify their עדות, but nevertheless רשב"א maintains it is a valid עדות!  </i><br><b>ולא דמי למנה ומאתים דעבידי דטעו טפי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The עדים notice more readily the type of money transferred that they notice the amount that was transferred. The money can sometimes be transferred in a manner that the עדים cannot easily discern the amount, but they can easily see the color. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> the case of מנה לבן <b>is not similar to</b> the case of <b>מנה מאתיים</b> where רשב"א maintains עדותן קיימת, <b>because</b> there is a <b>greater chance of error</b> by מנה מאתיים than by מנה לבן –<br><b>אלא מדמה מנה שחור ומנה לבן לאחד אומר חבית של יין ואחד אומר של שמן –</b><br><b>Rather</b> the case of <b>מנה שחור ומנה לבן</b> (according to ר"י) <b>is comparable to</b> a case where <b>one</b> עד said it was <b>a barrel of wine and the other</b> עד <b>said it</b> was a barrel of <b>oil,</b> which was lent or given for a deposit <b>–<br>דבהא מודו כולי עלמא דנחלקה עדותן כדאיתא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">לא,א.</i> התם:</b><br><b>In which case all agree that their testimony is divided</b> and unacceptable, <b>as mentioned there</b> in the גמרא.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>נהרדעי and ר"י agree with רשב"א regarding מנה מאתיים that it is a valid עדות. Regarding מנה לבן the נהרדעי compare it to מנה מאתיים (and ארנקי) so it is a valid עדות, while ר"י compares it to יין ושמן and נחלקה עדותן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Once תוספות concludes that by מנה מאתיים they are more likely to err (than by מנה לבן);<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8.</i> is it possible to distinguish between מנה מאתיים (where עדותן קיימת) and תרי ותלת אוצייתא where perhaps they are less likely to be mistaken?

<b>נחלקה עדותן—Their testimony is divided</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>According to רשב"א both ב"ש and ב"ה agree that if two sets of עדים offer contradictory testimony; one set claimed that he borrowed a מנה and the other claimed he borrowed מאתיים, the rule is עדותן קיימת since יש בכלל מאתיים מנה. However if in one set of עדים, one עד said מנה and the other said מאתיים, then ב"ש maintains נחלקה עדותן and it is not valid (and ב"ה maintains it is valid).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The logic of ב"ש is that the testimony of the עדים is precise; the ע"א who says מנה means מנה and not מאתיים, the ע"א who says מאתיים means מאתיים and not מנה. Therefore one of these עדים is a liar and is completely disqualified. There remains only one עד (let us assume the עד of מנה). One עד is not believed to be מוציא ממון. [ב"ה however maintains that the עדים are not precise and מנה does not exclude מאתיים and מאתיים does not exclude מנה, therefore they can be combined for a מנה.] When there are two כתי עדים, however, then even though one כת עדים is lying and פסול, there still remains another כת (let us again assume the כת of מנה) which is כשר, therefore there is a debt of at least a מנה.</i> תוספות explains the difference according to ב"ש between one כת עדים and two כתי עדים.<br>--------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה רבינו יצחק בן אשר לבית שמאי דאמרי בכת אחת נחלקה עדותן –</b><br><b>The ריב"א has a difficulty; according to ב"ש who maintain that by one set</b> of עדים (where one עד says מנה and the other מאתיים), <b>their testimony is divided –<br>דחשיבי להו עדות מוכחשת<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">One of the עדים is a liar.</i> ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read אפילו (instead of ואפילו).</i> בב' כיתי עדים נמי תבטל עדותן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not ask that it should be בטל since it is שני כתי עדים המכחישים זא"ז where the entire עדות of both כתות is void. That would be in a case where (for instance) one כת claims he owes money and the other כת claims he does not owe, then since we do not know which כת is telling the truth, we nullify both כתות. However, here no matter which כת is lying there still is a debt of (at least) a מנה in any event. Therefore תוספות question is based on נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול. See following footnote # 5 & 6.</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> ב"ש <b>considers them as contradictory witnesses,</b> so <b>even by two sets of עדים their testimony should be nullified –<br>דהוי נמצא אחד מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטלה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">We do not say, ignore the קרוב או פסול, there are other עדים כשרים, but rather since they all came to testify, one פסול invalidates all the כשרים.</i> אפילו הן מאה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Similarly here too, there are four עדים (two כתי עדים), one כת is certainly lying (according to ב"ש) and therefore פסול לעדות; how can we accept the עדות of the other כת when part of the עדות (of four) are פסולים! </i> –</b><br><b>For</b> it is <b>similar</b> to a case where <b>one of the witnesses turns out to be a relative or unfit</b> to testify, where the rule is that <b>their testimony is voided, even if there were a hundred</b> witnesses, but one קרוב ופסול nullifies the entire testimony –<br><b>כדאמר בפרק קמא דמכות (דף ה,ב) –</b><br><b>As</b> the משנה <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>מכות.</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלאו פירכא היא דמצינו למימר דבית שמאי כרבי יוסי סבירא להו –</b><br><b>And the ר"י answers that it is not a refutation, for we can say that ב"ש agrees with ר' יוסי –<br>דאמר התם במה דברים אמורים בדיני נפשות אבל בדיני ממונות תתקיים העדות בשאר<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Similarly here even though one כת is פסול, nevertheless the other כת is כשר, so there is a כת כשר which claims that there is a debt of (at least) a מנה. </i> –</b><br><b>Who maintains there</b> (in מכות); <b>when does this rule apply</b> (that נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטילה) only <b>by capital cases, however by monetary cases</b> even if נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול) the testimony is valid, for we say, <b>let the testimony be established by the remaining</b> witnesses who are not קרובים or פסולים –<br><b>והכי הלכתא דפסיק רב נחמן כוותיה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">In our texts in מס' מכות ו,א it states א"ר נחמן הלכה כרבי (not like ר"י). Others therefore amend the text here to read, ואפילו לרבי נמי דפסק רב נחמן כוותיה מצי למימר.</i> –</b><br><b>And this is the law for ר"נ ruled like</b> ר"י that by דיני ממונות we say תתקיים העדות בשאר.<br><b>ואפילו לרבי<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">רבי maintains there (ו,א) that even by דיני ממונות the rule is נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטילה.</i> נמי מצי למימר דהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דהכא מיירי (deleting the word מצי).</i> מצי מיירי כגון דאתו למיחזי<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות means that both כתי עדים were not appointed witnesses for the transaction; they merely happened to be there. The rule of נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטלה is only if they observed as witnesses [and at that point one of them was a קרוב או פסול, but] not if they were merely there as onlookers. Therefore even though they are now coming to בי"ד to testify, there is no פסול of נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול, since when they saw it, it was not as witnesses.</i> –</b><br><b>And even according to רבי we can also say, that here we are discussing</b> a case <b>where they came to see</b> but not to testify –<br><b>ואפילו אתי לאסהודי הני מילי –</b><br><b>And even if they came to testify,</b> we can differentiate that <b>when do we say</b> that נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטילה, only –<br><b>כי מסייעי אהדדי הוא דאמר נמצא אחד מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטלה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">When the witnesses are all in agreement with each other, their testimony is like one, therefore we say that if a part of that testimony is void (because one עד is a קרוב או פסול), everything is voided. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>When they are assisting each other, then we say נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטלה –<br>אבל הכא דהא מכחשי אהדדי<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot consider these two כתי עדים testifying, as one כת עדים, since they contradict each other, therefore the פסול of one כת has no effect on the other כת.</i> לא:</b><br><b>However here were they contradict each other,</b> we<b></b> do <b>not</b> say נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול עדותן בטלה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ב"ש who agree that by ב' כתי עדים there is a debt of a מנה (even though that by כת א' it is an עדות מוכחשת), is because they agree with ר' יוסי that there is no דין of נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול by דיני ממונות or alternately even if there is, nevertheless it is עדות כשרה because either they were merely onlookers or (even if they were appointed witnesses, nevertheless) since they contradict each other, the rule of נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול does not apply.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is the דין of נמצא א' מהן קרוב או פסול applicable only if they came to testify but not if they were merely onlookers?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> Similarly, why does it not apply<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 12.</i> if they are contradicting each other?<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ and סוכ"ד אות מג.</i>

<b>מלוה על פה אינו גובה לא מן היורשין ולא מן הלקוחות—An oral loan cannot collect neither from the heirs, nor from the buyers</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב ושמואל both ruled than an oral loan cannot collect from the heirs of the לוה, and not from those who bought properties from the לוה (even) after the loan.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A מלוה בשטר can collect (even) from those who bought property (לקוחות) from the לוה after the loan (if the לוה does not own sufficient assets).</i> תוספות explains the reason (and novelty) of this ruling.<br>There is a dispute<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">לקמן קעה,ב.</i> whether שעבודא דאורייתא or שעבודא לאו דאורייתא;<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">If שעבודא דאורייתא then all the assets of the לוה at the time of the loan are משעובד to the מלוה, therefore even if he sells them or he dies and they are inherited, nevertheless the מלוה has the right מן התורה to collect these assets (which were bought or inherited) from the לקוחות or the יורשים. In truth this would apply even to a מלוה ע"פ, however the חכמים enacted that a מלוה ע"פ cannot collect from the לקוחות since there is no publicity and so the לקוחות would be unfairly harmed (and/or people would be reluctant to buy, out of concern that the seller owes money). See footnote # 5.</i> when a לוה borrows money do we maintain that there a lien on his assets מן התורה that they are indentured to the מלוה for the loan – שעבודא דאורייתא, the view of עולא, or we maintain that מן התורה only the לוה is obligated to repay the loan, however there is no lien on his assets<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Nonetheless (even according to the מ"ד שעבודא לאו דאורייתא), the חכמים were מתקן that a מלוה can collect from יורשים ולקוחות (by a מלוה בשטר [only]), in order that people should be willing to lend money [for they are assured that they will be repaid, since the properties of the לוה are indentured to the מלוה]. See footnote # 5.</i> – שעבודא לאו דאורייתא, the view of רב ושמואל.<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">One practical difference whether we maintain שעבודא דאורייתא or לאו דאורייתא is regarding collecting a מלוה ע"פ from יורשים. If we maintain שעובדא דאורייתא so therefore since מה"ת even a מלוה ע"פ can collect from יורשים ולקוחות (see footnote # 3); it is only that the חכמים prevented collection from לקוחות so that they should not be unduly harmed (for they paid money and will lose their purchase), however regarding יורשים who are not losing any money they invested, we will follow the תורה ruling that שעבודא דאורייתא and the מלוה will collect from the יורשים. However if we maintain שעבודא לאו דאורייתא, it is only the חכמים who created a שעבוד (see footnote # 4), we can say that the שעבוד was only במלוה בשטר but not במלוה ע"פ, therefore one cannot collect from the יורשים, since they did not borrow any money and the assets of the לוה are not משעובד by a מלוה ע"פ. </i><br>---------------------<br><b>לא איצטריך אלא משום יורשין דלקוחות תנינא בהדיא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">לקמן קעה,א.</i> –</b><br><b>It was not necessary</b> for רב ושמואל to teach us this ruling regarding לקוחות, <b>only regarding יורשין, for</b> regarding <b>לקוחות the משנה taught it explicitly</b> that המלוה בעדים without a שטר, he is גובה only from נכסים בני חורין.<br><b>וקסבר שעבודא לאו דאורייתא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> רב ושמואל who maintain that a מלוה ע"פ is not גובה מן היורשין <b>maintain that there is no</b> concept of <b>שעבור</b> according to <b>תורה</b> law.<br><b>ומלוה בשטר שהוא גובה היינו שלא תנעול דלת בפני לוין<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">If there will be no lien on the sלוה' properties, no one would lend money, out of concern that they will not be repaid. See footnote # 4.</i> –</b><br><b>And the reason a מלוה בשטר collects</b> from יורשים ולקוחות <b>is</b> only <b>because ‘you should not close the door in the face of the borrowers’</b><br><b>ומכר<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">When a sale is made, the assets of the seller are משעובד to the buyer that in case the property bought is taken away from the buyer, either by a מלוה (whom the seller owes money to) or by a נגזל (the field never belonged to the seller); in these cases the buyer can be compensated for his loss from any property that the seller had in his possession at the time of the sale, even if he subsequently sold those properties, this buyer can collect from them.</i> נמי משום תקנת השוק<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">If the buyer is not assured that his purchase is guaranteed by the assets of the seller, he will be reluctant to buy, out of concern that there may be a lien on this field, or it may not even belong to the seller. See footnote # 9.</i> –</b><br><b>And also regarding a sale</b> there is a שעבוד on the assets of the seller <b>because of ‘improving the market’.</b> However by מלוה ע"פ (where the מלוה showed that he was not concerned about his loan), there was no תקנת חכמים, therefore the מלוה cannot collect from either the לקוחות or the יורשים.<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>ואף על גב דביורשין לא שייך לחלק בין מלוה על פה למלוה בשטר<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The reason why the חכמים were מתקן (according to the מ"ד שעבודא לאו דאורייתא) to collect from יורשים ולקוחות (even though מה"ת there is no שעבוד) is in order שלא תנעול דלת בפני לוין (see footnote # 4). However the חכמים distinguished between a מלוה בשטר (which has publicity), where the מלוה collects from the לקוחות (since they were aware there is a lien on this property), and a מלוה ע"פ (which has no publicity) where the מלוה does not collect from לקוחות (since they were not aware of any loan or lien on this property), so that they should not by unduly harmed. However יורשים inherit the land automatically, regardless if it is a מלוה בשטר or a מלוה ע"פ and in any case they are not unduly harmed (for they merely inherited the property; they did not pay for it) so the ruling by מלוה ע"פ should be the same as by a מלוה בשטר. See footnote # 5 & 12. </i> –</b><br><b>And even though by heirs it is not applicable to differentiate between a מלוה ע"פ and a מלוה בשטר</b> so why do רב ושמואל maintain that a מלוה בשטר can collect from the יורשים and a מלוה ע"פ cannot collect from the יורשים?<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling (regarding יתומים) should seemingly be either that we never collect from יתומים (for their protection) or we always collect from יתומים (because of נעילת דלת בפני לוין).</i><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>מכל מקום כל היכא דגבי לקוחות חיישינן משום נעילת דלת<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> כמו מלוה בשטר –</b><br><b>Nonetheless, wherever regarding לקוחות we are concerned</b> for the מלוה <b>because of נעילת דלת like by a מלוה בשטר</b> where we allow the מלוה to collect from לקוחות –<b></b><br>[תוספות offers other examples where the creditor collects from לקוחות besides a מלוה בשטר:]<br><b>או מלוה הכתובה בתורה<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The example discussed there in קידושין is regarding the redemption of the first born. One מ"ד maintains that פדיון הבן since it is כתובה בתורה it is ככתובה בשטר דמי and the assets of the father are משעובד for this obligation.</i> למאן דאמר (קדושין כט,ב) ככתובה בשטר דמי –</b><br><b>Or a debt which is written in the תורה, according to the one who maintains that it is like it is written in a שטר –<br>או כשעמד בדין<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">Once בי"ד rules that a person owes money to another [even if it was not in a case of מלוה בשטר, but (even in a מלוה ע"פ or) for other reasons; he owed wages or he damaged his property, etc.], there is sufficient publicity to warrant that the creditor may collect from the נכסים משועבדים of the debtor (i.e. from any property the debtor sold after the העמדה בדין). </i> או עשה עבדו אפותיקי<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">If the לוה designated his slave to be the (sole) source of payment for the מלוה, the מלוה can claim this עבד as payment, even if the לוה sold him (and even if it was a מלוה ע"פ [see תוס' מד,ב ד"ה עשה]).</i> –<br>Or where</b> the case was <b>decided in בי"ד, or he mortgaged his slave,</b> in all these abovementioned cases<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> where the creditor collects from the לקוחות –<br><b>גבי נמי מיתמי<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The מלוה wrote a שטר חוב to insure that his loan is guaranteed by the assets of the לוה (even if he sells them); however if he cannot collect from the יורשים his loan is not guaranteed, for perhaps the לוה will die [without selling any property] before he paid up his debt and the מלוה will not be able to collect his loan from the יורשים.</i> –</b><br><b>He also collects from the יתומים</b> (even though the concept of publicity is irrelevant as far as the יתומים are concerned) –<br><b>אבל מלוה על פה כיון דלא חשש לעשות שטר לגבות מלקוחות –</b><br><b>However</b> by a <b>מלוה ע"פ since</b> the מלוה <b>was not</b> sufficiently <b>concerned</b> about his loan <b>to make a שטר</b> in order <b>to collect from the לקוחות</b> indicating that (in this situation) he is willing to lend without a guarantee, therefore –<br><b>כי לא גבי נמי מיתמי ליכא נעילת דלת –</b><br><b>If he will not collect from the יתומים either, there is no נעילת דלת</b> for this מלוה has already shown that he is willing to lend without any concern about repayment.<br>תוספות mentions an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן בפרק קמא דבבא קמא (דף יא,ב) גבי<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read גבי אמר עולא אמר רבי אלעזר הלכה.</i> הלכה גובין מן העבדים –</b><br><b>And that which [עולא said in the name of ר' אלעזר] ‘the rule is,</b> a מלוה <b>may collect</b> his debt by taking <b>slaves</b> as payment’; <b>regarding</b> this statement –<br><b>אמר רב נחמן לעולא אמר רבי אלעזר אפילו מיתמי –</b><br><b>ר"נ said to עולא, ‘did ר"א say</b> that the מלוה can collect the slave as payment <b>even from the orphans</b> of the לוה’? עולא answered –<br><b>לא מיניה מיניה ואפילו מגלימא דעל כתפיה<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there concludes that this rule of גובה מן העבדים is in a case where he made the עבד an אפותיקי (see footnote # 16), in which case the מלוה may collect the עבד as payment even if the לוה sold the עבד.</i> –</b><br><b>‘No’;</b> ר"א said that the מלוה can collect the slave as payment only <b>from</b> the לוה. To which ר"ה responded, ‘<b>from</b> the לוה’!? Obviously he can collect עבדים from the לוה, <b>for</b> the מלוה <b>can even take the ‘shirt off his back’</b> for collecting a loan; why is it necessary to teach us that he can collect the slave as payment. This concludes the citation of the גמרא there.<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">The difficulty from that גמרא is (as תוס' explains later קעה,ב ד"ה לא) that it is seemingly indicated from the גמרא there (by the exchange אפי' מיתמי – לא מיניה) that even though he may collect the עבד from the לקוחות, nevertheless he cannot collect the עבד from the יתומים. This (seemingly) contradicts the entire thrust of תוספות here that there is more reason to collect from יתומים (who are not losing invested capital) than to collect from לקוחות (who stand to lose their investment). Why is it that by עבד you collect from לקוחות but not from יתומים?</i><br>תוספות concludes, the answer to the difficulty –<br><b>שם<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">ב"ק יא,ב תוס' ד"ה כגון. There תוס' explains that in the מסקנא the מלוה can collect the עבד from the יתומים as well as from the לקוחות. [However תוס' later ב"ב קעה,ב ד"ה לא maintains that in the case of עשה עבדו אפותיקי he collects from the לקוחות and not from the יתומים. The reason as תוספות states there is because 'משום שעשו חוצפה לקנות דבר שיש עליו קול שהוא משועבד, והאי טעמא לא שייך ביורשין'. In the case of a מלוה ע"פ however the ruling is that you collect from the יורשים but not from the לקוחות (at least according to the מ"ד שעבודא דאורייתא); because the לקוחות did nothing wrong since there was no קול and they need to be protected.]</i> מפורש:</b><br><b>Is explained there</b> in ב"ק.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ruling of מלוה ע"פ אינו גובה מן היורשין follows the view that שעבודא לאו דאורייתא. Whenever one is גובה from the לקוחות one is גובה from the יורשים and vice versa.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות explains why we collect from יתומים by stating that whenever there is נעילת דלת and we collect<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> from לקוחות we also collect from יתומים (presumably for there too there is נעילת דלת). תוספות chooses to give other examples (besides מלוה בשטר) where we collect from לקוחות (i.e. העמדה בדין, אפותיקי) and we should also collect from יתומים.<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 17.</i> However in the aforementioned cases there is seemingly no נעילת דלת; why then does תוספות mention (in the beginning of his explanation) the concept of נעילת דלת?!<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>
