<b>בפני האב שנה כולי—A year in the presence of the father, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cites a ברייתא which states that if the מחזיק made a חזקה for a year while the father was alive and two more years (after the father passes away) in the lifetime of his son (or vice versa) it is a valid חזקה. Our תוספות reconciles this ברייתא with another seemingly contradictory ruling.<br>-------------------------<br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty:<br><b>והא דאמרינן בפרק שני דכתובות (דף יז,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל ואחת)–</b><br><b>And</b> regarding this <b>which</b> the גמרא <b>states in the second פרק of</b> מסכת <b>כתובות –<br>אמר רב הונא אין מחזיקין בנכסי קטן ואפילו הגדיל –</b><br><b>רב הונא ruled, ‘one cannot make a חזקה in the estate of a minor; and even if he</b> reached <b>maturity</b> a חזקה is ineffective’; the explanation of ואפילו הגדיל –<br><b>לא כמו שיש מפרש שם<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות there ד"ה ואחת; this is the פירוש of ר' שמואל (רשב"ם). </i> דיתום אפילו גדול במילי דאבוה קטן הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The חזקה began during the lifetime of the father. The son during that חזקה period even if he was a גדול (sometime during this period) is not aware of his father’s assets, and never realized that someone is making a חזקה in his father’s property, therefore he did not make a מחאה after his father’s death..</i> –</b><br><b>Is not like the one who interprets it there</b> to mean <b>that even a גדול is considered a קטן regarding the affairs of his father –<br>ואין מועלת חזקה לגביה אפילו שהיה גדול כשמת אביו –</b><br><b>And</b> therefore <b>the חזקה will be ineffective regarding</b> this son, <b>even if he was a גדול when his father died;</b> this interpretation is incorrect –<br><b>דהא הכא אמר בהדיא דהוי חזקה כשאכל בפני הבן והאב שני חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">According to the פי' (הרשב"ם) this law (stated in the ברייתא that אכלה בפני האב ובפני הבן הרי זו חזקה) can never be since he maintains that even if the בן was a גדול when the father dies it is not a חזקה. So what case is the ברייתא discussing?! See the ר"ת in תוספות there who defends this פי' (הרשב"ם) from תוספות question here and explains that according to the רשב"ם the rule of the ברייתא is in a case where the son was already a גדול before the חזקה began. However if the son was a קטן when the חזקה began, even though he became a גדול before his father’s death it is not a חזקה. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1 & 2.</i> –</b><br><b>For here</b> the ברייתא <b>explicitly states that it is a חזקה when</b> the מחזיק <b>consumed</b> the produce <b>in the presence of the son and the father</b> for the duration of the required three <b>חזקה years –</b><br>תוספות offers his interpretation of אין מחזיקין בנכסי קטן:<br><b>אלא דוקא שהיה קטן כשמת אביו אינה חזקה אף על פי שאחרי כן הגדיל.</b><br><b>Rather</b> the ruling of ר"ה that אין מחזיקין בנכסי קטן means <b>that it is not a חזקה,</b> <b>only if</b> the son <b>was a קטן when his father dies, even though he became a גדול later</b> and the מחזיק made a חזקה during the time the son was a גדול. However if the son was a גדול when the father died it is a חזקה if אכלה שני חזקה בפני הבן והאב.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably a father informs his mature children regarding his assets (and would have told his בנו גדול) regarding this (disputed) field; however he would not share this information with his minor children.</i><b><br>רבינו יצחק:</b><br>The forgoing is attributed to the <b>ר"י.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>When the son reached maturity in his father’s lifetime the חזקה is valid by the son. If he reached maturity after his father passed we apply the rule of אין מחזיקין בנכסי קטן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why does תוספות here not accept the explanation of the ר"ת<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3. </i> offered in מס' כתובות?<br>2. Seemingly תוספות understands the פי' (הרשב"ם) that אין מחזיקין בנכסי קטן ואפי' הגדיל to mean that even if he was a גדול when the חזקה began, nevertheless it is not a חזקה בפני הבן (otherwise there would be no question from the ברייתא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3 and ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i>). According to this understanding, there is an additional difficulty in the words of רב הונא when he said 'ואפילו הגדיל'; for ר"ה meant (according to this understanding) even if he was a גדול (not that he became a גדול). Why did not תוס' ask this question (as well)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נח"מ.</i>
<b>ואי סלקא דעתך לוקח אית ליה קלא אין לך מחאה גדולה מזו—And if it enters your mind that there is publicity by a purchaser, there is no greater protest than this</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא taught if a three year חזקה was made against a מרא קמא; first the father lived there for a year, then the son inherited the father and lived there for a year, then the son sold it to a buyer who lived there for a year, it is a valid חזקה if the מערער did not make a מחאה during the three years. The מערער cannot claim that he was not מערער the third year because the person who was מחזיק then is a different person than the previous occupants (father and son),<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">They are not מחזיק כדמחזיקי אינשי; one year this one, the next year another one.</i> for we say that the sale is publicized and the מערער knew that the buyer’s חזקה is a continuation of the חזקה started by the father and son.<br>The גמרא asks that this presumption that a sale has a קול is contradicted by the סיפא of this<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספתא פ"ב ה"ג that these two ברייתות are written in sequence. See footnote # 4.</i> ברייתא which states that if a person makes a three year חזקה; the first year during the lifetime of the מרא קמא, the second year during the lifetime of his son, and the third year after the son sold it to a buyer (and no one made a מחאה during these three years) it is a valid חזקה. However if there is publicity by a sale so when the son sold it to the לוקח this was a valid מחאה against the מחזיק, which the son is making, so the מחזיק should have kept his שטר. The גמרא replies that this latter ברייתא is where the son sold all his properties (not the disputed property specifically) and the argument is whether the disputed property is included in the sale. תוספות offers an alternate resolution to this contradiction.<br>------------------------------<br><b>אומר רבינו יצחק דהוי מצי לשנויי כאן בשטר כאן בלא שטר –</b><br><b>The ר"י sates that</b> the גמרא <b>could have answered</b> and distinguished between the two ברייתות saying that <b>here</b> (in the first ברייתא where לוקח has a קול) we are discussing a case where sale was <b>with a שטר,</b> therefore the עדי השטר are מוציא a קול and the חזקה is valid) and <b>here</b> (in the second ברייתא where לוקח has no קול) <b>it is without a שטר</b> (and therefore there is no קול) –<br>תוספות proves that there is a distinction whether the sale was with or without a שטר:<br><b>דאין מצטרפין אלא בשטר כדאמרינן לעיל –</b><br><b>For</b> לקוחות <b>cannot combine</b> to make a חזקה <b>unless</b> they sold to each other the property <b>with a שטר as</b> רב <b>ruled previously<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">מא,ב. If three people made a חזקה in three consecutive years, one year per person where the property was sold from one to the other, it is a חזקה if the sale was with a שטר, for then the מערער is aware of the sale and cannot claim that each one made only a חזקה for a year.</i> –</b><br>תוספות offers a tentative reason why the גמרא did not use this distinction:<br><b>אלא שמא דעדיפא מיניה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage of the sגמרא' answer may be that it is applicable even if we maintain that עדים without a שטר also has a קול. See מהרש"א מהוד"ב for an alternate explanation; if we assume that both ברייתות are connected (see footnote # 2) then it is difficult to say that one is בשטר and the other שלא בשטר (for the ברייתא could have mentioned one case and differentiated whether or not it was בשטר), however we can say (according to the sגמרא' answer) that indeed both ברייתות are where he sold שדותיו סתם [in the first ברייתא it is a חזקה because the לוקח was utilizing the field (so the מערער should have been מוחה), and in the latter ברייתא it is a חזקה because there is no proof that he sold the disputed field]. See נח"מ.</i> קא משני:</b><br><b>But perhaps</b> the גמרא gave <b>a better answer.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a קול by לקוחות (regarding חזקה ומחאה), [only] if the sale was made with a שטר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות answers that if the sale is not בשטר (only with עדים) it is not a מחאה. Seemingly a מחאה does not require a שטר only עדים that he is מוחה, and since אין לך מחאה גדולה מזו why does this sale not invalidate the חזקה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א, נח"מ and בל"י אות תח. </i><br>--------------------------<br><b>תם ולא נשלם פירושי התוספות</b><br><b>לפרק חזקת הבתים והבורות</b><br><b>בעזרת אדון הנפלאות</b><br><b>נשוב לסיים פרקין עד גמירא<br>בברכת נורא על כל תהילה</b>

Daf 42b



Line 1

<b>אבל שותף יש לו חזקה—However a partner has a presumptive</b> status<br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא cited a dispute between אבוה דשמואל ולוי, who maintain that a partner has no חזקה, and שמואל who maintains שותף יש לו חזקה. According to שמואל the text in the משנה reads, אומן אין לו חזקה [indicating that שותף יש לו חזקה]. The גמרא will shortly state that in certain instances even שמואל agrees that שותף אין לו חזקה. Our תוספות discusses why indeed the משנה did not state שותף אין לו חזקה.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>יש ענין לשותף דאין לו חזקה כדמפרש לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא later on this עמוד that it applies in cases of either נחית לכולא or נחית לפלגא, or if לית בה דין חלוקה.</i> –<br>There is merit to</b> say even according to שמואל that <b>שותף אין לו חזקה</b> in certain cases <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>explains shortly.</b><br>תוספות (therefore) asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אם כן ליתני במתניתין שותף אין לו חזקה –<br>And if you will say; if indeed</b> this is the case that in certain instances שמואל agrees that שותף אין לו חזקה, <b>let the משנה states שותף אין לו חזקה –<br>אף על פי שיש שותף שיש לו חזקה –</b><br>And <b>even though there is a שותף שיש לו חזקה,</b> nevertheless since there are cases where שותף אין לו חזקה, the משנה can state שותף אין לו חזקה –<br><b>כי היכי דתני אריס אף על פי ששאר אריס שאינו אריסי בתי אבות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">אריסי בתי אבות are those sharecroppers whose ancestors before them worked as אריסים for these very same landowners.<br>See later מו,ב that only אריסי בתי אבות have no חזקה, but other אריסים do have a חזקה. The question is that just as we see regarding the אריסים, there are some who have a חזקה (i.e. שאר אריסים) and others who do not have a חזקה (like אריסי בתי אבות), and nevertheless the משנה states that אריסים do not have a חזקה, the same should be regarding שותפין that even though there are שותפין that have a חזקה, but since there are also שותפין that do not have a חקה (see footnote # 1), the משנה should have also stated that שותפין אין להם חזקה (just like אריסים). Why does שמואל maintain that the משנה does not mention שותפין?!</i> יש להן חזקה –<br>Just like the משנה states, a sharecropper</b> has no חזקה, <b>even though that other אריסים that are not אריסי בתי אבות do have a חזקה –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>ויש לחלק:</b><br><b>And it is possible to differentiate</b> between אריסים and שותפין. However תוספות does not explain the difference.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם who explains that regarding אריסים there is a particular type of אריס (meaning אריסי בתי אבות) who have no חזקה. Therefore the משנה can state אריסים אין להם חזקה, referring to the אריסי בתי אבות. However, regarding שותפין there is no special type of שותף which has no חזקה, rather it depends on whether נחית לכולא or נחית לפלגא (and we are not even sure when it is or is not a חזקה), and according to רבא it depends on whether יש בו כדי חלוקה or not, therefore there is no clear cut case where שתופין אין להם חזרה, therefore the משנה did not state it.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can distinguish between אריסים (where the משנה states אין להם חזקה and שותפין (where it does not mention it [according to שמואל]).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes 'ויש לחלק', without being specific as to how we differentiate. Is it because the difference is obvious (as the מהר"ם explains it [in footnote # 3], or because of the exact opposite that the answer is not sufficiently satisfying?

Line 2

<b>שותף כיורד ברשות דמי לאו למימרא דאין לו חזקה—A partner is like one who enters with permission; does that not mean that he has no <i>Chazokoh</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>שמואל ruled that a שותף has a חזקה. The גמרא challenged this since שמואל ruled that a שותף is considered like an אריס (who has the right to work the field). Presumably this means that the שותף has no חזקה, just like an אריס who has no חזקה. Our תוספות has a difficulty in understanding this challenge.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח offers an alternate גירסא of ותימה (instead of ואם תאמר).</i> תאמר מנא ליה דילמא לענין שנוטל בשבח המגיע לכתפים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This will be discussed in the following תוס' ד"ה שבח. See רשב"ם ד"ה לומר.</i> כדאמר בסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See later on this עמוד. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1 & 2.</i> –<br>And if you will say [and it is astounding]</b> <b>how does</b> the גמרא <b>derive this</b> (that שותף כיורד ברשות means that אין לו חזקה), <b>perhaps</b> this ruling <b>is</b> only <b>regarding that a</b> שותף <b>takes the שבח המגיע לכתפים,</b> just like an אריס, <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>states shortly,</b> but it does not mean that אין לו חזקה, so what is the challenge to sשמואל' ruling that שותף אין לו חזקה?!<b></b><br>תוספות anticipates a possible solution to his question:<br><b>וכי תימא דמשמע ליה דבכל ענין מדמי ליה לאריס –<br>And if you will say that it seems to</b> the גמרא <b>that</b> שמואל <b>compares</b> a שותף <b>to an אריס in all respects</b> (not only for שבח המגיע לכתפים) and therefore just as an אריס אין לו חזקה (as our משנה states), so too a שותף אין לו חזקה, and there is a contradiction in sשמאול' ruling. This would seemingly explain the question on שמואל –<br>תוספות negates this solution:<br><b>דלמא כשאר אריסים קאמר שיש להן חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה אבל (TIE footnote # 2).</i> ולא כאריסי בתי אבות:</b><br><b>Perhaps</b> שמואל meant <b>to say</b> that a שותף is like <b>other אריסים who do have a חזקה, but</b> the שותף <b>is not like אריסי בתי אבות</b> (who do not have a חזקה). Then there is no contradiction in the rulings of שמואל.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is seemingly no proof from sשמואל' statement of שותף כיורד ברשות דמי, that he maintains שותף אין לו חזקה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. <b>תוספות</b> initial question was<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See (text by) footnote # 2.</i> how do we know that when <b>שמואל</b> ruled <b>שותף כיורד ברשות</b>, he meant that <b>אין לו חזקה</b>, perhaps he only meant the he is <b>נוטל</b> the <b>שבח המגיע לכתפים</b>. Why did not <b>תוספות</b> ask initially that perhaps when <b>שמואל</b> said <b>שותף כאריס</b> he meant like <b>שאר אריסים</b> that he is <b>נוטל</b> the <b>שבח המגיע לכתפים</b> and <b>יש לו חזקה</b> like <b>שאר אריסים</b>?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i><br>2. <b>תוספות</b> initial question was how do we know that when <b>שמואל</b> ruled <b>שותף כיורד ברשות</b>, he meant that <b>אין לו חזקה</b>, perhaps he only meant the he is <b>נוטל</b> the <b>שבח המגיע לכתפים</b>. However if that is all that <b>שמואל</b> meant, he should have just said <b>שותף נוטל בשבח המגיע לכתפים</b>,<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא later on this עמוד which states לימא שותף אין לו חזקה.</i> why say <b>שותף כיורד ברשות דמי</b>?!<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See פני שלמה and נחלת משה.</i>

<b>שבח המגיע לכתפים—The improvement that reaches the shoulders</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא concluded that when שמואל stated that a שותף is כיורד ברשות דמי he meant to say that he receives the שבח המגיע לכתפים in a field which is not intended for planting trees, just as he would receive it in a field that is intended for planting trees.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה לומר for an explanation.</i> There are two interpretations as to the meaning of שבח המגיע לכתפים.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>מפרש רש"י בכמה מקומות וכן רבינו שמואל דמגיע לכתפים כגון ענבים הראויין ליבצר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">They are referred to as מגיע לכתפים, because they are ready to be harvested and carried away on one’s ‘shoulders’.</i> –<br>רש"י explains in many places and similarly the רש</b>ב"ם here <b>that</b> שבח <b>המגיע לכתפים is for instance grapes which are fit to be harvested –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשה דאמרינן בפרק קמא דבבא מציעא (דף טו,ב) –<br>And there is a difficulty</b> with the aforementioned explanation, <b>for</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ב"מ –<br>והא מעשים בכל יום וקא מגבי שמואל לבעל חוב בשבח המגיע לכתפים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is in a case where the לוה sold his property and the מלוה is collecting his debt from the mortgaged property which the buyer bought from the borrower; שמואל would allow the lender to collect even from the שבח המגיע לכתפים, which according to רש"י ורשב"ם means the ripe produce.  [Let assume that the loan was for $150, and the field (barren) is worth $100, and the fruit on the trees are worth an additional $50, the מלוה may take the field and the fruit.]</i> –<br>But it happens every day where שמואל allows a creditor to collect from the שבח המגיע לכתפים –<br>ואי סלקא דעתך היינו ענבים הראוים<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ענבים העומדים ליבצר (not ענבים הראוים ליבצר). [This הגה"ה should seemingly also apply to the previous time it states הראויין ליבצר (by footnote # 2).]</i> ליבצר אם כן בעל חוב לא גבי מינייהו<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">A lender can collect from the property of the buyer (which is קרקע), but not from the ripe produce of the property (which is considered מטלטלין), for this belongs to the buyer and is not mortgaged to the loan, as תוספות goes on to prove.</i> –<br>And if we are to assume</b> that שבח המגיע לכתפים <b>means grapes which are ready to be harvested</b> (like רש"י)<b>, if indeed it is so, the lender cannot collect from them –<br>כדאמר בכתובות פרק נערה (דף נ,ב) אמר<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">In our text in מסכת כתובות it reads אמר להו הבו לה וכו'. The case there is where the father died and it is obligatory on the male heirs to support the daughters of the deceased. The issue there is whether the daughters can claim their support from מטלטלין (of the estate) or only from קרקע.</i> ליה זיל הב ליה מתמרי דעל בודיא –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>relates in</b> מסכת <b>כתובות in פרק נערה;</b> רב יוסף <b>said to</b> the sons, <b>give her from the dates which are on the mats –<br>אמר ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ליה אביי לא (instead of ליה לא).</i> לא יהא אלא בעל חוב דחזו לבודיא קאמינא –<br>[אביי] said</b> to רב יוסף, ‘<b>let them</b> even be <b>considered as a creditor’;</b> could he collect from the מטלטלין of יתומים, so how can the daughter (who is weaker than a מלוה)<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">A מלוה can collect even from נכסים משועבדים, however regarding מזון האשה והבנות, the rule is that they cannot collect from נכסים משועבדים, only from the estate of the husband/father</i> collect from the מטלטלין of the יתומים? רב יוסף replied, ‘<b>I meant from</b> the dates which are ready to be harvested and <b>fit to be</b> placed <b>on the mat’</b>. However, אביי persisted –<br><b>סוף סוף כל העומד ליגדר כגדור דמי דצריכי לדקלא קאמינא –</b><br><b>‘Nonetheless</b> since they are ripe and ready to be harvested we have the rule, <b>whatever is ready to be harvested is like it was</b> already <b>harvested’,</b> so it is still considered מטלטלין; to which רב יוסף replied, ‘<b>I meant</b> only those dates <b>which still need to</b> be on <b>the tree’;</b> they are not ripe yet, so they are considered as קרקע –<br><b>אלמא לא גבי מאותם העומדים ליגדר<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The question on רש"י is if שבת המגיע לכתפים means ripe produce, how can the גמרא in ב"מ state that שמואל would be מגבה for a מלוה even from שבח המגיע לכתפים, when from the גמרא in כתובות it is clear that a מלוה cannot collect from ripe fruit, for they are considered מטלטלין which belong to the buyer and are not part of the mortgaged קרקע!</i> –<br>It is evident that</b> even a מלוה <b>cannot collect from those</b> fruits <b>which are ready to be harvested.</b> How can we understand פרש"י?!<br>תוספות dismisses this question on רש"י:<br><b>ולאו פירכא היא דהא רש"י נמי לא בעי למימר מאותן העומדים ליבצר מיד<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See (also) רש"י there בד"ה המגיע who writes, קרוב ליקצר אלא שעדיין צריכין לקרקע.</i> –<br>And this is no refutation</b> of פרש"י<b>, for even רש"י did not mean to say</b> that המגיע לכתפים <b>are</b> (only) <b>those</b> fruits <b>which are ready to be harvested immediately,</b> for they are certainly not considered קרקע –<br><b>אלא כלומר כל דבר שסופו ליתלש כגון פגין או בוסר –<br>Rather</b> רש"י meant <b>anything which will eventually be harvested, for instance unripe figs or grapes</b> is (also) called שבח המגיע לכתפים. It is self-understood that in our גמרא the שבח המגיע לכתפים which the שותף takes are the ripe foods. שבת המגיע לכתפים therefore generally means all produce that grows; ripe or unripe.<br>תוספות offers an alternate explanation of שבח המגיע לכתפים:<br><b>ורבינו תם מפרש מגיע לכתפים היינו דבר שבא על ידי טורח<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">It is called מגיע לכתפים because (as we say in the vernacular) you need to put your ‘shoulder’ to it.</i> –</b><br><b>And the ר"ת explains that מגיע לכתפים means</b> an improvement <b>that comes about through toil,</b> but not an improvement where it improved on its own without toil –<br><b>ומייתי ראיה מהא דתנן בסוף יש נוחלין (לקמן דף קלד,א) האומר זה אחי אינו נאמן –<br>And</b> the ר"ת <b>brings proof</b> to his explanation <b>from the משנה in the end of</b> פרק <b>יש נוחלין; one</b> (ראובן) <b>who says, ‘this</b> (לוי) <b>is my brother’, he is not believed<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that ראובן and שמעון are the known sons of יעקב. Then ראובן claims that לוי is also a son, and שמעון is skeptical. If יעקב left over six (equal) fields, לוי is not entitled to inherit two fields because שמעון can say to לוי, ‘prove it that you are a brother’. Rather שמעון inherits three fields as if there are only two brothers ראובן ושמעון.  </i></b> so that the newcomer (לוי) should inherit equally with his other brothers –<br><b>ויטול עמו בחלקו<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן claims that לוי is a brother, so that each brother is entitled to two fields, therefore ראובן takes two fields and לוי takes one field (that would have gone to ראובן had לוי not appeared on the scene). לוי cannot take one field away from שמעון, unless he can prove that he is a brother.</i> מת יחזירו נכסים למקומם<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">שמעון has no claim on sלוי' field since he already received his three fields. However the field that לוי received goes back to ראובן, since ראובן received only two fields.</i> נפלו לו נכסים ממקום אחר יירשו אחיו עמו<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">לוי maintained all along that he is a brother to ראובן ושמעון, therefore both ראובן and שמעון inherit him.</i> –<br>But rather</b> לוי <b>takes</b> a partial share <b>with</b> ראובן. If לוי <b>dies his property is returned to its place</b> (to ראובן). If לוי <b>inherited property from elsewhere</b> (not from his father)<b>,</b> and he died, all <b>his brothers inherit from him.</b> This concludes the משנה <b>–<br>ובעי רבא (שם קלה,ב) שבח ששבחו נכסים מאליהם מהו<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that the field which לוי received (from ראובן; see footnote # 13) was initially worth $100. Now it is worth $200; this improvement happened by itself as the גמרא there continues to explain. The question is if לוי dies what happens with the extra $100. The first hundred certainly goes to ראובן, as the משנה stated (footnote # 14); the question is regarding the $100 improvement; is it considered part of the original field and therefore it reverts back to ראובן, or is it considered like נפלו לו נכסים ממקום אחר, so it is inherited both by ראובן and שמען.</i> –<br>And רבא queried; what is the ruling regarding an improvement that the properties</b> (which לוי initially received from his father) <b>improved on their own.</b> The גמרא clarifies the query <b>–<br>בשבח המגיע לכתפים לא תבעי לך דכי נפלו ממקום אחר דמי<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">This is well understood according to פר"ת that שבח המגיע לכתפים means the improvement that לוי made in the field. This added value is not included in the initial value of the field; it is something that לוי added on his own, and since לוי claims that he is their brother they all share in his created wealth. </i> –<br>If it was שבח המגיע לכתפים there is no query, for it is like</b> the case <b>where he received assets from elsewhere,</b> where the rule is that all the brothers inherit him –<br><b>כי תיבעי לך בשבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים כגון דקלא ואלים ארעא ומסקא שרטון<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The query then would be since no one did anything to improve the field, this improvement can be considered as part of the initial field, so it should all belong to ראובן, or perhaps since its value increased it should be shared by all the brothers, ראובן and שמעון.</i> –<br>When should you query, in</b> a case of <b>שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים, for instance, the tree</b> in the field <b>became thicker, or a land on which a river deposited soil</b> making it more fertile. In any event –<br><b>משמע שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים היינו בא מאליו<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The query of רבא was regarding שבח הבא מאליו. The גמרא says that the query is by שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים, which means that שבח הבא מאליו and שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים are one and the same.</i> –<br>It seems that שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים means that it came by itself,</b> and by implication שבח המגיע לכתפים would mean that it came through one’s toil, as the ר"ת explained.<br>תוספות negates this proof and argues that on the contrary it disproves the ר"ת:<br><b>ולרבינו אלחנן נראה דאדרבה משם קשה לרבינו תם דלמה שינה בלשון –<br>However it appears to ר"א the opposite; that</b> the גמרא <b>there poses a difficulty for the ר"ת; for why did</b> the גמרא<b>change its language,</b> meaning –<br><b>דמעיקרא קאמר נכסים ששבחו מאליהם מהו –<br>That initially</b> רבא <b>stated, ‘what is</b> the rule<b></b> regarding <b>נכסים ששבחו מאליהם’ –<br>ובתר הכי קאמר כי תיבעי לך בשבח שאין מגיע לכתפים –<br>And afterwards</b> the גמרא changes <b>and says, ‘you should query regarding שבח שאין מגיע לכתפים’;</b> and if they are the same thing –<br><b>דמעיקרא נמי הוה ליה למימר שבח שאין מגיע לכתפים –<br>Initially</b> רבא <b>should have asked</b> regarding <b>שבח שאין מגיע לכתפים,</b> the fact that he did not use the same language as the גמרא uses later, indicates that they are not the same –<br><b>אלא משמע דשבח המגיע לכתפים נמי הוי נכסים ששבחו מאליהם<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">רבא queried regarding נכסים ששבחו מאליהם. The גמרא clarified that there are two types of נכסים ששבחו מאליהם, either שבח המגיע לכתפים (where there is no query) and שבח שאין מגיע לכתפים (where there is a query.) It therefore turns out (according to ר"א) that שבח המגיע לכתפים is also a type of נכסים ששבחו מאליהם, and therefore we cannot accept the פר"ת who maintains that המגיע לכתפים means that he toiled to make this שבח. [However, according to רש"י it is understood. There are two types of נכסים ששבחו מאליהם, one where the fruits grow by themselves, but that belongs to all the brothers since it is like נכסים שנפלו ממקום אחר (see shortly in this תוספות), but then there is another type of ששבחו מאליהם like דקלא ואלים which is a שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים; we do not harvest it on our shoulders, and that is where the query of רבא was asked.]</i> –<br>Rather it seems that שבח המגיע לכתפים is also</b> considered <b>נכסים ששבחו מאליהם –</b><br>תוספות has an additional difficulty with פי' ר"ת:<br><b>ועוד קשה לרבינו תם אמאי קאמר כגון דקלא ואלים הוי ליה למימר כגון פירות הבאות מאליהם –<br>And there is an additional difficulty with</b> the explanation of the <b>ר"ת</b> (who maintains that שבח המגיע לכתפים means profit from work and שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים means שבח which comes by itself without work); <b>why does</b> the גמרא <b>state</b> (in פרק יש נוחלין)<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See text by footnote # 18.</i> that a שבח שאינו מגיע לכתפים is <b>for instance a tree which became larger,</b> the גמרא <b>should have said, for instance fruits which grow on their own<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">However according to פרש"י that שבח המגיע לכתפים means that you can remove it on your shoulders, it is understood that דקלא ואלים is a שבח שאין מגיע לכתפים, however פירות הבאות מאליהם are certainly a שבח המגיע לכתפים.</i></b> without additional work –<br>תוספות clarifies פרש"י:<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 20 [in the bracketed area].</i><br><b>ואומר רבינו שמשון בן אברהם דאין תימה לפירוש רש"י דשבח המגיע לכתפים היינו פירות –<br>And the רשב"א says that one cannot wonder</b> and ask <b>according to פרש"י that שבח המגיע לכתפים refers to פירות;</b> if so –<br><b>אמאי חשיב להו כנכסים שנפלו לו ממקום אחר ויטלו אחיו עמו<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15-17.</i> –<br>Why does</b> the גמרא in ב"ב <b>consider them like assets which he received from elsewhere, and</b> so therefore all <b>the brothers can share in it –</b><br><b>הלא גם להם יש פירות בארצם שהיתה כנגד זו<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">Let us review (see footnote # 12); there are six fields each worth $100 (without פירות). שמעון took three fields (he does not acknowledge לוי as a brother), ראובן took two fields and לוי took one. At the time of sלוי' death his field had $10 worth of fruit. According to רש"י this is שבח המגיע לכתפים and the גמרא there states that it is shared equally by ראובן ושמעון. The question is why! Presumably just as sלוי' field produced $10 worth of פירות, so too did sשמעון' (third) field produce $10 worth of פירות. The reason שמעון has a claim on the $10 of sלוי' field is because לוי claims that he is a brother, if לוי is a brother then sשמעון' third field belongs to לוי, so he already received the $10 of fruit from his third field, and ראובן alone should receive the $10 from sלוי' field. If לוי did not exist this field would be sראובן', so he is taking back what he gave לוי. However according to the פר"ת it is understood. See footnote # 17.</i> –<br>Is it not so that they also have fruits in their land corresponding to</b> the fruits which grew on sלוי' land –<br>The רשב"א explains, why there is no difficulty לפרש"י:<br><b>דהא מבעי ליה בדקלא ואלים ארעא ומסקא שרטון אי חשיב כנפלו לו נכסים ממקום אחר –<br>For</b> we see <b>that</b> רבא there in ב"ב <b>queried regarding a tree which became larger, and land upon which</b> a river placed new <b>topsoil, whether they are considered as נכסים הבאים ממקום אחר</b> (and the brothers should share), so if (even) by דקלא ואלים וכו' there is a סברא that it should be considered like נכסים שנפלו לו ממקום אחר, then –<br><b>כל שכן פירות דאית לן לאחשובינהו טפי כנפלו לו ממקום אחר –<br>Surely</b> regarding <b>פירות</b> which grew on the property <b>that we should consider it even more like</b> נכסים <b>שנפלו לו ממקום אחר –</b><br>תוספות proves this point that פירות are considered more ממקום אחר than דקלא ואלים:<br><b>כדמוכח גבי בכור (לקמן דף קכד,א) דפליגי רבי ורבנן בחפירה והוו שיבלי (שלחופי<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read שלפופי (instead of שלחופי).</i>) והוו תמרי –<br>As is evident later regarding a firstborn, where רבי and the רבנן argue</b> in a case where <b>fodder became sheaves of grain, or date trees which produced dates;<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">When the father died the grain was not ripe; it was still fodder. Later it grew into sheaves of grain. The same with the dates; the issue here is whether the בכור receives his double portion as the estate was worth at the time of death, or does he receive his פי שנים for the produce which grew later.</i></b> the issue there is –<br><b>אי בכור נוטל פי שנים<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">A בכור takes a double portion in all the assets which the father owned at the time of his death. However he shares equally with his brothers any assets which came later to the father’s estate (the children improved the property).</i> אי לא ואפילו הכי מודו בדקלא ואלים וארעא ומסקא שרטון דשקיל –<br>Whether the בכור takes a double</b> portion of the grown produce <b>or not, but nevertheless all agree regarding דקלא ואלים וארעא ומסקא שרטון that he takes</b> a double portion in the improved assets –<br><b>אלמא חשבינן פירות טפי בנפלו<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read כנפלו (instead of בנפלו).</i> לאחר מכן מדקלא ואלים<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">The more the improvement is considered part of the initial estate, the more reason for the בכור to receive פי שנים. Since we see that all agree that he receives פי שנים from דקלא ואלים that proves that we do not consider this as something which came later, but rather it is part of the initial estate. However by פירות the רבנן maintain that the בכור does not receive פי שנים, because it is considered like something new which was added to the estate, meaning it is considered like נכסים שנפלו לאחר מכאן.</i> –<br>It is evident</b> from that גמרא that <b>we consider fruits to be more</b> in the category of <b>נפלו לאחר מכן than דיקלא ואלים –<br>ומצינן למימר שפיר שיטלו אחיו בפירות<sup class="footnote-marker">31</sup><i class="footnote">From the גמרא regarding בכור we understand that פירות is considered more מקום אחר than דיקלא ואלים, so since by דקלא ואלים there is consideration that all the brothers share in it, so certainly by פירות (which are more מקום אחר than דיקלא ואלים), that all the brothers share in the פירות.</i> –<br>And so therefore we can properly assume that the brothers</b> (ראובן ושמעון) <b>should share</b> equally in the פירות of לוי –<br>תוספות now resolves logically<sup class="footnote-marker">32</sup><i class="footnote">Previously תוספות (merely) proved that פירות are more כנפלו ממ"א than דיקלא. Now תוספות will explain why indeed פירות are considered נפלו ממ"א.</i> the ואין תימה mentioned previously:<sup class="footnote-marker">33</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 25.</i><br><b>ואף על פי שגם לקחו נגדם בחלקם דהם טרחו והם אכלו<sup class="footnote-marker">34</sup><i class="footnote">Even though we are discussing פירות הבאים מאליהם, nevertheless there needs to be some effort in maintaining the tree, such as pruning, weeding, etc. They therefore ‘deserve’ to eat the פירות (even though it may belong to לוי), since they worked for it.</i> –<br>And even though that they</b> (the brothers -שמעון) <b>also took a corresponding</b> share of פירות <b>in their portion,</b> nevertheless they all share in sלוי' fruits, <b>since</b> regarding their פירות, <b>they toiled and they ate</b> the work of their toil –<br><b>אבל מה שהמת טרח למה לא יקחו בטורח המת כמותו<sup class="footnote-marker">35</sup><i class="footnote">If the פירות would grow without any טרחה whatsoever, it is understood that שמעון has no claim on לוי, since he received a corresponding share of sלוי' produce (see footnote # 25). However there is some טרחה even by פירות, so שמעון did not totally consume sלוי' produce, for it was שמעון who was טורח, not לוי. Therefore the fruit for which לוי was טורח is also something additional beyond the original ירושה, therefore שמעון has a claim to it as well. </i> וכתלושים חשיבי –<br>However regarding what the deceased</b> brother לוי <b>toiled, why should they not receive the toil of the deceased like him</b> (ראובן). <b>And</b> the פירות <b>should be considered as if they were detached<sup class="footnote-marker">36</sup><i class="footnote">See following footnote # 37.</i></b> (harvested) –<br><b>ואי תלשם ואחר כך מת זה דבר פשוט שיטלו עמו<sup class="footnote-marker">37</sup><i class="footnote">The reason for this is that even if we consider the growing פירות as part of the original inheritance, once however they were harvested something new came in here, namely the work of harvesting (which increases the value of the פירות (they cost more when harvested than on the tree). This makes the פירות תלושים separate from the original ירושה and they are considered כנכסים שנפלו לו ממ"א. The same applies even before they were harvested, since לוי was טורח (see footnote # 34), this טרחה is considered as something new; it is just like תלושים.</i> –<br>And it is obvious that if</b> לוי <b>harvested</b> the פירות <b>and died afterwards that</b> שמעון <b>would share with</b> ראובן.<br>תוספות asks on פרש"י:<br><b>ומיהו קשה לפירוש הקונטרס למה הוצרך כאן להאריך ולומר<sup class="footnote-marker">38</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read ולומר שנוטל בשבח (instead of ולומר בשבח).</i> בשבח המגיע לכתפים –<br>However, there is a difficulty with פרש"י, why was it necessary here to elaborate and say that</b> שותף כיורד ברשות דמי means <b>that he takes בשבח המגיע לכתפים –<br>דהיינו פירות שבכל שנה ושנה כדין אריס<sup class="footnote-marker">39</sup><i class="footnote">The point of saying שנוטל וכו' כשדה העשוי ליטע is that he receives payment like an אריס for his work. [Presumably this means that when there are two partners who own a field, and presently neither of them is working the field (so there is no profit). If one of the partners on his own (without consulting his partner) decided to improve the field and he planted it, etc.; this partner will first receive the percentage which any אריס receives for his work (למחצה לשליש ולרביע), and the remaining profits are divided among them since they are partners. If for instance the net profit was $100 and an אריס receives half; $50 will go to the working partner and the remaining $50 will be divided equally among both partners. The working partner receives a total of $75 and the other partner receives $25, ופשוט.]</i> –<br>Which means</b> that the שותף receives <b>the fruits of each year, like the rule by a sharecropper;</b> why mention שבח המגיע לכתפים –<br><b>לא היה לו לומר אלא שנוטל בשדה שאינה עשויה ליטע כשדה העשויה ליטע –<br>Rather he should have only said that he takes</b> his share <b>in a field which is not intended for planting</b> trees <b>just as</b> he takes his share <b>in a field which is intended for planting</b> trees –<br><b>דהיינו כדין אריס <sup class="footnote-marker">40</sup><i class="footnote">If the intention is that he receives payment like an אריס even if it is a שדה שאין עשוי ליטע, why mention שבח המגיע לכתפים, just say that he will always receive payment like a שדה העשוי ליטע (which means like an אריס)?!</i>-</b><br><b>Which</b> (the amount he receives in a שדה העשויה ליטע) <b>is the rule concerning an אריס,</b> therefore in our case by a שותף it makes no difference whether it is a שדה העשויה ליטע or not, he takes his allocated share like an אריס in both cases. תוספות proves that one who plants without permission, a field that is עשויה ליטע, he receives payment like an אריס –<br><b>דיורד שלא ברשות שקיל בשדה העשויה ליטע כדין אריס –<br>For a יורד שלא ברשות takes</b> payment <b>in a שדה העשויה ליטע like an אריס –<br>כדאמר בהשואל (בבא מציעא דף קא,א) היורד לתוך שדה חבירו שלא ברשות כולי –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>השואל, one who is יורד לתוך שדה חבירו שלא ברשות, etc. –<br>ומסיק דבשדה העשויה ליטע אומדים כמה אדם רוצה ליתן בשדה זו ולנוטעה –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>concludes</b> regarding היורד שלא ברשות <b>that by a שדה העשויה ליטע we assess how much a person is willing to pay in order to plant</b> trees <b>in this field –<br>ופרש"י דהיינו כדין אריסי העיר<sup class="footnote-marker">41</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there ד"ה גלית who writes, ועשיתה שדה העשויה ליטע וידו על העליונה הוא כשאר שתלי העיר כמנהג המדינה. See later in this תוספות footnote # 49.</i> –<br>And רש"י explained</b> there <b>that this means</b> that he is paid <b>like the rate of the sharecroppers of that city<sup class="footnote-marker">42</sup><i class="footnote">We therefore know that even by היורד שלא ברשות in a שדה העשויה ליטע he is paid like an אריס, so the question remains why mention שבח המגיע לכתפים, he should have said that he is נוטל בשדה שאין עשויה ליטע like a שדה העשויה ליטע (where he is paid like an אריס). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>אבל לפירוש רבינו תם אתי שפיר דהכי פירושו שנוטל דוקא בשבח המגיע לכתפים –<br>However according to the פר"ת it is properly understood</b> why he mentions שבח המגיע לכתפים, <b>for this is the explanation</b> in the גמרא <b>that it is only by שבח המגיע לכתפים that he receives</b> בשדה שאין עשוי ליטע כשדה העשויה ליטע –<br><b>דהיינו בא על ידי טורח בשדה שאין עשויה ליטע כשדה העשויה ליטע כדין אריס –<br>Meaning</b> the improvement <b>that come through his toil,</b> only then does he receive the שבח <b>like an אריס,</b> <b>by a שדה שאין עשויה ליטע כשדה העשויה ליטע</b><br><b>אבל באין מגיע לכתפים לא יטול כדין אריס –<br>However</b> if it is a שבח <b>which is not מגיע לכתפים</b> (but it comes by itself), so then <b>he will not take like an אריס –</b><br>תוספות anticipates a difficulty on פר"ת:<br><b>ואף על גב (דאדם<sup class="footnote-marker">43</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read דאריס (instead of דאדם).</i>) נוטל בשבח דאתי מעלמא ממילא כדמשמע בפרק מי שאחזו (גיטין דף עד,ב) –<br>And even though that an אריס receives</b> his share <b>from improvements that come on their own from elsewhere, as is indicated in פרק מי שאחזו,<sup class="footnote-marker">44</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there relates that the owner said to the אריס, ‘all other אריסים water the plants three times and receive a fourth of the produce, you water it four times and you will receive a third’. It so happened that it rained (so much) that it was not necessary to water it a fourth time, and nevertheless (even though it was a שבח דאתי מעלמא ממילא) the אריס receives a third. </i></b> so since here we treat the שותף like an אריס, why should he not receive from שבח דאתא ממילא?!<br>תוספות responds that nevertheless –<br><b>הכא שיורד שלא ברשות סבר גמרא דאין לו ליטול בשבח הבא מאליו כדין אריס –<br>Here where he was יורד שלא ברשות, the גמרא assumes that he should not take from the שבח הבא מאליו like an אריס,</b> for an אריס is יורד ברשות<b>.</b><br>תוספות asks (on פר"ת):<br><b>ומכל מקום קשה דבכל מקום גרס ובשדה (שאינו שלו<sup class="footnote-marker">45</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read שאינה עשויה ליטע (instead of שאינה שלו).</i>) בוי"ו<sup class="footnote-marker">46</sup><i class="footnote">The text according to תוספות reads שנוטל בשבח המגיע לכתפים ובשדה העשויה ליטע כשדה שאין עשויה ליטע. This is not our גירסא, rather the וי"ו is omitted as תוספות suggests it should be according to פר"ת.</i> –<br>But nonetheless<sup class="footnote-marker">47</sup><i class="footnote">Even though we explained how according to פר"ת it is understood why the גמרא mentions שבח המגיע לכתפים (as opposed to פרש"י), nonetheless there still is a difficulty with the text.</i> there is a difficulty</b> (according to פר"ת), <b>for everywhere the text reads ובשדה שאין עשוי ליטע with a וי"ו</b> preceding the word שדה –<br><b>ולפירוש זה הוה ליה למימר בשדה בלא וי"ו כיון דחדא מילתא היא –<br>However according to פי'</b> ר"ת <b>it should read בשדה without a וי"ו</b> preceding, <b>since it is one matter;</b> he collects the שבח המגיע לכתפים by a שדה שאין עשויה ליטע וכו' <b>–</b><br>תוספות resolves a previous difficulty on פרש"י:<sup class="footnote-marker">48</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 42. The difficulty was based on the assumption that a יורד שלא ברשות in a שדה העשוי ליטע, where the גמרא states that we assess כמה אדם רוצה ליתן בשדה זו ולנוטעה, means that he receives payment like אריסי העיר. This following answer will also justify the גירסא of ובשדה according to פרש"י.</i><br><b>ויש ליישב פירוש הקונטרס ונפרש ההיא דהשואל כמה אדם רוצה ליתן בשדה זו ולנוטעה –<br>And we can justify פרש"י</b> and explain why the גמרא states שבח המגיע לכתפים, <b>by explaining that</b> גמרא <b>in</b> פרק <b>השואל</b>,<b></b> which states regarding היורד שלא ברשות בשדה העשויה ליטע, that we assess <b>how much is a person willing to give for this field</b> in order <b>to plant</b> trees in it; that this assessment –<br><b>דלאו היינו כדין אריס דלאריס נותנין יותר למחצה ולשליש כי עוסק בה לתקנה כמה צרכים –<br>Is not like the rule of an אריס, <sup class="footnote-marker">49</sup><i class="footnote">This is seemingly not how תוספות understood רש"י previously that it is כאריסי העיר. See however footnote # 41, that רש"י writes שתלי העיר which may mean קבלנים but not אריסים.</i> for an אריס we give</b> even <b>more</b>; we pay him <b>half or a third</b> of the produce, <b>since he works there</b> continually <b>to improve many</b> things <b>which are necessary,</b> and that is not what is meant by כמה אדם רוצה ליתן בשדה זו ולנוטעה –<br><b>אלא הכי פירושו כמה אדם רוצה ליתן לקבלן ליטע שדה זו ולא ירד בה לאריסות –<br>But rather this is the explanation</b> of כמה אדם וכו', that is <b>how much will a person be willing to give to a contractor</b> <b>to plant</b> trees <b>in this field, but will not enter into it as an אריס,</b> who remains continually in the field כי עוסק בה לתקנה כמה צריכים, and who receives his payment after the field produces –<br><b>אלא מיד נוטל שכרו ונוטל יותר משכיר יום כי שכיר יום אין עליו לתקן אם יתקלקל –<br>But rather the</b> קבלן <b>receives his payment immediately,</b> but does not remain in the field like an אריס<b>. However he receives more than a day laborer, for a שכיר יום has no obligation to repair if it is ruined,</b> but the קבלן must stand behind his work and is responsible to repair any problems –<br><b>והכי קאמר שנוטל בשבח המגיע לכתפים כאריס שלא יסתלקו<sup class="footnote-marker">50</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שלא יסלקו אותו (instead of שלא יסתלקו אותו.</i> אותו כמו קבלן –<br>And this is what</b> the גמרא means here, the שותף <b>takes in the שבח המגיע לכתפים</b> (meaning the fruits) <b>like an אריס</b> (למחצה ולשליש), who receives his payment when the fruit is grown (מגיע לכתפים), <b>for they cannot remove him</b> and pay him <b>like a קבלן –<br>כמו שעושין לנוטע שלא ברשות שמסלקין אותו בכך אפילו משדה העשויה ליטע<sup class="footnote-marker">51</sup><i class="footnote">This case of נוטל בשבח המגיע לכתפים is referring to a שדה העשויה ליטע that the שותף is treated like an אריס, not like a קבלן. The term שבח המגיע לכתפים indicates that he is treated like an אריס (who receives his payment when the fruit is harvested - שבח המגיע לכתפים), but not like a קבלן (who receives payment as soon as the planting is done).</i> –<br>As we do to one who is נוטע שלא ברשות that we remove him</b> from the field <b>with this</b> payment as a קבלן, <b>even if it is a שדה העשויה ליטע;</b> however this שותף remains as an אריס. This is the explanation of שנוטל שבח המגיע לכתפים, where we are discussing a שדה העשויה ליטע. The גמרא then continues, additionally –<br><b>ובשדה שאין עשויה ליטע כולי פירוש ועוד שגם בשדה שאין עשויה ליטע –<br>And by a שדה שאין עשוי ליטע, etc., meaning that additionally that even by a שדה שאין עשויה ליטע –<br>נוטל כמו בעשויה ליטע<sup class="footnote-marker">52</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly this means that he collects like an אריס (more than a קבלן).</i> מה שאין כן בנוטע שלא<sup class="footnote-marker">53</sup><i class="footnote">By נוטע שלא ברשות in a שדה שלא עשויה ליטע the rule is that he receives the lesser of either the הוצאה (expense) or the שבח (improvement), whichever is less.</i> ברשות:</b><br>The שותף <b>takes like by a</b> שדה <b>העשויה ליטע, which is not the case by a יורד שלא ברשות.</b> The second ruling is that the first ruling by a שדה העשויה ליטע that he is treated like an אריס applies even to a שדה שאין עשויה ליטע.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to רש"י the meaning of שבח המגיע לכתפים are fruits that ripen (which can be carried away on the shoulder), however according to the ר"ת it refers to any improvement that came through toil.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br><b>תוספות</b> asked on <b>פרש"י</b> why does it need to say <b>שבח המגיע לכתפים</b>; it should have only said <b>נוטל בשדה שאין עשויה ליטע כשדה העשוי ליטע</b> (which means <b>כאריס</b>).<sup class="footnote-marker">54</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 42.</i> Why did not <b>תוספות</b> simply ask, it should have said <b>נוטל בשדה שאין עשויה ליטע</b> כאריס, without mentioning <b>שדה העשויה ליטע</b>?!

Line 2

<b>אין לי עסק בה לא אמר כלום—“I have no dealings with it”; he said nothing</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that when the משנה ruled that שותפים can testify for each other, it is (only) in a case where the partner stated, ‘I have no interest in this field’, for which he is testifying. The גמרא asked, citing a ברייתא that the statement of אין לי עסק בה is meaningless and he retains his interest, so how can he testify. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>---------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר דבפרק השולח (גיטין דף מג,ב ושם) גבי מוכר עבדו לנכרי כולי<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The rule is that the עבד becomes freed. The ברייתא rules that nonetheless the original Jewish master is required to write a גט שחרור for this עבד. However רשב"ג states that if the master originally wrote for him 'אונו', it is sufficient.</i> אמר –<br>And if you will say that in פרק השולח regarding one who sells his slave (עבד</b> כנעני) <b>to a gentile, etc.</b> the גמרא <b>states –<br>היכי דמי אונו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">רש"י there interprets אונו to mean a שטר. It may also mean (his) strength like כחי וראשית אוני (in בראשית [ויחי] מט,ג), for this שטר gives strength to the עבד by making him free.</i> דכתב ליה לכשתברח ממנו אין לי עסק בך<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This אונו is considered his שטר שחרור and he does not require a שטר שחרור later.</i> –<br>What, for instance, is</b> considered <b>אונו</b> (so that a גט שחרור is not required), <b>where</b> the Jewish master <b>wrote</b> to this עבד before he sold him to the נכרי, <b>‘that when you will escape from</b> the נכרי, <b>I have no dealings with you’.</b> This concludes the citation from פרק השולח; תוספות continues with the question <b>–<br>אלמא אין לי עסק בך הוי לשון טוב –<br>It is evident</b> from that גמרא that the expression <b>אין לי עסק בך is an effective expression</b> to remove one’s ownership, so why does the ברייתא here rule that by אין לי עסק בה the rule is לא אמר כלום?!<br>תוספות answers and distinguishes between the two cases:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דאין לי עסק בך משמע אלא תהא לעצמך –<br>And the ר"י states that</b> the phrase <b>אין לי עסק בך, indicates</b> that I have no dealings with you, <b>rather you should be on your own –<br>וגבי עבד דמהני הרי את לעצמך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See the משנה in גיטין פה,ב which states גופו של גט שחרור, הרי את בן חורין הרי את לעצמך.</i> מהני נמי אין לי עסק בך –<br>So therefore regarding a slave where</b> the phrase <b>הרי את לעצמך is effective</b> to free a slave, therefore <b>אין לי עסק בך is also effective,</b> since they are the equivalent of each other <b>–<br>אבל בשדה דלא שייך למימר הרי את לעצמך כי אמר נמי אין לי עסק בך לא אמר כלום –<br>However regarding a field where it is not applicable to state, ‘you</b> (the field) <b>are on your own’, so too when he states אין לי עסק בך, he said nothing –<br>דכיון<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> דליכא לפרושי אין לי עסק בך אלא תהא לעצמך גבי שדה כמו גבי עבד –<br>For since regarding a field, we cannot interpret אין לי עסק בך</b> to mean, ‘<b>rather be on your own’, as we can regarding a slave,</b> therefore –<br><b>לא משמע גבי שדה אין לי עסק בה אלא סילוק דין ודברים<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Merely stating that one gives up his interest in a property has no effect, and he still retains his entire monetary interest in the property, unless he grants it away to another person or makes it הפקר.</i> כדמוכח בכריתות<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states, דאמר כי סליק נפשיה מדין ודברים מגופה דשדה לא סליק נפשיה. See רש"י there ד"ה מדין who writes, והכי קאמר לא אדין ולא אדבר על שדה זו עם שום אדם כי מוחזקת שלי היא.</i> (דף כד,ב) :</b><br><b>אין לי עסק בה by a field means nothing other than the removal of any monetary interest</b> in the field <b>as is evident in</b> מסכת <b>כריתות,</b> and that is not effective.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>אין לי עסק בה has the connotation of הרי את לעצמך, so by freeing a slave it is effective but not by disowning a field.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>After תוספות differentiated between עבד (where הרי את לעצמך is meaningful) and שדה (where הרי את לעצמך is meaningless), the contradiction has been resolved, why did תוספות need to continue<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> with 'דכיון' until the end of the תוספות, what does that add?!

Line 4

<b>מפני שמעמידה בפני בעל חובו—Because he establishes it before his creditor</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>שמואל ruled that one who sells a field to his friend (even) without a guarantee,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This (usually) means that if the field is taken away from the buyer (either by the creditor of the seller, or it turned out that the field never belonged to the seller), the seller is not responsible to return the money to the buyer.</i> he may not testify on behalf of the buyer (that it is his field),<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This is in a case where a third party claims that this sold field is really his (and it was never the seller’s).</i> because the seller has a vested interest that the field remain by the buyer (and not by the one who claims it is his field), for if the field remains by the buyer, the seller’s creditor<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that the seller borrowed money before he sold this field. The creditor now has a lien on this field and can collect it as payment for his loan even if the borrower sells it. However if the third party is successful in his claim that it was his field, there is no longer a lien on the field, so the lender cannot collect, and the borrower (the seller) will be in the position of a לוה רשע ולא ישלם, which is degrading for him. </i> will have from where to collect the debt. תוספות explains why we require this reason, when a simpler reason would seemingly suffice.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי איריא מפני שמעמידה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read שמעמידה בפני בעל חובו תיפוק (instead of שמעמידה תיפוק).</i> תיפוק ליה משום דלא ניחא ליה דתיהוי תרעומת עליו –<br>And if you will say; why mention</b> that the reason the seller cannot testify is <b>because he is מעמידה [בפני ב"ח], we can derive it</b> (that he may not testify) <b>because he is not pleased that</b> the buyer <b>will have complaints against him?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The buyer bought a field from him and if it is taken away from him (by the third party), the buyer will be extremely upset with the seller, for selling him a stolen field. Therefore in order to avoid the תערומות, the seller has a vested interest and may testify falsely. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i></b><br>תוספות proves that תרעומות is a valid concern:<br><b>כדאמרינן בפרק קמא דבבא קמא (דף ח,ב) ראובן שמכר שדה לשמעון שלא באחריות<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> –<br>As</b> the גמרא <b>states in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ב"ק, where ראובן sold a field to שמעון without a guarantee –<br>ואתא בעל חובו וקטריף לה מיניה דינא הוא דאתי ראובן ומשתעי דינא בהדיה –<br>And the creditor of ראובן came and took it away</b> from שמעון, <b>the rule is that ראובן may come and litigate against</b> the בע"ח, and argue that there is no lien on this field –<br><b>ולא מצי אמר ליה לאו בעל דברים דידי את<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly, the בע"ח should be able to claim that ראובן has no monetary stake in this דין תורה, it is only between the בע"ח and שמעון, for ראובן will not lose money no matter who wins the case, since ראובן took no אחריות on this sale. Therefore ראובן should not be allowed to argue in this די"ת since he is not a litigant.</i> –<br>And</b> the מלוה <b>cannot say to</b> ראובן, ‘<b>you are not my litigant’ –<br>דאמר ליה לא ניחא לי דתיהוי לשמעון תרעומת עילואי –<br>For</b> ראובן <b>can answer to</b> the בע"ח, <b>; it is not comfortable for me that שמעון should have complaints against me.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The question is that just like there, the concern for תרעומות makes ראובן a litigant because this makes him an interested party in the litigation, similarly here too, he should not be allowed to testify; since he has in interest that the field remain by the buyer, he is not fit to testify if it is for his benefit!</i></b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דאין נפסל בשביל כך לעדות<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות distinguishes between being eligible to argue in a ד"ת (so that the litigant cannot claim לאו בע"ד דידי את), for which the claim of לא ניחא לי דתיהוי תרעומות עלי is sufficient, but it is not sufficient to say that he has a vested interest so that he should not be eligible to testify. It is highly unlikely that he will testify falsely just so there should be no תערומות. To disqualify someone from testifying we require a monetary interest.</i> –<br>And one can say that because of</b> his interest that there should be no תערומות against him that is insufficient reason <b>that he should be disqualified to testify –</b><br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי הכא מיירי אפילו במכיר בה שהיא שלו דליכא תרעומת:</b><br><b>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say that <b>here</b> (by the ruling of שמואל) <b>it is even in a case where</b> the buyer <b>is aware that it belongs to</b> the seller, <b>so there is no תערומות,</b> for the buyer realizes its is not the seller’s fault that this third party is claiming fraudulently that it belongs to him.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Even if the מערער is successful in taking away the field from the buyer, the buyer will have no complaint to the seller, since it was not his fault. Therefore if this was the only reason (תערומות) the seller would be able to testify.</i> Therefore we require the reason of מפני שמעמידה בפני ב"ח.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The concern that there be no תערומות is insufficient to disqualify one from testifying. Alternately we require the reason מפני שמעמידה בפני ב"ח in a case where the buyer knows it belongs to the seller.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks that the גמרא should have used the reason of תערומות to explain why the seller cannot testify (instead of the reason of מעמידה בפני ב"ח).<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 5.</i> What would be gained by using the תערומות reason, as opposed to מעמידה וכו'?!

Line 6

<b>וליסלקו בי תרי מינייהו ולידיינו—So let two of them remove themselves from them and they will judge</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא taught that if a person with a vested interest in an asset, relinquishes his interest so he has no longer an interest in the asset, he may testify regarding this asset, since now he no longer has a vested interest. The גמרא cited a ברייתא which stated that if a ספר תורה was stolen from a city, the inhabitants of that city cannot testify nor can they be judges in this matter, since they have a vested interest in this ס"ת. The גמרא asked why two of the inhabitants cannot relinquish their interest in the ס"ת, so they will be able to testify. תוספות explains how relinquishing their interest makes them qualified witnesses.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא בעינן תחילתו וסופו בכשרות –<br>And if you will say,</b> how can the סילוק help, <b>for we require</b> from witnesses <b>that</b> by <b>the beginning and the end,</b> the witnesses <b>must be qualified</b> to testify<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See later קכח,א. The ‘beginning’ means when they saw the testimony, and the ‘end’ means when they are testifying. The must be עדים כשרים both when they see and when they deliver their testimony. However here they were not כשרים at the beginning when they observed the thief stealing the ס"ת, for they first relinquished their interest only later when the thief was found and is being tried in בי"ד.</i><br><b>והכא הוי תחילה בפסול<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">At the time when they saw, they did not as yet relinquish their interest in the ס"ת, so they are not qualified to testify, for they have a vested interest.</i> והוי כמו קרוב ונתרחק<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">One who was related by marriage at the time of the incident, cannot testify regarding his relative, and even later when his wife died so he is no longer related, nevertheless he still cannot testify regarding this incident, since he was related at the time of the incident. We require תחילתו וסופו בכשרות regarding a קרוב, the same rule should apply regarding נוגע בעדות.</i> –<br>But here</b> at <b>the beginning</b> they were <b>disqualified, so it is like a relative who became distant,</b> where his testimony is not accepted;<b></b> the same should apply here –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלא שייך תחילתו בפסלות הכא כיון שאין פסלות תלוי בגוף אלא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">It is possible to explain תוספות answer that a פסול קרוב is an intrinsic פסול, not necessarily because we are concerned he will lie (as the example always given that משה ואהרן are פסול to testify together since they are related; there is no concern that they are lying) therefore if they were פסול בתחלה that means that there was no עד at the scene. However the פסול of נוגע בעדות is not that he is פסול בעצם, but rather we are afraid that he may lie, because of his vested interest; once that issue is resolved that he no longer has a vested interest, we can accept his testimony. The concern by a נוגע בעדות is (only) at the time of the testimony, not at the time of the incident, but by a קרוב the problem is (also) at the time of the incident. See נחלת משה for alternate explanations.</i> בממון:</b><br><b>And the ר"י says that</b> the rule of <b>תחילתו בפסלות</b> (which disqualifies a קרוב) <b>is not applicable here</b> regarding נוגע בעדות, <b>since this פסלות is not dependent on the body</b> of the עד (as it is by a קרוב), <b>but rather</b> this פסלות is only <b>regarding a monetary</b> interest, and as soon as this interest no longer exists, the עד is כשר.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The requirement of תחילתו וסופו בכשרות is only regarding a פסול הגוף (like קרוב), but not regarding פסול נוגע בעדות (which is a פסול ממון).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks his question that we require תחילתו בכשרות on the ברייתא of the ס"ת. Why did תוספות not ask the same question on שמואל who ruled that השותפין מעידין זה לזה, and we established it in a case where he relinquished his interest in the partnership; but it is not תחילתו בכשרות?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See חתם סופר and נחלת משה.</i>

<b>הכי גרסינן—This is how the text reads</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>In our גמרות the text reads; ת"ש האומר תנו מנה לעניי וכו' אין דנין וכו' ואין מביאין וכו' העיר, ותסברא עניים וכו' אלא וכו' אותה העיר, ואמאי ליסתלקו וכו' ה"נ בספר תורה. Our תוספות presents a different גירסא.<br>---------------------------<br><b>ותסברא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א ומהר"ם that according to תוספות the גמרא first asked, ואמאי ליסתלקו בי תרי נפשייהו ולדיינו, the מתרץ answered ותסברא וכו' (not like the רשב"ם [see ‘Overview’]).</i> עניים שקלי ודיינין מיפסלי [אלא] הכא נמי בספר תורה ואמאי קרי להו עניים כולי:</b><br><b>And do you</b> really <b>think that the poor take</b> the money <b>and the judges</b> (who don’t receive the money) <b>are disqualified?! Rather this</b> case <b>as well is regarding a ס"ת, and the reason they call it עניים, etc.,</b> is because all are considered poor if they are lacking a ס"ת.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ‘ותסברא’, is the beginning of the answer and not part of the מקשן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What are the relative advantages of both גירסאות?<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Daf 43b



Line 1

<b>אמאי שמירה בבעלים היא—Why; it is guarding with the owner</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>שמואל ruled regarding partners that each one is considered as a שומר שכר to the other; meaning that each partner is liable<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A שומר שכר (a paid custodian) is liable to pay for גניבה ואבידה (if the item he was watching was lost or stolen). </i> for the assets of their partnership if it was lost or stolen when it was in the possession of one of the partners.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The partner is liable (even though he is not receiving payment), since his partner will also watch the items (another time; see רשב"ם מב,ב ד"ה ונעשין). This is considered payment to render him to be a ש"ש. This means that if $100 worth of goods were lost, the שומר must pay his partner $50.</i> The גמרא asked why should they be liable since this is a case of שמירה בבעלים.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">There is a rule which applies to the responsibility of all types of custodians that if the owner of the item was in the employ of the custodian, the custodian has no liability for the item which is by him. See שמות (משפטים) כב,יד where the פסוק states, אם בעליו עמו לא ישלם (if the owner is with him [in his employ] he need not pay).</i> Our תוספות qualifies and clarifies this question.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps תוספות writes 'פירוש' to exclude the פי' רשב"ם ד"ה שמירה who writes וכיון שהיה ראובן משמר מחלק שמעון בשעה שנגנבה (see also the רשב"ם in footnote # 2).</i> אם התחילו שניהם לשמור יחד<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume they own 20 pots in partnership. After they bought the pots each partner took half the pots to store them in their respective homes.</i> –<br>The explanation</b> as to when it is considered שמירה בבעלים is <b>if they both began to guard</b> (the items of their partnership) <b>simultaneously,</b> so that <b>–<br>כל אחד בשעה שהוא משמר חלק חבירו חבירו נמי משמר לו חלקו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">When partner # 1 (ראובן) is guarding the ten pots, half of these pots belong to שמעון, and at the same time שמעון is guarding half of his pots on behalf of ראובן, so ראובן is working for שמעון (guarding his pots), but שמעון is also working for ראובן by guarding sראובן' pots (and vice versa). Therefore it is considered שמירה בבעלים.</i>-–</b><br><b>Each one</b> of the partners, <b>at</b> the same <b>time that he guards his partner’s share, his partner is guarding his share</b><br><b>ואף על פי שאין עמו במלאכה בשעת אונס<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">When the item was stolen or lost from ראובן, at that time שמעון was no longer watching the other pots (perhaps they were sold already), nevertheless ראובן is פטור.</i> –<br>And even if</b> the other partner <b>was not in his employ at the time of the accident –<br>כיון שהיה עמו בתחילת שמירה בעליו עמו קרינן ביה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See (end of) footnote # 3.</i> –</b><br>Nevertheless <b>since</b> the partner <b>was with him</b> (in his employ) <b>at the beginning of the guarding, we call it בעליו עמו,</b> and he is פטור –<br>תוספות proves this point:<br><b>כדתניא (בבא מציעא דף צו,א) היה עושה עמו בשעת שאלה –<br>As the ברייתא taught,</b> if the owner <b>was working for (with) the borrower, at the time of the borrowing<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The פסוק of בעליו עמו (see footnote # 3) is written regarding a שואל (a borrower) specifically, however the גמרא derives that it applies to all the שומרים. i.e. שמר חנם, שומר שכר ושוכר.</i> –<br>אין צריך להיות עמו בשעת שבורה ומתה –<br>It is not necessary</b> for the owner <b>to be with him</b> (in his employ) <b>when</b> the borrowed cow <b>broke or died,</b> for he is פטור regardless, since he was in his employ בשעת שאלה –<br><b>היה עמו בשעת שבורה ומתה צריך להיות עמו בשעת שאלה<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The same applies here by the שותפין as long as they both started guarding simultaneously, it is considered שמירה בבעלים, regardless what the situation was בשעה גניבה ואבידה.</i> –</b><br>However. If <b>the owner was employed with</b> the borrower <b>at the time it broke or died,</b> that is not sufficient to exempt the שואל from paying, but rather <b>it is necessary that he</b> be employed <b>by</b> the borrower <b>at the time of borrowing –</b><br>תוספות qualifies (that the שמירה must not begin simultaneously):<br><b>ואפילו<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> לא התחילו שניהם לשמור יחד<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן was guarding and שמעון was not guarding yet.</i> –<br>And even if both of them did not begin guarding simultaneously –<br>מכל מקום האחרון פטור שהראשון היה עמו במלאכה בשעה שהתחיל השני<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן began guarding first (so he is in the employ of שמעון) at 8:00am and שמעון began guarding at 1:00 pm while ראובן was still guarding. Therefore שמעון is פטור מגניבה ואבידה, since ראובן (the [partial]owner was working for him when שמעון began his שמירה. However ראובן is חייב to שמעון for his loss since שמעון was not employed by ראובן, when ראובן began his שמירה.</i> לשמור:</b><br><b>Nevertheless the last one</b> to guard <b>is פטור, since the first one was in his employ at the time the second one began to guard.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The פטור of שמירה בבעלים is if the owner was in the employ of the שומר when the שמירה began.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>According to תוספות that we require שמירה בבעלים at the beginning, why did the גמרא not answer the question of 'ואמאי שמירה בבעלים הוא', that we are discussing a case where there was no שמירה בבעלים together at the same time, so one of them can be a ש"ש?<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה and footnote # 11.[Seemingly the conclusion of תוס' by writing ואפילו וכו' מ"מ האחרון פטור, explains the difficulty on שמואל who states נעשין ש"ש זל"ז, which indicates that there are both ש"ש, on which the גמרא asks that they cannot both be ש"ש, since it is שמירה בבעלים for at least one of them.]</i>
<b>דאמר שמור לי היום כולי—Where he said; guard for me today, etc.</b><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to previous תוס' ד"ה אמאי.</i><br>The גמרא explained the reason the two partners are considered שומרי שכר for each other, and it is not considered שמירה בבעלים, since they watched it on consecutive days, and they did not watch it at the same time.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">They said to each other you watch for me today and (in return) I will watch for you tomorrow.</i> תוספות clarifies the rules of שמירה בבעלים and שומרי שכר.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אכתי שמירה בבעלים היא דאמרינן בריש השואל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">בבא מציעא צד,ב.</i> –<br>And if you will say; but it is still</b> considered <b>שמירה בבעלים, for</b> the גמרא <b>states in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>השואל –<br>דבעלים באמירה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">[The גמרא there questioned how is it possible that both the cow and the owner are borrowed by the שואל simultaneously (as it seems from the expression השואל את הפרה ובעלה עמה), since the owner is employed as soon as he says and agrees to be employed, while the cow is not considered borrowed, until the שואל makes a משיכה in the cow.] In any event it is obvious that the owner is considered in the employ of the שומר by merely saying that he will work for him, so here too, since the שותפין agree that they will watch for each other; they should be considered in the employ of the other שותף and it should be considered שמירה בבעלים even if they said שמור לי היום ואני אשמור לך מחר!</i> גבי שואל את הפרה ובעלה עמה –<br>Regarding</b> what the משנה stated; ‘<b>one who borrowed a cow together with its owner’, that the owner</b> is considered to be in the employ of the שואל <b>by</b> merely <b>saying,</b> ‘I am employed by you’ –<br>תוספות answers by distinguishing between the two cases:<br><b>ויש לומר שאני התם דבאמירה משעבדי עצמן ליכנס במלאכתם מיד<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore since he is committing himself to begin working immediately he is considered in the employ of the שואל now!</i> –<br>And one can say; there</b> (by the שואל) <b>it is different, for the owner is obligating himself with his statement to immediately begin working –<br>אבל הכא לא משתעבד עד למחר –<br>However here</b> (by the שותפין) <b>he is not committing</b> himself to begin work only <b>until tomorrow,</b> but not immediately, therefore he is not in the employ of his partner as of yet, and it is not שמירה בבעלים.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומאי קא משמע לן שמואל דנעשין שומרי שכר זה לזה –<br>And if you will say; what is שמואל coming to teach us; that they become ש"ש one to another –<br>מתניתין היא בהשוכר את האומנים (בבא מציעא דף פ,ב) שמור לי ואשמור לך שומר שכר –</b><br>But <b>this is a משנה in</b> פרק <b>השוכר את האומנים;</b> if one says to another ‘<b>guard for me and I will guard for you’,</b> they each become a <b>ש"ש</b> to the other, so why was it necessary for שמואל to repeat a ruling that is stated explicitly in the משנה?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i><br>תוספות answers and distinguishes between the two cases:<br><b>ויש לומר דאי מהתם הוה אמינא לפי שהם אינן שותפין<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן said to שמעון if you will watch my cow today, I will watch your cow tomorrow, the cows belong exclusively to their respective owner’s only, therefore when ראובן watches the cow of שמעון for free. it is as if שמעון is receiving payment for him watching sראובן' cow the next day and vice versa. The service of watching is a bona fide payment.</i> –<br>And one can say that if</b> all we had was the משנה <b>there</b> in השוכר וכו', <b>I would have said</b> that only there, are they considered to be ש"ש, <b>since they are not partners –<br>אבל הכא שהם שותפין כל אחד ואחד כששומר חלק חבירו שומר גם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">When ראובן (the partner) is watching the entire stock of which half belongs to him and half to שמעון, one may argue that he is not giving something to שמעון, but rather he is watching his own (share of the) stock. Therefore perhaps they are not considered ש"ש. Therefore שמואל informs us that indeed they are ש"ש זל"ז. See רשב"ם ד"ה אמר where he writes, דס"ד אמינא דשומר חנם הוא דבלאו חלק חבירו היה צריך לשמור את שלו ושמירה אחת היא בין הכל ולא ליהוי שומר שכר קמ"ל.</i> בשביל עצמו:</b><br><b>However here where they are partners, so each one while he is watching his friend’s portion he is also watching for his</b> portion.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>If the owner commits himself verbally to be in the employ of the שומר immediately it is considered שמירה בבעלים, but not if his commitment will begin after the שמירה. It is more reasonable that שמור לי ואשמור לך is considered ש"ש where they are not partners than when they are guarding items which are owned in partnership.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why did תוספות not ask his question<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> on שמואל (what is his חידוש) previously when שמואל stated his ruling; why did he wait to ask it now (after the first question and answer in this תוספות)?!
