<b>וכיון דאסהיד דלוי הוא כולי—But since he is testifying that it belongs to <i>Levi</i>, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא is discussing a case where ראובן stole a field from שמעון and sold it to לוי. Afterwards יהודה comes and claims that it is his field, the rule is that שמעון cannot testify on behalf of לוי against יהודה (for he is a נוגע בדבר).<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">שמעון prefers to challenge לוי rather than יהודה.</i> The גמרא asks if שמעון will testify that it belongs to לוי, how will שמעון be able to dislodge לוי, since he testified already on his behalf. The גמרא offers an answer.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">שמעון will not testify on behalf of לוי, he will merely testify that sיהודה' claim is bogus.</i> תוספות offers an alternate answer.<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות comments:<br><b>הוה מצי לשנויי כגון דאסהיד שמעון דשל אבותיו דלוי הוה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem that this testimony of שמעון is valid to challenge יהודה if sיהודה' claim is that this field always belonged to him from generations past. </i> –</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have answered that for instance שמעון testifies that</b> this property <b>belonged to</b> sלוי' <b>ancestors,</b> so it could not belong to יהודה –<br><b>ובתר הכי אתי שמעון וטעין דמלוי זבנה ואית ליה סהדי דראובן גזלה ממנו ומכרה ללוי:</b><br><b>And later</b> (after sיהודה' claim will be dismissed [based on sשמעון' testimony]), <b>שמעון will come and claim that he</b> (שמעון) subsequently <b>bought it from לוי, and</b> שמעון <b>will produce witnesses that ראובן stole it from him and sold it</b> back <b>to לוי.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This allows שמעון to testify on behalf of לוי to negate sיהודה' claim, and subsequently for שמעון to dislodge לוי.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>שמעון can claim that it belonged to sלוי' ancestors (disqualifying יהודה) and later will claim that he (שמעון) bought it from לוי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there any advantage in תוספות proposed answer over the sגמרא' actual answer? If there is, why indeed did the גמרא not answer in this manner?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 6

<b>כגון דאית ליה סהדי למר כולי—For instance one has witnesses, etc.</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה וכיון.</i><br>The גמרא answered that the reason שמעון cannot remove יהודה from the field, in the same manner as he is removing לוי, is because in the dispute between שמעון ויהודה, both have witnesses that it belongs to them, and if יהודה will win his case against לוי, he will be the מוחזק, and שמעון will not be able to dislodge him. However in his confrontation with לוי it is only יהודה who has the witnesses (that ראובן stole the field from שמעון and sold it to לוי illegally). It seems from the גמרא that this answer כגון דאית ליה סהדי למר וכו', is something new which the תרצן informs us, however תוספות argues that seemingly we knew all along that שמעון and יהודה have witnesses supporting their claim; why does the גמרא say 'כגון'?!<br>----------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דלא הוה ליה למימר כגון<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The term 'כגון' indicates that the גמרא is giving us a new scenario in this case, when in fact we always knew this, as תוספות goes on to explain.</i> –<br>It is astounding! for</b> the גמרא <b>should not have said 'כגון' (for instance) –<br>דהא מעיקרא נמי ידעינן דאית ליה לשמעון סהדי דדידיה היא –<br>For initially we also knew that שמעון has עדים that it belongs to him –<br>כדקתני<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This does not say in the actual ברייתא, however רב ששת interpreted the ברייתא in this manner.</i> ראובן שגזל שדה משמעון<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא is teaching us the ruling in a case where ראובן stole a field from שמעון; the only way we can know that ראובן stole a field from שמעון is if שמעון has עדים that it belonged to him before ראובן took possession (and ראובן has no proof of ownership at all).</i> ואי לית ליה לשמעון סהדי שגזלה ראובן ממנו –<br>As the ברייתא states, ‘ראובן who stole a field from שמעון’, and if שמעון has no עדים that ראובן stole it from him –<br>אנן היכי ידעינן שגזלה ומכח מה הוא מערער<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling is that שמעון cannot testify against יהודה since he has a vested interest that the field should remain by לוי so that he (שמעון) will later be able to dislodge לוי. However, if שמעון has no עדים that he owns it, how can he protest against לוי occupying this field?!</i> –<br>How do we know that</b> ראובן <b>stole it, and on what basis is</b> שמעון <b>protesting</b> the occupation of the field. This proves that we always realized that שמעון has עדים –<br><b>ויהודה נמי על כרחך אית ליה סהדי דאי לאו הכי מאיזה כח מערער –<br>And perforce you must say that יהודה also has עדים</b> that he owns this field, <b>for otherwise, what is</b> sיהודה' <b>basis to protest</b> sלוי' occupation of the field. We have thus proven that even initially we were aware that both שמעון and יהודה have עדים supporting their claim that they are the owners, so why does the תרצן say 'כגון'?!<br><b>והכי הוי ליה למימר כיון דאית ליה סהדי למר כולי ומאי סלקא דעתיה דמקשה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is asking two questions. Firstly why say כגון, since we always assumed that both שמעון and יהודה have עדים that it belongs to them (as תוספות just proved). Secondly, how could the מקשן ask that the same way שמעון can dislodge לוי, he should dislodge יהודה (and even if we say that the גמרא means that שמעון can dislodge יהודה just as he can dislodge לוי [even if it is not in the same manner]), but that is not true, since against לוי he has witnesses that לוי bought his stolen field from ראובן, however regarding יהודה (who, if he wins the case against לוי, will be in possession of the field), שמעון cannot dislodge יהודה, for they both have (contradicting) עדים and the land will remain in the possession of יהודה who is the מוחזק.</i> –<br>Rather this is what</b> the תרצן <b>should have said, ‘since this one has עדים etc.</b> (and the other one has עדים)’, <b>so what did the questioner</b> even <b>think?!</b><br>תוספות dismisses a proposed solution:<br><b>ואין לומר דמעיקרא סלקא דעתיה דאיירי כגון דאית ליה ליהודה עדים דשל אבותיו היא –<br>And one cannot say that originally we assumed that this is a case where יהודה has witnesses that it belonged to his parents –<br>ולשמעון הנגזל אית ליה סהדי דאכלה שני חזקה וטעין מיהודה זבנה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Since יהודה merely has witnesses that it belonged to his parents and שמעון claims that he (subsequently) bought it from יהודה and has שני חזקה, so obviously שמעון will win the case, so why is שמעון concerned that יהודה may win the case from לוי, since in any event שמעון will be able to dislodge יהודה? This would explain the sגמרא' question. Therefore the תרצן answered that we are discussing a situation where the עדים of שמעון and יהודה are contradicting each other (each set of עדים testify that שמעון/יהודה own the field currently). The result will be that יהודה will retain the field (if he wins against לוי and is currently the מוחזק). However, תוספות negates this solution. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –<br>And שמעון, whose</b> field <b>was stolen</b> by ראובן, <b>has witnesses that he</b> (שמעון) <b>consumed</b> the produce of this field for the three <b>years</b> required for a <b>חזקה, and</b> שמעון <b>claims that he bought it from יהודה,</b> this would seemingly answer our question. However תוספות maintains that we cannot understand the גמרא in this manner –<br><b>דאם כן מאי קאמר בהאי זכותא<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות now emphasizes that the גמרא when it states בהאי זכותא, it does not mean just as he can remove לוי he can remove יהודה (albeit in a different manner), but rather it is apparent from the language בהאי זכותא וכו', that the manner of removing לוי ויהודה are identical. תוספות therefore asks that they are different methods and are not identical.</i> דמפיק לה מלוי ליפקה מיהודה –<br>For if indeed this is so</b> (that יהודה only has עדים that it belonged to אבותיו), <b>what is this</b> which the גמרא <b>states, ‘with the same power that</b> שמעון <b>can dislodge לוי, he can dislodge יהודה’,</b> but according to the proposed solution this is not so –<br><b>הא בהאי זכותא דמצי לאפוקי מלוי לא מצי לאפוקי מיהודה –<br>For with the power that he can dislodge לוי, he cannot dislodge יהודה –<br>דבעדי גזילה המעידין שגזל ראובן ממנו מצי מפיק לה מלוי שבא מכח ראובן –<br>For with the witnesses of theft, who testify that ראובן stole from</b> שמעון, <b>he</b> (שמעון) <b>can dislodge לוי whose</b> claim to ownership) <b>comes from</b> his purchase from <b>ראובן,</b> and when the witnesses will testify to the theft, ראובן and thus לוי, no longer have any claim to the field –<br><b>ומיהודה לא מצי מפיק לה אלא בעדי חזקה –<br>However</b> שמעון <b>cannot dislodge יהודה, only with עדי חזקה,</b> so how can the גמרא ask that he can remove יהודה, just as he can remove לוי.<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The question of תוספות is how can the גמרא ask that בההוא זכותא דקא מפיק ליה מלוי ליפקה מיהודה, when we know that they are two different claims. </i><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דסלקא דעתין דמעיקרא דיהודה בעי לאפוקי מלוי –<br>And it appears to the רשב"א that initially</b> the גמרא <b>assumed that יהודה wanted to remove לוי from</b> the field –<br><b>משום דאית ליה סהדי דראובן מכר לו וללוי אין עדים ובא שמעון להעיד ללוי דשל לוי היא –<br>Because</b> יהודה <b>had עדים that ראובן sold</b> the field <b>to him</b> (יהודה), however <b>לוי has no עדים</b> that ראובן sold it to him (he merely claims it), <b>and שמעון is coming to testify on behalf of לוי that it belongs to לוי –<br>ומשום הכי פריך כיון דמסהיד דהאי ארעא דלוי היא היכי מפיק לה מיניה –<br>So therefore</b> the גמרא initially asked, <b>since</b> שמעון <b>testified that this land belongs to לוי, how can he dislodge him –<br>והוה מצי לשנויי דלא מסהדי בהאי לישנא דלוי היא אלא דאמר דראובן מכרה ללוי –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>could have answered that he does not testify with this language, ‘that it belongs to לוי’, but rather</b> שמעון <b>stated that ראובן sold it to לוי;</b> the גמרא could have answered that –<br><b>אלא דעדיפא מינה משני<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">שמעון testified that he knows that it certainly does not belong to יהודה. This way לוי does not enter into the equation at all. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>However that</b> גמרא <b>offered an even better answer –<br>והשתא פריך שפיר דבההיא זכותא דמפיק לה מלוי ליפקה מיהודה –<br>So now</b> (that both לוי and יהדה claim that they bought it from ראובן), the גמרא properly <b>asks that with the same power</b> that שמעון <b>can remove לוי, he can remove יהודה –<br>דשניהם באין מכח ראובן ואם יביא שמעון עדים דראובן גזלה ממנו מצי לאפוקי מתרוייהו:</b><br><b>Since they both</b> (לוי ויהודה) <b>are coming from the strength of ראובן, so if שמעון will bring עדים that ראובן stole it from him he will be able to remove both of them</b> (לוי ויהודה).<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא answered כגון דאית ליה סהדי למר וכו'; that יהודה has witnesses that it is his (but not that he bought it from ראובן), so therefore we can no longer say בההוא זכותא דקא מפיק לה מלוי לפיקה מיהודה. The term כגון is appropriate since we are changing the scenario, where initially we assumed that יהודה claimed that he bought it from ראובן, but now we are saying that יהודה claims it was always and currently his; no connection to ראובן.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>לוי and יהודה both claim that they bought if from ראובן.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. The proposed solution of the 'ואין לומר' was that יהודה claimed that it was של אבותיו and שמעון claims that he bought it from יהודה.<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> In this scenario, how is שמעון testifying on behalf of לוי against יהודה. He cannot claim that יהודה is not the owner, since sשמעון' claim of his ownership is that he bought it from יהודה; so how is שמעון supporting לוי?!<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א and מהודרא בתרא.</i><br>2. תוספות writes that the גמרא could have answered that שמעון merely stated that לוי bought it from ראובן, but not that it belongs to לוי; however the גמרא offers a better answer.<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> Since the גמרא is עדיפא מיניה משני; why does תוספות mention his answer at all?! Is there any advantage in תוספות proposed answer?

<b>דוקא מכר דהוה ליה יאוש<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">יאוש means that we heard the owner say that he despairs of ever retrieving this lost or stolen item.</i> ושינוי רשות<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">שינוי רשות means that the item changed possession; in this case from the thief to the buyer. Everyone agrees that when there is יאוש and (then) שינוי רשות, that the current owner may keep the item even if we know who the original owner was. The owner has a claim against the thief, but not against the customer who bought it in good faith. Otherwise people would be reluctant to buy items, because (in case they were stolen) they may be taken away from them by the original owners. See (however) footnote # 7.</i>—Specifically by a sale where there is despair and change of possession</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא differentiates between קרקע and מטלטלין in a case where a stolen item was sold. If it was קרקע the נגזל (שמעון) can testify on behalf the buyer (לוי) against a potential claimant (יהודה), but not by מטלטלין. The גמרא asked (regarding the case of קרקע), why mention a sale; the same rule can apply with the גזלן (ראובן) against the outside claimant (יהודה). The גמרא answered that regarding מטלטלין however, we require that there is a sale, for then there is יאוש ושינוי רשות, so the buyer (לוי) acquires it,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">שמעון, therefore, has no vested interest in testifying on behalf of לוי against יהודה, for even if לוי wins, שמעון has no claim against לוי, since לוי acquires this (stolen) item through יאוש ושינוי רשות.</i> however if there was no sale, the נגזל (שמעון) would not be able to testify on behalf of the גזלן (ראובן), for since the נגזל can take it from the גזלן (even if there was יאוש), he (שמעון the נגזל) is considered a נוגע בעדות.<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה משום.</i> וכגון שמכר ראובן ללוי שלא באחריות<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This means that it was agreed by the parties that even if this item is taken away from לוי (by the rightful owner, since ראובן stole it), ראובן is not obligated to compensate לוי for his loss.</i> –<br>The רשב"ם explained</b> that were are discussing a case <b>where, for instance, ראובן</b> (the גזלן) <b>sold the</b> פרה וטלית <b>to לוי without a guarantee –<br>ונראה דפירש כן משום דאי באחריות<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This means that ראובן guarantees the sale to לוי that he will be compensated for any loss incurred by purchasing this item, if it is taken away from him (by the נגזל).</i> הוי שמעון נוגע בעדות –<br>And it appears</b> to תוספת <b>that</b> the reason the רשב"ם <b>explained it so</b> (that it was sold without אחריות), is <b>because if</b> it was sold <b>with אחריות,</b> then <b>שמעון would be a נוגע בעדות,</b> and could not testify on behalf of לוי against יהודה. תוספות explains –<br><b>דאף על גב דהוי יאוש ושינוי רשות מפיק לה שמעון מלוי –<br>That even though there was יאוש ושינוי רשות</b> (so seemingly לוי acquires this item and שמעון should not be able to take it away from him), nevertheless <b>שמעון can remove it from לוי –<br>כיון דאין שום הפסד ללוי שיחזור על ראובן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">When the consumer (לוי) will suffer a loss if the original owner (שמעון) will take it away from him, since there is no אחריות on this sale, we say that in order to protect the consumer, the נגזל cannot retrieve the stolen item (if there was יאוש ושינוי רשות). See footnote # 2. However when the buyer has recourse to recoup his loss from the גזלן, the נגזל can take it back from the buyer. [See ש"ך חו"מ סי' לז ס"ק כט who argues with this and maintains that the נגזל cannot remove it from the buyer if there was יאוש ושינוי רשות, even if there is אחריות.]</i> –<br>Since לוי suffers no loss, for he can return to ראובן</b> and be compensated for his loss –<br><b>אבל בקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read בקרקע אף על גב דאיכא יאוש (instead of בקרקע דאינה יאוש).</i> דאינה יאוש ושינוי רשות הדרא ליה –<br>However regarding land (property) [even though there is] יאוש ושינוי רשות,</b> nevertheless <b>it reverts back to</b> the נגזל –<br><b>כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4</i> דאין מועיל יאוש<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read יאוש ושינוי רשות בקרקע (instead of יאוש בקרקע.).</i> בקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">There is a rule that קרקע אינה נגזלת, it is always considered that it is in the רשות of the rightful owner (not of the גזלן) and  (according to the רשב"ם) not even ברשות לוקח (even after יאוש). Therefore by קרקע since שמעון the נגזל can dislodge לוי (the buyer) from the field, so שמעון cannot testify on behalf of לוי, for he is a נוגע בעדות, since as soon as the field is established by לוי, the נגזל can take possession of the field away from לוי. </i> –<br>As the רשב"ם explained that יאוש [ושינוי רשות] is not effective by land –</b><br>תוספות disagrees and question the פ"ה:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו יצחק דבירושלמי (דכלאים פרק ז<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">סוף ה"ד. In our ירושלמי לד,ב.</i>) אמר דיאוש מועיל בקרקע –<br>And the ר"י has a difficulty</b> with the רשב"ם, <b>for in</b> תלמוד <b>ירושלמי it states that יאוש is effective for קרקע –<br>דאף על פי שאינה נגזלת מכל מקום מהני בה יאוש<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Granted that קרקע אינה נגזלת, however that is only without יאוש, however when there is יאוש ושינוי רשות it is effective and the original owner is no longer considered a מוחזק.</i> –<br>So even though קרקע cannot be stolen</b> (and is considered always ברשות הנגזל), <b>nevertheless יאוש is effective –<br>וגבי עבד משמע בהשולח (גיטין דף לט,ב) דמהני ביה יאוש<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">Possibly תוספות is referencing the case there where the master said נתייאשתי מפלוני עבדי; the rule is that the slave is free (from working, but still requires a גט שחרור [to marry a בת ישראל]). It is evident that יאוש is effective by an ע"כ.</i> אף על גב דאיתקש לקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">It stands to reason that if יאוש is effective by an ע"כ (who is compared to קרקע regarding many laws [including the laws of קנינים (acquisition)]), so יאוש should also be effective by קרקע.</i> –<br>And</b> similarly <b>regarding a slave</b> (עבד כנעני), <b>it seems in</b> פרק <b>השולח that יאוש is effective by</b> an עבד כנעני, <b>even though he is compared to קרקע –<br>ובשמעתין דסיקריקון<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">סיקריקון is an extortionist who kills people if they do not give him their property. One of the laws regarding סיקריקון is that if the סיקריקון was on the property for twelve months (after taking it by force from the ישראל), anyone can buy it from the סיקריקון since the owner was מייאש (except that he must give the owner a fourth of the property, עיי"ש). It is evident that the ייאוש is effective since anyone can buy it from the סיקריקון.</i> (שם דף נח,ב) אומר רבינו יצחק דמוכח נמי כן –<br>And, says the ר"י that in the discussion</b> regarding <b>סיקריקון it is also evident</b> that יאוש is effective (even) by קרקע. <sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">In any event since we see that יאוש is קונה by קרקע, why is there a difference between פרה וטלית (where we say he can testify since יאוש (ושינוי רשות) is קונה, so he cannot take it away from the buyer). and קרקע (where we say that he cannot testify since he can remove the buyer), but since יאוש is קונה by קרקע, there is no difference between the two. If he was מייאש he should always be able to testify, and if he was not מייאש, he should never be able to testify. </i><br>תוספות explains:<br><b>ונראה דמיירי שלא נתייאש –<br>And it seems that</b> the case of קרקע <b>is where</b> the נגזל <b>was not מייאש –</b><br>תוספות responds to the obvious question:<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">Why are we differentiating between קרקע and מטלטלין, we should distinguish between יאוש (where he can testify) and no יאוש (where he cannot testify).</i><br><b>והוה מצי לפלוגי נמי בפרה וטלית<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> בין לפני יאוש בין לאחר יאוש –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>could have also differentiated by פרה וטלית</b> itself <b>whether</b> it was <b>לפני יאוש</b> (where he cannot testify), or <b>whether it was after יאוש</b> (where he can testify) –<br><b>אלא מילתא דשכיחא נקט דבקרקע אין רגילין להתייאש כשישראל גזלה –<br>Rather</b> the reason he chose to differentiate between קרקע and מטלטלין is because the תנא <b>mentions something which is common, since regarding קרקע it is not common to be מייאש, when a ישראל stole it;</b> the reason he is not מייאש <b>–<br>שאם לא יוכל להוציאה מידו משום דלא ציית דינא יוציאנה מיד<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">However by מטלטלין he is מייאש since he is not sure where the item will be, that he should be able to retrieve it.</i> בנו:</b><br><b>For</b> the נגזל assumes <b>that if he cannot take it away from the</b> גזלן, <b>for he does not obey the בית דין, I will take it away</b> eventually <b>from his son.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>There is a dispute between רשב"ם and תוספות whether יאוש is קונה by קרקע, or not.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות writes that the גמרא could have differentiated by a פרה וטלית whether it was לפני יאוש or לאחר יאוש.<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 19.</i> Why did not תוספות (also) say that we could have differentiated by קרקע whether it was לפני יאוש or לאחר יאוש?!

<b>ונוקמה ביורש—And let us establish it by an heir</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to previous תוס' ד"ה דוקא.</i><br>The גמרא explained that the case of מעיד לו עליה (by the פרה וטלית) must be where the גזלן sold it (for then there is יאוש ושינוי רשות), otherwise (if it was still in the sגזלן' possession), the rule would be אין מעיד לו עליה. The גמרא asks so let us establish it in a case where the גזלן died (but did not sell it) and it is now in the possession of his heir (so there is still יאוש ושינוי רשות). Our תוספות discusses whether in such a case the rule would be מעיד לו עליה.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא יורש אין מעיד לו עליה דהדרא ליה כדאמר בהגוזל בתרא (בבא קמא דף קיא,ב) –<br>And if you will say; but</b> if it is by a <b>יורש,</b> the נגזל <b>would not be</b> able <b>to testify for him, since it is returned to the</b> נגזל, <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>הגוזל בתרא –<br>דכל דבר המסויים כגון פרה וטלית חייבין להחזיר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The question is how can שמעון the נגזל testify on behalf the buyer’s children against יהודה, since if the item is given to the יורשים, the נגזל will be able to take it from the יורשים (even though there was יאוש ושינוי רשות), so he is a נוגע בעדות. This should explain why the גמרא could not have established the case of פרה וטלית by יורשים.</i> מפני כבוד אביהם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">When people will see the heirs with the stolen פרה וטלית, they will remark this is the פרה וטלית that their father stole. This will be a dishonor to their father.</i> –<br>That any specific item,</b> which the heirs of a גזלן inherited, <b>for instance a פרה וטלית, the</b> heirs <b>are required to return it</b> to the נגזל, <b>because of their father’s honor</b> (even if there was יאוש [ושינוי רשות]) <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<b><br>ויש לומר דהא אוקימנא בריש הגוזל קמא (שם דף צד,ב) כשעשה תשובה –<br>And one can say, that we have established in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>הגוזל קמא</b> that this rule that the יורשים are required to return their father’s stolen item to the נגזל, is in a case <b>where</b> the father <b>repented</b> and wanted to return the stolen item –<br><b>ולא הספיק להחזיר עד שמת<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">In such a case the יורשים are required to return the item, since we are concerned for כבוד אביהם for he did תשובה.</i> והכא איירי בלא עשה תשובה:</b><br><b>However, he did not have the opportunity to return it before he died, however here it is a case where</b> the father <b>did not do תשובה;</b> in which case the יורשים are not obligated to return it (for we are not concerned for כבוד אביהם, since he did not do תשובה).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The rule that יורשים must return items their father stole (to the נגזל), because of כבוד אביהם is only if the father did תשובה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What would be the ruling if the father did תשובה and attempted to return the stolen item, however the נגזל refused to accept it from him,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא (cited in תוס') in ב"ק צד,ב which states הגזלנין וכו' שהחזירו אין מקבלין מהן וכו'.</i> are the children obligated to return it to the נגזל?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' there ד"ה אי.</i>

<b>אלא כדרבין בר שמואל—Rather</b> it is <b>like <i>Rovin Bar Shmuel</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא concludes that the ברייתא of מכר לו וכו', which distinguishes between בית and פרה וטלית, is not discussing a case of גזלן but rather is teaching us the ruling of רבין בר שמואל regarding a sale of קרקע, where the seller cannot testify on behalf of the buyer against a מערער. Our תוספות clarifies the situation of the ברייתא and of רבין בר שמואל.<br>------------------------------<br><b>ואיירי ברייתא דוקא שלא באחריות דאז יכול להעיד על פרה וטלית<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that ראובן owes שמעון $100. ראובן sells לוי either קרקע or מטלטלין for $100. יהודה comes to לוי and claims that the קרקע or מטלטלין belong to him. The ברייתא rules that ראובן (the seller) cannot testify on behalf of לוי against יהודה in the case of קרקע but he can testify on behalf of לוי by the פרה וטלית. This distinction is true only if ראובן sold לוי (the קרקע or מטלטלין) without a guarantee. Therefore regarding the מטלטלין, which שמעון (the מלוה of ראובן) cannot take it away from לוי (for the מטלטלין of a לוה are not משועבד to the lender), so ראובן can testify on behalf of לוי, since to ראובן there is no difference whether the מטלטלין remain by לוי or are taken away from לוי. He does not gain anything if the מטלטלין remain by לוי since ראובן will still have to pay the מלוה (for the מלוה cannot collect from לוי). He does not lose anything if יהודה takes away the מטלטלין from לוי since he never guaranteed לוי (and the מלוה would have not been able to collect from לוי anyway). However if ראובן guaranteed לוי, obviously he cannot testify on behalf of לוי (against יהודה), for ראובן is a נוגע בעדות. If יהודה were to take away the מטלטלין from לוי, it would be necessary for ראובן to reimburse לוי, since it was sold באחריות. We assume that the case of קרקע is similar to the case of מטלטלין that it too was sold בלא אחריות, nevertheless ראובן cannot testify on behalf of לוי, since ראובן has a vested interest that the property remain by לוי, for then his מלוה will be able to collect his debt from the property. Otherwise if יהודה removes לוי from the property, then שמעון will not collect his loan and ראובן will be a לוה רשע ולא ישלם. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>And the ברייתא,</b> which discusses both קרקע and מטלטלין, <b>is specifically in a case where</b> the sale was <b>without a guarantee, for</b> only <b>then can</b> the seller <b>testify regarding</b> the <b>פרה וטלית</b> on behalf of the buyer. This is concerning the ברייתא –<br><b>ומילתא דשמואל איירי בכל ענין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">If ראובן sold the field to לוי with אחריות then obviously he cannot testify on his behalf, since ראובן wants the field to reman by לוי, for if יהודה removes לוי from the field, ראובן will have to compensate him (since he sold it באחריות). The novelty is that even if ראובן sold it without אחריות, nevertheless he is a נוגע בעדות, for he wants that לוי should retain the field in order that שמעון (his מלוה) will have where to collect from, and ראובן will not be a לוה רשע ולא ישלם.</i> ורבותא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות may be saying that even though the גמרא states that the ברייתא is according to שמואל, it does not mean that the ברייתא is exactly like שמואל, but rather there is a (slight) difference, for the ברייתא must be discussing a case of שלא באחריות, however the ruling of שמואל is in all cases, whether with or without אחריות. </i> נקט אפילו שלא באחריות:</b><br><b>However,</b> regarding <b>the ruling of</b> רבין בר שמואל in the name <b>שמואל</b> (which only discusses קרקע) this ruling <b>is in all cases</b> (whether it was sold with אחריות, or without אחריות) <b>and he mentions a novelty</b> that <b>even</b> if it was sold <b>שלא באחריות,</b> nevertheless the seller cannot testify on behalf of the buyer.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ברייתא is in cases without אחריות and in sשמואל' case it does not matter.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>We understand from תוספות that if ראובן sold the קרקע to לוי even without אחריות, he cannot testify on his behalf (against יהודה), since ראובן has a vested interest that the property remain by לוי so that שמעון (the מלוה of ראובן) will have from where to collect his debt. Otherwise (if יהודה retains the property) שמעון will not have collected his debt and ראובן will be called a לוה רשע ולא ישלם (he borrowed money and did not pay it back).<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See end of footnote # 1.</i> However if the field remains by לוי and שמעון takes it away, should not ראובן be considered a לוה רשע ולא ישלם regarding לוי, since לוי paid him money and received nothing in return. It seemingly should make no difference to ראובן who is losing out on his account; whether it is the מלוה (who is not paid back and lost his money) or whether it is the buyer (who paid money and received nothing). Why do we say that ראובן is a נוגע בעדות, what difference is there to ראובן, whether יהודה takes the field and the מלוה loses<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">It is difficult to answer that if יהודה takes the field then both the מלוה and לוי lose, so he is a double לוה רשע. This is not so; a person is considered a לוה רשע only if he causes the loss (like if the מלוה does not receive his payment, or if sלוי' field is taken by the מלוה because ראובן owes him money). However when יהודה takes it away from לוי this is not the fault of ראובן, for he claims that יהודה is a liar and the field belongs to him. ודו"ק.</i> or if לוי takes the field and לוי loses on account of ראובן, since שמעון the מלוה of ראובן takes it away from him?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i>

<b>עשה עבדו אפותיקי ומכרו כולי—He mortgaged his slave and sold him, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא ruled that if someone offered his slave as an אפותיקי for his creditor and then the borrower sold the slave, nevertheless the creditor can collect his debt by repossessing the slave for himself. תוספות explains the need for רבא to establish his ruling of a slave by an אפותיקי.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">An אפותיקי is similar to a mortgage; meaning that the לוה designates something of value (either קרקע or an עבד), from which the מלוה can collect his debt if the לוה defaults on the loan. The word אפותיקי is a combination of three words אפה תהא קאי (the loan is based on this).</i><br>--------------------------------<br><b>אפילו אי סבר רבא דעבדי כמקרקעי דמי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">It would seem from sרבא' statement that if the לוה did not make the עבד an אפותיקי, and sold him, the מלוה would not be able to collect the עכד as payment. However, if we assume that עבדים are like קרקע, then even if the עבד was not made an אפותיקי, the מלוה should still be able to collect from the עבד, since all קרקע is משועבד to the loan, and an עבד is considered קרקע. Therefore it is not understood why רבא mentions אפותיקי. [However if רבא would maintain עבדי כמטלטלי דמי, it is understood why רבא mentions אפותיקי, for only by an אפותיקי (of עבד) can the מלוה collect if he was sold, but not if he was not made an אפותיקי.] </i> נקט אפותיקי לאשמועינן בין בשטר בין בעל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">By an oral loan the מלוה cannot collect anything from משעובדים (sold properties), unless he made it for an אפותיקי, in which case the מלוה can collect, [only] if the אפותיקי was an עבד (but not anything else). The reason is (as the גמרא states) that if one makes his עבד for an אפותיקי there is publicity (even though it was a מלוה ע"פ). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> פה:</b><br><b>Even if רבא maintains that slaves are considered land,</b> nevertheless <b>he mentions אפותיקי to inform us</b> that the מלוה can collect this עבד as payment for his loan, <b>whether</b> the loan was written in a <b>document, or whether</b> it was <b>an oral</b> loan<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One can collect from a sold עבד who was an אפותיקי even if it was a מלוה ע"פ.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It seems from תוספות that an אפותיקי is effective even by a מלוה ע"פ, only by an עבד, but not by קרקע.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> Why is there this difference; if there is a קול by an אפותיקי עבד, there should also be a קול by an אפותיקי קרקע?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See חידושי הב"ח על הש"ס.</i>
<b>שורו אפותיקי ומכרו כולי—His ox was mortgaged and he sold it, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא taught that if a borrower made his ox for an אפותיקי, and then sold it, the מלוה cannot take away this ox from the buyer to satisfy his debt. רבא ruled elsewhere<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See גיטין מ,ב וש"נ.</i> that הקדש, חמץ, ושחרור מפקיעין מידי שעבוד.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This means (in the case of הקדש) that if the לוה made his ox for an אפותיקי and then the לוה was מקדיש this ox for a קרבן, the מלוה can no longer collect from this ox. For the הקדש removed the שעבוד. Similarly with חמץ and שחרור.</i><br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>הא דלא חשיב מכר בהדי הקדש דמפקיע מידי שעבוד<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Why did רבא state that (only) הקדש חמץ ושחרור are מפקיע מידי שעבוד, he should have added מכר; that it too is מפקיע מידי שעבוד, as we see here regarding עשה שורו אפותיקי ומכרו, the rule is אין בע"ח גובה הימנו!</i> –<br>The reason</b> רבא <b>did not include ‘selling’ among הקדש</b> חמץ ושחרור, <b>who extract from a שעבוד –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>משום דהקדש מפקיע אפילו אקני ליה מטלטלין אגב<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">There is a קנין אגב; if a buyer is purchasing קרקע and מטלטלין from a seller, once the buyer makes a קנין in the קרקע and acquires it, he also acquires the מטלטלין, even though he did not make any קנין on the מטלטלין.</i> מקרקעי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In a case where the לוה made the אפותיקי by being משעבד his קרקע to the מלוה, and אגב the קרקע he obligated himself to be משעבד something else (an ox) for an אפותיקי to the מלוה (see רשב"ם ד"ה וניחוש). If he subsequently was מקדיש the ox, it is מפקיע even this שעבוד, which was accomplished אגב קרקע, however if he merely sold the ox (which was משועבד to the lender אגב קרקע), the שעבוד still remains, and the מלוה can collect this ox from the buyer as payment for his debt.</i> מה שאין כן במכר :</b><br><b>Because הקדש is מפקיע</b> from שעבוד, <b>even if he granted</b> the מלוה <b>the מטלטלין via קרקע, however by מכר it is not so.</b> Therefore רבא could not have included מכר with the others, since the הפקעה from שעבוד is not in the same manner.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>הקדש can be מפקיע מידי שעבוד even if he was מקנה מטלטלין אגב קרקע, but מכר cannot.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Can we perhaps say that when הקדש is מפקיע מידי שעבוד there is no longer a possibility to collect from it,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">This means that even if this ox, who became הקדש, received a מום and is no longer fit for the מזבח, nevertheless the מקדיש cannot claim it since the הקדש was מפקיע the שעבוד.</i> however by מכר, it was not מפקיע the שעבוד,<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Were the buyer to resell it back to the seller (the לוה), the מלוה would be able to claim it, because the שעבוד was never נפקע.</i> but merely that the מלוה cannot collect from the לקוחות.<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See קובץ שיעורים אות קצ.</i>

Line 4

<b>והוא דכתב דלא כאסמכתא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">An אסמכתא is where one makes a stipulation, however he is depending (סומך) that it will never come to pass. For instance when negotiating a sale, the buyer says if I do not being the money within a week I will pay you ten times the amount we agreed on. The buyer has no intention of paying ten times the amount; he merely says this to assure the seller that he is sincere in buying the item. The buyer is סומך that he will surely bring the money, and he is not concerned that he will have to pay ten times the amount. Therefore even if he does not pay in time the stipulation is ineffective.</i>—Provided that he wrote, ‘and that it is not like an <i>Asmachtoh</i>’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב חסדא ruled that in the case where he made his מטלטלין an אפותיקי אגב קרקע; that it is a valid אפותיקי provided that the borrower writes in the שטר that he is מקנה the מטלטלי אגב קרקע sincerely, that it is not an אסמכתא (and not כטופסא דשטרי). <sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Otherwise, if he does not write דלא כאסמכתא, we can assume that he has no intention of making his מטלטלין an אפותיקי (if he does not pay), he only says it to convince the מלוה to lend him the money. The לוה is sure he will pay him back and the מלוה will never collect the מטלטלין. Therefore he must write ודלא כאסמכתא (see רשב"ם ד"ה דלא). Otherwise there is no אפותיקי.</i> Our תוספות is unsure as to the intent of this ruling.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>מספקא לן אי במטלטלי אגב מקרקעי דוקא<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">We may assume this since רב חסדא issued this ruling in conjunction with sרבה' ruling that if he was מקנה מטלטלי אגב קרקע, it is effective, and on this רב חסדא ruled that he must write דלא כאסמכתא.</i> או אפילו במקרקעי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’</i> לחודיה:</b><br><b>We are doubtful whether</b> this requirement of writing דלא כאסמכתא <b>is specifically</b> when the borrower is משעבד his <b>מטלטלין אגב קרקע</b> for an אפותיקי, <b>or even if</b> he is משעבד <b>just his קרקע</b> as an אפותיקי, he also is required to write דלא כאסמכתא.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>תוספות is not certain whether one must write דלא כאסמכתא, only by מטלטלי אגב קרקע, or even by קרקע alone.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can תוספות even consider that one must write דלא כאסמכתא even for קרקע alone (and otherwise there is no שעבוד), when we know that the קרקע of the לוה is always משעובד to the מלוה and he can collect even מנכסים משועבדים?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i><br>2. Why should there be a difference between קרקע and מטלטלי אגב קרקע; that one is an אסמכתא and the other is not?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה בגמ' בד"ה דלא.</i>

Line 5

<b>כגון שלקח ומכר לאלתר—For instance that he bought it and sold it immediately</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא taught that if ראובן sold a field to שמעון, he cannot later testify on behalf of שמעון against a potential litigant. However if he sold him a פרה וטלית he can testify on his behalf.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In the first instance we are concerned that ראובן has a vested interest that the property remain by שמעון so sראובן' creditor will have from where to collect, however regarding מטלטלין, which (usually) cannot be collected from לקוחות, we are not concerned. </i> In response to various questions, the גמרא answers that by the פרה וטלית there is no concern that he was משעבד it for his מלוה, since we know that ראובן bought the פרה and immediately sold it to שמעון, so there was no time between the purchase and sale that he could have borrowed money and be משעבד this פרה to the מלוה. The גמרא challenged this answer, asking perhaps ראובן the לוה said to his מלוה that I am משעבד to you 'דאיקני'.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This means, ‘I am placing collateral on any asset that I will acquire later’. Therefore as soon as ראובן purchased the פרה וטלית they became משעובד אגב קרקע to his מלוה. Therefore even though he immediately sold it to שמעון, nevertheless the שעבוד remains, so how can ראובן testify on behalf of שמעון, since he has a vested interest that the פרה וטלית remain by שמעון, so his מלוה will have where to collect from.</i> Our תוספות asks that the גמרא could have refuted this answer (of שלקח ומכר לאלתר) in another manner.<br>--------------------------------------<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>הוה מצי למיפרך אי הכי אפילו בית ושדה נמי אלא מגופה פריך:</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have asked, if</b> indeed it is <b>so</b> that he was לקח ומכר לאלתר, <b>so by בית ושדה as well</b> he should be permitted to testify, since he did not borrow in between; there should be no difference between בית ושדה and פרה וטלית, <b>however</b> the גמרא preferred to <b>challenge</b> this answer <b>from</b> פרה וטלית <b>itself;</b> which is what we are discussing.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>It is preferable to ask from the issue which is under discussion than from an external issue.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Which of these two challenges is stronger (the sגמרא' challenge דלמא דאיקני, or תוספות proposed challenge א"ה בית ושדה נמי)?

Line 6



Line 7

<b>דלא הוה ליה ארעא מעולם—That he never owned land</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא concluded that the reason the seller can testify on behalf of the buyer by מטלטלין is that we are discussing a case where there are witnesses that the seller never owned any land and therefore he could not have been משעבד his מטלטלין אגב קרקע. There is therefore no concern that the מלוה of the seller will collect these מטלטלי.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>מכאן תשובה לאומרים דמה שנהגו לכתוב בהרשאות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">A הרשאה is a ‘power of attorney’. In certain instances where one wishes to send an agent to claim on his behalf; the sender (מרשה) must grant the agent (מורשה) the ownership over the item in question. This is usually done through קנין אגב. The מרשה states that he is granting the מורשה some of his קרקע and אגב the קרקע he is granting him the ownership of this item. Otherwise, the other party may refuse to deal with the agent, saying לאו בעל דברים דידי את.</i> ונתתי לו ארבע אמות בחצרי –<br>From</b> the גמרא <b>here</b> (which states that witnesses testify that he never owned land) there is <b>a rebuttal to</b> those that <b>say regarding this which is customary to write in</b> שטרי <b>הרשאות, ‘and I gave him four אמות in my courtyard’</b> and אגב the קרקע I am also giving him the item in dispute; we write this in the שטר הרשאה –<br><b>אף על גב דלית ליה קרקע משום דאין לך אדם שאין לו ארבע אמות בארץ ישראל –<br>Even though</b> in reality the מרשה <b>has no land.</b> The reason we do this is <b>because there is no person who does not own</b> at least <b>ד' אמות in א"י –<br>דקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Land is always considered to be in the possession of the original owner, not the thief who may be occupying the land.</i> אינה נגזלת<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Our ancestors owned the land of א"י, so therefore we, as rightful heirs, own part of א"י, regardless who may be living on the land.</i> אי נמי דאין לך אדם שאין לו ד' אמות לקברו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –<br>Since land cannot be stolen, or</b> you may <b>also</b> say <b>that there is no person who does not have</b> the right to <b>ד' אמות to bury him.</b> This is how the 'אומרים' explain why we can write in the הרשה that ונתתי לי ד"א בחצרי. However תוספות objects –<br><b>דהכא משמע דאפשר שאין לו קרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">If every ישראל has some קרקע what is the answer that the עדים testify that the seller never had land; but according to these 'אומרים', everyone has land. This proves that it is indeed possible not to have land, and we need to understand how the הרשאות are effective.</i> –<br>For here it seems that it is possible that</b> a ישראל <b>has no קרקע</b> at all.<br><b>וכן משמע בפרק שלישי דקדושין (דף ס,ב עיין שם) הרי את מקודשת לי על מנת שיש לי קרקע –<br>And so too it seems in the third פרק of</b> מסכת <b>קדושין,</b> where the משנה states in a case where a man said to a woman, ‘<b>you are betrothed to be with the stipulation that I have land’</b>, the rule is that she is מקודשת only if he has land, but not if he does not –<br><b>משמע דאפשר שאין לו –<br>This implies that it is possible that he has no</b> land –<br>תוספות rejects a possible answer:<br><b>ודוחק להעמיד בגר שאין לו חלק בארץ<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Regarding a convert it is indeed possible that he has no land, since he did not inherit it from his ancestors; however it is very far-fetched to establish these גמרות that they apply only by a גר (which is very uncommon).</i> –<br>And it is improbable to establish</b> (these גמרות) <b>by a convert who has no share in the land –</b><br>תוספות has an additional difficulty with the 'אומרים':<br><b>ועוד דאם כן לא יעשה אדם שני שטרי הקנאה שהראשון קנה ארבע אמותיו –<br>And additionally; for if this is indeed so</b> that one is using his ד"א בא"י, the rule should be <b>that a person cannot make two notes of הרשאה, for the first</b> agent <b>already acquired his ד"א,</b> what is he giving to the second agent; he has no more קרקע?!<br>In summation תוספות rejects the notion that the reason one writes ונתתי לי ד"א בחצרי is because we assume he has land (either in א"י, or to be buried in). The question therefore arises how do people, who have no land, write הרשאות.<br><b>ונראה לרבינו תם דהיינו טעמא כיון שמודה שיש לו קרקע וחוב הוא לו –<br>And it is the view of the ר"ת that this is the reason</b> why one may write ונתתי לו ד"א בחצרי (even though he owns no land), for <b>since he admits that he has land and</b> this admission <b>is detrimental for him –<br>שהרי על ידי קרקע מקנה לחבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1. The מרשה is granting the מורשה this (virtual) land and, through אגב, also some of his assets.</i> –<br>Since through the land he is transferring</b> his assets <b>to his friend,</b> so therefore –<br><b>אפילו יש כמה עדים שמכחישים אותו הרי הודאת בעל דין כמאה עדים<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">הודאת בעל דין כמאה עדים דמי really means that one’s admission is greater than the testimony of (even) one hundred witnesses. [An example is if one responds, to a demand of payment for a loan, that he never borrowed the money, this is considered as an admission that he never paid it (if one did not borrow he certainly does not pay back). Therefore if there are witnesses that there was a loan, and witnesses that he paid back the loan, nevertheless he is obligated to pay, because his admission (by saying I did not borrow so therefore) that he did not pay back, is stronger than the testimony of the witnesses that he did pay back.]</i> –<br>Even though there are many witnesses who contradict him</b> and testify that he owns no land, nevertheless the rule is the <b>admission of a litigant is like a hundred witnesses –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ולא חיישינן למיחזי כשיקרא כדאשכחנא (לקמן דף קמט,א) גבי איסור גיורא –<br>And we are not concerned that ‘it appears like a lie’;</b> this is no concern, <b>as we find regarding<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">איסור גיורא had a son מרי בר איסור who was conceived before איסור was מתגייר, and so therefore legally he was not his son and not his heir. איסור had deposited 12,000 זוזים by רבא. When איסור was on his death bed, רבא assumed that he will be able to be קונה this deposit (מן ההפקר) when איסור died, since איסור has no heirs. However איסור falsely ‘admitted’ that the money which he deposited by רבא belonged to מרי בר איסור.</i> איסור the גר –<br>דנפק אודיתא מבי איסור ואף על גב שהיה איסור משקר<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">It is apparent that הודאה is effective even though we know it is a lie. Therefore here too, when the מרשה ‘admits’, to his detriment, that he has land, we accept it as so.</i> –<br>That an admission was issued from sאיסור' house, and even though that איסור was lying,</b> nevertheless the money went to מרי בר איסור, and not to רבא.<br>Based on this ר"ת,<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over; # 2.</i> תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה מורינו הרב רבי חזקיהו דמכל מקום ניחוש הכא דלמא אקני ליה מטלטלין אגב קרקע –<br>מהר"ר חזקיהו asked that notwithstanding</b> that there are witnesses here that the seller never owned any land, <b>we should still be concerned perhaps</b> the seller <b>was מקנה</b> his lender <b>מטלטלין אגב קרקע</b> and we will disregard the עדים because (perhaps) –<br><b>והודה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">This admission is to his detriment, since he is משעבד his קרקע ומטלטלין to his מלוה.</i> שיש לו מקרקע<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">According to the ר"ת that we accept the admission that one owns קרקע, even if in actuality he does not, the question of the גמרא remains; perhaps ראובן the seller was מקנה his מטלטלין אגב קרקע (in a manner of דאיקני) so even though the עדים testify that he never owned קרקע, but if he is admitting that he does own קרקע, he is believed, and so he is a נוגע בעדות because he wants to pay his מלוה, and should not be allowed to testify on behalf of the buyer.</i> אף על פי שלא היה לו מעולם –<br>The</b> borrower/seller <b>admitted that he owns land, even though</b> that in truth <b>he never owned</b> any land –<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה דכולי האי לא חיישינן שמא שיקרו להודות<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">When this case comes before us (where ראובן wants to testify on behalf of שמעון the buyer) we do not know whether ראובן owes money or not, we do not know whether he was מקנה מטלטלין אגב קרקע, etc. However we are concerned that perhaps this is what happened (that he borrowed and was מקנה מטלטלי אגב קרקע). Nevertheless once there are witnesses that he never owned קרקע, that concern is not there. You ask that we should be concerned that perhaps ראובן lied and said that he has קרקע, that concern is too far-fetched, and we can dismiss it.</i> –<br>And it appears</b> to תוספות that <b>to such an extent</b> <b>we are not concerned that they will lie in their admission.</b><br>תוספות rules:<br><b>ונראה לו דבזמן הזה שרגילים לכתוב והקניתי לו ארבע אמות בחצירי –<br>And it is the view of</b> מהר"ר חזקיהו <b>that nowadays that it is customary to write, ‘and I let him acquire ד"א in my courtyard’ –<br>אם כן מילתא דשכיחא היא ואם כן מכר לו פרה וטלית אין מעיד לו עליה –<br>Therefore it is a common practice</b> to ‘lie/admit’ that one owns קרקע, <b>so therefore if he sold him a פרה וטלית,</b> the seller <b>cannot testify on behalf</b> of the buyer –<br><b>אף על גב דאיכא עדים דלא היה ליה ארעא מעולם:</b><br><b>Even though there are witnesses that</b> the seller <b>never owned land,</b> because nowadays it is very common to admit (by lying) and be מקנה אגב קרקע, even though he has no קרקע, so this concern is more realistic and probable nowadays.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We write in a שטר הרשאה that ‘I gave him ד"א in my חצר’; either because everyone has ד"א in א"י (the view of the 'אומרים'), or because הודאת בע"ד כמאה עדים דמי (the ר"ת).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes that one of the reasons one may write ונתתי לו ד"א בחצרי is because שאין לך אדם שאין לו ד"א לקוברו.<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> Seemingly this right to be buried is something a person receives after he passes on, but right now, he does not own any land, so how can he be מקנה מטלטלין אגב this קרקע which he does not have?!<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See קובץ שיעורים אות קצב. See there also regarding קרקע אינה נגזלת that by כיבוש מלחמה even a נכרי is קונה מישראל, so how do we have קרקע בא"י. The קובץ שיעורים answers, דשאני א"י שאנו מובטחים שתחזור לנו בביאת הגואל אשר נחכה לו בכל יום שיבוא.</i><br>2. Does the question of מהר"ר חזקיהו also apply to the view of the 'אומרים' that everyone has ד"א;<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 11.</i> therefore even though there are עדים that he has no land, nevertheless he has ד"א so he can be מקנה the מטלטלין אגב קרקע? If indeed the question applies, what would be the answer?!

Daf 45a



Line 1

<b>אי דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי עליה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In the גמרא the text reads עליה דידיה הדר.</i> הדר—If he has other land, he will go after it</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>שמואל ruled that if ראובן<b></b> sold שמעון a field without אחריות, he cannot testify on behalf of שמעון (against לוי, who claims it is his), because perhaps ראובן wants this field to remain by שמעון, so that sראובן' creditor יהודה, will be able to collect it as payment for his loan to ראובן.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Superficially (and mistakenly) this means that ראובן thinks that יהודה will collect his debt from the field שמעון bought, and since it was sold without אחריות, so ראובן will not have to pay anything (back to שמעון). </i> Therefore ראובן is a נוגע בעדות. The גמרא asks; if ראובן has other property, then יהודה must collect from ראובן (and not from שמעון), so why is ראובן a נוגע בעדות.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">יהודה cannot collect from this sold field in any case, since ראובן has other  assets.</i> And if ראובן has no other assets, what difference does it make to ראובן whether יהודה will or will not be able to collect from שמעון?<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See following תוספות ד"ה מאי for clarification of this question.</i> In either case ראובן does not have to pay,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">If שמעון wins so יהודה will collect from שמעון (and ראובן will not have to pay back שמעון, since it was sold בלא אחריות), and if לוי wins, ראובן will still not pay יהודה, since he has no assets.</i> so why is he a נוגע בעדות?!<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא answers that ראובן is a נוגע בעדות for he wants that יהודה should collect his debt from sשמעון' field. For if לוי takes away the field from שמעון, so that יהודה cannot collect his debt, ראובן will be considered a לוה רשע ולא ישלם, which is very denigrating for him.</i> Our תוספות offers an alternate solution.<br>------------------------------<br>תוספות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>הוה מצי לשנויי כגון שעשאה אפותיקי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">אפותיקי means that the borrower ראובן tells the lender יהודה that if I do not pay you with money, you may collect the debt from this field specifically. The אפותיקי overrides the general rule of אין נפרעים מנכסים משעובדים במקום שיש בני חורין (which was the sגמרא' question, אי דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי עליה דידיה הדר), rather the מלוה can collect his debt from the אפותיקי, which was sold, even though the לוה has other fields which were not sold (בני חורין). </i> דאז לא הדר אארעא אחריתי דאית ליה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling of שמואל is in a case where the seller ראובן has other fields, but nevertheless he is a נוגע בעדות, since the sold field was an אפותיקי.</i> –</b><br>The גמרא <b>could have answered</b> that the case here is where <b>for instance</b> ראובן <b>made</b> this field (before he sold it to שמעון) as an <b>אפותיקי, so then</b> יהודה <b>cannot go after the other land that</b> ראובן has –<br><b>ואם תפול ביד המערער יפרע לו אחרת ומשום הכי אינו מעיד עליה דנוגע בעדות הוא:</b><br><b>So if the</b> field <b>will fall into the hands of the protester</b> לוי, then ראובן will need <b>to pay</b> יהודה <b>another field,<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">If לוי wins the דין תורה against שמעון, the אפותיקי is meaningless, for now we assume that this field never belonged to ראובן (rather it belonged to לוי). It is obvious that ראובן has a vested interest that לוי lose the case and the field remain by שמעון, so יהודה can collect his debt from שמעון, and ראובן is free from paying. However if לוי wins the case, ראובן has to pay יהודה out of pocket from the other assets that he has.</i> so therefore he cannot testify on behalf</b> of שמעון, <b>for</b> ראובן <b>is a נוגע בעדות.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can justify sשמואל' ruling in the case of an אפותיקי. One may collect מנכסים משעובדים<b></b> if it is an אפותיקי, even though there are בני חורין.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is there an advantage in תוספות proposed solution over the sגמרא' answer,<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6. The advantage of תוספות answer may be that the נגיעה בעדות is much more obvious.</i> and if yes, why did not the גמרא utilize it?!<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>מאי נפקא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">In the גמרא the text reads מאי נפקא ליה מינה.</i> מינה—What difference is it [to him]</b><br><br>Overview<b><sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to previous תוס' ד"ה אי.</i></b><br>The גמרא asked if the seller (ראובן) has no other assets, what difference is it to him whether the buyer (שמעון) wins the case (against לוי), or not; in either case he does not have to pay (since he has no assets). תוספות struggles with this question.<br>-------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דנפקא מינה שיפטרו אם יתעשר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ראובן wants that the field remain by שמעון, for then יהודה will collect his debt, and ראובן is free from paying. However if שמעון loses the field and יהודה cannot collect from שמעון, the debt remains and if שמעון becomes wealthy later, he will have to pay יהודה, so how can the גמרא ask מאי נפקא ליה מינה?! It is a major difference to him and therefore he is a נוגע בעדות!</i> –<br>It is astounding! there is a difference</b> to ראובן, whether שמעון retains the field or not, for if שמעון retains the field, ראובן <b>will be exempt</b> from paying יהודה, even <b>if</b> ראובן <b>becomes rich</b> later!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ושמא בשביל כן אין לפוסלו לעדות כיון דהשתא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> לא מרויח מידי:</b><br><b>And perhaps we cannot disqualify</b> ראובן <b>to testify on account of this</b> (which may happen in the future), <b>since now</b> (when he is testifying) <b>he is gaining nothing</b> (for now he has no assets, and cannot pay his creditor).<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>One may not be a נוגע בעדות on account of something which may happen in the future.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Is this answer of תוספות (that we are not concerned for the future) applicable only in a case where we do not know for sure that the seller owes money,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">In this case it is kind of a double ספק; perhaps he owes money (but perhaps not), and even if he owes money he may become wealthy (but perhaps not). Therefore in his type of ספק (which is a ספק ספיקא), we are not concerned. </i> or is it applicable even if we know that the seller owes money?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 4

<b>דינא הוא דמפצי ליה—The rule is that he reimburses him</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא ruled that if ראובן sold a donkey to שמעון, and a gentile took away the donkey from שמעון (by force), claiming that this donkey was stolen from him, ראובן is obligated to reimburse שמעון. Our תוספות clarifies this ruling.<br>------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דלימא ליה אייתי ראיה דבדין טרפה ואשלם לך –<br>The רשב"א is astounded; let</b> ראובן <b>say to</b> שמעון, <b>‘bring</b> me <b>proof that</b> the gentile <b>took it away from you legally, and</b> then <b>I will pay you’ –<br>דאפילו לגבי ישראל מצי למימר הכי כל שכן לגבי עכו"ם –<br>For even regarding a ישראל</b> (who took away an item by force from a buyer), the seller <b>can say</b> to the buyer, ‘prove that it was taken away from you legally, and I will pay you’, so <b>certainly regarding a gentile</b> (who is generally ‘dishonest’) that the seller can make this claim; why is the rule that the seller must reimburse him?!<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Why do we believe the gentile?!</i><br>תוספות answer:<br><b>ויש לומר דמיירי כגון שבדיני עכו"ם דן עמו ובדיניהם הויא דעכו"ם הלכך חייב לפצותו:</b><br><b>And one can say; that this is a case where they went to a gentile court, and they ruled in the gentile’s favor, therefore he is obligated to reimburse him.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The ruling of a gentile court is sufficient to validate a claim.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Shortly the גמרא qualifies this ruling that he must reimburse him, only if the gentile claimed the donkey but not the saddle,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This proves that the gentile is honest in his claim (otherwise he would have claimed the saddle as well).</i> if, however he claimed the saddle as well, he need not reimburse him. If we are relying on the proof of the ‘saddle’, why is it necessary to establish that the gentile was vindicated in court?! And if he was vindicated in court why do we need the proof from the saddle?!

Line 5

<b>אבל מסר לו שלא בעדים מתוך שיכול לומר כולי—However</b> if <b>he transferred<br>it to him without witnesses, since he could say, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה rules that a craftsman (אומן) has no חזקה.<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This means that if you gave you clothes to a tailor and the tailor claims that he bought it from you, and you have witnesses that it was yours, we do not believe the tailor even though he is in possession of the clothes. By anyone else (who is not an אומן) we believe the one who is a מוחזק. </i> רבה qualified this rule that it applies only if there are witnesses that it was given to the אומן. However if there are no witnesses, the אומן is believed, for he has a מיגו, since he could have said, ‘this never happened (להד"ם)’. Our תוספות explains what is meant by the מיגו of להד"ם.<br>--------------------------------------<br><b>אין לפרש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">See (however) רשב"ם in the beginning of ד"ה אבל (who seems to disagree with תוספות).</i> מתוך שהיה יכול לומר אין בידי כלל –<br>We cannot explain</b> the מיגו to mean, <b>since he could have said, ‘I have nothing</b> of yours <b>in my possession’,</b> we should therefore believe him that he bought it; this cannot be –<br><b>דהא בראה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">ראה means that עדים saw the item by the אומן, currently, while the די"ת is taking place and recognize that this belonged to the claimant..</i> מיירי כדמוכח אתקפתא דאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See מה,ב. אביי contradicts רבה from a ברייתא of ראה, which indicates that רבה is also discussing a case of ראה, otherwise there is no question on רבה. Therefore להד"ם cannot mean that, ‘I do not have it’, since we are discussing ראה.</i> דראה עבדו –<br>For</b> this <b>is a case where</b> witnesses <b>saw</b> the item by the אומן, <b>as is evident from the challenge of אביי</b> in the ruling of ‘<b>he saw his slave’,</b> etc.<br>תוספות explains the meaning of להד"ם:<br><b>אלא הכי פירושו מתוך שיכול לומר לא היו דברים מעולם שבא לידו בתורת אומנות –<br>Rather this is the explanation</b> of the מיגו; <b>since he could say, ‘it never happened that it came into my possession as a job –<br>אלא בתורת מכר אי נמי אתה מכרתו לאחר ואחר מכרו לי כדפירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה אבל. Therefore since he has the מיגו that he could have said, ‘I bought it from you, etc.’ therefore even if the אומן admits that he first accepted it as an אומן (to repair it), and later he bought it, he is believed (see מהרש"א).</i> –<br>Rather it was sold</b> to me’, <b>or</b> he may <b>also</b> claim, ‘<b>you sold it to someone else, and he sold it to me’, as the רשב"ם explained –</b><br>In summation: the מיגו of להד"ם is that the אומן could have claimed. ‘it was never given to me as a craftsman, rather I bought it from you, or from someone else who bought it from you’, therefore if he claims, ‘I bought it from you after you gave it to me to repair’,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> the אומן is believed. However להד"ם cannot mean that the אומן claims that he does not have it, because we are (even) discussing a case where witnesses saw the item by the אומן.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר מאי איריא אומן דאין לו חזקה היכא דמסר לו בעדים –<br>And if you will say why</b> is the משנה <b>teaching that an אומן</b> (specifically) <b>has no חזקה,</b> (and only)<b></b> in a case <b>where it was transferred to him</b> in the presence <b>of witnesses,</b> as רבה maintains <b>–<br>אפילו אחר נמי כיון שיש עדים שבא לידו בתורת פקדון –<br>Even another</b> who is not an אומן, <b>also</b> has no חזקה, <b>since there are עדים that it came into his possession as a deposit –</b><br><b>ואפילו לא ראה למאי דמסיק<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">מה,ב. רבה ruled there that if one deposits something by his friend in the presence of עדים, he must return it in the presence of עדים, otherwise he is not believed to claim, ‘I returned it’ (or I bought it).</i> שצריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>And even if it was not seen</b> in his possession currently, nevertheless there is no חזקה, <b>according to this which</b> the גמרא <b>concludes</b> in the name of רבה <b>that he must return it to him with witnesses –<br>ולקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">מו,א.</i> פריך לה אבל מכל מקום קשה דמאי סלקא דעתיה דרבה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">If he gave it to him in the presence of עדים; how can there be a difference between an אומן and a non-אומן?!</i> –<br>And later,</b> indeed, ר"נ בר יצחק <b>asks this</b> very same question, <b>but nevertheless there is a difficulty, for what did רבה assume</b> to differentiate between an אומן and a non-אומן?!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר כגון שמסר לו בעדים סתם<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">Obviously the ruling that אומן אין לו חזקה certainly applies in a case where the עדים know that it was given for repairs, תוספות is saying that the distinction between אומן and אחר is in the case where מסר לו בעדים סתם.</i> ולא פירש בפניהם אם בתורת מכר אם בתורת פקדון<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">A פקדון here (regarding the אומן) means that it was given for repairs.</i> –<br>And we can say</b> that we are discussing a case where <b>for instance he ‘merely’ transferred</b> the item <b>in the presence of witnesses, but did not specify in the presence</b> of the witnesses <b>whether</b> this transference is <b>for a sale or as a deposit –<br>ולהכי דוקא אומן אין לו חזקה דמסתמא לתקנו מסר לו כיון דלא פירש<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">Usually one gives an item to an אומן to repair it, not as a sale. If the אומן bought it, he should have clarified it to the עדים.</i> –<br>So therefore</b> in this case, <b>only an אומן has no חזקה, for presumably, he</b> gave it to the אומן <b>to repair it, since</b> the אומן <b>did not specify</b> that it was a sale –<br><b>אבל אחר מדלא פירש שהוא פקדון<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">When one gives a deposit he expects it to be returned, therefore the owner should have specified to the witnesses that this is a deposit (and he needs two witnesses to attest to it). Since the owner did not say it, this indicates that it is not a deposit, and so therefore the recipient has a חזקה.</i> מסתמא מכר או מתנה הוא –<br>However</b> regarding someone <b>else,</b> who is not an אומן, <b>since</b> the owner <b>did not specify that it was a deposit, presumably it was</b> either <b>a sale or a gift –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">How did רנב"י challenge רבה; seemingly we just gave a valid explanation why an אומן אין לו חזקה, however אחר יש לו חזקה, in a case where there were עדים, but the purpose of the transfer was not specified for the witnesses.</i><br><b>ורב נחמן בר יצחק דפריך בסוף הסוגיא<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 8. רנב"י asks if there are עדים why should there be a difference between אומן and אחר.</i> אומן הוא דאין לו חזקה הא אחר יש לו חזקה –<br>And רנב"י who challenged</b> רבה <b>in the end of this סוגיא,</b> saying<b></b> why is there this difference <b>that</b> only <b>an אומן אין לו חזקה however אחר יש לו חזקה;</b> what is the challenge, תוספות just explained the difference?!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>לא מסתבר ליה לרב נחמן לאוקומה בראיה<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">This ראיה is referring to the עדים seeing the transfer of the item from the owner to the אומן. [This is not the ראה mentioned previously (footnote # 3) which means that they currently see the item by the אומן.]</i> בלא ידיעה דלא שכיח –<br>It does not seem reasonable to ר"נ to establish</b> the rule of אומן in a case <b>where</b> עדים <b>saw, without knowing</b> what they saw, <b>for this is uncommon!</b><br><b>כדפריך [לעיל מיניה<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">מה,ב on the very bottom. The case there is where the אומן and the owner are arguing on the price they agreed upon for the repair. The גמרא asks if there were witnesses, let us ask them what they have to say.</i>] אי דאיכא עדים ליחזו עדים מאי קאמרי<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">According to תוספות explanation previously, what is the question, there were עדים, but nothing was specified.</i> –<br>A</b> רבא <b>asked previously</b> on אביי, ‘<b>if there are עדים, let us see what the עדים say –<br>דלא שכיח שימסור בפניהם ולא ידעי הקציצה –<br>For it is not common that he transferred it in the presence</b> of עדים, <b>and</b> the עדים <b>do not know the fixed</b> price, so just as there we assume the עדים know the price –<br><b>והכא נמי רב נחמן בר יצחק לא פריך אלא מכח סברא זו –<br>So here too ר"נ only asked his question</b> on רבה <b>based on this logic</b> that if there are עדים, they certainly are aware of the circumstances surrounding this transfer –<br><b>והכי פריך אי דאיכא עדים אחר אמאי יש לו חזקה –<br>And this is the challenge</b> of רנב"י, <b>if there are עדים why does the אחר have a חזקה?!</b><br><b>הא על כרחך ידעי עדים דבתורת פקדון אתא לידיה –<br>For perforce the עדים know that it came into his possession as a deposit</b> (just like by the אומן) –<br><b>דלא מסתבר לאוקומה<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read לאוקומה כגון דלא (instead of לאוקומה בדבר דלא).</i> בדבר דלא ידעי דלא שכיח כלל –<br>For it is not logical to establish</b> this ruling in a situation where <b>[for instance] it is a matter where</b> the עדים <b>do not know</b> the circumstances, <b>for it is totally unusual!</b><br>In summation: רבה maintains that he reason an אומן is different from אחר (in a case where there are עדים), is because nothing was specified in the presence of the עדים, therefore by an אומן we assume that it was for repair and by אחר we assume it was for a sale. However רנב"י maintains that this is a very unusual situation that the עדים do not know the details, so the משנה is not discussing it. Therefore there is the question why is an אחר different from an אומן.<br>תוספות cites a question and answer from the רשב"ם:<br><b>הקשה בקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה אבל. The reason a person is believed that whatever is in his possession belongs to him, is because we assume that if it was not his, how is it in his possession. However by דברים העשויין להשאיל, we say that even though it is in his possession, nevertheless it is not sufficient proof that it is his, perhaps he borrowed it or rented it.</i> אמאי יש חזקה לאומן מאי שנא מדברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably the item which he gave to the אומן are included in the category of אין לו חזקה; we can say it is in the sאומן' possession because it was given to him to repair. (even if actually it is not דברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר).</i> –<br>The רשב"ם asked why</b> did רבה <b>state that an אומן has a חזקה</b> if it was given to him without עדים; <b>why is this different from items which are made to lend out or to rent out;</b> where the rule is that by these items there is no חזקה?<br><b>ותירץ דדברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר שייך גבי כל אדם –<br>And he answered that דברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר applies to all people –<br>אבל הכא מצי למימר אומן אינך רגיל אצלי לתקן<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">A person may rent or lend his items to anyone, so the owner can always claim to the holder of the item, ‘I lent it to you’. Therefore there is no חזקה. however regarding an אומן if the owner claims that he gave it in for repairs, the אומן can counterclaim, ‘you are not my customer, so it must be that I bought it from you’.</i> –</b><br><b>However here the אומן can claim, ‘you are not accustomed to have me repair</b> your items’ –<br>תוספות offers his resolution to this issue:<br><b>ורבינו יצחק אומר דאפילו רגיל לתקן אצלו יש לחלק –<br>And the ר"י says that even if he is accustomed to repair by this</b> אומן, <b>nevertheless we can distinguish</b> between דברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר (where אין לו חזקה) and the case of אומן (where יש לו חזקה [if there are no עדים]) –<br><b>דדברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר שייך בין לגבי אדם שמכיר שהוא נאמן –<br>For</b> regarding the rule by <b>דברים העשויין להשאיל ולהשכיר</b> that there is no חזקה, this rule <b>applies whether</b> it is <b>regarding a person whom he recognizes as being honest –<br>בין מכיר שאינו נאמן ואין יכול כל שעה להעמיד עדים כשרוצה להשאיל ולהשכיר –</b><br>Or <b>whether he recognizes that he is not honest</b> (he lends and rents to everyone), <b>and he cannot have עדים present every time when he wants to lend or rent out.</b> the reason he cannot always require witnesses to be present, is in order <b>–<br>שלא להשיא עצמו שם רע בשכיניו<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore it is not a חזקה, for the initial owner claims, ‘I lent it to him, and the reason there are no witnesses is because I cannot afford to have witnesses by every transaction, for then people will say, ‘I’m not a pleasant neighbor’.</i> –<br>That he should not make a bad name for himself</b> <b>among his neighbors –<br>אבל לאומן אם צריך הוא לתקן יכול ליתן לאומן המכיר שהוא נאמן או להביא עדים –<br>However</b> regarding an <b>אומן, if he needs</b> an item <b>to be repaired, he can give it to an אומן whom he recognizes as being honest, or to bring witnesses</b> when he gives him the item to repair –<br><b>לכך יש לו חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">It is obvious that the owner trusts this אומן, otherwise why are there no עדים. Therefore since he trusts the אומן, the אומן is believed (with a מגו). See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> שלא בעדים:</b><br><b>Therefore</b> the אומן <b>has a חזקה</b> if it was <b>not</b> delivered to him in the presence of <b>עדים.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מגו of להד"ם is that it was never given to me for repairs, rather I bought it from you initially. The distinction between אומן ואחר where there are עדים is in a case where they were not explicit as to the nature of the transaction. The difference between דברים העשויין להשאיל and אומן (without עדים) is that the former applies to all people while the אומן can claim you are not my customer (רשב"ם), or that by an אומן he should have brought עדים if he did not trust him.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Why is the מגו claim of the אומן, that I initially bought it from you, a more believable claim,<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> than the actual claim of the אומן, that I bought it from you after you handed it to me for repairs?!<br>2. תוספות explains why an אומן has a חזקה in a case where there are no עדים.<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 24.</i> Seemingly if he has a חזקה, why is it necessary to say that he is believed because of a מיגו, he should be believed because of the חזקה?!
