Line 8

<b>אי הכי אפילו בעדים נמי מתוך שיכול לומר החזרתיו לך כולי—If so even with witnesses also, since he can say, I returned it to you, etc.</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה אבל.</i><br>אביי asked רבה, according to you that an אומן is believed, when there are no עדים, since he has a מגו of להד"ם, so too he should be believed even if there are עדים, since he has a מגו that he could have said, ‘I returned it to you’. תוספות discusses this question.<br>--------------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">There is seemingly an inherent difficulty in sאביי' question. אביי is asking that even if there are עדים, the אומן should be believed; however the משנה stated that an אומן is not believed, so according to אביי that an אומן is believed even when there are עדים, how can we understand the משנה. Seemingly his question is not on רבה, but rather on the משנה. Also how do we understand the term אי הכי (if so). What is he referring to?!.</i> בשלמא לדידי דלא מפליגנא בין יש עדים לאין עדים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means whether or not there were עדים that saw the owner transfer the item to the אומן.</i> –<br>The explanation</b> of sאביי' question on רבה is; the משנה <b>is understood according to me</b> (אביי), <b>that I do not differentiates whether there was עדים</b> or whether there was <b>no עדים –<br>אלא בראה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">ראה means that there are witnesses that the אומן is currently in the possession of the disputed item (so the אומן cannot claim, ‘I do not have it’).</i> הוא דמפליגנא –<br>Rather, I differentiate</b> whether <b>it was ראה</b> or not; meaning that in a case –<br><b>היכא דראה אפילו היכא דליכא עדים לא מהימן כדאמר אביי בסמוך<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See the גמרא on the עמוד ב' regarding ראה and the רשב"ם there ד"ה לא (at the [very] end).</i> –<br>Where it is ראה, even where there were no עדים</b> that can testify that he gave it to the אומן, nevertheless since it was ראה, <b>he is not believed, as אביי states shortly –<br>והיכא דלא ראה אף על גב דאיכא עדים מהימן במיגו דמצי אמר החזרתיו לך<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">אביי maintains המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים אינו צריך להחזיר לו בעדים, in disagreement with רבה.</i> –<br>And where there was no ראה,</b> the rule is that <b>even though there are עדים</b> that he gave it to the אומן, <b>nevertheless</b> the אומן is believed that he bought it, <b>with a מגו that he could have said, ‘I returned it to you’,</b> and then he would be believed since there is no ראה <b>–<br>אלא לדידך היכא דאיכא עדים אפילו לא ראה דלא מהימנא –<br>However according to you</b> (רבה), since you maintain in a case <b>where there are עדים, so even if לא ראה he is not believed,</b> the question is –<br><b>אמאי אינו נאמן במיגו דאי בעי אמר החזרתיו לך –<br>Why is he not believed with a מיגו that he could have said, ‘I returned it to you’?!</b><br>In summation, אביי is challenging רבה who maintains that believing the אומן is only dependent on whether there are עדים when it was given to the אומן, or not, but it makes no difference whether we know that the אומן has the item now (ראה), or not. The question then is just as he is believed when there are no עדים because of the מגו of להד"ם, the אומן should also be believed even if there are עדים because of the מיגו of החזרתיו. However according to אביי what matters is only if it is ראה or not, therefore the משנה is discussing a case of ראה, regardless whether there are עדים or not.<br>תוספות is not satisfied with this explanation:<br><b>ומיהו קשה דלשון אי הכי אפילו בעדים נמי לא משמע הכי<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">According to the previous פשט it seems that אביי is challenging רבה, why does he distinguish between בעדים and שלא בעדים, when he should really distinguish between ראה and לא ראה. However there is no mention here in the גמרא (at this point) anything about ראה. </i> –<br>However there is a difficulty</b> with this explanation, <b>for the language</b> of אביי asking, ‘<b>if this is so, even with עדים,</b> he should <b>also</b> be believed’, this language <b>does not fit</b> with the previous explanation –<br><b>אלא משמע אי הכי דשלא בעדים נאמן במיגו בעדים נמי הוה לך למימר מיגו –<br>Rather it implies, ‘if it is so that without עדים</b> the אומן <b>is believed with the מיגו</b> of להד"ם, so <b>even with עדים we should also employ the מיגו</b> of החזרתי and he should be believed; however –<br><b>בשלמא לדידי דלית לי מיגו שלא בעדים, בעדים נמי לית לי מיגו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The straightforward reading of the question is simply, if you say מיגו (of להד"ם) by אין עדים (to which אביי disagrees), why not say מיגו (of החזרתיו) even by עדים. Therefore אביי (who is challenging רבה) means to say that there is no מיגו at all even by אין עדים. However this פשט is also difficult (see מהרש"א), since אביי agrees that there is a מיגו of החזרתיו (by לא ראה). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>It is understood according to me</b> (אביי) <b>that I do not consider a מיגו when there are no עדים</b> (if it is ראה)<b>, so even when there are עדים there is also no מיגו –<br>אלא לדידך קשה ורבינו תם דחק לפרש ואין נראה כלל לרבינו יצחק:</b><br><b>However according to you</b> (רבה) who maintains a מיגו when there are no עדים, t<b>he difficulty is,</b> there should also be a מיגו when there are עדים. <b>And the ר"ת insisted on explaining</b> the question of אביי (as we said previously?), <b>however it does not appear at all</b> to be correct <b>according to the ר"י.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Seemingly the question of אביי is if רבה distinguishes only between יש עדים ואין עדים but not whether ראה or not, there should be a מיגו by יש עדים just like אין עדים.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. Previously תוספות taught that according to אביי the statement of רבה was in a case of ראה;<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See previous תוס' ד"ה אבל [TIE footnote # 4].</i> how can then אביי ask that even if there are עדים, he should be believed with a מיגו of החזרתיו, how can he claim החזרתיו if it is ראה?!<br>2. Why can’t we say that אביי maintains that there is never a מיגו by ראה and there is always a מיגו by לא ראה, and the פשט is like תוספות says in the end, because אביי assumes that the משנה is in a case of ראה (and that רבה assumes that it is in a case of לא ראה).

Daf 45b



Line 1

<b>המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר לו בעדים—One who deposits by his friend with witnesses is required to return it to him with witnesses</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבה replied to אביי the reason the אומן is not believed that אתה מכרתו לי, with a מיגו of החזרתיו (when it was given to him with עדים), is because the rule is המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר לו בעדים. Our תוספות explores why another מיגו is not available.<br>-------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אכתי להימניה במיגו דאי בעי אמר נאנסו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">[At most] an אומן is considered a שומר שכר, who is פטור for אונסין, so he can claim that an אונס happened. [When a שומר claims נאנסו, he must swear that it was נאנסו; otherwise he must pay. We must therefore say that when תוספות asks that he should be believed with a מיגו of נאנסו, it means that he will be required to swear  מכרתי לי. His claim cannot be more effective than the מיגו; since he would be required to swear by נאנסו (the מיגו), he is also required to swear by מכרתו לי (his claim).]</i> –<br>And if you will say; still</b> (even tough that צריך להחזירו בעדים, nevertheless) <b>we should believe</b> the אומן (that he bought it), <b>with a מיגו for he could have said there was a mishap</b> and the item no longer exists –<br><b>כדאמרינן בסוף המוכר את הבית (לקמן דף ע,א ושם) גבי מפקיד אצל חבירו בשטר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The depositor (the owner) was given a written note by the custodian (שומר) that this item was given to him as a deposit. The rule is that the שומר can later claim that he returned the item (even though the depositor is still in the possession of the note). The reason he is believed is because the שומר has a מיגו that he could have claimed נאנסו. Similarly here, even though there were עדים and we maintain המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר לו בעדים, nevertheless since he has a מיגו of נאנסו (where he would be פטור), therefore we believe him when he claims that he bought it.</i> –<br>As</b> רב חסדא <b>states in the end of</b> פרק <b>המוכר את הבית, regarding one who deposits</b> an item <b>by his friend with a note –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואפילו מאן דפליג התם היינו משום דשטרך בידי מאי בעי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of the שטר, the claim of החזרתי is contradicted by the fact that the מפקיד still has the שטר; if the שומר would have returned the פקדון, he should have asked for the שטר, therefore even though he has a מיגו, nevertheless the claim of שטרך בידי מאי בעי is ‘stronger’ than the מיגו. However here, there is no שטר, so we should believe the אומן that he bought it, with a מיגו of נאנסו, since nothing contradicts his claim of אתה מכרתו לי.</i> –<br>And even</b> according <b>to the one who argues there</b> (and maintains that the שומר is not believed)<b>, that is because</b> the depositor can claim, <b>what is your שטר doing in my hand,</b> however here that issue does not exist. The question remains why is he not believed במיגו דנאנסו <b>–</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ותירץ רבינו תם דודאי הוה מצי אביי למיפרך ליה –<br>And the ר"ת answered that certainly אביי could have asked this</b> question to רבה –<br><b>אי הכי בעדים נמי להימניה במיגו דאי בעי אמר נאנסו –<br>‘if so</b> (that בלא עדים he is believed במיגו of להד"ם) then <b>even with עדים he should also be believed</b> (that he bought it) <b>with the מיגו that he could have claimed נאנסו –<br>אלא דלא אסיק אדעתיה ואותביה מברייתא ואודי ליה דבראה איירי מתניתין –<br>However</b> this question <b>did not enter into the mind of</b> אביי, <b>and</b> instead <b>he refuted</b> רבה <b>from the ברייתא</b> of ראה עבדו וכו', <b>and</b> רבה <b>admitted to</b> אביי <b>that our משנה is discussing a case of ראה</b> (where there is no מיגו at all) –<br><b>ותו ליכא למפרך מידי אנאנסו<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Once it is ראה we know that the item is in the sאומן' possession, there can be no claim if נאנסו (or החזרתיו).</i> –<br>So we cannot ask anything at all regarding נאנסו!</b><br>In summation; we can ask why does רבה maintain that if מסרו בעדים he is not believed (by לא ראה), when he should be believed with a מיגו of נאנסו.<br>תוספות offers an alternate approach:<br><b>ויש מפרשים דהא דקאמר הכא דצריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>And there are those who explain that this which</b> רבה <b>stated here, that he is required to return</b> the פקדון <b>to</b> the owner <b>with עדים,</b> if he received it בעדים –<br><b>היינו אם רוצה להיות פטור משבועה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This [seemingly] explains why אביי did not ask that he should be believed with a מיגו דנאנסו, since here we are discussing a case where the אומן is believed without a שבועה (if there are no עדים), and if there are עדים he cannot claim מכרתו לי and be believed without a שבועה, since he does not have either the מיגו of החזרתי (since המפקיד אצל חברו בעדים צריך להחזירו לו בעדים), or the מיגו of נאנסו (which requires a שבועה).  </i> –<br>That is</b> only <b>if</b> the שומר (אומן) <b>wants to be exempt from an oath –<br>אבל בשבועה נאמן במיגו דנאנסו ואין מחזיר לו בעדים –<br>However,</b> if the שומר takes an <b>oath, he is believed</b> to claim החזרתי <b>with a מיגו</b> that he could have claimed <b>נאנסו, and</b> the שומר <b>is not</b> required <b>to return it with עדים –<br>והכי פירשו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly according to these י"מ why is the rule that אומן אין לו חזקה; since he has a מיגו of נאנסו, he should have a חזקה and be believed with the מיגו.</i> לעיל לא שנו דאומן אין לו חזקה בלא שבועה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">However an אומן will be believed to claim מכרתו לי with a שבועה, even if מסר לו בעדים, since he has the מיגו of נאנסו.</i> אלא שמסר לו בעדים –<br>And this is the explanation of the previous</b> גמרא, where רבה stated, ‘<b>we did not learn</b> this rule <b>that אומן אין לו חזקה without a שבועה, only if it was given to him בעדים –<br>אבל מסר לו שלא בעדים נאמן בלא שבועה במיגו דאי בעי אמר לא היו דברים מעולם<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות מה,א ד"ה אבל (TIE footnote # 5) as to the meaning of להד"ם.</i> –<br>However if it was given to him without עדים,</b> the אומן is believed <b>without a שבועה with the מיגו that he could have said להד"ם –</b><br>תוספות qualifies his statement:<br><b>ומיירי קודם שנתקנה שבועת היסת<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">In the times of the גמרא they (רב נחמן) instituted a שבועת היסת that whenever one has a claim, even though the other party denies it completely, the respondent must swear a שבועת היסת. In this case the owner claims the disputed item from the אומן, so even though the אומן is a כופר הכל (he maintains that it now belongs to him [since he bought it]), nevertheless he is required to swear and substantiate his claim. So after they instituted שבועת היסת, the אומן will not be believed without a שבועה, even if מסר לו שלא בעדים. Therefore the ruling of תוספות is only before תקנת שבועת היסת. </i> ולכך כי אמר לא היו דברים מעולם אין צריך שבועה –<br>And we are discussing</b> a case <b>before the שבועת היסת was instituted, so therefore when he claims להד"ם, a שבועה is not required –</b><br>תוספות reverses this qualification:<br><b>אי נמי לאחר שנתקנה וללישנא דבעי בשבועה דררא דממונא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">See shortly in this תוספות that the meaning of דררא דממונא is that there is some entanglement between the parties.</i> ולא חשיב הכא דררא דממונא –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say that this ruling (that the אומן is believed without a שבועה) is valid even <b>after</b> שבועת היסת <b>was instituted,</b> if we follow <b>the view that</b> שבועת היסת is only <b>required</b> when there is a <b>דררא דממונא, however</b> the case <b>here is not considered a דררא דממונא;</b> the reason this case is not a דררא דממונא <b>–<br>דאמר לא בא לידי בתורת אומנות ואין מודה שנתחייב בו מעולם –<br>For</b> the אומן <b>claims, ‘it never came into my possession as work’, and</b> the אומן <b>does not admit that he ever owed him</b> anything, therefore it is not a דררא דממונא –<br><b>ולא חשיב דררא דממונא אלא מנה לי בידך ואמר ליה הן –<br>And a דררא דממונא is only</b> in case where for instance the claimant said, ‘<b>you owe me a hundred זוז’</b> and the respondent agrees <b>and said to him yes,</b> ‘I<b></b> owe you the money’ –<br><b>למחר אמר ליה תנהו לי ואמר ליה נתתיו לך שמודה שנתחייב –<br>The next day</b> the claimant <b>says to him, ‘give me</b> the money’, <b>and the respondent says to him, ‘I gave it to you’,</b> in this case <b>he admitted that he owed</b> money, so therefore even though that now he is a כופר הכל, nevertheless he is חייב a שבועת היסת, for this is considered a דררא דממונא, however in our case where the אומן did not admit to anything, there is no שבועה, since there is no דררא דממונא.<br>In summation; the י"מ maintain that one is believed with a שבועה to claim החזרתי or אתה מכרתו לי even if it was given to him בעדים, since there is a מיגו of נאנסו. When רבה said he is not believed, he meant without a שבועה. In a case where לא מסרו לו בעדים, the אומן is believed without a שבועה with the מיגו of להד"ם (even לאחר שבועת היסת, since there is no דררא דממונא).<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ועל פירוש זה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This פירוש of the יש מפרשים maintains that when רבה ruled צריך להחזיר לו בעדים that is only if he wants to be believed החזרתי (or מכרתו לי) without a שבועה. However if he is willing to swear, he is believed to claim החזרתי (or אתה מכרתו לי), with a מיגו of נאנסו, even if מסר לו בעדים.</i> קשה לרבינו חננאל דמאי פריך לקמן מראה עבדו ביד אומן<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The ruling there is that the אומן is not believed to claim, ‘you (the owner) sold it to me’, since it was ראה.</i> –<br>And the ר"ח has a difficulty with this פירוש</b> of the יש מפרשים, <b>for what does</b> אביי <b>challenge</b> רבה <b>later from</b> the case of <b>‘he saw his slave by an אומן’,</b> where אביי asks –<br><b>אי דאיכא עדים למה לי ראה לייתי עדים ולישקול –<br>‘if there are עדים,</b> that the owner gave the עבד to the אומן, <b>why do we need ראה; let</b> the owner <b>bring these עדים and take</b> back his עבד, since according to רבה if there are עדים, the אומן is not believed, תוספות asks what is sאביי' question –<br><b>הא מהני ראה דאפילו בשבועה לא יהא נאמן דאין לו מיגו –<br>ראה is effective, that the אומן will not be believed even with a שבועה, since he has no מיגו</b> of נאנסו, etc. –<br><b>דבלא ראה מהימן הוא בשבועה במיגו דנאנסו –<br>For without ראה,</b> the אומן <b>is believed with a שבועה,</b> for he has the <b>מיגו of נאנסו!</b><br><b>וברייתא משמע<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is explaining that we cannot say (to support the question of אביי)  that the ברייתא, when it states that the אומן is not believed, it means that he is not believed without a שבועה. Therefore the ראה is superfluous, for even without ראה, the אומן is not believed without a שבועה. Accordingly sאביי' question will be sustained. Therefore תוספות explains that from the ברייתא it is apparent that the אומן is not believed at all, even with a שבועה, and for that we need ראה according to the י"מ, so what is sאביי' question?!. </i> דלא אמר כלום דאפילו בשבועה אינו נאמן –<br>And from the ברייתא</b> of ראה עבדו,<b></b> which states <b>that לא אמר כלום, indicates that he is not believed even with a שבועה,</b> and according to the יש מפרשים that is true only if ראה, for otherwise he is believed בשבועה with a מיגו דנאנסו!<br>In summation; the ר"ח asks, how can אביי ask on רבה, why does the ברייתא state ראה (if we are discussing that he gave over the עבד with עדים), since according to רבה, the עדים would be sufficient, but this is not so according to the י"מ, there is a difference whether it is ראה or not; by לא ראה, with עדים alone, the אומן would be believed בשבועה for he has a מיגו דנאנסו, however by ראה that מיגו no longer exists and the אומן is not believed at all (even with a שבועה) as it appears from the ברייתא which states לא אמר כלום, therefore it was necessary for the ברייתא to write ראה.<br>The ר"ח disagrees with the י"מ and the ר"ת:<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The ר"ח maintains that the נפקד is not believed בשבועה to claim החזרתי with a מיגו of נאנסו (if מסרו לו בעדים), not like the י"מ (footnote # 11) and the ר"ת. However this requires an explanation; why not; he has a מיגו?!</i><br><b>ונראה לו לתרץ<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This answers the very first question in this תוס'; why did not אביי ask, we should believe him with a מיגו דנאנסו?!</i> דהכא לא חשיב מיגו דטעמא דמאן דאמר דצריך להחזיר בעדים –</b><br><b>And it appears to</b> the ר"ח <b>to explain that here</b> by רבה <b>it is not considered a</b> valid <b>מיגו</b> that he should be believed to claim החזרתי with a שבועה, <b>for the reason of the one who maintains that</b> המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים <b>צריך להחזיר בעדים –<br>משום דכיון דלא הימניה בשבועה כדאמר בשבועות<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there distinguishes between a case where the לוה admitted in the presence of עדים (in which case א"צ לפורעו בעדים), and a case where he lent him בפני עדים, (in which case צריך לפורעו בעדים). The גמרא explains the difference that in the former case the מלוה trusted the לוה (for he lent him without עדים), however in the latter case he did not trust him (דלא הימניה), for he lent him בפני עדים, therefore צריך לפורעו בעדים. It is considered as if he said to him אל תפרעני אלא בעדים.</i> (דף מא,ב ושם) –<br>Is because that since he did not trust him</b> (even) <b>with a שבועה,<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">In מסכת שבועות it merely states דלא הימניה (it does not state בשבועה). In that case by a מלוה there is no שבועה (as there can be in our case by a פקדון [in a case of a נאנסו claim]).</i> as the</b> גמרא <b>states in</b> מסכת <b>שבועות –<br>דהויא כאילו אמר ליה בהדיא אל תחזיר לי אלא בעדים<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">This means that both parties agree that the only way the לוה/נפקד will be exempt is if you return it with עדים, nothing else is sufficient proof, not even a מיגו. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2.</i> –<br>Therefore it is considered as if he told him explicitly, ‘do not return it to me, only with עדים’ –<br>הלכך לא מהימן במיגו דאיהו דאפסיד אנפשיה<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The נפקד accepted these implicit terms, therefore he agreed to forgo his right to be believed with a מיגו.</i> –</b><br><b>Therefore he is not believed with a מיגו because he caused the loss to himself –<br>אבל התם בהמוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> סבר דאין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>However there in</b> פרק המוכר where there is a מיגו, they <b>maintain that אין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>ולא חשיב כאילו אמר אל תחזירני אלא בעדים ולכך נאמן במיגו –<br>So it is not considered as if he said ‘do not return it to me, only with עדים’, therefore he is believed with a מיגו.</b><br>In summation, the ר"ח maintains that if the rule is המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר לו בעדים, the שומר will not be believed with any claim (whether החזרתי or אתה מכרתו לי) with a מיגו of נאנסו, for the rule of צריך להחזירו בעדים is that it precludes any claim based on a מיגו, since איהו דאפסיד אנפשיה.<br>תוספות disagrees with the ר"ח:<br><b>אבל אין נראה דאפילו מאן דאית ליה צריך להחזיר לו בעדים כי איכא מיגו מהימן –<br>However it does not appear</b> that this is so; <b>for even</b> according to <b>the one who maintains צריך להחזיר לו בעדים,</b> nevertheless <b>when there is a מיגו</b> he is believed, even without עדים; not like the ר"ח –<br><b>דאי לאו הכי תקשי מאי פריך ליה אביי מההיא דראה עבדו ביד אומן –<br>For if it were not so</b> (but rather a מיגו is ineffective if we maintain צריך להחזירו בעדים), <b>you have this difficulty; what did אביי challenge</b> רבה <b>from that</b> ברייתא of <b>ראה עבדו ביד אומן,</b> proving –<br><b>דסברא<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">The מהר"ם amends this to read דסבר (instead of דסברא).</i> דאין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>That</b> the ברייתא <b>maintains אין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים,</b> not like רבה; that is no challenge to רבה –<br><b>הא איכא תנא בשבועות<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">The ת"ק of ר' יהודה בן בתירא on מא,ב.</i> דאית ליה המלוה את חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר לו בעדים –<br>Since there is a תנא in</b> מסכת <b>שבועות who maintains one who lends his friend with עדים, he is required to pay him back with עדים –<br>ויסבור רבה כוותיה –</b><br><b>So רבה will maintain like that</b> תנא; what is sאביי' question?!<br><b>אלא משום דאפילו ההוא תנא דשבועות מודה בפקדון<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">Their dispute, as stated there, is only by a מלוה, but not by a פקדון.</i> דאיכא מיגו דנאנסו<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore sאביי' challenge is upheld; how can רבה maintains by פקדון that צריך להחזיר לו בעדים, since this ברייתא clearly maintains א"צ להחזיר בעדים and even the one who maintains by a loan that צריך להחזיר that is because by a loan there is no מיגו (of נאנסו), but by a פקדון where there is a מיגו of נאנסו everyone agrees that א"צ להחזיר, contrary to רבה. In any event we see that in order to explain אביי we must say that by a פקדון there is a מיגו of נאנסו according to everyone (even if we maintain [by הלואה] that צריך להחזיר), this is contrary to the שיטת ר"ח. </i> –</b><br><b>Rather</b> we must say that it is a valid question <b>because even that תנא in</b> מסכת <b>שבועות, agrees by a פקדון</b> that he is not required to return it בעדים, <b>since there is a מיגו of נאנסו</b> so therefore –<br><b>דאין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים לכך נראה כפירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">See (the text between footnote # 3 and) footnote # 4.</i> רבינו תם:</b><br><b>He is not required להחזיר לו בעדים</b> for the מיגו is effective. <b>Therefore</b> תוספות <b>prefers the פירוש ר"ת.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>אביי could have asked that he should be believed with a מיגו דנאנסו (but לא אסיק אדעתיה; the ר"ת). The י"מ maintain that indeed he is believed במיגו דנאנסו (with a שבועה). The ר"ח maintains that there is no מיגו since איהו דאפסיד אנפשיה (if we maintain צריך להחזירו בעדים).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. According to the (אי נמי of the) יש מפרשים that רבה maintains that an אומן will be believed בשבועה even if מסרו לו בעדים (for he has a מיגו דנאנסו),<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 7.</i> what is אביי asking on רבה that even בעדים he should be believed with a מיגו דהחזרתי; in a case of החזרתי it is a דררא דממונא,<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 10.</i> and by a דררא דממונא there is a חיוב שבועה, so what is sאביי' question; רבה agrees that with a שבועה he is believed even when there are עדים?!<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See פני שלמה and נחלת משה.</i><br>2. According to the ר"ח who maintains that if the ruling is המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים צריך להחזיר בעדים, the נפקד will not be believed with a מיגו of נאנסו, since דאיהו דאפסיד אנפשיה;<sup class="footnote-marker">29</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 18.</i> what would be the ruling if the נפקד claims נאנסו, will he be believed with a שבועה? If yes, so why is he not believed with a מיגו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">30</sup><i class="footnote">See (עד"ז) in תוס' רי"ד ד"ה פיסקא.</i>

<b>נתנה לו בזמנו נשבע ונוטל—He gave it to him; in the time, he swears and takes</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא teaches of a case where there is a dispute between the owner (בעה"ב) and the worker (the אומן) as to the price of the job done by the אומן, where the בעה"ב said it was one זוז and the אומן claims two. The ruling is if the אומן returned the repaired item to the בעה"ב and is claiming his pay within the proscribed time,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">However if it is after the proscribed time for receiving payment, the rule is המוציא מחבירו עליו הראיה; the worker must bring proof as to the agreed upon wage; otherwise he receives what the employer claims.</i> the אומן is believed and he swears that the fee is two זוזים and he collects it.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">There is a general rule regarding an employer and employee in a case where the employee claims he was not paid yet for his work, and the employer claims that he paid him already, we rule in favor of the employee (if he made his claim with the allotted time for payment), for we assume that the employer is busy with all his employees and became confused, and thought that he paid this employee, when indeed he did not. The employee swears that he was not paid, and collects his full wages. Presumably the ruling in our case here is in accordance with this general rule.</i><br>-------------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר והא אמר בפרק המקבל (בבא מציעא דף קיב,ב ושם) אומן אומר שתים קצצת לי –<br>And if you will say; but in פרק המקבל</b> the ברייתא <b>states</b> regarding a case <b>where the אומן claims, ‘you fixed</b> the price for <b>me</b> at <b>two’</b> זוזים –<br><b>והלה אומר לא קצצתי לך אלא אחת המוציא מחבירו עליו הראיה דקציצה מידע ידיע –<br>And the</b> employer <b>claims, ‘I only fixed</b> the wages <b>for you at one’</b> זוז, the rule is <b>המע"ה,</b> and the אומן must prove his case; otherwise he receives only one, <b>for regarding the wage</b> the employer <b>certainly knows</b> what wage he agreed to.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there distinguishes between the case where the argument is whether the worker was paid or not (in which case the worker is believed, since בעה"ב טרוד בפועליו), and between the case where the argument is what wage was agreed upon (where the בעה"ב is believed, for קציצה מידע ידיע).</i> We have a contradictions between these two ברייתות; in our ברייתא the אומן is believed (נשבע ונוטל), and in ב"מ the בעה"ב is believed (המע"ה)!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ובפרק<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read בפרק (instead of ובפרק). This question and answer is cited here in תוספות (even though it is an explicit גמרא), in order to set up the following question in תוספות.</i> כל הנשבעין (שבועות דף מו,א ושם) פריך ליה –</b><br>The גמרא <b>in פרק כל הנשבעין asks this</b> question regarding the contradiction between the two ברייתות –<br><b>ומשני דהך דהכא כרבי יהודה דקציצה נמי לא דכיר דטרוד הוא בפועליו –<br>And answers that this</b> ברייתא <b>here</b> which believes the worker, <b>is according to ר"י</b> who maintains that the owner <b>does not even remember the</b> agreed upon <b>wage, since he is preoccupied with his workers,</b> and the ברייתא in ב"מ follows the opinion of the רבנן that קציצה מידע ידיע.<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר אם כן לאחר זמנו נמי אמאי אמר המוציא מחבירו עליו הראיה –<br>And if you will say; if</b> indeed it is <b>so,</b> that we are following the view of ר"י, so <b>even</b> if the worker is making his claim <b>after the</b> proscribed <b>time, why does</b> the ברייתא <b>rule</b> in this case that <b>המע"ה,</b> and the worker loses –<br><b>הוה לן למימר נשבע ונוטל –</b><br>The ברייתא <b>should have ruled</b> that the אומן <b>swears and takes</b> what he claims!<br>תוספות explains the logic behind his question:<br><b>דמאי טעמא אמרינן בעלמא<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to the general rule that in a dispute between the worker and owner (whether he received payment or not), if the claim was made בזמנו (see footnote # 6), the worker is believed (since בעה"ב טרוד בפועליו), however if it was made לאחר זמנו (after the proscribed time when the employer must pay the worker), the בעה"ב is believed.</i> לאחר זמנו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">זמנו (the time proscribed to pay a worker) is the next half day after he finished working; for a day worker it is the following night, and for a night worker it is the following day. Any claim made after that time is considered שלא בזמנו. See footnote # 8.</i> דאין נשבע ונוטל כדמפרש בריש כל הנשבעין<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">שבועות מה,ב.</i> –<br>For what is the reason that we say elsewhere</b> regarding a dispute between the worker and the employer; if the worker made his claim that he was not paid, <b>after the time</b> (when he needs to be paid), the rule is that <b>he cannot swear</b> that he was not paid <b>and take</b> his wages (even though there is the סברא of בעה"ב טרוד בפועליו), <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>explains in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>כל הנשבעין –<br>דחזקה דאין שכיר משהה שכרו ואין בעל הבית עובר בבל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">The תורה writes in ויקרא (קדושים) יט,יג that ולא תלין פעולת שכר אתך עד בוקר. This is referring to a day laborer that he must be paid the following night, before day break (see footnote # 6). The owner does not want to transgress this לאו, so he makes sure to pay him on time.</i> תלין<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore when a worker claims לאחר זמנו that he was not paid, so even though there is the סברא of בעה"ב טרוד בפועליו (which should support the worker’s claim), nevertheless there are two סברות that he was paid, because a) a worker does not wait to be paid, he wants his wages immediately, and b} the owner pays before זמנו is over, for otherwise he will be עובר a לאו. This is the reason why בעלמא, the worker is not believed לאחר זמנו, since his claim contradicts these two חזקות.</i> –<br>For there is a presumption that a hired</b> worker <b>will not wait</b> that long for his wages, <b>and the בעה"ב will not transgress</b> the prohibition of <b>בל תלין –<br>והכא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">It is necessary for תוספות to point this out (instead of saying that since the dispute here is whether it was one זוז or two, but not whether he was paid or not, so seemingly the whole idea of אין שכיר משהה ואין בעה"ב עובר is moot) because otherwise we can ask how can we believe the שכיר that he is owed two, since אין שכיר משהה and אין בעה"ב עובר, therefore תוספות explains that in this case it is not an argument since we see that this שכיר is משהה (and similarly this בעה"ב is עובר).</i> הרי שהה שכיר ובעל הבית עבר דמודה שקצץ לו אחת ועדיין חייב לו –<br>However here</b> (where they are not disputing whether he was paid or not, rather the dispute is the amount of wages they agreed upon), so we see <b>that the worker tarried, and the owner transgresses</b> the לאו, <b>for he admits that he agreed to one</b> זוז, <b>and he still owes it<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot say that we should not believe the worker that he was not paid (two זוז), since אין שכיר משהה, for the שכיר can rightfully claim that he is the type of שכיר that is משהה שכרו, for both agree that he did not receive his wages at all up to now (לאחר זמנו). Similarly we cannot say that the שכיר should not be believed, since he is accusing the בעה"ב of being עובר, this is not so, since the בעה"ב himself agrees that he was עובר for withholding the one זוז. Therefore we should revert back to the סברא of בעה"ב טרוד בפועליו, and award the worker his claim (נשבע ונוטל)!</i> to him</b> (לאחר זמנו) –<br>תוספות anticipates a possible solution to his question:<br><b>וליכא למימר דמיירי כגון דאמר לא קצצתי לך אלא אחת ופרעתי לך<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The owner therefore is really claiming ‘I owe you nothing’, so we can use the חזקה arguments against the שכיר, which support the בעה"ב, namely that אין שכיר משהה שכרו and אין בעה"ב עובר בל תלין. The שכיר must by lying, for he surely was paid. This would explain why the שכיר is not נשבע ונוטל. </i> –<br>And we cannot answer that we are discussing</b> a case <b>where for instance</b> the owner <b>claims, ‘I only made up</b> to pay <b>one</b> זוז, <b>and I paid you</b> the one זוז’ –<br>תוספות rejects this answer:<br><b>דאם כן בזמנו אמאי נשבע ונוטל הא כרבי יהודה מוקמי לה<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See (footnote # 4 and) previously in this תוספות (after footnote # 4).</i> ואיהו בעי הודאה במקצת<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">According to ר"י, we only say נשבע ונוטל if there is a partial admission from the בעה"ב; the שכיר claims, ‘you owe me two’ and the בעה"ב claims, ‘I owe you one’; it is a case of מודה במקצת, so instead of the owner swearing that he owes only one and swear a שבועת מודה במקצת and be פטור, the חכמים in order to appease the worker, instituted that the worker swear that he is owed two and he can collect. However if the בעה"ב is a כופר הכל (where there is no שבועה מה"ת), the חכמים never instituted this rule of נשבע ונוטל according to ר"י. </i> –<br>For if</b> indeed it is <b>so</b> that the owner claims, ‘I owe you nothing’, <b>why</b> then is the rule that if the שכיר made his claim <b>בזמנו</b> that he is <b>נשבע ונוטל, for since we established this</b> ברייתא <b>according to ר"י,</b> but <b>he requires a partial admission</b> in order to rule נשבע ונוטל –<br>תוספות anticipates another possible solution to his question:<br><b>ואין לתרץ נמי כגון שאומר אותה אחת שקצצתי לך ברשותך השהיתי דלא עבר בבל תלין<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This will (seemingly explain both cases; if it was בזמנו we rule נשבע ונוטל since the בעה"ב is a מודה במקצת (for the בעה"ב admits that he owes him the one). And when it is לא בזמנו, the שכיר loses because the בעה"ב was not עובר בל תלין in this case. תוספות original question was that the שכיר loses only if his claim implies that the בעה"ב is עובר בל תלין (which is untenable), but in this case (as we initially understood it), the בעה"ב admits that he was עובר on בל תלין. However according to this ואין לתרץ, the בעה"ב does not admit that he was עובר, it is the שכיר who claims that the בעה"ב is עובר בל תלין on the second זוז. The שכיר only agreed to wait for the wages of one זוז, not the second זוז. Regarding the second זוז, the שכיר is accusing the בעה"ב of בל תלין, therefore his claim is unacceptable. Everything is seemingly understood.</i> –<br>And we also cannot answer,</b> that we are discussing a case where <b>for instance</b> the בעה"ב <b>said, ‘this one</b> זוז <b>that I made up with you, I held it back with your permission’, so</b> the בעה"ב <b>did not</b> admit to <b>transgressing בל תלין –</b><br>תוספות rejects this answer:<br><b>דמכל מקום חזקה דאין שכיר משהה שכרו ליכא<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">In order to counteract the סברא that בעה"ב טריד בפועליו (which supports the שכיר) we require two opposing חזקות, one that אין שכיר משהה and two that אין בעה"ב עובר. In the proposed answer just given, there is the חזקה of אין בעה"ב עובר (which contradicts the claim of the שכיר [see footnote # 15]), however the second חזקה of אין שכיר משהה does not contradict the שכיר in this case, for all agree that he was משהה (at least one זוז), therefore the שכיר can claim that he is the type of שכיר that does not rush to receive his wages, so why should we not believe him, since only one חזקה opposes him but not two (see מהרש"א).</i> דהרי שיהה אחת –<br>But nevertheless the other חזקה,</b> against the שכיר, which is <b>that אין שכיר משהה, does not exist, for</b> we see that the שכיר <b>was משהה one</b> זוז –<br>תוספות rejects a possible response<br><b>ודוחק לומר דמאי דחזינן דשיהה שיהה<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">One may argue that the שוכר, who is claiming (לאחר זמנו) two, is contradicting the חזקה of אין שכיר משהה, and even though we know that he was משהה one (both agree to that), nevertheless we can argue that he was willing to forgo partial payment on time (one זוז), but we will still assume that no one is willing to forgo and wait for his entire wage (of two זוזים), so the שוכר is indeed contradicting the other חזקה as well. However, תוספות maintains that this is a דוחק, presumably because a person who can/t wait for his wages will not wait even for a partial payment, and one who is willing to wait for a partial payment will just as likely wait for the entire payment.</i> ומאי דלא חזינן<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read חזינן דשיהה לא שיהה (instead of חזינן דלא).</i> דלא שיהה לא שיהה:</b><br><b>And it is unreasonable to assume that this which we saw that he tarried</b> (the one זוז), <b>he was משהה, however this which we did not see [know] that he tarried, he was not משהה;</b> this is a דוחק.<b></b> Our תוספות does not answer the question, why is he not believed even לאחר זמנו.<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">See תוספות הרא"ש.</i><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Seemingly in the case where the שכיר claims two and the בעה"ב claims one, where the שכיר, is not contradicting the two חזקות of אין שכיר משהה and אין בעה"ב עובר, the שכיר should always be נשבע ונוטל even אחר זמנו (according to ר"י).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>We are saying that a שכיר should not be believed, when by his claim he is accusing the בעה"ב of transgressing the לאו of בל תלין. Why don’t we rather say that the שכיר should not be believed because by his claim of שתים קצצת לי he is accusing the בעה"ב of transgressing the לאו of לא תעשוק; he is robbing the שכיר of his wages?!

Line 9

<b>אי דאיכא עדים ליחזי עדים מאי קאמרי—If there are witnesses, let us see what the witnesses say</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה נתנה.</i><br>רבא cited a ברייתא in support of רבה (against<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">אביי maintains that the אומן is believed only if לא ראה, but not by ראה, regardless whether there were עדים or not.</i> אביי) that an אומן has a חזקה if there were no עדים when the item was given to him,<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The אומן is believed with a מיגו of להד"ם. See תוס' מה,א ד"ה אבל, that להד"ם here means that ‘I never received this item בתורת אומנות’..</i> even if ראה.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">ראה means that there are witnesses who saw the item by the אומן, at the time of the דין תורה.</i> The ברייתא rules that the אומן is believed in a case where there is a dispute between the אומן and the בעה"ב, what was the price they agreed upon for this job. רבא asked if there were עדים present when the בעה"ב gave the item to the אומן, we should ask the עדים what was the agrees upon price. This would indicate that there were no עדים at the transfer, and therefore the אומן is believed (even if ראה).<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות explains the question of 'אי דאיכא עדים וכו':<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly what is the question; perhaps there were עדים by the transfer, but they do not know the price.</i><br><b>דודאי ידעי הקציצה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See תוס' מה,א ד"ה אבל (TIE footnote # 16, 17).</i> דרגילות הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably the עדים were brought to witness the transaction, so they were told the details; the price, etc.</i> –<br>For</b> the עדים <b>certainly know the price for this is what is common –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו יצחק דעדיפא מינה הוה ליה למיפרך<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 16.</i> –<br>The ר"י is astounded!</b> רבא <b>should have asked even better –<br>דאי איכא עדים וראה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> דאכתי לא מסיק אדעתיה לאוקמה בלא ראה<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">It is only when we refute the proof of רבא (on מו,א) that אביי establishes the ברייתא by לא ראה, however initially in the proof of רבא, we assume that the ברייתא is in a case of ראה.</i> –<br>‘for if there are עדים</b> who witnessed the transaction <b>and</b> also <b>ראה’; (</b>תוספות explains why we assume that there were עדים and ראה) <b>for as of yet it did not enter our minds to establish</b> the<b></b> ברייתא in a case of <b>לא ראה –<br>אם כן אמאי מהימן אומן שהטלית<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read כשהטלית (instead of שהטלית)</i> בידו<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות question is why does רבא ask אי דאיכא עדים let us ask them how much was the קציצה, when there is a stronger question; for אי דאיכא עדים and ראה, how can the ברייתא state that the אומן is מהימן; the אומן cannot verify his claim and he also has no מיגו (there is no need to ask the עדים)?</i> –<br>‘If</b> indeed it is <b>so’</b> (that איכא עדים וראה) – the question should continue – ‘<b>why is the אומן believed when the garment is in his possession’ –<br>והכי הוה ליה למימר בשלמא לרב' מוקי לה בדליכא עדים דמהימן לרבא<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read לרבה (instead of לרבא).</i> במיגו<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> –<br>And this is what</b> רבא <b>should have said; it is understandable according to רבה, who will establish this</b> ברייתא <b>in</b> a case where <b>there are no עדים</b> by the transaction, in which case the אומן <b>is believed according to</b> (רבא) <b>[רבה] with a מיגו</b> of להד"ם (even if ראה) –<br><b>אלא לאביי<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 2.</i> במאי מוקי לה<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">The advantage of the way תוספות presents the proof, over the way the גמרא presents it, is that according to the גמרא, we could possibly answer that there were עדים, but nevertheless we cannot ask them because perhaps the עדים do not know the price; however the manner in which תוספות presents the question, the knowledge of the עדים is irrelevant. It is obvious that where ליכא עדים ולא ראה that</b> the אומן <b>is believed, and there is no novelty at all</b> in such a ruling –<br><b>אלא ודאי איירי בראה ואפילו הכי אומן מהימן<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The אומן has a מיגו of להד"ם; meaning that ‘I never received it from you בתורת אומנות’ (see footnote # 3).</i> –<br>Rather</b> the ברייתא <b>is certainly discussing a case of ראה</b> (and ליכא עדים), <b>and nevertheless the אומן is מהימן;</b> proving רבה correct and disproving אביי –<br>תוספות continues with the explanation of the גמרא:<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">How does אביי answer this question by merely saying it is a case of לא ראה; but what is the חידוש?!</i><br><b>ומשני לעולם בדליכא עדים ולא ראה ולא תני לרישא לשום חידוש –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>answers</b> on behalf of אביי, <b>that</b> really <b>there are no עדים and it was לא ראה, and</b> indeed the ברייתא <b>did not teach us any חידוש in the רישא,</b> as רבא asked –<br><b>אלא משום סיפא דבעי לאשמועינן דינא בנתנה לו –<br>Rather</b> the reason the ברייתא mentions the רישא, is <b>because he wanted to inform us the ruling in the סיפא</b> in the case where the אומן <b>gave back</b> the item <b>to</b> the בעה"ב (where there is the distinction between בזמנו and שלא בזמנו), therefore –<br><b>תנא נמי רישא כל זמן שהטלית ביד אומן אף על גב דפשיטא היא<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">The רישא sort of ‘sets the stage’ for the סיפא; as long as the אומן has it he is believed (by ליכא עדים ולא ראה; which is obvious), however once he returns it to the owner, there is a difference between בזמנו and שלא בזמנו</i> –</b><br>The ברייתא <b>also taught us the רישא</b> regarding the ruling that <b>as long as the garment is in the possession of the אומן,</b> he is believed, <b>even though this is obvious</b> since ליכא עדים ולא ראה.<b></b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>ואין להקשות במאי דמשני אביי אמאי נקט בסיפא נתנה לו –</b><br><b>And</b> regarding how the גמרא <b>answered on behalf of אביי</b> (that the רישא is in a case of ליכא עדים ולא ראה), <b>one cannot ask, why does the סיפא mention</b> a case where the אומן <b>gave it back to</b> the בעה"ב –<br><b>הוה ליה למיתני ראהו בידו אף על פי שהטלית ביד אומן<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">The רישא is in a case where the טלית is ביד האומן and he is believed (since לא ראה), the contrast (where the אומן is not believed) should also be in a case where the item is ביד אומן (and ראה), why make the contrast in a new case where נתנה לו?! See ‘Thinking it over’ # 2. However, according to רבה there can be no question, for the רישא is discussing a case of ראה and the אומן is believed. The contrast is only by נתנה לו.</i> –</b><br>The ברייתא <b>should have taught</b> a case where <b>it was seen in the</b> sאומן' <b>possession,</b> so <b>even though the טלית is in the sאומן' possession</b> the אומן is not believed –<br>תוספות responds that this is not a difficulty:<br><b>דהא לא נחת תנא מידי בדינא דראה<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות explained previously that according to אביי there is no חידוש in the רישא of the משנה (that by לא ראה וליכא עדים the אומן is believed), rather the תנא wanted to teach us the סיפא, the difference by נתנה לו whether it was בזמנו or לאחר זמנו (and the רישא was merely like an ‘introduction’ to the סיפא), therefore there can be no question why not mention ראה, for this was not the purpose or intention of the תנא. </i> –<br>For the תנא is not interested in teaching us anything about the rules of ראה –<br>ולהכי קתני נתנה לו והוא הדין דראה נמי כנתנה דמי<sup class="footnote-marker">24</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is adding (to reduce further the question posed by the ואין להקשות) that once we know the ruling by נתנה לו, we also know the ruling by ראה, since ראה is the equivalent of נתנה; it can no longer be considered ברשות האומן, once it is ראה, since he must return it to the בעה"ב.</i> שהיה<sup class="footnote-marker">25</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to read שהרי (instead of שהיה).</i> צריך ליתנה לו על כרחו:</b><br><b>So therefore</b> the ברייתא <b>taught נתנה לו</b> (which is what he wishes to teach us)<b>, and</b> it is self-understood that <b>the same ruling applies to ראה as well,</b> for ראה <b>is like נתנה,</b> for once it is ראה, the אומן <b>is required to return it to him</b> even <b>against his will.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The thrust of sרבא' question is that there is no חידוש in the רישא according to אביי.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. What changed in our understanding of sרבא' proof/challenge, from the way it was understood in תוספות question, to how it is understood in תוספות answer?<br>2. תוספות writes that ואין להקשות why the ברייתא does not teach concerning ראה;<sup class="footnote-marker">26</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 22.</i> what is the question; why should the תנא state the ruling of ראה (where there can be no difference between בזמנו and שלא בזמנו),<sup class="footnote-marker">27</sup><i class="footnote">When it is in the possession of the אומן (even if he finished the work and told the owner to pick it up), it is always considered בזמנו; the בעה"ב is not עובר on בל תלין.</i> rather than the ruling of נתנה לו where he differentiates between בזמנו and שלא בזמנו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">28</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>

Line 1

<b>אלא לאו דליכא עדים—Rather, is it not where there are no witnesses</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the two previous תוס' on מה,ב ד"ה נתנה וד"ה אי.</i><br>רבא is attempting to prove that [the רישא of] the ברייתא is in a case of ליכא עדים.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">ליכא עדים means that there are no witnesses who saw the בעה"ב give the item to the אומן (to repair).</i> Therefore the entire ברייתא is בדליכא עדים even the cases of נתנה לו. Our תוספות explains why there is no contradiction from another גמרא.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>הקשה רבינו יצחק בן מאיר דהיכי מצי לאורויי בדליכא עדים –<br>The ריב"ם had a difficulty; for how is it possible to understand</b> the ברייתא <b>in a case of ליכא עדים</b> (and we say that by נתנה לו בזמנו the אומן is נשבע ונוטל) –<br><b>אם כן אמאי בזמנו נשבע ונוטל הא אמרינן בריש כל הנשבעין (שבועות דף מה,ב ושם) –</b><br>For <b>if</b> indeed this is <b>so</b> (that it was given שלא בעדים), <b>why</b> is the ruling that if the אומן claimed his payment <b>בזמנו,</b> the אומן is <b>נשבע ונוטל, but</b> the גמרא <b>taught in the beginning of</b> פרק <b>כל הנשבעין –<br>דאם שכרו שלא בעדים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is in a case where the שכיר demands payment and the בעה"ב claims that he paid him. The rule generally is that the שכיר is נשבע ונוטל (since the בעה"ב is טרוד בפועליו so he is confused). </i> מתוך שיכול לומר לא שכרתיך מעולם –<br>That if</b> the בעה"ב <b>hired</b> the אומן <b>without עדים,</b> the rule is <b>that since</b> the בעה"ב <b>can claim, ‘I never hired you’</b> so I do not owe you anything –<br><b>יכול לומר לו שכרתיך ונתתי לך שכרך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">Seemingly here too the בעה"ב should be believed that the price was one (not two as the אומן claims), since he has a מיגו that he never hired him and he owes him nothing,</i> –</b><br>The בעה"ב <b>can also tell</b> the אומן, ‘<b>I hired you and I paid you!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ואומר רבינו יצחק דלא קשה מידי דחדא דפלוגתא היא התם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states, מכלל דפליג ריש לקיש (עיי"ש). See (also) נחלת משה.</i> –<br>And the ר"י says that there is no difficulty at all; firstly that this</b> ruling <b>is in dispute there</b> in שבועות where others (may) disagree –<br><b>ועוד דהכא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">In our case here they are arguing how much was the price, as opposed to the גמרא in שבועות where they are arguing whether the שכיר was paid or not; only there is there this מיגו of להד"ם, but not here as תוספות explains.</i> ליכא האי מיגו כיון שמודה במקצת<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The אומן claims, ‘you owe me two’, and the בעה"ב admits partially that he owes only one. This is the classic case of מודה במקצת where the rule is that the מודה במקצת is חייב a שבועה דאורייתא.</i> –<br>And additionally here this מיגו</b> (of לא שכרתיך) <b>does not apply, since</b> the בעה"ב <b>admits partially –<br>ואי אמר לא שכרתיך מעולם הוי כופר בכל וחזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See ב"מ ג,א. Every מודה במקצת (seemingly) has a מיגו of being a כופר הכל, who is פטור from a שבועה, so why is a מוב"מ obligated to swear; let us believe him with a מיגו that he could have been כופר הכל. The answer is that there is no מיגו, for a person who is a מוב"מ is not brazen enough to be כופר הכל in the presence of his creditor. Here too the בעה"ב is a מוב"מ (see footnote # 7), he does not have the מיגו of claiming I never hired you, for that makes him a כופר הכל, and we just said that every מוב"מ does not have the העזה to be כוה"כ; therefore there is no מיגו! See ‘Thinking it over’. However in מס' שבועות, where the owner claims ‘I paid you’ (meaning he is a כופר הכל), is he believed with the מיגו of לא שכרתיך, for both in his claim and in his מיגו he is a כוה"כ (he is מעיז in either case). It is only a מוב"מ (who is not מעיז כ"כ) that is not believed with a מיגו of כוה"כ (where he is מעיז כ"כ).</i> דאין אדם מעיז פניו בפני בעל חובו:</b><br><b>And if the</b> בעה"ב <b>would claim, ‘I never hired you’, he would be considered a כופר הכל (a complete denier), and there is the חזקה (presumption) that a person is not brazen</b> (enough to deny completely) <b>in the presence of his creditor.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Not everyone (necessarily) agrees that a בעה"ב has the מיגו of לא שכרתיך, and certainly not in our case where he is a מודה במקצת.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The idea that a מוב"מ has no מיגו of כוה"כ is very well known. What was תוספות question in the first place, and why was it necessary for תוספות to offer another answer [first]?!

<b>אי דאיכא עדים אחר אמאי יש לו חזקה—If there are witnesses why does ‘another’ have a <i>Chazokoh</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא is attempting to ascertain under which circumstances does the משנה rule that an אומן has no חזקה, however a non-אומן, has a חזקה. It cannot be in a case where there were witnesses who saw that the item was transferred to the recipient (with the intention of returning it to the owner), for in that case why does the ‘other’ (non-אומן) have a חזקה. Our תוספות further clarifies this case.<br>-------------------------<br><b>ונראה דבראה<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">ראה means that עדים saw the item by the אומן at the time of the די"ת.</i> מיירי דאי בלא ראה אומן נמי יש לו חזקה –<br>And it appears</b> to תוספות that this case of איכא עדים which the גמרא rejects (as the case where אומן אין לו חזקה, but אחר יש לו חזקה) <b>is in a situation of ראה, for if</b> it is in a situation where <b>לא ראה, so an אומן would also have a חזקה</b> and be believed with a –<br><b>מיגו דאי בעי אמר החזרתיו לך דאין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא concluded previously on מה,ב that even רבה agrees that המפקיד אצל חבירו בעדים אין צריך להחזיר לו בעדים. Therefore he would be exempt from returning it (or its value) if he would have claimed החזרתיו לך.</i> אלא ודאי בראה מיירי –<br>מיגו that he could have claimed, ‘I returned it to you’, for it is not necessary to return</b> the item <b>in</b> the presence <b>of עדים, so certainly it is a case of ראה –<br>אם כן אחר אמאי יש לו חזקה כיון דאיכא עדים דבתורת פקדון בא לידו –<br>So therefore</b> the גמרא asks (if there are עדים [and ראה]) <b>why would another</b> (a non-אומן) <b>have a חזקה, since there are עדים that it come into his possession as a פקדון</b> (so he cannot claim that he bought it from him initially) –<br><b>ולא מצי למיטען נמי החזרתי לך שהרי ראה –<br>And</b> the אחר <b>also cannot claim, ‘I returned it to you’, since it is ראה.</b> Therefore concludes the גמרא it must be in a case where ליכא עדים וראה where an אומן אין לו חזקה, however אחר יש לו חזקה.<b><br>ופירוש רבינו תם<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i> נראה לרבינו יצחק מאד רחוק על כן לא כתבתיו:</b><br><b>And it appears to the ר"י that the sר"ת' explanation is very far-fetched, so therefore</b> תוספות <b>did not write</b> the פר"ת.<b></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>When the גמרא asks אי דאיכא עדים is means איכא עדים וראה.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Did our תוספות add anything to the פי' רשב"ם (in the (ד"ה אי דאיכא?

<b>וכי אין אדם עשוי לומר לאומן מכור לי טליתי—And is it then so<br>that it is unusual to tell a craftsman, ‘sell my garment for me’</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא rules that if ראובן gave his טלית to an אומן (for repair) and the אומן returned to ראובן the טלית of שמעון, he may use the טלית until his טלית is returned to him. However if ראובן took sשמעון' <i>Talis </i>by mistake in the בית האבל, he may not use it. רב חייא explained the reason he may use it when the אומן mixed them up is because it often happens that someone tells the אומן that he should sell his garment on his behalf. תוספות clarifies this explanation.<br>----------------------------------<br><b>וטעה אומן ומכר את של זה –<br>And the אומן made a mistake and sold</b> the טלית of ראובן (who gave it to him to repair), instead of selling the טלית of שמעון (who asked him to sell it for him) –<br><b>שהיה סבור למכור את של חבירו ונתן לו את של חבירו תחתיו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore since it is customary to have the אומן sell a garment for you, we can assume that שמעון asked the אומן to sell his טלית, so when ראובן is using sשמעון' garment, שמעון does not mind, for he assumes his טלית has been sold (and all he is interested in is getting paid by the אומן). See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –</b><br><b>For</b> the אומן <b>was planning on selling</b> sשמעון' garment <b>and instead he gave</b> the buyer sראובן' garment –<br><b>אבל אם לא היה עשוי לומר לאומן למכור –<br>However if it were not customary to ask the אומן to sell</b> on your behalf –<br><b>לא היה מותר מחמת שטעה אומן ונתן את שלו לחבירו<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The logic of this (rejected) סברא is that in this case also, שמעון would not mind, since he is receiving sראובן' garment in exchange. So it is just like the אומן sold it, and instead of receiving money for the sale, he is receiving sראובן' garment as payment. Presumably the garments are (somewhat) similar (which caused the mix-up in the first place).</i> –<br>It would not be permitted</b> for ראובן to use sשמעון' garment <b>because the אומן made a mistake and gave</b> sראובן' garment <b>to</b> שמעון (and sשמעון' garment to ראובן) –<br><b>דהוי כנתחלפו לו בבית האבל או בבית המשתה –<br>For</b> then it is <b>like</b> the case where his garments <b>got mixed up in a mourner’s house or at a party house –<br>וסופו שיחזיר חבירו את שלו לאומן ויחזור ויתבע<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">It seems the criteria whether one may use the other טלית is dependent on whether the owner will want it back or not. In the case of the אומן, the owner does not expect to receive his טלית back, for he assumes it was sold; therefore the other party may use it. However by the בית המשתה, the owner realizes that there was a mix-up and wants his טלית back; therefore it is אסור for the other party to use it.</i> ממנו טליתו:</b><br><b>Where eventually</b> שמעון <b>will return</b> sראובן' garment <b>to the אומן and will come back and demand from</b> the אומן <b>his</b> (sשמעון') garment.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The issue is whether the original owner will be demanding his טלית back.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The rule by an אומן is that ראובן may use sשמעון' garment, since the אומן mistakenly sold sראובן' garment.<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1.</i> However what will happen if the buyer is unhappy with the sale and will return the garment; it will then turn out that ראובן used sשמעון' garment, even though it was not sold (and שמעון will want it back)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See רא"ש.</i>

<b>הא אית לי סהדי דחזיוה גבך—But I have witnesses who saw it by you</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא relates about the swindlers of פומבדיתא, that when a customer would approach a tailor and ask him for his garment, the tailor would respond להד"ם. The customer would say, ‘but I have witnesses who saw it by you’, the אומן would respond, ‘that is a different garment’. The אומן would not be willing to present the customer the garment in question for identification. The difficulty with this story is if the עדים positively identified the garment as belonging to the owner, how can the אומן be allowed to retain the garment; there are עדים?!<br>--------------------------------<br><b>פירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The term 'פירש' indicates that the explanation of the גמרא is (somewhat) different than what we may have assumed. Here, ‘הא אית ליה סהדי’, does not mean the עדים have positively identified it.</i> טלית שהיו בו סימנים כעין שלי –<br>The explanation</b> of the customer’s statement, הא אית לי סהדי דחזיוה גבך, is that the עדים saw <b>a garment that had identifying</b> marks <b>similar to my</b> garment –<br><b>ולא שהיה להם טביעות עין<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">טביעות עין means when someone recognizes an object by merely looking at it and knowing with a certainty to whom the object belongs, even though it would be difficult for him to describe what are the specific signs that makes him sure of his observation; it is like recognizing your black hat among many others. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> שהיו מכירים<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Had the witnesses recognized it with a certainty that it belonged to him, the אומן would be obligated to return it to him, since the sאומן' claim of להד"ם has been refuted by the עדים.</i> שהיא שלו:</b><br><b>However,</b> the עדים <b>did not have a טביעות עין that they were able to recognize</b> positively <b>that it belongs to him</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The עדים could not substantiate beyond a doubt that it belonged to the customer.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why is it that תוספות begins with discussing סימנים (that there were 'סימנים כעין שלי'), and תוספות concludes with 'טביעות עין'; why did not תוספות conclude with סימנים as well (like ולא שהיו להם סימנים מובהקים or סימנים ברורים, וכיו"ב)?!

<b>שפיר קאמר ליה—He responded to him properly</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview’ to the previous תוס' ד"ה הא.</i><br>רבא told אביי that the craftsman שפיר קאמר ליה, he responded effectively to the customer. תוספות explains, which response רבא is referring to.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>דלא משוי ראה מאי טעמא דראה תניא<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Others maintain that this is תוספות גירסא in our גמרא and this line דלא...תניא, is part of the heading of this תוספות.</i> –</b><br>The אומן responded properly so <b>that he did not make</b> this a situation of <b>ראה; what is the reason</b> that he was שפיר, <b>because the ברייתא states ראה –</b><br>תוספת asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דמאי בעי למימר –<br>The רשב"א is astounded, for what did</b> רבא <b>mean to say</b> when he said that the אומן was שפיר קאמר ליה; which statement of the אומן was רבא referring to –<br><b>אי בעי למימר שפיר קאמר דלא משוי ליה ראה דלא בעי לאפוקי דנחזייה<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is seemingly the understanding of the רשב"ם בד"ה איברא וד"ה שפיר; that רבא is referring to the response of the אומן that 'איברא לא מפיקנא ליה'; ‘I’m not going to show it’. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>If</b> רבא <b>meant to say</b> that the אומן <b>responded properly in order not to make it</b> a case of <b>ראה</b>, <b>by not agreeing to bring it out so it could be seen;</b> if indeed this is what רבא was referring to <b>–<br>דמה צריך למימר עלה ראה תניא<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא (on מה,ב) of ראה is in a case where the אומן claims ‘I bought it from you’, in which case if it was ראה (we see the item in the possession of the אומן) he is not believed for אומן אין לו חזקה, we assume it was given to him to repair the item; it was not sold to him. </i> –<br>So why was it necessary</b> for רבא <b>to comment on this</b> statement of the אומן that he is correct since <b>ראה תניא;</b> it is not necessary to use this proof and comment –<br><b>פשיטא דאי מפיק ליה ויכירוה שהיא שלו דחייב להחזיר –<br>It is obvious</b> that the אומן was ‘smart’ in not willing to show the item, <b>for if he would bring it out and</b> the עדים <b>would recognize that it belongs to the customer, that the</b> אומן <b>would be obligated to return it</b> to the customer –<br><b>שהרי כפר ואמר לא היו דברים מעולם<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Presumably this ruling would apply even to a non-אומן who claimed להד"ם, and the item was found by him. Therefore there is no need to refer to the ברייתא of ראה; it is self-understood that the אומן was ‘smart’ by refusing to show the item.</i> –<br>Since</b> the אומן <b>denied</b> having the item <b>and he claimed להד"ם,</b> so he is completely refuted by the עדים!<br>תוספות offers his explanation:<br><b>ונראה לו לפרש הכי שפיר קאמר כלומר שטוען טענה זו לא היו דברים מעולם –<br>And the</b> רשב"א <b>prefers to explain it thus;</b> רבא said that the craftsman <b>'שפיר קאמר', referring to his</b> original <b>response where he claimed להד"ם –<br>דעל ידי כך לא משוי ליה ראה הואיל ולעדים לא היה בה טביעות עין ויכול לומר אחר היה –<br>So that through this</b> claim of להד"ם, <b>he did not allow this</b> case to be considered <b>ראה,<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">We cannot deal with him as an אומן (where the rule of ראה applies), since he claims להד"ם, and he is believed like anyone else, unless he is proved wrong.</i> since the עדים did not</b> fully <b>recognize</b> the item, <b>so he could then claim, ‘it was another</b> garment; this is only because he initially claimed להד"ם –<br><b>אבל אי הוה טעין לקוח הוא בידי לא היה נאמן –<br>However if he would have claimed</b> initially, <b>‘I bought it’, he would not be believed –<br>דאין לו עוד מיגו דאי בעי אמר החזרתיו לך או לא היו דברים מעולם דירא לומר כן<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">A מיגו is effective when the claimant could have claimed the מיגו with the same ease as he is claiming his actual claim. Here however it is easier for him to claim לקוח where the עדים cannot contradict him, than claiming either החזרתי or להד"ם where the עדים contradict him. This is not a valid מיגו.</i> –<br>For he no longer has the מיגו that he could have said, ‘I returned it to you’, or</b> he could have said <b>להד"ם,</b> these מיגו<b></b> are no longer an option for him, <b>since he is afraid to make</b> any of <b>these</b> two מיגו claims; the reason he is afraid, is –<br><b>הואיל ויש עדים שראו טלית כאותו שהוא שלו בידו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">It is apparent from תוספות (who states that he cannot claim החזרתיו since there are עדים) that עדים are testifying that they saw the item in the sאומן' possession, very recently (or currently) that it is impossible for him to claim החזרתיו after they saw it. [The רשב"ם may not interpret the case in this manner.]</i> –<br>Since there are witnesses who saw a טלית, in his possession similar to the</b> customer’s טלית –<br><b>והשתא אתי שפיר דקאמר מאי טעמא ראה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The emphasis is on the word ראה, which means, ‘he saw it’, but not necessarily that we completely sure that it is his; he ‘merely’ saw it.</i> תניא –<br>And now it is properly understood</b> this which רבא <b>said, ‘what is the reason</b> why שפיר קאמר, it is because <b>ראה תניא –<br>כלומר אף על פי שאינה ראיה גמורה של טביעות עין אלא שהיו בה סימנין כמו שלו –</b><br>The word ראה in the ברייתא <b>means, even though it is not a perfect seeing of a טביעות עין, but rather it had signs similar to his</b> garment; that is also considered ראה –<br><b>דראה דקתני בברייתא משמע ליה בכל ענין ראיה (גמורה) אינו נאמן לומר לקוח הוא בידי:</b><br><b>For it seems to</b> רבא <b>that the ראה in the ברייתא</b> means that by <b>any type of ראה the</b> אומן <b>is not believed to claim, ‘I bought it’.<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">He is not believed to claim לקוח, because he has no מיגו of החזרתי or להד"ם, since he is afraid to claim that since he is concerned that the עדים are contradicting him.</i></b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The שפיר קאמר ליה is referring to his claim of להד"ם, for if he would have claimed לקוח, he would have no מיגו, since he is concerned about the minimal ראיה of the עדים. The meaning of ראה תניא is that a minimal ראיה is sufficient.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What are the relative advantages of פי' רשב"ם,<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 3.</i> and פי' רשב"א?

<b>שלח ליה רב נחמן בר רב חסדא לרב נחמן בר יעקב</b><b>—רנב"ח sent to רנב"י</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>Our תוספות discusses who is רב נחמן; mentioned many times in ש"ס<br>----------------------------------<br><b>רב נחמן סתם שבכל גמרא הוא רב נחמן בר יעקב –<br>In the entire גמרא</b> when <b>ר"נ</b> is mentioned <b>סתם</b> (without a father’s name), <b>it is ר"נ בר יעקב</b> (not רב נחמן בר יצחק) –<br>תוספות proves this:<br><b>תדע דבכל הגמרא לא תמצא רב נחמן בר יעקב נזכר שמו ושם אביו –<br>You know</b> that this is so, <b>for in the entire גמרא you will not find</b> regarding <b>ר"נ בר יעקב</b> that <b>his name and his father’s name are mentioned –<br>אלא אם כן יש רב נחמן אחר אצלו כי הכא<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">When we are citing only ר"נ בר יעקב and no other ר"נ, the גמרא writes ר"נ סתם, without mentioning his father, however when there is another ר"נ (like here in our גמרא where רנב"ח is mentioned), so in order to differentiate between the two sר"נ', the גמרא writes ר"נ בר יעקב (who is generally referred to as plain ר"נ). [However this does not mean that whenever another ר"נ is mentioned the גמרא will always state ר"נ בר יעקב (for this approach may present many difficulties), rather בר יעקב in only mentioned when there is another ר"נ, and never by ר"נ alone, however it is possible that another ר"נ is mentioned and nevertheless it still states ר"נ סתם. See (מהר"ם and) נחלת משה.]</i> –<br>Unless there is another ר"נ</b> mentioned <b>nearby, like here</b> where רנב"ח is mentioned together with ר"נ בר יעקב –<br>An additional proof:<br><b>ובירושלמי פליגי בכל מקום רב נחמן בר יעקב<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">In ירושלמי we do mention the father of ר"נ even when no other ר"נ is mentioned.</i> ורב ששת –<br>And in</b> the תלמוד <b>ירושלמי it is ר"נ בר יעקב and רב ששת who are always arguing –<br>משמע דהוא רב נחמן סתם דהוא בר פלוגתיה דרב ששת בגמרא שלנו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See for instance גיטין לב,ב two מחלוקת between ר"נ and ר"ש.</i> –<br>Indicating that</b> רנב"י is <b>ר"נ סתם</b> for ר"נ <b>is the</b> usual <b>opponent of ר"ש in our</b> תלמוד בבלי –<br>תוספות negates פרש"י:<br><b>ולא כמו שמשמע מתוך פירוש הקונטרס בסוף פרק כל הגט (גיטין דף לא,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל אנא) –<br>And it is not as it seems from פרש"י in the end of פרק כל הגט –<br>דרב נחמן בר יצחק הוה חתניה דבי נשיאה –<br>That ר"נ בר יצחק was the son-in-law of the נשיא</b> (the ריש גלותא) –<br><b>דהיינו רב נחמן סתם כדמוכח בהעור והרוטב (חולין דף קכד,א) –<br>For</b> the חתניה דבי נשיאה <b>was ר"נ סתם as is evident<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there states, ומשום דרב נחמן חתניה דבי נשיאה הוא וכו'. </i> in<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">According to רש"י the חתנא דבי נשיאה was ר"נ בר יצחק, but תוס' disagrees, for ר"נ סתם was the חדב"נ and ר"נ סתם is ר"נ בר יעקב, not ר"נ בר יצחק. </i></b> פרק <b>העור והרוטב –</b><br>תוספות offers additional proof the ר"נ סתם is ר"נ בר יעקב:<br><b>ועוד דאמרינן בהשולח (גיטין דף לט,ב) אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק אנא אמינא [אין] הלכה –<br>And additionally the</b> גמרא <b>states in</b> פרק <b>השולח</b> that <b>ר"נ בר יצחק stated, ‘I said the הלכה is not</b> like ר' שמעון –<br><b>ורבנן דאתו ממחוזא אמרי משמיה דרב נחמן הלכה –<br>And the רבנן who came from מחוזא said in the name of ר"נ, the הלכה</b> is like ר"ש’ –<br><b>אלמא רב נחמן סתם לאו היינו רב נחמן בר יצחק –<br>It is evident that ר"נ סתם is not the same as ר"נ בר יצחק –<br>ובפרק מי שהוציאוהו (עירובין דף מג,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל יתיב) אמר –</b><br><b>And</b> the גמרא <b>states in פרק מי שהוציאוהו –<br>יתיב רב נחמן בר יצחק אחורי דרבא ויתיב רבא קמיה דרב נחמן –<br>ר"נ בר יצחק was sitting behind רבא, and רבא was sitting in front of ר"נ;</b> this again proves that ר"נ בר יצחק is not ר"נ סתם –<br><b>וכן בכמה מקומות אמר רבא אמר רב נחמן –<br>And similarly in many places</b> it says in the גמרא that <b>אמר רבא אמר ר"נ –<br>ורב נחמן בר יצחק הוה תלמידיה דרבא<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">It is therefore unlikely that רבא should quote so many הלכות in the name of his student ר"נ בר יצחק. Therefore we must conclude when it says אמר רבא אמר ר"נ it refers to ר"נ בר יעקב.</i> כדמשמע<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה that he does not know how it is משמע there that ר"נ בר יצחק was a student of רבא.</i> בלא יחפור (לעיל דף כב,א) ואין להאריך :</b><br><b>But ר"נ בר יצחק was a student of רבא, as it seems in פרק לא יחפור, and there is no</b> need <b>to elaborate</b> further on this matter –<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>ר"נ סתם is ר"נ בר יעקב (not ר"נ בר יצחק).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The גמרא in קידושין לג,א states; <b>רב נחמן</b> משדר גוזאי<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">See רש"י there ד"ה ר"נ that he would send his servants (from the ריש גלותא) to assist elderly gentiles, עיי"ש. </i> אמר אי לאו תורה כמה נחמן בר <b>אבא</b> איכא בשוקא. It would seem from that גמרא that ר"נ סתם is ר"נ בר <b>אבא</b>, not like תוספות surmises here!

Line 7

<b>הא דאית ליה פירא בארעא—Here there is fruit on the land</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא reconciled two contradictory statements whether an אריס (sharecropper) can testify on behalf of the property owner, or not; by saying one case is where there is fruit on the land and the other is where there is no fruit on the land. תוספות explains this distinction.<br>-------------------------------<br><b>לא יעיד דנוגע בעדות<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The אריס has an interest that the initial owner (the one who hired him to be an אריס) to retain the field, but not the one who is contesting the ownership (the מערער).</i> הוא לפי שהיה נותן לו למחצה לשליש ולרביע<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">If the owner will win the case and retain the field he will pay the אריס with either half, a third, or a fourth of the produce for the work he did (according to what was agreed upon).</i> –</b><br>An אריס <b>cannot testify</b> that the land belongs to the owner<b></b> (his employer), where there is fruit (produce) on the land, for <b>he has a vested</b> interest <b>in his testimony, since the owner would give him a half, a third, or a quarter</b> of the produce –<br><b>ואם יזכה המערער הרי שלא ברשותו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The אריס was hired by the initial owner, not by the מערער; therefore if it turns out that the field was owned by the מערער, the אריס had no right to work this field. </i> ירד וידו על התחתונה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The rule of ידו על התחתונה (by a יורד שלא ברשות) is that the owner pay the worker the lesser of the two; either the expense, or the improvement. If the expense is less than the improvement, the worker receives only his expense; certainly not מחצה וכו' of the produce. [See (however) ‘Thinking it over’.] Therefore the אריס is prejudiced for the owner and is not an unbiased עד.</i> –<br>However if the מערער</b> (the one who is contesting the ownership of the field) <b>will win</b> the case, the אריס will not get paid that amount, <b>for</b> it is a case <b>where</b> the אריס <b>entered the property</b> to improve it <b>without permission</b> (from the real owner [the מערער]) so the rule is <b>he has the ‘underhand’</b> (which is much less than למחצה לשליש ולרביע –<br><b>אבל לית ליה פירא בארעא לא חייש אם יסלקוהו דכמה שדות ימצא באריסות:</b><br><b>However if there is no produce on the land,</b> the אריס may testify on behalf of his employer, even though he may lose his job if the מערער wins the case, nevertheless <b>he is not concerned</b> that <b>perhaps</b> the מערער <b>will remove him</b> from his job, <b>for the</b> אריס <b>can find</b> <b>many fields, which to sharecrop.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The מערער will pay the אריס much less than the owner. There is no shortage of אריסות opportunities.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>The rule<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 4.</i> that היורד שלא ברשות is ידו על התחתונה is only in case where he planted trees in a field which is אינה עשויה ליטע, however if he worked the field in the manner that it needs, the rule is שמין אותו כאריסי העיר, so seemingly he will receive the same amount, no matter who turns out to be the owner.<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה בגמ' ד"ה הא.</i>
