Line 9



Line 10

<b>לוקח ראשון מעיד ללוקח שני והוא דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי אבל<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">These words, אבל...יעיד, do not appear in the text of our גמרות.</i> לית ליה ארעא אחריתי לא יעיד—The first buyer may testify for the second buyer, provided that he has other land, however if he has no other land he may not testify</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא states that if ראובן (seller) sold one field to לוי (the לוקח ראשון) and then ראובן sold another field to יהודה (the לוקח שני), the rule is that if שמעון (the מערער) comes and contests the ownership of sיהודה' field (which he bought from ראובן), the לוקח ראשון (לוי) may testify on behalf of the לוקח שני (which is יהודה), provided that either ראובן or יהודה have another field; otherwise, לוי may not testify for יהודה. There is a dispute between the רשב"ם and תוספות how to explain this ברייתא.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>פירש הקונטרס<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">רשב"ם בד"ה לוקח.</i> משום דחייש שמא יבא בעל חובו ויטרוף ממנו –<br>The רשב"ם explained</b> the reason the לוקח ראשון cannot testify for the לוקח שני, if לית ליה ארעא אחריתי is because לוי is biased and wants the property to remain by יהודה (the לוקח שני), <b>since</b> לוי (the לוקח ראשון) <b>is concerned perhaps</b> sראובן' <b>creditor (</b>שמעון) <b>will come and collect from</b> לוי –<br><b>ולא יהא לו ממה לגבות מן המוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that the two fields of לוי and יהודה are each worth $100. לוי is concerned perhaps ראובן owes יוסף $100. Therefore if יהודה has another field (which he bought from ראובן, after לוי bought his field), or if ראובן still has a field worth $100, לוי can testify for יהודה, since he is not נוגע, for even if the מערער wins the case and takes away this one field from יהודה, nevertheless the מלוה will still be able to collect, either from sיהודה' other field or from sראובן' field, and לוי will not be affected. However if both יהודה and ראובן have no other field, לוי has an interest that יהודה should retain his field, otherwise the בע"ח will take away sלוי' field, and לוי will lose since ראובן cannot reimburse לוי, for ראובן has no other assets.. He is therefore a נוגע בעדות and cannot testify.</i> –<br>And</b> לוי <b>will not have from what to be compensated from the seller</b> (ראובן).<br>תוספות asks on the פרשב"ם:<br><b>וקשה לרבינו יצחק דאם כן אפילו אית ליה ארעא אחריתי<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This means that either יהודה or ראובן have another field (worth $100 [or more]).</i> נמי –<br>And the ר"י has a difficulty</b> with the פי' רשב"ם, <b>for if</b> it is indeed <b>so</b> that the לוקח ראשון is concerned that the seller (ראובן owes money), so <b>even if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי,</b> the לוקח ראשון should <b>also</b> not be allowed to testify –<br><b>דכי היכי דחייש לבעל חוב קטן –<br>For just as</b> לוי <b>is concerned for a limited creditor</b> (of $100, the value of one field) –<br><b>הכי נמי ניחוש לבעל חוב גדול שיהא חובו כנגד שני קרקעות<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Perhaps ראובן owes $200, therefore even if יהודה or ראובן own another land worth an additional $100, nevertheless לוי should not be able to testify for יהודה, for the loan may be for $200 and לוי wants to be sure that the מלוה has where to collect from without coming after לוי, therefore he is testifying for יהודה; he is a נוגע בעדות!</i> –<br>He should be just as concerned for a major creditor that the loan</b> to ראובן <b>is equal</b> to the value of <b>both fields –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות in his previous question on the רשב"ם is implying that we cannot say that the לוקח ראשון is concerned about a בע"ח (for if so, he should never be allowed to testify, since he may be concerned for a בע"ח גדול), however תוספות will cite גמרות where there is a concern for a בע"ח; there is a need to distinguish between the various cases.</i><br><b>אלא נראה לרבינו יצחק דאף על גב דלעיל (דף מד,א) גבי מוכר שדה שלא באחריות –<br>Rather it appears to the ר"י</b> that generally the לוקח is not concerned for a בע"ח, <b>for even though previously regarding</b> a case where <b>one sold a field</b> (even) <b>without a guarantee –<br>אמרינן שאין מעיד לו עליה מפני שמעמידה בפני בעל חובו –<br>We say that</b> the seller <b>cannot testify on behalf</b> of the buyer against a contester, <b>because the</b> seller want this field to remain<b></b> by the buyer (instead of by the מערער), <b>so his creditor can collect from it;</b> we see that we are concerned for a בע"ח!<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>התם ודאי חיישינן לבעל חוב לפי שאדם יודע אם יש לו בעלי חובים אם לאו –<br>There we are certainly suspect that there is a בע"ח, since a person</b> (the seller, whom we are discussing) <b>knows if he has creditors or not –<br>וכשאנו רואים שבא להעיד אנו חוששים שלכך מעיד לפי שרוצה להעמידה בפני בעל חובו –<br>And so when we see</b> the seller <b>coming to testify</b> on behalf of the buyer, <b>we suspect that the reason he is testifying, is because he want to be מעמידה בפני בע"ח –<br>והתם אפילו אית ליה ארעא אחריתי לא יעיד דחיישינן שמא יש לו בעל חוב גדול<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is stating in conjunction with his question that whenever we are concerned for a בע"ח there is no difference whether אית ליה ארעא אחריתי or not, for we do not know the size of the loan; we are concerned for a loan of any amount.</i> –</b><br><b>And</b> indeed <b>there, even if</b> the seller <b>has other lands, he may not testify, because we are concerned that perhaps he has a major creditor</b> for which he will need all the lands (his own and that which he sold) to satisfy the loan –<br>תוספות supports his view that if there is a concern for a בע"ח, it applies even if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי:<br><b>וכן אומר רבינו שמשון בן אברהם דמשמע לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">מג,א. The גמרא stated there that one שותף may testify on behalf of his שותף provided that he was מקנה his share of the field to the other שותף, so he no longer has any interest in it,</i> כי פריך –<br>And the רשב"א says similarly that</b> this is <b>indicated previously when</b> the גמרא <b>asks –<br>וכי קנו מידו מאי הוי הרי מעמידה בפני בעל חובו<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The first שותף who transferred his rights to the second שותף wants that field to remain by the second שותף so that the בע"ח from the first שותף will have from where to collect his loan. </i> –<br>‘and even he made a קנין</b> that he is transferring the field to his partner, <b>what of it, but</b> there is still the issue of <b>מעמידה בפני בע"ח’ –<br>ולא משני כגון דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי –<br>And</b> the גמרא <b>does not answer, ‘for instance that</b> the granting שותף, <b>has other land</b> from where his בע"ח can collect from. The reason is that whenever we are concerned for a בע"ח, there is no limit, for we cannot know how much is owed –<br>תוספות anticipates an additional difficulty:<br><b>והא דקאמר לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">מה,א. This is the case mentioned previously regarding המוכר שדה לחבירו שלא באחריות אינו מעיד לו עליה מפני שמעמידה בפני בע"ח. The גמרא asks that it should make no difference to the seller whether the buyer retains the field, or not.</i> אי דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי עליה הדר –<br>And regarding this which</b> the גמרא <b>stated previously, ‘if</b> the seller <b>has</b> <b>other land,</b> the מלוה <b>will go after it’</b> so he can testify on behalf of the buyer –<br><b>לא תקשי היאך הדר עליה שמא יש לו בעל חוב גדול<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות is saying that whenever we are concerned for a בע"ח it makes no difference whether אית ליה ארעא אחריתי, or not, for the loan may be very large and requires both lands to satisfy it.</i> –<br>You should not ask, how can he go after</b> the other land, <b>perhaps he owes much money</b> and he needs both lands to satisfy the loan, so how can he testify?! –<br>תוספות responds:<br><b>דהכי פירושו אי אית ליה ארעא אחריתי כדי כל החוב עליה הדר –<br>For this is the explanation</b> of that גמרא; ‘<b>if</b> the seller <b>has other lands sufficient for the entire loan</b> (no matter how large) <b>he will go after it –<br>ואי לית ליה ארעא אחריתי כדי כל החוב מאי נפקא מינה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there in the הוה אמינא did not understand what difference it makes to the seller whether this sold land remains by the buyer or not. If he has other land to cover the loan, the מלוה will not go after the buyer, and if his lands cannot cover the loan, so why should he care if the מלוה cannot collect his loan; it is the sמלוה' loss not his. [The גמרא answered that he does not want to be a לוה רשע ולא ישלם.]</i> –<br>And if he does not have other lands sufficient for the entire loan, what difference is there</b> to the seller.<br>This applies when we are discussing the seller who is the לוה, and he knows whether he owes money (and how much), or not –<br><b>אבל אין לחוש שהלוקח מעיד לפי שיהיה לבעל חוב של מוכר ממה לגבות –<br>However there is no concern that the buyer should testify</b> falsely <b>in order that the creditor of the seller should have from where to collect –<br>דאין הלוקח יודע אם יש למוכר שום בעל חוב –<br>Since the buyer does not know if the seller has any creditor!</b><br>תוספות rejects the פי' רשב"ם that we are concerned that the לוקח will testify falsely in order that the בע"ח of the מוכר should have from where to collect (to make sure that he does not collect from this לוקח), this is not so, for the לוקח has no idea whether the seller owes money or not.<br>תוספות offers his explanation why the לוקח ראשון cannot testify for the לוקח שני:<br><b>אלא היינו טעמא דאין הלוקח ראשון מעיד ללוקח שני אף על גב דלא חייש לבעל חוב<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See previously in this תוספות that the לוקח (ראשון) has no idea whether his מוכר owes money to anyone.</i> –<br>Rather this is the reason why the לוקח ראשון cannot testify for the לוקח שני, for even though</b> the לוקח ראשון <b>is not concerned for the בע"ח</b> of the מוכר –<br><b>מיהו חייש שמא קרקע גזולה היא והיום או למחר יבא הנגזל ויקחנה –<br>Nevertheless</b> the לוקח ראשון <b>is concerned perhaps this</b> (the field which the לוקח ראשון bought from the מוכר) <b>is stolen property, and</b> either <b>today or tomorrow</b> (anytime soon) <b>the victim of the theft will come and reclaim</b> his property –<br><b>ולא יהיה לו ממה לחזור על המוכר היכא דלית ליה ארעא אחריתי למוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">The לוקח ראשון is a נוגע בעדות if there is no other property (besides this contested field of the לוקח שני), either by the מוכר or the לוקח שני. The לוקח ראשון wants this contested field to remain in the possession of the לוקח שני, so in case his property (לוקח ראשון) is taken from him (because it never belonged to the מוכר), the לוקח ראשון will have recourse to collect this contested field from the לוקח שני. The לוקח ראשון cannot testify for the ללוקח שני, since he is a נוגע בעדות.</i> –<br>And</b> if the לוקח שני will lose his field, the לוקח ראשון <b>will not have from what to collect from the seller,</b> in a case <b>where there is no other field</b> left by <b>the מוכר.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>ואם תאמר ומלוה וערב (והלוקח) אמאי מעידים ללוה אף על גב דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי –<br>And if you will say, why can the מלוה and the ערב (and the buyer) testify for the לוה, even if there is ארעא אחריתי –<br>ניחוש שמא היא גזולה וכשיבא נגזל ויקחנה לא יהיה לו ממה לגבות –<br>Let us be concerned that perhaps</b> the ארעא אחריתי <b>is stolen</b> property, <b>and when the נגזל will come and take it away</b> from the לוה, the מלוה and the ערב <b>will not have from where to collect</b> what is owed to them; we should be concerned שמא גזולה היא –<br><b>כדחיישינן לחד נגזל גבי לוקח הכי נמי ניחוש גבי ערב ומלוה<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i>-<br>Just as we are concerned for one נגזל regarding</b> the <b>לוקח</b> ראשון (for that is why he cannot testify for the לוקח שני), <b>we should be concerned just as well regarding the ערב ומלוה!</b><br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ויש לומר דבשום מקום אין המלוה וערב והלוקח חוששין כל זמן שאחריות שלהן<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">In the case of לוקח ראשון, he cannot testify for לוקח שני where לית ליה ארעא אחריתי, because the לוקח ראשון is concerned that his own field may have been stolen, and the field of the לוקח שני, which he is depending on for security is being contested; therefore he is a נוגע בעדות. However by the מלוה וערב where their security (for the loan) is guaranteed by the ארעא אחריתי, in that case a person is not worried that perhaps his security will be lost (because it was stolen), he is only concerned that perhaps the property he owns is stolen. By the לוקח there is only one concern, perhaps his property is stolen and he will have no recourse; however by the מלוה וערב there are two concerns, firstly maybe the לוה will not pay (if he pays there is no concern), and secondly maybe the ארעא אחריתי was stolen (but maybe not), therefore since there needs to be two maybe’s, to such an extent one is not concerned.</i> קיים:</b><br><b>And one can say; that under no circumstances are the מלוה וערב ולוקח concerned</b> that that the field they depend on may be stolen, <b>as long as their security exists.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>According to the רשב"ם, the לוקח ראשון is concerned that the מוכר owes money, while according to תוספות, the לוקח ראשון is concerned perhaps his property was stolen.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות asks that by a מלוה וערב we should also be concerned that perhaps the ארעא אחריתי was stolen (just as the לוקח ראשון is concerned that his field was stolen).<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 15.</i> Can we ask the same question on the פי' רשב"ם that by the מלוה וערב, even if theלוה has אית ליה ארעא אחריתי, we should be concerned perhaps he owes another בע"ח, who will take away his ארעא אחריתי (just as we are concerned by the לוקח ראשון)?<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i>
<b>לוקח ראשון מעיד ללוקח שני—The first buyer may testify for the second buyer</b><br><br>Overview<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Overview; to the previous תוס' ד"ה לוקח (הא').</i><br>The ברייתא teaches that the לוקח ראשון can testify on behalf of the לוקח שני against a מערער if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי. Our תוספות questions the need for a לוקח שני.<br>--------------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>קשה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם אמאי לא קאמר לוקח מעיד למוכר<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This means that if the seller has another field (besides the one he sold to the לוקח), and someone is contesting the ownership, the לוקח may testify against the מערער for the benefit of the מוכר.</i> –<br>The רשב"א has a difficulty, why did not the</b> ברייתא <b>state that the לוקח can testify for the seller –<br>והוא דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי בין (לפרש"י<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">Others amend this to read לפרשב"ם (instead of לפרש"י).</i>)<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This means that the concern of the לוקח is that perhaps the seller owes someone money and the בע"ח will collect from the לוקח if the מוכר has no other field.</i> בין לפירוש<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The concern of the לוקח is perhaps the field he bought was stolen, and if the מוכר has no other field, the לוקח will not have from where to collect.</i> רבינו יצחק:<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות does not answer his question. See נחלת משה (בשם הקצות [והנתיבות]).</i></b><br><b>Provided that the</b> מוכר <b>has another field</b> besides the one being contested; this question is <b>both according to (פרש"י) [פרשב"ם] and also according to the פר"י.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Why do we need a לוקח שני; the same rule can apply by the לוקח ומוכר.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the advantage of תוספות case over the sברייתא' case?

Daf 47a



Line 1

<b>קבלן<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה קבלן that a קבלן is a guarantor who took the money from the מלוה and gave it to the לוה. The מלוה may collect directly from the קבלן, without being required to approach the לוה first for payment.</i> אמרי לה אינו מעיד—Some say a <i>Kahblohn</i> cannot testify</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא states that there is a dispute whether a קבלן may testify on behalf of the לוה regarding a contested property in the possession of the לוה. Previously the ברייתא taught that a ‘regular’ ערב (or a מלוה, etc.) can testify on behalf of the לוה, provided the לוה has another field (besides the one being contested). תוספות discusses the view that a קבלן may not testify.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא gives the reason because the קבלן prefers that the לוה should have both fields; which itself requires further explanation.</i><br>------------------------------<br><b>אף על גב דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This is obvious, for if the לוה has no other land, there is no difference between a קבלן and an ערב or a מלוה, for none of them may testify if לית ליה ארעא אחריתי, the only time the others may testify is if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי.</i> –</b><br>The קבלן may not testify (according to one view) for the לוה, <b>even though the</b> לוה <b>has other land –</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה דמאי נפקא מינה דאי אתי מלוה וטריף את של קבלן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1 that by a קבלן, the מלוה can collect directly from the קבלן, avoiding the לוה entirely. </i> –<br>It is astounding! For what difference does</b> it make to the קבלן that the לוה should keep both fields (including the contested field), <b>for</b> even <b>if the מלוה will come and collect the sקבלן'</b> field –<br><b>אתי קבלן וקטריף את של לוה כיון דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The קבלן is not biased; it makes no difference to the קבלן whether the לוה will retain or lose the contested field, since the לוה has another uncontested field. This is sufficient security for the קבלן! He should be permitted to testify!</i> –<br>The קבלן will come and collect the</b> uncontested field <b>of the לוה, since</b> the לוה <b>has another</b> uncontested <b>field –</b><br>תוספות considers a possible solution:<b><br>ואין נראה לומר כגון שיש לקבלן בינונית –<br>And it does not appear</b> correct <b>to answer</b> that this is a case where <b>for instance the קבלן owns average</b> valued fields –<br><b>וההיא ארעא שרוצה להעיד עליה נמי בינונית –<br>And that</b> contested <b>field which</b> the קבלן <b>wants to testify for</b> on behalf of the לוה <b>is also בינונית</b> (average) –<br><b>אבל ארעא אחריתי דאית ליה ללוה היא זיבורית –<br>However the other</b> uncontested <b>field which</b> the לוה <b>owns is זיבורית</b> (inferior; below average value), in which case –<br><b>דמפסיד כשיבא מלוה וטריף את שלו דלא יהיה לו לגבות אלא מזיבורית<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The קבלן is biased; he prefers that the לוה retain the contested בינונית field so in case the מלוה collects the sקבלן' field (בינונית) he will be able in turn to collect the בינונית from the לוה; if however the לוה loses the contested בינונית field, the קבלן will only be able to collect זיבורית; the קבלן does not want to give up בינונית and receive only זיבורית. This would seem to explain the גמרא satisfactorily. However תוספות rejects this explanation.</i> –<br>The</b> קבלן <b>will lose if the מלוה will come and take away</b> the sקבלן' <b>field, for</b> the קבלן <b>will only be able to collect the זיבורית</b> from the לוה –<br>תוספות rejects this explanation:<br><b>דאם כן מלוה נמי לא יעיד ללוה אפילו אית ליה ארעא אחריתי כענין זה<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא distinguishes that a מלוה may testify if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי, and a קבלן cannot testify (even if אית ליה ארעא אחריתי [according to one view]). Obviously both are discussing the same case. If the case of the קבלן is that the ארעא אחריתי is זיבורית, it is also this same case by the מלוה, that the ארעא אחריתי is זיבורית, so why can the מלוה testify, he is definitely biased, he would rather collect the contested בינונית field, than the uncontested זיבורית field!</i> –<br>For if</b> indeed <b>it is such</b> a case where the ארעא אחריתי is זיבורית, <b>even the מלוה should not be permitted to testify for the לוה even if</b> the לוה <b>has אחרא אחריתי in this</b> same <b>manner –</b><br>A second difficulty with this solution:<br><b>ועוד בכל ענין משמע דאינו מעיד דלא מפליג בין היא בינונית בין היא זיבורית<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">However according to the proposed answer the קבלן cannot testify only if the ארעא אחריתי was זיבורית.</i> –<br>And additionally it seems</b> that the קבלן <b>cannot testify in any situation, since</b> the ברייתא <b>did not distinguish whether</b> the ארעא אחריתי <b>was בינונית, or whether it was זיבורית –</b><br>A final difficulty with the proposed solution:<br><b>ועוד דצריך עיון בהניזקין (גיטין דף מט,ב) דנראה דמוכח התם –<br>And furthermore that</b> additional <b>contemplation is required in</b> פרק <b>הניזקין, where it seems evident</b> from the גמרא <b>there –<br>דאם אין ללוה אלא זיבורית גם קבלן לא יתן לו אלא זיבורית<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The rule is that a מלוה generally collects from בינונית. Therefore we assumed (in the proposed answer) that the מלוה will collect the בינונית of the קבלן (not his זיבורית) and therefore if all the לוה has left is זיבורית, the קבלן will suffer a loss. However, תוספות is arguing that this is not the case; for even if the לוה loses the contested בינונית, and remains only with the uncontested זיבורית, when the מלוה wishes to collect from the קבלן, he can only collect זיבורית, for that is the only field the לוה possesses. The מלוה indeed has the choice to collect first from the קבלן, but he cannot collect from the קבלן a superior field than he could have collected from the לוה. Therefore there is no loss and no bias. The מלוה collects זיבורית from the קבלן and the קבלן receives זיבורית from the לוה. See ‘Thinking it over’. </i> –<br>That if the לוה possesses only זיבורית, the קבלן is not required to give</b> the מלוה, anything <b>but זיבורית –</b><br>תוספות offers his explanation why the קבלן cannot testify:<br><b>ונראה דהיינו טעמא דקבלן אינו מעיד ללוה אף על גב דאית ליה ארעא אחריתי –<br>And it appears</b> to תוספות <b>that this is the reason why the קבלן cannot testify for the לוה, even if</b> the לוה <b>has another field –<br>משום דטריחא ליה מילתא למיקם עליה בדינא ודיינא<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The קבלן, in his attempt to be reimbursed by the לוה, will need to take the לוה to a בי"ד and prove to them that he paid the loan, and receive a ruling that the לוה must reimburse him and then carry out this ruling, He would rather not get involved at all by making sure that the מלוה collects directly from the לוה.</i> –<br>Because it is bothersome</b> for the קבלן <b>to get involved with a lawsuit and judges –<br>וכשיהיו ללוה קרקעות הרבה לא יגבה המלוה מן הקבלן –<br>However if the לוה has many fields the מלוה will not collect from the קבלן,</b> so assumes the קבלן –<br><b>הואיל ויכול לגבות מן הלוה בהרווחה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">This is what the גמרא means that the לוה should have both fields (see footnote # 2), for the קבלן assumes the greater variety there is by the לוה, the more chance there is that the מלוה will go after the לוה, and not after the קבלן.</i> –<br>Since he can collect comfortably from the לוה,</b> for there are many options –<br>תוספות responds to an anticipated question:<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The question is based on the premise, mentioned by תוספות previously (see [text by] footnote # 8), that the cases here are in all instances, since the ברייתא did not qualify its ruling.</i><br><b>אבל מלוה מעיד ללוה בכל ענין אפילו אותה שמעיד עליה היא בינונית ואחריתי זיבורית –<br>However the מלוה may always testify for the לוה in any situation even if that</b> contested field <b>for which</b> the מלוה <b>is testifying is a בינונית and the other</b> field is a זיבורית (where seemingly the מלוה stands to lose), nevertheless he may testify –<br><b>דמשום איחלופי בינונית לזיבורית לא יעיד שקר<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות totally negates the logic of the proposed answer that receiving זיבורת instead of בינונית creates a bias that we should therefore not accept his testimony. The difference between בינונית and זיבורית is insufficient to suspect that one would testify falsely because of the exchange.</i> –<br>Because</b> the מלוה <b>will not testify falsely on account that the בינונית will be switched to זיבורית –<br>דמכל מקום יש לו שוה בשוה<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">He may be receiving זיבורית, but its market value is the same as the בינונית; he receives more land which in the end equals the value of the בינונית. </i> –<br>For nonetheless he is receiving equal</b> value <b>for equal</b> value –<br>תוספות offers an alternate approach why the מלוה may testify:<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This answer assumes that there will be a bias if he loses the בינונית and receives זיבורית instead. Therefore the מלוה can testify only if the ארעא אחריתי is בינונית. And as to the question that it seems that the ברייתא is discussing all cases (see footnote # 8), תוספות therefore explains…</i><b><br>אי נמי ארעא אחריתי דכולה שמעתין כיוצא בו קאמר:</b><br><b>Or you may also say that</b> the phrase <b>ארעא אחריתי in the entire גמרא means a similar</b> land, but not an inferior land, for then there is a bias and they will not be able to testify.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The bias of the קבלן is that the more fields the לוה has, the more likely the מלוה will collect from the לוה and the קבלן will have no need to be embroiled in a די"ת<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. תוספות writes that if the לוה has only זיבורית, the מלוה can collect only זיבורית from the קבלן.<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 9.</i> What will be the rule if the לוה has only זיבורית and the קבלן has no זיבורית, only בינונית or עדית, can the מלוה collect from the קבלן (the בינונית), or not?<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">See פני יהושע and נחלת משה.</i><br>2. There is a dispute in תוספות whether one would testify falsely if he would receive זיבורית instead of בינונית.<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13 & 15.</i> What would be the סברא חיצונית; meaning what would be the thinking on one’s own without relying on proofs from sources.

<b>פעמים שבן בן גזלן אין לו חזקה כגון דקאתי בטענתא דאבא דאבוה—Sometimes the grandson of a robber has no <i>Chazokoh</i>; for instance when he comes with the claim of his grandfather</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רבא said (that even though ר' יוחנן taught that the grandson of a גזלן has a חזקה,<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">This is in a case where the grandson claims he inherited it from his father, the son of the גזלן [see (however) footnote # 12].</i> nevertheless) sometimes a grandson of a גזלן has no חזקה; that is in a case where the grandson claims that he inherited this item from his grandfather the גזלן.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">In this case we say that since the גזלן had no חזקה, therefore the חזקה of the grandson is meaningless.</i> Our תוספות discusses this issue.<br>-----------------------------<br>תוספות asks:<br><b>תימה לרבינו יצחק דאמאי אין לו חזקה הא טוענין ליורש<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See previously כג,א and in רש"י there ד"ה טוענין. In a case where the מערער (who has proof the he was once the owner of the property) claims it is his field, and the מוחזק replies that he inherited it from his father. The בי"ד argues on behalf of the יורש that perhaps the father of the יורש bought it from the מערער, and therefore the חזקה of the יורש is valid (even though the יורש did not claim that his מוריש bought it from מערער). </i> –<br>The ר"י is astounded; why does the</b> grandson <b>not have a חזקה, since we argue on behalf of an heir –<br>והוה ליה למימר דלמא אי הוה אביו קיים דהיינו בן גזלן הוה טעין אנא הדר זבינתה מינך<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">If the בן גזלן would claim that he bought it from the מערער, he would be believed, as the גמרא just stated.</i> –<br>So it should be said</b> by בי"ד<b></b> on behalf of the grandson (the יורש of the son) <b>that perhaps if his father (meaning the son of the גזלן</b>) <b>was alive,</b> the בן גזלן <b>would have claimed, ‘I bought it from you later’</b> (after my father the גזלן had it), therefore the חזקה of the יורש is valid.<br>תוספות (because of the abovementioned difficulty) presents a different גירסא:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דגרס פעמים שבן גזלן יש לו חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">Even though ר' יוחנן taught the (generally) a בן גזלן אין לו חזקה, nevertheless פעמים that a בן גזלן יש לו חזקה.</i> –</b><br><b>And it appears to the ר"י that the text reads, ‘sometimes the son of a גזלן has a חזקה</b> (not פעמים שבן בן גזלן אין לו חזקה) –<br><b>כגון דקאתי בטענתא דאבא דאבוה<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">The בן גזלן claims that this field belonged to his grandfather (the אבי הגזלן) and he eventually inherited it from his father (the גזלן) who in turn inherited it from his father (the אבי הגזלן).</i> דהוא אבי הגזלן –<br>For instance where</b> the בן גזלן <b>comes with the claim of his grandfather, meaning the father of the גזלן –<br>וקא משמע לן דאף על גב שהיתה ביד מי שאין לו חזקה דהיינו אביו הגזלן –<br>And</b> רבא <b>is teaching us that even though this</b> property <b>was in the possession of someone who does not have a חזקה, meaning his father the גזלן</b> (from whom he actually inherited it) –<br><b>מכל מקום יש לו חזקה כיון שאמר שהיתה של אבי אביו<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The claim is a valid claim since his grandfather was not a גזלן; anything in his possession is rightfully his. We believe the grandson that his grandfather had it, because the grandson has a מיגו, he could have claimed, ‘I bought it from you’.</i> –<br>Nevertheless</b> the בן גזלן <b>has a חזקה since he said it belonged to his grandfather –</b><br>תוספות reconsiders the first גירסא:<br><b>ויש ליישב גירסא ראשונה פעמים דבן בן גזלן אין לו חזקה והכי פירושה –<br>And we can substantiate the first גירסא,</b> which is <b>פעמים דבן בן גזלן אין לו חזקה, and this is the explanation;</b> the בן בן גזלן has no חזקה in a case where <b>–<br>כגון דאתא בטענתא דאבא דאבוה –<br>For instance that the</b> grandson <b>comes with a claim of his grandfather</b> the גזלן –<br><b>ואומר שאמר לו אביו דהיינו בן הגזלן שהניחה לו הגזלן אביו<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות will now answer the difficulty he had on this גירסא, namely why do we not argue on behalf of the grandson that his father (the בן הגזלן) bought it back from the מערער, since טוענין ליורש. The answer is that since the grandson claims that his father told him that he inherited it from his father (the גזלן), he negated any possibility that the son of the גזלן repurchased it from the מערער.</i> –<br>And</b> the grandson <b>claims that his father, meaning the son of the גזלן, said to him</b> (the grandson of the גזלן) <b>that his father the גזלן left him</b> this property –<br><b>דאם איתא דהדר זבנתה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read דהדר זבנה מיניה הוה (instead of דהדר זבנתה מינך הוה).</i> מינך הוה אמר ליה אנא זבינא –</b><br><b>For if it is true that</b> the בן הגזלן <b>went back and bought it from</b> the מערער, <b>he would have said to</b> his son (the grandson), <b>‘I bought it</b> from the מערער', instead of merely saying, ‘my father left it from me’, this proves that the בן הגזלן never bought it from the מערער –<br>תוספות offers an alternate reason why here we are not טוען ליורש that his father bought it:<br><b>אי נמי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">According to the א"נ, there is no need to say that the grandson stated that his father inherited it from his father the גזלן (which negates the claim of הדר זבנה), but even if no mention was made that his father inherited it from his grandfather, nevertheless בי"ד will not be טוען that perhaps his father bought it from the מערער.</i> נראה לרבינו יצחק דלא טענינן ליורש כי האי גוונא דמילתא דלא שכיחא היא –</b><br><b>Additionally it appears to the ר"י that we are not טוען ליורש in such a case, for it is something uncommon</b> that the בן גזלן who inherited the field from his father should buy it back from the מערער –<br>תוספות proves that we do not claim a מילתא דלא שכיחא (even) for יתומים:<br><b>כי היכי דאמר בסוף המוכר את הבית (לקמן דף ע,ב ושם דיבור המתחיל מאן) –<br>Just as</b> the גמרא <b>states<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is where the father of the יתומים received money (בשטר) from an investor, for the purpose of investing, where the profits would be divided between the investor and the father. The father then died and the investor (מלוה) is coming to collect from the יתומים with this שטר כיס. The חכמים ruled that in this type of investment/loan, we look at it is if half is a loan (for which the לוה is responsible to pay it back, no matter what happens) and half is considered to be a פקדון for which he can be exempt from returning it if there was an אונס. Therefore if the father would have lost all the money, on account of an אונס, he would be required to pay back the half, which is a loan, but could swear that it was lost באונס, and be פטור from paying the second half. In this case however the father died and the investor/מלוה wants to collect from the יתומים with this שטר כיס. The rule, according to one מ"ד, is that he collects everything (from their father’s estate). He certainly collects the מלוה half, for we cannot claim פרעתי, since he has a שטר, but he even collect the half of the פקדון, and we do not claim (on behalf of the יורשים) perhaps it was an אונס, so they should be פטור, since אונס לא שכיח. [This does not say there explicitly in the גמרא, but that it how תוספות explains it.]</i> in the end of</b> פרק <b>המוכר את הבית –<br>דלא טענינן ליתמי נאנסו משום דמילתא דלא שכיחא היא –<br>That we do not claim נאנסו on behalf of the יתומים since</b> אונס <b>is an uncommon occurrence –</b><br>תוספות responds to an anticipated difficulty:<br><b>והא דקאמר לעיל [בן] בן גזלן בן אומן יש לו חזקה<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות understands the case of בן בן גזלן יש לו חזקה (which ר' יוחנן stated together with בן אומן יש לו חזקה), to mean that the grandson claims that his grandfather the גזלן owned it (and he inherited from him). [This is not like the רשב"ם בד"ה לא that the grandson of the גזלן claims that he inherited it from his father (for that is פשיטא).] The question is how the grandson has a חזקה, since his grandfather the גזלן has no חזקה. We could therefore (mistakenly) conclude that we are טוען ליורש (to the grandson) that his father (the בן גזלן) bought it from the מערער. This contradicts this which תוספות just said that this claim is a מלתא דלא שכיחא and בי"ד will not claim it for the יורש. </i> –<br>And this which</b> ר' יוחנן <b>ruled previously</b> that <b>the grandson of a גזלן and the son of an אומן</b> (both) <b>have a חזקה –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>היינו דוקא משום דאמר בפנינו הודה<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Normally if the grandson would claim he inherited it from his grandfather (the גזלן), he would not be believed, but the גמרא previously explained that the ruling of בן בנו של גזלן יש לו חזקה, is when he claims בפנינו הודה, that the מערער admitted to the grandfather that the מערער sold it to him, therefore he is believed with a מיגו of מינך זבנתה. However if he merely claims, ‘I inherited from my grandfather’ he is not believed, since he was a גזלן. See ‘Thinking it over’ # 1.</i> –<br>That</b> ruling <b>is only because he claimed that</b> the מערער <b>admitted in our presence</b> that he sold it (to my grandfather [the גזלן]) –<br><b>ואדרבה משם יש להוכיח דמשמע הא לאו הכי אין לו חזקה –<br>And on the contrary; from there we can prove</b> what תוספות claimed, <b>for it seems</b> that <b>were it not for this</b> (that he claimed בפנינו הודה לו) <b>he has no חזקה –<br>כיון דמעיקרא בתורת אומנות ואריסות וגזלנות אתא לידיה:</b><br><b>Since initially it came into his possession through</b> either <b>אומנות, אריסות וגזלנות.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>We can be גורס that בן של גזלן יש לו חזקה, or we can be גורס that בן בנו של גזלן אין לו חזקה, and we are not טוען ליורש, either because he negated that option in his claim, or the claim of הדר זבנה is a מלתא דלא שכיחא which we are not טוען ליתומים (unless he claims בפנינו הודה).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. It appears from תוספות that by a בן בנו של גזלן, he has a חזקה in a case of בפנינו הודה even if he claims that he inherited it from his grandfather (the גזלן).<sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 13.</i> The question here is why the בן גזלן is not believed (even in a case of בפנינו הודה), because we say the הודאה is meaningless, and the בן בנו של גזלן is believed; here too we should say that the הודאה is meaningless. Why is there this difference between בן גזלן (where אין לו חזקה) and בן בנו של גזלן (where יש לו חזקה)?!<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם.</i><br>2. תוספות writes בן בן גזלן ובן אומן יש לו חזקה, and similarly in the end תוספות writes כיון דמעיקרא בתורת אומנות ואריסות וגזלנות אתא לידיה. Is תוספות question (and subsequent answer) based only on בן בן גזלן or also on אומן ואריס?<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">See פני יהושע ונחלת משה.</i>

Line 7

<b>ירד מאומנותו יש לו חזקה—He left his craft; he has a <i>Chazokoh</i></b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The ברייתא rules that once a craftsman (אומן) leaves his trade and is no longer an אומן, he has a חזקה, meaning that he can claim that he bought any item which is in his possession (as opposed to an אומן who has no חזקה). The issue here is whether we mean that he has a חזקה even on the items which were in his possession while he was an אומן, or that he only has a חזקה on these items which came into his possession after he left the אומנות.<br>--------------------------------<br><b>מצינו לפרש מאותן כלים שנתן לו לאחר שירד מאומנותו דומיא דאריס שירד מאריסותו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">When the ברייתא states that an אריס שירד מאריסתו יש לו חזקה it means that if he made a חזקה in a field (for three years) after he left his אריסות, it is a valid חזקה. In that case the חזקה began only after he finished the אריסות, however the time he was an אריס cannot be included in the three years necessary for a חזקה, similarly the חזקה of an אומן must begin after he left his אומנות, however if he had the item before he left the אומנות, there will be no חזקה, because we assume the item came into his possession as an אומן, but not as an owner.</i> –<br>We can explain</b> the ruling of ירד מאומנתו יש לו חזקה to be referring <b>to those utensils that were given to him after he left his אומנות, similar to a sharecropper (אריס) who left his אריסות –<br>אי נמי אפילו אותן כלים שנתנו לו בשעה שהיה עדיין אומן –<br>Or</b> we can <b>also</b> say that the אומן has a חזקה <b>even regarding those items which were given to him while he was still an אומן –<br>והוא ששהו אחר אומנותו כל כך שהוא רגילות שמחזירם לבעלים<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">Let us assume that items which are given to a tailor are picked up or returned to the owner within a month, but no one leaves it for more than a month. Therefore if the item was by the tailor (after he stopped tailoring), for more than a month, the tailor can claim, ‘I bought it from you’. If it was not bought by the tailor, the owner would certainly have taken it back before the month was over. </i> –<br>Provided that they lingered</b> by the אומן <b>after he</b> left <b>his trade to the extent that normally they would be returned to their owners –</b><br>תוספות draws a parallel ruling:<br><b>ונראה דבן אומן נמי דאמר לעיל<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">See (also) תוס' ד"ה כגון on this עמוד [TIE footnote # 4].</i> דיש לו חזקה כי אמר<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The הגהות הב"ח amends this to read אמר בפני הודה (instead of אמר בפנינו הודה).</i> בפנינו הודה –<br>And it appears</b> to תוספות <b>that also regarding the son of the אומן, where</b> the גמרא <b>previously ruled that the</b> בן אומן <b>has a חזקה when he claims</b> that the מערער <b>admitted in my presence</b> to my father that he sold it to my father; the ruling is –<br><b>היינו אחר ששהה אחר מות אביו –<br>Only</b> if the item <b>lingered after his father’s death</b> for the above-mentioned period –<br><b>דאי לאו הכי אין נראה שיהא נאמן במיגו דאי בעי אמר לקוח הוא בידי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The reason the בן אומן is believed (even if he claims he inherited it from his father the אומן) is when he adds the claim of בפני הודה. The reason we believe his claim of בפני הודה is because the בן אומן has a מיגו of לקחתיה ממך. However if the מערער made his claim immediately after the אומן passed on, there is no מיגו. The מערער will claim, ‘I gave in this item to be tailored less than a week ago and I wish to reclaim it. If the אומן would be alive he would certainly not have a חזקה (since it came to him בתורת אומנות); the same is with the בן אומן; we will argue in favor of the מערער that the בן אומן has it from his father. However if a long time passed, we say to the מערער, if you did not sell it, how come you left it for such a long time in the possession of the בן אומן, in which case the בן אומן will be believed בפני הודה, with a מיגו of לקחתיה ממך, since such a long time elapsed.</i> –<br>For otherwise</b> (if the dispute took place immediately after the father’s death) <b>it does not appear that</b> the בן אומן <b>would be believed</b> (that בפני הודה) <b>with a מיגו that</b> the בן אומן <b>could have claimed, ‘I bought it</b>’ –<br><b>דאי טעין נמי לקחתיה ממך לא היה נאמן:</b><br><b>For even if he would have claimed, ‘I bought it from you; he would not be believed.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>An אומן שירד מאומנתו (as well as a בן אומן who claims בפני הודה) has a חזקה, even if the item was in his possession when he was an אומן, provided that an inordinate amount of time elapsed from when the owner should have retrieved his item.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>1. These cases of אומן שירד מאומנתו and בן אומן, which תוספות is discussing, are they in situation of עדים (that he gave it to repair בפני עדים) and ראה (that we see it in his possession) or not (both not or one not)?<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i><br>2. What would be the ruling by an אומן who claims לקחתיה מינך, in a case where the item lingered by the אומן for an extended period of time? Why?

Line 1

<b>מגורשת ואינה מגורשת<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה מגורשת that this refers to a woman whose divorce is in doubt; for instance where her husband threw the גט to her and we are unsure whether it was closer to her (where she is מגורשת) or whether it was closer to him (where she is not מגורשת). For further clarification see גיטין עח,א וב'.</i> בעלה חייב במזונותיה—She is divorced and not<br>divorced; her husband is liable for her sustenance</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The גמרא explained that the novelty that a divorced woman has a חזקה (in her husband’s assets) is in a case where her divorce is in doubt (מגורשת ואינה מגורשת), and since in this case her husband is liable for her מזונות, we may have thought that she has no חזקה בנכסי בעלה; the ברייתא teaches us that she does. תוספות clarifies the case, where she has a חזקה.<br>-----------------------------<br><b>וכגון שייחד לה ארעא אחריתי<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This would seem to be in disagreement with the רשב"ם בד"ה מגורשת, עיי"ש. See מהרש"א.</i> –<br>And for instance where he designated for her</b> needs <b>another land</b> (not the contested land, which she claims as hers)<b>,</b> from where she can receive her מזונות –<br><b>דאי לאו הכי אין לו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">A marginal note amends this to לה (instead of לו).</i> חזקה דכיון דאית לה מזוני מזוני הוא דקא אכלה כדאמרינן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">נא,א.</i> לקמן:</b><br><b>For if it were not so</b> (that the husband did not designate another property for her מזונונת), <b>she has no חזקה</b> בנכסי בעלה, <b>for since she is</b> entitled <b>to מזונות,</b> we can say that the reason the husband did not protest her occupying the field is because the husband can claim <b>she was eating her מזונות,</b> therefore I did not protest, <b>as the</b> גמרא <b>states later.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The woman who is a ספק מגורשת has a חזקה בנכסי בעליה, only if he designated another property for her מזונות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>What is the ruling by a regular wife, if he was מייחד לה ארעא אחריתי, does she have a חזקה בנכסי בעלה? Why?<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See מהרש"א.</i>

Line 2

<b>ראייתן ראיה ומעמידין שדה בידן—Their proof is a proof and we place the field in their possession</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב הונא taught that all those who do not have a חזקה, nevertheless if they bought proof that the field is theirs, their proof is valid and we place the field in their possession, except for a robber that his proof is no proof, and we do not place the field in his possession. תוספות discusses the need for the duplication; ראייתן ראיה and מעמידין שדה בידן. They seemingly mean the same thing; the field is theirs.<br>---------------------------------<br><b>נראה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהפ דנקט תרוייהו –<br>It appears to the רשב"א that</b> the reason ר"ה <b>mentions both of them,</b> ראייתו ראיה, and מעמידין שדה בידן, is –<br><b>איידי דבעי למיתני גבי גזלן אין ראייתו ראיה ואין מעמידין שדה בידו<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">See רשב"ם ד"ה ראייתן that the entire רישא is superfluous; it was taught only as an introduction to the סיפא, and since in the סיפא it was necessary to mention both; regarding אין ראייתו ראיה and ואין מעמידין שדה בידו (as תוספות will explain immediately), therefore he mentions them both in the רישא even though it was not necessary.</i> –<br>Since he wanted to teach</b> (in the סיפא) <b>regarding a robber</b> that <b>אין ראייתו ראיה</b> <b>and אין מעמידין שדה בידו,</b> therefore in the רישא he also mentioned both of them even though it was not necessary –<br>תוספות explains why by גזלן it was necessary to mention both:<br><b>דהתם איצטריך תרוייהו דאי לא תנא אלא אין ראייתו ראייה –<br>For there</b> by גזלן <b>it was necessary</b> to mention <b>both;</b> אין ראייתו ראיה and אין מעמידין שדה בידו, <b>for if</b> ר"ה <b>would have taught only אין ראייתו ראיה,</b> and not mention אין מעמידין שדה בידו –<br><b>הוה אמינא דאין ראייתו ראיה לגבי הא שאין מעמידין שדה<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">We may have certainly assumed that, if ר"ה would only say אין מעמידין השדה בידו; but we could have assumed that even if he would say just אין ראייתו ראיה.</i> בידו אבל מעות יש לו<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">This means (as תוספות continues to explain) that the case of גזלן is [even] where the עדים saw the actual transfer of money (from the גזלן to the נגזל) and nevertheless אין ראייתו ראיה; we will not allow the גזלן to keep the field (for we will assume that it was a forced sale), however the גזלן is entitled to get his money back (even if לא מנה לו מעות בפני עדים), for either there is proof that he gave it to the נגזל, or the נגזל admitted that he was paid. This is what we would assume if all ר"ה stated was אין ראייתו ראיה. </i> –<br>I would have said that</b> the ruling of <b>אין ראייתו ראיה</b> is only <b>regarding that we do not place the field in his possession however, he has the money –</b><br>The reason we would assume that we are [also] discussing a case where we know there was a transfer of money is because –<br><b>דלא היינו אומרים טעמא אי לאו דאודי ליה הוה ממטי ליה ולחמריה לשחוור –<br>That we would not have assumed the reason</b> אין ראייתו ראיה (that the sale is invalid) is because that <b>if he would not admit to</b> the גזלן that he sold him the field, the גזלן <b>would have brought him and his donkey to the official</b> (as רב כהנא explained) –<br><b>אלא הוה מפרשינן טעמא משום דתליוהו וזבין לא הוו זביניה זביני<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">This means, ‘he (the buyer) hung him (the seller) up on a tree, and (because of this coercion) he sold the property, the rule is the sale is not valid. We will assume that this was a coerced sale, since the buyer is a גזלן and therefore it is never a valid sale (regardless if money was seen transferred, or not). However the גזלן receives his money back (regardless if money was seen transferred or not, since the נגזל admitted that he received money). </i> אפילו מנה לו מעות –<br>Rather we would have explained the reason</b> why the sale is invalid is <b>because</b> the rule is <b>תליוהו וזבין לא הוו זביניה זביני,<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">However this is incorrect, for as the גמרא states shortly that ר"ה maintains that תליוהו וזבין זביניה זביני.</i> even when</b> the robber <b>counted the money to</b> the נגזל in the presence of עדים. This is how we may have understood the ruling of ר"ה, had he only said אין ראייתו ראיה –<br><b>הלכך קאמרי תרוייהו דאין ראייתו ראיה כלל דאפילו מעות אין לו<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">When ר"ה stated אין מעמידין השדה בידו, we know that the גזלן does not get the field, the addition of אין ראייתו ראיה is that even though there are witnesses (or a שטר) that the נגזל admitted to receiving payment (however no one saw the actual transfer of funds), the גזלן cannot even receive this money back, for we say this admission was coerced as רב כהנא said; אי לאו דאודי ליה וכו'. However a coerced sale with payment is a valid sale. We can therefore not be discussing a case where עדים saw the transfer of money. See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> –<br>Therefore</b> ר"ה <b>said both;</b> אין ראייתו ראיה and אין מעמידין שדה בידו, so now we understand <b>that אין ראייתו ראיה at all, that he even does not receive the money –<br>דטעמא הוא משום דאי לאו דאודי ליה כולי –<br>For the reason</b> of this ruling by a גזלן <b>is because</b> we assume <b>that if</b> the seller <b>would not have admitted to</b> the גזלן, <b>etc.</b> הוה ממטי ליה ולחמריה לשחוור. The admission is coerced and therefore meaningless.<br>In summation; had ר"ה just said one (either אין ראייתו ראיה or אין מעמידין), we could have mistakenly assumed that we are [also] discussing a case where money was transferred in the presence of עדים, however since (we are mistakenly assuming that) the rule is תליוהו וזבין לאו זביניה זביני, therefore the rule will be that the גזלן does not receive the field but he receives his money back (even if לא מנה לו המעות בפני עדים). Therefore ר"ה mentioned both rules, so now we know (from אין מעמידין השדה בידו) that the גזלן does not receive the field, and therefore אין ראייתו ראיה teaches us that the does not receive the money back (in a case where לא מנה המעות בפני עדים), the reason is that we assume that he did not pay money, and the reason why the נגזל admits that he received money is like רב כהנא (that דאי לאו דאודי לי' וכו'). However if מנה המעות בפני עדים the גזלן will retain the field, since תליוהו וזבין זביניה זביני.<br>תוספות continues:<br><b>והאי כולן נראה לרבינו שמשון בן אברהם דקאי נמי אבן שלא חלק ואשה שלא נתגרשה –<br>And it appears to the רשב"א that this</b> word <b>כולן</b> which ר"ה stated (וכולן שהביאו ראיה) <b>it also refers to the son who did not separate</b> from being supported by his father, <b>and a woman who was not divorced<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא on מז,א states,  בן שחלק ואשה שנתגרשה הרי הן כשאר כל אדם; indicating that a בן שלא חלק and an אשה שלא נתגרשה do not have a חזקה, like an אומן ואריס. Therefore when ר"ה stated that כולן שהביאו ראיה וכו', he meant not only the אומן ואריס but also the בן ואשה. </i></b> that by them too ראייתן ראיה וכו'.<br><b>ואף על גב דאמר לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">נא,א.</i> [גבי אשה בנכסי בעלה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">A married woman cannot have a חזקה in her husband’s assets, for he can say, ‘I let you use it for your support’ (מזונות, etc.). Furthermore even if she has a שטר which states that her husband sold her this field for this amount of money, that does not prove anything, for we can say that the husband was suspicious that she had money hidden away from him (to which he is entitled to), therefore he made as if he is selling her this field so she will reveal this money. </i>] דלגלויי זוזי הוא דבעי<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The question is how can the רשב"א state that the ruling of ר"ה applies to an אשה שלא נתגרשה, that יש לה ראיה, when the גמרא later states that she has no ראיה since we say לגלויי זוזי הוא דבעי?! </i> –<br>And even though</b> the גמרא <b>later states regarding [a woman in her husband’s assets]</b> that she has no ראיה<b></b> for we say, <b>he wanted to reveal her money –</b><br>תוספות responds:<br><b>כיון דאוקימנא בהודאה<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">תוספות just explained that the rulings of ר"ה is only in a case where the ראיה was that the נגזל admitted that he sold the field (and that he received payment) and the same is by the אומן ואריס that we are only discussing a case of where they admitted that the אומן ואריס bought the item (but not that there is proof that there was a transfer of funds [no one saw any transfer]), therefore we can include a woman שלא נתגרשה, meaning that if the husband admitted that he sold her the field, she gets to keep it, for since we do not know of any money which exchanged hands, the reason of גלויי זוזי does  not apply (there was no reason for the husband to admit to the sale) and the ראייה is valid.</i> לא שייך בה גלויי זוזי –<br>Since we</b> have just <b>established</b> the ruling of ר"ה that ראייתו ראיה is (only) in a case of <b>admission</b> (however it does not apply in a case where מנה לו המעות), therefore the concept of <b>גלויי זוזי is not applicable –</b><br>Another approach why ראייתו ראייה even by אשה שלא נתגרשה:<br><b>ועוד דמשמע לקמן דסבירא להו לרב הונא ולרב נחמן דלא אמר לגלויי זוזי הוא דבעי:</b><br><b>And additionally, it seems later that ר"ה and ר"נ maintain that we do not say</b> that he sold it because of <b>לגלויי זוזי הוא דבעי,</b> but rather it is a good proof, therefore we can maintain here that ראייתן ראייה applies also to an אשה שלא נתגרשה.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>The double ruling that אין ראייתו ראיה and אין מעמידין שדה בידו teaches us that not only does the גזלן not receive the field, but he also does not get back any money (where it was merely אודי ליה).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>It seems from תוספות that the way we know that not only does the גזלן not receive the field, but also that he does not receive his money back, is from the fact the רב הונא said two things; אין מעמידין שדה בידו (he does not get the field), and אין ראייתו ראיה (he does not get the money back).<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 6.</i> According to this, ר"ה should have stated it in the reverse אין מעמידין שדה בידו ואין ראייתו ראייה, why does he actually state אין ראייתו ראייה (first, and then) אין מעמידין שדה בידו?!<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">See נחלת משה.</i>
<b>ומעמידין שדה בידן—And we place the field in their possession</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב הונא taught that 'וכולן'; if all of them (those who do not have a חזקה), bring proof that they bought it, we place the field in their possession; we accept the proof as valid. The issue here is that one of those who have no חזקה is an אומן, a craftsman; a tailor, a launderer, etc. what does it mean that we place the field in his possession. A tailor always has a חזקה in a field; he does not need a ראייה.<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>גבי אומן נמי שייך שדה כגון<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The owner of the field contracted him to build or repair something on the field. Therefore normally the contractor cannot claim a חזקה on those buildings that he built and/or the field, because the owner can say, ‘I hired you to take care of those buildings, therefore I did not protest your being there’. However, if the contractor shows a שטר that he bought this field with the buildings, it is a valid proof.</i> אם הוא בנאי:</b><br><b>Regarding an אומן</b> we can <b>also apply</b> the case of a <b>field, for instance if he is a building contractor.</b><br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Some אומנים are involved with fields as their אומנות.<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>תוספות previously stated<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">בד"ה ראייתן.</i> that when רב הונא said 'וכולן' he included a בן בנכסי אביו and an אשה בנכסי בעלה. Therefore the 'וכולן' of ר"ה can be referring to an אריס and these two, Perhaps ר"ה was not discussing an אומן. Why did תוספות find it necessary to include אומן in the 'וכולן'?

Line 4

<b>אבל בשטר קנה—However he acquires it with a note</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>The משנה in גיטין taught<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">  גיטין נה,ב. </i> that if a person bought a property from a סיקריקון,<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">A סיקריקון is a violent gentile who extorted the property from the ישראל with the threat of killing him.</i> and he then bought it back (again) from the (original) owner, the buyer does not acquire the property.<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The reason is because the owner agreed to this sale only under duress. He was concerned that if he does not validate this sale, the סיקריקון will come after him again.</i> רב qualified this ruling that it applies only if the original owner merely told the buyer, לך חזק וקני, however if he wrote a שטר that he is selling him the field, the buyer acquires the field. תוספות reconciles our גמרא with a seemingly contradictory גמרא.<br>-----------------------------------<br><b>אלקח מן האיש וחזר ולקח מן האשה<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">The case there is when someone bought the נכסי מלוג property of a wife, from her husband (who does not own them but has the rights of eating the פירות of the נכסי מלוג), and then he went and bought the same נכסי מלוג from the wife (who actually owns them). The rule is that the buyer does not acquire the נכסי מלוג, since the husband does not own them, and the wife can claim, ‘I agreed to the sale only because 'נחת רוח עשיתי לבעלי'.  </i> נמי קאי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">The qualification of רב applies to the case of לקח מן האיש וכו' as well. The buyer is not קונה if all the wife told him was לך חזק וקני, however if she gave him a שטר, the buyer is קונה.</i> כדמוכח במתניתין<sup class="footnote-marker">6</sup><i class="footnote">Others omit the word במתניתין, for it is not evident from the משנה, but rather from the גמרא. The גמרא there brings this case of לקח מן האיש וכו' as a proof to שמואל and a refutation of רב regarding סיקריקון; indicating that the two cases are intertwined.</i> בהניזקין (גיטין דף נח,ב ושם) –</b><br>This ruling of רב <b>applies also to</b> the case of, ‘<b>he bought from the man, and he went back and</b> also <b>bought from the woman’, as is evident (from the משנה) in</b> פרק <b>הניזקין.</b><br>תוספות asks:<br><b>וקשה דתניא בסוף מי שהיה נשוי (כתובות דף צה,א ושם דיבור המתחיל וכתבה) –<br>And there is a difficulty for the ברייתא taught in פרק מי שהיה נשוי –<br>כתב לראשון<sup class="footnote-marker">7</sup><i class="footnote">The husband sold a property which was designated for his wife’s כתובה. He cannot sell it without his wife’s consent.</i> ולא חתמה לו לשני וחתמה לו איבדה כתובתה<sup class="footnote-marker">8</sup><i class="footnote">In this case she cannot claim that she signed it because נחת רוח עשיתי לבעלי (see footnote # 4), since we see that she had the courage not to sign for the first buyer, this shows that she really agreed to the sale of the second buyer.</i> –</b><br>The husband <b>wrote a</b> שטר <b>to a first</b> buyer, <b>but she</b> (the wife) <b>did not sign it for him,</b> the husband then sold it <b>to a second</b> buyer <b>and she signed</b> the שטר <b>for him;</b> the rule is <b>she forfeited her כתובה.</b> This concludes the ברייתא. We can infer <b>–<br>דוקא משום דלא חתמה לראשון אבל אי חתמה לראשון לא איבדה כתובתה<sup class="footnote-marker">9</sup><i class="footnote">The reason is she can claim נח"ר עשיתי לבעלי.</i> כדמוכח התם –<br>That it is only because she did not sign for the first</b> buyer, that is why she forfeits her כתובה, <b>however if she signed for the first</b> buyer <b>she did not forfeit her כתובה, as it is evident there;</b> this is true <b>–<br>אף על פי שכתבה שטר<sup class="footnote-marker">10</sup><i class="footnote">The ברייתא states חתמה, which means signing on a שטר.</i> –<br>Even though she wrote a שטר,</b> however רב ruled that if she wrote a שטר to the buyer (after he bought it from her husband) it is a valid sale, and from the גמרא there it is apparent that even if she signed on a שטר, it is not a valid sale!<br>תוספות answers:<br><b>ונראה לרבינו יצחק דהא דקאמר רב בשטר קנה יש להעמיד בשטר הראיה שאחר הקנין<sup class="footnote-marker">11</sup><i class="footnote">A שטר can have two functions; it may be a שטר קנין that with the transfer of the שטר from the seller to the buyer, the buyer acquires the field. Alternately the field may be acquired through another type of קנין, like חליפין or כסף or חזקה, and the שטר is ‘merely’ proof that a transfer of ownership took place. תוספות is saying that the ruling of רב that בשטר קנה is (only) by a שטר ראיה; meaning that the קנין was accomplished before the giving of the שטר.</i> –<br>And it appears to the ר"י that this which רב ruled</b> that <b>when a שטר</b> is given, <b>he acquires</b> the property, <b>we can establish</b> this ruling <b>by a שטר</b> that is used for <b>proof</b> of ownership, <b>which</b> is presented <b>after the קנין –<br>דכיון שאחר הקנין עשתה שטר שייפתה כחו כל כך קנה –<br>For since she made the שטר after the קנין, so she empowered him so much,</b> therefore <b>he acquires the field –<br>וההיא דכתובות מיירי בשטר מתנה בלא קנין אחר אלא שטר<sup class="footnote-marker">12</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא in כתובות (where there is no קנין for she can claim נח"ר עשיתי לבעלי) is where the שטר was a שטר קנין (and there was no other קנין), however the ruling of רב is where it was a שטר ראיה; given after the קנין.</i> –<br>And that גמרא in כתובות is discussing</b> a case of a <b>שטר מתנה without any other קנין except for the שטר,</b> therefor he is not קונה<b>.</b><br>תופות offers an alternate solution:<br><b>אי נמי חתמה דהתם לשון גמר כמו חתמו גבי תורף דגיטין –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say that the word <b>חתמה there</b> (in כתובות) <b>is an expression of completion, like</b> the word <b>חתמו regarding the תורף of a divorce –<br>וכמו תורה חתומה ניתנה בהניזקין (גיטין דף ס,א) כלומר שגמרה מקח ונתרצתה בעל פה<sup class="footnote-marker">13</sup><i class="footnote">Therefore in כתובות there was no שטר, so the sale is not valid, but רב is discussing where there was a שטר, therefore the sale is valid (even if was [just] a שטר קנין).</i> –<br>And</b> like the phrase <b>in</b> פרק <b>הניזקין,</b> ‘<b>the תורה was given complete’;</b> the חתמה in כתובות <b>means she completed the sale and agreed orally</b> to the sale, but not that she signed a שטר –<br>A third and final answer:<br><b>אי נמי חתמה ממש ובשטר של בעל –<br>Or</b> you may <b>also</b> say, <b>she actually signed</b> the שטר,<b></b> however she signed <b>her husband’s שטר,</b> therefore the sale is not valid –<br><b>והא דאמר רב בשטר קנה שעשתה שטר מכירה בשמה –<br>And this which רב ruled בשטר קנה, is where she made a</b> separate <b>bill of sale with her name</b> (not part of her husband’s שטר).<br>תוספות continues to explain the dispute between רב and שמואל:<br><b>ומסתבר דטעמא דרב כטעמא דשמואל</b><sup class="footnote-marker">14</sup><i class="footnote">See ‘Thinking it over’.</i> <b>דאמר בהניזקין (שם דף נח,א ושם דיבר המתחיל אבל) –<br>And it is logical that the reason of רב,</b> who maintains that if there was a שטר, he is קונה, <b>is like the reasoning of שמואל, who rules in פרק הניזקין</b> that <b>–<br>אף בשטר לא קנה עד שתכתוב לו אחריות<sup class="footnote-marker">15</sup><i class="footnote">This is referring to the case of לקח מן האיש ואח"כ לקח מן האשה (see footnote # 4). According to שמואל the buyer acquires the field only if the woman guaranteed the sale, meaning that if the property were to be taken away from the לוקח (for any legal reason), she will reimburse him the money he paid. The reason the sale is valid, for in this instance where the woman is prepared to shell out money, she cannot claim נח"ר עשיתי לבעלי.</i> –<br>He is not קונה even with a שטר unless</b> the wife <b>writes</b> for the customer <b>a guarantee –<br>ושמואל לטעמיה דאמר בפרק קמא דבבא מציעא (דף יד,א ושם) –<br>For שמואל follows his view which he stated in the first פרק of</b> מסכת <b>ב"מ –<br>אחריות לאו טעות סופר בשטרי מקח וממכר ורב סבר אחריות טעות סופר הוא<sup class="footnote-marker">16</sup><i class="footnote">רב maintains that in any שטר we assume that there is a guarantee (for the sale, or the loan), and the fact that it does not state so explicitly in the שטר is merely an oversight of the סופר, who forgot to write it. However שמואל maintains that in order there should be a guarantee for the sale, it must be explicitly included, otherwise there is no guarantee. Therefore in the case of לקח מן האיש וכו', according to שמואל there is no sale unless a guarantee was written (for then we know that she is serious [see footnote # 15]), however according to רב that אחריות טעות סופר so if she wrote a שטר even without אחריות, the sale is valid since the אחריות is automatically included in the שטר. It turns out therefore that רב and שמואל basically agree that when there is אחריות the sale is valid (they only argue  what is considered that there is אחריות; according to רב any שטר, and according to שמואל a שטר with explicit אחריות).</i> –</b><br>The lack of a <b>guarantee</b> in a שטר <b>of buying and selling</b>, <b>is not</b> to be attributed <b>to a mistake of the scribe, however רב maintains</b> that the lack of <b>אחריות is considered a mistake of the scribe.</b><br>תוספות presents a difficulty with this view that טעמא דרב כטעמא דשמואל:<br><b>אבל קצת קשה דלקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">17</sup><i class="footnote">מח,א.</i> פריך לרב הונא דאמר<sup class="footnote-marker">18</sup><i class="footnote">On the bottom of this עמוד מז,ב.</i> תליוהו וזבין זביניה זביני –<br>However there is a slight difficulty for later</b> רב המנונא <b>challenges רב הונא who maintains that a forced sale is a valid sale;</b> the question was –<br><b>מהא דאמר שמואל<sup class="footnote-marker">19</sup><i class="footnote">The challenge was actually from the case of סיקריקון (see ‘Overview’), which is a forced sale. שמואל ruled that even if the owner wrote a שטר to the buyer (from the סיקריקון), the buyer is not קונה. The question is, according to רב הונא he should be קונה since תליוהו וזבין זביניה זביני. [The גמרא there said that according to רב there is no question since he agrees that if there was a שטר he is קונה; the question is only according to שמואל.]</i> אף בשטר לא קנה –<br>From this which שמואל ruled that</b> the buyer <b>is not קונה even</b> if the sale was made <b>with a שטר –<br>ואי תלוי הדבר באחריות מאי קשה ליה משמואל<sup class="footnote-marker">20</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא there said that there is no difficulty from רב since he agrees that the sale is valid because there is a שטר (meaning there is אחריות), the same answer can be applied to שמואל that if there is a שטר with אחריות the sale is valid. There is no real dispute between רב ושמואל regarding a forced sale both agree that when there is אחריות it is valid and when there is no אחריות it is not valid.</i> טפי מרב:</b><br><b>However if</b> the validity of the sale <b>depends only if there was אחריות, so why is there a difficulty from שמואל more than from רב?!</b> תוספות does not answer this question.<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>In the case of לקח מן האיש ואח"כ לקח מן האשה it is a valid sale if the שטר was only לראיה and another קנין was made previously, or a שטר is always valid, or a שטר is valid if it is a separate שטר from her husband’s. The dispute between רב ושמואל is regarding whether אחריות טעות סופר (רב), or not (שמואל).<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>How can we understand that when תוספות writes טעמא דרב כטעמא דשמואל,<sup class="footnote-marker">21</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 14.</i> that it is the intent of תוספות to offer an additional answer to his original question<sup class="footnote-marker">22</sup><i class="footnote">See footnotes #7-10.</i> from פרק מי שהיה נשוי?<sup class="footnote-marker">23</sup><i class="footnote">See מהר"ם ומהרש"א.</i>

<b>ורב ביבי מסיים בה כולי—And <i>Rav Bibi</i></b><i> </i><b>concluded it, etc.</b><br><br>O<small>VERVIEW</small><br>רב נחמן related from the name of רב הונא that even if the גזלן brought proof that he bought the field (a שטר), nevertheless the proof is insufficient and he does not get to retain the field. The גמרא stated that רב ביבי concluded in the name of ר"נ that (even though) the גזלן does not receive the field, but he receives back the money<sup class="footnote-marker">1</sup><i class="footnote">The fact that he receives his money back, indicates that witnesses saw the גזלן pay the owner; otherwise he would not receive the money back, for how are we sure that he paid the owner.</i> which he paid for the field.<sup class="footnote-marker">2</sup><i class="footnote">This seemingly indicates that רב ביבי heard from ר"נ this ruling in the name of ר"ה.</i><br>----------------------------<br><b>קצת קשה הלשון<sup class="footnote-marker">3</sup><i class="footnote">The גמרא states ורב ביבי מסיים בה משמיה דר"נ; indicating that he added something to what ר"נ taught from רב הונא. This indicates that ר"ה ascribes to this statement of קרקע אין לו אבל מעות יש לו.</i> דהא רב ביבי פליג כדאמרינן לקמן<sup class="footnote-marker">4</sup><i class="footnote">מח,א. The גמרא clearly states there that רב ביבי מימרא הוא, ומימרא לרב הונא לא סבירא ליה.</i> –<br>The language is somewhat difficult</b> to accept, <b>for ר"ב argues</b> with ר"ה <b>as</b> the גמרא <b>states later –<br>ורב הונא לא מיירי בהכי<sup class="footnote-marker">5</sup><i class="footnote">See footnote # 1. רב ביבי is discussing a case where the money was counted בפני עדים therefore he gets it back; however ר"ה is only discussing a case where the owner (only) admitted to receiving payment that is when we say אין ראייתו ראיה (but he does not get any money back), however in a case where מנה בפני עדים, the rule is that the גזלן is קונה, since תליוהו וזבין זביניה זביני.</i> אלא בהודה ולא במנה:</b><br><b>Since ר"ה is not discussing this</b> case <b>but rather only</b> a case where the owner <b>admitted</b> to receiving money, <b>but not a</b> case where the money <b>was counted</b> in the presence of עדים; in that case it is a valid sale<br><br>S<small>UMMARY</small><br>Seemingly רב ביבי and ר"ה disagree; so how can we say ור"ב מסיים בה?!<br><br>T<small>HINKING IT OVER</small><br>Why does תוספות write קצת קשה; it seems to be a very strong קשיא?!
